,add sth to'gether </b><br>to come together to produce sth; to join two or more things, numbers, etc. together to produce sth(将…)合成，累积为；(把…) 相加:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The games, the dancing and the good food all added together to make a memorable occasion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游戏、舞蹈和美餐组成了这一难以忘怀的时刻。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When all the different factors are added together, I can understand her decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考虑到种种因素，我能够理解她的决定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Add the two numbers together and divide by three.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这两个数相加，再除以三。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>factors,numbers,costs</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,add 'up (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to seem reasonable; to make sense; to have all the different parts agreeing with each other合乎情理；有道理；各部份协调一致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are things in her story that just don’t add up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的叙述有些地方根本不吻合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now that I know where she was last night, it’s all beginning to add up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道了她昨晚的去处，一切就开始说得通。</font><br>to increase gradually to make a large number or amount积少成多:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Save a small amount each month; it’ll soon add up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每月节余一点，很快就攒多了。</font><br>if two or more numbers <b>add up</b>, they come to the total that they should or that you would expect达到应有(或预计)的总数；凑够数:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These figures just don’t add up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些数字加起来还不够。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,add 'up <i>(especially BrE</i>), ,add sth 'up </b><br>to calculate the total of two or more numbers or amounts(把…)加起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never could add up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从来不会计算账目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s very good at adding up in her head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很会心算。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She added the figures up in no time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她立刻把数字加起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I needed to use a calculator to add up the bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得用计算器算账单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>numbers,figures,score,cost</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,add 'up to sth </b><br>if two or more numbers or figures <b>add up to</b> sth, they make a total of sth when they are added together总共是；总计为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you arrange the numbers in groups that add up to 10? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把数字按每组总和为10进行划分好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cost of all the equipment you need for a baby adds up to a considerable sum.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿所需物品的费用总数相当可观。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to show sth; address	<h3>address<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ad'dress yourself to sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to think about a problem or a situation and decide how you are going to deal with it想法解决问题(或处理事情等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must address ourselves to the problem of traffic pollution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须着手解决交通污染的问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>\n
adhere	<h3>adhere<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ad'here to sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to act in the way that a particular law, rule or set of instructions says that you should; to follow or support a particular opinion or set of beliefs坚持，遵守，遵循(法律、规章、指示、信念等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have adhered strictly to the terms of the treaty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们严格遵守了条约的条款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He found the diet very difficult to adhere to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他觉得很难坚持这种规定饮食。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How many people actually adhere to this view?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 实际有多少人坚持这一观点呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>principles,rules,guidelines</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep to sth <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All safety requirements must be adhered to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必须遵守所有安全规定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
admit	<h3>admit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ad'mit of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to show that sth such as an explanation or an answer is possible; to allow sth to happen容许，有…可能(指解释、回答等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The situation admits of only one explanation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一状况只可能有一种解释。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>explanation,answer</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>allow of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
agree	<h3>agree<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'gree with sb</b><br>to make you feel happy or healthy使高兴(或健康)；适合某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look great! Marriage obviously agrees with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你容光焕发啊！结婚显然对你有益。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mushrooms don’t agree with me }(= they make me feel ill/sick)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我吃了蘑菇就会不舒服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'gree with sth;a'gree with doing sth </b><br>to approve of sth, especially a policy or a belief同意，赞成(尤指政策或信仰):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t agree with capital punishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不赞成死刑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>disagree with sth, disagree with doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
aim	<h3>aim<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'aim at sth;'aim at doing sth </b><br>to try to achieve sth; to have sth as your aim力求达到；努力取得；以…为目标:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s aiming at a sports scholarship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在争取获得一项体育奖学金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to aim at increasing exports.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要努力增加出口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do you aim to achieve? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你追求的目标是什么？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'aim sth at sb/sth </b><br>if you <b>aim sth at</b> a particular person or group, you do or say sth that you intend to have an effect on them(言语或行动)针对…，以…为对象:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The advertising campaign is aimed primarily at young people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个广告宣传运动主要是针对年轻人的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was not aiming my remarks at you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的话不是冲你说的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>remarks,criticism,campaign</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'aimed at sth;be 'aimed at doing sth </b><br>to have sth as an aim or purpose以…为目标；旨在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new scheme is aimed at reducing unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新计划旨在减低失业率。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n
alight	<h3>alight<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'light on/upon sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to notice sb/sth suddenly; to find or think of sth by chance突然注意到；偶然发现(或想到):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My eye alighted on an old book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的目光突然落到了一本旧书上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finally alighted on a solution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最后偶然想到了解决方法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>light on/upon sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
align	<h3>align<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'lign yourself with sb/sth </b><br>to publicly support a person, a group of people or a set of opinions公开支持(某人、集体或观点) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The senator aligned himself with the critics of the proposed reforms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位参议员公开支持对拟议的改革提出批评的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>\n
allow	<h3>allow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>al'low for sth </b><br>to include sth when you are calculating sth or planning sth将…计算在内；考虑到； 估计到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Add an extra ten minutes to your journey time to allow for the traffic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考虑到交通，你的行程得额外多预算十分钟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ’ ve bought a large size to allow for the fact that it may shrink in the wash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 估计到衣服可能会缩水，我买了件大号的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the possibility,the fact that…, &b{differences</b> }<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This had not been allowed for in the budget.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预算没有把这个考虑在内。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>al'low of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to show that sth such as an explanation or an answer is possible; to make sth possible容许(解释、回答等)；使有可能:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The facts allow of only one explanation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些事实只可能有一种解释。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>admit of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
allude	<h3>allude<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>al'lude to sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to mention sb/sth indirectly or in a few words间接(或略微)提到；暗指；影射:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hated his mother’s way of alluding to Jean but never actually saying her name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不喜欢母亲拐弯抹角从不指名地提及琼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know the person who was alluded to in the report?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道报告中影射的人吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
amount	<h3>amount<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'mount to sth </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) <br>to add up to sth; to result in a final total of sth总计；共计:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cost of the trip amounted to well over ￡500.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次旅行花费远远超过了500 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The money I pay in tax and insurance contributions amounts to about 40% of my salary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 交税和保险费用掉我工资的40%左右。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come to sth</b><br>to be equal to or the same as sth等于； 相当于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What they did amounted to a breach of contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们这样做等同于违约。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It doesn’t matter whether I pay or my husband pays — it amounts to the same thing in the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我付钱或我丈夫付钱无关紧要─最终反正都是一回事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It all <b>amounts to</b> a lot of hard work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切意味着大量艰苦的工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come to sth</b><br>if you say that sb/sth <b>doesn’t amount to much</b>, you mean that he/she/it is not very important(某人或事物)无足轻重，意义不大:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll never amount to anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决不会有出息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The information we have doesn’t amount to much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们所掌握的情况意义不大。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>add up to sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
angle	<h3>angle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'angle for sth </b><br><i>(often used in the progressive tenses</i>常用于进行时) <br>to try to obtain sth without asking for it directly转弯抹角地打听；博取:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s angling for an invitation to the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她婉转地让别人邀请她参加聚会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fish for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
answer	<h3>answer<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,answer 'back</b><br>to defend yourself against sth bad that sb has said about you为自己辩护；答辩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s not fair to criticize without giving her the chance to answer back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 批评她而不给她机会辩白是不公平的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,answer 'back; ,answer sb 'back </b><br>if a child<b>answers back</b> or <b>answers you back</b> when you are telling them to do sth, for example, they reply rudely顶嘴；回嘴；还嘴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t answer back! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别回嘴！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s a rude little boy, always answering his mother back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他年纪小脾气倔，总是和母亲顶嘴。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'answer for sb </b><br>to speak on behalf of sb and say what they will do or what they think代表…讲话； 代表…的意见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t answer for my colleagues, but I can manage a meeting next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能代表同事们的意见，但我可以在下个星期会面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>speak for sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'answer for sth </b><br>to be responsible for sth bad; to accept the blame for sth承担过失；受责难:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has a lot to answer for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她与很多坏事都脱不了干系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s old enough to answer for his own actions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已经不小了，要对自己的行为承担责任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When it comes to violence among young people, television has a great deal to answer for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说到年轻人的暴力，电视要负很大责任。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the consequences,sb’s actions</b><br>to say that you are certain that sb has a particular quality or can be trusted or relied on担保，保证(某人的品质等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can answer for her honesty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以担保她为人诚实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>vouch for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'answer to sb (for sth) </b><br>to have to explain your actions to sb or show that they are right or reasonable向某人(为某事)负责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will answer to me for any damage to the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车有任何损坏我都找你负责。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If anything happens to her, you’ll have me to answer to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她如果出了任何事，你都得向我交待。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'answer to sth </b><br>to be called sth; to recognize a name as your own被称作； 名叫:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I answer to either Susan or Sue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我名叫苏珊或休。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m afraid there’s no one here <b>answering to that name</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕这里没人叫那个名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have a cat <b>answering to the name of</b> Bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们有只名叫比尔的猫。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ name</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
appeal	<h3>appeal<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ap'peal for sth/sb;ap'peal for sb to do sth</b><br>to make a serious and urgent request for sth or for sth to be done恳求；呼吁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has appealed for calm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府呼吁保持镇静。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police appealed for witnesses to come forward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The victim’s family has appealed for help in tracking down the killer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 受害人家属恳求帮助追捕兇手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>witnesses,help,information,calm,funds</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ap'peal to sb </b><br>if sth <b>appeals to</b> you, you like it or find it interesting and attractive使感兴趣；对…有吸引力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ‘Harry Potter’ books appeal to readers of all ages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 《哈里·波特》系列的书吸引着不同年龄的读者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prospect of camping didn’t appeal to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对要去露营的想法没有兴趣。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>appeal to sth </b><br>to try to persuade sb to do sth by reminding them that it is a good, reasonable thing to do打动人心:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maybe if you <b>appeal to</b> her better nature }(= her kindness)&b{, you can get her to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 也许你动之以情，就能得到她的帮助。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sb’s better nature,sb’s sense of justice</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

argue	<h3>argue<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,argue sb 'into sth; ,argue sb 'into doing sth </b><br>to persuade sb to do sth by giving them a large number of reasons why they should do it说服某人(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I managed to argue him into going back home to talk to his parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我终于说服他回家去和父母对话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>argue sb out of sth,argue sb out of doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,argue sth 'out </b><br>to discuss all the details of an idea, a plan, etc., often in an excited or angry way, until you reach a decision彻底辩论(常指激烈辩论之后作出决定):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sure they’ll manage to argue out any differences that arise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我相信他们会把出现的分歧辩个明白。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m too tired to <b>argue it out</b> with you now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很累，现在没有力气和你争辩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The issues have all been argued out at great length.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些问题经过长久的辩论均已得到解决。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,argue sb 'out of sth; ,argue sb 'out of doing sth </b><br>to persuade sb not to do sth by giving them a large number of reasons why they should not do it说服某人放弃(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I argued her out of her crazy idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我说服她放弃了荒唐的想法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>argue sb into sth,argue sb into doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'argue with sth </b><br>to disagree with what sb says;to say or show that sth is not right不同意(说法)；不承认(表述)；表示(某事)不正确:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘It’s cold today, isn’t it?’ ‘I can’t argue with you there!}(= I agree with you)&b{.’</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “今天很冷，对吧？”“ 的确很冷！ ” </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a lovely jacket — and you couldn’t argue with the price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件短上衣很不错─而且价格也合适。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
arrive	<h3>arrive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>ar'rive at sth </b><br>to agree on sth or to find sth after discussing and thinking about it达成(协议)；作出(决议等)；得出(结论等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had both arrived at the same conclusion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他俩得出了同样的结论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It didn’t take long to arrive at a decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没过多久便作出了决定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>conclusion,decision,agreement</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reach sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
arse	<h3>arse<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,arse a'bout/a'round <i>(BrE</i>, !, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to behave in a silly or annoying way and waste time instead of doing what you are supposed to be doing鬼混；闲混:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop arsing about and give me my bag back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别胡闹了，把我的包还给我。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Mess around</b> and <b>play around</b> are more polite verbs to use to express this.表达此义用<b>mess around</b> 和<b>play around</b> 更有礼貌。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
ascribe	<h3>ascribe<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'scribe sth to sb </b><br>to consider, perhaps wrongly,that sth has been written, painted, spoken or created by a particular person以为某项作品(或说话) 出自某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This play is usually ascribed to Shakespeare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个剧本通常被认为是莎士比亚创作的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>attribute sth to sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a'scribe sth to sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to consider that sth is caused by a particular person or thing把…归因于；认为…是由于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ascribed his exhaustion to the heat and an unfamiliar diet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他认为自己疲乏是由于炎热和不适应饮食。</font><br>to consider that a person or a thing has a particular quality认为… 具有:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am reluctant to ascribe supernatural powers to a fortune teller.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不太相信算命的人有超自然力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government ascribe great importance to these policies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府十分重视这些政策。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>attribute sth to sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
ask	<h3>ask<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ask after sb </b><br>to ask for news about sb and how they are, etc.问候；问好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did she ask after me in her letter? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在信中问起我了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>enquire after sb <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb a'long </b><br>to ask sb if they would like to go with you to an event or activity邀某人做伴；请某人同行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane and Ed are going to a movie tonight, and they’ve asked me along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简和埃德今晚要去看电影，还邀我同去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>invite sb along <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask a'round </b><br>to ask a number of different people in order to find out sth四处打听；多方询问:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t know if there’s any work, but I’ll ask around for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道有没有工作，不过我会帮你打听打听。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb a'round <i>(AmE</i>) =ASK SB OVER/ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb 'back (to sth) (<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to invite sb to come back to your house with you for a drink,etc. when you are both out together邀请(一起外出的人)回到家里来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked him back for a coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我邀请他回我家来喝杯咖啡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>have sb back;invite sb back (to sth)(<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ask for sb </b><br>to say that you want to see or speak to sb要求与某人见面(或对话):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s somebody at the door asking for Pete.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门外有人要见皮特。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ask for sth </b><br>to say that you want sb to give you sth要求某事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jodie asked for a guitar for her birthday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔迪说她过生日想要把吉他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you get into trouble, don’t hesitate to ask for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果有麻烦，就立刻找人帮忙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We <b>couldn’t have asked for</b> better weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气再好不过了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A beautiful house, husband and children. What more could you ask for? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 漂亮的房子、丈夫和孩子。你还能再奢望什么呢？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>request sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(<i>informal</i>) if sb is <b>asking for trouble</b> or <b>asking for it</b>, they are behaving in a way that is likely to cause sth bad to happen to them招惹(麻烦或痛苦等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re asking for trouble walking home alone at night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你夜里独自一人步行回家是自找麻烦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘You asked for it! }(= you deserve what I am going to do to you)&b{’ she said, pouring a bucket of water over his head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你自讨苦吃！”她说着就朝他头上泼了一桶水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>trouble,it </b><br>to say that you want to speak to sb or be directed to a place说明要求(找某人)；问(路):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you arrive, go to reception and ask for George.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到达后就到服务台说找乔治。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ask for the station if you get lost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果迷路，就问去车站的路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb 'in/ 'up </b><br>to invite sb to come into the room or building that you are in, especially your home邀请某人进(家等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Aren’t you going to ask me in? It’s cold out here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不请我进去吗？外面很冷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She asked me into her office for a chat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她请我进她的办公室聊聊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once we get settled, we must ask the neighbours in for coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一安顿下来，就一定请邻居来家里喝咖啡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>invite sb in/up <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb 'out </b><br>to invite sb to go out with you, especially when you would like a romantic relationship with them请…外出约会(尤指为建立恋爱关系):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has he asked you out yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他约你外出了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>invite sb out <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb 'over/ 'round <i>(BrE</i>) (<i>AmE</i>,ask sb a'round)</b><br>to invite sb to come and visit you in your home邀请(某人)来家里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s asked me round for dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她请我去她家吃饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>invite sb over/round <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ask sb 'up=ASK SB IN/UP</b><br>\n

average	<h3>average<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,average 'out </b><br>to result in a fair or equal amount over a period of time or after several occasions达到平均；结果公平；持平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sometimes I do the cooking and sometimes my flatmate does. It averages out over a month }(= results in us each doing the same amount of cooking)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有时我做饭，有时同住的人做饭。一个月下来我们做饭的次数一样多。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,average sth 'out (at sth) </b><br>to calculate the average of sth算出…的平均数(为):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you average it out, there’s one car stolen every three minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 算起来平均每三分钟就有一辆汽车失窃。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tax authorities averaged out his profit at ￡10 000 a year over five years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 税务局算出他五年的平均收益为每年1万英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,average 'out at sth </b><br>to have a particular amount as the average over a period of time平均数为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The time she spends practising the piano averages out at about an hour a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她练钢琴的时间是平均每天大约一小时。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n

back	<h3>back<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back a'way; ,back a'way from sb/sth </b><br>to move backwards away from sb/sth frightening or unpleasant退避，躲避(人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stepped forward and she backed away in alarm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向前跨了一步，她惊慌地退避开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child backed away from the dog nervously.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子紧张地后退躲避那条狗。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>retreat (from sb/sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACK OFF 2<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back a'way from sth; ,back a'way from doing sth </b><br>to avoid doing sth unpleasant or difficult; to show that you no longer support an action or an idea退缩；背弃(某行动或想法):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will not back away from tough measures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不会手软的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The union has backed away from calling a strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会放弃了号召罢工。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'down(on/from sth) </b><br>to take back a claim or a demand that you have made, or sth that you have said, usually because sb forces you to(被迫)收回(声明、言论等)；放弃(要求、主张等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Neither of them will back down on this issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他俩在此问题上都不会让步的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His critics were forced to back down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 批评他的人被迫偃旗息鼓了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>climb down (over sth); give in (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACK OFF (FROM STH/FROM DOING STH),BACK OFF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'off </b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to stop threatening or annoying sb放过(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Back off and let me make my own decisions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别烦我了，让我自己做决定吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The press have agreed to back off and leave the couple alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新闻界同意不再打扰这对夫妻。</font><br>to move away from sb/sth frightening or unpleasant躲避(人或事物) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the head teacher approached the children backed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 校长过来时，孩子们闪开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>retreat (from sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACK AWAY,BACK AWAY FROM SB/STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'off (from sth/from doing sth), ,back 'off sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to decide not to continue to do sth or support an idea, in order to avoid a difficult or unpleasant situation放弃(某事)；不再支持(某想法):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government backed off in the face of strong opposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府在强烈的反对下退却了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He refused to back off from his earlier statement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不肯撤回先前的声明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rebels backed off their demand for meeting with the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反叛者放弃了和总统会面的要求。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACK DOWN (ON/FROM STH)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'onto sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>if a building <b>backs onto</b> sth, it has sth behind it(建筑物)背向，背靠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel backs onto the golf course.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅馆的后面是高尔夫球场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'out; ,back 'out of sth; ,back 'out of doing sth </b><br>to decide not to do sth that you had agreed or promised to do退出；放弃(同意或答应做的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything’s arranged. It’s too late to back out now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切都安排好了。现在打退堂鼓为时太晚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s still time to back out of selling the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在决定不卖房子还来得及。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull out,pull out of sth,pull out of doing sth;withdraw (from sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'up; ,back sb/sth 'up </b><br>to move backwards a short distance, especially in a vehicle; to make sb/sth move backwards a short distance(使)后退；倒(车):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can back up another two metres or so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以再退两米左右。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jeff backed the van up and drove off quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰夫倒了倒车，然后飞快地开走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The woman was backed up against the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那女子被挤到了墙边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reverse,reverse sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back 'up; ,back sth 'up</b><br>if traffic <b>backs up</b> or <b>is backed up</b>, it cannot move and forms a long line(车辆)拥塞，排起长龙；交通阻塞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two lanes were closed by the accident, causing cars to back up for miles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因事故关闭了两条车道，汽车拥塞长达几英里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The traffic is backed up to the traffic lights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车辆在交通灯处阻塞了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back sb/sth 'up </b><br>to say or show that what sb says is true证明某人(所言属实)；证实(某人所言):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I tell my parents I was with you, will you back me up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假若我对父母说我当时和你在一起，你肯为我作证吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His version of events is not backed up by the evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对事情的陈述证据不足。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>statement,claim </b><br>to support or help sb/sth支持，帮助(某人或事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mel complained that her husband never backed her up in the control of the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 梅尔抱怨丈夫从未帮她管桝过孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Backing her up }(=playing music to support her)&b{ was the band ‘Midnight Express’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为她伴奏的是“午夜快车”乐队。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>support sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'backup <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] (<i>AmE</i>, <i>music</i>) (<i>usually used as an adjective </i>通常用作形容词) music that supports the main singer or player in popular music or jazz(流行音乐或爵士乐的)伴奏，伴唱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a backup singer for Stevie Wonder </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史蒂维·旺德的伴唱歌手</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She once sang backup for Madonna.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她曾经为麦当娜伴唱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  BACK-UP at BACK STH UP <br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,back sth 'up </b><br><i>(computing</i>) to make a copy of a file, a program, etc. that can be used if the original one is lost or damaged给(文件、程序等)做备份；备份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We back up all the files every night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每晚都给所有文件做备份。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>file</b><br>to add sth extra to sth, especially as a support(将某物)添加到；(以某事物)辅助，支持:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lectures will be backed up by practical work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课堂讲授将辅以实习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They backed up their demands with threats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们提了要求并威胁说一定要满足。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'back-up <i>n </i></b><br>[U] support or help that you can use in order to do sth支持；援助:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp military backup</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军事援助</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have a huge back-up team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们有一支庞大的后援队伍。</font><br>[C] a second piece of equipment, set of plans, person, etc. that can replace another if necessary备用器械(或计划、人员等)；后备:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s our back-up if another player isn’t available.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我们其他队员无法上场，就由他替补。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the back-up plan </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 备用计划</font><br>[C] (<i>computing</i>) a copy of a file, program, etc.for use in case the original is lost or damaged(文件、程序等的)备份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you kept a backup of this file? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把这文件备份了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a backup disk </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 备份磁盘</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACKUP at BACK SB/STH UP<br>\n
bag	<h3>bag<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bag sth 'up </b><br>to put sth, usually large amounts of sth, into a bag or bags把(常指大量的东西)装进袋子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The vegetables are bagged up on the farm and then sent out to the shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蔬菜在农场装袋后送到商店。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
bail	<h3>bail<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bail 'out; ,bail 'out of sth </b><br><i>(BrE also </i><b>,bale 'out, ,bale 'out of sth)</b> to jump out of a plane that is going to crash, using a parachute (= a large piece of cloth that opens out like an umbrella and makes people fall slowly and safely)(从即将坠毁的飞机中)跳伞；应急跳伞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crew just had time to bail out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机组人员刚好来得及跳伞。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to stop doing sth or taking part in sth because it is difficult or unpleasant放弃(做某事)；退缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The actor who was supposed to be playing the part bailed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 原计划饰演这个角色的演员不干了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BACK OUT,BACK OUT OF STH,BACK OUT OF DOING STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bail 'out; ,bail sth 'out <i>(BrE also </i>,bale 'out, ,bale sth 'out) </b><br>to throw water out of a boat with a container or with your hands(从船中)往外舀水:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat will sink unless we bail out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们若不排水，船就要沉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They started bailing the boat out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们动手把船里的水舀出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>boat,water</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bail sb 'out <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to pay sb’s bail (= the money that sb accused of a crime has to pay if they do not appear at their trial) for them, so that they can be set free until their trial保释(被告)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bail sb/sth 'out; ,bail sb/sth 'out of sth <i>(BrE also </i>,bale sb/sth 'out, ,bale sb/sth 'out of sth)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to rescue sb/sth from difficulties,especially financial difficulties帮助…脱离(财政等)困境；(从困境中)拯救…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has refused to bail the company out again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府拒绝再次帮助该公司渡过难关。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bailout <i>n </i>(<i>especially AmE</i>, <i>finance</i>)</b><br>an act of giving financial help to a company, economy, etc.to save it from failing(帮助渡过难关的)财政援助:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp government/bank bailouts </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府财政援助；银行应急贷款</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a bailout package </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 财政援助计划</font><br>\n
balance	<h3>balance<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'balance A against B </b><br>to compare the value or importance of one plan, argument, etc. against another将(两计划、论点等)进行比较；权衡(两事物的)重要性:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must balance the high salary against the long working hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须权衡高工资和长工时两者的利弊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set sth against sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,balance 'out; ,balance sth 'out/ 'up </b><br>if things that are very different or have opposite effects<b>balance out</b> or you <b>balance them out</b>, they become equal in amount or value(使) … 相等，抵消:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you eat a variety of food, protein and carbohydrate will balance out over a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 饮食多样化，一个星期之后蛋白质和碳水化合物就均衡了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to invite three more girls to balance up the numbers }(= so that there are equal numbers of boys and girls)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得再邀请三个女孩，这样男女就一样多了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

bandy	<h3>bandy<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bandy sth a'bout (<i>also</i> ,bandy sth a'round <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>if a word, a name, etc. <b>is bandied about</b>, it is mentioned or talked about by many people, often in a careless way传播；散布:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stories being bandied about are completely false.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些流行的说法完全是没影儿的事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s not paid anything like the ￡4 000 a week figure being bandied around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挣的钱并不是人们纷纷传说的每周4 000 英镑的数目。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>story,figures,word/term</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
bang	<h3>bang<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang a'round (<i>also</i> ,bang a'bout <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to move around noisily乒乓作响地来来去去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We could hear them banging about upstairs, moving things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们能听到他们在楼上轰隆隆地来回挪动东西。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang a'way </b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to hit sth repeatedly with lots of force or energy(连续地)砸，敲，打:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She picked up the hammer and began banging away with enthusiasm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拿起锤子便用力敲打起来。</font><br>if sth such as your heart <b>bangs away</b>,it makes very loud regular sounds(心脏等)怦怦作响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My heart was banging away unhealthily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的心脏扑通扑通地跳得很不舒服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang a'way at sth <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to work very hard at sth努力工作；致力于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She banged away all day at her assignment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一整天都在埋头写作业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bash away (at sth) (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang sth 'down </b><br>to put sth down quickly and with a lot of force so that it makes a loud noise猛摔；砰地一扔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He banged his fist down on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他砰地一拳砸在桌子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He banged the phone down }(= ended the telephone conversation)&b{ before I could explain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还没来得及解释，他就啪地挂断了电话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang 'into sb/sth </b><br>to crash into or hit sb/sth violently, usually by mistake(不小心)撞着，碰撞(某人或物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran around the corner and banged into an old lady who was coming the other way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从拐角处跑出来，一下子撞了迎面走来的一位老太太。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang 'on about sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to talk or write a lot or in a boring way about sth囉嗦；唠叨； 絮叨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pat is always banging on about politics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帕特总是没完没了地谈论政治。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She keeps banging on about how wonderful her son is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她逢人便说她的儿子有多优秀。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on (about sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang 'out sth; ,bang it/them 'out (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to play music very loudly高声奏出(音乐):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He banged out the tune on the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在钢琴上轰鸣地弹奏那首曲子。</font><br>to write sth very quickly and without taking much care匆匆写出；(写文章等)粗制漤造:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was banging out four novels a year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一年赶写了四部小说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bash sth out <i>(BrE</i>); churn sth out</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>out</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>out</b> .名词必须放在<b>out</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>out</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bang sb/sth 'up <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to damage or injure sb/sth, especially by hitting sth else撞伤某人(或身体部位)；碰坏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I banged up my knee when I fell off the bike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从自行车上摔下来磕破了膝盖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,banged 'up (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to be locked up or put in prison被关起；被关进监狱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was banged up in a Singapore jail for six months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在新加坡一座监狱里关押了六个月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>\n
bank	<h3>bank<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bank on sb/sth;'bank on doing sth;'bank on sb/sth doing sth </b><br>to rely on sb/sth; to be confident that sth will happen依靠； 指望；对…有信心:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m banking on your help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还得靠你帮忙呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m banking on you to help me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还得靠你帮忙呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d banked on getting a cup of coffee at the airport, but everything was closed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我原指望在机场能弄杯咖啡喝，可所有的地方都关门了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was banking on the train being on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他指望火车会正点到达。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She might already have cleaned up but <b>I wouldn’t bank on it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她或许打扫过了，可我不敢打保票。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on sb/sth,count on doing sth,count on sb/sth doing sth;reckon on sb/sth,reckon on doing sth,reckon on sb/sth doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bank 'up; ,bank sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to form into a large pile; to make sth form a large pile(使)堆积:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snow had banked up on either side of the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 路的两旁尽是积雪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
bargain	<h3>bargain<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bargain sth a'way <i>(rare</i>)</b><br>to give away sth valuable or important in exchange for sth less valuable or important赔…；付出(过高的代价):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leaders refused to bargain away the freedom of their people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 领导人不肯以牺牲人民的自由做交易。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bargain for/on sth;'bargain for/on doing sth;'bargain for/on sb/sth doing sth </b><br>to expect or be prepared to do sth; to expect sth to happen or sb to do sth预料到(某事)；预备(做某事)；料想到(某事发生或某人做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hadn’t bargained for such bad weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没预料到如此恶劣的天气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hadn’t bargained on taking the kids with us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没打算让孩子们和我们同去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t bargain for Jake being at the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没想到杰克会来参加聚会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he tried to argue with Kate, he <b>got more than he had bargained for</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图和凯特争辩，不料却招架不住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What I hadn’t bargained for was that very few people would speak English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没想到的是很少人愿意说英语。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reckon on sb/sth,reckon on doing sth,reckon on sb/sth doing sth</b><br>[NOTE]These phrasal verbs are usually used in negative sentences.这些短语动词通常用于否定句。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
barge	<h3>barge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,barge 'in (on sb/sth), ,barge 'into sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to enter a place or join a group of people quickly and rudely, without being asked闯入；冒昧介入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry to barge in, but…</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抱歉冒昧打扰，可是… </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She barged in on our meeting without knocking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们开会时她不敲门就闯了进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just barged (<i>his way</i>) into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迳直闯进了屋子。</font><br>to interrupt what sb is doing or saying, especially when you have not been invited to join in插嘴；打岔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as I paused for breath, Bart barged in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚停下来喘口气，巴特便抢过了话头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t just come barging into our conversation! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能冒冒失失地打断我们的谈话！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n

bash	<h3>bash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bash sb/sth a'bout <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to hit or strike sb/sth and treat them/it in a rough way猛击；蛮横对待:<br><i><font 11 until 6.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从11点到6点钟一刻不停地写那篇文章。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bash sth 'down <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bash sth 'in <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to break or destroy sth by hitting it violently用力打破；撞毁:<br><i><font (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to continue working hard at sth持续努力地做(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s bash on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp care匆匆地写；(写文章等)粗制漤造:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t do drafts of articles. be	<h3>be<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'after sth </b><br>to try to get or obtain sth追求，争取(某事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several people in the office are after the same job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 办公室里有几个人想做同一件工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s being too nice. <i>especially BrE</i>)=BE/GO/KEEP ON AT SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'at sth </b><br>to be busy doing sth忙于(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been at his essay all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他整整一夜都在写文章。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll <b>be at it</b> all day tomorrow.</font></i><br><font holiday/vacation or on a business trip外出(尤指度假或出差):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll be away for the month of August.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们八月份要外出度假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s away on business at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出差了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be be'fore sb=BE UP BEFORE SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be be'hind sb </b><br>to give sb your support支持某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget that doing sth, such as paying a bill, your rent, etc.耽搁；拖欠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re behind with the mortgage repayments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没有按时偿还按揭贷款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m behind with my college assignments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没依时完成大学作业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'down </b><br>if a computer system <b>is down</b>, it is not working temporarily(计算机系统)出故障；暂时停机:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Surely your computer isn’t down again? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的计算机一定不是又坏了吧？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'down on sb </b><br>to treat sb severely or unfairly对某人苛刻(或不公平):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been really down on me lately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最近特别和我过不去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'down to sb </b><br>to be the responsibility of sb; to be sb’s fault是某人的责任；是某人的错:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s down to you to help them now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在该你帮助他们了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'down to sth </b><br>to have only a little money
