season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本季度流行超短裙。</font><br>to be elected to a political position当选(政治职位):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Democrats are in for another term.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 民主党获选连任。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'in for sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to be going to experience sth soon, especially sth unpleasant即将面临(尤指令人不快的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s in for a shock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她就要碰上一件震惊的事了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It looks like we’re in for a storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们好像要遇到暴风雨了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get 'in on sth (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to have a share in or knowledge of sth; to be or become involved in sth参与；知道；涉足:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you in on the secret? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道这个秘密吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to be in on the deal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很想加入这桩交易。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be (well) 'in with sb </b><br>to be (very) friendly with sb and likely to get an advantage from the friendship同某人关系密切(可从中获益)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'into sth </b><br>to have a taste for or an interest in sth爱好；对…感兴趣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you into jazz music?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你喜欢爵士乐吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been into trains since he was a small boy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从小就很喜欢火车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'off </b><br>to leave; to go, especially in a hurry离开；(匆忙)走开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must be off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须走了。</font><br>to have gone bad and not be fit to eat or drink变质(不宜食用或饮用):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This milk is off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 牛奶坏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'off sth </b><br>to have no interest in sth; to have stopped liking sth对(某事物)不感兴趣；不再喜欢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can’t be well. She’s been off her food all week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的身体不可能很好。她厌食整整一星期了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s it. I’m off men for life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就是这样。我一辈子都对男子提不起兴趣。</font><br>to have finished speaking on the telephone打完电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Isn’t he off the phone yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还没打完电话吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,off for 'sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to have a particular amount of sth有某数量的…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How are we off for coffee }(= how much have we got)&b{? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们有多少咖啡？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'on </b><br>(of an event, a show, a performance, etc.活动、演出、表演等) to be happening; to take place进行中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the party still on?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  聚会还没散吗？</font><br>(of a performer演员) to be on the stage; to perform在台上；演出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who’s on next?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  下面该谁上台？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re on after the support band.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在伴奏响起之后上台。</font><br>(of food食物) to be cooking在烹调中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are the potatoes on?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  土豆烧上了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp you’re 'on (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)<br>used when you are accepting a bet or a challenge(接受赌注或挑战时说)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'on sb </b><br>if sth such as drinks, food, tickets, etc.<b>are on</b> sb, they are paid for by that person(饮料、食物、票等)由某人支付:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drinks are on me tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚的饮料我买单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'on sth </b><br>to be taking medicine, a drug, etc.在服用(药物、毒品等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been on the pill for ten years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她服用这种药有十年了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m on strong painkillers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在服用强力止痛药。</font><br>to be talking to sb on the telephone(和某人)在通电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been on the phone for hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打电话有好几个小时了。</font><br>to be eating or drinking sth在吃(或喝)…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m on my third coffee already this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我今早喝的第三杯咖啡了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp what are you 'on? (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) <br>used when you are very surprised at sb’s behaviour and are suggesting that they are acting in a similar way to sb using drugs(认为对方行为不正常)你吃了什么药<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'on about sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to talk about sth, often in a boring way; to mean sth谈论，唠叨(某事)；意思是:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always on about how much money he earns.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总爱唠叨他赚多少钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you on about? }(= I don’t really understand)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你究竟是什么意思？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/go/keep 'on at sb (<i>also</i> be 'at sb) (<i>informal</i>,<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to try to persuade sb to do sth by talking about it very often and in an annoying way反复劝说，纠缠(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been on at my husband to go to the doctor, but he won’t.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不断地劝我丈夫去看医生，可他就是不去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>nag sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'onto sb (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to become aware that sb has done sth wrong or illegal and be trying to catch them捕捉，缉捕(犯错或违法者):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police aren’t onto us yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方还没有发觉要捉拿我们。</font><br>to talk to sb about sth, especially to complain about sth or ask them to do sth和某人谈(某事)；(尤指)向某人抱怨，要求某人(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been onto the council about the noise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经和委员会谈过噪音的问题了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'onto sth </b><br>to find or discover sth that could have very good results for you or for sb else找到，发现(会对自己或他人带来很好结果的事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could be onto something }(= she might have discovered sth that will prove important)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她可能发现了重要线索。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'out </b><br>to have stopped work as a protest and be on strike罢工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The postal workers are still out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 邮政工人还在罢工。</font><br>to be no longer in prison获释出狱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve heard Smith’s out now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说史密斯出狱了。</font><br>if a jury (= a group of people who decide the results of a competition or whether or not sb is guilty of a crime) <b>is out</b>,they are still trying to make a decision(评委会或陪审团)还在裁决中<br>to no longer be in fashion过时；不流行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Black is out this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年不时兴黑色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Politeness seems to <b>be out of fashion</b> these days }(= no one is polite any more)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今讲礼貌似乎已经过时了。</font><br>if an action, for example, <b>is out</b>, it is not possible or is not allowed(行动等)不可能，不允许:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall we get together one evening next week? Monday’s out — I’ve got a French class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下周抽个晚上聚一聚吧？星期一不行—我有法语课。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp the jury is (still) 'out on sth <br>used when you are saying that sth is still not certain(某事)仍未定夺， 悬而未决:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jury is still out on whether wine can be good for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 葡萄酒对人是否有好处尚无定论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'out for sth;be 'out to do sth </b><br>to be trying very hard to do sth or to get sth企求；力图(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s out for revenge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他企图进行报复。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone’s just out for what they can get these days }(= they are trying to get things for themselves)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今每个人都只顾图谋私利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The German team want to win this game, but Brazil are out to stop them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 德国队想赢得这场比赛，但巴西队会竭力阻止他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'out of sth </b><br>to have used up a supply of sth and have nothing left用光；耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re out of sugar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的糖吃完了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'over sb </b><br>to have returned to your usual state of happiness after the end of a relationship(和某人关系结束后)恢复心情:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was hard at first, but I’m over him now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和他分手之初很难过，可我熬过来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'over sth </b><br>to have returned to your normal state of health after an illness病瘉；恢复健康:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s over the flu now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的流感好了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'past it (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to show that you think sb is so old that they can no longer do anything useful or interesting(某人)年老无用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children laughed at him and said he was past it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们嘲笑他，说他年老不中用了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+it<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'through (to sb) </b><br>to be connected to sb on the telephone(和某人)接通电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re through now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 您的电话接通了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re through to the manager now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 您可以和经理通话了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'through (with sb/sth) (<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to have finished using or doing sth; to have finished a relationship with sb不再使用(某物)；做完(某事)；已结束(同某人的)关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Aren’t you through yet? You’ve been ages! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你还没做完？你真是没完没了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He promised he was through with drugs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他答应不再吸毒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keith and I are through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 基思和我吹了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up </b><br>to be awake醒来；醒着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re up early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你醒得真早。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been up all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我彻夜未眠。</font><br>(of the wind, the sea, etc.风、海等) to increase in strength or become violent增强；变得猛烈； 水势(变得) 兇猛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the morning the wind was up and we got ready for a day’s sailing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早晨风力增强了，我们为一天的航行作好了准备。</font><br><i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) (of a drink, a meal,etc.饮料、饭菜等) to be ready准备好；预备好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tea’s up! Come and get it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茶沏好了！来用吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> WHAT’S UP at BE UP TO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up against sb/sth </b><br>to be facing problems or difficulties面对问题(或困难) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re up against tough competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们面临着激烈的竞争。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With three players injured, they were really up against it }(= in a difficult situation)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三名队员受了伤，他们的处境实在艰难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you realize what you’re up against?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你意识到你面临着什么吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up before sb (<i>also</i> be be'fore sb) </b><br>to appear in court or before a judge上法庭； 出庭(受审):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s up before the judge tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他明天出庭受审。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up for sth </b><br>to be considered for sth, especially as a candidate for a job, in an election, etc.为(职位或选举等的)候选人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s up for promotion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她可能升职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>informal</i>) There are 50 tickets <b>up for grabs</b> }(= available for people who ask quickly)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有50 张票，来晚了就没了。</font><br>to be for sb to buy供出售:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I see your house is <b>up for sale</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道你的房子要出售。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A Picasso is <b>up for auction</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一幅毕加索的画要拍卖。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to be ready to take part in an activity准备好参加…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new job will be a challenge, but I’m <b>up for it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新工作将是一个挑战，但我已准备应战。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up to sb </b><br>to be sb’s responsibility or duty是某人的责任(或职责):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s up to you to make sure the house is kept tidy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 保持房屋整洁是你的责任。</font><br>to be left to sb to decide由某人决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Shall we go out?’ ‘It’s up to you.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “ 我们出去好吗？”“你来决定吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'up to sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to be busy doing sth,especially sth bad忙于做(尤指坏事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What have you been up to lately?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你最近忙些什么呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids are quiet — I’m sure they’re up to no good }(= they are doing sth bad)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们鸦雀无声的─我敢肯定他们没在干什么好事。</font><br>to be as good as people expect和期待的一样好；不负所望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Was your meal up to standard?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  给你的饭菜够标准吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp what’s up? (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) <br>used to ask sb if there is something wrong出什么事了；怎么了:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look terrible! What’s up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你看上去糟透了！出什么事了？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t understand <b>what was up with</b> George.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无法理解乔治是怎么了。</font><br>used as a greeting to mean ‘how are you?’,‘what have you been doing?’, etc.(问候语)你好吗，忙些什么呢<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be upon sb ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to be going to happen very soon即将发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The election is almost upon us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选举很快就要开始了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
bear	<h3>bear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bear 'down on sb/sth (<i>also</i> ,bear 'down upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to move towards sb/sth in a determined or threatening way冲向；咄咄逼近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A crowd of journalists bore down on the minister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一群记者冲向部长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hurricane is bearing down on central America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飓风向中美洲袭来。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) if a problem or a difficult situation <b>bears down on</b> you, it makes you feel very worried and has a severe effect on you(问题或困境)深深烦扰，严重影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drought is bearing down very hard on farmers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旱情让农民忧心忡忡。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to press or push on sb/sth施加压力于；压住；推动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>)The government has announced it will bear down on }(= deal strictly with)&b{ inflation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府宣布将严加遏制通货膨胀。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bear on/upon sb/sth </b><br>( <i>formal</i>) to be connected with sb/sth; to have an effect on sb/sth和… 有关； 涉及； 对… 有影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This decision bears directly on our everyday lives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一决定直接影响我们的日常生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>affect sb/sth</b><br>[NOTE]This verb is mainly used in written English.这个动词主要用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bear sb/sth 'out <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to show that sth is true or that what sb says is true; to support sb/sth证实； 为… 作证； 支持:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I always said she’d do well. John will bear me out on this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我总是说她会做好的。约翰会证实这一点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John will bear out what I say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰会证实我的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This theory is not borne out by the facts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个理论没有事实根据。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bear 'up (under sth) </b><br>to remain cheerful and in control in a difficult situation保持振作；承受；挺住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘How is your mother?’ ‘She’s bearing up very well.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你母亲好吗？”“她很硬朗。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘How are you?’ ‘Oh, bearing up.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你怎么样了？”“还挺得住。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bear upon sb/sth =BEAR ON/UPON SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bear with sb </b><br>to be patient with sb耐心对待；容忍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’ll just bear with me for a moment, I’ll try to find her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果能给我一点时间，我会尽力找她的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s under a lot of strain. Just bear with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她承受着很大的压力。对她要有耐心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
beat	<h3>beat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sb 'back</b><br>to make sb move backwards away from sth使后退；使倒退:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was beaten back by the flames.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火焰迫使她退了回去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They tried to beat the enemy forces back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们试图把敌军击退。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat 'down (on/upon sb/sth) </b><br>if the sun <b>beats down</b>, it shines with great heat(阳光)强烈照射， 曝晒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun beat down all afternoon from a clear sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个下午晴空当头，骄阳似火。</font><br>if rain <b>beats down</b>, it falls with great force(雨)倾泻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain was beating down on them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大雨浇在他们身上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sb/sth 'down</b><br>to persuade sb to reduce theprice of sth; to get sb to accept a lower price forsth说服某人降价；杀价:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chris tried to beat them down to a lower price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 克里斯设法让他们降价。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sb/sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sth 'down </b><br>to hit sth hard, often manytimes, until it falls down用力将(某物)砸倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police had to beat the door down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察不得不把门撞开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are hardly <b>beating the door down</b> to get her latest book }(= they are notrushing to buy it)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们并没有争相购买她最近出版的书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>door</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break sth down;batter sth down</b><br>to make sth flatter or lower byhitting it hard, usually with sth flat(用平展的工具)把…拍平，把…打下去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I used a spade to beat down the mud until it was flat and hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用铁锹把泥土拍得又平又硬实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two women tried to beat down the flames on his back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个女子试图把他后背上的火焰扑打灭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>flames</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sb/sth 'off </b><br>to drive sb/sth back or awayby fighting击退；驱走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They beat off an attack by the rebel army.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们击退了叛军的进攻。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to beat the thugs off with a stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想用棍子打走那些流氓。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>attack,attacker </b><br>todefeat sb/sth in a competition(在竞争中)赢， 打败… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has beaten off very strong competition from abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司战胜了来自国外的强有力的竞争。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>challenge,competition</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'beat on sb <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to hit or kick sbrepeatedly不断击打(或踢)某人<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  BEAT SB UP;BEAT UP ON SB <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sth 'out </b><br>to produce a rhythm by hittingsth such as a drum repeatedly敲打出节奏<br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>rhythm </b><br>to put out a fire by hitting it with sthsuch as a blanket, a jacket, a brush, etc.(用毯子、上衣、刷子等)扑打灭(火):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He used his jacket to beat out the flames.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用短上衣把火扑灭了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>flames,fire </b><br>to make a piece of metalflat by hitting it with a hammer, etc.锤平(金属板):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pure gold can be beaten out to form very thin sheets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 纯金可以锤成金箔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>gold/iron,dent</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sb 'out (for sth) (<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>to defeat sb in acompetition(在竞争中)赢某人，打败某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They beat out nine other companies for the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们击败另外九家公司，赢得了合同。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'beat sb to sth; ,beat sb 'to it </b><br>to achieve sth orreach a place before sb else抢先； 捷足先登:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beckham beat everyone else to the ball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贝克汉姆超过了所有的人先得到球。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Book now before somebody else beats you to it! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别人还没预订之前赶紧捷足先登吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat sb 'up </b><br>to hit or kick sb repeatedly殴打；毒打:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her husband used to beat her up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的丈夫过去常对她大打出手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gang went round beating up old ladies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这伙匪徒四处殴打老妇。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bash sb up <i>(informal</i>, <i>less frequent</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BEAT UP ON SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat-'up (<i>especially AmE</i>) (<i>BrE usually</i> ,beaten-'up) <i>adj </i></b><br>[usually before noun] (<i>informal</i>)old or damaged破旧的；破损的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drives a beat-up old van.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开一辆破破烂烂的旧货车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat yourself 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to blame yourself for sth; to criticize yourself自责；自我批评:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we don’t succeed the first time, we shouldn’t beat ourselves up, but try again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一次不成功，我们不应该自责，而要再次努力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beat 'up on sb <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to attack sb physically or with words攻击某人(身体)；(言语上)攻击某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Of course it’s not OK to beat up on your wife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打妻子当然不对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was accused of beating up on the President in the press.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人指责他在报章上攻击总统。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BEAT ON SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
beaver	<h3>beaver<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beaver a'way (at sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to work very hard at sth忙于(某事)；勤奋工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been beavering away at her homework for hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她连续几个小时都在忙着写作业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

bed	<h3>bed<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bed 'down <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to lie down to go to sleep somewhere you do not normally sleep换个地方睡觉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Young people bedded down in doorways.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年轻人睡在各家门口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>doss down <i>(BrE</i>,<i>less formal</i>)</b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,bed 'in)</b> if sth/sb new<b>beds down</b>, it/they become settled and start to work well(新事物或人)适应，开始正常工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’ll take a while for the new system to bed down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新系统需要过段时间才能正常运转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new players have bedded down well in the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新队员已经很好地适应了这个队。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
beef	<h3>beef<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beef 'up sth; ,beef it/them 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make sth bigger, stronger, more interesting, etc.使较大(或强壮、有意思等)；加强…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Security has been beefed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安全措施已经加强了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has been trying to beef up its image.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司一直致力于改善形象。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'beefed-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] improved;made bigger, stronger, more interesting, etc.改进的；强化了的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp beefed-up security </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 强化的安全措施</font><br>\n
beg	<h3>beg<sup>1</sup></h3><h4><b>(-gg-)</b></h4>\n&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,beg 'off; ,beg 'off sth; ,beg 'off doing sth</b><br>to ask to be excused from sth; to say that you cannot do sth that you are expected or have promised to do推辞(要求或已答应做的事)；反悔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was asked to work the weekend shift but she tried to beg off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人让她周末轮值，可她竭力推辞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He begged off visiting his grandparents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把看祖父母的事推掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull out,pull out of sth,pull out of doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CRY OFF,CRY OFF STH,CRY OFF DOING STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
believe	<h3>believe<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be'lieve in sb/sth </b><br>to feel sure that sb/sth exists相信某人(或事物)存在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you believe in ghosts?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你相信有鬼吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I believe in God.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我相信有上帝。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t believe in aliens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不信有外星人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DISBELIEVE IN SB/STH <br>to have confidence in sb/sth, to feel sure that they/it will be successful or achieve sth信赖；信任；相信某人(或事情)会成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents always believed in me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父母始终对我抱有信心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have to believe in a product before I can sell it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须对产品有把握才能出售。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be'lieve in sth;be'lieve in doing sth </b><br>to feel that sth is right or valuable; to approve of sth认为某事对(或有价值)；赞成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you believe in capital punishment? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你赞成死刑吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t believe in running risks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不主张冒险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve always believed in giving people a second chance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我始终认为应该给人第二次机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be'lieve sth of sb </b><br>to accept that sb is capable of a particular action, etc., especially a bad or immoral one相信某人做出(尤指坏事或不道德的事) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Taking drugs! I can’t <b>believe that of</b> Lucy! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吸毒！我不相信露西会这样！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I hadn’t seen him doing it, I would never have <b>believed it of</b> him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果不是亲眼所见，我决不会相信他会干这种事的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is determined to <b>believe the worst of me</b> }(= think I am capable of doing, and likely to do, sth very bad)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坚持认为我能干出坏事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
belong	<h3>belong<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be'long to sb </b><br>(not used in the progressive tenses不用于进行时) <br>to be the property of sb; to be owned by sb属于某人；归某人所有:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house belonged to my cousin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这所房子是我表兄的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That land belongs to the golf club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那片地归高尔夫俱乐部所有。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who does the van belong to?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆客货车是谁的？ </font><br>if a time or an event<b>belongs to</b> a team, a group of people, etc. they are the most successful, popular or important(时代或赛事等)属于…，是…的世界:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Britain did well in the athletics competition, but the day belonged to Norway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以往英国队在田径比赛中表现很好，但整天却是挪威队大出风头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The second half of the twentieth century belonged to the young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 二十世纪中末叶是年轻人的世界。</font><br>if a job, a duty, etc. <b>belongs to</b> you, it is your responsibility(工作、职责等)归某人负责﹔是某人的责任:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job of disciplining a child belongs to the parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 管桝孩子是父母的职责。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The credit for our success belongs to the staff }(=they made us successful, for example by working hard)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的成功是职工努力的成果。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be'long to sth </b><br>to be a member of sth, for example, a club, an organization or a family是(俱乐部、组织、家庭等) 的成员:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t belong to any political party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有加入任何政党。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Portugal already belongs to the European Union.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 葡萄牙已加入欧洲联盟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>(trade) union,club, (political) party </b><br>to be part of a particular group or system是(某族类或纲目)的一部份；属于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rattlesnakes belong to the viper family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 响尾蛇属于蛇科。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These three turtles all belong to one species.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这三种龟均属同一物种。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>species,class,group,category</b><br>to be part of sth or connected with a particular time or place是(某事物)的一部份；与(某时间或地点)有关:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These things belong to the past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些都是过去的东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Writers like him belong to a different generation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他这样的作家属于另一代。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the past,generation</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
belt	<h3>belt<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,belt sth 'down <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to drink sth quickly很快喝掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He belted down his beer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把啤酒一饮而尽。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sth back</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,belt 'out sth; ,belt it/them 'out (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>belt out</b> a song or a piece of music, you sing or play it very loudly高声唱歌(或奏乐) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody can belt out a tune like she can.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没人有她那么响亮的歌喉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A radio belted out pop music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收音机高声播放出流行音乐。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>out</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>out</b> .名词必须放在<b>out</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>out</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,belt 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br><i>(spoken</i>) used to tell sb not very politely to be quiet住口；闭嘴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Belt up, will you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你安静点行不行？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>shut up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to fasten the belt that you wear in a car to keep you in your seat if there is an accident (a<b>seat belt</b>) 系上安全带<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>buckle up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
bend	<h3>bend<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bend 'down </b><br>to lean down低下；垂下；向下弯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He bent down and kissed her on the cheek.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他低下头吻了她的面颊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bend 'over; ,bend 'over sth </b><br>to lean over; to bend from the waist俯身； 弯腰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bend over and touch your toes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 弯下腰触摸你的脚指。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was bending over his desk, writing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正伏案写字。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp bend over 'backwards (to do sth) <br>to do everything you can or make a great effort to do sth, especially to help sb尽一切努力，竭力(做某事、帮助某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We bend over backwards to be fair to all the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们尽力公平对待所有的孩子。</font><br>\n
bet	<h3>bet<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bet on sth;'bet on sb doing sth </b><br>to rely on sth or on sb doing sth and expect it to happen相信；对…有把握；指望(某人做某事) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Do you think she’ll come?’ ‘I wouldn’t bet on it }(= I don’t think it is very likely)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你觉得她会来吗？”“难说。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t bet on me still being here when you get back! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别以为你回来的时候我还会在这里！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on sb/sth,count on doing sth,count on sb/sth doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

bind	<h3>bind<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bind sb 'over <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to warn sb that they will have to appear in court if they break the law again令某人具结保证(不再违法):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was bound over to keep the peace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被责令具保不再闹事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bind sb to sth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to force sb to do sth by making them promise to do it or making it part of a legal document迫使(某人)许诺(某事)；(用法律文书)约束:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company directors are <b>bound to secrecy</b> }(= they have promised not to say anything)&b{ about the future of the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司董事们许诺对公司的未来保密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band found they were bound to the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队发现他们为合同所约束。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bind sth 'up (with sth) </b><br>to tie a long thin piece of fabric around sth to protect it(用长布条)缠绕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She bound up his wounds with bandages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用绷带把他的伤口包扎好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be bound 'up in sth <br>to be very busy with sth;to be very interested or involved in sth忙于，热中于(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s too bound up in his work to have much time for his children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他工作太忙，没有多少时间留给孩子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp bound 'up with sth<br>closely connected with sth与(某事物)紧密相连:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The history of the company is closely bound up with the history of the Grant family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司的历史与克灵顿家族的历史密切相关。</font><br>\n
bite	<h3>bite<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bite at sth </b><br>to try to bite sth试图咬…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog bit at the boy’s hand.</font></i><br><font them反击；反驳:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you criticize him, he’ll bite back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若批评他，他会反驳的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit back (at sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bite sth 'back </b><br>to stop yourself from saying sth or from showing how you feel忍住不说出某事；不流露情感:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She struggled to bite back the tears of disappointment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她努力克制着不让失望的眼泪流下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mike bit back his anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迈克按捺住怒火。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The word ‘idiot’ came into her head, but she bit it back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想到了“白痴”这个词，可她忍住没有说出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>words,anger,retort</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>suppress sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bite 'into sth </b><br>to cut or press into the surface of sth咬(或切、压、陷)入某物:<br><i><font effect on sth, especially by making it smaller产生不良影响；(尤指)使缩小；压缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The recession is biting into our profits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济衰退对我们的收益产生负面影响。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bite sth 'off </b><br>to cut sth off by biting it咬下；咬掉:<br><i><font bitten off by a dog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的手指让狗咬了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp bite/snap sb’s 'head off (<i>informal</i>)<br>to shout at sb or speak to them angrily, often for no good reason(无充分理由)怒斥某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I only asked him when the work would be finished and he almost bit my head off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只是问了问什么时候能把活干完，他就冲我大喊大叫。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp bite off more than you can 'chew (<i>informal</i>) <br>to try to do too much or sth that is too difficult for you想一口吃成胖子；不自量力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This time he’s bitten off more than he can chew.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一次他胃口太大， 难以应付了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp I, etc. could have bitten my/his/her'tongue off/out <br>used to say that you wish you hadn’t said sth that you have just said(表示后悔刚说过的话)真该死，真不该:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam looked hurt and Maria could have bitten her tongue off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆那副受到伤害的表情令玛丽亚对自己的话懊悔不已。</font><br>\n
black	<h3>black<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,black 'out </b><br>to lose consciousness or lose your memory for a short time暂时失去知觉(或记忆) ； 晕眩； 昏厥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pain hit him and he blacked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他疼得昏了过去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blackout <i>n </i></b><br>a temporary loss of consciousness or of memory暂时失去知觉(或记忆)；晕眩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did you start having these blackouts?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你何时开始有这些短暂昏厥的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLACKOUT at BLACK STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,black sth 'out </b><br>to turn out lights completely or cover windows, etc. so that light cannot be seen from outside关掉(某处)的灯；使(某处)不透光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp blacked out windows/houses </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不透光的窗户；黑暗的房子</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city was often blacked out}(= there were no lights because there was no electricity)&b{ by power cuts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 停电常常造成这城市一片漆黑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>window,city</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blackout </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) (in the past) a period of time during a war when the streets and buildings were kept as dark as possible so that the enemy could not see what to bomb(旧时)灯火管制期<br>[usually pl.] (<i>BrE</i>) a covering for windows that stops light from outside coming in,or that stops bright light being seen from outside遮光窗罩(或窗帘):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp blackout material </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窗户遮光材料</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>'outage</b> <i>AmE</i>) a period of time when the electricity supply to a place stops completely断电；停电<br>a situation when the government or the police prevent a radio or television programme from being broadcast, or do not allow some news or information to be given to the public(电台或电视节目的)禁止播放；新闻封锁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government have been accused of maintaining a news blackout over election fraud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人指责政府封锁有关选举舞弊的新闻报道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLACKOUT at BLACK OUT<br>\n
blank	<h3>blank<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blank 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>if you or your mind<b>blanks out</b>, you can’t remember anything or you become confused忘掉一切；变得煳涂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope I don’t blank out in the exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 但愿我考试时脑子里不会一片空白。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blank sth 'out </b><br>to deliberately forget sth unpleasant刻意忘记某事；抹去…的记忆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your childhood may have been difficult but you can’t just blank it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个人的童年或许艰难，但不能就从记忆中抹去。</font><br>to cover sth written or printed, for example, with black ink so that it cannot be read把(书写或印刷文字)掩盖，遮盖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the names in the report had been blanked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报告中所有的名字都已涂掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
blare	<h3>blare<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blare 'out; ,blare sth 'out </b><br>if music <b>blares out</b>, or a radio, etc. <b>blares out</b> music, it is produced or played very loudly(音乐)声音响亮；(收音机等)高声播出(音乐) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Music was blaring out from somewhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轰鸣的音乐从某处传出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio was blaring out rock music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收音机播放着吵闹的摇磙乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>blast out,blast sth out <i>(less frequent</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
blast	<h3>blast<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blast a'way (at sb/sth) </b><br>if a gun or sb using a gun <b>blasts away</b>, the gun fires loudly and continuously连续高声地射击(某人或物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine guns blasted away all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机关枪声整夜不断。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blast sb/sth a'way <i>(less frequent</i>)</b><br>to kill sb or remove sth or break it apart violently,for example with a gun, explosives, etc.击毙，炸死(某人)；打掉，炸开(某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have blasted away the side of this beautiful valley to make a road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们炸掉了这美丽的峡谷的一侧以便修路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) This theory has been blasted away by the new evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个理论给新的证据推翻了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>blow sb/sth away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blast 'off </b><br>when a spacecraft <b>blasts off</b>, it leaves the ground and goes up into space(宇宙飞船)发射，升空:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rocket blasted off at 7.28 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火箭于夜晚7点28 分发射。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lift off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blast-off <i>n </i></b><br>[U] the moment when a spacecraft leaves the ground(宇宙飞船的)发射，起飞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blast-off will be in 30 seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离发射时间还有30 秒钟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blast 'out; ,blast sth 'out </b><br>if music <b>blasts out</b> or a radio, etc. <b>blasts out</b> music, it is produced or played very loudly(音乐)声音响亮；(收音机等)高声播出(音乐):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A Beatles song was blasting out at full volume.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一首披头士歌曲以最大音量播放着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio was blasting out heavy rock music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收音机轰鸣地播放着重摇磙乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>blare out,blare sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
blaze	<h3>blaze<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blaze a'way </b><br>(<b>at sb/sth</b>) if guns or people <b>blaze away</b>, the guns fire continuously(向某人或物)连续射击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guns kept blazing away at the enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 枪对着敌人不停地扫射。</font><br>if a fire<b>blazes away</b>, it burns brightly熊熊燃烧<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blaze 'up </b><br>if a fire <b>blazes up</b>, it suddenly starts burning more strongly(突然)熊熊燃烧起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) His anger blazed up uncontrollably.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他压抑不住心头怒火。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
blend	<h3>blend<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blend 'in </b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) if something <b>blends in</b> with sth else or with its surroundings, it looks similar to it/them or matches well(与环境等)和谐，协调:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The curtains blend in perfectly with the carpet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窗帘和地毯的格调完全一致。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new office block doesn’t blend in well with its traditional surroundings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新办公大楼和传统风格的周围环境不协调。</font><br>(<b>with sb</b>) if sb <b>blends in</b> with other people, they become similar to the people around them(和周围的人)融合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He should try to blend in with the locals a bit more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他应该争取更多地与当地人打成一片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLEND INTO STH;MERGE IN (WITH STH),MERGE INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blend sth 'in </b><br>(in cooking 烹饪) to add another substance to sth and mix them together把…调入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Heat the butter gently and then blend in a little flour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把黄油稍稍加热，然后调入少许麵粉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>mix sth in</b><br>to make a substance mix with another so that you cannot see where one ends and the other starts使混合进；掺和进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blend the eyeshadow in with your fingers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用手指把眼影揉进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He blended in the charcoal lines to make the picture look softer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他加了些炭笔线条使画面显得柔和些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blend 'into sth </b><br>to look or sound so similar to sth that it is difficult for anyone to see or hear it separately融合到…中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The animals can become almost invisible by blending into the long grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些动物藏在长草中几乎难以辨认。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new development should blend into its surroundings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新开发区应该和周围环境协调一致。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>background,surroundings</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLEND IN;MERGE IN (WITH STH),MERGE INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
blimp	<h3>blimp<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blimp 'out/ 'up <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to become fat; to gain weight发福；体重增加<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
blink	<h3>blink<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blink sth a'way </b><br>to clear sth from the eyes by blinking (= closing and opening your eyes quickly)眨眼分散泪水(或挤掉脏东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He blinked away a tear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他眨掉眼泪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tears</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blink sth 'back </b><br>to try to control your tears控制泪水:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found myself blinking back tears during his speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他演讲的时候我觉得我在尽力克制着不流泪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{tear(s)</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
block	<h3>block<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,block sb/sth 'in </b><br>to stop a vehicle from being driven away by parking too close to it(紧挨着停靠车辆)把某人或另一辆车困住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re blocking that Mini in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你挡住那辆迷你牌汽车了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somebody had parked in front of me, blocking me in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人把车停在我前面，把我困住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was blocked in by two lorries so I had to leave the car and walk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的车被两辆大货车夹在中间开不走，我只好下车步行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,block sth 'off </b><br>to close a road or another place by placing a barrier across it to stop sb/sth going in or coming out(用路障等)封锁，堵住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police blocked the street off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察把这条街道封锁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pipe had been blocked off to prevent further leaks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 管道堵上了，以免再渗漏。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>street,road,area,entrance</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>close sth off &b{(to sth/sb)</b> }<br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to reserve a period of time for a particular activity留出(时间):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thursday afternoons are blocked off for sports.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 星期四下午定为体育运动时间。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,block sth 'out </b><br>to stop light or noise from coming in; to cover or hide sth挡住，遮住(光线或声音)；覆盖；隐藏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trees blocked out much of the sunlight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树木挡住了大部份的阳光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) I’m so used to the traffic noise now I just block it out }(= I don’t hear it)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很适应汽车的噪音，现在不把它当回事了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>light,sun,sound</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,block sb/sth 'out; ,block sb/sth 'out of sth</b><br>to avoid remembering sb/sth or thinking about sb/sth, especially sth unpleasant刻意忘记，不去想(尤指令人不快的人或事物)；(从脑海中)抹去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to block the incident out of his mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图把那件事从记忆中抹去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>blot sb/sth out,blot sb/sth out of sth;shut sth out,shut sth out of sth;suppress sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,block sth 'up</b><br>to fill sth such as a hole completely so that nothing can get through it塞住，封住(孔、洞):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the windows had been blocked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的窗户都封死了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>window,door,hole,fireplace</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blocked 'up <i>adj </i></b><br>completely full; not clear塞满的；阻塞的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got a blocked-up nose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的鼻子塞住了。</font><br>\n
blot	<h3>blot<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blot sb/sth 'out; ,blot sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>to avoid remembering sb/sth or thinking about sb/sth, especially sth unpleasant刻意忘记，不去想(尤指令人不快的人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wanted to blot out the memory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想抹去那段记忆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>memories,thoughts</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>block sb/sth out,block sb/sth out of sth;shut sth out,shut sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blot sth 'out </b><br>to stop light or noise coming in; to cover or hide sth挡住，遮住(光线或声音)；掩盖； 隐藏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dark clouds were blotting out the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乌云渐渐遮住太阳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>light,sun,stars,sound</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>block sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
blow	<h3>blow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow a'way; ,blow sth a'way </b><br>to be moved or carried away by the force of the wind or by sb’s breath; to move in this way(被)颳走，吹动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so windy the tent nearly blew away! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风大得把帐篷都快颳走了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sudden breeze blew his newspaper away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的一阵风颳跑了他的报纸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She blew away the dust on the lid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吹掉盖子上的灰尘。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sb a'way </b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to impress sb a lot;to surprise or please sb给某人留下深刻印象；使某人惊喜(或高兴):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her performance on Broadway last year and it just blew me away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去年在百老汇看过她的演出，印象十分深刻。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>sport</i>) to defeat sb easily轻松地打败某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mitchell blew away the other runners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 米切尔轻而易举地赢了其他赛跑选手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sb/sth a'way </b><br>to kill sb or remove or destroy sth with explosives or with a gun(用炸药或枪)杀掉，除掉，摧毁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threatened to blow us away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他威胁说要把我们枪毙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They blew his kneecaps away }(= by shooting them)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们开枪打碎了他的膝盖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>blast sb/sth away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'down; ,blow sth 'down </b><br>if sth <b>blows down</b>, or the wind <b>blows it down</b>, it falls to the ground because of the force of the wind(被)颳倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An old oak tree had blown down in the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风把一棵老橡树颳倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hundreds of trees have been blown down this winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年冬天有几百棵树被颳倒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'in; ,blow 'into sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to arrive somewhere where you are not expected突然来到；突然进入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look who’s just blown in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看，谁来了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you heard who’s just blown into town?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你听说谁刚到城里来了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'off; ,blow sth 'off; ,blow sth 'off sth</b><br>if sth <b>blows off</b>, or the wind <b>blows it off</b>, it is removed by the force of the wind(被)颳动，吹走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My hat blew off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的帽子被颳掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A gust of wind blew her cap off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一阵风把她的帽子颳掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof was blown off the Greens’ house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 格林家的屋顶被风掀掉了。</font><br>if sth <b>blows off</b> in an explosion, or an explosion <b>blows sth off</b> it is violently removed(被)炸掉，炸开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door blew off in the explosion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那扇门被炸掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The explosion blew the roof off (<i>the house</i>).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爆炸把屋顶掀开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp blow/knock sb’s 'socks off <br>to impress or surprise sb very much给某人留下深刻印象；使某人十分惊愕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I first heard the song, it blew my socks off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我初次听到这首歌时就被深深打动了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'off sth; ,blow it 'off <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to decide not to do sth you should do or were planning to do推掉(应该做的事)；取消(原计划):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jessica blew off her classes on Friday afternoon to go shopping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰西卡逃掉了星期五下午的课去逛商店了。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must follow <b>off</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>off</b> .名词必须放在<b>off</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>off</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sb 'off <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to disappoint sb by not meeting them as arranged; to end a relationship with sb不赴约；和(某人)分手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were supposed to go out yesterday, but he blew me off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们说好昨天出去的，可他让我空等了一场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'out</b><br>if a tyre <b>blows out</b>, it bursts suddenly(轮胎)突然爆裂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the front tyres blew out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个前轮胎突然破了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>burst</b><br>if an oil or gas well <b>blows out</b>, it suddenly sends out gas with great force(石油、天然气)发生井喷<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blowout <i>n </i></b><br>an occasion when a tyre bursts on a vehicle while it is being driven(机动车行驶过程中的)爆胎<br>an occasion when oil or gas suddenly escapes from an oil well井喷<br><i>(BrE</i>,<i>informal</i>) a large meal at which people eat too much大餐； 盛宴<br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) a large party or social occasion盛大聚会；交谊会<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLOWOUT at BLOW SB OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'out; ,blow sth 'out </b><br>if a flame <b>blows out</b> or sb/sth <b>blows it out</b>, it is put out by the wind or some air被(风等)吹灭；熄灭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a sudden gust of wind and the candle blew out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的一阵风把蜡烛吹灭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took a deep breath and blew out all the candles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她深吸一口气，把所有的蜡烛都吹灭了。</font><br>if a window <b>blows out</b>, or an explosion, etc. <b>blows it out</b>, the force makes it fall out(窗户)被炸掉，被炸开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the windows blew out in the blast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爆炸把所有的窗户都炸飞了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The explosion blew out the windows in the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爆炸把楼房的窗户炸破了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>sport</i>)</b><br>to defeat sb easily轻易击败某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The home team blew out the Suns by 30 points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主队以30 分的优势把太阳队一举打败。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blowout <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>sport</i>)</b><br>an easy victory轻易的胜利<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLOWOUT at BLOW OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sth 'out </b><br>to breathe sth out from your mouth吹出；呼出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She inhaled and then blew the smoke out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吸了一口，接着吐出了烟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exhale sth</b><br>to fill sth, especially your cheeks,with air鼓起(腮帮子等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She blew out her cheeks in exasperation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她生气地鼓起腮帮子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cheeks</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp blow your/sb’s 'brains out (<i>informal</i>)<br>to kill yourself/sb by shooting yourself/them in the head枪击头部自杀/杀人<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow itself 'out </b><br>if a storm <b>blows itself out</b>, it loses its force and stops(风暴)平息，减弱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By morning the storm had blown itself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到早上时风暴就平息了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'over </b><br>if a storm <b>blows over</b>, it becomes less strong and stops(风暴)颳过去了，平静下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sheltered in a barn until the storm blew over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们躲在一处仓房里，直到风暴平息。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>die down;subside</b><br>if sth such as an argument<b>blows over</b>, it becomes less important and is forgotten(争吵等)平息，被忘掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t come back to work until the argument has blown over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等争论平息后再回来工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>subside</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'over; ,blow sb/sth 'over </b><br>if sb/sth <b>blows over</b> or the wind <b>blows sb/sth over</b>, they fall to the ground because of the force of the wind(被)颳倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the trees had blown over in the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一棵树在风暴中颳倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fence had been blown over in a storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 篱笆在一次风暴中颳倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pedestrians were blown over in gale force winds today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天大风级的风把行人颳得站立不稳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow 'up </b><br>to explode; to be destroyed by an explosion爆炸；被炸毁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bomb blew up as experts tried to defuse it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 专家们试图拆除引信时炸弹爆炸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car blew up when it hit the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车撞墙后炸毁了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>explode <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to start suddenly and with force爆发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A storm blew up just after the ship left port.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮船刚离开港口便狂风大作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A row has blown up over the leaking of information to the press.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向新闻界透露消息引发了一场争论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>die down</b><br><b>(at sb)</b> (<i>informal</i>) to become very angry(对某人)动肝火，动怒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mum blew up at my dad for keeping me up so late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妈妈对爸爸大发雷霆，因为他这么晚还不让我去睡觉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His attitude annoyed me and I blew up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的态度令我讨厌，于是我发火了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp blow up in sb’s 'face <br>if a plan, a deal or a situation <b>blows up in your face</b>, it goes very badly wrong and causes you harm or embarrassment(计划、交易、状况等)造成损害，令人难堪<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blow-up <i>n </i></b><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) an explosion爆炸<br><i>(AmE</i>) an occasion when sb becomes very angry; an argument勃然大怒；争吵:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tensions between them ended in a big blow-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们之间的紧张关系最终使他们大吵一场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLOW-UP at BLOW STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sb/sth 'up </b><br>to kill sb or destroy sth with a bomb or an explosion炸死(某人)；炸毁(某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hijackers threatened to blow the plane up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 劫机者威胁说要炸掉飞机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A judge in Italy was blown up by a car bomb last week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上个星期一名法官在意大利被汽车炸弹炸死了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blow sth 'up </b><br>to fill sth with air or gas给(某物)充气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to blow up the tyres on your bike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你该给自行车轮胎打气了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>balloon,tyre</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>inflate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>let sth down </b><br>to make sth larger放大:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What a lovely photo! Why don’t you have it blown up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多可爱的照片！你为什么不把它放大呢？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>photo</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>enlarge sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to make sth seem more important, better or worse than it really is夸大； 夸张:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole affair has been <b>blown up out of all proportion</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个事件被渲染得太过了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exaggerate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blow-up <i>n </i></b><br>a larger picture made from a photo or picture放大了的照片(或图像):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The blowup showed a scar on the attacker’s cheek.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放大的照片显示出攻击者面颊上有块伤疤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLOW-UP at BLOW UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'blow-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that you can fill with air or gas可充气的<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BLOW-UP at BLOW UP<br>\n
bluff	<h3>bluff<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bluff sb 'out <i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to lie and pretend in order to deceive sb哄骗某人<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bluff it 'out <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to lie and deceive sb in order to get out of a difficult situation,especially when they suspect you are not being honest(即使受到怀疑) 继续蒙混过关:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he asks any difficult questions, you’ll have to bluff it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要是出难题，你就只能蒙混了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know everything so there’s no point trying to bluff it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我什么都知道了，所以不必再蒙骗下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bluff sb 'out of sth <i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>AmE</i>)</b><br>to deceive sb in order to get sth from them哄骗某人交出；从某人处骗得<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cheat sb of sth,cheat sb out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
blunder	<h3>blunder<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blunder a'round; ,blunder a'round sth <i>(also</i> ,blunder a'bout/ 'round, ,blunder a'bout/ 'round sth <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to move about a place in an awkward or uncertain way, knocking into things跌跌撞撞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He blundered about in the dark, feeling for the light switch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摸黑撞来撞去找电灯开关。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I blundered around the flat, trying to be quiet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在公寓里磕磕绊绊，尽力保持安静。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,blunder 'into sth </b><br>to walk into sb/sth because you are awkward or unable to see(因笨拙或看不见)撞上…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She blundered into a tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她撞到了一棵树上。</font><br>to accidentally find yourself in a difficult or dangerous place or situation突然陷入困境:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She blundered into a dangerous area of the city after losing her way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她迷路之后不知怎么就到了城市的危险地带。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had innocently blundered into a private dispute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他稀里煳涂地卷入了一场私人纠纷。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
