bog	<h3>bog<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bog 'down (<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>to be unable to make progress难以进展；停滞不前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill bogged down after being passed by Congress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议案在国会通过之后很难推行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,bogged 'down (in sth) </b><br>to be/get stuck in mud or wet ground; to become stuck in sth and unable to make progress陷进烂泥(或泥沼)；受到阻碍；无法前进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car got bogged down in the mud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车陷入了烂泥中。</font><br>to be unable to make progress in an activity难以进展；停滞不前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t get bogged down in details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要拘泥于细节问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m rather bogged down (with work) at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在被(工作)拖住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bog 'off <i>(BrE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb rudely to go away走开； 磙开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bog off, I’m trying to sleep! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一边去，我要睡觉！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clear off (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
boil	<h3>boil<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil a'way </b><br>if a liquid <b>boils away</b>, it boils until there is nothing left(液体)烧乾，蒸发掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water in the saucepan had all boiled away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 锅里的水烧乾了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>evaporate <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil sth 'down </b><br>to make a liquid less in quantity by boiling it煮浓；熬浓<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reduce sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>(<b>to sth</b>) to make sth smaller by removing unimportant parts and leaving only the essential things概括；归纳；压缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Boil the report down to the key points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把报告压缩一下，只保留要点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>condense sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil 'down to sth </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) <br>if a situation, an issue, etc.<b>boils down to sth</b>, it has that as its main part(局势、问题等)归结为，基本问题是:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It all boils down to money in the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问题最终的癥结是钱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil 'over </b><br>if a liquid in a pan, etc. <b>boils over</b>, it boils and flows over the side of the pan(液体)煮溢，潽出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let the milk boil over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别把牛奶煮溢了。</font><br>(<b>into sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) if anger, an argument,etc. <b>boils over</b>, it changes and becomes very violent and difficult to control(怒火、争论等)恶化，爆发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The unrest could boil over into civil war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时的骚乱有可能演化成内战。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She interrupted swiftly before his temper could boil over again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没等他再次动怒她便连忙打岔了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>explode</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil 'up </b><br>if anger, an argument, etc. <b>boils up</b>, it starts to become stronger or more violent(怒火、争论等)升级，恶化<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boil sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to heat a liquid or some food until it boils把(液体或食物)烧开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll boil the kettle up again and we’ll have a cup of tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我烧壶开水，咱们泡茶喝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ book	<h3>book<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,book 'in (at sth), ,book 'into sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to arrive at a hotel and arrange to have a room到(旅馆)办理入住手续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They booked in (at the St Francis Hotel) using a false name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们(在圣富兰西斯旅馆)用假名办理了住宿手续。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She booked into a hotel in the centre of Boston.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在波士顿市中心的一家旅馆办理了住宿手续。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>check in (at sth); check into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>check out,check out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,book sb/yourself 'in (at sth), ,book sb/yourself 'into sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to reserve a room at a hotel,etc. for sb为别人(或自己)预订(旅馆房间等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve booked us in at the Plaza.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在广场大酒店预订了房间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel I was booked into was awful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我预订的那家旅馆很糟糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s booked himself into a rehabilitation clinic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自己联系了一家康复诊所。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hotel</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,book 'up (for sth) (<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to reserve a place, for example on a trip or a course报名参加(旅行、课程等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I booked up for the course months in advance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我提前几个月就报名要听这门课了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,booked 'up </b><br>if a plane, restaurant, theatre,etc. <b>is booked up</b>, there are no seats, tables, etc.available(飞机、餐馆、剧院等)客满，预订一空:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the flights are booked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有航班都满员。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) if a person <b>is booked up</b>, they have no time available(人)没有空闲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can’t see you tomorrow, he’s booked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他明天日程满了，不能见你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>\n
boom	<h3>boom<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boom 'out </b><br>if a sound or sb’s voice <b>booms out</b>, it makes a loud, deep noise(声音或嗓音)浑厚有力地发出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His voice boomed out, announcing the winners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用浑厚响亮的声音宣布获胜者。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,boom 'out sth </b><br>to say sth in a loud deep voice浑厚有力地说话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She boomed out instructions through a loudhailer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用扩音器深沉有力地发出指示。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A voice boomed out:‘Nobody move!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人低沉地说：“全都不许动！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+adv+speech<br>\n

,bounce sth 'back </b><br>if an email <b>bounces back</b>, or the system <b>bounces it back</b>, it returns to the person who sent it because the system cannot deliver it(电子邮件)退回；退回(电子邮件)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bounce sb 'into sth; ,bounce sb 'into doing sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make or force sb to do sth quickly without giving them time to think about it追迫(或催迫)别人做事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt I’d been bounced into supporting a proposal I didn’t really agree with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得迫于压力才支持了一项自己并非真正同意的提案。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is often used in the passive.这个短语动词常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bounce sth 'off sb (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to tell sb else your ideas to find out what they think about them(把想法)告诉(某人以试探其反应):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were able to share problems and bounce ideas off each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们能够共同探讨问题并相互交流思想。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>ideas</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
bow	<h3>bow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bow 'down </b><br><b>(to/before sb/sth)</b> to move your head or the top part of your body forwards or downwards as a sign of respect(向…或在…前)颔首，鞠躬:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He refused to bow down before the king.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拒绝给国王鞠躬。</font><br><b>(to sb/sth)</b> to do what sb tells you to do without trying to resist屈从于人；听任摆布:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We refuse to just bow down and let the government do whatever it wants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决不能只是任人摆布，让政府为所欲为。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bow 'out; ,bow 'out of sth </b><br>to stop doing an activity or a job that you have been doing successfully,often for a long time退出，告别(成功的事业等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After thirty years in politics, he feels it is time to bow out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从政三十年之后，他觉得是时候退出政坛了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smith will bow out of professional football at the end of the season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯将于本赛季末告别职业足球。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bow to sth </b><br>to agree unwillingly to do sth or to accept sth that sb else wants you to勉强同意做(或接受某事)；屈从于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government eventually bowed to public pressure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府终于在公众的压力下让步了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pressure,the inevitable</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give in (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
bowl	<h3>bowl<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bowl sb 'out </b><br>(in cricket板球运动) to make the person who is hitting the ball (the <b>batsman)</b> have to leave the field by throwing a ball that they cannot hit and that hits the wicket (= the three sticks behind the batsman); to dismiss a whole team in this way击中三柱门把击球员(或整个球队)杀出局<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bowl sb 'over </b><br>to surprise or impress sb a lot; to affect sb deeply使某人惊叹；让某人印象深刻；深刻影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were bowled over by the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对这个消息感到震惊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Philip bowled us all over by deciding to go into advertising.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 菲利普决定从事广告业，让我们全都大为吃惊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
box	<h3>box<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,box sb 'in </b><br>to prevent sb from doing what they want, especially by creating rules or other difficulties给某人设框框；使窒碍难行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President was unable to act because the Democrats were boxing him in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统受到民主党的阻拦无法展开工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was boxed in by rules and regulations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给规章制度框住了脚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,box sb/sth 'in </b><br>to prevent a person or a vehicle from moving by surrounding them/it with other people or vehicles围困；拦挡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t park here — you’re boxing that car in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能在这里停车─ 你挡了那辆车的路！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn’t overtake the leader because he was boxed in by the other runners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没法超过领先的人，因为其他赛跑运动员把他的路堵住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,box sth 'up </b><br>to put sth in a box or boxes把…装箱(或盒):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She boxed up all the old baby clothes to send to her niece.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把所有的旧婴儿服都装箱寄给姪女。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
branch	<h3>branch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,branch 'off </b><br>if a road or path <b>branches off</b>, it leaves a larger one and goes in a different direction(道路)分岔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She followed the path until it branched off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她沿着小路一直走到岔道口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Over the bridge a road branches off to the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了桥，右侧有一岔道。</font><br>if a person<b>branches off</b>, they leave a road or path and travel in a different direction(人)改道，转道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go past the farm and branch off towards the trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了农场后就转道朝树林走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,branch 'out (into sth) </b><br>to begin to do a new job or an activity that you do not usually do涉足新工作；拓展新业务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is branching out into Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司正在开拓欧洲业务。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s leaving the company to <b>branch out on her own</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她要离开公司自己开业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
brazen	<h3>brazen<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brazen 'out sth; ,brazen it 'out </b><br>to behave in a confident way as if you are not ashamed or embarrassed about sth you have done, even though you should be厚着脸皮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The senator <b>brazened it out</b> as the list of scandals grew.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 丑闻不断出现，这位参议员依然若无其事。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>out</b>, but <b>it</b> comes between the verb and <b>out</b> .名词必须放在<b>out</b> 之后，但<b>it</b> 放在动词和<b>out</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
break	<h3>break<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break a'way </b><br><b>(from sth)</b> if an object <b>breaks away</b> from sth that is holding it in place, it becomes separated from it脱离(某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat had broken away from its moorings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船起锚了。</font><br><b>(from sb)</b> to escape suddenly from sb who is holding you or keeping you prisoner逃离(某人)；挣脱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisoner broke away from the guards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 犯人挣脱了看守。</font><br><b>(from sb/sth)</b>to leave a group or an organization, such as a political party or a state, because of a disagreement,usually in order to form a new one脱离(集体或机构等，常另立门户):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several MPs broke away to form a new party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几名下院议员分离出去组建一个新党。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two states broke away from the federation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个州脱离了联邦。</font><br><b>(from sb/sth)</b> to move away from a group of people or a crowd(从一组人或一群人中)移开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She managed to break away from the pack }(= in a race)&b{ and establish a lead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她努力甩开了其他赛跑者，取得了领先的地位。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke away from the group and came over to talk to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离开了小组，过来和我们说话。</font><br><b>(from sb/sth)</b> to reject a tradition or the usual way of doing things and do sth new and different破除(传统)；摈除，改变(惯常的做法)；破旧(立新):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is trying to break away from its traditional image.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司正试图改变其传统形象。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'breakaway <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] a <b>breakaway</b> group, political party or part of a country is one that leaves a larger group(指集体、政党、国家的一部份)分离出来的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a breakaway faction/movement/republic </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 脱离原组织的派系；独立运动；已独立的共和国</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'breakaway <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] an act of separating from a larger group/state, etc.脱离；分离<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'down</b><br>if a vehicle, etc. <b>breaks down</b>, it stops working because of a fault(车辆等)出故障；坏掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The washing machine has broken down again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 洗衣机又坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We }(= our car)&b{ broke down twice on the way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的车在回家的路上抛锚了两次。</font><br>if talks, a marriage,etc. <b>break down</b>, they fail(谈判、婚姻等)破裂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Negotiations between the two sides have broken down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 双方谈判失败了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their marriage broke down after three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们结婚三年后分手了。</font><br>to lose control of your feelings and start crying情不自禁地哭起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As she drove away, I just broke down and wept.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她开车离开时， 我不禁失声痛哭。</font><br>if your health<b>breaks down</b>, it becomes very bad(身体)垮掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her health broke down as a result of the strain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因过度劳累身体垮掉了。</font><br><b>(into sth)</b> to be divided into parts so that it is easier to discuss,to analyse or to deal with分为(若干部份):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My weekly budget breaks down as follows:50% for rent, 20% for food, 10% for travel, and 20% for everything else.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每星期的预算分项列明如下：租金50%，食物20%，交通10%，其他20%。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job breaks down into seven parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项工作分七部份。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK STH DOWN 3 <br><b>(into sth)</b> if a substance <b>breaks down</b>, it separates into different parts or changes into sth else in a chemical process分解(为) ； 变化(成) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some pesticides break down safely in water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些杀虫剂可在水中安全分解。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  BREAK STH DOWN 4 <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'breakdown <i>n </i></b><br>[C] an occasion when a vehicle or a machine stops working(车辆或机器的)故障， 损坏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had a breakdown on the way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的车在回家的路上抛锚了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a breakdown truck </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 救险车</font><br>[C] [U] a failure of talks, a marriage, law and order, etc.(谈判、婚姻的)破裂，失败；(治安的)瘫痪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a breakdown in communication </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通信中断</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were both responsible for the breakdown of their marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们双方对婚姻的破裂都负有责任。</font><br>[C]a period of mental illness when sb becomes tired, depressed and unable to lead a normal life神经衰弱；精神崩溃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a <b>nervous breakdown</b> last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去年患了精神衰弱。</font><br>[C,usually sing.] detailed information or figures that are the results of dividing sth into its parts to explain it more clearly细目；分类:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get me a breakdown of how the money was spent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我看一下这笔钱使用情况的细目。</font><br>[U] the act of dividing a substance into its parts in a chemical process分解<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,broken-'down <i>adj </i></b><br>[usually before noun] <br>(of a vehicle or a machine车辆或机器) not working 抛锚的；出故障的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a broken-down car </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抛锚的汽车</font><br>in a poor condition状况差的； 破旧的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a broken-down wall </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剥落的墙壁</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break sth 'down </b><br>to make sth fall down or open by hitting it hard打倒，砸破(某物) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to get the police to break the door down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不得不请警察来撞开门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>door</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sth down</b><br>to destroy or remove sth,especially a problem or an attitude or opinion that sb has破除，消除(尤指问题、思想等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our aim is to <b>break down barriers</b> that exist between teachers and parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的宗旨是消除老师和家长之间的隔阂。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>barriers </b><br><b>(into sth)</b> to separate sth into smaller parts in order to analyse it or deal with it more easily把…分类；划分:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve broken down the costs by country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把费用按国家划分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company was broken down into smaller units.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司分成了较小的单位。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The question can be broken down into two parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题可以分为两部份。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  BREAK DOWN 5 <br><b>(into sth)</b> to make a substance separate into its parts or change in a chemical process使分解(为)；使变化(成):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Enzymes in the mouth and stomach break the food down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 口腔和胃里的…可分解食物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK DOWN 6<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'breakdown <i>n</i></b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,broken-'down <i>adj </i></b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'in </b><br>to enter a building illegally or by force非法(或强行)进入；破门而入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somebody broke in last night and stole the PC and video.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚有人闯进屋里偷走了电脑和录像机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firefighters had to break in to rescue them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队员得破门而入营救他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK INTO STH 1 <br><b>(on sth)</b> to interrupt sb when they are speaking or doing sth打断(别人的话) ； 搅扰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He apologized for breaking in on their conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为打断了他们的谈话而表示歉意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary broke in:‘It’s not her fault!’</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽插嘴说：“不是她的错！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'break-in <i>n </i></b><br>an entry into a building using force, usually illegally破门而入；闯入；(非法的)强行进入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There has been a series of breakins in the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区发生了一连串的闯入房屋案。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break sb/sth 'in </b><br>to train a person so that they get used to a new job or situation; to train a horse so that you can ride it让新来者适应(新工作或环境)；训练(马匹) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We try to break newcomers in gently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们尝试让新来者慢慢融入整体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horses hadn’t been broken in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些马还没训练好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break sth 'in </b><br>if you <b>break in</b> new shoes or boots, you wear them until they become comfortable把(新鞋或靴子)穿得合脚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me weeks to break in these new boots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我穿了几个星期才适应这双新靴子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>boots,shoes</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wear sth in</b><br><i>(AmE</i>) (in the past) to prepare the engine of a new car for normal use by driving it slowly and carefully(旧时)磨合，试用(新车)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>car</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run sth in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'into sth </b><br>to enter a building, open a car,etc. illegally and by force强行闯入；撬开(汽车等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A thief can break into a car in under ten seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼十秒钟之内就能把车撬开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three houses in our street have been broken into this week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们这条街本周有三家被盗。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>house,car</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK IN 1 <br>to suddenly begin to do sth such as laugh, cheer, run,etc.突然开始(笑、欢呼、跑等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke into a run when he saw the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看见警察，撒腿就跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her face broke into a huge smile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她立刻笑容满面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience broke into applause.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 观众中爆发出热烈的掌声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>smile/grin,run/trot,song,laughter </b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to use a banknote (= a piece of paper money) of high value to buy sth costing less找开(大面值钞票买东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t want to break into a twenty-pound note.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不想找开一张20 英镑的钞票。</font><br>to interrupt sb’s thoughts打断，搅扰(某人的思路):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her mother’s voice broke into her thoughts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她母亲的声音打断了她的思绪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>thoughts</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>disturb sth</b><br>to start to get involved in an activity that it is difficult to become involved in and to be successful at it成功参与；顺利打入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is having difficulty breaking into new markets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该公司在打入新市场时遇到困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is trying to break into journalism.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正努力在新闻界找寻立足之地。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>market </b><br>to open and use sth that you have been saving for an emergency or a special occasion启用(应急备用品):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to break into my savings to pay for the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得动用积蓄支付旅行费用。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'off; ,break sth 'off </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,break sth 'off sth)</b> to separate sth from sth else, using force; to become separated from sth in this way(使…)断开，折断；使…从…断开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leg of the table just broke off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子腿刚断。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A corner of her tooth had broken off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的牙齿有一角掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke off a piece of chocolate and gave it to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他掰下一块巧克力给我。</font><br>to stop speaking or stop doing sth suddenly before you have finished(突然)停顿，中断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke off abruptly in the middle of a sentence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一句话说了一半就突然停住口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to break off our holiday and return home immediately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不得不中止休假立刻回家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They broke off their conversation as I approached.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我走近他们就中断了谈话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep2 v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break sth 'off </b><br>to end sth such as a relationship终止(关系等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve broken off their engagement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们解除了婚约。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Britain threatened to break off diplomatic relations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国威胁说要断绝外交关系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were having an affair but she <b>broke it off</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正谈着恋爱，可她突然不谈了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>diplomatic relations,engagement,talks/negotiations</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>terminate sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'out </b><br>if sth unpleasant such as a fire, a war, etc. <b>breaks out</b>, it starts suddenly(火灾、战争等) 突然发生， 爆发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They would have got married in 1939 if war had not broken out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果不是战争爆发，他们在1939年就会结婚的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A fire broke out on a ferry yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天一艘渡船突然失火。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>war,fire,fighting,row,violence </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,break 'out of sth)</b> to escape from a place or from a situation逃离(某地)；摆脱(某状况):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two terrorists have broken out of Blackwall Prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名恐怖分子逃出布雷克威尔监狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She longed to break out of the daily routine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她渴望摆脱每日刻板的生活。</font><br>if sth<b>breaks out</b> on your skin, your skin becomes covered in sth(皮肤)突然布满某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>AmE</i>) I keep breaking out }(= I keep getting lots of spots)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我脸上不断长出粉刺。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sweat broke out all over his body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然冒出一身汗。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv 2 }also&b{ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'breakout <i>n </i></b><br>an escape from prison越狱<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outbreak <i>n </i></b><br>the start of sth or the sudden appearance of sth unpleasant or violent爆发；突然发生；突然出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the outbreak of war </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争的爆发</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'out in/into sth </b><br>to suddenly become covered in sth such as sweat突然布满(汗水等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke out in a cold sweat at the thought of the trial.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一想到审判就冒出一身冷汗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My skin has broken out in an itchy <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to achieve your first important success in sth; to make an important or new discovery获得初次重要成功； 作出新的重大发现； 突破:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Glenn Close broke </b><br>(of the sun or moon太阳或月亮) to appear from behind sth从…后露出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun finally broke through in the afternoon.</font></i><br><font <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK THROUGH,BREAK THROUGH STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'up </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) if a school or the children in it <b>break up</b>, school closes for the holidays at the end of a period of the school year (a<b>term)</b> (学校或学生)期终放假:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We break up for color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  学校放假了吗？ </font><br>(of a relationship, a band, etc.关系、乐队等) to come to an end; to stop working together结束；解散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their marriage broke up after ten years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的婚姻十年后破裂了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are rumours that the band are breaking telephones, or two radios that are used for sending and receiving messages, is <b>breaking up</b>, the people speaking can no longer hear each other clearly(电话、电台信号等)变弱，变模煳:<br><i><font </b><br>to end a relationship with sb(同某人)断绝某种关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rob and I broke up last week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和罗布上个星期吹了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s just broken up with her boyfriend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她刚刚和男朋友分手。</font><br><i><font [synonym]<b>split up (with/from sb),split sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'break-up <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the ending of a marriage or a relationship(婚姻或关系的)破裂，中断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He moved away after the break-up of his marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离婚之后就搬走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp marriage break-up </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婚姻破裂</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BREAK-UP at BREAK UP,BREAK SB/STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'up; ,break sb/sth 'up </b><br>(<b>into sth</b>) if a group of people or a family <b>breaks up</b>, or sb<b>breaks it up</b>, the members separate and do not stay together(使集体或家庭成员)分离，分成… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The conference broke up into discussion groups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与会者分成小组进行讨论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had never intended to break up his family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从未想过要拆散他的家庭。</font><br><i><font sb/sth up (into sth)</b><br>if a group of people meeting <b>break up</b>, or sb<b>breaks them up</b>, they go away in different directions(使聚集的人)散开，分散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting broke up after two hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议开了两个小时之后散会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police broke up the everyone else leave)&b{, but I have to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想让聚会解散，可我必须离开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'break-up <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the division of a company, a country, an organization or a group of people into smaller parts(公司、国家、组织等的)解体，分裂，分离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the break-up of the Commonwealth</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英联邦的解体</font><br><i><font <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,break 'up (into sth), ,break sth 'up (into sth)</b><br>if sth <b>breaks up</b>, or sb/sth <b>breaks it up</b>, it becomes separated into smaller pieces(把整体)拆开，分成部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship broke up on the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船触礁撞碎了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Break the chocolate up into small pieces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把巧克力掰成小块。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sentences can be broken up into clauses.</font></i><br><font period of time or a pattern, more interesting by adding sth different to it给(乏味的事物)增添趣味；调剂(生活等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I break up my day by going for a walk in the with sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to end your connection or relationship with sb/sth because you no longer agree with them(因分歧)离开某人，离开某事物；终止与…的关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nick broke with his father to set up his own firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尼克不再跟着父亲，办起自己的公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'break with sth breathe	<h3>breathe<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,breathe 'in </b><br>to take air into your lungs through your nose or mouth吸气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Breathe in brew	<h3>brew<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brew 'up; ,brew sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to prepare a hot drink of tea or coffee沏茶；煮咖啡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come into the kitchen while I brew up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我煮咖啡时你到厨房来吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll brew up a fresh pot of tea when they arrive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们到来时我来沏壶新茶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'brew-up <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>an act of making a drink of tea; the drink that you make沏茶；沏好的茶；煮好的咖啡<br>\n
brick	<h3>brick<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brick sth 'in/ 'up </b><br>to fill in or block an opening with bricks用砖堵住洞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fireplace had been bricked in some years before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 壁炉几年前用砖封上了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somebody had bricked up all the doors and windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人把所有的门窗用砖堵住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>window,fireplace,door</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
brighten	<h3>brighten<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brighten 'up </b><br>if the weather <b>brightens up</b>,it becomes clearer and brighter放晴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a dull start, it should brighten up later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早晨阴天，过会儿就会晴朗。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clear up</b><br>if a person<b>brightens up</b>, they become happier and more cheerful快活起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He brightened up when they said he could go with them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们说他可以一起去，他就高兴起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cheer up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brighten sth 'up </b><br>to make sth more interesting,exciting or attractive使更加有趣(或令人兴奋、有吸引力):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve brought some flowers to brighten the place up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我带来一些花，把这里装点一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Brighten up your bedroom with a few posters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 挂几张印刷画让你的寝室亮丽生色。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>place,room</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cheer sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
brim	<h3>brim<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brim 'over (with sth)</b><br>(<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) if a cup or a container<b>brims over</b> with a liquid, it is so full that the liquid flows over the edge(杯、容器等)满溢；溢出(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He filled my glass so full it was brimming over! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把我的杯子盛得太满了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes were brimming over with tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她热泪盈眶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>overflow (with sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brim 'over with sth </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) if sb <b>brims over with</b> sth,they show a lot of a particular quality表现得充满(某品质) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s brimming over with confidence and enthusiasm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她显得信心十足，意气风发。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>confidence,excitement</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
bring	<h3>bring<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth a'bout </b><br>to make sth happen导致；引起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What has brought about this change?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  是什么引起了这一转变？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His nervous breakdown was brought about by stress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他神经崩溃是压力所致。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>change,the end/collapse of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cause sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb a'long <i>(AmE</i>)=BRING SB ON</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb/sth a'long </b><br>to bring sb/sth somewhere with you带上… (去某处) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I bring my sister along to the party?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  我能带妹妹来参加聚会吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She brought some CDs along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她随身带了些激光唱片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb a'round <i>(AmE</i>)=BRING SB ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb/sth a'round <i>(especially AmE</i>)=BRING SB/STH ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth a'round to sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)=BRING STH ROUND TO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb 'back (to sth) </b><br>to return sb to a place;to take sb home把某人送回(某处)；送某人回家:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll bring you back again after the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 聚会结束后我再把你送回去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to bring him back }(= to make him return)&b{ to the matter in hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尽量让他回到手头的事情上来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Putting the driver of the car in prison won’t bring my sister back }(= return her to life after she has been killed)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把汽车司机关进监狱也不会让我姐姐复生。</font><br>to put sb back in their old job or position恢复某人的工作(或职位):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp United have brought back their old manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联队重新起用从前的经理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'back </b><br><b>(to sth)</b> to return sth to the place it came from把某物送回； 归还:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If the dress doesn’t fit, bring it back to the shop and we’ll change it for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 连衣裙若不合身，就送回店里来，我们给你换一件。</font><br>to make you remember sth or think about it again使回忆起；使再想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Talking about his death <b>brought it all back</b> to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说起他的死就让我想起那一切。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The photos brought back happy memories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些照片唤起美好的回忆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>memories </b><br>to make sth that existed or was done before be used or done again恢复； 重新使用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you in favour of bringing back the death penalty?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你赞成恢复死刑吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>restore sth;reintroduce sth <i>(both more formal</i>)</b><br><b>(for sb)</b> to return with sth for sb给某人带回…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What shall I bring back for the children from Paris?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  我从巴黎回来给孩子们带什么好呢？</font><br>In informal language <b>bring sb back sth</b> and, less often, <b>bring sb sth back</b> are also used in this meaning.非正式语言也说<b>bring sb back sth</b> ，有时说<b>bring sb sth back</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I brought the kids back some books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给孩子们带回来几本书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you bring me something back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给我带点东西回来好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bring sb/sth before sb/sth <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to present sb for judgement; to present sth to sb/sth for discussion or a decision把某人提交法庭审判；将…提交讨论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children should not be brought before a court.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不应该让儿童在法庭受审。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The case was brought before the judge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个案子提交给了法官审理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>case</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>haul sb before sb/sth,haul sb up before sb/sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb 'down (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to depress sb; to make sb unhappy使沮丧；使不高兴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spending New Year alone brought me right down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 独自一人过新年让我闷闷不乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get sb down;depress sb <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb/sth 'down </b><br>to take sb/sth from a higher to a lower level使下落； 使降低位置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They brought all the boxes down from the attic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们从阁楼搬下了所有箱子。</font><br>to make sb/sth fall to the ground使倒地；使跌倒；使坠落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was brought down in the penalty area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在罚球区被撞倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their plane was brought down by a violent storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的飞机遇到强烈风暴坠毁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she fell, she brought him down with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她倒下的时候把他一同拉下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He brought down the bird with a single shot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一枪就打下了那只鸟。</font><br>to make a government,a leader, etc. lose power or be defeated使(政府、领导人等)倒台；打倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scandal brought the government down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件丑闻导致了政府垮台。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>government</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'down</b><br>to make sth smaller in size or amount降低；减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are determined to bring down inflation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决心降低通货膨胀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The price war is bringing the cost of flights down.</font></i><br><font [OBJ]<b>plane</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>land sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp bring the 'house down <br>to make an audience laugh or clap in an enthusiastic way令观众捧腹大笑； 使观众掌声如雷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her performance brought the house down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的演出赢得了雷鸣般的掌声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'down on/upon sb <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to make sth unpleasant happen to sb as a result of your actions给某人带来(不愉快的事)；给某人招惹某事；连累:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had brought nothing but trouble down on the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他尽给家里添乱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp bring down the 'curtain on sth;bring the 'curtain down on sth<br>to finish or mark the end of sth落下帷幕；结束；标志着…的终结:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her decision to retire brought down the curtain on a <i>formal</i>, <i>rare</i>)</b><br>to give birth to sb生孩子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She brought forth a son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她生了个儿子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>child</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'forth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to 她的话招致尖刻的回应。</font><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>) to take sth out of a container(从容器中)拿出，取出<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'forward </b><br>to move sth to an earlier date or time将(…的日期或时间)提前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll have to bring the date of the final game forward.</font></i><br><font 她提出了建新校舍的建议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>proposal</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth forward</b><br>(<i>finance</i>) to move a total from the bottom of one page or column of numbers to the top of </b><br>to make or earn money for sb挣；(给某人)赚得…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much is she bringing in every month?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  她每月挣多少钱？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His job only brought him in a small income.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的工作收入微薄。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb 'in </b><br>(<b>on sth</b>) to get sb involved in sth,especially to advise or help, etc.让某人参与(尤指提供意见或协助等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can we deal with this without bringing the police in?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  我们不求助于警方能处理这件事吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to bring Inspector Lacey in on this investigation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想请莱西巡官参与这项调查。</font><br><i><font [OBJ]<b>experts,police,troops</b><br>if the police <b>bring sb in</b> they take them to a police station to question them or arrest them将(某人)带到警察局讯问；逮捕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two men have been brought in for questioning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有两名男子被带到警察局进行讯问。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>suspect</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb/sth 'in </b><br>to take sb/sth into a room, a house, an office, etc.把…带进(房屋、办公室等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you bring in another chair? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请再搬张椅子进来好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring him in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把他带进来！</font><br>In informal language <b>bring sb in sth</b> and,less often, <b>bring sb sth in</b> are also used.非正式语言也说<b>bring sb in sth</b> ，有时说<b>bring sb sth in</b>:<br><i><font us some tea in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请给我们拿些茶来好吗？ </font><br>to attract sb/sth to a place or a business吸引(访客或顾客等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The visitor centre is bringing in more and more people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游客中心吸引着越来越多的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,customers,tourism</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BRING SB/STH INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sth 'in </b><br>to introduce a new law制订(新法规) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 陪审团作出有罪的裁决。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ verdict,decision</b> }<br>to mention or include sth提及；包括:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She brought in other evidence to support her argument.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她引用其他证据来支持她的论点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bring sb/sth 'into sth </b><br>to take sb/sth into a place把…带进某处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring that chair into the dining room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把那张椅子搬到餐厅吧。</font><br>to include or mention sb/sth in a discussion, conversation,etc.将…包括在(讨论、谈话等)中；让某人参加；提及:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why do you always have to bring Pete into it }(= brush	<h3>brush<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brush a'gainst/ 'by/ 'past sb/sth </b><br>to touch sb/sth lightly when you move close to them/it擦…而过；轻轻擦过…:<br><i><font fallen掸乾净某人/自己(尤指摔跤后拂去衣服上的灰尘) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stood up and brushed herself down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她站起来把身上的灰尘拍掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Brush your coat down to get the mud off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你外套上的泥刷乾净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp also</i> BRUSH STH OFF 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brush 'off; ,brush sth 'off </b><br>if mud, dust etc.<b>brushes off</b>, or you <b>brush it off</b>, it is removed by brushing被刷掉；拂去…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t worry about the mud — it’ll brush off easily when it’s dry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们很容易就把尘土掸掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,brush sb 'off (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to refuse to listen to sb; to ignore sb in a rude or unkind way不理睬某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to explain to her, but she brushed him off impatiently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp sb/yourself by brushing their/your clothes quickly with your hand掸净某人/自己(拂去衣服上的灰尘)<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BRUSH SB/YOURSELF DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp bubble	<h3>bubble<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bubble 'over (with sth) </b><br>to be full of excitement,enthusiasm, ideas, etc.充满，充溢着(兴奋、热情、某想法等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were bubbling over with excitement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们兴奋不已。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bubble 'under; ,bubble 'under sth </b><br>if sth is<b>bubbling under</b>, it is already fairly successful but is not yet as successful as other things of the same kind, although it is likely to be so soon有希望即将成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is our list of tracks bubbling under — songs that may soon be in the Top 20.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是我们认为有希望走红的歌曲目录─可能即将进入排行榜前20 名的歌曲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bubble 'up </b><br>if a liquid <b>bubbles up</b> from the ground, etc. it rises up in the form of bubbles or making the sound of bubbles(液体)冒泡，发出冒泡的声音:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water bubbled up from the pool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 池里的水咕嘟咕嘟地冒泡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)Clouds will bubble up }(= start to form) &b{later this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天傍晚将转多云。</font><br>if laughter or an emotion <b>bubbles up</b>, it becomes stronger and starts to be heard or seen(笑声)变大，被听到；(感情)变强烈，开始流露:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could feel the anger bubbling up inside me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到心中潜涌着的愤怒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Laughter came bubbling up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 笑声传了出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

bugger	<h3>bugger<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bugger a'bout/a'round (with sth) (<i>BrE</i>, !,<i>slang</i>) </b><br>to waste time doing stupid or unimportant things; to behave in a silly way闲混；胡闹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop buggering about and let’s get on with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别晃荡了，我们继续干正事吧。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Mess around</b> or, in British English, <b>mess about</b> is a more polite informal way to say this.较礼貌的非正式说法是<b>mess around</b> 或英国英语的<b>mess about</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bugger sb a'bout/a'round <i>(BrE</i>, !, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to treat sb badly or in a way that wastes their time难为某人；故意浪费某人的时间:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sick of being buggered about by my boss.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板就跟我耗着，真让人恶心。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Mess sb around</b> or, in British English,<b>mess sb about</b> is a more polite informal way to say this.较礼貌的非正式说法是<b>mess sb around</b> 或英国英语的<b>mess sb about</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bugger 'off <i>(BrE</i>, !, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to go away走开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bugger off and leave me alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走开，别管我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Clive’s buggered off to the pub with Julie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 克莱夫和朱莉去酒馆了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Clear off</b> is a more polite informal way to say this.较礼貌的非正式说法是<b>clear off</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,bugger sth 'up (<i>BrE</i>,!, <i>slang</i>) </b><br>to spoil sth; <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] existing as an essential part of sth/sb内在的；固有的；天生的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the inbuilt survival instinct of animals </font></i><br><font already achieved在…的基础上发展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to build on last year’s success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要在去年成功的基础上努力。</font><br><i><font [OBJ]<b>success,skills,strengths,achievements</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This success should be built on, not ignored.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 应该在此次成功的基础上发展，而不是就此停下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,build sth 'on; ,build sth 'onto sth </b><br>to add sth such as an extra room to an existing building(在建筑物上)增建…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had built on a large extension at the back of the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to base sth on sth; to use sth as the basis or foundation for sth把…作为…的基础:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our company has built its reputation on the quality of up after the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车祸之后来往车辆排起的长龙越来越长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could feel the anger building up inside <b>'build-up <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] [U] an increase in the amount, strength or number of sth增长； 增加； 增强:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a build-up of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大气中二氧化碳的增加</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BUILD-UP at BUILD UP (TO STH),BUILD YOURSELF UP (TO STH); BUILD-UP at BUILD SB/STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,build 'up(to sth), ,build yourself 'up(to sth) </b><br>to gradually prepare yourself for sth such as a race or competition(为…)逐步做准备:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Start gently and build up to the more strenuous exercises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开始时慢点，逐渐过渡到较强的锻炼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Build up slowly until you can jog for 30 minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 慢慢地增加时间，直到能跑上30 分钟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Build yourself up to the day of the performance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好好为演出那天做准备。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'build-up (to sth) <i>n </i></b><br>[C, usually sing.] the time before an important event, when people are gradually preparing for it(重要事情的) 前期， 准备过程:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the build-up to the Olympics</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奥林匹克运动会的前期准备</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BUILD-UP at BUILD UP;BUILD-UP at BUILD SB/STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,build sb/yourself 'up </b><br>to make sb healthier or stronger增强…的体质；使更加强壮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave me lots of vitamins and minerals to build me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她让我服用很多维生素和矿物质以使我更健康。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,build sb/sth 'up</b><br>to speak about sb/sth with great enthusiasm, often praising them more than they deserve吹捧；鼓吹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has been <b>built up to be</b> the answer to the nation’s problems.</font></i><br><font description, especially of a performance,that is intended to make people excited about it and want to see it宣扬；捧场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The reviewers gave the play a big build-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 评论家对这齣戏大肆吹捧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BUILD-UP at BUILD UP;BUILD-UP at BUILD UP (TO STH),BUILD YOURSELF UP (TO STH)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,build sth 'up </b><br>to collect or create sth, often gradually over a period of time(逐步)收集，建立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has built up an impressive collection of paintings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她收集了相当多的画作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>collection,library </b><br>to develop sth建立；开发:<br><i><font built up quite a reputation for herself as a reporter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哈丽雅特作为记者赢得了相当高的声誉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are gradually limit is lower in built-up areas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在楼房林立的地区最高限速要低一些。</font><br>built-up shoes, boots, or heels have extra height buoy	<h3>buoy<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buoy sb/sth 'up </b><br>to make or keep sb cheerful and confident鼓励；鼓舞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Winning the match buoyed the team up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛获胜使该队欢欣鼓舞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party did little to buoy up her spirits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次聚会并没有让她振作多少。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was buoyed up by her father’s praise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲的赞扬给她增添了信心。</font><br>to keep sb/sth floating; to stop sb/sth from sinking使漂浮；使浮起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I relaxed, letting the salt water buoy me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放松下来，任凭海水托浮着。</font><br><b>Buoy sb/sth</b> can also be used.也可以说<b>buoy sb/sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Buoyed by their recent victory, the team are convinced they can win the final.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在最近的胜利鼓舞下，这个队有信心赢得决赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buoy sth 'up (<i>finance</i>)</b><br>to make or keep prices at a high or satisfactory level保持高价；使(价格)维持于较高水平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Share prices were buoyed up by the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个消息使股价居高不下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to buoy up the economy </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 繁荣经济</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>prices</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
burn	<h3>burn<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn a'way; ,burn sth a'way </b><br>to disappear as a result of burning; to make sth do this(使)烧掉，烧光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Half the candle had burnt away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蜡烛烧掉了半支。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire had burned away down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们坐在炉火旁， 看着它慢慢烧完。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>burn up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn 'down; ,burn sth 'down </b><br>if a building<b>burns down</b>, or sb <b>burns it down</b>, it is destroyed by fire(把…)焚毁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The palace burnt down in the 19th century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座宫殿于19世纪被烧毁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She threatened to burn the house down.</font></i><br><font use energy by exercising(通过锻炼等)消耗能量:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Walking briskly can burn off a lot of calories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快步走能消耗很多热量。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>calories,fat</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn 'out; ,burn sth 'out </b><br>if a machine or part of a machine <b>burns out</b> or sb/sth <b>burns it out</b>, it stops working because it has been used too much or has got too hot(因使用过多或过热) 出故障:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clutch has burnt out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离合器因过热而失灵了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I burnt out the motor in the first car I had.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把我的第一辆车的马达烧坏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn 'out; ,burn itself 'out </b><br>to stop burning because there is no more fuel烧尽；熄灭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blow out the candles before they burn out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把蜡烛吹灭，免得烧完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By the time the fire brigade arrived the fire had burnt (itself) out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队赶到时火已经熄灭了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURN STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn 'out; ,burn yourself 'out </b><br>to become very tired or sick and unable to continue your work by working too hard over a period of time耗尽体力；积劳成疾；累垮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a high pressure job and many people burn out at a young age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那工作压力很大，很多人年纪轻轻就积劳成疾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he carries on working so hard, he’ll burn himself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要是继续这样拚命工作，就会把自己累垮。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURN SB OUT,BURN SB OUT OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'burnout <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the state of being very tired or sick because you have worked too hard筋疲力尽； 过度劳累:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Burnout is common among teachers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过度劳累在桝师中很常见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burnt-'out (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually</i> ,burned-'out)</b><br>very tired or sick because you have worked too hard筋疲力尽的；过度劳累的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp burnt-out rock singers </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 体力耗尽的摇磙歌手</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURNT-OUT at BURN STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn sb 'out; ,burn sb 'out of sth </b><br>to force sb to leave a building by setting fire to it放火迫使某人离开(建筑物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A gang has tried to burn a woman out of her home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一伙匪徒试图放火把一名女子赶出她的家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURN OUT,BURN YOURSELF OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn sth 'out </b><br>to destroy sth completely by fire,so that only the outside or the frame is left把…烧成空架子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two cars were burnt out in the crash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撞车事故中有两辆汽车被烧成废铁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURN OUT,BURN ITSELF OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'burnt-out (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually</i>'burned-out) <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] completely destroyed or badly damaged by fire烧毁的；烧坏的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp burnt-out buses </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烧成空壳的公共汽车</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp burned-out houses </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烧毁的房屋</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURNT-OUT at BURN OUT,BURN YOURSELF OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn 'up </b><br>to be destroyed by heat被烧毁；被烧掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The spacecraft burned up as it entered the earth’s atmosphere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宇宙飞船进入地球大气层时被烧毁。</font><br>(<i>usually used in the progressive tenses</i>通常用于进行时) to have a fever or a high temperature发烧；体温高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is burning up — she needs a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发烧了─她需要看医生。</font><br>if a fire <b>burns up</b>, it gets stronger and has larger flames(火)烧得更旺；火势加大<br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>burn down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn sb 'up <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb very angry激怒；使大怒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The way he treats me really burns me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那么对待我实在令我愤怒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burn sth 'up </b><br>to get rid of sth completely by burrow	<h3>burrow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'burrow in sth </b><br>to search for sth among things in a container(在容器等里)搜寻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She burrowed in her pocket and eventually found a few coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在衣袋里摸来摸去，最后找到了几枚硬币。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
burst	<h3>burst<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burst 'in (on sb/sth), ,burst 'into sth </b><br>to enter a room, a building, etc. suddenly and noisily, interrupting the people who are in it闯入打扰(人或事情)；闯进某处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He apologized for bursting in on our meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为闯进来打断了我们的会议表示歉意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door suddenly flew open and Mia burst in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门猛地打开了，米娅一头闯进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran down the stairs and burst into the kitchen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她跑下楼梯，一头钻进了厨房。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURST INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'burst into sth </b><br>to start producing or doing sth suddenly and with great force突然爆发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aircraft burst into flames }(= suddenly started to burn)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机猛地燃烧起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was so relieved I <b>burst into tears</b> }(= suddenly started to cry)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我如释重负， 突然大哭起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cab’s engine <b>burst into life</b> }(= suddenly started to work)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出租车的引擎猛地发动起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the curtain fell, the audience burst into applause }(=suddenly started to clap)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着帷幕落下，观众突然报以热烈的掌声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tears,flames,laughter,life</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BURST IN (ON SB/STH),BURST INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'burst on/onto sth (<i>also</i> 'burst upon sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to appear somewhere suddenly in a dramatic or unusual way突然在…出现；突然显现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A major new talent has burst on/onto the tennis scene.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门突然打开，一名男子从房子里冲了出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,burst 'out doing sth </b><br>to begin buy	<h3>buy<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sth 'back </b><br>if somebody <b>buys sth back</b>, they buy again sth that they have sold earlier to sb else把(卖出去的东西)买回；回购:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bank will supply and buy back foreign currency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银行将提供和回买外汇服务。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sold the car in 1949 for ￡400. To buy it back last year cost ￡31000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他于1949年以400 英镑卖掉汽车。去年要回购需花31 000 英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp
