shares with an agreement that it will buy them again at a later date股份回购(公司把为集资而售出的股份买回来):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a share buy-back</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 股份回购</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a share buy-back programme </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 股份回购计划</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sth 'in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to buy sth or a large amount of sth for a special occasion or in order to have a supply for the future(为某事或库存而)大量购买…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll have to buy in extra food if they’re coming to stay for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他们要来住段时间，我得额外购买些食物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>food</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy 'into sth </b><br>to buy shares in a company, for example to gain control over it购买公司股份(尤指为取得股权):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are looking to buy into another insurance company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们期待着购买另外一家保险公司的股份。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>company,business </b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to accept sth that many other people believe随大流信从:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We don’t buy into the myth that money is the answer to everything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不会人云亦云地相信钱是万能的神话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sb 'off </b><br>to pay sb to stop them acting against you, causing trouble for you, etc.收买， 贿赂(某人不做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to buy Brennan off to stop him from talking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不得不用钱封住布伦南的口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sb/yourself 'out; ,buy sb/yourself 'out of sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to pay money so that sb/you can leave an organization, especially the armed forces, before the time agreed付给补偿金(让某人或自己提前退役、离职等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After four years in the navy I bought myself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在海军服役四年之后我出钱提前退役了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sb/sth 'out </b><br>to buy part of a company, business,etc. from sb else so that you own all of it and control it购买…的全部股权:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to buy her out and have the house to myself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想买下她的产权，自己占有这房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company was bought out by two German businessmen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司的全部股份都被两名德国商人买下了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>partner,company</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'buyout <i>n </i>(<i>finance</i>)</b><br>a situation when sb buys enough shares in a company to gain control of it控制股权收购<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buy sth 'up </b><br>to buy quickly all of sth or as much as you can迅速地全部(或尽量)购买某物；收购:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve bought up all the land in the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们收购了这个地区的全部土地。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>company,land,property</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
buzz	<h3>buzz<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buzz a'round; ,buzz a'round sth (<i>also</i> ,buzz a'bout/ 'round, ,buzz a'bout/ 'round sth <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to move around quickly and busily(在…或为…)团团转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She buzzed round (the kitchen).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她(在厨房里)四下忙碌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The photographer buzzed around, checking the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 摄影师跑来跑去忙着调整灯光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Questions buzzed round inside my head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我脑海里充满了疑问。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buzz 'off (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb, not very politely, to go away走开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Buzz off, I’m trying to work! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走开，我得干活！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish he’d buzz off! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望他走开！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clear off;go away <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,buzz 'round; ,buzz 'round sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)=BUZZ AROUND,BUZZ AROUND STH</b><br>\n
call	<h3>call<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]<b>To call</b> is the most common way to say ‘to telephone’ in American English. It is also used in British English, but <b>to phone</b> and <b>to ring</b> are more common.美国英语最常用<b>to call</b> 表示打电话。它也用于英国英语，但不及<b>to phone</b> 和<b>to ring</b> 常用。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call a'round; ,call a'round sb/sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to telephone a number of different people, usually to try to get information四处(给…)打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been calling around trying to get the best price on a computer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正四下打电话，想找到买计算机的最优价格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I called around the neighbourhood to get support for my campaign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给左邻右舍打电话，请他们支持我发起的运动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb a'way </b><br>to ask sb to stop doing what they are doing and go somewhere else to deal with sth把…叫到别处去(做别的事)；叫走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was called away to the phone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人叫他去接电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was called away from the meeting to deal with an emergency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被叫出会场去处理紧急情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'back <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to visit sb again再次拜访；回访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll call back later when your wife’s at home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回头等你夫人在家时我再来拜访。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'back; ,call sb 'back </b><br>to telephone sb again or to telephone sb who telephoned you earlier(给…)再打电话，回电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Call back in an hour — he’ll be here then.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一小时之后再打电话吧─他就回来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kate phoned. Can you call her back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯特来电话了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll call you back with the details later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回头再给你打电话，告诉你详细情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'callback <i>n </i></b><br>a device in a telephone that automatically calls again a number that was busy when you first called it(电话中的)自动重拨装置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a callback facility </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自动重拨功能</font><br>a telephone call that you make to sb who has called you earlier回电话<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'back </b><br>to shout to sb to turn around and come back to a place they have just left把…喊回来；喊回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran off, but he called me back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我撒腿就跑，可他把我喊回去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started to walk off but were called back by the police officer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们拔腿走开，可被警察喊了回去。</font><br>to ask sb who is applying for a job, etc. to return so that you can talk to them again通知(求职者)回来(再谈):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three people were called back for a second interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请了三个人来进行第二次面试。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'by <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to visit a place or a person for a short time, usually when you are going somewhere else(顺道)拜访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you call by on your way home? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你回家时进来坐坐吧？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jan called by to bring your gift.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简给你送了份礼物来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'down</b><br>to shout to sb to ask them to come down from a place which is higher than you喊(某人)下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve called him down }(= to come downstairs)&b{ to breakfast already.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经喊他下楼吃早餐了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sth 'down (on/upon sb) (<i>literary</i>)</b><br>to pray that sth unpleasant will happen to sb because of sth bad they have done to you; to make sth bad happen to sb祈求某人受惩罚；诅咒；使某人遭殃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He called down curses on them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他诅咒他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>curses,wrath</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call for sb <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to go to sb’s home, for example,and take them or go with them somewhere(去…家里等)接某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I call for you at eight? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我八点钟来接你好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call for sth </b><br>if a situation <b>calls for</b> a particular action or quality, it needs or requires it需要(行动或素质):<br><i><font great skill and courage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的工作需要很高的技能和勇气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tougher action by the government is called for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府应该采取更加严厉的行动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>un'called for <i>adj </i></b><br>(of remarks or behaviour话语或行为) not fair or necessary in the circumstances不公正的；不必要的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall ignore that uncalled-for remark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会理会那句不负责任的话的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call for sth;'call for sb/sth to do sth </b><br>to demand publicly that sth should be done(公开)要求；(向…)呼吁…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The group has called for a boycott of the elections.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个集体呼吁大家抵制选举。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The other directors have called for him to resign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 其他领导人已要求他辞职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A total ban on nuclear weapons has been called for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们呼吁全面禁止核武器。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sth 'forth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to produce a particular reaction引起；使产生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her remarks have called forth harsh criticism in the media.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的话引发了媒体的严厉批评。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'in </b><br><b>[+adv/prep ]</b> (<i>especially BrE</i>) to visit a place or a person for a short time, usually when you are going somewhere else(顺路)拜访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He called in at the office before he left for London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他动身去伦敦之前顺便来办公室看了看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She often calls in for a chat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她经常进来聊天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop in (on sb/at…) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to telephone the place where you work打电话来(工作单位):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She <b>called in sick</b> this morning }(= telephoned to say that she was ill/sick and would not be coming to work)&b{.</font></i><br><font to complain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多听众打电话来投诉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call-in <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>a television or radio show in which people can phone to talk to people on the show, ask questions, give their opinions, etc.(电视或电台的)电话节目:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a call-in show </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 直播电视节目</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'in </b><br>to ask sb to come and help, give advice,repair sth, etc.召来， 叫来(服务等) :<br><i><font a plumber in to look at this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须请水暖工来瞧瞧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bomb disposal experts were called in to get rid of the device.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请来了炸弹处理专家销毁这个装置。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>police,expert</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>send for sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sth 'in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to order or request the return of sth, especially a product that has a fault下令收回，要求退回(尤指有毛病的产品):<br><i><font <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb/sth 'off </b><br>to order soldiers, dogs, etc. to stop attacking sb, searching for sb/sth, etc.把(士兵等)叫走(不再搜查等)；把(狗等)叫开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please call your dog off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把你的狗叫走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>dog</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sth 'off </b><br>to cancel or abandon sth that has been planned or that has already started取消；停止进行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting was called off at the last minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议在最后一分钟取消了。</font><br><i><font [OBJ]<b>match/game,engagement/wedding,deal,search,strike</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call on sb</b><br>(<i>especially BrE</i>) to visit sb for a short [synonym]<b>drop in (on sb/at …)</b><br><i>(AmE</i>) to ask sb in a class, etc. to answer a question or give their opinion请(课堂上的学生等)回答提问(或发表意见):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The math teacher always calls on the boys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数学老师总是要男同学回答提问。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call on/upon sth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to use your strength,courage, etc. in order to achieve sth or deal with a problem尽力，鼓起勇气(为争取某事物或处理某问题):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had to call on all her reserves of courage to face the ordeal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不得不鼓足勇气直面这一严峻考验。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>strength,courage</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call on/upon sb to do sth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to make a serious or urgent request to sb to do sth(严肃或迫切地)请求，要求，要(某人做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m available in case I’m called on to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果需要帮忙，我随叫随到。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We call upon all parties to respect the results of the election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要求所有党派尊重选举结果。</font><br>to formally invite or request sb to speak, etc.邀请，要求(某人讲话等)；恭请:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I now call upon Mr. Spring to give the vote of thanks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在请斯普林先生致谢辞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was called on to make a </b><br>to shout or say sth loudly in order to get sb’s attention or help(向某人)呼喊，喊…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He called out to her, but she carried on walking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大声喊她，但她继续走她的路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He woke in the night, calling out her name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他夜里醒来，呼唤着她的名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They called out the numbers of the winning tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们高声宣布中奖的票号。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>name</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>shout out (to sb), shout sth out (to sb) </b><br>[NOTE]<b>Call/call sth</b> can be used with a similar meaning, but <b>call out/call sth out</b> suggests sth louder or more urgent.表达相近含义可用<b>call/call sth</b> ，但<b>call out/call sth out</b> 含较大声和迫切之意。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'out </b><br>to ask sb to come to help you,when there is an emergency召唤某人(帮忙或立即行动):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve never had to call the doctor out at night before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以前从来没有在夜里请过医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to call out an electrician.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得叫来电工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Troops were called out to deal with the riot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已召集部队来镇压骚乱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>doctor,fire brigade,electrician </b><br>to order or ask workers to stop work as a protest下令罢工； 通知罢工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Miners were called out on strike by union leaders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会领导人号召矿工罢工。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call-out <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>an occasion when you ask sb to come to help you in an emergency(紧急)求援，求助:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ambulance call-outs </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叫救护车</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much is the plumber’s call-out charge? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请水暖工上门要花多少钱？</font><br>[NOTE]The noun <b>call</b> is also used.也可用名词<b>call</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'out for sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to telephone a shop,store, restaurant, etc. to ask them to deliver food to you at home or at work(打电话)叫外卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s call out for pizza.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们打电话要外卖比萨饼吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>send out for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'over </b><br>to call sb to come over to where you are, because you want to speak to them, give or show them sth, etc.叫来；让(某人)来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Call the waiter over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叫服务员过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'round <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to visit sb at their home for a short time(到别人家里)短暂拜访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just called round to say hello.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚进去问候了一声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop round</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call 'up; ,call sb/sth 'up <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to make a phone call to a person or a place打电话(给某人或到某处):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Call up and make a reservation for 8 o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打电话预订8点钟的位子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She called him up from the bus station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在公共汽车站给他打电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Call up the office and ask for Mr. Morgan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打电话到办公室找摩根先生。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Call</b> and <b>call sb</b> are also frequently used with this meaning. <b>Call up</b> and <b>call sb up</b> are very common in spoken English.此义也常作<b>call</b> 和<b>call sb</b> 。英语口语经常说<b>call up</b> 和<b>call sb up</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sb 'up </b><br>to officially ask sb to go to do training in the army, navy or air force or to fight in a war徵召(服役)；徵召入伍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the war began, he was too old to be called up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争开始的时候他年纪太大，不能应徵。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>conscript sb <i>(especially BrE</i>),draft sb <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to ask sb to join sth or take part in sth; to choose sb to play in a team选入，徵调(运动员):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been called up for next week’s match.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已入选参加下个星期的比赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call-up <i>n </i></b><br>an official order to join the army,navy or air force徵兵令； 徵召令:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp call-up papers/camps </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 徵集令；徵集营</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>,<i>sport</i>) an official invitation to play in a team or in a particular game(运动员的)选调函，徵调函<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,call sth 'up </b><br><i>(computing</i>) to obtain information that is stored on a computer调用贮存； 调出备用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She called up all the files he had worked on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她调出他处理过的所有文件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>file,information</b><br>to bring sth back to your mind; to make you remember and think about sth使回忆起；使想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sound of their laughter called up memories of his own childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的笑声唤起了他童年的回忆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>memory</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>recall sth (<i>formal</i>)</b><br>to use a quality that you have发挥，利用(素质) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He called up all his reserves of courage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他鼓足勇气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>reserves</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call upon sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'call upon sb to do sth</b><br>\n
calm	<h3>calm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,calm 'down; ,calm sb/yourself 'down </b><br>if sb<b>calms down</b>, or you <b>calm them down</b>, they stop being angry or excited and become calm(使)平静下来，镇静，安静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Calm down! I’ve said I’m sorry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别生气了！我说过对不起了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was nothing we could do to calm her down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们无法让她平静下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went for a walk to calm himself down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出去散步，使自己平静下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack was so shocked that he had to be calmed down by his wife and son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克受到了很大惊吓，须要由妻子和儿子来抚慰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,calm 'down; ,calm sth 'down </b><br>to become calmer; to make a situation calmer(使局势)趋于平静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole fuss will have calmed down by tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切争吵到明天就会缓和下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve spoken to them to try to calm things down a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我告诉过他们要设法平息事情。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
camp	<h3>camp<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,camp 'out (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to sleep outside, usually in a tent; to sleep on the floor somewhere for a short time露宿；露营；(暂时)睡地板:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If there is nowhere to stay, we’ll have to camp out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果找不到住处，我们只能露宿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People camped out in the school hall to escape the flood water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们在学校礼堂临时寄宿躲避洪水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'campout <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>a time when people sleep outside in a tent露营<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,camp it 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>(of a man男子) to move or behave deliberately in a way that people think is typical of a man who is sexually attracted to other men (a <b>homosexual)</b> 故意模仿同性恋；搔首弄姿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He enjoys camping it up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢表现得像个同性恋。</font><br>to exaggerate your behaviour or a performance to make people laugh装腔作势，装模作样(以引人发笑):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I really camped it up in the final scene.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在最后一幕演得实在过火了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>\n
cancel	<h3>cancel<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cancel 'out; ,cancel sth 'out </b><br>if two or more things <b>cancel out</b> or one <b>cancels out</b> the other,they are equally important, but have an opposite effect on a situation so that the situation does not change抵消； 对消:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gains and losses are expected to cancel out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预计得失参半。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our expenditure and profits <b>cancel each other out</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的开支和赢利相互抵消。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job is hard work, but this is cancelled out by the fact that the people are so nice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作辛苦不要紧，因为大家都很友善。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
cannon	<h3>cannon<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cannon 'into sb/sth</b><br>(of a moving person,vehicle, etc.移动的人、车辆等) to hit sb/sth by accident and with great force冲撞；猛撞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stopped suddenly and I almost cannoned into her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她突然停下来，我差点撞了她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cannon 'off sb/sth </b><br>if sth moving <b>cannons off</b> sb/sth, it hits them/it by accident and with great force and then goes off in a different direction(移动着的东西)撞上…后弹开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ball cannoned off his leg into the goal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球碰了他的腿之后弹入球门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
capitalize (<i>also </i> capitalise)	<h3>capitalize (<i>also </i> capitalise)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'capitalize on sth (<i>also</i> 'capitalize upon sth<i>less frequent</i>, <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to use sth to gain further advantage for yourself以…谋私利:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They capitalized on their success by raising prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们藉着成功的势头提价。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The opposition tried to capitalize on popular discontent over the new law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反对派企图利用公众对新法规的不满。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>success,opportunity,potential</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take advantage of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
care	<h3>care<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'care for sb </b><br>to like or love sb喜欢，爱(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I care deeply for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我非常爱你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just want to be loved and cared for by somebody.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只是想有人爱我，在乎我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'care for sb/sth </b><br>to take care of and be responsible for sb who is very young, old or sick, etc. or for sth that is in danger or could be damaged照顾，照料，保护(人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurses give advice to the patients and those who care for them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 护士给病人和陪护人员提出建议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cares for several children with special needs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她照看着几个需要特别照顾的儿童。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is committed to caring for the environment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司承诺保护环境。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>children,the sick,the elderly</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were all clean and well cared for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们都乾乾净净，照料得不错。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LOOK AFTER SB/STH/YOURSELF;LOOK AFTER STH <br><b>not care for sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b> to not like sb/sth very much不太喜欢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t care for opera.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不大喜欢歌剧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp would you care for ... (<i>formal</i>)<br>used to ask sb if they would like sth to eat or drink你想来点(吃或喝的东西)吗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you care for a cup of tea? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想喝杯茶吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>un'cared for <i>adj </i></b><br>not looked after; neglected无人照看的；被忽视的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children looked dirty and uncared for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们看上去脏兮兮的，没人照料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp uncared-for gardens </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疏于管理的园子</font><br>\n
carry	<h3>carry<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth a'round (<i>also</i> ,carry sth a'bout/'round <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br><b>(with you)</b> to take sth from one place to another; to take sth everywhere with you(随身)带着某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to carry this bag about with me all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想成天提着这个包到处走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The CD player is light enough to carry around in your pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp CD机很轻，可以放在衣袋里随身携带。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb/sth a'long </b><br>to take or move sb/sth forward把…往前带(或移动):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His body had been carried along by the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的躯体被河水冲走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd was so thick that she was carried along with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群挤得水泄不通，她只能随着他们移动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) His immense enthusiasm carried us all along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他巨大的热情深深地感染了我们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb/sth a'way/ 'off </b><br>to support the weight of sb/sth and take them/it away把… 抬走；把… 冲 走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A strong current carried the dinghy away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一阵激流把小艇卷走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,carried a'way </b><br>to be so excited and enthusiastic about sth that you lose control of your feelings and may behave in a silly or thoughtless way忘形；忘乎所以:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got so carried away with shopping that I completely forgot the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只顾购物，完全忘记了时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t get carried away — it’s not that exciting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别兴奋得失态了─没那么令人激动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb 'back (to sth)</b><br>to remind sb of sth that happened in the past使回想起；使回忆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The song carried her back to her childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这首歌勾起了她童年的回忆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sb back (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'forward </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,carry sth 'over</b>)(<i>finance</i>) to move a total sum of money, or a total amount, from one page or column to the next, or from one week or year to the next(金额或总数等)转(下页等)；结转(下期等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The figures were carried forward from the previous page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些数字是从前一页转过来的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bring sth forward</b><br>to help sth to make progress or succeed推进；推动…发展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She will carry the project forward after I leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我离开之后将由她推动这个项目。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb 'off </b><br>if a disease <b>carries sb off</b>, they die as a result of it(疾病)把某人带走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was carried off by the epidemic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在这场流行病中走了。</font><br>to capture sb抓捕；抓获:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemy carried off many prisoners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人抓走了很多俘虏。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb/sth 'off =CARRY SB/STH AWAY/OFF</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'off </b><br>to win sth赢得；获得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She carried off most of the prizes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她赢得了大多数奖项。</font><br>to succeed in doing sth difficult; to deal with a difficult situation successfully成功地对付，不费劲地处理(困难的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s the only person I know who can wear a dress like that and <b>carry it off</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认识的人中她是唯一能若无其事地穿着那样的裙子的！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry 'on </b><br><b>(with sth)</b> (<i>also </i><b>,carry 'on doing sth)</b>(<i>especially BrE</i>) to continue doing sth or moving in a particular direction, without stopping继续做；继续(向…)移动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Carry on working/with your work while I’m away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不在时你要继续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If she carries on shoplifting, she’ll end up in jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她如果还在店铺里偷东西，最终会被抓进监狱的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ignored me and carried on writing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不理睬我，继续写东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I called out to him, but he carried on down the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喊了他一声，可他继续沿着路走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on,go on doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CARRY STH ON 1 <br>to manage to continue living or working in your usual way in spite of difficult or unpleasant circumstances坚持如常生活(或工作):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Life carried on as usual after the fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火灾之后人们如常地生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re all going to carry on as if nothing has happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们大家要像没发生过什么事一样坚持工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on;continue</b><br><b>(with sth)</b> to continue speaking or doing sth after a short pause(停顿之后) 继续讲话(或做某事) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Well’, she carried on, ‘then I realized where I’d met him before!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “啊，”她接着说，“接着我意识到是在哪儿见过他的！”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ted looked up briefly, then carried on with what he was doing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 特德抬头看了看，然后继续干他的活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on (with sth)</b><br>to last for a particular time持续，延续(一段时间):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long can this situation carry on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种状况能持续多久？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on;last</b><br><b>(at sb)</b> <b>(about sth)</b> (<i>informal</i>) to argue, quarrel or complain noisily; to make a fuss争吵；吵闹；(向某人)大声抱怨(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop carrying on about how hard your life is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要再嚷嚷你生活得如何艰难了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long are they going to be shouting and carrying on like that? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们这么大吵大闹的要多长时间？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on (at sb) (about sth) </b><br><b>(with sb)</b> (<i>old-fashioned</i>,<i>informal</i>) to have a sexual relationship with sb(与…)有性关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s carrying on with her boss.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和她的老板关系暧昧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv1 }also<b> v+adv+-ing3 </b>also&b{ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'carry-on <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)excited or noisy behaviour over sth that is not important; a fuss忙乱； 吵闹； 大惊小怪<br>(<i>AmE</i>) a small bag or case that you carry onto a plane with you随身行李:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m travelling light — I just have a carry-on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我旅行带的东西很少─只有一只小提箱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you have any carry-on luggage? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有随身行李吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'on </b><br>to continue sth, especially sth that sb else has begun继续，承接(他人做的事) ； 继承:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our children will carry this tradition on after us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的子孙会继承这一传统。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CARRY ON 1 <br><b>,carry 'on sth, ,carry it/them 'on </b> to do the activity mentioned从事(某活动) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re trying to carry on a very important conversation! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正要进行一次很重要的谈话呢！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They carried on a correspondence for over forty years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们通了四十多年的信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to carry on a business/trade </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经营业务/生意</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>conversation,correspondence,business</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>conduct sth</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow<b>on</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and<b>on</b> .名词必须放在<b>on</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>on</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'out </b><br>to do sth that you said you would do or that you have been asked to do履行；实施；执行；落实:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to carry out a plan/a promise/an order </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把计划/承诺/命令付诸行动</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had no intention of carrying out his threats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他并不想做他威胁要做的事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had carried out all his instructions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她执行了他的所有命令。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>threat,promise,order </b><br>to do and complete a task完成(任务):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to carry out a survey/an investigation </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进行民意测验/调查</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to carry out repairs/checks/tests </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进行维修/检查/试验</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to carry out research </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进行研究</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not yet clear who carried out the attack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 还没弄清楚是谁发动攻击的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'carry-out <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>, <i>ScotE</i>)</b><br>a meal that you buy cooked from a restaurant and take away to eat somewhere else外卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s get a carry-out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们来份外卖吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'over </b><br>to delay sth until a later time延迟； 延期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game had to be carried over until Wednesday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛要推迟到星期三。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can carry over 4 days’ leave to next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以把4天的假期挪到下一年休。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>postpone sth</b><br>to keep sth from one situation and use or deal with it in a new situation运用；应用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should carry over what you learn in school into your everyday life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该把在学校学到的知识运用到日常生活中。</font><br>=CARRY STH FORWARD 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'carry-over <i>n </i></b><br><i>(finance</i>) a total sum of money or an amount that is moved to the next column/page/year, etc.结转金额(或数额) <br>something that is kept from one situation or time and used in another保留备用的事物<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'round (with you) (<i>especially BrE</i>) =CARRY STH AROUND (WITH YOU)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry 'through (on/with sth) (<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>to do and finish what you have promised, agreed or arranged to do履行(承诺等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He convinced us that he would carry through with/on his promise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他向我们保证他能履行自己的诺言。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sb 'through; ,carry sb 'through sth</b><br>to help sb to deal with a difficult period帮助…渡过难关:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her determination carried her through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她靠毅力挺了过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His courage helped to carry them through the difficult times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的勇气让他们挺过困难的日子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carry sth 'through </b><br>to finish a task, a plan, etc.successfully成功完成；顺利实现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was determined to carry through her plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她决心完成计划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once Helen has started a task, she’ll carry it through to the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海伦开始一项工作，就会把它进行到底。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>plan,proposal,decision,reforms</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
cart	<h3>cart<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cart sth a'round (<i>also</i> ,cart sth a'bout/ 'round<i>especially BrE</i>) (with you) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to talk about carrying sth large, awkward or unimportant from one place to another or everywhere you go提着，拿着(笨重或不重要的东西)四处走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to cart my shopping around with me all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一整天都要提着买来的东西到处走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carts all sorts of useless stuff about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带着各种各样的废物四下晃荡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry sth around (with you) (<i>more formal</i>),lug sth around (with you)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cart sb/sth a'way/ 'off (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to take sb/sth away with some difficulty强行带走；费劲地送走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two players were carted off to hospital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好不容易才把两名运动员送到医院。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police arrived and carted 40 rioters off to jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察到场把40 名骚乱者扭送到监狱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sb/sth away <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was carted away by two policemen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被两名警察押走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
carve	<h3>carve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carve sth 'out </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,carve sth 'out of sth</b>)(<i>geology</i>) to make a physical feature in the earth’s surface over a long period of time through the action of water, ice, weather, etc.形成(地貌):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley was carved out by glaciers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这片峡谷是冰川形成的。</font><br>(<b>for yourself</b>) to build a successful career,a good reputation, etc., often with difficulty or hard work闯出(自己的路等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She carved out a unique niche for herself in the music business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她终于在乐坛上赢得一席之地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s carved out a successful career in the building industry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在建筑业干出了一番事业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>career,name,niche</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carve sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to wound sb or their face badly with a knife用刀伤害(某人)；用刀划伤(某人的脸):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got carved up outside the pub last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他昨天夜里在酒馆外遭人用刀刺伤。</font><br>to go past a moving vehicle ahead of you and then suddenly move in front of it in a dangerous way超车抢道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was carved up by a lunatic in a Porsche.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个开保时捷的疯子超车抢了我的道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We saw the van carve up several cars, before turning left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看见货车抢了几辆车的道之后左拐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>person,car</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cut sb/sth up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,carve sth 'up </b><br>to divide a company, an area of land, etc. into parts and share them out划分；分割； 瓜分:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They carved the territory up into three provinces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把领土划分为三个省。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thieves hurriedly carved up the loot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼匆忙瓜分了赃物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'carve-up <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) the act of dividing sth up into parts and sharing them out划分；瓜分<br>\n
cash	<h3>cash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cash 'in (on sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to gain an advantage from a situation in a way that people think is wrong or dishonest从中牟利；捞好处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many businesses cashed in on the massive public interest in her death.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多公司利用公众对她去世的广泛关注来赚钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new law means video pirates can no longer cash in by selling illegal copies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新法规意味着非法录制录像片者不能再通过销售盗版带牟利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cash sth 'in </b><br>to exchange sth for money把…兑成现金:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cash in any remaining travellers’ cheques when you return.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回来时把剩余的旅行支票兑成现金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will lose money if you cash your policy in early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若提前兑换保险单就会损失钱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>shares,policy</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cash 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>(<i>AmE </i><b>,cash 'out)</b> to count the money that has been taken in a shop/store, restaurant,etc. at the end of the day(商店、饭店等在每天营业结束时)计算当天总收入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We cash up at five o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们五点钟结算当天总收入。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
cast	<h3>cast<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,cast a'bout) (for sth) (<i>formal</i>) </b><br>to look around you to try to find sth; to try very hard to think of sth四处寻找；苦苦思索:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cast about for an escape route.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他到处寻找逃生路线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was desperately casting around for an excuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绞尽脑汁找藉口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is having to cast around feverishly for ways to cut its costs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司迫切须要想出各种降低成本的办法。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is usually used in written English.这个短语动词通常用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sb/sth a'side <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to get rid of, or give no attention to, sb/sth that you no longer want or need抛弃；丢弃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She just cast him aside when she got bored.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得厌烦时就把他撇在一边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has been able to cast aside }(= stop using)&b{ her wheelchair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她能丢掉轮椅了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>discard sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sth a'side <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to throw sth to one side把…丢在一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cast aside the newspaper impatiently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不耐烦地把报纸扔到一边。</font><br>to get rid of feelings, attitudes, etc. that are bad or negative, or that stop you achieving sth消除，祛除(负面的感觉、态度等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cast aside all his inhibitions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他抛开一切禁忌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speakers cast modesty aside and talked about their success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲者毫不谦虚地大谈他们的成就。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sth aside;toss sth aside <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,cast a'way (on sth) </b><br>to be left somewhere after your ship has been destroyed at sea(船遇难后幸存者)流落某处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What would you do if you were cast away on a desert island? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若被撇在荒岛上会怎么办呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'castaway <i>n </i></b><br>a person whose ship has been destroyed and who has managed to swim to an island, etc.(沉船后)流落到岛屿等的人<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sth 'back (to sb/sth) </b><br>to make yourself think about a particular time, a situation in the past, etc.回想；回忆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I <b>cast my mind back</b> to our first meeting all those years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想起多年前我们的初次见面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ your mind</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sth 'down <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>if you <b>cast</b> your eyes<b>down</b>, you look down向下看；落下目光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cast her eyes down modestly while Jack was talking about her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克谈及她时她稍稍垂下目光。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ eyes</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lower sth <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'downcast (<i>also </i>,cast 'down <i>less frequent</i>) <i>adj</i>(<i>literary</i>) </b><br><b>downcast</b> eyes are looking down(目光)垂下的；向下看的<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DOWNCAST at BE CAST DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,cast 'down (by sth) (<i>formal</i>) </b><br>to be sad or unhappy about sth(因某事)沮丧，不愉快:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is not easily cast down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很少有情绪低落的时候。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'downcast (<i>also </i>&b{,cast 'down</b> <i>less frequent</i>) <i>adj</i>(<i>literary</i>) }<br>sad or unhappy沮丧的；不愉快的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a downcast expression </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 垂头丧气的表情</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked so downcast I took pity on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那十分沮丧的样子令我产生了怜悯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DOWNCAST at CAST STH DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast 'off; ,cast sth 'off </b><br>to undo the ropes that are holding a boat in position so that it can start to move解缆；解(船)；解缆出航<br>(in knitting编织) to remove a row of stitches from the needle in a way that will make a finished edge收针:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the scarf is the right length, cast off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 围巾编织得够长就收针。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>stitches</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>cast on,cast sth on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sth 'off <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to take off a piece of clothing and throw it to one side脱下(衣服)扔到一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They cast off their clothes and jumped in the pool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们脱掉衣服就跳进游泳池。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>jacket,shoes,clothes</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sth off <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>to get rid of sth bad or sth that you do not like丢弃； 摆脱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to cast off her upbringing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她努力摆脱童年的影响。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to cast off those winter blues and burst into spring! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该扔掉那些冬天的忧郁投入春天的怀抱了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cast-off (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually </i>'handme- down) <i>n </i></b><br>[usually pl.] a piece of clothing that the original owner no longer wants to wear被抛弃的衣物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s fed up with wearing her sister’s cast-offs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她厌烦了穿姐姐倒下的衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cast-off <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that the original owner no longer wants to wear or use(衣服等)丢弃的，不再需要的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp cast-off clothing </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不再穿的衣服</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp cast-off plastic bags </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 丢弃的塑料袋</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast 'on; ,cast sth 'on </b><br>(in knitting编织) to make the first row of stitches on a needle, or add new stitches起针； 放针:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cast on and knit 10 rows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 起针编织10行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>stitches</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>cast off,cast sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sb/sth 'out; ,cast sb/sth 'out of sth (<i>formal</i>)</b><br>to drive sb away; to get rid of sb/sth,especially by using force驱逐；赶走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was cast out by society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被社会摈弃了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He claimed to be able to cast out demons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自称能驱魔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The villagers had been cast out of their homes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 村民被赶出了家园。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outcast <i>n </i></b><br>someone who is rejected and ignored by other people and often has to leave their home and friends被抛弃的人；被冷落的人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt like a social outcast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得像是被社会摈弃了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was treated like an outcast by the other children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他受到其他小朋友的排斥。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outcast <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] ignored or not accepted by other people被冷落的；被抛弃的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp outcast members of society </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 社会弃儿</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cast sb/sth 'up (on sth) (<i>literary</i>) </b><br>if the sea<b>casts sb/sth up</b> on the land, it carries them/it in and leaves them/it there(海水)把…冲上岸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A whale bone was cast up on the beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一副鲸骨架被冲到海滩上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wash up,wash sth up <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>cast</b> your eyes<b>up</b>, you look up向上看；抬起目光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cast her eyes up to the ceiling and sighed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她望着天花板叹了口气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{eyes</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
catch	<h3>catch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'catch at sth/sb </b><br>to try to get hold of sth quickly试图一把抓住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to catch at a branch but couldn’t reach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她急切地想抓住树枝，但够不着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sb’s hand/arm/sleeve</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clutch at sb/sth;grasp at sth/sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'on (<i>informal</i>)</b><br><b>(to sth)</b> to understand sth;to realize the truth of sth理解；领悟；认识到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s very quick to catch on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他领悟能力很强。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The students soon caught on to the idea that phrasal verbs are not really difficult.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生们很快就明白到短语动词其实并不难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are catching on to the fact that he’s a fraud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们逐渐意识到他是个骗子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cotton on (to sth)</b><br><b>(with sb)</b> to become popular or fashionable受(…)欢迎；流行起来；变得时髦:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a good idea, but it’ll never catch on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个好主意，但绝对不会受欢迎的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Paying by credit card has only caught on recently here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里用信用卡付账只是最近才兴起的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 3-D films never caught on with a mass audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 立体电影从未真正卖座。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch sb 'out </b><br>to trick sb into making a mistake or doing sth wrong; to discover that sb does not know much or is doing sth wrong挑刺儿；找岔子；刁难:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The test isn’t designed to catch you out. It’s to see how much you’ve learnt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个测验不是故意用来刁难你的，而是为了解你学到了多少东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The interviewer may try to catch you out with trick questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主持面试者可能设法用刁钻的问题来难倒你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She reacted like a child caught out in a lie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的反应就像个说谎被揪住的孩子。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) if a situation, bad weather etc. <b>catches sb out</b>, it surprises them and puts them into a difficult situation使突陷困境:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snow catches us out every year }(= we are not prepared for it)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大雪每年都让我们猝不及防。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many investors were caught out by the collapse of the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多投资者由于这个公司倒闭而突然陷入困境。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'up (with sb/sth) (<i>BrE also </i>,catch sb/sth 'up) </b><br>to reach sb/sth ahead of you by going faster than them/it赶上，追上(某人或物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was walking so fast I had to run to catch up (with her).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她走得飞快，我必须跑步才能跟上她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police car finally caught up with the van at the junction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警车最后在交叉路口追上了客货车。</font><br>to reach the same level or standard as sb/sth else that was better or more advanced赶上，达到(某水平):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to catch up with our competitors in Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得追上在欧洲的竞争对手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll have to work hard to catch up with the rest of the class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须努力学习赶上班里其他同学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I went back to school I found I <b>had a lot of catching up to do</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回到学校时发现我要补很多课程。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'up (with sth) </b><br>to spend extra time doing all the work, tasks, etc. that you should have done earlier补做(未做的事)；赶做；补上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m so behind with my paperwork, it’s going to take me a week to catch up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我落下了很多文案工作，要用一周时间补上。</font><br>to find out about things that have happened了解(已发生的事情):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come and stay for a few days, so that we have a chance to catch up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来住几天吧，这样我们就有机会聊一聊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to catch up with all your news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想知道你最近所有的情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve <b>got a lot of catching up to do</b> after all this time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了这么长时间，我们彼此有很多情况要通报。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CATCH UP ON STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch sb 'up (on sth) (<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>to tell sb about things that have happened通报某人(发生的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can catch me up on the news later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你以后再告诉我这件事吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>=CATCH UP (WITH SB/STH) 1 <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You go ahead. I’ll catch you up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你先走，我随后赶上你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She caught the leader up and then overtook her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她追上了领先的选手并超过了她。</font><br>=CATCH UP (WITH SB/STH) 2<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This company is the most likely to catch up the market leader.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司最有可能赶上市场的主导者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s training hard to catch her sister up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在刻苦训练好赶上她的姐姐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,caught 'up in sth</b><br>to become involved in an unpleasant event or situation that you cannot escape from被卷入；陷入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A number of tourists got caught up in the riots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 若干游客卷入了那场暴乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp children caught up in crime </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 牵涉到犯罪活动里的儿童</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry I’m late — I got caught up in a traffic jam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抱歉我来晚了—我遇到了塞车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>violence,war,events,traffic </b><br>to be completely absorbed in an activity, your own feelings, etc.陷入(活动、感情等)；被完全吸引:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got caught up in the excitement and drama of the auction.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她完全沉浸在拍卖的兴奋和激动场面中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t hear you come in; I was so caught up in this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没听见你进来；我只顾着看这本书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>excitement,book</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'up on sb =CATCH UP WITH SB 2 </b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Old age is catching up on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 岁月不饶人啊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'up on sth </b><br>to spend extra time doing all the work, tasks, etc. that you should have done earlier补做(未做的事)；赶做；补上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got a lot of work to catch up on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有许多工作要补做。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent the weekend catching up on lost sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我利用周末补上了缺乏的睡眠。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>work,sleep </b><br>to find out about things that have happened了解(已发生的事情):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was good to see Patsy and catch up on all the gossip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 见到帕齐并彻底聊一聊真好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CATCH UP (WITH STH)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,catch 'up with sb </b><br>if the police or people in authority <b>catch up with</b> sb, they finally find out that they have done sth wrong and punish them终于查到某人头上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were involved in burglary for years before the police caught up with them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们偷盗多年，最终还是给警察逮住了。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>catch up on sb</b> <i>less frequent</i>) if sth you have done or sth that has been happening to you <b>catches up with</b> you, it starts to cause you problems that you have so far managed to avoid产生(曾设法避免的)问题:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His past is finally catching up with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的过去终于开始困扰他了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The late nights were beginning to catch up with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 熬夜开始让她出现不良反应了。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to meet sb you have not seen for a while and hear their news和(分别一段时间的人)了解情况:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just wants to rest and catch up with old friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他只想休息一下，找老朋友叙叙旧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Catch up with you later! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回头找你聊聊！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’<b>ve got a lot of catching up to do</b> after all this time! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了这么长时间，我们得好好聊聊！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>friends</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
cater	<h3>cater<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cater for sb/sth </b><br>to provide everything that sb, a group of people or a situation needs or wants提供某人(或某集体、情况等)所须；为…而设:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The careers service caters for the needs of young people and adults.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 职介部门特别为年轻人以及成人而设。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The resort also caters for winter sports.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个度假胜地也适合进行冬季运动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>needs,children,interests</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All age groups are well catered for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有年龄段的人都获得妥善服务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cater to sb/sth <i>(disapproving</i>)</b><br>to provide sth that satisfies what a particular type of person wants迎合某类人(等)的要求；满足…所想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Endless media coverage catered to the public’s interest in the scandal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没完没了的媒体报道迎合了公众对这一丑闻的好奇心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their every need was catered to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的所有需要都得到了满足。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
cave	<h3>cave<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cave 'in </b><br><b>(on sb/sth)</b> if a roof, wall, etc. <b>caves in</b>,it falls down and inwards(房顶、墙等)塌落，塌陷，坍塌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof of the tunnel caved in on the workmen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 隧道顶部塌落，压住了工人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>roof,wall </b><br><b>(to sth)</b> to finally do what sb wants you to do after you have resisted for a long time让步；屈服；屈从:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The management refused to cave in to their demands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 资方拒绝答应他们的要求。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Under his fierce questioning she caved in and told him the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他的严厉质问下，她招架不住把真相告诉了他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>demands,pressure</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cave-in <i>n </i></b><br>the fact of a roof, wall, etc. falling down and inwards(房顶、墙等的)塌落，塌陷，坍塌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For the people inside the tunnel there was a serious risk of flooding or a cave-in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 隧道里的人冒着透水或塌方的巨大危险。</font><br>an instance of agreeing under pressure to do sth you do not want to do让步；屈服；屈从<br>\n
centre (<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i>center)	<h3>centre (<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i>center)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>to be, or make sb/sth, the most important person or thing around which most activity takes place围绕，环绕(某人或事情等)；以…为中心；把…作为…的中心:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The debate centres around the question of power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争论的焦点是权力问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The case centred around the couple’s adopted children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 论据围绕这对夫妇领养的孩子们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her life was centred entirely around her family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的生活完全以家庭为中心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nightlife of the town is largely centred around the hotels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城市的夜生活大多集中在旅馆区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'centre on sb/sth;'centre sth on sb/sth (<i>also </i>'centre upon sb/sth, 'centre sth upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to give a lot of attention or thought to one particular activity, idea or person,etc.把注意力(或思想)集中于…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The discussions centred on the hostage issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讨论围绕着人质这一问题进行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Public interest centred largely on the team’s stars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公众关心的主要是这个队的明星。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The group has centred its attention on the need for reform.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个组主要关注改革的必要性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His research is centred on the effects of unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的研究环绕着失业带来的影响。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

chalk	<h3>chalk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chalk 'up sth; ,chalk it/them 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to achieve a success, a victory, a score in a game,etc.获得，取得(成功)；记下，记录(成就、比赛得分等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team has chalked up its fifth win in a row.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这支队已连赢五场比赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This week Dee Brothers chalked up 100 years of business in this town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本周迪伊兄弟公司在这个城开业100 年了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>success,victory,win</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chalk sth 'up to sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to think that sth happens as a result of sth else把某事归因于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can chalk our recent victories up to a lot of luck.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以把近期的胜利归因于好运十足。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the goal was disallowed they <b>chalked it up to</b> a bad referee decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们认为进球被判无效是裁判误判。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>attribute sth to sth <i>(formal</i>),put sth down to sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp chalk it up to ex'perience (<i>spoken</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) <br>used to say that you can learn from sth bad that has happened to you引…为戒<br>\n

change	<h3>change<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change sb/sth a'round <i>(especially AmE</i>)=CHANGE SB/STH ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'back </b><br><b>(into sth)</b> to take off your clothes and put on what you were wearing earlier换上(原来穿的衣服):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll just change back into my tracksuit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这就换上刚才穿的运动服。</font><br><b>(into/to sb/sth)</b> to return to an earlier state or form恢复原状；还原；复原:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you double click on SELECT, the screen changes back to the main design screen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 双击“选项”，屏幕就返回主设计屏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Slowly the angry animal changed back into its normal calm self.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发怒的动物慢慢恢复正常的温顺本性。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change sth 'back (into/to sth) </b><br>to exchange an amount of money into the system of money <b>(currency)</b> that it was in before把(钱)换成(原货币):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I change these dollars back into sterling? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以把这些美元兑换回英镑吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'down (into/to sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to move the stick that controls the speed in a vehicle into a position suitable for slower speeds (a <b>lower gear)</b> (开车等)换低一挡，换成低速挡，减速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Change down into second as you approach the corner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接近街角时把车速调低到第二挡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>change up (into/to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'into sth </b><br>to put on different clothes换上(衣服):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We quickly changed into our swimsuits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们迅速换上了游泳衣。</font><br><i><font
