<b>,change 'into sth; ,change sb/sth 'into sth</b><br>to change, or to make sb/sth change, into sth different(使)变成，变为…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The castle has changed into a hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城堡改成了旅馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The handsome prince was changed into a frog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英俊的王子给变成了青蛙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn into sth,turn sb/sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'out of sth </b><br>to take off the clothes you are wearing and put on different ones更换， 换掉(衣服)；更衣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must change out of these wet clothes before I get a chill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须把这些湿衣服换掉，免得受凉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She changed out of her suit as soon as she came home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一回到家就换下了套装。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'over </b><br><b>(from sth) (to sth)</b> to stop using one system or thing and start using another改用系统(或事物) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The magazine changed over from pink paper to white in 1917.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杂志于1917年把粉色纸张改换为白色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re changing over to a new computer system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正要改用新的计算机系统。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>switch over (from sth) (to sth) </b><br><b>(to sth)</b> (<i>BrE</i>) to change from watching one television channel to watching another变换(电视频道):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I changed over to BBC1 to see the football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我换到了英国广播电视台第1台收看足球赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can we change over? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们换一下频道好吗？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>switch over (from sth) (to sth) ;turn over (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'changeover <i>n </i></b><br>a change from one system or thing to another(制度或其他事物的)过渡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The changeover to the new system will take place gradually.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将循序渐进地过渡到新制度。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a changeover period </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过渡时期</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'over/ 'round <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>if two people<b>change over/round</b>, they move to where the other person was before or do what the other person was doing对调，对换(位置或所做的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you and Phil change round? You’re too tall to stand in the front row.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你和菲尔对换一下好吗？你太高，不能站在前排。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you get tired of driving we can change over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是你开车累了我们可以换着开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>swap around/over/round <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change sb/sth 'round <i>(especially BrE</i>)(<i>AmE usually </i>,change sb/sth a'round) </b><br>to move objects,such as furniture, or people into different positions变换(人或傢具等)的位置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who’s changed the desks around? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁挪动桌子了？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re always changing this room round! }(= making it look different by moving the furniture,etc.)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你总是把房间里的傢具调来换去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Yankees keep changing their players around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杨基队一直在调整队员的位置。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>room,furniture</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>swap sb/sth around/over/round <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,change 'up (into/to sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to move the stick that controls the speed in a vehicle into a position suitable for faster speeds (a <b>higher gear)</b> (开车等) 换高一挡， 换成高速挡， 加速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Change up into fourth gear now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在把车速调高到第四挡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>change down (into/to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

chase	<h3>chase<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,chase a'bout/ 'round)</b><br>to be very busy, rushing from one place to another四下忙碌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been chasing around all morning trying to find a gift for my sister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我东奔西跑了一上午，想为我妹妹找到件礼物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase sb/sth a'way/ 'off/ 'out </b><br>to force sb/sth to run away by running after them or threatening them把…驱逐，赶走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He chased the attackers away by firing shots into the air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对空中鸣枪把袭击者吓跑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase sb/sth 'down (<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to try hard to get sth or find sb/sth that you need or want设法得到；努力搜寻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been trying to chase Sam down all day! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一整天都在苦苦寻找萨姆！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>seek sb/sth out <i>(more formal</i>),track sb/sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase sb/sth 'off =CHASE SB/STH AWAY/OFF/OUT,ETC.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase sb/sth 'out =CHASE SB/STH AWAY/OFF/OUT,ETC.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=CHASE AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chase sb/sth 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to contact sb and remind them to do sth they have said they would do or that they ought to do催促；催办:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll chase him up and find out what’s going on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来催催他搞清楚现在的情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is his job to chase up clients with outstanding debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向客户追索未偿还债款是他的工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you chase up those late replies }(= remind people to reply)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你催催大家答覆好吗？</font><br>to try to find sb/sth that you need;to try to get more information about sb/sth找寻(所需的东西)；想法获取(更多消息):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re chasing up two other people who were at the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在寻找另外两名当时在晚会中的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll chase up references to the battle in the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要去图书馆查找关于这次战斗的资料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
chat	<h3>chat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chat sb 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to talk in a friendly way to sb because you are sexually attracted to them(受异性吸引而)亲昵地攀谈， 与某人搭讪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who was that girl you were chatting up last night?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  昨晚你和人家搭讪的女孩是谁？ </font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to talk to sb in a friendly way because you want them to do sth for you or to give you sth和某人套近乎；与…攀谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll have to chat the boss up if you want some days off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若想请几天假， 就得和老板拉拉关系。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'chat-up <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>an attempt to talk in a friendly way to sb you are sexually attracted to亲昵攀谈；搭讪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was trying some old chat-up lines.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图用些老套的话来搭讪。</font><br>\n
cheat	<h3>cheat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cheat sb of sth (<i>also</i> ,cheat sb 'out of sth) </b><br>to prevent sb from having sth, especially in an unfair or dishonest way(尤指用不正当或不诚实的手段)阻止某人得到某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had cheated the taxman of ￡60 000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他骗税务员少收了6万英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was cheated out of his rightful inheritance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人骗取了他本应得到的遗产。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cheat on sb </b><br>to be unfaithful to your husband,wife or partner by secretly having sex with sb else对丈夫(或妻子、伴侣)不忠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was the last to know that she had been cheating on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是最后一个知道她一直背着他偷情的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>wife,partner,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cheat on sth </b><br>to fail to do sth you have agreed or promised to do食言；背信；负约:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government have cheated on their commitment not to raise taxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府违背了不加税的承诺。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>agreement,commitment</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cheat sb 'out of sth =CHEAT SB OF STH</b><br>\n
check	<h3>check<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'in </b><br><b>(at sth)</b> to go to an official desk at a hotel, an airport, etc. and tell sb that you have arrived(在旅馆、机场等)登记，报到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After checking in, we went out for a meal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们登记之后就出去吃饭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must check in at desk 25 an hour before take-off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你务必在飞机起飞前一小时到25 号台办理登机手续。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECK INTO STH 1 <br><b>(with sb)</b> (<i>especially AmE</i>) to contact sb to let them know where you are or what you are doing(向某人)汇报，报告(自己的方位或工作):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have to check in with my boss every three hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须每三小时向老板汇报一次。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>report in (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'check-in <i>n </i></b><br>[U] the act of telling an official at an airport that you have arrived, showing them your ticket, etc.办理登机手续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the check-in desk</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 办理登机手续的柜台 </font><br>[C] [U] the place at an airport where you go to say you have arrived, show your ticket, etc.登机手续办理处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were long queues at the check-in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 办理登记手续的地方排起长队。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sb 'in </b><br>to take sb’s name when they arrive at a hotel or an airport, look at their ticket, etc.(在旅馆、机场等)为某人登记；给某人办入住(或登机)手续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Write all the names of the guests in this book as they are checked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给客人办手续时把他们的名字都记在这个本子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the passengers have been checked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已为所有乘客办妥登机手续。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>guests,passengers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sth 'in </b><br>to leave or accept bags, cases, etc.to be put on a plane or a train託运(行李):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When we arrived at the airport we checked our bags in straight away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们到达机场后就直接託运了我们的包。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>luggage,bags</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'into sth </b><br>to arrive at a hotel, private hospital, etc. to begin your stay there登记入住(旅馆、私人医院等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I arrived in Boston and checked into my hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到波士顿后住到了预订的旅馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s checked into a private clinic for drug rehabilitation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她住进了一私人诊所戒毒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hotel,motel,clinic</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>book into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>check out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECK IN 1 <br>to try to find out more about sth or discover the true facts about sth调查:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are checking into the cause of the crash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方在调查飞机坠毁的原因。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>look into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sth 'off </b><br>to put a mark beside items on a list to show that they are correct, present or have been dealt with在(清单项目)上做记号(表示正确、存在或已处理)；核对:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve checked off all the furniture on the list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我核对了清单上的所有傢具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He checked everyone’s name off as they arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在每位来宾的姓名上都打了漖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tick sth off</b><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to put a mark in a box on a document to give an answer to a question, choose sb/sth, etc.(在文件核选框中)做记号(做出回答、选择等)；漖出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some voters wrote in names instead of checking off the candidates listed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些选民填写了姓名，而不是漖出所列的候选人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'check on sb/sth </b><br>to make sure that sb is safe,happy, etc. or that sth is progressing as it should be核实，检查(是否正常等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll just check on dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来看看晚饭好了没有。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor visited every day to check on my progress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生每天来检查我的进展情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>progress,children,patient </b><br>to find out if sth is true or correct,especially sth that sb has said about themselves核实，调查(尤指个人资料):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you always check on future employees? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你总是对要雇用的人进行调查吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you check on his address? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你核实一下他的住址好吗？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECK UP<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were put to bed and then not checked on again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们被安排睡下之后就没有再检查了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'out <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>if facts, etc. <b>check out</b>, they can be shown to be correct or true(事实等)经得起查证，言之成理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story doesn’t check out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的说法没有依据。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>story,reference</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'out; ,check 'out of sth </b><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal, becoming old-fashioned</i>) to leave a place or finish an activity离开(某地)；结束(活动):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The climb was too difficult so I checked out early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次登山太艰难，所以我早早地放弃了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can’t just <b>check out on us</b> like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不能就这样离开我们！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s check out of here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们离开这儿吧。</font><br>to leave a hotel, a hospital, etc. where you have been staying结账离开(旅馆等)；出院:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She checked out this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她今天上午退房了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He decided to check out of the hospital and go home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定办理出院回家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hotel,motel,hospital</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>check in;check into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'checkout <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>[U] the act or time of leaving a hotel at the end of your stay结账离开旅馆；退房时间:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Checkout is 10 a.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 退房时间为上午10点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp checkout time </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 退房时间</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECKOUT at CHECK OUT,CHECK SB OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'out; ,check sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>if you<b>check out</b> in a shop/store, or sb <b>checks you out</b>,you find out how much you have to pay and give sb the money(在商店)结账，为某人结账:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can check out at aisle eight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 您可以在第八通道结账。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl who checked me out looked at me strangely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我结账的姑娘奇怪地打量了我一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'checkout <i>n </i></b><br>the place where you pay for the goods you are buying in a supermarket(超市的)付款处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were huge queues at the checkout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 付款处排起了长队。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a supermarket checkout</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 超市付款处</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECKOUT at CHECK OUT,CHECK OUT OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sb/sth 'out</b><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) to find out if sth is true or correct or if sb is honest, truthful,reliable, etc.调查；查证；核实:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check him out before you give him the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 先调查一下再雇用他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police have checked out his story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方已经核实了他的叙述。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to check out whether the company is reliable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们需要查证这家公司是否可靠。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>story,claim,company</b><br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) to look at sb/sth because they/it seem interesting or attractive察看，观察(有趣或有吸引力的事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check out our new fashion range! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看一看我们的新时装系列吧！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s worth checking out that new restaurant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家新餐厅值得一试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check out that gorgeous guy over there! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看看那边的帅小伙！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sth 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to borrow sth such as a book or a video from a library(从图书馆等)借出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I checked out three books from the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从图书馆借了三本书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>book,video</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sb/sth 'over </b><br>to examine a person or an animal to make sure that they are healthy; to examine a machine, etc. to make sure it is working correctly为(人或动物)做体检；检查(机器运行等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor would like to check you over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生想给你做体检。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got the car checked over before the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我上路之前检查了汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>look sb/sth over;examine sb/sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check sth 'over (<i>also </i>,check 'through sth) </b><br>to examine sth written or printed carefully to make sure that it is correct仔细检查；核对；校对:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got to check over my work for spelling before I hand it in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 交作业前我得仔细检查是否有拼写错误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should get someone to check the letter over for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该找人帮你把信校对一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check through your notes carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 仔细检查你的笔记。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were 23 files to look at, and Tim spent half his day checking through them all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有23 份文件需要看，蒂姆花了半天时间全部检查完。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>through</b> . A pronoun can come between the verb and <b>through</b> or after <b>through</b> .名词必须放在<b>through</b> 之后，代词可放在动词和<b>through</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,check 'up(<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br><b>(on sb)</b> to make sure that sb is doing what they should be doing,or that what they have said about themselves is true监督；督促；调查，核实(某人的话):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They always check up on prospective employees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们总是对可能雇用的人进行调查。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won’t have you checking up on me like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不允许你那样监督我！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d better check up to see the kids are OK.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我最好去看看孩子们还好吧。</font><br><b>(on sth)</b> to find out if sth is true or correct; to find out what is happening查证，核实(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think the train’s at ten o’clock, but I’ll phone the station to check up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想火车十点钟发车，可我得给车站打电话核实一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went to the library to check up on a few things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去图书馆查阅了一些资料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CHECK ON SB/STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'check-up <i>n </i></b><br>an examination by your doctor to see how healthy you are体格检查；体检:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to go for a check-up </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去做体检</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a routine check-up</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 常规体检</font><br>\n
cheer	<h3>cheer<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cheer sb 'on </b><br>to encourage sb, especially sb in a race or competition, by shouting(赛跑、比赛等中)为…吶喊助威:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd cheered the runners on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 观众用喝彩声为赛跑选手加油。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cheer 'up; ,cheer sb/yourself 'up </b><br>to become,or to make sb/yourself, happier or more cheerful(使)振作精神，振奋起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seems to have cheered up since Saturday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打星期六开始似乎高兴起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cheer up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 振作点！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing could cheer him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有什么能让他高兴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She bought some chocolates to cheer herself up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她买了些巧克力鼓励一下自己。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>brighten up;liven up,liven sb/sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cheer sth 'up </b><br>to make a room, etc. brighter and more cheerful给(房间等) 增色； 使明亮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Flowers always cheer up a room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里一有花就亮丽起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>room</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>brighten sth up;liven sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
chew	<h3>chew<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'chew on sth</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>'chew at sth)</b> to bite sth continuously,especially because you are nervous or to test your teeth(因紧张等)不断地咬…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He chewed on his bottom lip as he considered the question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一边思考问题一边不时地咬下嘴唇。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) =CHEW STH OVER <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t we chew on it for a while? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们为什么不仔细考虑一段时间呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chew sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to tell sb angrily that they have done sth wrong训斥；斥责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got chewed out by his teacher for being late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为迟到挨老师骂了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tell sb off (for sth/for doing sth);reprimand sb <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chew sth 'over (<i>also</i> 'chew on sth) (<i>both informal</i>)</b><br>to think about or discuss sth carefully and in detail仔细考虑；深思熟虑；详细讨论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spent the weekend chewing over the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他利用周末细緻地考虑了这个问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problem,idea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chew sth 'up </b><br>to bite sth until it is completely soft or destroyed把…嚼得松软；嚼碎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby chewed the cookie up and swallowed it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子把饼乾嚼碎吞了。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) if a machine <b>chews sth up</b>, it damages or destroys it(机器)损害，毁坏…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cassette player’s chewed the tape up again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放音机又嚼带了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
chicken	<h3>chicken<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chicken 'out; ,chicken 'out of sth;,chicken 'out of doing sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to decide not to do sth because you are afraid因害怕而放弃；退缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I don’t fight him, everyone will say that I chickened out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我不和他打一场，大家都会说我软弱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She chickened out of telling him the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吓得不敢告诉他真相。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bottle out,bottle out of sth,bottle out of doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>\n
chill	<h3>chill<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chill 'out (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to relax completely and not get upset or excited about anything放松；冷静；镇静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chill out! We’ll get there on time! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别紧张！我们会按时赶到的！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent most of the weekend chilling out at my friend's house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这个周末大部份时间都在朋友家悠闲地度过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'chill-out <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that helps you to relax or makes you feel relaxed有助于放松的；使人轻松的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp chill-out music </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 令人轻松的音乐</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a chill-out room }(= a place at a club, etc. where you can relax when you do not want to dance)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (俱乐部等的)休息室</font><br>\n
chime	<h3>chime<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chime 'in (with sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to join in a conversation suddenly or interrupt sb插嘴；(以…)打断谈话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Absolutely!’ she chimed in eagerly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “当然了！”她急忙插嘴道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He kept chiming in with his own opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不断插话发表自己的意见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chime 'in with sth;'chime with sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to agree with sth; to be similar to sth与…相一致(或相似) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His policies chimed in with the national mood at the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的政策与当时国民的心态相吻合。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fit in with sth</b><br>[NOTE]These phrasal verbs are usually used in written English.这些短语动词通常用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>\n
chip	<h3>chip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chip a'way at sth </b><br><i>(used especially in the progressive tenses </i>尤用于进行时) <br>to make sth smaller or weaker by continuously breaking small pieces off it不停地削(或凿)…；不断削弱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was chipping away at the rocks, looking for fossils.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不停地凿岩石寻找化石。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The government seems to be chipping away at people’s rights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府似乎在不断削弱人民的权利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chip sth a'way/ 'off; ,chip sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sth by continuously breaking off small pieces不停地(从…)削掉…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She used a hammer to chip away the stone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用锤子一点一点地敲掉那块石头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I chipped the rust off the box with a knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用刀刮箱子上的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chip 'in (with sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to join in or interrupt a conversation; to add sth to a conversation(以…)插话，补充:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Feel free to chip in if I’ve forgotten to mention anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我如果忘记讲什么事，请随时补充。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She chipped in with some interesting remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她插嘴说了几句有意思的话。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,chip 'in sth)</b> to give some money so that a group of people can buy sth together凑份子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has everyone chipped in for the present?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  大家都凑了钱买礼物吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has chipped in with a $200 donation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司凑了200 元的捐款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s all chip in five dollars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们每人都凑五元钱吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>club together (to do sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chip sth 'off; ,chip sth 'off sth=CHIP STH AWAY/OFF,CHIP STH OFF STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chip 'off; ,chip 'off sth </b><br>if paint or a surface<b>chips off</b>, it comes off in small pieces(从…)剥落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The varnish is chipping off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 清漆开始剥落了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the paint had chipped off the gate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大门上的油漆快掉光了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n

choke	<h3>choke<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,choke sth 'back </b><br>to try to stop yourself from showing a strong emotion, or saying sth that might upset sb忍住，抑制住，克制住(强烈的感情或要说的话):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He choked back his tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他强忍住眼泪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A protest rose to her lips, but she choked it back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很想提抗议，但话到嘴边又咽了下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tears,sob(s)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,choke sth 'off </b><br>to prevent or stop sth阻止；妨碍；窒息:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp High interest rates have choked off investment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高利率窒碍了投资。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>demand,investment </b><br>to stop or interrupt sth使…停止(或中断) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His words were choked off by the sudden screams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的尖叫声打断了他的讲话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,choke 'up; ,choke sb 'up </b><br>to become, or to make sb, so upset that you/they are unable to speak(使难过得)哽噎，说不出话来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That song really chokes me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到那首歌时简直泣不成声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>gets choked up</b> just remembering the day she left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一想起她离开的那天他就哽噎着说不出话来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要我们把这些原木噼成柴吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall have to chop her food up very small for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要给她把食物切碎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chop up the onion into small pieces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把洋葱切碎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cut sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> HACK STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
chow	<h3>chow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chow 'down(on sth) (<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to eat a lot of food胃口大开； 大吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We chowed down on fried chicken and salad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们大嚼炸鸡和色拉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
chuck	<h3>chuck<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sth a'way <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to not make good use of sth; to waste sth不充分利用；浪费:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s chucking all her money away on presents for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她乱花所有的钱给他买礼物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s too good an opportunity to chuck away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个好机会，不能错过。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,chuck sth 'out)</b> to throw sth away because you no longer want or need it扔掉；丢弃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We chucked the old sofa away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们扔掉了旧沙发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t chuck yesterday’s paper out. I still haven’t done the crossword.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别扔了昨天的报纸。我还没做字谜游戏呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sth away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'chuck it down (<i>also</i> 'chuck down, 'chuck down sth <i>less frequent</i>) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to rain very heavily下大雨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was chucking it down outside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外面大雨倾盆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pour down <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv ◆ v+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sth 'in <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to include sth extra with what you are selling or offering without increasing the price附送…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you buy the freezer and the fridge we’ll chuck in a toaster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果买冰柜和冰箱，我们免费赠送一个吐司炉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sth in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sth 'in/ 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to decide to stop doing sth such as a job or a course of study放弃，中断(工作、课程等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What made you decide to chuck in your course? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么决定不上课了？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel like <b>chucking it all in</b> and going back to Africa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想放弃一切回非洲去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>job,course</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>jack sth in <i>(BrE</i>),pack sth in <i>(BrE</i>),give sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sb 'out; ,chuck sb 'out of sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to force sb to leave a place, a job, etc.强迫某人离开(处所、工作等)；撵走；解雇:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her parents chucked her out when she got pregnant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她怀孕后父母把她赶出了家门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sb out,throw sb out of sth;turn sb out (from sth), turn sb out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sth 'out <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to reject a plan, a proposal, etc.否决，拒绝接受(计划、提议等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee chucked my proposal out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会否决了我的提议。</font><br>=CHUCK STH AWAY 2<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,chuck sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)=CHUCK STH IN/UP</b><br>\n

clamp	<h3>clamp<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clamp 'down; ,clamp 'down on sb/sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to become strict about sth in order to prevent sth happening, especially a crime, a protest, etc.严厉打击(犯罪、抗议示威等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government intends to clamp down on drug smuggling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府拟严厉打击毒品走私。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>crack down,crack down on sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'clampdown (on sb/sth) <i>n </i></b><br>sudden action that is taken by a government or other authority to stop a crime, a protest, etc.(对犯罪活动、抗议示威等的)严禁，制止，取缔措施<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clamp 'on sth; ,clamp sth 'on sb/sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to force sb to accept sth unpleasant强制… 接受(不愉快的事情) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army clamped on a curfew after the riots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骚乱之后军队实行了宵禁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army clamped a curfew on the refugee camps.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军队对难民营实行宵禁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv (<i>rare</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
claw	<h3>claw<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'claw at sb/sth </b><br>to try to catch sb/sth or scratch or tear sb/sth with sharp, curved nails <b>(claws)</b> or with your fingernails(用爪子或指甲)抓住，挠， 撕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat was clawing at the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫在挠门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to claw at his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想抓他的脸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,claw sth 'back (<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to work hard to get sth back that you have lost设法捞回；费力地挽回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re trying to claw back their share of the market.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正设法夺回他们的市场份额。</font><br>if a government <b>claws back</b> money it has paid to people, it gets it back, usually by taxing them(常指通过税收)收回(已支付给民众的钱款):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government are clawing back age allow ances in tax.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府正通过税收收回老年补助金。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'clawback <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>business</i>)</b><br>the act of a government getting back in tax the money it has paid to people; the money that is paid back通过税收收回补助金；通过税收收回的钱<br>\n

Clear off! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你无权在这里。走开！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cleared off as soon as he heard the police car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一听到警车声便逃之夭夭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked if I could play with them, but they told me to clear off home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我问能否和他们一起玩，他们却叫我别呆在家里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clear 'out; ,clear 'out of sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to leave a place quickly迅速离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would it be better for you if I just cleared out and went back to London? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是否觉得我最好马上离开这里回伦敦去？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I told him to clear out of the house by Monday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我叫他星期一之前搬出这所房子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get out, get out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clear sth 'out </b><br>to make sth empty and clean by removing what you do not want把… 腾空:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cleared out all the cupboards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把橱柜全腾空了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tidy sth out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'clear-out <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) the act of throwing away all the things you no longer want or need or of getting rid of people you no longer want清理；清除；裁减:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a clear-out of staff to reduce the wages bill</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为减少工资支出而进行的裁员</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clear 'up </b><br>if the weather <b>clears up</b>, it becomes brighter and rain, etc. moves away(天气)转晴，放晴，变晴朗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For a week, it rained all day and cleared up in the evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一星期以来都是白天下雨，晚上放晴。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>brighten up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clear 'up; ,clear sth 'up </b><br>to make sth clean and neat使整洁；清理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll help you clear up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来帮你收拾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Clear up the mess in here before you go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里凌乱不堪，你收拾乾净再走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>mess</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tidy up,tidy sth up <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if an illness, infection, etc. <b>clears up</b> or sth<b>clears it up</b>, it disappears(疾病、感染等)痊瘉， 治瘉， 消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rash cleared up very quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 皮疹很快消失了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The antibiotics should clear up the infection.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抗生素能治瘉这种感染。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>rash,infection</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clear sth 'up </b><br>to solve a problem; to find an explanation for sth解决(困难)；解答；解释:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to clear up a mystery </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 揭开谜团</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m glad we’ve cleared that misunderstanding up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴我们消除了误会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>confusion,matter,problem,mystery</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
climb	<h3>climb<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,climb 'down (over sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to admit that you are wrong or have made a mistake; to change your position in an argument承认错误；认错； 放弃立场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The president was forced to climb down and issue an apology.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统被迫让步并致歉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>back down (on/from sth); give in (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'climbdown (over sth) <i>n </i></b><br>an act of admitting that you are wrong or have made a mistake; an act of changing your position in an argument认错；让步<br>\n

clock	<h3>clock<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock 'in/ 'on; ,clock sb 'in/ 'on <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to record the time that you arrive at work, especially by putting a card into a machine; to do this for sb or check the time they arrive at work(尤指用机器)记录上班时间， 上班打卡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We arrived and clocked on for the night shift.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们到了单位就打卡接替夜班。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>punch in,punch sb in <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>clock off/out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock 'in at sth </b><br>to last or take a particular amount of time; to cost a particular amount of money持续，用去(时间)；耗费，花掉(钱):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fastest runner clocked in at 3 minutes 40 seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最快的赛跑选手用了3 分40 秒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock 'off/ 'out;'clock sb 'off/ 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to record the time that you leave work, especially by putting a card into a machine; to do this for sb(尤指用机器)记录下班时间，下班打卡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget to clock off when you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下班离开时别忘了打卡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>punch out,punch sb out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>clock in/on, clock sb in/on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock 'on; ,clock sb 'on <i>(BrE</i>)=CLOCK IN/ON,CLOCK SB IN/ON</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock 'out; ,clock sb 'out <i>(BrE</i>)=CLOCK OFF/OUT,CLOCK SB OFF/OUT</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,clock sth 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to win or achieve a particular number or amount达到(某一数量):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve clocked up 500 miles }(= we’ve travelled 500miles)&b{ today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今天旅行了500 英里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has clocked up record exports this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司今年的出口达到了最高纪录。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>miles,years</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>notch sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n

tightly紧紧地抱住…；裹紧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His fingers closed around her wrist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的手指紧箍着她的手腕。</font><br><i><font because of the recession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济衰退导致很多企业纷纷倒闭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has closed down most of the <b>,close 'in </b><br>(<b>on sb/sth</b>) to come nearer to and surround sb/sth in a frightening way or in order to attack them(威慑地或为了进攻)逼近，靠近，包围:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemy is closing in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人渐渐逼近了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fog was closing in on us.</font></i><br><font days/nights are closing in now that autumn/fall is here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 秋天来临，白天越来越短/夜幕降临得越来越早。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The evenings are closing in fast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜晚到来得越来越迅速。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>draw in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,close sth 'off (to sb/sth) </b><br>to put sth across the entrance to a road, a room, etc. so that people cannot go in隔离；封锁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police have closed the area off [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,close 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>if a shop/store <b>closes out</b> it sells everything very cheaply before it stops operating as a [OBJ]<b>light,noise</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>shut sb/sth out</b><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to bring sth to an end结束；了结:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The vote closed out the three-day debate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 投票为三天的辩论画下句点。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) if you <b>close out</b> a bank account, you stop keeping money in [opposite]<b>open up </b><br>to hide your thoughts and feelings隐瞒，掩饰(思想感情):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She closed up when I mentioned her father.</font></i><br><font cock	<h3>cock<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cock 'up; ,cock sth 'up <i>(slang</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to spoil or ruin sth by doing it badly or by making a mistake把…搞糟(或弄得一塌煳涂):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve really cocked up this time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这次确实弄得一塌煳涂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The travel agency completely cocked up the arrangements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅行社完全没有按照预先的安排行事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Trust him to cock things up again! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一准会再一次把事情搞砸！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>mess up,mess sth up;bungle sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cock-up (<i>slang</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) <i>n </i></b><br>a mistake that spoils or ruins plans or arrangements; sth that has been spoilt because it has been badly done搞糟； 搞糟的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s made a complete cock-up of the arrangements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把计划全搞乱了。</font><br>\n
