come	<h3>come<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'bout </b><br>to happen发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s hard to understand how the accident came about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很难理解事故是怎样发生的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you tell us how <b>it came about that</b> you decided to strike?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你能告诉我你们为什么决定罢工的吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>happen</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>(<i>also</i> <b>,come'through)</b> <b>[+adv/prep]</b> (of an idea, an opinion ora feeling想法、意见或感情) to be expressedclearly and understood easily传达:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think the film’s message comes across clearly?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你认为这部电影清楚传递了信息吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These themes come across very strongly in the novel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些主题在小说中表述得淋漓尽致。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could tell she was frightened. It came over in her voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看得出她很害怕。这从她的声音中很容易听出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The feeling of solidarity among the people really came through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们之间的团结之情十分明显。</font><br><i>(AmE also </i><b>,come 'off</b> <i>informal</i>) [<b>+adv/prep</b> ] <b>(as sth)</b> to make a particular impressionon people给人以…印象；使产生…印象:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She comes across well in interviews.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在面试中常给人留下很好的印象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the press conference, he came over as cool and confident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在新闻发布会上给人的印象是冷静自信。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'cross(with sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to provide orsupply sth that sb asks for, especially money提供，给予(所要求的，尤指金钱):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They eventually came across with another $250 000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们最后又提供了25万元。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We still hope the company will come across for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们依然希望公司给予我们所需。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv,come a'cross; ,come a'cross sth <br>to cross aroom, a road, a river, etc. towards the placewhere the speaker is走过(房间、道路、河等)到说话者处；过来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you’ve done your homework, come across to my house and we’ll listen to some music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你写完作业之后就来我家，我们听听音乐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She waved and came across the room to talk to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向我招招手，然后从房间那边走过来和我说话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'cross sb/sth </b><br>to meet or find sb/sth bychance, without having planned or thoughtabout it(偶然)遇见，碰见，发现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s the most unpleasant man I’ve ever come across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我见到过的最令人厌恶的男人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came across a pile of old photographs while she was clearing the attic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打扫阁楼时偶然发现了一沓旧照片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>encounter sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep,come 'after sb/sth <br>to chase or follow a personor an animal to try to catch them追赶；追逐；跟在…后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmer came after them, threatening to call the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农夫一边追赶他们一边威胁说要报警。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'long </b><br>to arrive or appear somewhere;to start to exist, happen or be available到达；抵达；出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s lucky you came along when you did or I’d have been stranded at the bus stop for an hour! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 真幸运那时你到了，否则我就得在公共汽车站耗上一小时！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the right opportunity comes along, he’ll take it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 适当的机会来临时，他会抓住的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are new designs coming along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新款式即将面世。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn up</b><br>togo somewhere with sb跟随； 一起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re going to the pub. Do you want to come along?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要去酒吧。你想一起来吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’d better come along with me to the police station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最好跟我去趟警察局。</font><br>=COME ON 4 <br>come along!(<i>especially BrE</i>) =COME ON 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'long; ,come a'long sth </b><br>to move forwardor from one end of sth to the other, towardsthe speaker(沿…)过来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I waited for ages for a bus, then three came along together! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我等公共汽车等了好半天，然后一下子来了三辆！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lorry was coming along the road at great speed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大货车沿着马路高速开了过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>road</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep,come a'part <br>to break or fall into pieces破碎；破裂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teapot just came apart in my hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茶壶就在我手中裂开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) After the first act, the play begins to <b>come apart at the seams</b> (= have a lot of problems).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一幕过后，这齣戏就开始问题百出。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall apart</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'round <i>(especially AmE</i>)=COME ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'round; ,come a'round sth <i>(especially AmE</i>) =COME ROUND,COME ROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,come 'round sth)</b><br>to move or travel around a corner绕(拐角)；走弯道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus came round the bend too fast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车在弯道处开得太快。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ corner,bend</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come at sb </b><br>to move towards sb as if you are going to attack them逼近，迫近(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came at me with a knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拿着刀子向我扑过来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The questions came at me so fast that I didn’t have time to think about them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问题像连珠炮一般向我袭来，以至于我无暇思考。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come at sth </b><br>to approach, think about or try to deal with a question, problem, etc. in a particular way处理，应付(问题、困难等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re getting nowhere. Let’s try coming at the problem from a different angle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们这样会毫无进展。还是换个角度考虑这个难题吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problem</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'way; ,come a'way from sth </b><br>to leave a place or a person离开；离去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come away, now. There’s nothing to see.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走吧。没什么可看的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane came away from the meeting feeling angry and upset.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简又气又难过地离开了会场。</font><br>to become separated from sth分离；脱离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pulled at the door handle until it came away in his hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用手拽门把，最后把它拽了下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plaster had started to come away from the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灰泥已开始从墙上脱落。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come a'way with sth </b><br>to leave a place with a particular feeling, impression or result带着(某种感觉、印象或结果)离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came away from the championship with three medals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从锦标赛上拿走了三枚奖牌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We came away with the impression that something was wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们离去时觉得有些不对劲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'back </b><br>to return to the place where the speaker is回来；返回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come back here at once! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马上回到这儿！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did she say when she was coming back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说过何时回来吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t you come back to my place for a coffee? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为什么不来我这里喝杯咖啡呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They came back from the trip relaxed and happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们旅行回来时轻松快活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went into the kitchen and came back with two glasses of milk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她进厨房去拿来两杯牛奶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll come back for the car tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们明天回来取汽车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Liverpool came back from being 2-0 down to win the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 利物浦队在落后0 :2的情况下将比分扳回，最终获胜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to begin to exist or happen again再次出现(或发生)；恢复:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My headache has come back again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的头疼病又犯了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her confidence is starting to come back slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正慢慢恢复自信。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go away </b><br>to return to school or work after a break(休假后)返校，回去工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know when Bill is coming back to work? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道比尔何时回来上班吗？</font><br>to become popular, successful or fashionable again再受欢迎；再次成功；再度流行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Punk hairstyles are <b>coming back into fashion</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 又在流行鬅客发式了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Punk hairstyles are <b>coming back in</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 又在流行鬅客发式了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think trams will come back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你认为有轨电车会再时兴吗？</font><br>(of a message or a reply 信息或答覆) to be given in answer to a message,letter, etc. that you have sent or a question that you have asked返回；答覆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sent her an email and a message came back that she was away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给她发了个电子邮件，收到返回信息说她外出了。</font><br><b>(to sb)</b> to return to your memory, often suddenly(突然)恢复记忆，回想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s all coming back to me now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在我全都回想起来了。</font><br><b>(at sb) (with sth)</b> to reply to sb quickly,strongly or angrily(强有力地或愤怒地)答覆，反驳:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came back at the speaker with some questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用一些提问来反驳讲话人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came back straightaway, telling me what he thought of me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他直截了当地进行了辩白，把他对我的看法告诉了我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'comeback <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] if a person<b>makes a comeback</b> they return to performing or to public life after a long time, or they become popular again(长期沉默之后的)恢复演出，再度出山， 再度走红:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band’s trying to make/stage a comeback.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这支乐队正准备复出。</font><br>if something <b>makes a comeback</b> it becomes popular or fashionable again再度流行(或时兴、盛行):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cartoons seem to be making a comeback.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 动画片似乎又开始受欢迎了。</font><br>a way of getting payment or a reward for sth unfair or wrong that has been done to you得到补偿的方式:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will I have no comeback if the contract falls through? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果撤消合同，我没有办法得到补偿吗？</font><br>a quick reply that is often angry, insulting,clever or humorous(生气、侮辱性、聪明或幽默的)迅速回答，当场反驳:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For once in her life, she had no sharp comeback.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有生以来仅此一次没有立即提出尖刻的反驳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'back to sth </b><br>to return to a particular subject, an idea, etc. and start to talk about it or think about it回到(主题、想法等)上来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll come back to that point in a moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我稍后就回到这一点上来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It always seems to come back to the question of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 话题似乎总是回到钱的问题上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return to sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come be'fore sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(of a legal case, a proposal or an issue 法律案件、提议或议题) to be presented to sb/sth so that they can discuss it or make a decision or a judgement about it提交到…讨论(或作决定、审理):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The case comes before the court next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这案件提交法院，下周审理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill came before parliament last month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议案于上月呈交议会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the court(s), committee,judge,parliament</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come be'tween sb and sb; ,come be'tween sb and sth </b><br>to harm or disturb a relationship between two people; to prevent sb from doing,enjoying or having sth损害… 之间的关系；离间； 妨碍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody will ever come between them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人会拆散他们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to come between her and her work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想妨碍她工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'by; ,come 'by sth </b><br>to pass sb/sth without stopping(从…旁)经过，走过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some kids on bikes came by, but they didn’t notice me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一些骑自行车的孩子过去了，可他们没注意到我。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to come to visit sb for a short time in a casual or informal way短暂看望某人；串门子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thanks for coming by yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感谢你昨天来看我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come by on your way home from work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你下班回家的路上进来坐坐吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you come by the office tomorrow, I’ll have it ready for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你明天来办公室一下，我会给你准备好的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop by;stop by,stop by sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come by sth </b><br>to manage to get sth; to receive sth by chance设法得到(或获得) ； (偶然)收到，得到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jobs are hard to come by these days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今找工作很难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Information about the company was not easy to come by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有关这家公司的情报不容易弄到手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you come by that cut on your hand?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你手上的伤是怎么来的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get sth;obtain sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Old postcards are fairly easily come by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 古旧明信片现在很容易找到。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down </b><br><b>(from…) (to…) </b> to travel from one place to another, especially from the north of a country to the south从…到…(尤指从一国的北部到南部):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When are you going to come down and see us? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你何时南下来看我们？</font><br>if a price, a level or an amount <b>comes down</b>, it becomes lower or less than before(价格、水平、数量)下降，降低:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oil is coming down in price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 石油价格在下跌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Inflation has come down twice in the last month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通货膨胀率上月两度下浮。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>decrease <i>(more formal</i>), drop;fall</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go up</b><br>You can also use <b>come back up</b> with the opposite meaning if a price, etc. is increasing towards what it had been before.表达相反的含义，指价格等回升可用<b>come back up</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oil prices are coming back up }(= they have been high in the past, then they fell, but now they are rising again)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 石油价格逐渐回升。</font><br>to break and fall to the ground崩塌；坍塌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Part of the ceiling had come down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天花板有一处塌了下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>collapse</b><br>(of a plane, etc.飞机等) to fall from the sky; to be brought down to the ground从空中坠落；着陆；降落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot was forced to come down in a field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞行员被迫降落在田野里。</font><br>(of rain, snow, etc.雨、雪等) to fall落下；降落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain was coming down harder now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨下大了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>only &b{the rain,the snow</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall</b><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to decide that you support or oppose sb/sth and say so publicly决定并宣布(支持或反对):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I knew my parents would come down on my sister’s side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我就知道父母会站在妹妹一边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee came down against the proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会决定并宣布反对这项提议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Voters came down firmly in favour of reform.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选民表示坚决拥护改革。</font><br>when the curtain in a theatre <b>comes down</b>, it is the end of the performance(剧院帷幕)落下；演出结束:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the curtain came down, we all rushed for the exits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演出一结束，我们便纷纷冲向各个出口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go up </b><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to reach down to a particular point下垂， 向下延伸(到某一点) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother’s hair comes down to her waist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲的头发垂至腰部。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to stop having the pleasant feelings and excitement that sth such as an enjoyable experience or a drug produces(愉快或兴奋的感觉过去后)平静下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party was so good I haven’t really come down yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚会太美好了，我还没有真正平静下来。</font><br><b>(from sth) (to sth)</b> (of a person selling sth 卖方) to suggest or agree to a lower price降价出售；减低售价:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wasn’t prepared to pay ￡1500, but they eventually came down to ￡1350.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不愿意出 1 500 英镑，可他们最后降到了1 350 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you come down another $30? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能再降30 元吗？</font><br><b>(from sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>formal</i>) to leave a university (especially Oxford or Cambridge) after finishing your studies大学毕业(尤指从牛津或剑桥):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did you come down (from Oxford)?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你何时(从牛津)毕业的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come up (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp come (back) down to 'earth (with a'bang/ 'bump) <br>to return to the reality of everyday life after a period of great excitement or a time when you have been living in a way that is not very practical回到现实中(停止白日梦):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came (back) down to earth with a bang when he discovered that all his money had run out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发现自己的钱全用光了就猛醒过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'comedown <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] (<i>informal</i>) a situation which is not as good, important or interesting as one you have experienced previously倒退；退步:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a bit of a comedown after her previous job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这比她的上一份工作稍差了点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down; ,come 'down sth </b><br>to move from a higher place or position to a lower one, or from a distant place towards the speaker(从…) 下来，过来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come down from that tree! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从树上下来！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car was coming down the road towards us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车沿着马路朝我们开来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack came down the stairs two at a time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克一步两级地下楼来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come up,come up sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down on sb (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to punish sb or criticize sb severely惩罚； 斥责； 训斥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The courts are coming down heavily on drug dealers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法庭要严惩毒品贩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t come down too hard on him — he’s young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要太严厉地责备他─他还小呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If it happens again, we’ll come down on you so hard that you’ll wish you’d never been born.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果再有此事，我们会叫你吃不了兜着走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came down on me like a ton of bricks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他噼头盖脸地训斥了我一番。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down to sb (from sb/sth) </b><br>to be passed to sb from sb who lived in the past(从…)流传下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The estate came down to her from her grandfather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 财产是祖父遗留给她的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>story,name,tradition</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down to sth </b><br>to be able to be explained as one simple, important question or point可归结为；可归纳为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>It all comes down to </b>a matter of priorities in the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切归根到底就是优先权的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When it comes down to it }(=the most important fact is)&b{, we can’t afford to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最重要的是，我们去不起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What it comes down to is a choice between money or happiness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 归结起来就是在金钱和幸福之间的抉择。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'down with sth </b><br>to get an illness, often not a very serious one患，得，染上(小病):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I came down with a bad cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得了重感冒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’m coming down with something.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我有点不舒服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>flu,a cold</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go down with sth;catch sth;get sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come for sb/sth </b><br>to come to sb’s home, or to the place where sb/sth is in order to take them/it somewhere去接某人，去取某物(以带到另一处):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police came for him this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察今天上午来把他带走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you come for the parcel? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是来取包裹的吗？</font><br>to attack sb/sth进攻；攻击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam came for me with his fists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆挥舞着拳头朝我打来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'forth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to appear or be produced出现；产生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck the rock and water came forth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他敲打石头，有水冒出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,forth'coming <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] about to happen or appear very soon即将发生的(或出现的) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is in charge of promoting the band’s forthcoming album? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁负责推销乐队即将推出的歌集唱片？</font><br>[not before noun] ready or made available when you need it现成； 随要随有:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unfortunately money for the project has not been very forthcoming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可惜这个项目的资金还不太到位。</font><br>[not before noun] (of a person 人)ready to give information when they are asked愿提供信息；配合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s not very forthcoming about his love life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不大愿意谈他的爱情生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'forward (with sth) </b><br>to offer to give help,information, etc.主动提供(帮助或信息等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police have asked witnesses to come forward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方呼吁目击者站出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re hoping that a sponsor will come forward with the extra money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们希望有赞助者来出额外资金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one came forward to claim the reward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人前来认领奖赏。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come from </b><br>(<i>not used in the progressive tenses</i>不用于进行时) <br>to be born in or live in a particular place出生于；来自:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where do you come from?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是什么地方的人？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She comes from London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是伦敦人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come from sth </b><br>to start in a particular place or be made from a particular thing始于；产自；来自:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the wines that we sell come from France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出售的葡萄酒大多产自法国。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does your information come from a reliable source? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的消息来源可靠吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m lazy? That’s rich, coming from you! }(= you are lazy too)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我懒惰？真好笑，是你先懒！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He comes from a wealthy family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出身于富裕家庭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where’s that terrible noise coming from?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  那可怕的声音是从哪里传出的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 93% of our energy comes from fossil fuels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  93%的能源来自矿物燃料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp where sb is 'coming from (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)<br>a person’s situation, attitude, ideas, etc.that make them say what they have said(决定某人言论的)某人的全部背景:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know exactly where you’re coming from.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我完全了解你的立场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come from sth;'come from doing sth =COME OF STH,COME OF DOING STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'in </b><br>when the sea <b>comes in</b> it moves towards the land(海水)涌向陆地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tide was coming in fast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 潮水迅速向岸边涌来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go out </b><br>to finish a race in a particular position(赛跑等比赛中)取得(名次):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Which horse came in first?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  哪匹马得了第一名？ </font><br>to arrive; to be received到达；传来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp News is coming in of a train crash in Scotland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刚收到的消息说苏格兰发生了火车撞车事故。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve got more work coming in than we can handle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作是不断增加，让我们应接不暇。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I met all the trains that came in from London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我迎接了从伦敦来的所有列车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve got just enough money coming in each month to pay the bills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每月的收入刚好够支付账单。</font><br>to become available可提供；可利用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp English strawberries usually come in in June.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国的草莓通常在六月份上市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New jobs are coming in all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新的职位不断出现。</font><br>if a law or a rule <b>comes in</b>, it is introduced and begins to take effect(法律或规则)开始生效:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New legislation coming in next month will tackle low pay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下个月实施的新法规将处理低工资的问题。</font><br>to take part in a discussion,sometimes by interrupting sb参加讨论； 插话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to come in here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在想说几句。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish he wouldn’t keep coming in with his stupid suggestions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望他不要没完没了地用那些愚蠢的建议打断别人的话。</font><br>to come to your home, office, etc. in order to repair sth, or do some work上门服务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A plumber’s coming in to look at the boiler.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有位水暖工要来看看热水器。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> COME IN,COME IN STH,COME INTO STH;COME IN,COME INTO STH;COME INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,come in 'handy/ 'useful <br>to be useful有用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These boxes will come in handy when we move house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们搬家时这些箱子会派上用场的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'income <i>n </i></b><br>money that you receive regularly,especially as payment for work收入<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'incoming <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>travelling towards a place and arriving there到来的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp incoming flights/passengers </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进港航班/旅客</font><br>(of the sea海水) coming towards the land涌向陆地的； 上涨的<br>(of a phone call, letter or message电话、信或消息) that has been sent to you or received by you发来的；收到的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This phone only takes incoming calls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电话只接打进来的电话。</font><br>recently appointed or elected新任的； 新当选的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the incoming Socialist government </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新当选的社会党政府</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'in; ,come 'in sth; ,come 'into sth </b><br>to enter a room or a building; to pass through sth such as a hole, a window, in at the windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光从窗户射进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you come in the door, you’ll find Reception on your difficult job well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有那种圆满完成一项棘手工作的满足感。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I told him no good would come of it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我警告过他不会有什么好结果的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'off </b><br>to be able to be removed可拆除(或拆下来):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did your trip to New York ever come off? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你去纽约的事最后成了吗？ </font><br>(<i>informal</i>) if a plan, etc. <b>comes off</b>, it is successful or it has the result that you intend(计划等)成功，达到预期效果(或结果) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her attempt to break the world record nearly came off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试图打破世界纪录的努力差点成功。</font><br>[<b>+adv</b> ] (<i>informal</i>) if somebody<b>comes off</b> well or badly in a fight, a contest,etc. they finish the fight in a good or a bad condition(搏斗、比赛等)成功，不成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always comes off worst in fights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打架总是输得很惨。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)=COME ACROSS 2<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'off; ,come 'off sth </b><br>to become detached or separated from sth(从…)脱落:<br><i><font tripped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我绊了一跤把眼镜摔掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She braked sharply and came off her bike.</font></i><br><font direction(从大的或重要的事物中)分离，脱离，岔开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A narrow road comes off on the left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 左侧岔出去一条狭窄的路。</font><br>to leave the stage, the sports field, etc. during a play or a game(演出或比赛时) 离开舞台(或赛场等)；下台；下场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two players came off just before half time.</font></i><br><font <b>,come 'off sth </b><br>to stop using sth; to stop taking a drug, medicine, alcohol, etc.停止(服药、吸毒、饮酒等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time she tried to come off sleeping England will never win! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 住口！英格兰队绝对不会赢的！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'on </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,come a'long</b> <i>especially BrE</i>,<i>less frequent</i>) used to encourage sb to do sth, for example, to hurry(用于鼓励)快，加油，加把劲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, we’ll be late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点，我们要迟到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, things can’t be that bad! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加把劲，情况不会那么坏的！</font><br>used to show that you do not believe what sb has said or that you disagree with them(表示不相信某人所说的话或不同意)得了吧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暖气自动开始供暖吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve set the oven to come on at five.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把烤箱设定在五点钟开始烘烤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>lights</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go off </b><br><i>(also</i> <b>,come a'long)</b> to make progress; to improve or develop in the way that you want改进；改善；发展；完善:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your French is really coming on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的法语确实有进步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tim’s come on well with the guitar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蒂姆的吉他弹得大有起色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How’s dinner coming along? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚饭做好了吗？</font><br>(of an actor or a performer演员) to walk onto the stage and start to perform登台；出场；上场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When are Westlife coming on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 西城男孩何时出场？</font><br>(in sport 体育运动) (of a player 运动员) to join a team instead of another player during a game(比赛中替换别人)上场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Robson came on in place of Wilkins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罗布森替换威尔金斯上场。</font><br>(of a television programme, etc. 电视节目等) to start to be shown开始播送:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time does the news come on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新闻报道什么时候开始？</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) (of a season, a period of time, an illness, etc. 季节、时段、疾病等) to begin开始:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s getting colder. Winter’s coming on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气开始变冷了。冬天到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’ve got a cold coming on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得我要感冒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It came on to rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天下起雨来了。</font><br>[<b>+adv</b> ]to go to a place去某处；到…去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on in and make yourself at home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进来随便坐坐吧。</font><br><i><font behave in a very forceful way, especially in a way that shows sb you want to have a sexual relationship with them说话(或举止)过分；(尤指)露骨地调情<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'oncoming <i>adj </i></b><br>[only [OBJ]<b>question,topic,subject</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'out </b><br>when the sun, moon or stars <b>come out</b>, they appear in the sky(太阳、月亮或星星)出现，露出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun came out in the afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午后太阳出来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>appear</b><br>(of news, the truth, etc. 消息、真相等) to become known after a time when it has been secret显露出来；为人所知:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The truth up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 结果发觉全都是她捏造出来的。</font><br>to be shown clearly显示；显出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His arrogance comes out in every speech he Will you come out to dinner with me tonight?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你今晚和我出去吃饭好吗？</font><br>if a photograph <b>comes out</b>, the picture can be seen 我的照片由于光线不足，显影效果不好。</font><br>when words <b>come out</b> they are spoken说出；讲出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I opened my mouth to apologize, but the words wouldn’t come out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我张开嘴想道歉，但这话怎么也说不出口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to pay her a compliment but it came out all wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他本来想称赞她， 可是话一出口却全变味了。</font><br>[<b>+prep</b> ] to state publicly that you do or do not support sth公开表明(是否支持):<br><i><font sth </b> to be brave enough to say or do sth that other people might find it hard to say or do站出来；挺身而出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has she actually come out and admitted it yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是否真的站出来承认了？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only one member of staff came out and said that the working conditions were unsatisfactory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有一名职员挺身而出，指出工作条件不称心。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) to stop work and go on strike罢工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The miners ,come 'out of sth </b><br>to leave a place or appear from inside a place离开；从…出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come out! come out of the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙上这颗螺丝钉拔不出来。</font><br>if a mark or dirt <b>comes out</b>, it is removed from sth by washing or 这条裙子很昂贵，可一洗颜色就快退光了。</font><br>[<b>+adv/prep/adj</b> ]to finish sth in a particular state; to have a particular result(以某状态)完成某事；有某结果:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came out on top in 我每看见她就突然感到很腆。</font><br>=COME ACROSS 1<br>=COME ACROSS 2<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'over sb/sth </b><br>(of a feeling, a mood, etc. 感觉、情绪等) to affect sb/sth 你来家里吃午饭好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> COMEOVER 2 <br>(of a regular event 有规律的事) toarrive; to happen at the usual time到来；按时发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t believe Christmas has come round again! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 难以相信又到圣诞节了！</font><br>to move amonga group of people in order to give them sth在人群中穿梭(服务):<br><i><font <i>see also</i> PASS OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'round; ,come 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)(<i>also</i>,come a'round, ,come a'round sth <i>AmE</i>, <i>BrE</i>) an official way通过电话(或无线电等)传来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got an international call coming through for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我接了你的一个国际长途电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re going to buy a new car when the insurance money comes through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们收到保险金之后要买辆新车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s still waiting for his divorce to come through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还在等候批准离婚。</font><br><b>(with </b><br>to enter and cross a room, an area of land, a town, a country, etc.; to pass through sth穿过；越过；通过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put something over the hole to stop the rain coming through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把洞遮盖上以免漏雨。</font><br>to get better after a serious illness; to avoid serious injury or damage(重病后)康复；免受严重伤害:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s very ill but his doctors expect him to come through the operation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他病得很重，但医生估计手术后能挺过去。</font><br>to start to appear from under or behind sth露出；探出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby’s front teeth were coming through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿的门牙露头了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun’s coming through the clouds at last.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳终于拨云而出。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>emerge <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to pass from one stage of a competition to the next; to be successful in a test or an exam通过(选拔赛等)；通过(考试):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chris did well to come through the qualifying rounds of the tournament }(= for example in tennis)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 克里斯顺利通过了锦标赛的资格选拔赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the students <b>came through</b> (the exam) <b>with flying colours</b> }(= were very successful)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数学生考试成绩优秀。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'to =COME ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come to sb </b><br>if an idea <b>comes to</b> you, it suddenly enters your mind突然出现在脑海:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea came to me in the middle of the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在午夜时突然想到了这个主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It suddenly came to her that she had been wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她突然想到她错了。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) (of money, property,etc. 钱财等) to pass to sb else when sb dies遗传给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my money will come to you when I die.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去世以后我的钱全都是你的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come to your'self <i>(old-fashioned</i>) </b><br>to return to your normal state恢复常态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took her a while to come to herself again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她过了一会儿才回过神来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'come to sth </b><br>to add up to sth; to be equal to sth合计；共计；等于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill came to $50.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 账单金额总计为50 元。</font><br>to reach a particular state or condition; to arrive at sth达到(某状况)；得出(结果):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We both came to the same conclusion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都得出同样的结论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t know what the world’s coming to }(= I think things are getting very bad and unpleasant)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不明白这世道是怎么了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All her dreams had come to nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她所有的梦想都破灭了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>this,that,nothing</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctors will operate if necessary, but it may not come to that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必要时医生会施行手术——但也许还不致如此。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp when it comes to sth/to doing sth<br>when it is a case, matter or question of sth/of doing sth在…方面；涉及…时:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When it comes to cooking, he’s much better than I am! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 说到烹饪，他比我强多了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come to'gether </b><br>if two or more people or things<b>come together</b>, they form one group or one piece合成一体； 结合； 联合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several local groups came together to fight the proposed housing development.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个当地组织联合起来反对建议中的房产开发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp During the last three days of rehearsals, everything came together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在最后三天的排练中，各部份都连接起来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'under sth </b><br>be included within a particular group or collection of things归入；归类:<br><i><font [OBJ]<b>heading,banner,category</b><br>to be managed, controlled or owned by a particular group or organization由…管理(或控制)；隶属:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisons now come under central government control.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 监狱现在由中央政府监控。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>control,authority,wing </b><br>if you <b>come under</b> attack, criticism, etc. sb attacks, criticizes,etc. you成为(攻击、批评等的)目标:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has come under attack over the new bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府因为新的法案而受到攻击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s come under intense pressure to change her mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她招架不住巨大压力要改变主意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>attack,pressure,fire,scrutiny,criticism</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'up </b><br>(<b>to …</b>) <b>(from …)</b> to travel from one place to another, usually from a smaller place to a larger one, or from the south of a country to the north(从…)上到(通常指从小地方到大地方，或从一国的南部到北部):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve come up from Texas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们是从得克萨斯上来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We thought we’d go up to London for a weekend in the big city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们本想上伦敦去，在那个大城市度周末。</font><br>(<b>to sb/sth</b>) to go towards a person in order to talk to them走到…跟前；走近…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An old guy came up to me in the street and asked me for money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 街上有个老人走到我跟前来要钱。</font><br><i><font above the ground长出地面；破土而出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first snowdrops are just coming up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最早的雪花莲刚破土发芽。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>appear</b><br>when the sun or moon <b>comes up</b>, it rises in the sky(太阳或月亮)升起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sat and watched the sun coming up behind the hills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们坐着观看红日从群山后面喷薄而出。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>only &b{the sun,the moon</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rise</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go down </b><br>to rise to the surface of water or another liquid升到水面(等)；浮出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I came up gasping for air.</font></i><br><font 气泡不断地冒出水面。</font><br>to happen,especially when you do not expect it(尤指意外地) 发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Something urgent has come up; I have to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有紧急事情发生了；我必须走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Opportunities like this don’t come up every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种机遇不是每天都有的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>crop up</b><br>(<i>always used in the progressive tenses </i>总是用于进行时) (of an event or a time事情或时间) to be going to happen very soon即将发生(或出现、到来):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our exams are coming up soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们马上要考试了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Coming up next is the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以下是新闻报道。</font><br>to be talked about or discussed被提及；被讨论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The subject didn’t come up in conversation last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚的谈话中没有提到这个课题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary’s name keeps coming up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽的名字一再被提到。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>name,question,subject</b><br>to be dealt with by a court of law(由法庭)审理:<br><i><font is chosen and you are one of the winners(在博彩游戏中)被抽中，中奖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My numbers came up and I won a million pounds! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的号码被抽中，赢了一百万英镑！</font><br><i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) (<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) to be ready soon; to be coming soon马上备妥；马上来到:<br><i><font for example in an airport出现，显示(在电脑屏幕或布告牌上):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her flight has just come up on the arrivals board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她乘坐的航班刚刚显示在进港布告牌上。</font><br>[<b>+adj/adv</b> ] (<i>BrE</i>) (of an object or a substance物体或物质) to appear in a particular way at the end of a period of time or when sth has been done to it(一段时间之后或经过处理) 以某方式出现， 变得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the wool is washed, it comes up beautifully soft and fluffy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 毛线洗涤后变得十分柔软蓬松。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve given it a good clean and it’s <b>come up like new</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我彻底清洗了，使它焕然一新。</font><br>(of lights in a cinema,a theatre, etc.影院、剧院等的灯光) to become brighter after the film/movie, play, etc. has finished(放映或演出结束时)被打亮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lights came up to loud applause.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灯光随着雷鸣般的掌声被打亮了。</font><br><b>(to sth)</b> (<i>BrE, formal</i>) to begin your studies at a university (especially Oxford or Cambridge)上(尤指牛津或剑桥)大学:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came up (to Oxford) in 1982.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 于1982年上(牛津)大学。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come down (from sth)</b><br><b>(to sth)</b> to reach as far as a particular point or level达到(某点或某水平):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water came up to my chin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水淹到了我的下巴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My sister hardly comes up to my shoulder.</font></i><br><font 他的围巾裹住了眼睛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reach sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be coming up 'roses (<i>informal</i>) <br>(of a situation情况) to be developing in a successful way进展顺利:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything’s coming up roses! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切都很顺利！ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp come 'up in the world<br>to become more important in society or more successful in your career发迹；出人头地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s really come up in the world since she left school.</font></i><br><font You’ve come up trumps again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这顿饭好极了！你又露了一手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,up-and-'coming <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] (<i>informal</i>)making good progress and likely to be successful in the future初露头角的；潜力巨大的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an up-and-coming young actor </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个初露头角的年青演员</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'upcoming <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] (<i>especially AmE</i>) about to happen soon即将发生的；就要出现的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the upcoming presidential election </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即将举行的总统选举</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'up; ,come 'up sth </b><br>to move from a lower place or position to a higher one, or upstairs in a building, especially with the speaker or towards the place where the speaker is上来；上…来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who wants to come up to the top of the hill with me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁想和我爬到山顶上去？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My apartment is on the third floor. Are you coming up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的单元在三楼。你要上来吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can hear somebody coming up the stairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到有人爬楼梯上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>road,stairs</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come down,come down sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'up against sb/sth </b><br>if you <b>come up against sb/sth</b>, you have to face sb/sth difficult要面对(难缠的人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We expect to come up against a lot of opposition to the scheme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们预料这个计划会遭到很多人的反对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll come up against the reigning the time when sth must be done接近(期限):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s coming up for retirement soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很快就要退休了。</font><br><i><font [OBJ]<b>sale,auction</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,come 'up on sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to be almost a particular time or age接近(某时间或年龄):<br><i><font to sth </b><br>to approach a particular place, an age or a period of time接近(某地、年龄或时段):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re coming up to a busy road now.</font></i><br><font of an idea, an answer to a question or a solution to a problem想到(主意)；找到(答案或解决方法):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came up with a great idea for increasing sales.</font></i><br><font commune	<h3>commune<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>com'mune with sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>commune with</b> sth such as nature, you spend time thinking deeply about it and so feel close to it与…相沟通；与(大自然等)相交融<br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>nature</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

conk	<h3>conk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,conk 'out <i>(informal </i> or <i>humorous</i>) </b><br>if a vehicle or a machine <b>conks out</b>, it stops working(车辆或机器)停止运转，失灵:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our car conked out 5 miles from home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的汽车在离家5英里的地方抛锚了。</font><br>if a person <b>conks out</b>, they fall asleep because they are very tired(因极度疲劳)入睡，睡着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was so tired she came home and conked out at eight o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她疲惫不堪地回到家，八点钟就睡下了。</font><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>) (of a person人) to collapse or become unconscious昏倒；晕倒<br><i>(AmE</i>) to die死亡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old guy looks as if he’s going to conk out any minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位老人看上去随时都会死去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

cool	<h3>cool<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cool 'down; ,cool sb 'down </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,cool 'off, ,cool sb 'off</b>) to become, or to make sb become,cool or cooler(使)变凉，凉快:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going for a swim to cool down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要去游泳凉快凉快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A shower will cool you down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冲个淋浴会让你感到凉爽的。</font><br>to become, or to make sb become, less angry or excited(使)冷静，平静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s very angry. Give her some time to cool down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她十分生气。给她点时间冷静一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to cool her down but she carried on shouting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图让她平静下来，可她继续大喊大叫。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cool 'down; ,cool sth 'down </b><br>to become, or to make sth become, cooler(使某物)变凉，冷却下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He waited for the soup to cool down a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他等着汤稍微凉一凉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once it had cooled down outside, we went for a walk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外面一凉爽下来，我们就去散步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cool the soup down by stirring it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把汤搅一搅弄凉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain had cooled everything down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场雨把一切都变得清爽。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cool 'off </b><br>to become less interested or enthusiastic变冷淡；热情冷却:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our relationship was going well, but then Laura seemed to cool off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正当我们的关系进展顺利时，劳拉却似乎冷淡下来了。</font><br>to become less angry or excited冷静下来；平静下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I’m angry, I go for a walk to cool off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我生气时就去散步消消气。</font><br>if sth hot <b>cools off</b>, it becomes cooler(某物)变凉，冷却下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave the engine to cool off before you touch it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等发动机冷却下来才可碰它。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cooling-'off period <i>n </i></b><br>a period of time in which two sides in a dispute try to come to an agreement before taking any further action(争执双方试图达成协议的)冷却期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is to be a six month cooling-off period before divorce proceedings begin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离婚诉讼开始前有六个月的冷却期。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The union and the employers failed to reach an agreement within the coolingoff period.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会和资方在冷却期内未能达成共识。</font><br>a period of time when you can change your mind about buying sth, such as an insurance plan, that you have agreed to buy(在同意购买保险计划等后可改变主意的)冷静期，试用期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Customers have a 14-day cooling-off period in which to cancel the agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 客户有14天的冷静期可以终止协议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cool 'off; ,cool sb 'off =COOL DOWN,COOL SB DOWN 1</b><br>\n
