It’s cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 穿暖和点。天气很冷。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cover 'up (for sb/sth), ,cover sth 'up </b><br>to try hard to stop people finding out about a mistake, a crime, etc.; to hide the truth about sth(为…)掩盖， 隐瞒(错误、罪行、真相等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always covering up for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是护着她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government’s attempts to cover up the scandal failed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府企图掩盖丑闻，但失败了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>scandal,mistake,truth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>conceal sth (<i>more formal</i>), hide sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cover-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] an act of hiding a mistake, a crime, etc.掩盖；隐瞒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The opposition accused the government of a cover-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反对派指责政府隐瞒真相。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cover sb/sth 'up </b><br>to put sth over sb/sth in order to hide or protect them/it盖住；遮住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can cover up ugly pipes with wooden boxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以用木盒扣住这些难看的管子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was something on the table covered up with a cloth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子上有东西用布罩着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
cozy	<h3>cozy<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cozy 'up to sb <i>(AmE</i>)=COSY UP TO SB</b><br>\n
crack	<h3>crack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crack 'down; ,crack 'down on sb/sth </b><br>to try harder to prevent people breaking a rule, using sth harmful, committing a crime, etc. and deal severely with those who do竭力取缔；严厉打击；镇压:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police are cracking down hard on drug dealers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方正在严厉打击毒品贩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government is cracking down on misleading food labelling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府正竭力取缔误导性食物标籤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clamp down,clamp down on sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'crackdown &b{(on sb/sth)</b> <i>n </i>}<br>severe action that is taken to prevent people committing a crime,opposing the government, etc.严厉打击；制裁；镇压:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a police crackdown on car crime </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方对汽车犯罪的严厉打击</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crack 'on (with sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to work hard and do sth quickly努力尽快地干；拚命干:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d better crack on with the painting before it gets dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最好加把劲赶在天黑之前刷完漆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get on (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crack 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to become physically or mentally ill because you are under pressure(因压力造成身体或精神)垮掉，崩溃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s cracking up under the strain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过大的压力使她快垮掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'crack-up <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>a period of mental illness caused by pressure精神崩溃<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crack 'up; ,crack sb 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to start laughing a lot; to make sb laugh a lot(使)大笑起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everybody cracked up when he fell over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摔了一跤，引起一阵哄笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s so funny — she cracks me up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她真滑稽─逗得我哈哈大笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>crease up,crease sb up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be ,cracked 'up to be sth (<i>informal</i>) <br>to be as good, clever, exciting, etc. as people think or say sb/sth is如同人们想像(或说)的一样好(或聪明、令人兴奋等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stardom is not all it’s cracked up to be.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明星的地位并非想像的那么美好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s not as good as she’s cracked up to be.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她并不像人们说得那么好。</font><br>\n
cram	<h3>cram<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cram 'into sth; ,cram sb/sth 'in; ,cram sb/sth 'in/ 'into sth </b><br>to go into a place or space that is too small for everyone/everything; to push or force sb/sth into a place or space that is too small(把…) 塞进(…) 去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Six of us crammed into Rob’s Mini.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们六人挤进了罗布的迷你牌汽车里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I only had three days in New York, but I crammed in as much sightseeing as I could.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在纽约只呆了三天时间，可我尽可能多看了些地方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He crammed all the sweets into his mouth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把糖果全塞进嘴里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t cram eight children into the car! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能把八个孩子塞进车子里！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
crank	<h3>crank<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crank sth 'out <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to produce sth quickly and in large amounts大量地快速制造；粗制漤造:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plant can crank out about 63 cars an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工厂每小时可生产汽车63辆之多。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>churn sth out;turn sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crank sth 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make a machine start working or work better使机器运转；使…提高效率:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to crank up the air conditioning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该打开空调了。</font><br>to make music, etc. louder把(音乐等的) 音量调高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They cranked the music up when the party started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚会开始时他们把音乐的音量放大了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>music,volume</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn sth up <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
crash	<h3>crash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crash a'round (<i>also</i> ,crash a'bout/ 'round <i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to move around making a lot of noise声音很大地活动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard her crashing about in the bathroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到她在浴室哗啦啦地折腾。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crash 'down </b><br>to fall with a very loud noise轰隆一声倒下(或坠落、落下):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Passengers had a lucky escape when a huge tree crashed down onto a bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大树哗啦一声倒在公共汽车上，幸好乘客安然无恙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John’s hand <b>came crashing down</b> on the table }(= he hit the table hard with his hand)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰的手砰地一声砸在桌子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) All my dreams <b>came crashing down</b> around me }(= I completely failed in what I wanted to do)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我所有的梦想都轰然破灭了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Crash down</b> is usually followed by a phrase beginning with a preposition. <b>crash down</b> 通常后接介词短语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crash 'out <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to go to sleep because you are very tired睏得睡着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was so tired I crashed out in an armchair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我十分疲倦，在扶手椅上睡着了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>flake out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crash 'out of sth </b><br>(in sport 体育运动) to lose a game very badly and so not be able to continue to take part in a competition(被淘汰)出局:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp England crashed out of the World Cup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英格兰队在世界杯比赛中遭淘汰。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is used especially in newspapers.这个短语动词尤用于报章。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crash 'round <i>(especially BrE</i>)=CRASH AROUND</b><br>\n
crawl	<h3>crawl<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'crawl with sb/sth </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) <br>to be full of moving people, animals, insects, etc. in an unpleasant way满是移动中的(人或动物、昆虫等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The place is crawling with cops! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这地方到处是警察！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>police,insects</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
cream	<h3>cream<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cream sb/sth 'off </b><br>to take away the best people or things in a group or an amount of money, usually for your own advantage提取(精华) ；选取(最好的人或物)；取走(某数额的金钱):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The best pupils are creamed off into special classes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最优秀的学生都编到特别班。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company’s directors are creaming off the profits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司董事分配利润。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
crease	<h3>crease<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crease 'up; ,crease sb 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to start laughing; to make sb start laughing(使)大笑起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all creased up when we saw her hat! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看到她的帽子都哈哈大笑起来！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His programme always creases me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的节目总是令我捧腹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>crack up,crack sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
credit	<h3>credit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'credit A with B;'credit B to A </b><br>to believe that sb/sth is responsible for sth or for doing sth,especially sth good认为…负责某事(或做某事) ； 把… 归功于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bach is credited with performing the first solo on a piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们认为巴赫是演奏第一首钢琴独奏曲的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She credits her good looks and intelligence to her father’s side of the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她认为她的美貌和才智是父亲的血统遗传的。</font><br>to consider that sb/sth has a particular good quality or characteristic认为… 有…品质(或特点):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had credited him with more sense.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我原以为他会更加理智。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Numerous health benefits are credited to this natural oil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们认为这种天然的油对健康有很多好处。</font><br>You can also use the pattern <b>credit sb/sth as sth</b>,especially in the passive.也可以说<b>credit sb/sth as sth</b> ， 尤其在被动语态中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cheetah is generally credited as the world’s fastest animal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猎豹被公认是世界上跑得最快的动物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
creep	<h3>creep<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,creep 'in; ,creep 'into sth </b><br>to start happening or affecting sb/sth gradually逐渐开始发生(或影响) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought I’d decided, but then doubts started to creep in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我原以为自己拿定主意了，可后来却开始疑惑起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hint of sarcasm crept into his voice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的语气带一丝嘲讽。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More and more foreign words are creeping into the language.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 越来越多的外来词进入这种语言中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,creep 'over sb/sth </b><br>if a feeling <b>creeps over</b> you,or an expression <b>creeps over</b> your face, it gradually affects you(感觉)悄悄袭来；(表情)慢慢流露:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A feeling of tiredness began to creep over her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她渐渐开始感到疲惫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sly smile crept over her lips.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的双唇透出一丝狡诈的笑意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>steal over sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,creep 'up</b><br>if a price, an amount, etc. <b>creeps up</b>,it rises very gradually(价格、数量等)逐渐增长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp House prices are starting to creep up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房价在渐渐上涨。</font><br><b>(on sb)</b> to move nearer to sb/sth slowly and quietly without being seen or heard缓慢地悄悄靠近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t creep up on me like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别那样蹑手蹑脚地靠近我！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack crept up behind me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克从我背后不声不响地走近。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>steal up (on sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,creep 'up on sb</b><br>if an event, a date, etc. <b>creeps up on</b> you, it arrives before you are really ready for it(事情、日期等)不期而至:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The exams just seemed to creep up on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考试好像不期而至。</font><br>if a feeling, etc. <b>creeps up on</b> you, it starts to affect you before you realize it(潜在的感觉等)作用于某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anorexia can creep up on young girls when they least expect it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年轻女子可能在最没有防备的情况下患上厌食症。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
crop	<h3>crop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crop 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to appear, happen, etc. when it is not expected(意外地)出现，发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t make it tonight — something’s cropped up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚不行─有突发事情要处理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her name keeps cropping up everywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的名字出乎意料地在各种场合出现。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
cross	<h3>cross<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cross sb/sth 'off; ,cross sb/sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sb’s name or an item from a list by drawing a line through it because you have dealt with them/it or they/it are no longer involved(从名单或清单上)画掉，删掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cross off any items we’ve already got.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把我们已有的物品都画掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane won’t be coming, so we can cross her off the list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简不来了，我们可以把她的名字画掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>delete sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cross sth 'out/ 'through </b><br>to remove words from a text by drawing a line through them, usually because they are wrong画掉，删掉(错字等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I crossed his name out and wrote mine instead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我删掉他的名字填写了我的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve spelt it wrong. Cross it out and try again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把字拼错了。画掉再写一遍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>word,name</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>delete sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cross 'over </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,cross 'over sth)</b> (<i>especially BrE</i>) to go from one side of sth, for example a road/street, a room, etc. to the other走到对面；横穿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s cross over to the other side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们到那边去吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She crossed over the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她横过马路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>road,bridge </b><br><b>(into/to sth)</b> to move from one style or type of music, culture, politics, etc. to another; to combine parts of different styles or types(从某种音乐、文化、政见等)转变，变换；结合不同风格(或类型):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re a blues band who have succeeded in crossing over to jazz.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们是一支成功地融合了爵士乐风格的布鲁斯乐队。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'crossover <i>n </i></b><br>a successful combination of different styles or types of music or culture; a successful change from one style or type to another(不同音乐或文化风格或种类的)结合，转变:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a fresh and exciting rock-dance crossover</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 摇磙乐与舞蹈的新颖且生动的彻底融合</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a crossover artist </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 完全转变风格的艺术家</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cross sth 'through</b><br>\n
crouch	<h3>crouch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'crouch over sb/sth </b><br>to bend over sb/sth so you are near them/it俯身接近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She crouched over the injured man, checking his wounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她俯身检查伤员的伤口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
crowd	<h3>crowd<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd a'round; ,crowd a'round sb/sth (<i>especially AmE</i>)=CROWD ROUND,CROWD ROUND SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd 'in; ,crowd 'into sth </b><br>to move in large numbers into a small place涌入(狭小的空间):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as the doors opened people began to crowd in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门一开人们便开始涌入。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all crowded into the lift.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们全都涌进电梯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Memories she would rather forget came crowding in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想忘掉的往事涌上心头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Doubts crowded into my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一时满腹疑团。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pile in,pile into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd sb/sth 'in; ,crowd sb/sth 'into/ 'onto sth </b><br>to put a large number of people or things into a small space把人或物塞进(…) 去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I doubt if we can crowd any more people in — the place is packed already.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我怀疑我们能否再塞进人了─这里已经拥挤不堪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were all crowded into a small area behind the goal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们全都挤在球门后面的一小块地方。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cram sb/sth in,cram sb/sth in/into sth;pack sb/sth in,pack sb/sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd 'in (on sb)</b><br>if high buildings, mountains,etc. <b>crowd in</b>, they seem to surround you and threaten you or have a strong effect on you(高楼、高山等) 围逼(某人) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The high walls seemed to crowd in (on her).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四周高高的墙壁似乎(向她)压过来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He tried to resist the fears that were crowding in on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他竭力抑制涌上心头的恐惧感。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd sb/sth 'onto sth =CROWD SB/STH IN,CROWD SB/STH INTO/ONTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd sb/sth 'out; ,crowd sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>if a number of people or things <b>crowd out</b> other people or things, they are present in such large numbers that there is no room for anyone or anything else把人或物(从…里)挤出去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tourists are crowding the regular customers out of the bar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 酒吧挤满了游客，老主顾都进不去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Small shops are increasingly being crowded out by the big supermarkets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 越来越多的小店铺给大超市挤得无立足之地。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>squeeze sb/sth out,squeeze sb/sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crowd 'round; ,crowd 'round sb/sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)(<i>AmE usually </i>,crowd a'round, ,crowd a'round sb/sth) </b><br>to gather in large numbers around sb/sth聚集在…周围；聚拢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People were crowding around to see what was going on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们聚过来围观。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fans crowded round him to ask for his autograph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 崇拜者围着他要签名。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
crumple	<h3>crumple<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,crumple sth 'up </b><br>to crush sth, especially a piece of paper, into a ball把(纸张等)压成一团:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She crumpled his letter up without even looking at it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她连看都没看就把他的信揉成一团。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>paper</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
cry	<h3>cry<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cry for sth </b><br>to ask for or demand sth in a forceful or urgent way呼吁；呼救:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The families of the victims are crying for justice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 受害者家属强烈呼吁公正审判。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listen! That sounds like somebody crying }(= calling)&b{ for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听！那声音像是有人在喊救命。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>help,mercy</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cry 'off; ,cry 'off sth; ,cry 'off doing sth (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to decide not to do sth you have promised or agreed to do不履行(诺言等) ； 食言:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d arranged to go together but Luis cried off at the last moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们说好一起去的，可卢斯到时候又变卦了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why did you cry off training last night? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你昨晚为什么临时不来参加训练？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull out,pull out of sth,pull out of doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BEG OFF,BEG OFF STH,BEG OFF DOING STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cry 'out </b><br>to make a loud sound without words because you are hurt, afraid, surprised, etc.(因伤痛、害怕、惊讶等)大叫，叫喊:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cried out in/with pain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她疼痛得大叫起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cry 'out sth </b><br>to shout sth loudly大声呼喊:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He suddenly cried out, ‘Stop at once!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然大喝一声：“马上住手！”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could hear a voice crying out her name.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她听见有人喊她的名字。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+speech ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp for ,crying out 'loud! (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) <br>used to show that you are surprised or angry about sth(表示吃惊或生气)哎呀，天哪，岂有此理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For crying out loud! What did you do that for?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的天哪！你干嘛要那么做？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cry 'out against sth </b><br>to protest strongly about sth强烈抗议；大声疾呼反对:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People have been crying out against this abuse for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多年来人们一直在强烈谴责这种漤用情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outcry &b{(against/at/over sth)</b> <i>n </i>}<br>[C] [U] a public reaction of strong protest against sth公众的强烈抗议:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is sure to be a massive outcry against the proposals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些提案定会遭到公众大规模的强烈抗议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cry 'out for sth </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) <br>to clearly need sth very quickly迫切需要:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The group is crying out for new members.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个组急需新成员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole system was crying out for a radical review.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个体系亟待彻底检讨。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
cuddle	<h3>cuddle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cuddle 'up (to/against sb), ,cuddle 'up together </b><br>if children, pets, etc. <b>cuddle up</b>, they sit or lie close to each other or sb else, because they need warmth or comfort, or want to show affection依偎着(…)；紧靠在一起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack cuddled up to his mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克依偎着他的母亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cubs cuddle up together for warmth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幼兽挤在一起取暖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>snuggle up (to/against sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cuddle 'up to sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>rare</i>)</b><br>to try to be friendly to sb in order to gain an advantage for yourself亲近…(以获得好处)；靠拢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just before the election they started cuddling up to the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们就在选举之前开始靠拢政府。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cosy up to sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n

curl	<h3>curl<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,curl 'up;be ,curled 'up </b><br>to lie down or sit down with your back curved and your knees and arms close to your body蜷曲； 蜷曲着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I love curling up in an armchair with a good book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爱在沙发上蜷作一团看我喜欢的书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat was curled up asleep under the bush.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫在灌木下蜷成一团睡觉。</font><br>if the edges of pages, leaves, etc.<b>curl up</b> they bend towards the middle(书页、叶子等的边缘)卷起，卷曲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pages had all curled up at the corners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 书页的角都卷曲了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,curl sth 'up; ,curl yourself 'up </b><br>to bend sth/yourself into a tight curved shape使蜷曲着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She curled her legs up under her on the sofa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她盘腿坐在沙发上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He curled himself up under the covers and went to sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他蜷缩在被子底下睡了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

cut	<h3>cut<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut a'cross sth</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,cut 'through sth)</b> to take a short route (a <b>short cut)</b> across a place instead of going around it穿过某地(抄道走):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll get there quicker if we cut across the fields.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们穿过野地过去会快一些的。</font><br>to affect or be true for people in different groups that usually remain separate影响，符合，适用于(分离的不同群体):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Opposition to the proposal cuts across party boundaries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对这个提案的反对超越了党派界限。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>boundary,division </b><br>to interrupt and stop sth搅扰，打断(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sound of the fire alarm cut across his attempt to explain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图解释，可火警声打断了他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sth a'way (from sth) </b><br>to remove sth by cutting with a knife or a sharp tool(从…)切除，割掉；砍掉；剪去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cut away any dead branches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把枯枝全砍掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut 'back (on sth) </b><br>to reduce sth such as the amount sb spends or produces减少， 削减，缩减(开支或生产等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The recession means that everyone is cutting back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济衰退意味着每个人都在削减开销。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve had to cut back on staff to save money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须裁减雇员以省钱。</font><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) to eat, drink or use less of a particular thing, usually for your health节制，减少(饮食或使用某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I smoke too much. I must cut back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我抽烟太多。我必须加以控制了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor’s told me to cut back on red meat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生建议我少吃红肉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CUT STH BACK 1; CUT DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'cutback &b{(in sth)</b> <i>n </i>}<br>[usually pl.] a reduction in sth削减； 缩减； 减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp cutbacks in public spending </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共开支的削减</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sth 'back </b><br>to reduce sth a lot, especially to save money or improve the environment or your health(为省钱、环保、健康等原因)大幅度减少…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Government funding is being cut back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府在削减拨款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have agreed to cut back CFC emissions by the end of the century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们同意到本世纪末大量减少含氯氟烃的排放。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>production,spending,pollution</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pare sth down (to sth), pare sth back (to sth)</b><br>to reduce the size of a plant, a bush, etc.by cutting parts off剪枝；修剪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That rose bush needs cutting back a lot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那棵玫瑰丛需要剪许多枝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bush,tree</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>prune sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut 'down (on sth) </b><br>to reduce the amount or quantity of sth削减，缩小(…的数量):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Recycling cuts down on waste.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 废品回收能减少浪费。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve spent too much already this month — I’ll have to cut down a bit }(= spend less money)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这个月开销已经太大了─我得省着点用钱。</font><br>to consume, use or buy less of sth减少消耗(或使用、购买某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor’s told me to cut down on fatty foods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生建议我少吃多脂肪的食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven’t stopped smoking, but I’ve cut down to five a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还没戒烟，可已经减少到每天抽五支。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CUT STH DOWN 1; CUT BACK<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sb 'down <i>(formal</i>, <i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to kill sb导致某人死亡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was cut down by pneumonia at an early age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他年纪轻轻就因肺炎病故。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sb/sth 'down <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb feel or look stupid, especially in front of other people使(当众)出丑；使出洋相；让某人现眼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always cuts her down in front of his friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是在他的朋友面前让她难堪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always cutting down my lifestyle.</font></i><br><font OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,cut 'out for sth;be ,cut 'out to do/be sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to have the qualities and abilities needed for sth具有所需素质及才能；是…的材料:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t think I’m cut out for country life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为我不适合乡村生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s not cut out to be a politician.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不是从政的料。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is usually used in negative sentences.这个短语动词通常用于否定句。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv+prep ◆ be+v+adv+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut 'through sth </b><br>=CUT ACROSS STH 1 <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The path cuts through the wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小径横穿树林。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It should be quicker if we cut through town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们抄近道从城里走就会快一些。</font><br>to pass through sth by cutting切开；割开；砍开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will this saw cut through metal?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  这把锯子能切割金属吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The sharp wind cut through his shirt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凛冽的风吹透了他的衬衣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The pain cut through him like a knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他感到痛如刀割。</font><br>to overcome a difficulty that is preventing you from making progress克服(困难)；冲破(阻碍) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once you cut through the technical language the report is easy to understand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一弄懂术语，报告就容易理解了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The yacht cut smoothly through the waves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帆船平稳地破浪前进。</font><br>to interrupt sth打断，打扰(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His voice cut through her thoughts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的声音打断了她的思路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> CUT STH THROUGH STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sth 'through sth </b><br>to make a path or passage through sth by cutting开闢穿越…的小道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to use their knives to cut a path through the undergrowth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们得用刀在灌木林中噼出一条路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>path</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  CUT THROUGH STH <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sb 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to injure sb by cutting them with a knife, a piece of glass, etc.割伤；划伤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was very badly cut up in the fight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在斗殴中给严重划伤。</font><br>to make sb very emotionally upset使伤心；使悲伤；使难受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s still very cut up about the divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她还为离婚的事十分难过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)(<i>AmE </i>,cut sb/sth 'off) </b><br>(of a vehicle or a driver 车辆或驾车人) to suddenly drive in front of another vehicle in a dangerous way超车抢道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you see how he cut me up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看见他怎样抢我的道了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carve sb/sth up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,cut sth 'up </b><br>to divide sth into small pieces with a knife or a sharp tool切碎；剁碎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who’s going to cut up the vegetables? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁来切蔬菜？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
dab	<h3>dab<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dab at sth (with sth) </b><br>to touch sth, especially your face, several times, quickly and lightly(用某物)轻触，轻按几下(面部等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was crying and dabbing at her eyes with a handkerchief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一边哭一边用手绢轻按眼睛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gently dabbed at his cuts with a piece of cotton wool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用一块药棉轻轻按了按伤口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>my, your, etc. eyes</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dabbed her eyes with a handkerchief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用手绢轻按眼睛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dab sth 'off </b><br>to remove sth such as a stain, sth you have spilled on sth, etc. with quick, light movements轻而快地擦掉(或抹掉):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dab the coffee off with your handkerchief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用你的手帕把咖啡擦掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dab sth 'on(with sth) </b><br>to put sth on a surface with quick, light movements(用某物)轻而快地涂上(或点上)…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dab the paint on with a sponge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用海绵扑上颜料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dabbed on a little perfume.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她轻轻地搽了一点香水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
dabble	<h3>dabble<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dabble in sth </b><br>to take part in an activity or a sport, but not very seriously涉足，浅尝(活动或体育运动):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She swims twice a week and has been dabbling in weight training.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一周游两次泳，偶尔还练习一下举重。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
dally	<h3>dally<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dally with sth/sb <i>(old-fashioned</i>)</b><br>to think about sth, do sth or treat sb in a way that is not serious enough轻率地对待；玩弄；戏弄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve been dallying with the idea for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们多年来一直有这个想法，但从没有认真考虑过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea,thought</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>toy with sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
dam	<h3>dam<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dam sth 'up </b><br>to stop the water flowing in a river by building sth across it (a <b>dam)</b> 建堤坝拦挡(河水) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stream was dammed up to form ornamental lakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 溪流用水坝拦挡起来，形成了装饰性的湖泊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) I tried to dam up my tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我强忍住泪水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
damp (<i>also </i> dampen)	<h3>damp (<i>also </i> dampen)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,damp sth 'down </b><br>to make a fire burn more slowly or stop burning使(火)减弱；灭火:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Firefighters were damping down the embers hours later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几小时后，消防队员基本扑灭了余烬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put sand on the fire to try to damp it down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图用沙子压住火。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire had been damped down but not extinguished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火势得到了控制，但尚未熄灭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fire</b><br>if somebody or something <b>damps down</b> an emotion or a feeling,it becomes less strong抑制，控制(情绪、感情等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to damp down her feelings of despair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她努力克制自己的绝望感。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>emotions</b><br>if somebody or something <b>damps down</b> a situation or an activity, it becomes slower or weaker缓和(局势)；减缓(速度):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The latest increase in interest rates has damped down activity in the housing market.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新近的利率增长使住房市场减少了活力。</font><br><i>(rare</i>) to make a surface slightly wet by spraying a small amount of water over it喷水打湿(表面)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
dangle	<h3>dangle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dangle sth be'fore sb/sth </b><br>to offer sb sth very attractive to try to persuade them to do sth用某事物诱惑…；吊胃口:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s the biggest financial incentive ever dangled before British footballers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是历来对英国足球运动员的最大经济诱惑。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>In front of</b> can be used instead of <b>before</b> .可用<b>in front of</b> 代替<b>before</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
dash	<h3>dash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash a'bout <i>(especially BrE</i>)=DASH AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash a'gainst sth </b><br>(of rain, waves, the sea, etc.雨、浪头、海等) to beat violently against a surface拍打，撞击(表面)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash a'round (<i>also</i> ,dash a'bout/ 'round <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to move very quickly from place to place, being very busy四处奔走忙碌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been dashing around all day! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我东奔西跑地忙了一整天了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the scene of the accident, people were dashing about all over the place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在事故现场，人们忙得团团转。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rush around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash a'way/ 'off </b><br>to go away from a place in a hurry急忙离开；匆匆走掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dashes off every day at 4 o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每天4点钟就急匆匆地走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash sth a'way </b><br>if you <b>dash</b> tears <b>away</b>, you remove them quickly from your face一把擦掉(泪水):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dashed away the tears welling up in his eyes with an impatient hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他烦躁地一把抹掉涌出的泪水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash 'off =DASH AWAY/OFF</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash sth 'off </b><br>to write or draw sth very quickly仓促写出；草草画成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I dashed off a quick letter to my brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我急急忙忙给我弟弟写了封信。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>scribble sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dash 'round <i>(especially BrE</i>)=DASH AROUND</b><br>\n
date	<h3>date<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,date 'back … (<i>also </i>,date 'back to sth)</b><br>to have existed since a particular time in the past or for the length of time mentioned追溯到；始于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a tradition that dates back at least a thousand years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一传统至少可以追溯到一千年前。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her problems date back to her childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的这些问题小时候就有了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The town dates back to Roman times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座城镇建于古罗马时代。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'date from sth </b><br>to have existed since a particular time in the past自… 至今； 从… 开始:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a beautiful vase dating from about 1715.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个漂亮的花瓶大约在1715 年就有了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strike was the latest stage in a dispute which dated from 1990.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次罢工是自1990年以来纠纷的最新阶段。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

deal	<h3>deal<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'deal in sth </b><br>to do business; to make money by buying and selling a particular product or kind of goods经营， 买卖(商品等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made a fortune dealing in stocks and shares.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他买卖证券股票交易发了财。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They deal exclusively in Chinese art.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只经营中国艺术品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company deals in computer software.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司经营计算机软件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>shares,art </b><br>to make money by buying and selling goods illegally,especially drugs做非法交易；(尤指)贩卖毒品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re rumoured to be dealing in stolen goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据说他们倒卖赃物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>drugs,arms</b><br>to be concerned with or involved in sth关心；参与；涉及:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This newspaper doesn’t deal in gossip, only in facts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家报纸不传播小道消息，只报道事实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s not the type to deal in rumours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不是那种爱说长道短的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,deal sb 'in <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to include sb in an activity让某人加入(活动)；把某人算入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It sounds like a great plan! Deal me in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这计划听上去很棒！算我一个！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count sb in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>deal sb out,deal sb out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,deal sb 'out; ,deal sb 'out of sth <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to not include sb in an activity不让某人加入(活动)；不把某人算入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can deal me out of this. I don’t want to get involved in anything illegal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不要把我算在内。我不想参与任何违法的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count sb out,count sb out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>deal sb in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,deal sth 'out (to sb)</b><br>to share sth among a number of people, groups of people or organizations把…分配，分发(给…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll deal out the proceeds to several charities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将把收入分赠给几个慈善团体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The profits were dealt out among the investors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 利润分给了投资者。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>distribute sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>(in a game of cards 纸牌游戏) to give cards to each player(给游戏者)发牌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dealt out seven cards to each player.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给每人发了七张牌。</font><br>to give sb a particular punishment; to say what punishment sb should have给予， 宣布(判决、处罚):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dealt out the same punishment to all the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她惩罚所有的孩子一视同仁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Severe penalties are dealt out to persistent offenders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 惯犯予以严惩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>punishment</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>administer sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'deal with sb </b><br>to look after, talk to or control people in an appropriate way, especially as part of your job打交道，管理人(尤指作为工作):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her job involves dealing with young offenders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的工作包括看管少年犯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re very difficult people to deal with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们这些人很难缠。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>handle sb</b><br>to take appropriate action in a particular situation or according to who you are talking to, etc.对付，应付，对待(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you deal with this customer? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你来招呼这位顾客好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to deal with students and handle a load of paperwork as well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须照应学生，同时还得完成大量文书工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most patients are dealt with within four weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数病人四个星期之内就得到治疗。</font><br>to take appropriate action to punish sb who has done sth wrong整治，处罚(某人) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your father will deal with you when he gets home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你父亲回家后会收拾你的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Athletes found guilty of taking drugs were swiftly dealt with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 被检测出服用禁药的运动员立刻受到了处罚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sort sb out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'deal with sb/sth </b><br>to do business regularly with a person, an organization, a government,etc.与… 做生意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We prefer to deal only with reputable companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只喜欢和有声誉的公司打交道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is best to deal directly with foreign suppliers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最好和外国供应商直接进行交易。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,company </b><br>to talk to sb, an organization, a government, etc. in order to reach an agreement or settle a dispute商谈；谈判:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I prefer to deal with somebody in authority.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我喜欢与管事的人谈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It would help if I knew exactly who I’m dealing with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我早知道我在跟谁谈就好了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'deal with sth </b><br>to solve a problem, carry out a task, etc.解决；处理；应付:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to deal with enquiries/ issues/complaints </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 处理各种询问/问题/投诉</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police dealt with the incident very efficiently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方处理这一事件的效率很高。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s some urgent correspondence here that hasn’t been dealt with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里有些急件待处理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problems,matter,situation,crisis </b><br>(of a book, poem, article, etc. 书、诗、文章等) to be about sth涉及； 论及； 关于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The next programme deals with the subject of divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下个节目将讨论离婚这一主题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>subject,question,issue</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cover sth</b><br>if you <b>deal with</b> an emotion such as anger or sadness, you learn to control it or become less affected by it学着控制，学着克制(情绪):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is beginning to deal with his anger in a constructive way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始用建设性的方法处理自己的怒气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘You’ve got to try and forget her and get on with your life.’ ‘I’m dealing with it!’ </font></i><br><font depend	<h3>depend<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'pend on sb/sth (<i>also</i> de'pend upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br><b>(for sth)</b> (<i>not usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常不用于进行时) to need help or support from sb/sth in order to live or to manage in a particular situation需要，依靠(提供资金、帮助等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The organization depended heavily on voluntary help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个机构十分依赖志愿者帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came to depend on her daughter for support.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她最终依赖女儿供养。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He depends on medication to stay alive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他靠药物维持生命。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rely on/upon sb/sth (for sth)</b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to be affected by or decided by sb/sth受…的影响；由…决定；取决于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t know if I’ll come or not. <b>It all depends on</b> how tired I feel this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道能不能来。这全得看我今晚有多累。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This may be a welcome change or not, depending on your point of view.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个变化是否受欢迎取决于你的观点。</font><br>In informal English it is quite common to say <b>depend</b> rather than <b>depend on</b> before words like <i>what</i>, <i>how</i>, or <i> whether</i>.在非正式英语中， <i>what</i>,<i> how</i> 或<i>whether</i> 等词之前颇常用<b>depend</b> ， 而非<b>depend on</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It depends how tired I feel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这得看我有多累。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It all depends what happens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这全要视情况而定。</font><br>to rely on sb/sth; to be able to trust sb依靠； 信赖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you’ll be able to come — I’m depending on you to help me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望你能来─我指望着你帮忙呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need someone who can be depended on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们需要一个可以信赖的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on/upon sb/sth;rely on/upon sb/sth</b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to be sure that sth will happen确信；相信；指望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can depend on my sister to spoil things }(= she always does)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我妹妹保准把事情弄糟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on/upon sb/sth;rely on/upon sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>\n
deprive	<h3>deprive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'prive sb/sth/yourself of sth </b><br>to prevent sb/sth from having sth important; to take sth away from sb剥夺；使丧失；使不能享有:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In prison they were starved and deprived of sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在狱中挨饿并且睡眠不足。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby’s brain had been deprived of oxygen during the birth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这婴儿出生时大脑缺氧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no need to deprive yourself of food on this diet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按照这个规定饮食没必要节食。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>humorous</i>) I couldn’t deprive you of }(= take away from you)&b{ your last few pence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能搜刮掉你最后的几便士。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
derive	<h3>derive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'rive from sth </b><br>to come or develop from sth从…衍生出；起源于；来自:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The word history derives from the Latin word ‘historia’ meaning story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp history一词源自拉丁语的historia，意思是story(故事) 。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The criticism derives from a misunderstanding of our aims.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一指责是由对我们目标的误解造成的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'rive sth from sth </b><br><i>(formal</i>) to get or obtain sth from sth从… 中得到(或获得) … :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She derived a great deal of satisfaction from this achievement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从这一成绩中得到极大的满足。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pleasure,satisfaction,information,benefits</b><br>to obtain a substance from sth从…中提取…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These remedies are derived mainly from the natural world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些药物主要是从自然界的东西提炼出来的。</font><br>to come or develop from sth从…衍生出；起源于；来自:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Rubik cube derives its name from its inventor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rubik cube(魔方)是以发明人命名的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The name of the mountain appears to be derived from an old Norse word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座山的名称像是从一个古挪威词衍生出来的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>name,word</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

sb/sth<i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to arrive somewhere, especially suddenly and unexpectedly and in large numbers(突然)涌到，大批到来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dozens of police descended on the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 数十名警察突然来到这座大楼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>humorous</i>) My sister and her family are descending on us this color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果反过去辱骂他，就是跟他一般见识。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stoop to sth,stoop to doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
despair	<h3>despair<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'spair of sb/sth;de'spair of doing sth (<i>formal </i> or <i>humorous</i>)</b><br>to feel that there is no hope that sb/sth will improve, get better, etc. or that sth will happen对…绝望；对…失去希望；丧失信心:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I despair of you, Ian — act your age! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你太让我失望了，伊恩─你年纪不小了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d begun to despair of ever seeing him again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我那时开始绝望，觉得再也见不到他了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

devolve	<h3>devolve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'volve on/to/upon sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(of work,duties, power or responsibility工作、职责、权力或责任) to be given to a person or an organization by sb at a higher level of authority交给下属(或下层等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the responsibility has devolved upon him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的责任都落到了他身上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Additional powers will devolve to the regional governments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将向地方政府下放更多的权力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>de'volve sth to sb/sth </b><br>to give work, duties,power or responsibility to sb with less authority than you(将工作、职责、权力、责任等)交给下属(或下层等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More powers are gradually being devolved to the regions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正逐步向地方下放更多的权力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

die	<h3>die<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,die a'way </b><br>(of a sound声音) to become so faint or weak that you can no longer hear it逐渐减弱；逐渐模煳；逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sound of the car engine died away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车发动机的声音逐渐消失了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her laughter died away when she saw how angry he was.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看见他那样生气，她的笑声就低了下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fade away</b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,die 'out)</b> (of rain, wind or a storm 雨、风或风暴) to gradually become weaker and stop逐渐减弱；逐渐平息:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain will largely die away overnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨过一夜就差不多会停了。</font><br>(of a feeling or an emotion 感觉或情绪) to gradually become weaker and disappear逐渐平静； 逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The excitement over their affair soon died away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对于他们的风流韵事的兴奋劲儿很快过去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fade away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,die 'back (<i>also</i> ,die 'down) </b><br>if a plant <b>dies back</b>, its leaves die, although the roots are still alive(植物)叶凋而不死:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leaves die back in winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叶子到冬天就枯萎了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,die 'down</b><br>(of a sound or flames 声音或火焰) to gradually become less loud or strong逐渐降低；逐渐变弱；逐渐平息:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He waited for the applause to die down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他等着掌声平息下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire had died down by the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炉火到早晨就熄灭了。</font><br>(of wind, rain or a storm 风、雨或风暴) to gradually become less strong or violent逐渐减弱；逐渐变小；逐渐平息:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As it got dark, the wind died down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风到了晚上就逐渐变小了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>subside</b><br>if something such as excitement or confusion <b>dies down</b>, it gradually becomes less(兴奋情绪或混乱心情等)逐渐平静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When all the fuss had died down, he just quietly went back home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切喧闹平息之后，他悄悄地回家了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>subside</b><br>=DIE BACK<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,die 'off </b><br>if a group of people or animals <b>die off</b>,they die one by one over a short period of time until there are none left相继死去；先后死去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The survivors are dying off daily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 活下来的正在一天天地死去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,die 'out </b><br>if a family, race or species <b>dies out</b>,there are no longer any members left alive(家族、种族或物种)灭绝，逐渐消亡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are several theories about why dinosaurs died out so suddenly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于恐龙为何突然灭绝的理论有几种。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many plants and animals are in danger of dying out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有多种植物和动物濒于灭绝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>become extinct</b><br>(of a custom, tradition or skill 风俗、传统或技能) to no longer be used or practised失传:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many New Year and May Day ceremonies have virtually died out now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新年和五朔节的很多仪式如今实际上已经失传了。</font><br>=DIE AWAY 2 <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outbreaks of rain will die out later in the day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骤雨将在白天晚些时候逐渐停止。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
dig	<h3>dig<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dig 'in </b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to begin to eat开始吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dig in while it’s hot! </font></i><br><font looked at the stack of work and dug in straight away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看了看那一堆工作便立刻埋头干起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dug into the reports and finished them before the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她全力以赴地写报告并在开会之前写完了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dig sth 'in; ,dig sth 'into sth </b><br>to push sth into sth把… 插入； 把… 戳进… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bird dug its claws in and held onto its prey.</font></i><br><font 她用手指甲掐住我的胳膊。</font><br>to mix a substance into soil by digging(把…)掺进土中，混入土壤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve dug the fertilizer into the soil.</font></i><br><font plans拒绝做某事；固执己见；不让步:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dug his heels in and insisted she went with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他固执地坚持要她跟他走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dig yourself 'in;be dug in </b><br>to make a safe place for yourself in the ground and prepare for the enemy to attack掘壕防守；挖掩体隐蔽:<br><i><font 对他的过去探究过多不是个好主意。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) =DIG IN,DIG INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,dig (deep) into your 'pocket(s) , 'savings,etc.<br>to spend some of the money you questions在…中探究(或找寻信息):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp See what you can dig up on this man’s past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看看你能在这个人的过去找到些什么。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp dine	<h3>dine<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dine on sth </b><br>to eat a particular type of food吃(某种食物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We dined on freshly-caught fish in a floating restaurant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在一家水上饭店品嚐了刚打到的鱼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They dined on a diet of soup and bread.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们常吃的食物是汤和麵包。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dine 'out <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to have dinner away from your home, for example at a restaurant or in sb else’s home下馆子；外出(或在别人家)进餐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We dined out every night when we stayed in Paris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在巴黎时每天晚上都外出吃饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>eat out <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dine 'out on sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>humorous</i>)</b><br>to tell people of something that has happened to you in order to impress them以(自己的事情)娱乐别人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She only actually said one sentence to Brad Pitt but she dined out on it for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她实际只和布雷德…皮特说过一句话，然而她把这事儿挂在嘴皮子上有很多年。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
dip	<h3>dip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dip sth 'in/ 'into sth; ,dip sth 'in </b><br>to put sth very quickly into a liquid and take it out again用…蘸(…)；(身体部位)沾(水等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dipped her toes cautiously into the sea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她小心翼翼地用脚趾探了探海水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took off her shoes and cautiously dipped a toe in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脱下鞋小心翼翼地用一个脚趾探了探。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fruit had been dipped in chocolate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这水果蘸了巧克力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dip 'into sth </b><br>to read or watch only small parts of a book, magazine, programme, etc.读(或看)…的部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve only had time to dip into the report.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这报告我只看了一小部份。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The continuous news services are intended for people to dip into.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 重复不断的新闻报道是为方便人们随时收看一部份。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>book,report </b><br>to put your hand into a container to take sth out of it把手伸进(…里取东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dipped into her purse and took out a coin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从钱包里掏出一枚硬币。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp dip into your 'pocket, 'savings, etc. <br>to take an amount from money that you have been keeping or saving掏腰包；用积蓄(等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have dipped into their savings to pay for the shares.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用积蓄买股票。</font><br>\n
disagree	<h3>disagree<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>disa'gree with sb </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) <br>if something such as food or the weather <b>disagrees with</b> you, it has a bad effect on you or makes you feel ill(食物、天气等)不适合某人，使某人不适:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel terrible — something I ate must have disagreed with me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很难受─一定是吃了不该吃的东西。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>upset sb</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mushrooms don’t agree with me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我吃蘑菇不舒服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> AGREE WITH SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>disa'gree with sth;disa'gree with doing sth </b><br>to disapprove of sth and think it is bad or wrong不赞成；反对:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We totally disagree with the ban on fox hunting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们完全不赞成猎狐禁令。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She disagrees with keeping animals locked up in cages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她反对把动物锁在笼子里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>decision,statement,principle</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>agree with sth,agree with doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

dish	<h3>dish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dish sth 'out (to sb)</b><br><i>(informal</i>) to give sth out to large numbers of people or in large amounts广泛发出；大量发出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always dishing out advice to people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是指手画脚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth out (to sb) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>In informal spoken language <b>dish sb out sth</b> is also used.非正式口语也说<b>dish sb out sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dished me out a few vitamin pills.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了我一些维生素丸。</font><br>to serve food to sb by putting it on plates把﹙ 食物﹚ 分到盘里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s busy dishing out the dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忙着给大家分晚饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>serve sth (&b{to sb</b> ) (<i>more formal</i>)}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,dish it 'out (<i>disapproving</i>)<br>to criticize sb or attack them指责；批评；攻击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was good at dishing it out. It was time he learned what it felt like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就知道攻击别人。那回轮到他好好感受一下了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dish 'up; ,dish sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to serve food by putting it on plates把﹙食物﹚盛到盘里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You pour the wine while I dish up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你倒葡萄酒，我把食物分到盘子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come and wash your hands — I’m just going to dish up the dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来洗洗手──我这就把晚饭端出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>serve sth out;serve,serve sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dish 'up sth; ,dish it/them 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to present or offer sth to sb, usually sth not very good提供，供给﹙通常指不太好的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She keeps on dishing up the same old jokes in her shows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在节目里尽重复些老掉牙的笑话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>serve sth up</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>\n

dive	<h3>dive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dive 'in; ,dive 'into sth </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to start doing sth with enthusiasm and without stopping to think﹙过急地﹚全身投入，全力以赴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dived in with a question before I had finished speaking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还没讲完话她便迫不及待地提问了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had dived into the new business without thinking it through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们未经慎重考虑就全力办起了新企业。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to start eating with enthusiasm大吃起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as the food was served, she dived in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 食物一端来，她就大口大口地吃起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>food,dinner</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dig in;dig into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dive into sth </b><br>to move your hand quickly into sth such as a pocket or bag to try to find sth迅速将手伸入﹙包或口袋里﹚找东西:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dived into her handbag for the keys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她立即将手伸进提包里找钥匙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bag,pocket</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
divest	<h3>divest<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vest sb/yourself of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to take clothes off sb/yourself﹙给某人﹚脱衣服:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swiftly divested himself of his clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迅速脱掉衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vest sb/sth of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to take sth away from sb/sth从…取去…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The court order divests the company of all its assets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法院指令剥夺了公司的所有资产。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>strip sb/sth of sth <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vest yourself of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to get rid of sth you no longer want or that is no longer useful丢弃，抛弃﹙不需要或无用的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She managed to divest herself of the unwanted property.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她设法处理掉了那件不需要的东西。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DIVEST SB/YOURSELF OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>\n
divide	<h3>divide<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vide by sth </b><br>if a number <b>divides by</b> another number, the second number is contained in the first an exact number of times能被﹙ 某数﹚整除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does 612 divide by 13? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  612能被13整除吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 148 doesn’t divide by 12.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  148不能被12整除。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vide sth by sth </b><br>if you <b>divide</b> a number <b>by</b> another number, you find out how many times the second number is contained in the first﹙一数﹚除以﹙另一数﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What’s 48 divided by 3?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  48除以3得几？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 48 ÷ 3 = 16.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  48除以3等于16。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vide into sth </b><br>if a number <b>divides into</b> another number, it is contained in the second number a particular number of times能整除﹙某数﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does 300 divide into 1 270? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  300 能整除1 270 吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di'vide sth into sth </b><br>if you <b>divide</b> a number<b>into</b> another number, you find out how many times the first number is contained in the second用﹙一数﹚除﹙另一数﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you divide 300 into 1 270? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能用300 除1 270 吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di,vide sth/sb 'off (from sth/sb) </b><br>to separate two things or two people with a barrier such as a wall or fence; to form a barrier between two things or people用﹙屏障等﹚隔开；把…﹙与…﹚隔开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A fence divided off one side of the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一道篱笆把园子的一边隔开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They put up a barrier to divide the women’s section off from the men’s.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用挡板把女部和男部分开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di,vide 'up;di,vide sb/sth 'up (into sth) </b><br>to separate,or to make sb/sth separate, into groups or parts分成部份；分组；把…分开﹙成为…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Divide up into two teams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 分成两队。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They divided the children up into groups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把孩子分成几组。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Divide up your time so that you don’t spend too long on any of the questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把时间分配一下，这样就不会在任何一题上花太多时间。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>di,vide sth 'up (among/between sb) </b><br>to separate sth into parts and give one part to each of a number of people﹙由…﹚分担，分摊，分享；把…分派﹙给…﹚；摊派:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We divided the work up between us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们分担了工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The money was divided up among all three winners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这笔钱分给了所有三名获胜者。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>work,money,land</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
