do	<h3>do<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,do a'way with sb/yourself <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to kill sb/yourself杀死，干掉﹙某人﹚；自杀:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to do rid of sth;to stop doing or having sth废除；取消；结束:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve done away with the uniform at our school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,do sb 'down; ,do yourself 'down (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to criticize sb or yourself in a way that makes them/you appear more stupid or less able than they/you really are贬低他人；贬低自己:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t do him down, he’s a good worker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp down,put yourself down <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'do for sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to damage or destroy sth; to injure or kill sb; to put sb/sth in a situation so bad that they/it have no chance of returning to normal毁灭；破坏；伤害；杀死:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The last bout </i>(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>in serious trouble or danger; having no chance of succeeding at sth麻烦很大；十分危险；完蛋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If anyone recognizes us, we’re done for! }(= we 'in <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if sth <b>does you in</b>, it makes you feel extremely tired使筋疲力尽；使疲乏至极:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s done me in, lifting all those boxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我搬完那些箱子后都累垮了。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,do yourself 'in</b>) (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) to kill color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She drew back from the window in case anyone saw her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从窗口退后，免得有人看见她。</font><br>(<b>from sth/from doing sth</b>) to because winter is coming﹙天黑﹚渐早；﹙白昼﹚渐短:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nights are drawing in fast now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天黑得越来越早了。</font><br><i><font September and the days had begun to draw in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时是九月末，白天开始缩短了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>close in </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>draw out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw 'in; ,draw 'into sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if a train <b>draws in</b>, or <b>draws into</b> a station, it slowly enters a station and stops at the platform﹙火车﹚到站，进站停靠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The London train drew in late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发自伦敦的列车到站时晚点了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got to the platform just as the train was drawing into the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到月台时火车正徐徐进站。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull in,pull into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>draw out,draw out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sb 'in; ,draw sb 'into sth; ,draw sb 'into doing sth </b><br>to make sb become involved or take part in sth, although they do not want to使某人不由自主地投入﹙环境等中﹚；把某人牵涉进去﹙或卷入某事情等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t like the book when I started it, but the strange story soon drew me in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我开始读这本书时并不喜欢它，但那离奇的故事情节很快把我吸引住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I refuse to be drawn into this argument.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拒绝卷入这场争论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>conversation,discussion,argument,situation</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>involve sb (in sth)</b><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is often used in the passive.这个短语动词常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sth 'in </b><br>if you <b>draw in</b> a breath, you breathe deeply or quickly深吸，迅速吸入﹙一口气﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She drew in a deep breath at the magical sight of the city below.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她俯视城市迷人的景色，不禁深深地吸了一口气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew in his breath sharply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他猛吸一口气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ a/your, etc. breath</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sth 'off </b><br>to remove some liquid from a larger amount抽出，排掉﹙液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew off a glass of beer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他倒了一杯啤酒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw 'on </b><br>(of a time or a season 时光或季节) to slowly pass渐渐过去；荏苒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As night drew on, it became clear he wasn’t coming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜渐深了， 他显然是不会来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'draw on sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>'draw upon sth</b> <i>more formal</i>) to use sth that you have or that is available to help you do sth凭藉；利用；动用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The assignment asked us to draw on our experiences while we were in England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个任务要求我们参考在英国时的经验。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll have to draw on my savings to pay for the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得动用积蓄买那辆车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>experience,work,resources,savings,tradition</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sections of the book should be drawn on as required.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 应按要求引用本书章节。</font><br>if you <b>draw on</b> a cigarette or a pipe,etc. you breathe smoke into your mouth from it吸，抽﹙烟等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew on his cigar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他吸了一口雪茄。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cigar,cigarette,pipe</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>(<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) when evenings or nights are <b>drawing out</b>, it is gradually becoming lighter for longer in the evening because spring is coming﹙天黑﹚渐晚；﹙白昼﹚渐长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After March the evenings started drawing out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 三月份之后夜晚越来越短。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>draw in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw 'out; ,draw 'out of sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if a train <b>draws out</b> or <b>draws out of</b> a station, it begins to move and slowly leaves the station﹙火车﹚离站，出站:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I arrived in time to see the train drawing out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我赶到时正好看到火车徐徐离站。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train drew slowly out of the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车徐徐开出车站。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull out,pull out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>draw in,draw into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sb 'out </b><br>to encourage sb who is shy to talk freely让﹙害羞的人﹚畅谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to draw him out on the subject of his life in Africa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我设法让他好好谈谈他在非洲的生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sth 'out </b><br>to make sth such as a meeting or an event last longer than usual or longer than it should拖延， 拉长﹙ 会议或活动等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They drew the interview out to over an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拖拖沓沓面试了一个多小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The process is likely to be drawn out over several months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一过程有可能拖拉几个月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>drawn-'out (<i>also </i>,long-drawn-'out,'longdrawn <i>less frequent</i>) <i>adj </i></b><br>lasting longer than you expect or too long拖延的；拉长的；持续很久的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The negotiations were difficult and drawn-out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些谈判进行得艰难且拖沓。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was another long-drawn-out meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 又是一次冗长的会议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sth 'out; ,draw sth 'out of sth </b><br>to take money out of a bank color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several thousand pounds had been drawn out of the account.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几千英镑从这个账户提走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sth out,take sth out of sth;withdraw sth (from sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw 'up; ,draw sth/sb/yourself 'up </b><br>to come to a stop; to make sth/sb/yourself stop﹙使﹚停下，停止:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A taxi drew up outside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出租车在外面停了下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew the car up at the front door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把汽车停在前门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was walking towards the door when a loud knock <b>drew him up sharply</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝门走去，一记响亮的敲门声令他猛地收住脚步。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull up;pull sb up;pull yourself up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DRAW YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,draw sth 'up </b><br>to make or write sth that needs careful planning拟订；制订；起草:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My solicitor is drawing up the contract.</font></i><br><font 需要拟订明确的指导方针。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve drawn up a plan of action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们制订了行动计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>contract,agreement,plan</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>formulate sth (<i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to bring sth nearer to sb/sth将…拉近；使靠近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She drew up another chair and sat with them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拉过一把椅子和他们坐在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew his knees up to his chest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把双膝抱在胸前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>chair,knees</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ to her full height, hands on hips, and glared at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她双手叉腰站得直挺挺的，对我怒目而视。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull yourself up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp dream	<h3>dream<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dream sth a'way </b><br>to spend time in a lazy way thinking about things you would like to do but not actually doing anything﹙把时间等用于没有行动的﹚空想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dreamt her life away, never really achieving anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一辈子都在幻想，但一事无成。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>life</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dream of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp wouldn’t 'dream of sth/of doing sth <br>used to emphasize the fact that you would not even think about doing sth无论如何也不会做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Don’t go without me, will you?’ ‘I wouldn’t dream of it!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “别扔下我好吗？ ”“我决不会那么做的！ ”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>un'dreamed of <i>adj </i></b><br>much more or much better than you thought was possible料想不及的；做梦都没想到的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp undreamed-of happiness </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 意想不到的幸福</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dream 'on <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb that you are certain that what they have just said will not happen做梦﹙ 指对方所说的不切实际﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You want a pay rise? Dream on! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想加薪？做梦吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dream sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to have an idea or think of a plan, especially one that is not very practical凭空想出，虚构出﹙尤指不切实际的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scheme was dreamed up by a local businessman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个计划是当地一个商人异想天开地弄出的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Trust you to dream up a crazy idea like this! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这个人就是会想出这种荒唐的主意来！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea,scheme</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
dredge	<h3>dredge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dredge sth 'up (<i>usually disapproving</i>)</b><br>to mention sth that sb has forgotten or wants to forget because it is unpleasant or embarrassing重提，翻出﹙令人不快的往事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always dredges up that embarrassing story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她老是翻出那件令人尴尬的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the past </b><br>to remember sth or to do sth with difficulty追忆；回忆；竭力做﹙某事﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was dredging up the little she knew about babies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她努力回忆自己知道关于婴儿的那点皮毛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to dredge up a smile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他勉强笑了笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
dress	<h3>dress<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dress 'down (in sth) </b><br>to wear clothes that are less formal than those you usually wear or those that are usually worn in a particular situation穿着便服；穿着便装:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He deliberately dressed down for the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有意穿便装参加聚会。</font><br><i><font <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dressing-'down <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>old-fashioned</i>, <i>informal</i>)an occasion when sb speaks angrily to a person because they have done sth wrong训斥；责骂<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dress 'up (as sb/sth), ,dress sb/yourself 'up (as sb/sth)</b><br>to put on special clothes in order to pretend to be sb else装扮﹙成…﹚；乔装打扮；化装:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids love dressing up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们都喜欢装扮成别人玩儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They dressed themselves up as cartoon [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dress 'up (in sth), ,dress yourself 'up (in sth)</b><br>to wear special or more formal clothes than you usually do or than those usually worn in a particular situation穿着盛装；穿着正装:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t bother to dress up — come as you are.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她穿了一套灰色西装出庭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>dress down (in sth)</b><br>Do not confuse this phrasal verb with <b>get dressed</b> or <b>dress</b>, <b>dress sb/yourself</b>,which just mean ‘to put on clothes’.不要将这个短语动词和<b>get dressed</b> 或<b>dress</b> 、<b>dress sb/yourself</b> 混淆，后者仅表示“穿衣服”:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I jumped out of bed and drift	<h3>drift<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drift a'part </b><br>to become less close or less friendly with sb逐渐疏远:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Over the years we just drifted apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年复一年我们就这么渐渐疏远了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drift 'off </b><br>to fall asleep睡着； 入睡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She soon drifted off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快入睡了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I drifted off to sleep on the sofa while I was watching the football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看足球赛时在沙发上睡着了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>doze off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
drill	<h3>drill<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drill sth 'into sb </b><br>to make sb learn or understand sth by repeating it frequently向某人反复灌输…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had multiplication tables drilled into us at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以前我们上学得反复背诵乘法表。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s no need to drill things into them — they’ll learn as they go along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没必要生塞硬灌──他们会边做边学的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drum sth into sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
drink	<h3>drink<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drink sth 'down</b><br>to drink all of sth quickly迅速喝光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He filled a cup with cold water and drank it down in one gulp.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他盛了一杯凉水一饮而尽。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drink 'in sth; ,drink it/them 'in </b><br>to look at, listen to or experience sth with great pleasure and interest尽情地欣赏某事物；陶醉于…；乐在其中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wandered the streets, drinking in the atmosphere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她漫步街头，乐在其中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sat gazing at the view, drinking it all in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们坐着尽情地欣赏景色。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sight,view,atmosphere,beauty</b><br>A noun must always follow <b>in</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>in</b> .名词必须放在<b>in</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>in</b> 之间。<br> <b>Drink in sth</b> cannot be used in the passive.<b>drink in sth </b>不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'drink to sb/sth </b><br>to wish sb/sth good luck, success or happiness, by raising your glass and then drinking为…乾杯﹙或祝酒﹚；举杯祝贺…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all drank to the couple’s health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都举杯祝这对夫妇健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Things can only get better.’ ‘I’ll drink to that!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “情况只会更好的。”“我举杯赞成！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>toast sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drink 'up; ,drink sth 'up </b><br>to finish all of a drink﹙把…﹚喝完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Drink up. It’s time to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喝完吧。该走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Drink your milk up — it’s good for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把牛奶喝完─牛奶有益。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
drive	<h3>drive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'drive at sth </b><br>to try to express or say sth试图表达﹙ 或说﹚ … :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not sure I understand <b>what you’re driving at</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不确定我是否理解了你要表达的意思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What’s he driving at? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想说什么？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get at sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive a'way/ 'off; ,drive sb/sth a'way/ 'off </b><br>(of a car or a driver 汽车或开车人) to go away in a vehicle; to take sb away in a vehicle驱车离开；驾车带走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cab drove slowly away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出租车慢慢开走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s someone to drive your car away and park it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人帮你把车开到停车场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were driven away in a police van.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们被警车带走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive sb/sth a'way (from sth) </b><br>to make sb not want to go to a particular place or be with a particular person; to make sb/sth leave a place令人却步；驱使…离开﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rising prices are driving our customers away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不断上涨的价格使顾客望而却步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His temper and his violent behaviour have driven all his family away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脾气和暴力行为把家人全吓跑了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,customers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive 'off </b><br>(in golf 高尔夫球) to hit the ball to begin a game开﹙球﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive 'off; ,drive sb/sth 'off =DRIVE AWAY/OFF,DRIVE SB/STH AWAY/OFF </b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The van drove off at high speed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 客货车高速开走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car was driven off at speed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车高速开走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Then he drove her off to the airport.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 然后他开车把她送往机场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive sb/sth 'off; ,drive sb/sth 'off sth </b><br>to force sb/sth to move away from a particular place赶走…；驱赶…﹙离开…﹚；击退:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army was driven off by the fierce attacks of the rebels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队被反叛者的激烈进攻打退了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were driven off the island by the new owner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们给岛上的新主人赶走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive 'on </b><br>to continue driving either without stopping or after stopping for a short time驱车继续行驶:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We drove on until we came to an open square full of cafés.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一直开到一处布满小餐馆的露天广场才停下车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Paula stopped to let Philip out of the car before driving on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 葆拉停车让菲利普下车之后又继续往前开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drive sb/sth 'out; drool	<h3>drool<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'drool over sb/sth </b><br>to look at sb/sth in a way that shows you like and admire or want them/it, often in a silly or exaggerated way痴情地看；迷恋地看:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was drooling all over you at the party! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚会上他一直在痴迷地打量你！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys drooled over the sports cars in the showroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些男孩给陈列室里的跑车迷住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
drop	<h3>drop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop a'round <i>(AmE</i>)=DROP BY</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sth a'round <i>(AmE</i>)=DROP STH ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop a'way <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if the ground<b>drops away</b>, it slopes down steeply away from where you are﹙地面﹚陡峭地向下延伸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The seabed suddenly dropped away and I was waist deep in the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海床陡直向下，我掉进了齐腰深的水里。</font><br>to become less strong or disappear减弱； 消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt his dark mood dropping away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他觉得悲观的情绪渐渐减少了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'back </b><br>if a person in a group <b>drops back</b>,they move to a position further back behind other people, often because they are not able to stay at the front逐渐落在﹙同伴等的﹚后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The original leader in the race has now dropped back to third place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛开始时领先的人现在落后到了第三。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall back</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop be'hind; ,drop be'hind sb/sth </b><br>if sb<b>drops behind</b> or <b>drops behind</b> sb/sth, they move to a position behind other people落后﹙ 于… ﹚ ； 移到﹙ 他人﹚ 后面的位置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dropped behind to walk with Sam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他退后和萨姆一道走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We cannot afford to drop behind our competitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可担当不起落后于竞争对手的后果。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall behind,fall behind sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'by (<i>also</i> ,drop 'round <i>BrE</i>, ,drop a'round <i>AmE</i>) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to pay a short, informal visit to sb, often without arranging this in advance看望一下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just dropped by to check you were OK.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只是顺便来看看你还好吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m dropping round to Kate’s later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回头要顺便去凯特家一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>call by <i>(especially BrE</i>), stop by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP IN (ON SB/AT…),DROP INTO STH;DROP OVER<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sth 'by <i>(AmE</i>)=DROP STH IN (TO SB/STH),DROP STH INTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'in (on sb/at…), ,drop 'into sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to pay a short, informal visit to sb, often without arranging this in advance看望一下…；到某处一会儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Drop in any time you’re passing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你路过时就进来坐坐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She drops in on her parents at least once a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一周至少去看父母一次。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I dropped into the coffee shop for a quick drink on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家半路上进咖啡店简单喝了一杯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>call in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP BY<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp centre/surgery/clinic </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随时可去的活动中心；无需预约的门诊/诊所</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sb/yourself 'in it <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to put sb in a difficult or embarrassing situation使陷入困境； 使尴尬:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got herself out of trouble by dropping Laura in it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她自己甩掉了麻烦却把劳拉扯进去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep+it<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sth 'in (to sb/sth), ,drop sth 'into sth (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually </i>,drop sth 'by)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to deliver sth, especially when you are on the way to somewhere else﹙顺路﹚递送:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dropped the report in on her way out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她外出时顺便把报告送去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll drop a note in to you when I know the STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sth 'into sth =DROP STH IN (TO SB/STH),DROP STH INTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'off</b><br>(<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) to fall into a light sleep打盹儿；小睡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always dropping off in front of the TV.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看电视老是打瞌睡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>doze off;nod off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if a number,an amount or a quality <b>drops off</b>, it decreases﹙数量﹚减少；﹙数字、质量﹚下降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The numbers applying for membership have dropped off sharply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 申请会员资格的人数锐减。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall drop-off in sales.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理们因新近的销售额下降而担忧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP-OFF at DROP SB/STH OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sb/sth 'off </b><br>to stop and let sb get out of a car,etc.; to deliver sth to a place, often when you are on the way to somewhere else停车让﹙某人﹚下去；﹙顺路﹚递送﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could to get out, or where sth can be left; the action of doing this停车谢客﹙或卸货﹚站点；停车谢客﹙或卸货﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is easier to get a taxi at passenger <b>drop-off points</b> than at flight arrival stands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在谢客站叫出租车比在航班进港候客处容易。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP-OFF at DROP OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'out; ,drop 'out of sth 1 </b><br>to stop taking part in an activity, being a member of a group,etc.不再参加；退出；脱离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several members of the team had to drop out at the last minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几位队员要临时退出比赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had to drop out of the race half way through.</font></i><br><font university, etc. without finishing your studies退学；辍学:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dropped out of college after only a few weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在大学只读了几个星期就退学了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many students drop out or fail because they’re not enjoying the course.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多同学因为不喜欢这门课程而放弃或考试不及格。</font><br>to reject the accepted ideas, morals and values of society拒绝传统社会:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s a danger that when people lose their jobs they drop out (of society) altogether.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 失业的人很容易脱离社会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'dropout <i>n </i></b><br>a person who leaves school, college or university before they have finished their studies退学者；辍学者:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He might be a college dropout but he’s made a fortune in business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他可能中途离开大学，但在商界发了财。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a high <b>dropout rate</b> from some college courses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些大学课程的退出率很高。</font><br><i>(usually disapproving</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) a person who rejects the accepted ideas, morals and values of society拒绝传统社会者:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many of the town’s dropouts hang around the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个镇的很多脱离社会传统的人在广场上闲荡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'over <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to visit sb for a short time at their home, without arranging a time in advance串门子；到某人家小坐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’ll just drop over to Jim’s for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想就去吉姆家小坐会儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t you drop over this evening?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今晚为什么不来坐坐呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pop over/round</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP BY<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=DROP BY</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drop sth 'round <i>(BrE</i>)(<i>AmE </i>,drop sth a'round)(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to deliver sth to sb’s home, etc.把﹙某物﹚送到﹙某人家等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll drop those papers round later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我过会儿把那些文件送过去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> DROP STH IN (TO SB/STH),DROP STH INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
drown	<h3>drown<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drown sb/sth 'out </b><br>if a sound <b>drowns out</b> sb/sth, it is so loud that they/it cannot be heard﹙声音﹚盖过…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The music was playing at full volume, drowning out conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 音乐开到了最大音量，盖过了谈话声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her reply was drowned out by a passing motorbike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的回答淹没在路过的摩托车车声中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>noise,sound,roar,music</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her voice was drowned by the crashing waves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的声音淹没在海浪拍击声中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
drum	<h3>drum<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drum sth 'into sb </b><br>to make sb remember sth by repeating it often向某人反复灌输；对某人反复讲述:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drummed road safety into them before letting them out on their bicycles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他反复叮嘱他们要注意交通安全，然后才让他们骑自行车出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Traditional values were drummed into him from an early age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从小就被反复灌输了传统价值。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had it drummed into me that I shouldn’t talk to strangers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我曾反复提醒自己不要与陌生人讲话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drill sth into sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drum sb 'out; ,drum sb 'out of sth </b><br>to force sb to leave a group or an organization, usually because they have done sth wrong开除；轰走；驱逐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was drummed out of the club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被赶出了俱乐部。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw sb out,throw sb out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drum sth 'up </b><br>to work hard to get sth竭力争取；兜揽﹙生意﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re launching a campaign to drum up more business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正要发起运动以揽到更多生意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We couldn’t drum up enough cash to keep the club going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们无法争取到足够的现金继续办俱乐部。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,support,customers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
dry	<h3>dry<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dry 'off; ,dry sb/sth 'off; ,dry yourself 'off </b><br>to become dry; to make sb/sth/yourself dry﹙使﹚变乾；弄乾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We lay beside the pool to dry off in the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们躺在游泳池边在太阳下晒乾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can use this towel to dry yourself off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以用这条毛巾擦乾身体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I dried the car off with a soft cloth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用软布把汽车擦乾。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dry 'out; ,dry sb 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to receive treatment to help you stop drinking alcohol or taking drugs; to cure sb of drinking too much alcohol or of taking drugs﹙使﹚戒酒瘾，戒毒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went into a clinic to dry out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她到一家诊所戒毒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dry 'out; ,dry sth 'out </b><br>to become very or too dry; to make sth become very or too dry﹙使﹚变乾，乾透:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water the plant regularly and don’t let the soil dry out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经常给植物浇水，别让土壤乾透了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind and the sun had dried out my skin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风吹日晒使我的皮肤变乾燥。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>dry 'up </b><br>if a supply of sth <b>dries up</b>, it is no longer available枯竭；耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan was abandoned when the money dried up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钱用光之后计划就被放弃了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>investment,supply,funds</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run out </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to stop talking suddenly because you cannot remember what to say next or are very nervous突然说不出话来；结舌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She dried up during the second act.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在第二幕突然忘台词了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just dried up halfway through the interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 面试进行到一半时我真的张口结舌。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) used to tell sb rudely to be quiet or stop talking闭嘴；住口<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dry 'up; ,dry sth 'up </b><br>if a river or a lake, etc.<b>dries up</b>, or sth <b>dries it up</b>, it becomes completely dry﹙使河流、湖泊等﹚乾涸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The well dried up for the first time in a century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个世纪以来这眼井第一次乾涸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun dried up all the puddles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳把所有的水坑烤乾了。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>,<i>informal</i>) to dry dishes after they have been washed擦乾﹙碗碟﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll dry up if you wash the dishes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你洗盘子，我可以擦乾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He dried all the dishes up and put them away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把所有的碟子抹乾并收起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,dried 'up <i>adj </i></b><br>completely dry乾涸的；乾透的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They camped in a dried-up river bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在一处乾涸的河床上扎营。</font><br>[only before noun] (<i>disapproving</i>)(of a person人) old, with many folds and lines on the skin, small and usually bitter or bad-tempered年老乾瘪的﹙且通常尖刻暴躁的﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The librarian was a dried-up, bitter old man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 图书馆员是个乾瘪尖刻的老头儿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,drying 'up <i>n </i></b><br>[U] (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) the act of drying dishes after they have been washed抹乾碟子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to do the drying up </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把碟子抹乾</font><br>\n

ease	<h3>ease<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease 'back </b><br><i>(business</i>) if profits, prices, etc.<b>ease back</b>, they become a little lower, especially after they have been high﹙利润、价格等﹚略微回落， 稍降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company’s profits eased back from ￡15.1 million to ￡14.7 million.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司利润从 1 510 万英镑回落到1 470 万英镑。</font><br>(<b>on sth</b>) if somebody <b>eases back</b>, they go a little slower, do sth with a little less energy, are less strict, etc.than before﹙把某事﹚放慢，放宽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team played aggressively in the first half of the game, but were able to ease back in the second.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队在比赛上半场表现得气势汹汹，但在下半场就稍微收敛些。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government should ease back on farming restrictions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府应该放宽农业限制。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease 'back into sth; ,ease sb/yourself 'back into sth </b><br>to gradually become familiar again with sth you have not done for some time;to help sb become familiar again with sth they used to do﹙让某人或自己﹚重新熟习﹙生疏了的事情﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smith is gradually easing back into running after his injury.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯受伤后正慢慢恢复跑步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to ease the kids back into the school routine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该让孩子们逐步恢复上学期间的作息习惯了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The <b>ease back process</b> is designed to reduce the chance of re-injury.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个恢复过程特别为减少再次受伤的可能性而设计。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EASE INTO STH,EASE SB/YOURSELF INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease 'into sth; ,ease sb/yourself 'into sth</b><br>to gradually become, or help sb become, familiar with sth new, especially a new job﹙让某人或自己﹚逐渐熟悉﹙新事物，尤指新工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to ease into retirement </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 逐步适应退休生活</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a course for easing people into the world of computing </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帮助学员进入电脑世界的课程</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EASE BACK INTO STH,EASE SB/YOURSELF BACK INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease 'off </b><br>to gradually become less strong or unpleasant逐渐减轻；逐渐缓解:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eventually the rain started to ease off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨势终于开始减弱了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pain eased off after a few hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个小时之后疼痛减轻了。</font><br>to go slower or make less effort放慢速度；放松:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He eased off in the last lap and still won.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在最后一圈放慢了速度，还是赢了比赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slack off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease sb 'out; ,ease sb 'out of sth </b><br>to make sb leave their job or position, especially by making it difficult or unpleasant for them over a period of time﹙尤指长时期刁难﹚让某人离开﹙工作岗位等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was eased out of his job as presidential adviser.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迫于形势，最终辞去总统顾问的职务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ease 'up </b><br>(<b>on sth</b>) to go slower or make less effort; to do sth less放慢速度；放松；减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor told him to ease up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生让他放松点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d ease up on the training a bit if I were you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我若是你就减少点训练。</font><br>(<b>on sb</b>) to start being less severe with sb﹙对某人﹚放松要求:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think you should ease up on the kids a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得你应该对孩子们温和些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
eat	<h3>eat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat sth a'way </b><br>to gradually damage or destroy sth over a period of time侵蚀；腐蚀；逐渐破坏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Something was eating away the foliage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有东西在一点点地侵害叶子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the stone had been eaten away by pollution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部份石头被污染物腐蚀了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sea is eating away the coastline.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海水侵蚀着海岸线。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EAT AWAY AT STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat a'way at sb </b><br>to worry sb over a long period of time﹙精神上﹚折磨某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jealousy is eating away at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 嫉妒心折磨着他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat a'way at sth </b><br>to gradually damage or destroy sth over a period of time侵蚀；腐蚀；逐渐破坏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pollution is eating away at the stone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 污染物腐蚀着石头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Resentment ate away at their relationship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 怨恨逐渐破坏了他们的关系。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EAT STH AWAY<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat 'in </b><br>to have a meal at home rather than at a restaurant在家里吃饭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you eating in tonight? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今晚在家吃饭吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>eat out </b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,eat sth 'in</b>) (<i>especially BrE</i>) to buy and eat food at a restaurant, rather than taking it away to eat在餐馆进餐﹙非外卖﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is this food to eat in or take away? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份食物是在这里吃还是带走？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>take sth away <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'eat into sth </b><br>to gradually damage or destroy sth逐步腐蚀；逐渐损坏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Woodworm had eaten into most of the furniture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 木蛀虫把大部份傢具都蛀了。</font><br>to use or take away a large part of sth valuable, especially money or time消耗， 花掉，耗费﹙尤指部份的金钱或时间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My work began to eat into the weekends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的工作开始占用周末。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>profits,time</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat 'out </b><br>to have a meal in a restaurant, etc. rather than at home上馆子吃饭；在外用餐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ate out almost every night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们几乎每晚都下馆子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dine out <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>eat in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat 'up </b><br>used to tell sb to eat quickly or to eat everything they have been given快点吃；要吃完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eat up! You’ll be late for school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点吃！你上学要迟到了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EAT STH UP 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat sb 'up </b><br>if an emotion such as anger, guilt, etc.<b>eats sb up</b>, it worries them all the time and they cannot think of anything else﹙情感﹚折磨某人，煎熬着某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The anger was eating her up inside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她怒不可遏。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>consume sb <i>(formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s eaten up by jealousy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他妒火中烧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eat sth 'up </b><br>to eat all the food you have been given吃完；吃光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eat up your broccoli. It’s good for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把花椰菜吃完。这对你有益。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> EAT UP <br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) to use large quantities of sth, for example fuel or electricity大量消耗﹙燃料、电力等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His extravagance is eating up our profits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在挥霍掉我们的赢利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The van really eats up petrol/gas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆客货车很耗油。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
ebb	<h3>ebb<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ebb a'way </b><br>to gradually become weaker and begin to disappear逐渐减弱；开始消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His confidence ebbed away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他渐渐丧失了信心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>strength,enthusiasm,anger</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

eke	<h3>eke<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eke sth 'out </b><br>to make a small supply of sth last longer by using only a little at a time or by adding sth else to it省出…再用；节约使用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She eked out the stew to make another meal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她省出一些炖菜再做一顿饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>income,supplies 2 </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eke 'out sth, ,eke it/them 'out <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to manage to live with very little money餬口；度命:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She <b>eked out a living</b> by selling what she could grow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她能种什么就卖什么维持生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>living,existence</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>out</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>out</b> .名词必须放在<b>out</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>out</b> 之间。<br>\n

empty	<h3>empty<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,empty 'out; ,empty 'out of sth </b><br>if a place <b>empties out</b>, or people <b>empty out of</b> a place, it becomes empty of people﹙空出﹚地方；把﹙某场所﹚空出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At 11.30 the restaurant emptied out }(= people left it)&b{. </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到11 :30 餐厅里已空无一人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People were emptying out of bars and clubs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 酒吧和夜总会里的人纷纷散去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,empty sth 'out; ,empty sth 'out of sth </b><br>to remove all the things from inside a container﹙从容器中﹚将…全部拿出；腾空﹙容器﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He emptied the bag out onto the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把袋子里的东西全放到桌子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t empty the bath water out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别把洗澡水全倒了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was asked to empty everything out of my pockets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我被要求把衣兜里的东西全掏出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
encroach	<h3>encroach<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>en'croach on sth (<i>also</i> en'croach upon sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to use up too much of sb’s time,personal life, etc.; to begin to affect sb妨碍﹙正常生活或活动等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to prevent her work from encroaching too far on her private life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尽力避免工作过多地影响她的私生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cut into sth <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>to gradually spread over more and more of an area逐渐遍布﹙某地区﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New housing is starting to encroach upon the surrounding fields.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新住宅开始延伸到周围的田地。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>territory,land</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
end	<h3>end<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'end in sth </b><br>to have sth as an ending or as a result以…结尾﹙或告终﹚；末端是；以…为结果:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many adverbs in English end in -ly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多英语副词以ly结尾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His first attempt to run a marathon ended in disaster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他第一次参加马拉松比赛以惨败告终。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The partnership between the two companies could all <b>end in tears</b> }(= have an unhappy or unpleasant result)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两家公司合伙最终可能以悲剧收场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>failure,disaster,divorce,a draw</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,end 'up; ,end 'up doing sth </b><br>to reach or come to a particular place or situation that you did not expect or intend to be in最终处于﹙意料或意愿之外的境况等﹚；结果做了﹙意料或意愿之外的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ended up in prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最终锒铛入狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to end up worse off than when I started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想结果比开始时还差。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I expect I’ll end up paying, as usual.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我估计到头来和往常一样还得由我付账。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you drive like that, you could <b>end up dead</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你继续这样开车，总有一天会把命都丢掉！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>finish up,finish up doing sth;wind up,wind up doing sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>Note that this phrasal verb does not mean the same as <b>end</b> .注意这个短语动词和<b>end</b> 的意思不同:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Classes end at 4 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课在下午4点结束。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+-ing<br>\n

engage	<h3>engage<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>en'gage in sth;en'gage in doing sth;en'gage sb in sth;en'gage sb in doing sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to take part in sth; to make sb take part in sth; to be busy doing sth﹙使﹚从事，参加， 忙于… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lecturers engage in teaching and research.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讲师从事桝学和研究。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to engage him in conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试图要他跟她谈话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was engaged in running a small business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他忙于经营一个小生意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>activities,research,business,discussion</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be en'gaged on/upon sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to do sth; to be involved in doing sth正在做；投入﹙活动等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is engaged on a biography of his father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在写关于他父亲的一本传记。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n

enter	<h3>enter<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'enter into sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(<b>with sb</b>) to begin to discuss or deal with sth﹙与某人﹚开始讨论，着手处理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government agreed to enter into negotiations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府同意进行谈判。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The examiners cannot enter into any correspondence over the results.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主考官不可以就结果进行任何通信联系。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>negotiations,correspondence,contract</b><br>(<b>with sb</b>) to begin or become involved in a formal agreement﹙与…﹚开始协商，订定协议:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has entered into an agreement with the World Bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已经和世界银行签订了协议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is vital that the contract be freely entered into.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自由签订本合同是至关重要的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>agreement</b><br>to affect a situation or be an important part of it影响；是…的重要部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Luck didn’t <b>enter into it</b>; I won because of my skill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我取胜并不是靠运气，而是靠我的技术。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>it</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'enter on/upon sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to make a start on sth; to begin sth开始； 着手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The economy entered on a period of sustained growth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济进入了持续增长阶段。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In 1991, he entered upon a turbulent political career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他于1991年开始动荡不定的政治生涯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

even	<h3>even<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,even 'out </b><br>if sth <b>evens out</b>, it becomes level or steady after a period when it has gone up and down or changed a lot﹙在多变之后﹚变平坦，稳定下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The path evens out further on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条小路再向前就平坦了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp House prices will eventually even out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房价最终将趋于稳定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,even sth 'out </b><br>to spread sth equally over a number of people or a period of time平均分配；平均分摊:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to even out the work among the staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尽量把工作平均分配给职员。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,even sth 'up </b><br>to make a situation, a competition,etc. more equal使拉平；使相等；使平衡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I give you another ￡5, that will even things up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我再给你5英镑的话就拉平些了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

eye	<h3>eye<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eye sb 'up (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to look at sb in a way that shows that you are interested in them, especially in a sexual way感兴趣地打量某人；﹙尤指﹚色迷迷地打量着某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s eyeing me up as a potential customer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她满怀期待地注视着我，以为我可能买她的东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was eyeing up all the women at the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他色迷迷地打量着晚会上所有的女人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,eye sth 'up <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to look closely at sth, because you want it or are interested in it渴望﹙或感兴趣﹚地盯着某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you eyeing up that strawberry tart? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你眼馋那块草莓挞吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
face	<h3>face<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,face sb 'down <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to oppose or defeat sb by dealing with them directly and confidently决然把某人压倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President is determined to face down his critics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统决心给指责他的人以迎头痛击。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,face 'off <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br><i>(sport</i>) to start a game such as ice hockey﹙冰球等﹚开球:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teams face off at 2.30.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球队在2点30 分开球。</font><br>to get ready to argue, fight or compete with sb准备好辩论﹙或战斗、比赛﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The candidates face off in a Democratic primary today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天候选人准备在民主党初选中进行辩论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'face-off <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>a method of beginning a game such as ice hockey﹙冰球赛等的﹚开球<br>an argument or a fight辩论；搏斗<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,face 'onto sth </b><br>if a room or a building <b>faces onto</b> sth, the windows look in that direction﹙房间或建筑物的窗户﹚面向，面对，正对:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The front bedroom faces onto a main road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 前面的…室面向大马路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,face 'up to sth </b><br>to accept and deal with a difficult or unpleasant situation敢于面对， 勇于正视﹙困难或不快之事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When is she going to face up to her responsibilities? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她何时能勇于承担自己的责任呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must <b>face up to the fact that</b> he is no longer young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他必须敢于面对自己不再年轻的事实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fact,reality,problem, responsibilities</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>square up (to sb/sth)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This problem has got to be faced up to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必须直面这个问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
factor	<h3>factor<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,factor sth 'in; ,factor sth 'into sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to include a particular fact or situation when you are calculating sth, or thinking about or planning sth把…因素包括进﹙…﹚去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you estimated the cost of the repairs, you forgot to factor in the labour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在估算维修成本时忘了把劳务因素考虑进去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>factor sth out,factor sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,factor sth 'out; ,factor sth 'out of sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to not include a particular fact or situation when you are calculating sth, or thinking about or planning sth不把… 因素包括进﹙…﹚去；把…因素排除在﹙…﹚外:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When inflation is factored out, the trade deficit fell 12.8%.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撇开通货膨胀这一因素，贸易赤字下降了12.8%。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>factor sth in,factor sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
fade	<h3>fade<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fade a'way </b><br>to gradually become less strong,clear or frequent and disappear逐渐变弱﹙或模煳不清﹚；逐渐消逝；逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His footsteps gradually faded away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脚步声渐渐消逝。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her enthusiasm will soon fade away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的热情很快就会消失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>die away</b><br>(of a person 人) to become weaker and die衰弱； 病重死亡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s fading away rapidly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的身体迅速地垮掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fade 'in; ,fade sth 'in </b><br>if a sound or a picture in a film/movie, etc. <b>fades in</b>, or sb <b>fades it in</b>, it gradually becomes louder or clearer﹙使画面﹚淡入，渐显；﹙使声音﹚渐强<br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>fade out,fade sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fade-in <i>n </i></b><br>[U] [C] an act of gradually making a picture appear at the beginning of a scene in a film/movie﹙画面的﹚淡入，渐显<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fade 'out; ,fade 'out of sth </b><br>to become quieter,weaker, etc. and gradually disappear安静下来；逐渐减弱； 逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The protest eventually faded out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抗议声终于逐渐消失了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked a strong candidate, but then <b>faded out of</b> the picture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看上去像个有实力的候选人，但后来却淡出了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fade 'out; ,fade sth 'out </b><br>if a sound or a picture in a film/movie, etc. <b>fades out</b> or sb <b>fades it out</b>,it gradually becomes quieter or less clear﹙使画面﹚淡出，渐隐；﹙使声音﹚渐弱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Near the end of the song he faded out the music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在歌曲的末尾把音乐减弱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>fade in,fade sth in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fade-out <i>n </i></b><br>[U] [C] an act of gradually making a picture disappear at the end of a scene in a film/movie﹙画面的﹚淡出，渐隐<br>\n
faff	<h3>faff<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,faff a'bout/a'round (<i>BrE</i>, <i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to waste time doing unimportant things and not get very much done磨蹭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop faffing about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别磨磨蹭蹭的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
fake	<h3>fake<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fake sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to deceive or trick sb; to make sb think you are going to do one thing and then do another欺骗；蒙骗；以假动作迷惑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thought I was going to turn left, but I faked him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以为我要向左拐，可我让他上当了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
fall	<h3>fall<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall a'bout <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to laugh a lot捧腹大笑；笑得前仰后合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all fell about at her idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们听了她的想法都笑得前仰后合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s rude to the audience and yet they <b>fall about laughing</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不尊重观众，然而他们却哄堂大笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall a'part </b><br>to be old or in bad condition and break or break into pieces破旧；破碎；破裂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you buy cheap shoes, they’ll fall apart after a few months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 便宜的鞋子几个月就穿破了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dictionary is falling apart now, I’ve used it so much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的词典要散架了，我用得太多。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come apart</b><br>to have so many problems that it is no longer possible to exist or operate破裂；崩溃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole country’s falling apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个国家都要分裂了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After my marriage fell apart I moved away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我离婚之后搬走了。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to have so many problems or worries that you can no longer think or behave normally精神崩溃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I fell apart when she left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她离开之后我崩溃了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be falling apart at the 'seams <br>to have a lot of problems and be starting to fail即将失败；接近崩溃<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall a'way </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to break off or separate from a surface剥落；掉落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plaster was falling away in big chunks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灰泥大块大块地剥落。</font><br>(of land, a road, etc.地面、道路等) to slope down向下倾斜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ground falls away abruptly to the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 右边的地势陡降。</font><br>to gradually disappear逐渐消失；逐渐消散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gradually, all his cares and worries fell away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他逐渐变得无忧无虑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When things got difficult, his supporters all fell away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遇到困难时，他的支持者都渐渐离他而去。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to get less or smaller减少；减小:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The number of applicants has fallen away sharply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 申请人数目锐减。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FALL OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'back </b><br>to fail to stay with people at the front in a race﹙赛跑﹚落后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Betts had been leading, but fell back with 10 laps to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贝茨原本领先，可还剩10 圈时却落后了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop back </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FALL BEHIND,FALL BEHIND SB/STH <br>to move or turn back away from sth or sb后退； 撤退；退却:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the troops moved forward, the crowd fell back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队前进时，人群向后撤退。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>retreat <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>finance</i>) to decrease in value or amount﹙价值﹚降低；﹙ 数量﹚ 减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices rose by more than 10% before falling back slightly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格上涨了10%之后又稍有回落。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'back on sb/sth (<i>also</i> ,fall 'back upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to use sb/sth when the situation is difficult or other people/things have failed求助于；借助于；转而依靠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s very hard if you have no family to fall back on.</font></i><br><font 他总会搬出他那些老掉牙的笑话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fallback <i>n </i></b><br>a plan or course of action that you can use if sth else fails应变计划； 退路:<br><i><font to stay with other people or things, especially in a race or competition落后；落在…后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I fell further and further behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我越来越落后。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The industry is falling behind the rest of Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个行业逐渐落在欧洲其他国家后面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell behind the rest of the class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他落后于班里的其他同学。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop behind,drop behind sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FALL BACK 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall be'hind with/in sth </b><br>to not do sth or pay sth at the right time拖欠﹙付款﹚；没有及时做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fell behind with the rent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拖欠了租金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He began falling behind in his schoolwork.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始不按时做作业了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>payments,school work</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'down </b><br>to suddenly stop standing突然倒下；坍塌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought the whole house was falling down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以为整个房子要倒塌了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her legs were so weak that she fell down on her knees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她双腿虚弱得突然跪倒在地。</font><br>to drop to the ground落下；垂到地面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His trousers were falling down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的裤管长及脚跟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lump of the ceiling fell down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天花板掉下了一小块。</font><br><i>(only used in the progressive tenses </i>只用于进行时) (of a building建筑物) to be in extremely bad condition破烂不堪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a beautiful house but it’s falling down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子很漂亮，但摇摇欲坠。</font><br>(of an idea, an argument, a method, etc.想法、论点、方法等) to be shown to be not true or not good enough站不住；站不住脚；说不通；不成立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s where the theory falls down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是该理论说不通的地方。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'downfall <i>n </i></b><br>the loss of sb’s power, position,money, etc.; the thing that causes this衰落；衰败；垮台；衰落﹙或衰败、垮台﹚的原因<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'down on sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to fail to do sth correctly or successfully没有把… 做好；把…搞糟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The suggestion was that he was <b>falling down on the job</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 言外之意是他活儿干得不好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>job</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fall for sb/sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to be attracted to sb/sth; to fall in love with sb/sth爱上；倾心于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell for a young student.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他爱上了一个年轻的学生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fell for the farmhouse as soon as we saw it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对那所农舍一见倾心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fall for sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to be tricked into believing sth is true when it is not信以为真:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You didn’t fall for that old trick, did you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你没有给那个老花招迷惑住吧？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'in </b><br>if a roof or a ceiling <b>falls in</b>, it drops to the ground﹙顶部或天花板﹚塌落，坍塌:<br><i><font [opposite]<b>fall out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'in with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to join sb; to become involved with sb加入；开始与某人有牵连:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fell in with a bad crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她结交了一帮坏人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'in with sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to agree to or support a plan or an idea, especially when you do not really want to﹙尤指勉强地﹚同意，赞成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always expects me to fall in with his plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总以为我会赞成他的计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>plans</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go along with sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'into sth </b><br>to begin to be in a particular state进入﹙某状态﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell into a deep sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他陷入沉睡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tramway fell into disuse in the 1920s.</font></i><br><font
