color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一定不能犯这个错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s fallen into arrears with the rent }(= he is late in paying it)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有按时交租金。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>disuse,disrepair </b><br>to begin to do sth or become involved in sth开始做﹙或参与﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I fell into the habit of having a nap after dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我养成了晚饭之后小睡的习惯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fell into conversation with her neighbour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和邻居聊上了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the habit of…, conversation</b><br>to be able to be divided into sth可分成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Computer viruses fall into three broad categories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机病毒可分为三大类。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>two groups,three categories,etc.</b><br>to belong to a particular group or class属于﹙某集体或类别﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only 25% of people fall into this group.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有25% 的人属于这一组。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>category,group,class,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'off </b><br>to decrease in quantity or quality数量减少；质量下降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Attendance has fallen off recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出席人数最近减少了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The standard of cooking fell off when the old chef left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 原来的厨师走了之后烹饪质量下降了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FALL AWAY 4<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fall-off (<i>BrE also </i>'falling-off <i>less frequent</i>)(&b{in/of sth</b>) <i>n </i>}<br>[sing.] a decrease in the quality of sth﹙质量的﹚下降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a fall-off in attendance/ interest/sales </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出席人数/兴趣/销量的减少</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'off; ,fall 'off sth </b><br>if something <b>falls off</b> or<b>falls off</b> sth, it becomes separated from the thing it is joined to﹙从…﹚掉下，掉落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door handle has fallen off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门柄脱落了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put the picture up properly — we don’t want it to fall off the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把画挂好—我们可不想它从墙上掉下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fall on sb/sth (<i>also</i> 'fall upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>)(<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to be the responsibility or duty of a particular person or organization﹙责任等﹚落在…身上；由…负担:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the cost fell on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大部份费用由我们负担。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he died, the responsibility of the business fell on his son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去世以后，企业归他儿子负责管理。</font><br>if your eyes <b>fall on</b> sb/sth, you suddenly see or notice them/it﹙视线﹚落在…上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My eye fell on a letter she had left on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然看见她落在桌上的一封信。</font><br>to attack sb/sth with energy or enthusiasm袭击；向…进攻；扑向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children fell on the food with cries of delight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们快活地喊叫着扑向食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He fell on the drawings and examined them closely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他扑向那些画仔细鉴赏起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>food</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'out </b><br>(of hair, teeth, etc.毛发、牙齿等) to become loose and drop out掉落； 脱落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chemotherapy made her hair fall out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 化疗使她的头发脱落。</font><br>(<b>with sb</b>) (<b>over/about sth</b> ) (<i>especially BrE</i>) to have an argument with sb and stop being friendly with them﹙ 与某人﹚﹙为… ﹚争吵，吵架:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s not worth falling out about this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为这事争吵不值得。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why have you fallen out with him? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么和他吵架了？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They fell out over their father’s will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为父亲的遗嘱争吵起来。</font><br>(of soldiers 士兵) to move out of lines原地解散；离开队列<br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>fall in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,falling-'out <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>especially BrE</i>) a quarrel争吵；吵架:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve had a bit of a falling-out.</font></i><br><font accident﹙核爆炸或事故之后的﹚放射性坠尘<br>the bad results of a situation后果； 余波:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the current crisis and its political fallout </font></i><br><font His bike fell over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的自行车倒了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fall 'over sb/sth </b><br>to hit sb/sth with your responsibility of a particular person﹙职责、责任﹚落在…身上；应由…做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The task of telling them the news fell to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 示威秩序由警方负责维持。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fall to sth;'fall to doing sth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to start doing sth开始做； 干起来:<br><i><font included in a particular group of things属于； 归入… 中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What heading do these items fall under? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp fax	<h3>fax<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fax 'in; ,fax sth 'in </b><br>to send a fax (= a message sent using a machine that sends and receives messages or documents along telephone wires and then prints them) to an organization, a company, a television or radio programme, etc.﹙把…﹚以传真发送:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Viewers are invited to fax in with their comments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欢迎观众发传真来表达意见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Orders can be either phoned or faxed in to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可给我们打电话或发传真订货。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fax sth 'on (to sb/sth) </b><br>to send a fax (= a message sent using a machine that sends and receives messages or documents along telephone wires and then prints them) that you have received to sb else for them to see or deal with把﹙收到的传真﹚转发﹙给…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please email or fax this on to a friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把此条信息用电子邮件或传真转发给朋友。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fax sth 'out </b><br>to send a fax (= a message sent using a machine that sends and receives messages or documents along telephone wires and then prints them) to a large number of people at the same time以传真散发﹙信息﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Draft proposals will be faxed out for comment at the end of May.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 草拟的提案将在五月底一併传真给大家评议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fax sth 'through </b><br>to send sb a fax (= a message sent using a machine that sends and receives messages or documents along telephone wires and then prints them) with details of or information about sth以传真发送﹙详情等﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

feed	<h3>feed<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,feed 'back (into/to sth) </b><br>if sth <b>feeds back</b> to/into sth, it returns to the place, situation, idea, etc.that it started from and has an effect, usually a good one, on its development﹙某事物﹚反过来带动，反过来影响﹙另一事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rising import prices tend to feed back into domestic prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进口价上升趋向带动国内价格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What the audience says feeds back into the development of the programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 观众的反馈促进这个节目的发展。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,feed sth 'back (to sb) </b><br>to give information,advice or opinions about a product, sb’s work,etc., especially so that it can be improved将﹙信息、建议或意见﹚反馈给﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will feed this information back to the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们会把这一情况反馈给公司。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The results of the tests will be fed back to the schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考试成绩将反馈给各学校。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>information</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'feedback <i>n </i>[U] </b><br>information, advice or opinions about how good a product, sb’s work, etc. is反馈的信息﹙或建议、意见﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got a lot of positive feedback about the programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个节目收到很多正面反馈意见。</font><br>an unpleasant noise produced by some electrical equipment when some of the power returns to the system﹙电器的﹚反馈噪音<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,feed sth 'in; ,feed A 'into B;'feed B with A</b><br>to put sth into a machine将…放进机器:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll need to feed the paper in by hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得手动进纸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to feed information into a computer</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将信息输入计算机</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fed coins into the meter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他往停车收费器里投硬币。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fed the meter with coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他往停车收费器里投硬币。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'feed on/off sth </b><br>(of an animal, etc. 动物等) to use sth as food; to eat sth; to be nourished or strengthened by sth以…为食；从…中得到滋养；靠…长壮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This bat feeds on fruit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种蝙蝠以水果为食。</font><br><i>(often disapproving</i>) to become stronger because of sth else因… 而壮大:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The media feed off each other’s stories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 媒体靠相互提供报道而运作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,feed 'through (to sb/sth/into sth) </b><br>to reach sb/sth after going through a process or a system逐渐﹙在…身上﹚产生影响﹙或成效﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rises in prices feed through to higher wage claims.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 物价上涨的结果是人们要求加薪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It will take time for the higher rates to feed through to investors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 需要时日投资者才能因收费提高而受惠。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,feed sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to give extra food to a person or an animal to make them stronger and more healthy﹙用大量食物﹚养肥，养壮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look as if you need feeding up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看上去似乎需要增加点营养。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'feed B with A =FEED STH IN,FEED A INTO B,FEED B WITH A</b><br>\n

words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选词填空。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve left gaps on the sheet for you to fill in the details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll have to fill the holes in with cement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得用水泥堵这些洞。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hole,crack </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to spend time while you are waiting for sb/sth消磨，打发﹙时间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How shall we fill in the time until he arrives? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们该如何打发他来之前的这段时间？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fill 'out </b><br>to become larger, rounder or fatter膨胀；扩张；长胖；长肥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby’s filled out a lot recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿最近胖多了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fill sth 'out </b><br>to make sth larger or more complete使更大﹙或更完整﹚；扩充:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll need to fill the story out to make a full page article.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得把这篇报道扩充成满一页的文章。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) =FILL STH IN 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fill 'up; ,fill sth 'up </b><br>(<b>with sb/sth</b>) if a container or a place <b>fills up</b> or sb <b>fills it up</b>, it becomes completely full充满﹙容器或地方﹚；满是﹙人或东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The restaurant was beginning to fill up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 餐馆快满员了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She filled her glass up again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她又斟满一杯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People began filling up the empty seats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们开始坐满空位。</font><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to fill your vehicle with petrol/gas, etc.装满﹙汽油等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to fill up with petrol before we go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出发之前我得加满油。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fill the tank up with diesel.</font></i><br><font particularly of filling a car with petrol/gas填充；﹙尤指汽车的﹚加油<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fill sb/yourself 'up </b><br>to give sb a lot of food so that they feel full; to eat as much as you can﹙让…﹚吃饱，尽情地吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meals at school never fill me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校里的饭菜从未让我吃饱过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eat lots of pasta to fill yourself up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多吃通心粉，吃得饱饱的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
filter	<h3>filter<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,filter sth 'out </b><br>to remove sth from a substance by passing it through a special substance or device过滤掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use a sun cream to filter out ultraviolet rays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用防晒霜滤掉紫外线。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
find	<h3>find<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'find against sb <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to decide in a court of law that sb is guilty作出不利于…的裁决；判…败诉﹙或有罪﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The court found against the defendant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法庭判被告有罪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'find for sb <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to decide in a court of law that sb is innocent作出有利于…的裁决；判…胜诉﹙ 或无罪﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jury found for the defendant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 陪审团作出对被告有利的裁决。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,find 'out (about sth/sb, that…, how…, etc.), ,find sth 'out (about sth/sb) </b><br>to learn a fact, a piece of information, or the truth about sth/sb获知，查明，弄清﹙情况或真相﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won’t be happy when she finds out about this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她若知道这事会不高兴的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘What did she say?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “她说了什么？”“你很快就会知道的。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did you find out (that) she was ill? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你什么时候得知她生病的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never found out exactly what happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未弄清楚到底发生了什么事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you find that out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是怎样发现这个情况的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a while to find out what he was really like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我过了一段时间才发现他的真面目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you ever find out who did it? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你查出是谁干的吗？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,find sb 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to discover that sb has been dishonest or has done sth wrong查出﹙坏人﹚；识破:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’re ever found out, you’ll go to prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一旦被查出来，就会坐牢的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
finish	<h3>finish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish 'off (with sth), ,finish sth 'off (with sth)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to have sth as the last part of sth; to make sth end by doing one last thing﹙以…﹚作结， 使圆满； 完成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a delicious meal we finished off with coffee and mints.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吃完美味可口的饭菜之后，我们喝咖啡嚼薄荷糖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The concert finished off with the band’s latest hit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 音乐会以乐队的最新流行歌曲作压台戏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band finished off the show with their latest hit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队用自己的最新流行歌曲作演出的压台戏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have to go now, can I leave you to finish off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须走了，你留下做收尾工作好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her outfit was finished off with navy shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她穿上深蓝色的鞋子，整装完毕。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Finish </b>and <b>finish sth</b> are also used with almost the same meaning.表达相近含义用<b>finish</b> 或<b>finish sth</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish sb 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb so unhappy,tired, etc. that they cannot continue what they are doing使垂头丧气；使筋疲力尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Running in that heat nearly finished him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冒着那种酷热跑步快使他受不了了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Finish sb </b>can also be used with almost the same meaning.表达相近含义可用<b>finish sb</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish sb/sth 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to destroy or kill sb/sth, especially sb/sth that is already injured杀死，彻底摧毁﹙已严重受伤或受损的人或事物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thought the soldiers would come back and finish him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以为那些士兵会回来打死他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ought to finish the poor animal off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该把这可怜的动物人道毁灭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)The business had been finished off by financial difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 企业最终由于财政困难而倒闭。</font><br>(in sport 体育运动) to defeat a person or team that you are competing against打败， 挫败﹙对手﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Agassi finished him off in three sets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阿加西经过三盘比赛把他击败了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish sth 'off </b><br>to complete sth完成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to try and finish off my work tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚要争取把活儿干完。</font><br>to use the last part of sth, especially food or drink用完，用光﹙尤指食物或饮料﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s finished off all the ice cream! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把冰激凌一扫而光！</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Finish sth </b>is used with almost the same meaning.表达相近含义用<b>finish sth</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish 'up </b><br>[<b>+adj/prep</b> ] (<i>also </i> ,finish 'up doing sth) (<i>especially BrE</i>) to reach or come to a particular place, state or situation after a long series of events, often without planning it最终来到；结果成为；以…终结:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lost control of the car and finished up in the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开车失控栽进了河里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She started out washing dishes and finished up as a chef.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从洗盘子干起，最后成了厨师。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all went home and I finished up doing most of the clearing up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都回家了，到头来清扫的活大部份是我干了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>end up,end up doing sth;wind up,wind up doing sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>In this meaning, <b>finish up</b> is always used with either an adjective, a phrase beginning with a preposition, or <i>doing sth</i>.<b>finish up </b>作此义时总与形容词、介词短语或<i>doing sth</i>连用。<br>Note that <b>finish up</b> does not mean the same as <b>finish.</b> 注意<b>finish up</b> 和<b>finish</b> 含义不同:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Classes finish at 4 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下午4点钟放学。</font><br>(<i>AmE</i>) to complete what you are doing; to do the last part of sth完成﹙手头的工作﹚；做最后的部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll finish up here and join you later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把这里活儿做完之后就去找你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,finish sth 'up (<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to do the last part of sth; to use what is left of sth作最后加工；做﹙或用﹚最后的部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stayed home to finish up his assignment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他呆在家里完成作业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'finish with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to end a relationship with sb与﹙某人﹚断绝关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve finished with Antonia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和安东尼娅分手了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break up (with sb) </b><br>to stop punishing sb停止处罚，不再惩罚﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll never do that again once I’ve finished with him! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等我桝训过他以后他再也不会干那事了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'finish with sth </b><br>to no longer need to use sth不再需用﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you wash your cup when you’ve finished with it? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杯子用过后洗洗好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I keep the book a little longer? I haven’t finished with it yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我能把书再保留一段时间吗？我还没看完呢。</font><br>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to stop doing sth because you no longer want to do it or enjoy it不再做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he was finished with football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他不再踢球了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
fire	<h3>fire<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fire a'way <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to begin asking questions or to begin to speak﹙让人﹚开始说，开始问:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Can I ask you some questions?’ ‘Fire away!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “ 我能问几个问题吗？ ”“问吧！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fire sth 'off </b><br>to shoot a bullet from a gun开枪；射击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fired off a volley of shots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他举枪扫射。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>gun,shot </b><br>to ask a lot of questions, etc.quickly, one after the other连珠炮似地提问:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fired off a series of questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他接连提了一系列问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>questions </b><br>to write a letter, report,etc. quickly, often because you are angry﹙常指愤怒地﹚奋笔疾书:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She would fire off a letter of protest in the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她早晨要奋笔写一封抗议信。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>letter </b><br>if you <b>fire off</b> an email, you send it发出，发送﹙电子邮件﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to fire off an email to a newsgroup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要给新闻组发一封电子邮件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>email</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fire sb/sth 'up </b><br>to make sb/sth become excited or enthusiastic about sth激起热情；使充满激情:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager fired the team up at half-time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理在中场休息时鼓舞全队的士气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fire sth 'up </b><br><i>(AmE</i>) to light a fire; to make sth hot点火；使变热:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll get the burgers — you fire up the grill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去拿汉堡—你把烤架烧热。</font><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) to make an engine start operating发动，启动﹙引擎﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fired up the engine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发动了引擎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>engine</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
firm	<h3>firm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,firm sth 'up (<i>also</i> ,firm 'up <i>less frequent</i>) </b><br>if sb<b>firms up</b> an arrangement, an agreement, etc. it becomes more definite or less likely to change落实；敲定﹙安排、协议等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll phone on the 25th to firm up the details of the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将于25号打电话落实开会的细节。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices will firm up later this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年晚些时候会把价格敲定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>plans,agreement </b><br>to make sth, especially part of the body, harder or more solid使﹙尤指身体部位﹚坚实；使坚硬；使坚固:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These exercises will firm up those difficult areas of your body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些运动会使身体有问题的部位变结实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>) ◆ v+adv<br>\n
fish	<h3>fish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fish for sth </b><br><i>(often used in the progressive tenses</i>常用于进行时) to try to make sb tell you sth, say sth nice to you, etc. by asking them a question寻求，渴望听到﹙赞扬的话等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you fishing for compliments? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是在寻求对方的赞扬吧？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>information,compliment</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>angle for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fish sb/sth 'out; ,fish sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>to take or pull sb/sth out of somewhere﹙从…中﹚取出，拿出，拖出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fished some change out of his pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从衣兜里摸出一些零钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several days later his car was fished out of the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几天之后他的汽车从河里打捞上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
fit	<h3>fit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit 'in (with sth) </b><br>if sth <b>fits in</b>, it looks pleasant or suitable with other things or in a particular place﹙ 与某事物或场所﹚ 协调， 适合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The building doesn’t fit in with the surrounding area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座建筑和周围环境不协调。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s an old house, but our furniture fits in well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子陈旧了，可和我们的傢具很搭配。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit 'in; ,fit 'into sth </b><br>to be the right size or shape to go in a particular place放得下；摆得开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will all your furniture fit in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的傢具都摆得下吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The piano wouldn’t fit into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里搁不下这架钢琴。</font><br>to live or work easily and naturally with a group of people﹙与…﹚合得来；适应:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tim never fitted in at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蒂姆从未适应过大学生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane <b>fitted in</b> well <b>with</b> the rest of the staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简和其他职员关系融洽。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s fitted into the team well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已经很适应这个队。</font><br>to have a particular role or part in a plan,a situation, etc.﹙在计划、情况等中﹚担当某角色:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where does he fit in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哪里有他适合的地方？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like to know where I fit in and what I have to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想知道我的岗位和工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where do I fit into all this? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这些情况中我该发挥什么作用？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit sb/sth 'in; ,fit sb/sth 'into sth </b><br>to find a place for sb/sth, especially when there is not much space把…放进﹙有限的空间﹚里；把…置于﹙有限的位置﹚里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can’t fit a sofa in here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里放不下沙发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will try to fit you in somewhere in the organization.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将设法把你安排在这个机构里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get sb in,get sb into sth;get sth in,get sth into sth </b><br>to manage to find time to see sb or to do sth找到时间﹙见某人、做某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurse will fit you in between other appointments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 护士会在其他预约中安排出见你的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How do you manage to fit so much into your day? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你怎么能在一天中安排下这么多事情？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit 'in with sth </b><br>if an activity or event <b>fits in with</b> sth else, they exist or happen together in an easy or convenient way﹙活动或事情﹚适合，与… 相宜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My job fits in with looking after my family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的工作不耽误照顾家庭。</font><br>to adapt to what sb else is planning or to sb else’s way of doing things与﹙他人的计划或做事方式﹚一致起来；适应:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve got to learn to fit in with our methods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们必须学会顺应我们的方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll fit in with what you want to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会按你的要求做的。</font><br>to agree with ideas or information that you already have about sb/sth与﹙已有的想法或信息﹚一致；符合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That fits in with everything I’ve heard about her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这与我对她的了解完全相符。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit sb/sth 'out (<i>also</i> ,fit sb/sth 'up) (&b{with sth</b> ) }<br>to supply sb/sth with the clothes, food, equipment,etc. they need向…提供所需的东西﹙如衣服、粮食、装备等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship had to be fitted out before the voyage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮船出航之前一定要为其提供必需品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the high cost of fitting out offices </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 配置办公室设备的高额支出</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fitted him out with a set of dry clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们给他换了套乾衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit sb 'up (for sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to make sb appear to be guilty of a crime that they have not committed诬陷某人﹙犯某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re trying to fit me up for the theft.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们企图把偷盗的事栽到我头上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>frame sb <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fit sb/sth 'up (with sth) =FIT SB/STH OUT (WITH STH)</b><br>\n
fix	<h3>fix<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fix on sth </b><br>to decide to choose sth选定；决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We haven’t fixed on a date for the meeting yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们尚未确定会议的日期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>decide on/upon sth;settle on/upon sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fix sth on sb/sth </b><br>if you <b>fix</b> your eyes or your mind <b>on</b> sb/sth, you look at or think about them/it with great attention集中﹙目光、注意力、思想等﹚于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fixed her eyes on his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她凝视着他的脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His attention was fixed on a large dark car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他全神贯注地看着一辆黑色大轿车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>eyes,gaze,attention</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fix sb 'up; ,fix yourself 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to arrange for sb to have sth; to provide sb with sth向某人提供；给某人准备；安顿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can fix you up with somewhere to stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以给你安排住处。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope she soon gets herself fixed up with a job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望她很快找到工作。</font><br>In informal spoken language <b>fix sb up sth</b> is also used.非正式口语也说<b>fix sb up sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you fix me up an appointment for tomorrow? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 能把我的预约安排在明天吗？ </font><br>(<b>with sb</b>) to arrange for sb to meet sb who might become a boyfriend or girlfriend给… 介绍﹙ 男友、女友﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My brother says he wants me to fix him up with one of my friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我哥哥说他想让我把他介绍给我的一位朋友。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FIX YOURSELF UP;FIX STH UP 1; FIX UP TO DO STH,FIX UP FOR SB TO DO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fix sth 'up </b><br>to arrange or organize sth; to arrange for sb to have sth安排；组织；提供；准备:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you fixed your holiday up yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你安排好假期了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall we fix up a meeting for next week? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把会议定在下个星期好吗？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>meeting</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>arrange sth </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FIX UP TO DO STH,FIX UP FOR SB TO DO STH <br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to repair, decorate, etc. a room of a house修理； 装饰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They spent ￡30 000 fixing up their house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们花了3万英镑整修房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fixed up the attic as a study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把阁楼装修成书房。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>house,room</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>do sth up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to build or make something quickly;to make sth ready迅速建起﹙或制作出﹚；准备好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fixed up a shelter for the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们匆匆搭了个棚子过夜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fix yourself 'up <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make yourself neat and attractive打扮； 梳妆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you wait? I’ll just go and fix myself up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等一下好吗？我这就去收拾一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FIX SB UP,FIX YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fix 'up to do sth; ,fix 'up for sb to do sth (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make arrangements to do sth or for sb to do sth安排﹙某人﹚做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s fixed up for her to see the doctor on Thursday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已经安排她星期四看医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve fixed up with the school to start in September.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我和学校商定九月份开始。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>arrange to do sth;arrange for sb to do sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FIX STH UP 1; FIX SB UP,FIX YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+to inf ◆ v+adv+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fix sb with sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>fix sb with</b> a look, etc., you look at them directly for a long time把﹙目光等﹚停在某人身上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fixed him with a cold stare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她冷冷地盯着他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
fizzle	<h3>fizzle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fizzle 'out <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to fail or to end in a weak or disappointing way, often after having started strongly﹙顺利开始﹚结果失败，终成泡影；虎头蛇尾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The romance fizzled out after a month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个浪漫故事一个月后就结束了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coup attempt soon fizzled out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政变不久就失败了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
flag	<h3>flag<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flag sb/sth 'down </b><br>to signal to the driver of a moving vehicle to stop, usually by waving your arm﹙挥手﹚示意某人停车，示意车子停下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to flag down a passing motorist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挥手招呼一位过路的司机把车停下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police were flagging down all heavy goods vehicles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察在挥旗拦挡所有重型货车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>taxi/cab,motorist</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wave sb/sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
flake	<h3>flake<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flake 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to collapse or fall asleep because you are very tired﹙疲倦得﹚倒下，睡着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was so exhausted that I flaked out on the sofa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我筋疲力尽地倒在沙发上睡了。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to begin to behave in a strange way行为古怪起来<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
flare	<h3>flare<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flare 'up </b><br>(of flames, a fire, etc.火焰、火等) to suddenly burn more strongly突然旺起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire flared up as I added more wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我添了些木柴，火顿时旺起来。</font><br>if fighting, tension,anger, etc. <b>flares up</b>, it starts very suddenly and violently﹙战斗、紧张状态、怒火等﹚突然发作， 加剧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Violence flared up in several cities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几座城市突然发生暴力事件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dispute could flare up into a major crisis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一争端可能激化为一场重大危机。</font><br>if a person<b>flares up</b>, they show sudden anger towards sb突然发怒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He flared up in a fury and shouted at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一下子火冒三丈，对她大喊大叫。</font><br>if an illness or injury <b>flares up</b>, it suddenly starts again or becomes worse﹙疾病、损伤﹚复发，突然加剧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her asthma has flared up again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的哮喘病又犯了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'flare-up <i>n </i>[usually sing.] </b><br>a sudden expression of anger, violent feeling, etc.﹙怒火、强烈感情等的﹚爆发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the latest flare-up between the two countries </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两国间新近爆发的不和</font><br>an occasion when an illness or injury starts again or quickly becomes worse﹙疾病的﹚复发；﹙损伤的﹚迅速恶化<br>\n
flash	<h3>flash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flash sth a'round (<i>also</i> ,flash sth a'bout <i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to show sth valuable,especially money or jewellery to people, or let them see it, to impress them炫耀﹙尤指钱或珠宝﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop flashing your money around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别到处炫耀你的金钱了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flash 'back (to sth)</b><br>if your mind or your thoughts <b>flash back</b> to sth that happened in the past, you suddenly remember it回忆；回想；回顾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mind flashed back to my first day at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回忆起第一天上大学的情景。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'flashback <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] a scene in a film/movie,book, etc.which shows sth that happened earlier﹙电影、书等的﹚闪回，倒叙，倒叙片段<br>a sudden, very clear, strong memory of sth that happened to you in the past that is so real you feel that you are living through the experience again﹙往事的﹚闪回，再现眼前，浮现在脑海:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She still has nightmares and vivid flashbacks of the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她依然做噩梦，那次事故的情景历历在目。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flash 'by/ 'past; ,flash 'by/ 'past sb/sth </b><br>to go or pass very quickly; to go very quickly past sb/sth急速通过； 飞驰； 飞逝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The days just flashed by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 日子转眼就过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She watched the scenery flash past the train window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看着景色从火车窗外飞掠而过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
flatten	<h3>flatten<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flatten sth/yourself a'gainst/ 'on sb/sth </b><br>to press your body or part of your body on or against sb/sth﹙把身体或身体部位﹚紧贴…，平贴…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She flattened her nose and lips against the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把鼻子和嘴唇紧贴着窗户。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I flattened myself against the wall to let them pass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我身体紧靠着墙让他们通过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flatten 'out </b><br>if a road, an area of land, etc. <b>flattens out</b>, it gradually becomes flat﹙道路、土地等﹚ 逐渐变平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After Oxford the countryside flattens out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了牛津以远乡村逐渐平坦。</font><br>to stop growing or going up停止增长﹙或上升﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sales have flattened out in the last few years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过去几年销售额已逐渐停止增长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flatten sth 'out </b><br>to make sth completely flat使变平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She flattened out the crumpled letter on the desk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在写字台上把皱巴巴的信展平。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
flesh	<h3>flesh<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,flesh sth 'out (with sth)</b><br>to add more details or information to an argument, an idea, a drawing,etc.﹙以细节或信息﹚充实论据﹙或构思、图像等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to <b>flesh out the bones</b> of your idea a bit more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要进一步充实一下你的思想骨架。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They must be prepared to flesh out their strategy with some details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们必须准备好为策略增加一些细节。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

strongly﹙想法或记忆﹚突然涌现在脑海，涌上心头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly all my fears <b>came flooding back</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp fly	<h3>fly<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fly a'round; ,fly a'round sth (<i>also</i> ,fly a'bout,,fly a'bout sth <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>(<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) if a story or a piece of news is <b>flying around</b>, it is being talked about by a lot of people and passed from one person to another﹙传闻或消息﹚传播，扩散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stories about his past are flying around among the students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的过去在学生们中间传播开来。</font><br><i><font <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fly at sb </b><br>(of a person or an animal 人或动物) to attack sb suddenly and violently扑向； 猛烈攻击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She flew at him, hitting and kicking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她扑上前去对他拳打脚踢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fly 'by/ 'past </b><br>when time <b>flies by/past</b>, it seems to pass very quickly﹙ 时间﹚ 飞逝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My three years at college flew by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在大学的三年一晃就过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you have lots of things to do, time just flies past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有很多事情要做时，就觉得时间过得飞快。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>time,days,hours,etc.</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was so much to do the time just flew.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要做的事情很多，可时间过得飞快。</font><br>when miles, etc. <b>fly by/past</b>, a journey by car, bus, train or bicycle seems to pass very quickly﹙ 旅程﹚ 过得飞快:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the miles flew past and we got closer and closer to the sea, the kids got more and more excited.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅程飞快，我们越来越接近大海，孩子们越来越兴奋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp fob	<h3>fob<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fob sb 'off (with sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to try to make sb stop asking questions or complaining by giving them answers or excuses that are not true﹙用不实之词﹚搪塞，欺骗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t try to fob me off with excuses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 休想找藉口骗我。</font><br>to give sb sth that is different from or not as good as what they want﹙ 把劣质的或不想要的商品﹚ 骗售给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We thought we’d been fobbed off with inferior goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们以为对方向我们骗售劣质货物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>palm sb off (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fob sth 'off on/onto sb <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to trick sb into accepting sth that you do not want or sth that is not genuine﹙把不想要的商品或假货﹚骗售给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to fob all her junk off onto me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她设法向我骗售她的所有旧货。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n

fold	<h3>fold<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold a'way/ 'down; ,fold sth a'way/ 'down </b><br>to be able to be bent or arranged into a smaller or flatter shape that you can store or carry more easily; to bend or arrange sth in this way摺小，叠平﹙以便贮存或携带﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bed can fold away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张床可以摺叠收起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can fold the table away to make more room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以把桌子摺叠起来腾出空间。</font><br>[NOTE]If you want to talk about a newspaper, a piece of paper, etc. use <b>fold up</b> .摺叠报纸或纸张等用<b>fold up</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'foldaway (<i>also </i>'fold-down,'fold-up) <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that can be folded so that you can carry it or store it more easily摺叠式的； 可摺叠的<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold sth a'way </b><br>to fold sth and put it away将﹙ 某物﹚ 摺叠 收起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She folded the newspaper away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把报纸叠起收好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold sth 'back, 'over, 'down, etc. </b><br>to bend sth back, over, down, etc. so that one part of it lies flat on another摺叠；对摺:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He folded the corner of the page over to mark his place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摺起书页一角作记号。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold 'down; ,fold sth 'down =FOLD AWAY/DOWN,FOLD STH AWAY/DOWN</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold sth 'into sth; ,fold sth 'in </b><br>(in cooking 烹饪) to mix one substance gently with another,usually with a spoon﹙用勺子等﹚把…调入…，拌入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gently fold the flour into the mixture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轻轻地把麵粉调拌进这一混合物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fold in two egg whites.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 调入两个鸡蛋的蛋白。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'fold A in B;'fold B round/over A </b><br>to wrap sb/sth in sth包；裹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gently folded the baby in a blanket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她轻轻地把婴儿裹在毯子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She folded a blanket round the baby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用毯子把婴儿裹了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>folded</b> her <b>in his arms</b> }(= he put his arms around her)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他搂抱着她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fold 'up; follow	<h3>follow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow 'on </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to continue or result from sth in a natural or logical way是…的必然结果；因… 而起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listen carefully to the answer and make sure that your next question follows on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 仔细听答案，并一定要据此回答下一个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Following on from what Jill has said, I’d like to talk about the future of the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想借吉尔的话题谈谈公司的前景。</font><br>to leave a place after sb else and meet them later追随； 跟上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You go now. I’ll follow on later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在走。我随后会追上的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'follow-on <i>n </i>(<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>something that continues or results from sth; the action of following on from sth后续事物；结果；后续工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie ‘Arthur 2’ was a successful follow-on to ‘Arthur’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影《阿瑟之二》是《阿瑟》的一部成功的续集。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp follow-on treatment/talks </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 后续治疗/会谈</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a follow-on call </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随后打的电话</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow 'through <i>(sport </i>)</b><br>to complete a stroke in tennis, golf, etc. by continuing to move the club,etc. after you have hit the ball﹙击球后球拍、球棒等﹚完成顺势动作<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow-'through (<i>also </i>'follow-through <i>especially AmE</i>) <i>n</i> (<i>sport</i>)</b><br>(in tennis, golf, etc.网球、高尔夫球等) the final part of a stroke after the ball has been hit﹙击球后的﹚随球动作，顺势动作<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FOLLOW-THROUGH at FOLLOW THROUGH (WITH STH),FOLLOW STH THROUGH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow 'through, ,follow sth 'through </b><br>to complete sth you have begun or already done把…进行到底；完成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The store did not follow through with the prosecution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店中途撤回了起诉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never follows things through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做事从不坚持到底。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow-'through <i>n </i></b><br>the actions that sb takes to complete or continue sth后期工作；后续行动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your follow-through on the project was not very satisfactory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在这个项目上所做的后续工作不太令人满意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FOLLOW-THROUGH at FOLLOW THROUGH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,follow 'up; ,follow sth 'up </b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to take further action about sth对…采取进一步行动；跟进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should follow your letter up with a phone call }(= you should write first and then telephone)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你写信后还应该打电话。</font><br>to find out more about sth sb has told you or suggested to you追查；探究:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are following up all the leads.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方正沿着所有线索继续追查。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s worth following up his idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 值得顺着他的想法继续探讨。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>lead,idea,complaint,matter</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>investigate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'follow-up (to sth) <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] something that continues sth后续事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The survey is a follow-up to the questionnaire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个调查是问卷的后续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp follow-up treatment/studies </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 继续治疗；追捬研究</font><br>\n
fool	<h3>fool<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fool a'round </b><br><i>(BrE also </i><b>,fool a'bout</b>) (<b>with sth</b> )to waste time or behave in a silly way闲耍；虚度光阴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop fooling about with that knife! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别瞎摆弄那把刀子！</font><br>(<b>with sb</b>) (<i>especially AmE</i>) to have a casual sexual relationship with another person’s partner or with sb who is not your partner﹙和某人﹚乱搞男女关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been fooling around with other women.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一直和别的女人鬼混。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) if two people <b>fool around</b>,they kiss and touch each other in a sexual way（两人）亲吻抚摸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were fooling around on the couch when my dad walked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在沙发上拥抱亲吻时我爸爸走了进来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
force	<h3>force<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,force 'back sth; ,force it/them 'back </b><br>to try very hard not to show an emotion强忍﹙不表露情感﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp pronoun comes between the verb and <b>back</b> .名词必须放在<b>back</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>back</b> 之间。<br><b>Force back sth</b> is not used in the passive.<b>force back sth</b>不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,force sth 'down </b><br>to make yourself eat or drink sth when you do not want to勉强咽下﹙食物或饮料﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She forced down her breakfast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她勉强吃下早餐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'force sth on sb (<i>also</i> 'force sth me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不想接那钱，可她硬塞给我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Teachers feel that changes are being forced on them.</font></i><br><font (<i>also</i> 'force itself/themselves upon sb <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>if sth<b>forces itself on</b> you, you cannot avoid becoming aware of it十分明显；一目了然:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he read the letter, the truth forced itself on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他读信时发现真相跃然纸上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'force ITSELF/THEMSELVES ON SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'force yourself upon sb =FORCE YOURSELF ON SB</b><br>\n
forge	<h3>forge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,forge a'head </b><br>to move forward quickly迅速向前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He forged ahead, panting and breathless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他气喘吁吁地向前奔跑。</font><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to make progress quickly进步神速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is forging ahead with its plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司的计划正顺利进行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane’s language skills enabled her to forge ahead on the career ladder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简的语言能力使她能够迅速攀登事业阶梯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>press ahead/on (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
fork	<h3>fork<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fork 'out (for sth), ,fork sth 'out (for/on sth)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to pay a lot of money for sth, especially when you do not want to﹙尤指不情愿地﹚大量花钱，大把掏钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to fork out for a cab home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不得不多掏钱乘出租车回家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to fork out $30 for a cab home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不得不花30 元钱乘出租车回家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>shell out (for sth),shell sth out (for sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,fork sth 'over <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to pay for sth,especially when you do not want to﹙尤指不情愿地﹚ 支付， 出钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to fork over the $10 I owed her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只好把欠她的10 元钱还上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

get	<h3>get<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]In spoken American English, the past participle<b>gotten</b> is almost always used.美国英语口语中，过去分词几乎都用<b>gotten</b> 。<br><i>(BrE also </i><b>,get a'round</b>) if sb who isold or ill <b>gets about</b>, they are able to move fromplace to place without difficulty﹙老年人或病人﹚各处走动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gets about with the help of a stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拄着拐棍四处走动。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) =GET AROUND<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=GET behave as ifyou are better than other people自以为了不起；自高自大；自视甚高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been getting a bit above herself since winning that award.</font></i><br><font sb传达，传递信息﹙给某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The message is finally getting across to the public.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一信息终于传达给了公众。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'cross; ,get a'cross sth </b><br>to move fromone side of a river, a bridge, a street, etc. to theother通过，穿过﹙河、桥、街道等﹚:<br><i><font <i>less frequent</i>)(&b{to sb</b> ) }<br>to communicate sth to sb; to make sth clear to sb﹙向某人﹚传达，把…讲清楚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s not very good at getting his ideas across to the class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不太会讲课。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll have to think of new ways of getting your message across [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth a'cross sth (<i>also</i> ,get sb/sth 'over sth) </b><br>to move sb/sth, or to help sb/sth move, from one side of sth such as a road, river, bridge, wall,etc. to the other把﹙某人或某物﹚送过﹙马路、河、桥、墙等﹚；使﹙某人或某物﹚通过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve got to get supplies across the border somehow.</font></i><br><font 比利费劲地鞭策矮马跳过那些障碍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'after sb <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to keep asking or telling sb to do sth, often in an annoying way不断催促，敦促﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been getting after me to take a vacation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一直催着我休假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to get after Jack to clean his room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得一再催促杰克打扫他的房间。</font><br>to try to catch sb, especially after they have committed a crime追捕；追击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to be tougher on those who commit crime and get after drug users more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp successful in your life or your career走在﹙某人的﹚前面；领先；胜过﹙某人﹚；取得成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It isn’t easy to get ahead in the movie business.</font></i><br><font background or the details that they need to know first﹙ 讲话时未经充分说明﹚直奔正题，直接切入主题<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'long <i>(informal</i>)</b><br><i>(often used in the progressive tenses </i>常用于进行时) to leave a place离开；离去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s late. We’d better be getting along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不早了，我们最好离开吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One more coffee and then I must get along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我再喝一杯咖啡就必须走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GET ON 5<br>(<b>with sb/together</b>)=GET ON 1 <br>(<b>with sth</b>) =GET ON 4<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,get a'bout) </b><br><i>(informal</i>)to move from place to place; to go to lots of different places各处走动； 周游:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You certainly get around! Paris one minute, Bonn the next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你真是个大旅行家啊！一分钟在巴黎，下一分钟又到了波恩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can use my car to get around while she’s here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在这里逗留期间可以开我的车到各处转。</font><br>(of news, a piece of information, etc.消息、信息等) to become known by a lot of people传播；流传:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news of her resignation soon got around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她辞职的消息很快传开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Word soon got around that they were having an affair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很快人们就纷纷传说他们之间关系暧昧。</font><br>to have an active social life and be aware of what is happening积极参加社交活动；关心时事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time you got around more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你该多了解社会了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GET OUT 2 <br><i>(informal</i>,<i>disapproving</i>) to have sexual relationships with lots of different people和很多人有性关系；乱搞<br>=GET ABOUT 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'round; ,get a'round sth =GET ROUND,GET ROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'round sb <i>(especially AmE</i>)=GET ROUND SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,get a'bout sth, ,get 'round sth) </b><br>to move around a city, a country,etc.在﹙城市或乡村等﹚四处走动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s easy to get around Amsterdam on a bicycle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骑自行车转阿姆斯特丹很方便。</font><br>(of news, a piece of information,etc. 消息、信息等) to become known by a lot of people在…传播﹙或流传﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp News soon gets round the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消息很快在办公室传开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It didn’t take long for the rumour to get all around town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没过多久谣言就传遍了全镇。</font><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) =GET ROUND STH 3<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'round to sth; ,get a'round to doing sth =GET ROUND/AROUND TO STH,GET ROUND/AROUND TO DOING STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get at sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) to keep criticizing sb一再批评，不断指责，老是数落﹙某人﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam’s parents are always getting at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆的父母老是责备他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She feels she’s being got at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到自己总是受人数落。</font><br>to influence sb, especially illegally, for example by threatening them or offering money, in order to persuade them to say sth untrue or act in an unfair way﹙尤指非法地﹚影响某人；胁迫；贿赂；买通；威逼利诱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the witnesses had been got at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名证人被买通了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They even tried getting at the judge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们甚至试图给法官施加压力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get at sb/sth </b><br>to reach or obtain sb/sth; to find a way of entering a place, talking to sb, looking at sth, etc.接触某人/事物；取得﹙或通往﹚…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The files are locked up and I can’t get at them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 文件资料锁起来了，我取不到。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t get at my inheritance until I’m 21.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我满21岁时才能得到遗产。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put it in a place where it can be got at easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把它放在容易拿到的地方。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get at sth </b><br>to learn, discover or find out sth获悉；了解；查明；发现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve got to get at the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须查明真相。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>truth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>find sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp what are you, was he, etc. 'getting at? (<i>spoken</i>)<br>used to ask, often in an angry way, what sb is/was suggesting﹙气愤地问﹚你﹙或他等﹚这话是什么意思，你﹙或他等﹚用意何在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What exactly are you getting at? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到底是什么意思？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I see what you’re getting at, but I’m afraid I can’t help you with that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我明白你的意思，可我恐怕帮不上你这个忙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get a'way </b><br>to have a holiday/vacation度假；休假:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re hoping to get away for a few days at Easter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们期待着复活节出去休几天假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you manage to get away this year? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今年能出去度假吗？ </font><br>(<b>from sth/…</b>) to succeed in leaving a place﹙得以﹚离开，脱身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was midday before we finally managed to get away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到中午时分我们终于脱身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won’t be able to get away from the office before 7.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我7点钟之前无法离开办公室。</font><br>(<b>from sb/sth/…)</b> to escape from sb or a place摆脱﹙某人﹚；逃离﹙某地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thieves got away in a blue van.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼乘坐一辆蓝色客货车逃跑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re not getting away from me so easily! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决不会这么轻易放过你的！</font><br><b>,get a'way (with you)</b>! <i>(BrE</i>, <i>spoken, becoming old-fashioned</i>) used to show that you find it difficult to believe what sb has just said﹙表示某人的话难以置信﹚胡扯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get away! You could never run that far! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不可能！你决不会跑那么远的！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘I’m going to live in China.’ ‘Get away with you!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我要移居中国了。”“开玩笑吧！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'getaway <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.]<br>the act of leaving a place in a hurry, especially after committing a crime﹙尤指犯罪后的﹚逃跑，逃走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made a quick getaway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们迅速逃跑了。</font><br>a short holiday/vacation; a place for this短假； 假日休闲地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the popular island different way or talking about a different subject改变﹙做事方式﹚；转换﹙话题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The club should get away from its old-fashioned image and try to attract younger people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个俱乐部应该改变过时的形象以吸引年轻人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to get away from the subject of babies.</font></i><br><font can relax﹙到他处度短假﹚躲清净<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>there’s no getting a'way from sth;you can’t get a'way from sth </b><br>you have to admit that sth unpleasant is true不容否认，只好承认﹙不愉快的事实﹚:<br><i><font 他的失误导致全队输掉比赛这一事实是无法否认的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth a'way from sth </b><br>to remove sb/sth from somewhere从某处把…弄走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get that dog away from me! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把狗从我这儿赶走！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone was trying to get Angela away from the window.</font></i><br><font it携某物潜逃；偷走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thieves raided the bank and got away with ￡50 000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盗贼抢劫了银行并偷走了5万英镑。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get a'way with doing sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to do sth wrong and not be punished or criticized for it做﹙坏事﹚而未受惩罚﹙或批评﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t believe you cheated in the that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样侮辱我的人我决不会轻饶。</font><br>to receive a relatively light punishment只受到轻罚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For such a serious offence he was lucky to get away with a fine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他犯了如此大的罪而只交罚款了事，算是万幸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fine,warning</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'back </b><br>(<b>from/to sth/…</b>) to return, especially to your home返回；回去；回家:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time did you get back last night? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你昨晚什么时候回家的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We only got back from our trip yesterday.</font></i><br><font happening走开；退后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get back or I’ll shoot! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走开，不然我就开枪！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand back;back off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb 'back </b><br>to persuade sb to begin a romantic relationship with you again, after you have been apart for some sth/for doing sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) =GET BACK AT SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth 'back (to sth/…) </b><br>to take sb/sth back to a place after they have been away from it把…带回，把…送回﹙某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll get her back home before midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将在午夜之前把她送回家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'back </b><br>to obtain sth again after you have lost it, spent it, lent it to sb, etc.取回，重新获得﹙丢失或借出的东西等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s got her old job back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已恢复原职。</font><br><i><font 寻回﹙失窃的﹚皮夹机会不大。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp get your 'breath back (<i>BrE</i>)<br>to start breathing normally again after physical exercise﹙体育运动之后﹚恢复正常呼吸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a while to get my breath back after running for the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我追公共汽车之后过了好一会儿才缓过气来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) I haven’t had a moment to get my breath back (= I’ve been very busy) since we came back from Prague.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自从我们从布拉格回来之后，我忙得连喘息的时间都没有。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'back at sb (<i>also</i> ,get sb 'back) (&b{for sth/for doing him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是他因为我和他争论而报复我的方式。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll get her back for what she’s done.</font></i><br><font <b>,get back 'into sth</b><br>to start being interested or involved in a particular activity again再度对…产生兴趣；重新参与；重操旧业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’ll try to get back into journalism when the kids start school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们入学之后，她将重新干记者这行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How soon should I get back into serious them again by letter or by telephone以后再答覆﹙或回覆﹚某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave a message and I’ll get back to you as soon as I can.</font></i><br><font 订单给了他们就杳无音讯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'back to sth </b><br>to start doing or talking about sth again; to return to sth回到某事上:<br><i><font sb again,after you have been apart for some time﹙ 和某人﹚恢复恋爱关系，再续旧情:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack’s getting back with his ex-girlfriend.</font></i><br><font
