</b><br>to not go as fast as is necessary or as other people; to not produce sth at the right time落后；拖延；拖欠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once I get behind (with my work) it’s very hard to catch up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我﹙工作﹚ 一旦落后就很难赶上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re getting behind with the rent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们拖欠租金了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop behind,drop behind sb/sth;fall behind,fall behind sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get ahead</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get be'hind sb/sth </b><br>to move into a position behind sb/sth到…后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you get behind the tree, she won’t see you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你躲到树后面吧，她不会看见你的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seems to go mad when he gets behind the wheel of a car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他走到车子的方向盘前就好像发疯似的。</font><br>to reveal the person or thing responsible for starting or developing sth显露，揭示﹙背后的人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a programme that really gets behind the world of pop music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个节目彻底揭示了流行音乐界的幕后情况。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to support sb/sth and help them to succeed支持；扶持:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole town got behind him/the campaign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全镇的人都支持他/这场运动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get be'yond sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get 'past sth</b>) to move or advance further than a particular place超过， 超出﹙ 某处﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven’t been able to get beyond chapter one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还没能看完第一章呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When we got beyond York, it started to snow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们过了约克郡之后就开始下雪了。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get 'past sth</b>) to make progress so that you no longer do or are interested in a particular thing超出，超脱﹙某事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hasn’t she got beyond/past the stage of sucking her thumb yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她还没有超过吮吸拇指阶段吗？</font><br>to become more than sth多出；多于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What if our losses get beyond 10%?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我们亏损超过10% 怎么办？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp get beyond a 'joke <br>to become annoying and no longer acceptable变得令人恼火；变得无法接受﹙或过分﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This rain is getting beyond a joke. Let’s go inside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这雨越来越烦人了。我们进屋吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'by </b><br>to manage to live or do a particular thing using the money, knowledge, equipment, etc.that you have﹙靠…﹚维持生计，设法过活，勉强应付:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How does she get by on such a small salary? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她靠这点微薄的工资怎么过活？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Are you earning more money now?’ ‘I get by.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你现在赚钱多一些了吗？”“够煳口吧。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s got a deadline to meet, so she’s getting by on virtually no sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了不超过期限，她几乎没怎么睡觉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t know a lot of Italian, but I can get by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我意大利语会得不多，但能勉强应付。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To begin with, you can get by with a few simple tools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首先，你可以将就着用几个简单的工具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Getting by isn’t good enough for me. I want to be successful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不满足于勉强过得去。我想有所成就。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'by; ,get 'by sb/sth =GET PAST,GET PAST SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'down</b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to move from a higher position to a lower one﹙从…﹚下来，下去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver got down from his truck to help me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 司机从卡车上下来帮我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get up </b><br>to bend downwards from a standing position and sit, kneel or lie on the ground坐下，跪下，躺下﹙在地上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children got down on their hands and knees and pretended to be lions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们四肢着地扮成狮子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s going to shoot! Get down! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要开枪了！趴下！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get up </b><br>(<b>to sth/…</b>) to visit or arrive at a place further south in the country than the place where you live去﹙或到达﹚一国的南部； 南下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long did it take you to get down here? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你南下到这里用了多长时间？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get up </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) (of children 儿童) to leave the table after a meal饭后离开餐桌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please may I get down (from the table)? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以离开﹙餐桌﹚吗？</font><br>(<b>to sth</b>) (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) to go to a place去﹙某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll get down there straight away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我马上就去那里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got five minutes to get down to the store.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有五分钟的时间到商店。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to relax and enjoy yourself,especially in a very lively way轻松快活；娱乐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s get down and party! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们放开狂欢吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'down; ,get 'down sth </b><br>to move from a higher place to a lower one, for example using stairs, a rope, a ladder, etc.﹙用阶梯、绳索、梯子等﹚下来，下去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you doing on the table? Get down now! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在餐桌上做什么呢？马上下来！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you get down the hill without any difficulty? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你下山顺利吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How does water get down the back of the sink? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水如何从洗涤池后面流下去呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get up,get up sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb 'down <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb feel sad or depressed使悲伤；使沮丧；使忧郁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This weather is really getting me down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这天气实在让我觉得压抑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let it get you down too much.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别太介意这事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>depress sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth 'down </b><br>(<b>to sth/…</b>) to send or move sb/sth to a place, often a place further south in a country将…派往﹙或运送到﹚﹙常指一国的南部﹚；派﹙或运送﹚…南下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get somebody down here straight away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马上派人南下这里来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll need to get the boat down to the south coast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得把船开到南海岸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get sb/sth up</b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to move sb/sth from a higher position to a lower one把﹙某人﹚带下来；将﹙某物﹚拿下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get a jar down from the shelf for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你帮我从搁板上拿个罐子下来好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got the baby down from the high chair and put her on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从高脚椅上把孩子抱下来放在地板上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get your head down! }(= bend so that your head is low)&b{ He’s going to shoot! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 低下头！他要开枪了！</font><br> In informal spoken language<b>get sb down sth</b> and, less often, <b>get sb sth down</b>, are also used.非正式口语也说<b>get sb down sth</b> ， 有时说<b>get sb sth down</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get me down that book? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我把那本书拿下来吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get me that book down?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我把那本书拿下来吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'down </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get sth 'down sb/you</b> <i>informal</i>) to swallow sth, usually with difficulty﹙勉强﹚吞下，咽下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The medicine was so horrible I could hardly get it down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药苦极了，我简直咽不下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get this tea down you, then you’ll feel better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这杯茶喝下去你就会感觉好点的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>swallow sth </b><br>to make a note of or record sth记录；记下；写下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get it down in writing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把它写下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just managed to get down the car’s registration number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我勉强记下了汽车的牌照号码。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you get his name and telephone number down? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你记下他的名字和电话号码了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>note sth down;take sth down;write sth down </b><br>to reduce sth, especially the cost or price of sth减少，降低﹙尤指成本或价格﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we bargain, we may be able to get the price down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我们议价，就有可能把价格压下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How can I get my blood pressure down? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我如何能把血压降下来？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bring sth down;lower sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth 'down sth </b><br>to manage to move sb/sth from a higher place to a lower one, for example using stairs, a rope, a ladder, etc.﹙用阶梯、绳索、梯子等﹚设法把…弄下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t get the bookcase down the stairs on my own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我自己没法把书柜搬下楼梯去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'down sb/you <i>(informal</i>)=GET STH DOWN 1</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'down on sb/sth (for sth) (<i>AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>) </b><br>to think that sb/sth is wrong and to criticize them认为… 错误而加以指责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always getting down on me for coming in late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是因我迟到而责骂我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s easy to get down on kids from day to day and forget their good points.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很容易日复一日地数落孩子而忘记他们的优点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'down to sth; ,get 'down to doing sth </b><br>to begin to do sth; to give serious attention to sth开始做某事；开始认真注意﹙或对待﹚某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s get down to business straight away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们马上开始干正事吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Isn’t it about time you got down to work? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是该开始工作了？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Read the text all the way through before you get down to translating it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 先把原文通读一遍，然后再着手翻译。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,work</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'in; ,get 'into sth </b><br>to arrive at a place到达:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When do you normally get in }(= arrive home)&b{ from work? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一般什么时间下班回到家？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time do you get into work in the morning?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你上午什么时间上班？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train got in late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车晚点到达。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time does your flight get into Heathrow? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的航班什么时候到达希思罗机场？ </font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get 'in sth</b> <i>informal</i>) to succeed in entering a place, especially a building进入，进去﹙尤指建筑物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did the burglars get in?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盗贼是如何进来的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They broke a window to get into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们打破一扇窗闯进了房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t get in }(= to a concert, party, etc.)&b{ without a ticket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 无票不得入场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maybe we can get in the window? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 也许我们可以从窗户爬进去？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get out,get out of sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get 'in sth</b>) to enter or go inside sth进去，进入﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran to the car, got in and drove off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跑到汽车旁，钻到里面开走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw Jan getting into a cab.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见简进了一辆出租车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hurry up and <b>get into bed</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点上床。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get in the car! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上车！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He needs help getting in the bath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他需要有人扶着进浴缸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Luckily the poison hasn’t got into her bloodstream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幸运的是毒素没有进入她的血液。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smell of smoke got into all my clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟味渗入了我所有的衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get out,get out of sth </b><br>to be elected to a political position当选:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They need 326 seats to get in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们需要326个席位才能当选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Republican candidate got in with a small majority.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 共和党候选人以微弱多数当选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did she first get into Parliament? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她何时第一次当选为下议院议员的？</font><br>to gain a place at a school, college, university,etc.获得学校录取；被接受入学:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s applied for Cambridge, but doesn’t know if she’ll get in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她申请了剑桥大学，但不知道能否被录取。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to get into Harvard, but I wasn’t accepted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我试图进哈佛大学，但不获接收。</font><br>(<i>also </i><b>,get 'in sth</b> <i>informal</i>) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>sport</i>) to be chosen as a member of a sports team入选﹙为队员﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He played well at the trials for the football team and got in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在选拔赛中表现良好，因此入选足球队。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll never get into the senior side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我永远进不了成年队。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you get in the team?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你入选这个队了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GET INTO STH;GET INTO STH,GET SB/YOURSELF INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'in sth =GET IN,GET INTO STH 2,3,6</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb 'in</b><br>to call sb to your home, etc. to do a job for you请某人来家里做事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll have to get a plumber in to mend the pipe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得找个管子工来修理管子。</font><br>to attract a large audience吸引﹙大批观众﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A pantomime usually gets the crowds in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 童话剧通常能吸引大批观众。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull sb in </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get sb 'into sth</b>) to fit sb in a small place让人进入﹙狭小空间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get another person in }(= in a car, for example)&b{? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们能再挤进一个人吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fit sb/sth in,fit sb/sth into sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get sb 'into sth</b>) to make it possible for sb to get into a place, attend an event,etc.使能进入﹙某处﹚；使能参加﹙活动等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I come to the stage door, can you get me in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我到舞台侧门，你能让我进去吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'in </b><br>to collect or gather sth and bring it inside a place收集； 收割:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you get in the washing when it started raining? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨下起来时你把晾出去的衣服收进来了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get the bags in from the car? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把车上的那些袋子拿进来好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We worked hard all week to get the corn in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们为收穫谷物苦干了整整一星期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bring sth in </b><br>to buy a supply of sth购买；买进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you got your coal in for the winter yet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你买好了过冬的煤了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you be getting any more of these dresses in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们还进这些连衣裙吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>informal</i>) Who’s going to get the beers in }(= buy beer for everybody)&b{? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁来为大家买啤酒？ </font><br>to manage to do, have, etc. sth, although there is not much time﹙挤时间﹚设法做某事﹙或得到某物等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can only get in an hour’s piano practice a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每天只能拿出一小时练钢琴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ought to get in another meeting before the end of the month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 月底之前我们应该争取再开一次会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fit sth in </b><br>to manage to say sth,usually when there are lots of people talking﹙说话人很多时﹚争取发言:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She talks so much that it’s impossible to get a word in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说起话来滔滔不绝，让人一句话都插不进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Excuse me’, I eventually got in, ‘I think I can help you.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “对不起，”我最终插进来，“我想我可以帮你。” </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>word </b><br>to manage to finish a piece of work and give it to sb in authority, for example your teacher设法交出﹙完成的工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you manage to get your project in on time?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你争取按时完成专题研究了吗？</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get sth 'into sth</b>) to fit sth in a small place把某物放进﹙ 狭窄空间﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How are we going to get everything in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们怎样把所有的东西放进去呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fit sth in,fit sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp (not) get a word in 'edgeways (<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE</i>(not)get a word in 'edgewise) <br>to (not) be able to say anything because sb else is talking too much能﹙或无法﹚插话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When those two get together, you can’t get a word in edgeways.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他俩凑到一块儿，就没你说话的份儿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'in on sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become involved or take part in an activity参加﹙活动﹚；参与:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did she manage to get in on the deal? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她如何争取参与这项交易的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s hoping to get in on any discussions about the new project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他盼望着参加有关新计划的任何讨论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  BE IN ON STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp get ,in on the 'act (<i>informal</i>) <br>to become involved in an activity that sb else has started,especially to get sth for yourself﹙尤指为私利﹚参与，插一手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Since the success of the first fourwheel drives, other companies are getting in on the act too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自从第一代四轮驱动汽车成功之后，其他公司也纷纷效仿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'in with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to try to become friendly with sb, especially in order to gain an advantage for yourself﹙尤指为捞取好处与某人﹚成为朋友，拉关系，套近乎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you noticed how he’s trying to get in with the boss? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你注意到他在如何竭力讨好老板了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got in with a bad crowd at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在学校结交了一帮坏人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'into sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp what has got into sb? advertising?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能指点我如何涉足广告业吗？</font><br><i>(also</i><b>'get into doing sth</b>) to become involved in an activity; to start into fights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆动不动就打架。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you sure you know what you’re getting into? </font></i><br><font SB/YOURSELF INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'into sth; ,get sb/yourself 'into sth </b><br>to reach a particular state or condition, especially a bad or unpleasant one; to make sb do this﹙令别人或自己﹚处于…局面，陷入…境地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jerry was always getting into trouble as a boy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你最后是什么时候让他入睡的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>baby </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,get sb 'off sth</b>) to help sb to escape punishment使免受处罚；使逃脱惩罚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s relying on clever lawyers to get her off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她指望着请位聪明的律师使她免受惩罚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They managed to get him off the charge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们设法使他避过了指控。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'off </b><br>to send sth by post/mail邮寄某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must get these letters off tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚必须把这些信件寄出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>send sth off (to sb) </b><br>to remove sth from sth; to manage to remove sth from sth﹙设法从…上﹚取掉某物，拿掉某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get your coat off and come and sit down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把大衣脱了，过来坐下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her finger was so swollen that she couldn’t get her ring off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的手指肿胀得摘不掉戒指。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>clothes,coat</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sth off </b><br>to have permission from your employer not to go to work for a particular period of time得到许可﹙某段时间﹚不上班；请到假:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you get some time off next week? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你和你的老板合得来吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m glad you get on so well with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴你和她相处得如此融洽。</font><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to start an activity or continue doing sth, especially after an interruption开始… ； ﹙ 尤指中断后﹚继续…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be quiet and get on with your dinner! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安静下来，继续吃你的饭！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s get on with the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们继续开会吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got on with the job quietly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她默不作声地开始工作了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’re going to tell us, just get on with it! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果想告诉我们，就说出来吧！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d love to talk but I must get on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我倒想聊聊，可我必须继续工作了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All I want is to get on with my life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只想继续生活。</font><br>(<b>in sth</b>) to be successful in your career﹙事业上﹚获得成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s keen to get on in her career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很想干一番事业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Having contacts is the only way to get on in the art world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与有影响的人士交往是在艺术界取得成功的唯一途径。</font><br>(<i>also </i><b>,get a'long</b>) (<b>with sth</b> ) used to talk about how well sb is doing a task, managing a situation,etc.﹙在某方面或…上﹚进展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How’s Jan getting on at college? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简在大学怎么样？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you getting on alright with your project? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的项目进展顺利吧？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can get along without him easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有他我也能应付自如。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not getting on very fast with this job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这项工作进展得不太快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you get on in your exams? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你考试怎么样？</font><br><i>(often used in the progressive tenses</i>常用于进行时) to leave a place, because you have lots to do出发﹙因要做的事情很多﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time we were getting on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们该动身了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> GET ALONG 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be getting 'on <br>(of a person人) to be becoming old年事渐高<br>(of time时间) to be becoming late渐晚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The time’s getting on — we ought to be going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时候不早了──我们该动身了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,getting 'on for…</b><br>to be near a particular time, age or number接近，靠近﹙某时刻、年龄或数目﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It must be getting on for midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定快到午夜了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think he’s getting on for 40.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想他将近40 岁了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,getting 'on towards/toward…(<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to be near a particular time,especially a time that is late接近﹙尤指较晚的时刻﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It must be getting on toward midnight by now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在一定快到午夜了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'on; ,get 'on sth</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,get 'onto sth</b>) to get into a bus, plane, train, etc.乘上，登上﹙公共汽车、飞机、火车等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did he manage to get on the wrong plane? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怎么会搭错了飞机？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did Jack manage to get on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克最后上了车吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did anyone see Sue getting onto the bus? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有没有人看见休上公共汽车？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>plane,bus,train</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>board,board sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>get off, get off sth</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,get 'onto sth</b>) to move your body so that you are standing, sitting or lying on sth站﹙或坐、躺﹚到…上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got on his bike and rode off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他骑上自行车走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did the rabbit get onto the table? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那块泥是如何掉到地毯上的？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be careful that the oil doesn’t get onto your clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小心别把油蹭到衣服上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get on sth;'get sb on sth </b><br>used especially in offices to mean to make telephone calls, or to contact sb by phone﹙在办公室﹚打电话，打电话与某人联系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll get on the phone and find out exactly what he wants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来打个电话，问问他到底想要什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t get him on the phone all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打了一天电话都找不到他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I get her on the line? driving fast cars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰觉得开快车很刺激。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pleasure,enjoyment</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'over (<i>also</i> ,get yourself 'over <i>informal</i>)[+adv/prep] </b><br>to go to a place or to arrive somewhere去，到达﹙某地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much will it cost you to get over to Ireland? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到爱尔兰去要花多少钱？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d better get over there right now to see her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我最好立刻到那里去见她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get yourself over there now and tell him how you feel.</font></i><br><font happiness, etc. after the end of a relationship with sb, an illness, a shock, etc.从断绝关系﹙或疾病、震惊等﹚中恢复过来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never really got over Jennifer }(= when their </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>overcome sth </b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think the problem can be got over without too much difficulty.</font></i><br><font sth surprising or unexpected really did happen or is true相信﹙令人吃惊或意外的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t get over }(= I’m very surprised or shocked by)&b{ how much she’s changed! <b>,get sb 'over </b><br>[+adv/prep] to arrange for sb to go or come to a place安排某人来﹙或去某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get a reporter over here straight away! </font></i><br><font 我们今晚请我父母来吃饭好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'over </b><br>(<b>to sb</b>) =GET STH ACROSS (TO SB)<br><i>(informal</i>) to complete sth necessary and usually unpleasant完成，结束﹙令人不快但免不了的事﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can we just get this test over? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就把这次考试考完好吗？</font><br><i><font <b>,get yourself 'over </b><br>[+adv/prep] =GET OVER<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth 'over sth =GET SB/STH ACROSS STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sth 'over sth </b><br>to make sth reach a particular state or condition使达到某状态﹙或状况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you manage to get chocolate all over your clean T-shirt? </font></i><br><font frequent</i>) </b><br>to manage to move past sb/sth设法通过；设法过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to get past them and run for the door.</font></i><br><font <b>,get 'round sb (<i>also</i> &b{,get a'round sb</b> <i>especially AmE</i>)}<br>to persuade sb to let you do or have sth, or to do what you want, often by being nice to them﹙用讨好卖乖的手段﹚说服某人，让某人依顺:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll try and get round my dad tonight and persuade him to give us a lift.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的头发乱得梳不通。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Get sth through </b>and <b>get sth through sth</b> are not used in the passive. <b>get sth through</b>和<b>get sth through sth</b> 不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GET THROUGH,GET THROUGH STH 3<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get to sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to begin to annoy, anger,upset or affect sb, even though they try not to let it令某人忍无可忍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His constant nagging is beginning to get to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的纠缠不休开始使她厌烦了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let her get to you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让她激怒你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seeing him so sad really got to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看见他如此伤心，我实在于心不忍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'get to sth </b><br>to arrive at a place or reach a particular situation, age, time, etc.到达， 抵达﹙ 某地﹚；到﹙某状况、年龄、时间等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train gets to London at 6 o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车6点钟到伦敦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t get to bed until after midnight last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨晚午夜之后才上床的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s got to the stage/point where I don’t want to go home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经到了不想回家的地步了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you get to my age you’re a bit more relaxed about things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等你到了我这个年纪，就会不太介意各种事情了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It got to 4 o’clock and she still hadn’t arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已经4点钟了，可她还没来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wonder <b>where</b> Anthony’s got to }(= where he is/what he is sth </b><br>to reach the point where you do sth; to begin to do sth做起﹙某事﹚来；开始做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got to thinking that perhaps she wouldn’t come after all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始琢磨着也许她根本不会来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get to'gether (with sb) </b><br>to meet with sb for social purposes or to discuss or organize sth﹙ 与某人﹚ 碰头， 会面； 聚集:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must get together for a drink some time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 资方应与工会一起开个会讨论他们的分歧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Local residents have got together and started a petition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp together</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get sb/sth to'gether</b><br>to bring people or things together in one place召集；聚集；收集；汇集:<br><i><font </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到星期五能把钱收齐吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think you can get together a proposal by next week? </font></i><br><font 我根本没开始收拾旅行用品呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp get your 'act together (<i>informal</i>)<br>to become properly organized in order to be able to deal with or achieve <b>get it to'gether (with sb)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to start a romantic or sexual relationship with sb﹙和某人﹚开始谈恋爱，发生性关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t know Bill and Gina had got 快起床，你这懒骨头！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get 'up; ,get 'up sth </b><br>to climb to the top of sth such as a hill, steps, etc.爬上，登上﹙…的顶部﹚ :<br><i><font
