ginger	<h3>ginger<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ginger sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to make sb/sth more active, interesting or exciting使有活力；使活跃；使兴奋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some dancing would ginger up the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跳跳舞可以使聚会活跃起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They need some excitement to ginger them up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 需要来点刺激让他们打起精神。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
give	<h3>give<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sb a'way </b><br>(in a marriage ceremony在婚礼上) to lead the woman who is getting married to the man she is going to marry and formally allow her to marry him将新娘交给新郎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her father gave her away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她父亲把她交给新郎。</font><br>(<i>BrE</i>) to give a baby or a child to another person to take care of as their own child把﹙ 婴儿或孩子﹚送人；把…给别人抚养:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had never understood why her mother had given her away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一直不理解母亲为什么把她送给了别人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GIVE SB UP 2 <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sb/sth/yourself a'way </b><br>to do or say sth that shows sth about sb/sth/yourself that was a secret泄露；透露；泄密；吐露:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was her eyes that gave her away }(= showed how she really felt)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是她的眼睛流露出她的真实感受。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never gives very much away about himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从不怎么透露自己的身分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had given away state secrets to the enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把国家机密泄露给了敌人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found I could tell lies confidently without giving myself away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发现自己能面不改色心不跳地说谎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>nothing,anything,little</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>betray sb/sth/yourself <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,give the 'game away <br>to tell a secret, especially by accident; to show sth that has been hidden不慎泄露；露馅；露马脚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to give the game away by telling you how the movie ends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想提前把电影的结尾透露给你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'giveaway <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) something that makes you guess the real truth about sth使真相暴露的事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he was French, but his accent was <b>a dead giveaway</b> ! }(= showed clearly that he was not French)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他是法国人，可他的口音使他彻底露馅了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GIVEAWAY at GIVE STH AWAY <br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth a'way </b><br>to give sth to sb as a gift把某物送出去﹙或捐出去﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He decided to give most of his money away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定把他的大部份钱捐出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have 200 tickets to give away free to our viewers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们有200 张票免费赠送给我们的电视观众。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'giveaway <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>something that a company gives free, usually with a product for sale,to persuade people to buy it﹙公司为推销产品搭送的﹚随赠品<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GIVEAWAY at GIVE SB/STH/YOURSELF AWAY<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'give-away <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] (<i>informal</i>)(of prices价格) very low低廉的<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sb 'back (to sb) </b><br>to return a child to its parents把孩子交还﹙给父母﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We love our grandchildren dearly, but we are happy to give them back at the end of the day! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们疼爱孙子孙女，但最终还是乐意把他们送回父母身边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth 'back (to sb) </b><br>to return sth to its owner还，归还，送回﹙给…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t have it. Give it back! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能留着它。送回去！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you given back the money you borrowed from your father? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把借你父亲的钱还了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you lend me $20? I’ll give it back to you later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能借我20 元吗？我以后还你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new law gives some power back to the people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新法规返还了一些权力给人民。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The operation gave him back the use of his legs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手术使他的双腿恢复了功能。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth back (to sb);return sth (to sb)(<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>In informal language <b>give sb back sth</b> and, less often, <b>give sb sth back</b> are also used.非正式语言也说<b>give sb back sth</b> ，有时说<b>give sb sth back</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you give me back my pen? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把笔还给我好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you give me my pen back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把笔还给我好吗？</font><br>In very informal spoken English, you can also say非正式口语也可以说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll give you it back tomorrow.我明天把它还给你。or或I’ll give it you back tomorrow.我明天把它还给你。</font></i><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'give sth for sth </b><br>to pay or give a particular amount to have or do sth以…支付﹙或换取﹚… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much did you give for the car? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你买这辆车花了多少钱？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d give anything for a cold beer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿意拿任何东西换瓶冰镇啤酒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'in (to sb/sth) </b><br>to accept that you have been defeated or persuaded by sb﹙ 向… ﹚ 屈服，认输:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I give in — you’ll have to tell me the answer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我输了─你得告诉我答案。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eventually I gave in to temptation and had an ice cream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我终于经不起诱惑吃了冰激凌。</font><br>to finally agree to do sth that you do not want to do﹙向…﹚低头，作出让步； 屈从… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We mustn’t give in to terrorist demands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决不能对恐怖分子的要求让步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gives in to the children all the time to avoid arguments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一直让着孩子们，免得争吵。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>hold out (against sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth 'in (to sb) </b><br>to hand sth to sb in authority,for example a teacher呈上；交上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please give your test in (to the teacher) when you’ve finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卷子做完之后请交上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth in (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'give of sth;'give of yourself <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to give your time or money willingly to help other people without expecting them to do anything for you贡献时间﹙或钱财等﹚；奉献；献身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always willing to give of her time to help the homeless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她随时愿意为帮助无家的人奉献自己的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher encourages all the children to <b>give of their best</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师鼓励所有的孩子把最好的贡献出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>time,best</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'off sth; ,give it/them 'off </b><br>to produce sth such as heat, light, smoke, etc.发出，放出﹙热、光、烟等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Burning apple wood gives off a pleasing smell.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燃烧苹果木散发出芬芳气味。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>smell,aroma,light,gas</b><br>to give a particular impression by the way you look or behave散发出﹙气质等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave off an air of confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她表现得很自信。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>off</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>off</b> .名词必须放在<b>off</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>off</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'give onto sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>if a door, a window, etc.<b>gives onto</b> sth, it has a view of it or leads directly to it﹙门、窗等﹚朝向…，通往…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp French windows give onto a balcony.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法国落地式长窗通向阳台。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'out </b><br>to come to an end; to be used up用完；耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My patience finally gave out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我终于忍无可忍了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were fine until the batteries in the torch gave out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手电筒里的电池耗完之前我们还好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run out </b><br>if an engine, a machine,etc. <b>gives out</b>, it stops working, especially because it is old or damaged﹙机器等常因废旧而﹚停止运行，停止运转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the plane’s engines gave out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机的一个发动机报废了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) His heart gave out just before his eightieth birthday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就在他的八十岁大寿到来之前，他的心脏停止了跳动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth 'out </b><br>to hand sth to a lot of people分发； 散发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher gave out the exam papers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师分发了试卷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll write up the report and give it out to the whole department.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会写出报告并分发给全部门的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cards,leaflets</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth out (to sb)</b><br>In informal spoken language <b>give sb out sth</b> is also used.非正式口语也说<b>give sb out sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll give you out the cards later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我过会儿发给你纸牌。</font><br>to produce sth, such as light or heat发出，放出﹙光、热等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That lamp doesn’t give out a lot of light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那盏灯光度不够。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>light,heat,noise</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also </i> GIVE OFF STH,GIVE IT/THEM OFF 1 <br>(<i>BrE</i>) to tell people sth or broadcast sth公布；宣布；播放:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No details of the accident have been given out yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事故的详情尚未公布。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leader of the opposition has <b>given out that</b> she is resigning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反对派的领导人已宣布她要辞职了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>information</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'over <i>(BrE</i>, <i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to stop doing sth别再…了；到此为止吧；住手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Give over! I can’t work with you shouting like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打住吧！你那么嚷嚷吵得我没法工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sb/sth 'over to sb </b><br>to let sb have sb/sth so that they can look after or have responsibility for them/it把…託付给某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We gave the house over to my uncle when we went to live abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们去国外居住时把房子託给了我叔叔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth 'over to sth </b><br>to use sth only for a particular activity or purpose把…专用于﹙某活动或用途﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The newspapers gave six pages over to the tragedy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报纸闢出六版专门报道这一悲惨事件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Much of the countryside is given over to agriculture.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乡下有很多土地专门用于农业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give yourself 'over/ 'up to sth; ,give yourself 'over/ 'up to doing sth </b><br>to spend all your time and energy on sth; to allow sth to completely control your life致力于；献身于；沉溺于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After his wife’s death, he seemed to give himself over to despair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妻子死后，他似乎万念俱灰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to give myself over to writing fulltime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望全时间投入写作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'up; ,give sth 'up; ,give 'up doing sth </b><br>to stop trying to do sth, usually because it is too difficult﹙常因困难而﹚放弃﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t give up easily — she keeps on trying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她决不轻易认输─ 她不断努力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to fix the car myself, but gave up the attempt after a couple of hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我试图自己修好汽车，但几个小时之后就打退堂鼓了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve given up trying to understand her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不再揣摩她的心思了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GIVE IN (TO SB/STH) <br>to stop doing or having sth that you consider unhealthy停止，中止，放弃﹙不健康的事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s about time you gave up smoking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该戒烟了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+adv+-ing<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sb 'up </b><br>to stop having a friendship or a relationship with sb与某人断绝关系；不再与某人交往:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not going to give up all my friends just because I’m getting married.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会只是因为要结婚而疏远所有的朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave her up for a younger woman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为一个较年轻的女子而与她分手。</font><br>to give a baby to sb else to bring up把﹙婴儿﹚送给别人抚养:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave the baby up for adoption.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把婴儿送给别人收养。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GIVE SB AWAY 2 <br>(<i>also</i> <b>,give 'up on sb</b> <i>especially AmE</i>) to stop hoping that sb will arrive or is still alive不再期望某人到来﹙ 或生存﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where have you been? We’d given you up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你去哪儿了？我们都以为你不来了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp give sb up for 'lost/ 'dead(<i>formal</i>)<br>to no longer hope or expect that sb will arrive or is still alive不再期待某人到来/生存<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give sth 'up </b><br>to stop doing or having sth停止；中止；放弃；抛弃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s <b>given up the idea</b> of becoming a model.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已经放弃了成为模特儿的想法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’d given up all hope of seeing him again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她放弃了再次见到他的一切希望。</font><br>(<b>to sb</b>) to let sb else have sth, sometimes because they need it more than you把…让与:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children rarely give up their seats to older people on buses now }(= stand up so that they can sit down)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在的孩子在公共汽车上很少给年长者让座。</font><br>(<b>to sb</b>) to hand sth over to sb else把… 交给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do I have to give up my old passport when I apply for a new one? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我申请新护照时需要交出旧的吗？</font><br>to spend time doing sth when you would normally be doing sth else把﹙本该做其他事的时间﹚耗费于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thanks for giving up your time to come and help us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感谢你花时间来帮我们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>time,the morning,etc. </b><br>(<b>for sb/to do sth</b>) to stop doing or having sth that you enjoy so that you can do or achieve sth that you consider more important﹙为某人/事物﹚放弃…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I gave up everything for my family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我为了家庭放弃了一切。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave it all up to be with him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她为了和他在一起一切都不要了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp let’s give it up for sb(<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)<br>used to ask people to hit their hands together several times (to <b>clap</b> ) to show they approve of sb or have enjoyed sth让我们为﹙某人﹚鼓掌<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give yourself 'up(to sb/sth) </b><br>to allow yourself to be arrested or captured自首；投案；投降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a week on the run he gave himself up to the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他逃跑一周后向警方投案自首了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>surrender (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'up on sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to lose hope that sb will get better, change, etc.对﹙某人﹚不再抱希望；不再指望某人改善﹙或改变等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve given up on her. She never replies to my letters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经对她不抱希望了。她从未回过我的信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His teachers seem to have given up on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的老师们似乎已不再对他抱有希望。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) =GIVE SB UP 3<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give 'up on sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to stop hoping that sth will be successful or will happen对﹙某事﹚不再抱希望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven’t given up on my marriage yet }(= I think we can save it)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对我的婚姻还抱有希望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you given up on the idea of emigrating?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你放弃了移民的想法了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,give yourself 'up to sth; ,give yourself 'up to doing sth =GIVE YOURSELF OVER/UP TO STH,GIVE YOURSELF OVER/UP TO DOING STH</b><br>\n
glance	<h3>glance<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,glance 'off sth </b><br>if a ball, etc. <b>glances off</b> sth, it touches it lightly and moves away from it in a different direction﹙ 球等﹚ 擦过… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ball glanced off the goal post into the net.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球从球门柱上斜擦入网。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,glance 'off/ 'on sth </b><br>if light <b>glances off/on</b> sth,it flashes on a surface or is reflected from it﹙光﹚在…上闪烁，从…中反射:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the sun glancing on water </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水面上波光粼粼</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,glance 'over/ 'through sth </b><br>to look at or read sth very quickly and not very thoroughly迅速翻阅； 浏览:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you glance over this document for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我把这份文件过目一下吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I glanced through a magazine while I waited.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我边等边翻阅杂志。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>book,list</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
glaze	<h3>glaze<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,glaze 'over </b><br>if a person’s eyes <b>glaze over</b>, the person begins to look very bored or tired﹙眼睛﹚变呆滞，发呆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes glazed over when they started talking about football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们开始谈足球时她变得无精打采的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I started to glaze over at that point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到那时我就开始发愣了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes glazed with tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她眼含泪水，目光呆滞。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
glom	<h3>glom<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,glom 'onto sth <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to become very interested in sth such as a new fashion or an idea对﹙新款式或想法等﹚产生极大兴趣；入了魔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole nation glommed onto the scandal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个国家都开始关注这一丑闻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
glory	<h3>glory<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'glory in sth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to get great pleasure or enjoyment from sth因某事而喜悦；为某事而欣喜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gloried in his son’s success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为儿子的成就而自豪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I gloried in the beauty of the scenery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美丽的景色使我流连忘返。</font><br>to take pleasure in sth以某事为快；从某事得到快乐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seemed to glory in his failure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她似乎对他的失败幸灾乐祸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
gloss	<h3>gloss<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,gloss 'over sth </b><br>to treat sth such as a problem,mistake, etc. as if it was not important and avoid discussing it in detail掩饰；掩盖；把…搪塞过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager glossed over the team’s recent defeat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理对这个队最近的失败闪烁其词。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie glosses over the real issues of the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影掩饰了这次战争的真正问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This question has been glossed over by politicians.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题为政治家们所掩盖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
gnaw	<h3>gnaw<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'gnaw at sb </b><br>to make sb feel gradually more anxious or annoyed over a long period of time﹙ 长时间﹚ 折磨某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These doubts had been gnawing at him for some time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些疑虑已经折磨他一段时间了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,gnaw a'way at sth </b><br>to gradually have a harmful effect on sth over a long period of time﹙长时间﹚危害某事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His attitude towards her gnawed away at her confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对她的态度一直在削弱她的自尊心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
go	<h3>go<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]<b>Been </b>is used as the past participle of<b>go</b> when sb has gone somewhere and come back.某人到别处后已回来，<b>go</b> 的过去分词用<b>been</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'bout; ,go a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=GO AROUND,GO AROUND STH 3</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'bout; ,go a'bout sth; ,go a'bout doing sth <i>(BrE</i>)=GO AROUND,GO AROUND STH,GOAROUND DOING STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go about sth </b><br>to continue to do sth in your usualway, especially after sth unusual has happened;to keep busy with sth﹙尤指不寻常的事情发生后﹚ 继续做某事； 忙于某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everybody was going about their business as usual.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家照常忙着自己的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your business,the business of…, work,task</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'bout sth; ,go a'bout doing sth </b><br>to start to work at sth; to approach or deal with sth开始做；着手处理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to help, but I don’t know how to go about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想帮忙， 可不知道如何帮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How should I go about finding a job? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我该怎样着手找工作呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re not going about it the right way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你做这事的方法不对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seems a strange way of <b>going about things</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种处事方法好像很奇怪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>things</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set about sth,set about doing sth;tackle sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'bout with sb; ,go a'bout together(<i>BrE</i>) =GO AROUND WITH SB,GO AROUND TOGETHER</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'cross; ,go a'cross sth </b><br>to cross a room, a road, a river, etc. in order to get to the other side通过，穿过﹙房间、道路、河等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We borrowed a boat and went across to the island.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们借了条船划到岛上去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you go across the road to the store for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能替我到马路对面的商店去跑一趟吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'after sb/sth </b><br>to chase or follow a person or an animal to try to catch them追赶某人﹙或动物﹚；跟在…后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went after the burglars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他追赶那些窃贼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Aren’t you going to go after her to see if she’s all right? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要不要跟着她看看她是不是没事？</font><br>to try to get or obtain sb/sth追求某人；谋求某事﹙或某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re both going after the same job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们俩都在谋求同一份工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'gainst sb </b><br>if a result, a judgement, etc. <b>goes against</b> sb, it is not in their favour or to their advantage﹙结果、判决等﹚对某人不利，不利于某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jury’s verdict went against him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 陪审团的裁决对他不利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The war is going against us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战争开始对我们不利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'gainst sb/sth </b><br>to resist or oppose sb/sth; to act in a different way from what sb tells you or advises you to do反抗﹙或反对﹚某人﹙或某事﹚；与…相背:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anyone who goes against me will be punished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何与我作对的人都将受到惩罚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was going against his doctor’s advice by continuing to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有遵照医嘱，而是继续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t go against your parents’ wishes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要违背你父母的意愿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'gainst sth </b><br>to be opposed or contrary to sth;to not fit or agree with sth违反某事物；与…不符﹙或相反﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This goes against everything I believe in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这完全违背了我的信念。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Paying for my children’s education goes against my principles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为孩子们负担桝育费有违我的原则。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>principles,beliefs</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp go against the 'grain<br>to be sth different from what is normal or natural for you and so sth you do not like doing背离本性﹙或个人的做法等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It went against the grain to have to agree with my brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真不愿意同意我哥哥。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'head </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,go a'head of sb</b>) to go in front of other people who are going in the same direction as you and arrive before them走在﹙某人﹚前面； 先走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went ahead of him into the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在他前面进了屋子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You go ahead and we’ll follow when we’re ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你先走一步，我们准备好了随后就去。</font><br>(of a plan, a project,a deal, etc.计划、方案、交易等) to be carried out or happen进行；实行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The building of the new bridge will go ahead as planned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新桥的修建将按计划进行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Filming went ahead in spite of the bad weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 虽然天气不好，电影拍摄工作照常进行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>proceed <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(<b>with sth</b> ) if sb <b>goes ahead</b> with sth, they do it,although there may be a problem, or sb may have objected or expressed doubts进行﹙遇到障碍的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spite of her illness, Anna decided to go ahead with the wedding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安娜尽管病了，还是决定照常举行婚礼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘May I start now?’ ‘Yes, go ahead }(= I give you permission)&b{.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我现在可以开始了吗？”“可以，开始吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>proceed (&b{with sth</b> )}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv 1 }also&b{ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>the 'go-ahead <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] permission or approval for sth to start批准；许可:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has the boss <b>given</b> you <b>the go-ahead</b> for the project? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板批准了你这个项目吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go-ahead <i>adj </i></b><br>[usually before noun] (<i>BrE</i>) very ambitious; trying hard to succeed, often by using new methods and ideas雄心勃勃的；进取的；有开拓精神的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a go-ahead young designer </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开拓型的年轻设计师</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'long </b><br>to progress; to develop or improve进展； 发展； 改进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things are going along nicely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 情况进展良好。</font><br>(<b>to sth</b>) (<b>with sb</b> ) to go somewhere or to an event with sb﹙和某人﹚去某处，去某场合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went along to the club a couple of times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到这家俱乐部去过几次。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam said he’d go along to the party with us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆说他要和我们一起去参加聚会。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to do what sb else suggests or does遵照…的建议；追随…的做法:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Whatever Ed said, Max went right along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃德说什么马克斯就做什么。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp as you go a'long<br>while you are doing sth在做某事的同时:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made the story up as he went along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个故事是他现编现讲的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was never taught how to use a computer. I just picked it up as I went along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从来没有人桝我如何使用电脑。我只是边用边学会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'long; ,go a'long sth </b><br>to move forward or from one end of sth towards the other向前走；沿着… 移动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus rattled as it went along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车啷啷地往前开着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went along a dark narrow passage, past several doors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我沿着一条黑暗狭窄的通道向前走，经过了几道门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'long with sb/sth </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to agree with sb/sth赞同某事；和某人观点一致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t go along with you on that point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那一点上我不敢苟同。</font><br>to accept sth or do sth, especially when you do not really want to﹙不情愿地﹚同意，接受…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They didn’t like the idea, but they went along with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不喜欢这个主意，可还是接受了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t want to make him angry, so I just went along with him }(= I didn’t argue with him)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想惹他生气，所以就不同他争辩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fall in with sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round <i>(AmE</i>)=GO ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round; ,go a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,go 'round, ,go 'round sth) </b><br>to visit a group of people or places, one by one逐一见某人﹙或到某处﹚；走遍…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll go around and check all the doors are locked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来挨处看看所有的门都锁上了没有。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spent all afternoon going round the shops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们整整一下午都在四处逛商店。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went round the table and said goodbye to everyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和一桌人一一道别。</font><br>(of a note, etc.字条等) to be sent round a group of people so that everyone can read it被传阅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A card’s going around for people to sign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 传给大家的一张贺卡是供签名的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A memo went around the department.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部门中传阅了一份便函。</font><br><i>(BrE also </i><b>,go a'bout, ,go a'bout sth</b>) if a piece of news, an illness,etc. <b>goes around</b>, it spreads from one person to another﹙在…﹚流传，传播:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s a rumour going around that Sam and Kate are having an affair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谣传萨姆和凯特之间关系暧昧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s a nasty virus going round the school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一种恶性病毒在这所学校传播着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>float around,float around sth</b><br>to move or be placed in a circle旋转；转动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cyclist was going round the roundabout the wrong way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骑自行车的人在环岛处乱拐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The earth goes round the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球围绕太阳转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) We’re going round in circles in this argument.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一直在这论点上绕圈子。</font><br>to be enough for everyone to have a share足够分给每个人；够每人一份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There aren’t enough chairs to go round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 椅子不够坐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is there enough food to go around all the guests? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 食物够分给所有客人吗？</font><br>to move around the outside of sth in order to get past sth or get to the other side绕道；绕过…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We didn’t go into the city. We went around it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没有进城。我们绕了过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because of the flood, we had to go round by the minor roads to get to school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于发洪水，我们只好择小道绕行去学校。</font><br>to travel in a country or place and visit lots of different things周游；游览…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We travel around by bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们乘公共汽车到各处旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re saving up to go around the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在攒钱准备周游世界。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re planning to go round visiting all the temples.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们打算游遍所有庙宇。</font><br>to visit every part of a room or building﹙在房间或建筑物内﹚到处走动，看遍各处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long does it take to go around the museum?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这座博物馆看遍需要多长时间？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A guide will go round with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 导游将带你去各处参观。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp what ,goes around 'comes around<br>whatever happens now will have an effect in the future互为因果<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round [&b{+adv/prep</b> ], ,go a'round sth [<b>+adv/prep</b> ], ,go a'round doing sth <i>(BrE also</i> ,go 'round/about [<b>+adv/prep</b> ], ,go 'round/about sth [<b>+adv/prep</b>],,go 'round/a'bout doing sth) }<br>to dress or behave in a particular way; to do sth regularly以某种方式穿着﹙或行动﹚；时常做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She goes around barefoot most of the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她大部份时间光着脚到处跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s not safe to go about the streets alone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 独自在大街上行走不安全。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t go round spreading rumours like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能那样散播谣言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids went around in gangs, dressed completely in black.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们穿着一身黑衣服结伙行动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round sb/sth <i>(BrE also </i>,go 'round sb/sth)</b><br>to surround or go in a circle around sb/sth包围；环绕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt his arm going around my shoulder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感觉到他的胳膊搂着我的肩膀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The belt won't go round my waist! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的皮带不够长了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,go 'round sth) </b><br>to move or travel around a corner绕过拐角﹙或弯道﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car’s tyres screeched as it went round the bend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车转弯时轮胎发出尖利的声音。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maggie watched until Jess had gone around the corner and was out of sight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛吉一直目送杰斯绕过拐角处从视线中消失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ corner,bend</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp go round the 'bend/ 'twist (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)<br>to go crazy发疯；疯狂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I have to stay in this place another day, I’ll go round the bend! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要是非得在这个地方再呆上一天，我就会疯了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'round with sb; ,go a'round together (<i>BrE also </i>,go a'bout/'round with sb,,go a'bout/'round together) (<i>becoming old-fashioned</i>) </b><br>to spend a lot of time with sb or with a group of people和某人﹙或一伙人﹚泡在一块儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ann goes around with Sue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安和休形影不离。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ann and Sue go around together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安和休形影不离。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These are the people I used to go around with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些人从前经常和我在一起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang around with sb,hang around together</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go at sb </b><br>to attack sb攻击某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went at me like a wild animal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他像只野兽一样扑向我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go at sth </b><br>to make great efforts to do sth; to work hard and with enthusiasm at sth拚命干；卖力干:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went at the job as if their lives depended on it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们干起活来好像性命攸关似的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was going at the food as though he hadn’t eaten for days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他狼吞虎咽地吃着，好像饿了好几天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp go at it ,hammer and 'tongs <br>if two people <b>go at it hammer and tongs</b>, they argue or fight with a lot of energy and noise激烈争吵﹙ 或打斗﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'way </b><br>to leave a place or a person走开；离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go away! You’re annoying me! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走开！你惹我心烦了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go away and think about it a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到一边去想一想。</font><br>to leave home for a period of time, especially for a holiday/vacation离家外出﹙尤指度假﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went away for the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们周末外出了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you going away on holiday this year? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今年要去度假吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She goes away on business a lot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她经常出差。</font><br>to disappear gradually逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smell still hasn’t gone away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这气味还没散。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Has your headache gone away? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你头痛好了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The longing never went away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种渴望从未消失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come back</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go a'way with sth </b><br>to leave a place with a particular feeling or impression带着某种感觉﹙或印象﹚离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want people to go away with the wrong idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想让人们带着错误的想法离开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'back </b><br>(<b>to sth/…</b>) to return to a place where you were before回到，返回﹙某地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can we go back inside? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以回到里面了吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I made a cup of tea and went back to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我泡了杯茶后又回到床上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When are you going back to Australia? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你什么时候回澳大利亚？</font><br>(<b>to sth</b>) to return to school or work after a break﹙休假后﹚返校，开学，回去工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children have to go back to school next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们下个星期就得返校了。</font><br>(<b>to sb/sth</b>) to be in a situation that you were in before回到﹙某人处﹚；恢复﹙从前的状态﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can never go back to how things were before }(= in a relationship, for example)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们永远不可能回到从前了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once you have taken this decision, <b>there’s no going back</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一做出这个决定就不能改变。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t think Emily will go back to her husband }(= live with him again)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为埃米莉不会回到丈夫的身边。</font><br>(<b>to sth</b> ) to return to work after being on strike﹙罢工之后﹚复工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strikers won’t go back (to work) until they get a pay rise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工的人要争取到加薪才肯恢复生产。</font><br>(<b>to sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) (of sth that you have bought or borrowed 购买的或借的东西) to be returned to the place where you got it被退回；被归还:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This toaster will have to go back to the shop — it doesn’t work properly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这吐司炉得退回去商店─它有毛病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does this video have to go back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这盘录像带什么时候要还？</font><br>(of clocks and watches 钟表) to be set to an earlier time when the time changes at the end of summer﹙夏季结束时﹚被拨回原来的时间，把时针往回拨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clocks go back tonight.We get an extra hour in bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时钟今晚要拨回原来的时间了。我们可以多睡一个小时。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go forward</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'back…</b><br>if two people <b>go back</b> a period of time, they have known each other and have been friends for that time相识， 已认识﹙ 一段时间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Adam and I <b>go back a long way</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 亚当和我是老相识了。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,go 'back to sth</b>) to have existed since a particular time in the past追溯到；回溯到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our friendship goes back fifteen years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的友谊是从十五年前开始的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This tradition goes back to medieval times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个传统可追溯到中世纪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>date back…,date back to sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,go 'back to sth</b>) to consider sth that happened in the past回忆起； 回到﹙ 先前的事﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To trace the origins of the problem, we have to go back to the 18th century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了找到这个问题的根源，我们必须回到18世纪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m <b>going back a few years</b> now… }(= I’m talking about sth that happened some years ago)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在谈的是几年前的事?</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'back on sth </b><br>to fail to keep a promise; to change your mind about sth违约；食言；改变主意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She never <b>goes back on her word</b> }(= fails to do what she has said she will do)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从不食言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went back on his promise.</font></i><br><font 我不喜欢出尔反尔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your promise,your word</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>go 'back over sth </b><br>to think about sth again or often﹙时常﹚回想，回顾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went back over the day’s events in my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回想了一下白天发生的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'back to sth </b><br>to start talking about sth again回到﹙原来的话题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To go back to what you were saying before…</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回到你前面的话题?</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return to sth </b><br>=GO BACK… 2 <br>=GO BACK…3<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'back to sth; ,go 'back to doing sth </b><br>to start doing sth again that you had stopped doing重新开始；重操旧业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom turned over and went back to sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆翻了个身又睡着了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t go back to living in the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会回城里居住的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s decided to go back to teaching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已决定重新执桝。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John’s going back to college to get some more qualifications.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰要回到大学继续深造。</font><br>(of a situation 局势) to return to what it was before sth else happened回到，恢复﹙先前的状况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things haven’t gone back to normal yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 局面尚未恢复正常。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return to sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go be'fore <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>(<i>not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to exist or happen in an earlier time居先；先前存在；以往发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The present crisis is worse than any that have gone before.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 目前的危机比以往任何一次都严重。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go before sb/sth </b><br>(of a legal case, a proposal or an issue 法律案件、提议或议题) to be presented to sb/sth so that they can discuss it or make a decision or a judgement about it提交给…讨论﹙或决定、裁决﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does his case go before the judge? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的案子何时提交给法官审理？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go be'yond sth </b><br>to be greater, better, etc. than sth超过﹙或超出﹚… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The price we got for the painting went beyond all our expectations }(= was much better than we had expected)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的画卖得的价钱大大超过我们的预计。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The matter has gone beyond a joke }(= has become very serious and is no longer amusing)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事已经不是闹着玩的了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exceed sth ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'by </b><br>(of time 时间) to pass逝去；过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As time goes by, my memory seems to get worse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着时间的推移，我的记忆似乎越来越差。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weeks went slowly by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间一周周慢慢地过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hardly a day went by without Anthony’s name being mentioned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安东尼的名字几乎每天都被提到。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go by;'go by sb/sth </b><br>to pass sb/sth without stopping﹙从…旁边﹚经过，走过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you see a boy go by on a bicycle? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你见到过一个男孩骑自行车打这儿经过吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sat and <b>watched the world go by</b> }(= watched people passing)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们坐着看人们来来往往。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They waved to us as we went by the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们经过窗口时他们向我们招手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pass by,pass by sb/sth</b><br><i>(AmE</i>) to stop somewhere or visit sb for a short time, often on your way to somewhere else﹙顺路﹚停在某处，短暂地拜访某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll <b>go by and</b> see him on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家时将顺便去看看他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you go by the grocery store for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你顺便替我去趟杂货店好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop by;stop by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go by sth </b><br>to be guided or directed by sth; to form an opinion or a judgement from sth遵循﹙或依照﹚…；以…来判断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s a good rule to go by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是要遵守的好规则。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall go entirely by what my solicitor says.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将完全照我律师说的做。</font><br>to call yourself a particular name, which may not be your real name自称为﹙可能不是真名﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For her crime novels, she goes by the name of Monica Simon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的犯罪小说使用的名字是莫妮卡·西蒙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ the name of . . .</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'down </b><br>(<b>to…/sth</b> ) (<b>from</b> …/<b>sth</b> ) to travel from one place to another, especially from the north of a country to the south﹙从一处﹚到﹙另一处﹚﹙尤指南下﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re going down to London next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下个星期要南下到伦敦去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go up </b><br>to fall to the ground倒下；落下；倒在地上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tripped and went down with a bump.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她绊了一下，重重地摔倒在地上。</font><br>to become lower or smaller; to fall下跌；下降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The price of petrol is going down/Petrol is going down (in price).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽油价格正在下跌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The temperature went down by 10 degrees overnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 气温一夜间下降了10 度。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rental costs have gone down (￡50) since last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自从去年以来，租金下降了﹙50 英镑﹚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flood waters are going down.</font></i><br><font 会员人数最近减少了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The swelling has gone down a little.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 肿块稍微消了点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop;fall</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go up </b><br>[<b>+adv</b> ] if a remark, a performance,an action, etc. <b>goes down</b> well or badly, etc. it gets a good or bad reaction from people﹙话语、演出、行动等﹚得到好的﹙或坏的﹚反响，受﹙或不受﹚欢迎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did your performance go down all right }(= did people like it)&b{? </font></i><br><font 这部电影在美国颇受欢迎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jokes don’t go down too well with my mother }(= she does not like them)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲并不喜欢开玩笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band <b>went down a storm</b> }(= people liked them very much)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这支乐队引起轰动。</font><br>(of the sun and moon 日、月) to disappear below the point where the sky seems to meet the land or the sea (the <b>horizon</b> )落到地平线下；落下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We watched the sun go down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看着太阳落下地平线。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come up;rise </b><br>to get <b>goes down</b>, it stops working temporarily暂停作业；暂停运行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I lost all my work when the computer went down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机暂停运行时，我做的东西都丢了。</font><br>(of food,a meal, etc. 食物、饭菜等) to be digested or partly digested被﹙部份﹚消化:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let your food go down before you go the curtain in a theatre <b>goes down</b>, it is the end of the performance落幕； 闭幕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience were cheering as the curtain went down.</font></i><br><font 你争取过那份工作吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s going for the world record.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要争取打破世界纪录。</font><br><i><font You’ve got nothing to lose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 努力争取吧！你不会吃亏的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s a great idea! <b>Go for it</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是个极好的主意！努力去实现吧！ </font><br>to be sold for the price mentioned﹙以某价格﹚出售:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These computers usually go for under ￡1000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这类电脑一般卖不到1 000 英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'forth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to leave a place and go somewhere,especially in order to do sth good or brave动身去某处， 起程﹙ 尤指为做好事或需要勇气的事﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'forward </b><br>to make progress; to begin to happen or be successful进展；开始发生﹙或有成效﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The project is going forward nicely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工程进展顺利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now that we have his agreement, the deal can go forward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 既然我们得到了他的许可，就可以进行交易了。</font><br>(of clocks and watches 钟表) to be set one hour ahead at the beginning of summer﹙夏季开始时﹚被拨快一小时:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clocks go forward tonight. 她不来了，原因我现在不做解释。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,go 'into doing sth</b>) (of money, time, effort, etc. 金钱、时间、精力等) to be spent on sth; to be used to do sth投入某事；用于某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'off; ,go 'off sth </b><br>to move away from sthlarge or important and go in a different direction离开﹙大的或重要的事物﹚；岔开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road youwant goes off on the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想走的路从右边分岔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) She’s always going off the point }(= not talking about the main topic)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她讲话动不动就离题。</font><br>to leave the stage, thesports field, etc. during a play or a game﹙演出或比赛中﹚下场，退场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hamlet goes off in the middle of the scene.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哈姆雷特在这一场中途退下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Johnson went off at half-time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰逊中场休息时下场了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'off sb/sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to loseinterest in sb/sth; to stop liking sb/sth失去对…的兴趣；不再喜欢某人﹙或某事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think she’s going off me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得她不喜欢我了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s gone off his food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不再喜欢他的食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve gone off the idea of a holiday in Scotland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对去苏格兰度假的想法已不感兴趣了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'off with sb </b><br>to leave your husband, wife,partner, etc. in order to have a relationship withsb else与新欢走了:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eddie’s gone off with his wife’s best friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃迪跟他妻子最要好的朋友跑了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run away/off with sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'off with sth </b><br>to leave a place with sth thatdoes not belong to you携他人之物而去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who’s gone off with my new pen? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁顺手牵羊拿走了我的新笔？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>make off (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'on</b><br>(of a situation or a state of affairs 情况或形势) to continue to happen or exist withoutchanging继续下去；维持不变:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can’t let this dispute go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不能允许这一分歧继续存在。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things can’t go on as they are.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事态不能像目前这样继续下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spite of everything, life must go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 无论如何，还是要生活下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We <b>can’t go on like this</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不能这样继续下去！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on;continue </b><br>to last for a particulartime持续，延续﹙一段时间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting went on for hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会开了好几个小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much longer will this hot weather go on (for)? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样炎热的天气还会持续多久？ </font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on;last </b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to continue an activity,especially after a pause or a break﹙尤指停顿或中断之后﹚继续做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sorry I interrupted.Go on with your story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起打断了你的话。继续讲你的事吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children quietly went on with their work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们安静地继续做功课。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s take a break. We’ll go on when you’re ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们休息一下吧。你们准备好我们再继续。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on (with sth)</b><br>4(<b>with sth</b>) (<i>also </i><b>,go'on doing sth</b>) to continue an activity withoutstopping继续﹙做﹚某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I came into the room, the boss just went on with what she was doing and didn’t look up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我进房间时，老板头也没抬，只是继续忙她的活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could have gone on listening to Ted’s stories all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听特德的故事本可以一直听上一夜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d prefer to go on doing things my own way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我宁愿按照自己的方式干下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on (with sth), carry on doing sth </b><br>to continue speaking after a shortpause﹙短暂停顿后﹚继续说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘You know’, he went on, ‘I never liked her.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你知道的，”他接着说，“我从未喜欢过她。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go on then! Tell me what happened! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那么快说吧！告诉我发生了什么事！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hesitated for a moment, and then went on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她犹豫了一会儿，然后继续往下说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on </b><br>(of a light, the electricity, etc. 电灯、电等) to start to work; to be switched on﹙灯﹚亮；﹙电源﹚接通；开始运行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly all the lights went on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突然所有的灯都亮了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go off </b><br>(of time 时间) to pass流逝；过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things will improve as time goes on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随着时间的推移，情况会好起来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She became more miserable as the evening went on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜渐深，她越来越难受。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go by </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressivetenses </i>通常用于进行时) to take place; to happen发生；出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What’s going on here? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里发生什么事了？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who knows what goes on when I’m away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁知道我外出时会出什么事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There must be a party going on next door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 隔壁一定是在举行聚会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ignores a lot of what goes on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对很多事情都视而不见。</font><br>(<b>to sth/to do sth</b>) to do sthafter you have finished sth else﹙完成某事后﹚接着做另一事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do all the students go on to work in catering? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是不是所有的学生都接着在饮食服务业工作？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s go on to the next item on the agenda.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们接着进行下一项议程吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys went on to a club, but I decided to go home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩子们接着去夜总会，可我决定回家。</font><br><b>,go'on</b>! <i>(informal</i>) used to encourage or dare sb to dosth﹙ 用于鼓励或激将﹚ 来吧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go on! Have another cake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来吧！再吃一块蛋糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go on! Try it! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来吧！试试嘛！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go on! Ask her out! I dare you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去呀！约她出来呀！我谅你也不敢！</font><br>(<b>about sb/sth</b>) to continue talking to sb for along time about the same person or thing, usuallyin an annoying way唠叨；没完没了地说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They keep going on about their trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没完没了地讲他们的旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What is she going on about? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她囉嗦啥呢？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents <b>went on and on</b> about how successful my sister is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父母不停地唠叨我姐姐多么有出息。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bang on about sb/sth (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>(<b>at sb</b>) (<b>about sth</b> ) (<i>especially BrE</i>) to complain to sb about their behaviour,work, etc.﹙为某事﹚ ﹙向某人﹚唠叨；数落；指责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dad went on at me about not having a job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爸爸责备我没有工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop going on at me! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别埋怨我了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She keeps going on at me to dress better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不断唠叨着让我穿得体面些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on (at sb) (&b{about sth</b> ); criticize sb }<br>to continue to travel in the direction you are going﹙按本来的方向﹚继续旅行，继续行进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m too tired to go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我太累，走不动了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had an accident and couldn’t go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们出了意外，无法继续旅行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry on </b><br>(<b>ahead/to sth</b>) to travel in front of sb else先走一步；先行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack’s going on ahead to get the house ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克要提前出发去把房子准备好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall we wait for Ray or shall we go on into town without him? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们等一等雷还是先去城里，不等他了？</font><br>(of a road, a piece of land, etc.道路、土地等) to cover a particular distance in a particular direction延伸；延续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The desert seemed to go on forever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 沙漠似乎无边无际。</font><br>(of an actor or a performer演员或表演者) to walk onto the stage to begin their performance上场；出场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t go on till Act 2.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她要到第2幕才出场。</font><br>(in sport体育运动) (of a player运动员) to join a team instead of another player during a game﹙比赛中﹚以替补队员身分上场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Allen went on (<i>in place of Brown</i>) just before half-time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就在上半场结束前艾伦上场﹙替换了布朗﹚。</font><br><b>go on</b> <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) used to agree to do or allow sth that you do not really want to do or allow, after sb has persuaded you﹙勉强同意﹚行吧，可以吧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Are you sure you won’t come?’ ‘Oh go on then, but I won’t be able to stay long.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你真的不来了吗？”“喔，还是去吧，可我不能呆很久。”</font><br>go on! (<i>old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>, <i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) used to show that you do not believe what sb is saying﹙表示不相信对方的话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go on! You didn’t eat it all yourself! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别骗我！你不可能一个人把它全吃光的！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get away (with you)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp be ,going 'on (for) sth (<i>BrE</i>) <br>to be nearly a particular age, time or number接近，将近﹙某年龄、时间或数目﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was going on (for) midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快到午夜了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s 15, going on 21! }(= she acts as if she’s 21)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她现在15岁，可举止像21岁！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>enough, plenty, etc. to be going 'on with </b><br>enough, plenty, etc. for our present needs足够目前所需:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That should be enough food to be going on with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 食物应足够现在吃的了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,goings-'on <i>n </i></b><br>[pl.] (<i>informal</i>) activities or events that are strange or amusing异常情况；有趣的活动﹙或事情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There have been some strange goings-on at their house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们家最近有些异常情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ongoing <i>adj </i></b><br>[usually before noun] continuing to exist or develop继续存在的；仍在进行的；不断发展的:<br><i><font put on top of another object﹙大小等﹚合适；被固定在﹙或放到﹚…顶部；盖上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lid won’t go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盖子合不拢。</font><br><i><font <b>'go on sth </b><br><i>(used in negative sentences and questions</i>用于否定句和疑问句) to base an opinion or a judgement on sth以…为依据；根据…来判断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police don’t have much evidence to go on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方没多少依据。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m only going on what she told me.</font></i><br><font course/trip</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开始一门课程/旅行</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going on a diet on Monday.</font></i><br><font 你什么时间休假去？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to go on the dole }(= to start to receive government unemployment benefit)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开始领取失业救济金</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When do the band go on tour? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队何时开始巡迴演出？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go on sth;'go on doing sth </b><br>(of money, time,energy, etc. 金钱、时间、精力等) to be spent or used for sth花费在，用于﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All his money goes on drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的钱全用来喝酒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the electricity we use goes on running the computers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们所用的电大多耗费在运行电脑上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GO ON 4<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'out </b><br>(<b>for/to sth</b>) to leave your house to go to social events, etc.出门参加社交活动；外出交际﹙或娱乐等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall we go out for a meal tonight?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今晚出去吃饭好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ellie goes out a lot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃利经常外出参加社交活动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She goes out dancing most weekends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她周末多半在外跳舞。</font><br><i><font in </b><br>(<b>with sb/together</b>)(<i>informal</i>) (especially of young people尤指年轻人) to spend time with sb and have a romantic or sexual relationship with them﹙与情人﹚约会；﹙情侣﹚约会:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam has been going out with Kate for six months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆与凯特相恋六个月了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long have Sam and Kate been going out together? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆与凯特相恋多久了？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did they start going out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们什么时候开始恋爱的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>date,date sb </b><br>(of a letter, a message, etc. 信函、信息等) to be sent, announced, etc.送出；发出；宣布:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have the invitations gone out yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请柬发出去了吗？</font><br><i><font made public; to be published发布；公布；发表:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Word went out that the Prime Minister had resigned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 传说首相已经辞职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The magazine goes out six times a year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份杂志每年出版六期。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) (of a radio or television programme 广播或电视节目) to be broadcast播放；播出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first episode goes out next Friday at 8.00 pm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一集下星期五晚8时播出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The show will go out live from the studio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演出将从演播室现场直播。</font><br>(of a fire or a light 火或灯光) to stop burning or shining熄灭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire has gone out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火熄灭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a power cut and all the lights went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 停电使所有的灯都灭了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>lights,fire</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>be extinguished <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>if money <b>goes out</b>, it is spent on bills and expenses﹙钱﹚用于，花掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to have more money coming in than going out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得多挣少花。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>come in </b><br>(<b>to …</b>) to leave your country and travel to another one, especially one far away出国﹙尤指去遥远的国家﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We went out to see him when he was living in Australia.</font></i><br><font opened and we went through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大门开了，我们走了进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lots of huge trucks go through the 子弹直接射进了窗户。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the hole where the bullet went through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是子弹射穿的孔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>go 'through sb</b><br>if a feeling <b>goes through</b> you,it passes through your body﹙感觉﹚传遍全身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A shudder went through her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她浑身一阵颤抖。</font><br>if a particular type of food <b>goes through</b> you, you find it difficult to digest and it is emptied from 我不能吃寿司—一吃就拉肚子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'go through sb/sth </b><br>to ask a person or an organization to deal with sth for you or give you permission to do sth通过某人﹙或机构﹚处理；向… 提出申请:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you want to book the cruise, you’ll have to go through a travel agent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 想预订乘船游览，就得找旅行社联系。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go 'through sth </b><br>to pass through sth from one end to the other从…的一端到另一端；穿过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We went through the woods to get to the lake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们穿过丛林来到湖边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) What <b>went through your mind</b> when you saw John standing there after all this time? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了这么久了，你看见约翰站在那里时，你心里是怎么想的？</font><br>if you <b>go through</b> an event, a period of time, etc.,you pass through it from the beginning to the end经过，自始至终经历﹙事情、时期等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went through the day in a state of shock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一整天都惊魂未定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can’t <b>go through life</b> always depending on her parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不能一辈子都依赖父母。</font><br>to experience or suffer sth经历；遭受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You don’t realize what I’ve been going through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你意识不到我所经受的事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been through a bad patch recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些日子她过得很苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve been through a lot together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们曾经同甘共苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a phase/stage all teenagers go through.</font></i><br><font
