look at, check or examine sth closely and carefully,especially in order to find sth查遍…；搜遍…；找遍…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve gone through all my pockets but I can’t find my papers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他死后女儿得仔细查阅他的文件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pockets,papers </b><br>to discuss or study sth in detail, especially repeating perform a series of actions; to follow a method经过一套程序﹙或所有步骤等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the process you have to go through to become a club member.</font></i><br><font again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我退出系统时出了差错，只好从头再来一遍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you seen him go through his exercise routine in the mornings? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看见过他早晨做完一套例常锻炼了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>process,routine,procedure</b><br>to use up sth用完；耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I milk already? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把那些牛奶全喝光了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get through sth </b><br>to wear or make a hole in sth磨破；穿破:<br><i><font formalities have to be gone through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些手续必须履行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp go through the 'motions (of sth/of doingsth)<br>to or say sth without being serious or sincere about it敷衍；走过场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her heart wasn’t in the game — she was just going through the motions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有用心比赛—只不过是在应付差事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>go through the 'roof </b><br>(of prices, etc. 价格等) to rise very quickly飚升；猛增:<br><i><font take us to court, but he’ll never go through with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说要控告我们，可他决不会费这么多事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go STH 1 <br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) (<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时)(of two people两人) to spend time with each other and have a romantic or sexual with sb与某人相好；与某人发生关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been going with him for quite a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和他恋爱已好一阵子了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp suggesting it支持，同意﹙计划、想法等﹚；与某人看法一致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m prepared to go with her decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿意支持她的决定。</font><br><i><font </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条裙子和我的套头毛衫相配吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GO TOGETHER 2 <br>(of two or more things 两个或以上的事物) to exist at the same time or in the same place as sth; to be often found together并存；相伴而生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Disease often goes with poverty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疾病与贫穷常常相伴而生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She loves all the attention that goes with being famous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢名气带来所有别人注视的目光。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  GO TOGETHER 1 <br>to be included with or as a part of sth是…的一部份；附属于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A new car goes with the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份工作配有一辆汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,go with'out; ,go with'out sth; ,go with'out doing sth </b><br>to manage without sth which you usually have没有…而勉强应付；没有…也行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never want the children to have to go without.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从来不希望孩子们要将就些什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went without sleep for three days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她熬了三天没睡觉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>do without,do without sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n

ago, but it’s growing out now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我是六个星期前染发的，可现在长得快退光了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,grow sth 'out </b><br>to let your hair grow so that the colour or style changes or disappears让头发长长以使染色﹙ 或发式﹚ 消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve decided to grow the layers out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决定把我分层削短的头发留长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,grow 'out of sth </b><br>if a child <b>grows out of</b> clothes, he/she becomes too big to wear them长大至穿不进…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She grows out of her clothes so fast! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她这么快就长得穿不进她的衣服了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>coat,trousers,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>outgrow sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>grow into sth </b><br>to stop doing something or suffering from sth as you become older长大至不再做某事﹙或不再受…之苦﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He grew out of his eczema as he got older.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他长大后湿疹就好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a very rebellious teenager, but he <b>grew out of it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他十几岁时非常叛逆，但长大后就好了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>outgrow sth </b><br>to develop from sth产生于，源于﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These laws grew out of a need to protect children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些法规是为保护儿童而制定的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,grow 'up </b><br>when a person <b>grows up</b>, they become an adult长大成人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kate’s growing up fast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯特长得很快。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oh, grow up }(= behave in a more sensible way)&b{ and stop making such a fuss! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喂，懂事点，别这么闹了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a difficult teenager, but grew up to be a responsible adult.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他十几岁时很难相与，可长大成人之后很有责任心。</font><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to spend the time you are a child in a particular place or in a particular way﹙在某地或以某方式﹚生长，长大:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He grew up in Portugal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在葡萄牙长大。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mel and I grew up together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 梅尔和我是一起长大的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This generation has grown up on MTV.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这代人是在音乐电视前长大的。</font><br>to develop gradually逐渐发展；形成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The town had grown up around the abbey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个镇子是环绕着修院发展起来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cult had grown up around him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他凝聚了一种对他的狂热崇拜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>develop</b><br>Do not confuse this phrasal verb with<b>grow</b> . <b>Grow</b> can be used without an object to mean ‘increase in size, number, cost, etc.’ <b>Grow</b>,but not <b>grow up</b>, can be used with an object.不要将这个短语动词和<b>grow</b> 混淆。<b>grow</b> 不带宾语可用于表示规模、数目、费用等增长。<b>grow</b> 可带宾语，<b>grow up</b> 不可以:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to grow vegetables</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 种植蔬菜</font><br>Use <b>bring sb up</b> to refer to parents caring for their children until they are grown up and teaching them how to behave, etc.抚养桝育孩子用<b>bring sb up</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,grown-'up <i>adj </i>(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>mentally and physically an adult长大成人的；成年的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has two grown-up children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有两个已成年的孩子。</font><br>adult, mature成人的； 成熟的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Susie is very grown-up for her age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 相对她的年龄来说苏西非常成熟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'grown-up <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>(<i>used especially by adults when talking to children, or by children</i>尤用于成年人对儿童说话或作儿童用语) an adult person大人；成人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grown-ups will sit at one table and the children at another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大人坐一桌，孩子坐另一桌。</font><br>\n

hack	<h3>hack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack sth a'bout <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to cut or change sth in a rough and careless way乱砍；乱剪；粗率(或胡乱)地改变:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hairdressers have hacked her hair about a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 理发师把她的头发削得有点乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The script was hacked about by several people before the movie was finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影拍完之前，有几个人大刀阔斧地把脚本删改得面目全非。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hack at sth; ,hack a'way (at sth) </b><br>to try to cut sth using strong rough blows with an axe, a knife, scissors, etc.猛砍；用力噼；猛剪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s really hacked at my hair. It’s a complete mess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她实在是对我的头发下了狠手，把它剪得一塌煳涂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was hacking away at the trees with an axe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用斧子对着那些树猛砍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t hack at it! Cut it carefully! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要乱剪！仔仔细细地剪！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack sth 'down</b><br>to cut a tree, etc. roughly so that it falls to the ground砍倒，砍伐(树等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are hacking down the forests to sell the timber.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在砍伐森林销售木材。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tree</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack 'into sth <i>(computing</i>)</b><br>to find a way of looking at or changing the information on sb else’s computer without their knowledge or permission非法侵入(他人计算机系统):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A teenage girl managed to hack into the bank’s computer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名十几岁的女孩设法侵入了这家银行的计算机。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack sb 'off <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb feel extremely annoyed or irritated使极其恼怒；使非常生气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was hacked off with the whole situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对整个局面大为恼火。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always wants her jobs done in the next 10 minutes. That really hacks me off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是要别人10 分钟之内就把活干完。这使我非常气愤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack sth 'off; ,hack sth 'off sth </b><br>to cut sth off sth with rough heavy blows把…(从…上)砍下来；削掉(…上的)…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hacked off the dead branches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把枯树枝砍掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hacked the padlock off the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把门上的挂锁砸掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was always threatening to hack her lovely long hair off with the kitchen scissors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是威胁说要用厨房剪刀剪掉她那漂亮的长发。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth off,chop sth off sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hack sth 'up </b><br>to cut sth very roughly into large pieces把…剁成大块:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hacked up the meat with a large knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用大刀大块大块地把肉剁开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

hammer	<h3>hammer<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hammer a'way at sth </b><br>to work hard in order to finish or achieve sth; to repeat sth again and again努力干；孜孜以求；不断重复:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He kept hammering away at the same point all through the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开会自始至终都在反复强调同一点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hammer sth 'in; ,hammer sth 'into sb </b><br>to force sb to learn sth by repeating it many times反复灌输:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll manage to hammer the point in somehow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将设法反复灌输这一点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have had English grammar hammered into them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们学习英语语法都是通过反复灌输。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hammer sth 'out </b><br>to discuss a plan, a deal, etc.for a long time and with great effort, until sth is decided or agreed on反复讨论出(一致意见)；充分研讨出(决定):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took weeks to hammer out an agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过多个星期的反复讨论才达成协议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>deal,agreement,policy</b><br>to produce a sound, play a tune, etc. especially on a piano, loudly and not very well(在钢琴等上)敲打出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hammered out ‘Happy Birthday’ on the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在钢琴上敲敲打打地弹出了《生日快乐》。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
hand	<h3>hand<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth a'round <i>(especially AmE</i>)=HAND STH ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sb 'back to sb/sth </b><br>used by a television or radio reporter at the end of a report from a particular place to show that the main presenter will continue(电视或电台记者从某地报道结束时示意主持人将继续主持)现在请回到…那里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now I’ll hand you back to Trevor in the studio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在请回到演播室特雷弗那里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'back (to sb) </b><br>to give sth back to the person, country, etc. who used to have it or who owns it legally把…归还(给原先或合法的拥有人、国家等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The territory was handed back to Egypt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 领土归还给了埃及。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will not press charges if the stolen money is handed back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果把偷走的钱还回来，我们将不予控告。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money,control </b><br>to give sth back to the person who gave it to you把某物归还(给原主):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked quickly at my passport and then handed it back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看了一下护照就还给了我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>passport,letter,glass</b><br>In informal spoken language<b>hand sb back sth</b> and, less often, <b>hand sb sth back</b> are also used.非正式口语也说<b>hand sb back sth</b> ，有时说<b>hand sb sth back</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I handed her back her pen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把笔还给了她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I handed her her pen back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把笔还给了她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth back (to sb);return sth (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'down</b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,hand sth 'on</b>) (<b>to sb</b> ) to give or leave sth to a younger person把…传下去(给较年轻的人)；流传(给后世):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my clothes were handed down to me by my brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我所有的衣服都是我哥哥传下来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These skills have been handed down from generation to generation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些技术一直世代相传。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s got no one to hand the family house on to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有后代继承他家的房子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tradition,custom,skills</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pass sth down (to sb)</b><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) (of a court of law or other official body 法庭或其他官方团体)to announce an official decision正式宣布；公布:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge handed down a sentence of six years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官宣布判处六年徒刑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>decision,sentence,verdict</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hand-me-down <i>n </i></b><br>[usually pl.] (<i>especially AmE</i>) clothing that is no longer wanted and is given to sb else, especially a younger brother or sister被抛弃(或传给别人)的衣物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I used to hate wearing my brother’s hand-me-downs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以前讨厌穿我哥哥倒下来的旧衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'in (to sb) </b><br>to give a piece of work to sb, such as a teacher, so that they can correct,read or deal with it; to give sth to sb in authority because it belongs to them or is lost提交， 呈交，上交(书面材料或失物等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Make sure you hand in your homework on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要按时交家庭作业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hand your room keys in by 10 a.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上午10 点之前交房间钥匙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>essay,homework</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth in (to sb) </b><br>to tell sb officially that you intend to leave your job递交辞呈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve just handed in my notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我刚刚提交了辞呈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>only&b{ your notice,your resignation</b> }<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth in (to sb); resign</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'on (to sb) </b><br>to send or give sth to another person after you have finished with it把某事物交给(某人)使用(或处理):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hand on the magazine to your friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把杂志传给你的朋友阅读。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The task has been handed on to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项任务交给了我继续处理。</font><br>=HAND STH DOWN 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pass sth on (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'out (to sb) </b><br>to give sth to each person in a group把…分发(给…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She handed textbooks out to the new students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把课本发给新生。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>leaflets,money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth out;pass sth out (to sb) </b><br>to give advice, criticism,a punishment, etc. to sb提出，给予(建议、批评、惩罚等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The courts are handing out tough sentences to frequent offenders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法庭正对惯犯予以重判。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>information,punishment,sentence</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dish sth out (to sb) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'handout <i>n </i></b><br>something that is given free to people, especially food, money or clothes免费品(尤指食物、钱或衣物) <br>a document giving information about sth, especially one that is given to a group or a class by a teacher, speaker,etc.(尤指发给学生、听众等的)讲义<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand 'over to sb; ,hand sb 'over to sb <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to give sb else a turn to speak when you have finished talking(讲话结束后)请其他人讲话，让某人听另一个人讲话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to hand over now to our guest speaker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在有请我们的特邀演讲人发言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll hand you over to dad for a chat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你跟我爸爸聊聊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand 'over to sb; ,hand sth 'over to sb </b><br>to give sb else your position of power or authority;to give sb else the responsibility for dealing with a particular situation把(权力或责任)移交给某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am resigning and handing over to my deputy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要辞职了，由我的副手接任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My father has handed over the business to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父亲把生意交给了我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'handover <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the act of moving power or responsibility from one person or group to another; the period during which this happens(权力、责任等的)移交，移交期<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  HANDOVER at HAND SB/STH OVER (TO SB),HAND YOURSELF OVER (TO SB) <br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sb/sth 'over (to sb), ,hand yourself 'over (to sb) </b><br>to give sb/sth officially to sb else,especially sb in authority把人或物交出(给当局处理) ； 引渡； 自首:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They handed him over to the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把他交给了警方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He forced me to hand over the keys to the safe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他逼我交出保险柜的钥匙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>deliver sb/sth over/up (to sb), deliver yourself over/up (to sb) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'handover <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the act of giving a person or a thing to sb in authority(人或物的)交出；引渡；自首<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> HANDOVER at HAND OVER TO SB,HAND STH OVER TO SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hand sth 'round <i>(especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually</i> ,hand sth a'round) </b><br>to offer or pass sth (especially food and drink) to each person in a group of people or in a room传递，分发(尤指食物或饮料):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you hand round the sandwiches, please? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请分发一下三明治好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
hang	<h3>hang<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'bout <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br><i>(informal</i>) =HANG ON 3 <br>=HANG AROUND<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'bout; ,hang a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=HANG AROUND,HANG AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'bout with sb; ,hang a'bout together <i>(BrE</i>)=HANG AROUND WITH SB,HANG AROUND TOGETHER</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,hang a'bout/ 'round)(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to wait等待:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry to keep you hanging around for so long.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起让你等了这么久。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won’t hang about for you if you’re late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是来晚了我就不等你了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wait around (for sb/sth)</b><br>to delay doing sth; to be slow to do sth拖延； 慢悠悠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you finished already? You don’t hang about, do you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你已经完成了？你蛮快呀，是不是？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'round; ,hang a'round sth <i>(BrE also</i> ,hang a'bout/ 'round, ,hang a'bout/ 'round sth)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to spend time somewhere, without doing very much转悠；闲荡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spent most of the day hanging about doing nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们那天大部份时间都在闲荡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children hang around the streets because there’s nowhere for them to play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在街上东游西逛，因为他们没有地方玩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why are they always hanging round our house? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为什么总是在我们的房子附近转悠？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang a'round with sb; ,hang a'round together <i>(BrE also </i>,hang a'bout/ 'round with sb,,hang a'bout/ 'round together) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to spend a lot of time with sb or with a group of people(和某人)常待在一起，泡在一块儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bob hangs around with Tim.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲍勃和蒂姆形影不离。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bob and Tim hang around together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲍勃和蒂姆形影不离。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t like the kind of people she hangs about with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢她交往的那种人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go around with sb,go around together</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'back </b><br>to not move forwards because you are nervous or afraid畏缩； 却步:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hung back, afraid to go near the dog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她站在原地，不敢走近那条狗。</font><br>to stay behind in a place such as a school or an office after most of the other people have left留下；继续留在原处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My friends rushed out, but I hung back to talk to the teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 朋友们急忙跑出去了，可我留下来找老师说话。</font><br>to be unwilling to do sth; to hesitate畏缩；吞吞吐吐；犹豫:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a great opportunity. We can’t afford to hang back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是个绝好的机会。我们可不能再犹豫了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'on </b><br>to hold sb/sth firmly抓紧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on tight and you won’t fall off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你抓紧就不会掉下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse suddenly galloped off and I tried to hang on as best as I could.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马突然飞奔起来，我拚命抓紧绳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  HANG ONTO STH/SB,HANG ON TO STH/SB <br><i>(BrE, spoken</i>,<i>informal</i>) used to ask sb to wait for a short time等一下；停一下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on a minute — I’m nearly ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请等一下─我快准备好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The line’s engaged. Would you like to hang on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 占线。你稍候好吗？ </font><br><i>(BrE also </i><b>,hang a'bout</b>) (<i>spoken</i>,<i>informal</i>) used to tell sb to stop what they are doing or saying, because you have just realized sth, or because you do not understand sth(有所发现或没听懂对方的话时说)停一下，等一等:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on! I’ve had an idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等等！我想到一个主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on! How much did you say it was? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等一下！你说多少钱？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on! That’s not what I said! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 稍停一下！我可没那么说！</font><br>to continue doing sth even when the situation is difficult(在逆境中)坚持不懈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much longer can their troops hang on in that position? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的军队还能在那个阵地坚持多久？</font><br>to wait for sth to happen等待某事发生；等候:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need an answer soon — don’t keep me hanging on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我需要快些得到答覆─别让我一直等着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp hang (on) 'in there (<i>informal</i>)<br>to continue trying to do sth, even though it is very difficult坚持下去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on in there! The exams will soon be over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坚持下去！考试很快就结束了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hang on sth </b><br>to depend on sth有赖于，取决于(某事物) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My whole future hung on his decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的未来全取决于他的决定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>decision</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>depend on sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hang sth on sb <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to blame sb for sth, often unfairly(不公正地)为…责备某人，把…归咎于某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t hang the damage to your computer on me — I wasn’t even there! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的计算机坏了不能赖我─我当时根本不在场！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'onto sth/sb; ,hang 'on to sth/sb </b><br>to hold sth/sb tightly抓紧某物(或某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang onto my hand while we cross the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过马路时拉紧我的手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold on,hold onto sth/sb,hold on to sth/sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> HANG ON<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'onto sb/sth; ,hang 'on to sb/sth</b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to keep sb/sth; to not sell, give away or lose sth保留；不卖掉；不放弃；不丢失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on to the receipt in case you want to change the dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留着发票，万一你想退换连衣裙也可以。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can hang on to the book for a bit longer if you want.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想的话，可以暂时留着这本书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope she manages to hang on to her job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望她能保住那份工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company seems to be incapable of hanging on to its staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司似乎无力留住职员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s a great guy — you should hang on to him! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个很不错的人─你应该抓住他不放！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold onto sb/sth,hold on to sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to spend a lot of time in a place or with a person or a group of people常去某处；泡在某处；(和某人或集体) 泡在一起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where does he hang out these days? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他这些天常去哪儿？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She used to hang out with the Beatles in the sixties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在六十年代常常和披头士乐队泡在一块儿。</font><br>to spend time relaxing, doing very little闲散； 歇闲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve just been hanging out and listening to music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在偷闲听听音乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hang-out <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) a place where you live or enjoy spending time with friends住所；(和朋友) 常到之处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a popular hang-out for teenagers</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 青少年聚首的热门地方</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang sth 'out </b><br>to attach things that you have washed to a piece of string or rope outside so that they can dry; to put sth such as a flag, etc. out of a window or in a street by attaching it to a piece of string or rope把(衣服) 晾出去；把(旗帜等)挂出去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you hung the washing out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把洗好的衣服晾出去了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many houses hung out a banner supporting the march.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多住房外悬挂了支持游行的横幅。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>washing,clothes,flags,banner</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> HANG UP,HANG STH UP 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'over sb/sth </b><br>if a problem, a threat or sth sad <b>hangs over</b> you, you think about it or worry about it a lot困扰某人；为某事所困扰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A question mark hangs over the future of the club }(= no one knows what is going to happen)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 俱乐部的将来还是个问号。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The threat of dismissal hung over our heads.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遭解雇的威胁使我们忧心忡忡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>question mark,threat</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>head,future</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'round <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)=HANG AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'round; ,hang 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)=HANG AROUND,HANG AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'round with sb; ,hang 'round together <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)=HANG AROUND WITH SB,HANG AROUND TOGETHER</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang to'gether </b><br>to be well organized and fit together well; to have parts that all agree with each other相符；一致；连贯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book doesn’t really hang together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书的结构不很紧密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This account of what happened doesn’t hang together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对事情的这一描述前后矛盾。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hang 'up; ,hang sth 'up</b><br>to attach sth from the top to a hook, a piece of string, etc. so that the lower part is free or loose; to be attached in this way(把…)悬挂，吊起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dress is hanging up in the wardrobe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的连衣裙挂在衣柜里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I hang your coat up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我帮你把大衣挂起来好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took off his suit and hung it up carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脱掉西装外套，小心地挂了起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>coat,clothes</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> HANG STH OUT <br>(<b>on sb</b>) to end a telephone conversation, often very suddenly, by putting down the part of the telephone that you speak into (the <b>receiver</b>) or switching the telephone off (突然)挂断(某人的)电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hung up on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她挂断了我的电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t hang up. I’d like to talk to Dad too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别挂断电话。我也想和爸爸谈谈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was so upset I hung up the phone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我十分生气，挂断了电话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>phone,receiver </b><br>to finish using sth for the last time; to give up a particular activity,profession, etc.终止使用某物；结束某种活动(或专业等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After twenty years playing football, he’s finally hanging up his boots.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 踢了二十年足球，他终于挂靴了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>boots</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>get ,hung 'up <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to be delayed耽搁；延误:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got hung up in traffic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我遇上了交通阻塞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry I’m late — I got hung up at the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起我来晚了─我在办公室脱不开身。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hang with sb <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to spend a lot of time with sb(和某人)长时间待在一起，泡在一块儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you still hanging with those guys? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你还和那些人混在一起吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

hark	<h3>hark<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hark at sb <i>(spoken</i>, <i>humorous</i>)</b><br>used only in the form <b>hark at</b> sb, to show that you think what sb has just said is stupid, or shows too much pride(只用于hark at sb的形式)听听某人的蠢话， 看某人的傲慢样子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘I need to lose some weight.’ ‘Hark at her! She’s so thin I can hardly see her!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我需要减减肥。”“听她有多傻！她瘦得我都快看不见她人了！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hark 'back to sth </b><br>to talk about or remember sth that happened in the past or was mentioned before重提，回忆起(过去的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t keep harking back to the past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能没完没了地唸叨从前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the past,youth</b><br>(<i>BrE</i>) to remind you of or to be like sth in the past使想起；和(过去的事物)相似:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The melody harks back to one of his earlier symphonies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这首曲子使人想起他早期的一首交响曲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n

hatch	<h3>hatch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hatch 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>when a bird, an insect, etc.<b>hatches out</b>, it comes out of the egg; when an egg <b>hatches out</b>, it breaks open and a bird, an insect, etc. comes out(鸟、虫等)孵出，破壳而出；(蛋)孵化:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chicks hatch out after fifteen days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小鸡过十五天就孵出来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have the eggs hatched out yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些蛋孵化了吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When will the caterpillars hatch out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 幼虫何时孵化出来？</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Hatch </b>is used instead of <b>hatch out</b> in American English. It can also be used in British English.美国英语用<b>hatch</b> 而非<b>hatch out。hatch</b> 也可用于英国英语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

sb/sth for a particular reason因…而不喜欢…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve <b>got nothing against</b> her family personally — it’s just that there are so many of them! </font></i><br><font BrE</i>)</b><br>to allow a husband,wife or partner that you are separated from to return允许分手的丈夫(或妻子、伴侣)回头；愿与某人重修旧好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had his wife back time and time again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一再允许妻子回到身边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sb back </b><br>to invite sb to your house after you have been somewhere with of person, especially when in fact they are not以为某人是(某类人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I <b>didn’t have you down as</b> the jealous type.</font></i><br><font hawk	<h3>hawk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hawk sth a'bout/a'round/ 'round; ,hawk sth a'bout/a'round/ 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to try to sell things by going from place to place asking people to buy them沿街兜售:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pirate copies of their CD were being hawked around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的光碟给盗版后在街上兜售。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hawked their newsletter around student bars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在学生小卖部推销他们的简讯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
head	<h3>head<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'head for/towards sth (<i>also</i> be 'headed for/towards sth <i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>(<i>often used in the progressive tenses </i>常用于进行时) <br>to be going in a particular direction or to a particular place朝…方向(或地方)行进；前往:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time I was heading for home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到我该回家去的时候了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane headed for the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简走向门口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>make for sb/sth </b><br>to be likely to experience sth,especially sth bad很可能遭受(尤指不幸)；会招致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re heading for trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们会惹麻烦的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country is headed for an economic disaster.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国家将要陷入经济灾难。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>trouble,defeat,disaster,victory,a fall</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,head 'off </b><br>to leave a place to go somewhere else or do sth else出发；动身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time we headed off to get the train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们该动身去上火车了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,head sb 'off </b><br>to get in front of sb in order to make them turn back or go in a different direction拦挡某人使改变方向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police tried to head off the demonstrators before they got to the city hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方试图在游行示威者到达市政厅之前拦截他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>intercept sb <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,head sb/sth 'off </b><br>to prevent sth; to stop sb from doing sth阻止，防止(某事发生)；阻止(某人做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their attempts to head off criticism have failed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们阻止别人批评的努力失败了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'head towards sth (<i>also</i> be 'headed towards sth <i>especially AmE</i>)=HEAD FOR/TOWARDS STH,BE HEADED FOR/TOWARDS STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,head 'up sth; ,head it/them 'up </b><br>to be in charge of sth such as a department, a company,an organization, etc.领导，主管(某部门、公司或机构等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She heads up our finance division.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是我们的财务部门主管。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>operation,company</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br> This phrasal verb is also used in the passive.这个短语动词也用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new company will be headed up by Graham Hart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新公司将由格雷厄姆·哈特领导。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She heads our finance division.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是我们的财务部门主管。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>\n
heal	<h3>heal<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,heal 'up/ 'over </b><br>if a cut, a wound, etc. <b>heals up/over</b>, it closes and becomes healthy again(伤口等)瘉合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her leg took a long time to heal up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的腿过了很长时间才瘉合。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cut has healed over now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伤口现已瘉合。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
heap	<h3>heap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'heap A on B;'heap B with A (<i>also</i> 'heap A upon B <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to put a lot of sth in a pile on sth在…上放很多(东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She heaped food on my plate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她往我的盘子里放了很多食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The food was heaped on the plate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盘子里堆满了食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chairs were heaped with cushions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 椅子上摞着埝子。</font><br>to offer or give sb a lot of sth, especially praise or criticism大量提供(或送)给某人；(尤指)对某人大加赞扬(或批评) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They heaped scorn upon his proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对他的建议大加嘲讽。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Praise was heaped on the police for their handling of the case.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方处理这一案件得到了高度赞扬。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>praise,scorn</b><br>[NOTE]These phrasal verbs are often used in the passive.这些短语动词常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,heap sth 'up </b><br>to put sth into a pile堆放:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A huge pile of washing was heaped up in a corner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 角落里攒了一大堆待洗的衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pile sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
hear	<h3>hear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hear about sb/sth </b><br>to be told news or information about sb/sth得知(有关某人的)信息；获悉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m so sorry to hear about your mother }(=for example, that she is ill)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 获悉你母亲的事我很难过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you heard about your job yet }(= if you have got it or not)&b{? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的工作有消息了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hear from sb;'hear sth from sb </b><br>to receive news or information from sb, usually by letter or telephone接到某人的信、电话等:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you ever hear from any of your school friends? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你收到过你的校友的信吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>written</i>) I look forward to hearing from you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盼望着收到你的信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I haven’t heard anything from Kate for ages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我好长时间没听到凯特的音信了。</font><br>to formally get sb’s opinion about sth or their description of sth that has happened, such as an accident, etc.听取某人的意见(或陈述、汇报等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can we hear from some of the women in the audience? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们能否听一些妇女观众的意见？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police would like to hear from anyone who witnessed the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方想要听取这次事故的任何目击者的陈述。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to hear something from somebody who’s had experience of studying abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想听听曾经出国留学的人的意见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hear of sb/sth </b><br>to know about sb/sth because you have been told about them/it听说，得知(某人/某事) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve heard of the Alexander technique, but I don’t know anything about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说过亚历山大方法，可我对此一点都不了解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve never heard of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未听到过他的消息。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> UNHEARD-OF at HEAR OF SB/STH,HEAR STH OF SB/STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hear of sb/sth;'hear sth of sb/sth </b><br>to have news of sb/sth得到…的消息；获悉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was sorry to hear of your accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 获悉你遇到了意外，我很难过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was last heard of in Liverpool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后一次听到他的消息时，他在利物浦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re going abroad? This is <b>the first I’ve heard of it</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要出国？这可是我第一次听说这件事！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp From what I’ve heard of Andy, he’s become very successful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从我所掌握的有关安迪的情况来看，他已经十分成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I expect we’ll hear more of this band in the future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我期待着以后能更经常地听到这支乐队的消息。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> NOT HEAR OF STH,NOT HEAR OF SB DOING STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>un'heard-of <i>adj </i></b><br>that has never been known or done; surprising前所未闻的；空前的；惊人的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s almost unheard-of for it to rain there in July.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那里七月份下雨很罕见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>not 'hear of sth;not 'hear of sb doing sth</b><br>to not allow something or not allow sb to do sth拒绝(或不允许)某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I offered to go but she wouldn’t hear of it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我建议由我去，但她不允许。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wouldn’t hear of us postponing the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们就是不同意我们推迟旅行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> UNHEARD-OF at HEAR OF SB/STH,HEAR STH OF SB/STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hear sb 'out </b><br>to listen until sb has finished saying what they want to say听某人把话说完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know you don’t believe me, but please hear me out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道你不相信我，可是请听我说完！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
heat	<h3>heat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,heat 'up <i>(AmE</i>)=HOT UP</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,heat 'up; ,heat sth 'up </b><br>to become warm or hot;to make sth warm or hot(使)变热，变暖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pipes will expand as they heat up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 管子变热就会膨胀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can heat up the soup in the microwave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以把汤放在微波炉里热一热。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>warm up,warm sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
hedge	<h3>hedge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hedge sth a'bout/a'round/ 'round with sth (<i>BrE</i>, <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to surround and limit sth with conditions or restrictions(以… ) 限定… ，限制…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Employment is hedged around with legislation nowadays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今雇工受法律限制。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hedge sb/sth 'in </b><br>to surround sb/sth with sth;to restrict the freedom of sb to do sth围着(或框着…)；约束住…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cathedral is hedged in by other buildings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大桝堂四周有建筑物围着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt hedged in by all the rules and regulations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他感觉被这一切规章制度束缚住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fence sb in;hem sb/sth in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
help	<h3>help<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,help sth a'long </b><br>to try to make sth happen more quickly or easily促进，加速(…的发生或发展) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother always says that a cup of tea helps things along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲总是说喝杯茶效率高。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father’s name helped along his career in the early days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲的名字早年助他拓平了事业的道路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,help sb 'off/ 'on with sth </b><br>to help sb to take off or put on a piece of clothing, such as a coat帮某人脱/穿衣服:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I help you off with your coat?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来帮你脱大衣好吧？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She helped him on with his dressing gown.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她帮他穿上了晨衣。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,help 'out (with sth), ,help sb 'out (with sth) </b><br>to help sb in order to make things easier for them,for example by doing some of their work or by giving them money(在…上)提供协助，减轻某人的负担:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thank you for helping out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感谢你帮我解围。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dad said he’d help me out with money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父亲说他会借钱给我解急的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'help sb to sth;'help yourself to sth </b><br>to give sb/yourself some food or drink为某人/自己取用(食物或饮料) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I help anyone to more chicken? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再给哪位来点鸡肉好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please help yourselves to salad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用色拉请自便。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
hem	<h3>hem<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hem sb/sth 'in </b><br>to surround sb/sth with sth so that they cannot move freely围着，框住(某人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thick trees hemmed them in on all sides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茂密的树木环绕着他们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship was hemmed in by the ice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船的四周都是冰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)We felt hemmed in by restrictions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们觉得条条框框太多了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fence sb in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
