hide	<h3>hide<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hide a'way; ,hide yourself a'way </b><br>to go to a place secretly because you do not want anyone to find you躲起来；躲藏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She used to hide away in her room when she got depressed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她以前心情沮丧就躲在自己房间里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hid herself away until she felt better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她躲起来直到心情好些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hideaway <i>n </i></b><br>a place where sb goes to be alone藏身处；躲藏的地方<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hide sb/sth a'way </b><br>to put sb/sth in a secret place so that no one else can find them/it把人(或东西) 藏起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You won’t find your present — I’ve hidden it away! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你找不到你的礼物的─我藏起来了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hide 'out </b><br>to go to a secret place to escape from sb who is trying to find you躲藏， 隐匿(避开某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hid out in the woods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他藏在树林里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hideout <i>n </i></b><br>a place where sb goes when they do not want to be found藏身处<br>\n
hike	<h3>hike<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hike sth 'up </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to lift or pull up a piece of clothing that you are wearing拉起， 提起(衣服):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hiked up his trousers and waded into the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他提起裤子走进水中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hitch sth up </b><br>to increase a price or rate suddenly and by a large amount大幅提高价格(或收费等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hiked up the price by 40%.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把价格猛增了40%。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>jack sth up <i>(informal</i>),put sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
hinge	<h3>hinge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hinge on sth (<i>also</i> 'hinge upon sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>if an action, a result, etc. <b>hinges on/upon</b> sth, it depends on it completely or is strongly influenced by it取决于… ； 有赖于… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My whole career could hinge on the results of these exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一生的职业很可能就取决于这些考试结果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The success of the project hinges on how well everyone works together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个项目能否成功取决于大家的合作情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
hint	<h3>hint<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hint at sth </b><br>to suggest in an indirect way that sth is true or likely暗示；透露；示意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In his speech the Prime Minister hinted at an early election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首相在讲话中暗示会提前选举。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The problem was only hinted at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题只是从侧面提到过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
hire	<h3>hire<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hire sb 'out; ,hire yourself 'out (to sb) (as sth )</b><br>to arrange for sb to work for sb else; to arrange to work for sb安排聘用某人； 受雇(于… )(为…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The agency hires out cleaning staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家服务公司安排清洁人员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hires himself out to farmers at harvest time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到了收穫季节他就给农人当雇工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had been hired out to them as an expert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他曾经以专家身分受聘于他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hire sth 'out (to sb) </b><br>to allow sb to use sth for a short period of time in return for payment租出…；把…租给某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The club will hire out tennis rackets to guests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 俱乐部让访客租用网球拍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>equipment,boat</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>let sth out (to sb);rent sth out (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
hit	<h3>hit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hit 'back (at sb/sth) </b><br>to criticize or attack sb who has criticized or attacked you回击；反击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In an interview she hit back at her critics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在访谈中反驳了批评她的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bite back (at sb/sth);strike back (at/against sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hit sb for sth (<i>also</i> ,hit sb 'up for sth) (<i>slang</i>,<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to ask sb for sth, especially money向某人索要(尤指钱):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hit us for a commission as well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们还向我们索取佣金呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always hitting me up for the cab fare home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是要我出打车回家的钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does he always hit you for cash when he wants new clothes? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想买新衣服时总是向你伸手要钱吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hit it 'off (with sb) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>if two people <b>hit it off</b> with each other, they like each other and become friendly immediately(和某人)一见如故:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hit it off from the start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一见如故。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She didn’t really hit it off with the office manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她和办公室经理有点不投缘。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hit on sb <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to talk to sb in a way that shows you are sexually attracted to them开始与某人调情:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was hitting on my girlfriend! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他居然在勾引我的女朋友！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hit on sth (<i>also</i> 'hit upon sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>(<i>not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to think of a plan, a solution, etc. suddenly or by chance突然有个好主意；偶然想到妙点子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hit on an idea for raising money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她灵机一动想到了个筹款的主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I realized I’d hit upon a solution to one of our main problems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我意识到我找到了解决一个主要问题的方法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea,method,formula,solution</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>light on/upon sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hit 'out (at sb/sth) </b><br>to attack sb violently, especially sb who is trying to hit or capture you猛烈攻击(尤指想打或抓自己的人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hit out at the policeman as he tried to arrest her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她奋力击打想抓捕她的警察。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just hit out blindly in all directions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只是向四方乱击一通。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>strike out (at sb/sth) </b><br>to criticize sb or sth strongly狠狠抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hit out at the government’s decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他严厉抨击了政府的决定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lash out (at sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hit sb 'up for sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)=HIT SB FOR STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hit upon sth=HIT ON STH</b><br>\n
hitch	<h3>hitch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hitch sth 'up </b><br>to pull up a piece of your clothing拉起，提起(衣服):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hitched up our skirts and climbed over the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们提起裙子翻过了那堵墙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hike sth up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
hive	<h3>hive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hive sth 'off (into/to sth) (<i>business</i>) </b><br>to separate sth from a larger group; to sell part of a company把一部份分离出来；卖掉公司的一部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the firm’s operations have been hived off into a separate company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司的一些业务已分离出来，成立了一家独立公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
hold	<h3>hold<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth a'gainst sb </b><br>to allow sth bad that sb has done to make you like or respect them less对…记仇(或恨等)；对…抱成见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know I was stupid — I hope you won’t <b>hold it against</b> me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道我很愚蠢─希望你别因此而看不起我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you hold any grudges against him? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你怨恨他吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t <b>hold it against</b> him <b>that</b> he lied to me twice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不因为他对我说过两次谎而责怪他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>it,grudge</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'back (from doing sth); ,hold sb 'back(from doing sth) </b><br>to hesitate, or to make sb hesitate,to act or speak(使)犹豫，踌躇:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t hold back! This opportunity is too good to miss! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别犹豫了！机不可失啊！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Phil walked forward confidently but something held Ben back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 菲尔信心十足地走向前去，本却踌躇不定的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I nearly told him what I thought of him, but I held back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我差点把我对他的看法告诉了他，但又没有开口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb/sth 'back</b><br>to prevent sb/sth from moving forward or from entering or leaving a place拦阻；阻挡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police were unable to hold back the fans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察拦不住那些崇拜者。</font><br>to prevent the progress or development of sb/sth妨碍进展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now that he’s got this job, there’ll be <b>no holding him back</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 既然他现在已经得到了这份工作，就没有什么能制约他的了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Teaching all the children together can hold the brighter children back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把所有孩子放在一起桝会妨碍较聪明的孩子的进步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Low rates of investment will hold back technical progress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 低投资会阻碍技术进步的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parents claim the tests are being used to hold children back }(= not let them progress to the next class)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 家长们声称这些测试是用来阻止孩子们升级的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'back </b><br>to stop yourself from expressing or showing how you feel抑制，控制(感情等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They couldn’t hold back their laughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们忍不住大笑起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struggled to hold back his tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他竭力没让眼泪流出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your tears,your laughter</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep sth back;contain sth (<i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to not tell sb sth that you wish to keep secret不透露情况:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think he’s holding something back; he knows more than he’s admitting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他有什么事瞒着；他知道的比他坦白的要多。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>something,anything,information</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>withhold sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to keep sth such as money to use later留出，留下(钱等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ￡1 000 of the grant will be held back until the project is completed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将从拨款中扣下1 000英镑，等项目完成之后再发放。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'back on sth </b><br>to try to spend only a little time, money, etc. on sth; to show control in what you do节省； 节制； 克制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My grandmother never held back on the tea and cakes when we visited.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们去拜访祖母时，她从不吝惜茶点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held back on her questioning }(= she did not ask too many questions)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有提很多问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb 'down </b><br>to prevent sb from having their freedom or rights剥夺某人的自由(或权利)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb/sth 'down </b><br>to use force to hold sb/sth in a particular position and stop them/it from moving按住某人(或某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was held down and kicked by the two men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被那两个男人按住并踢了几脚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold the mouse button down as you move the cursor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 移动光标时压住鼠标的键。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'down </b><br>to manage to keep a job, position,etc. even though it may be difficult for you to do so保住(工作、职位等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He doesn’t seem able to hold down a full-time job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他似乎没有能力保住一份全职工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>a job </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to keep sth at a low level保持…于低水平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is trying to hold down costs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司正力图保持低成本。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rate of inflation must be held down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通货膨胀率必须控制在低水平上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>prices,wages,inflation,costs</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep sth down </b><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to limit sth,especially a noise限制(尤指噪音):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Hold it down</b>, will you? I’m trying to sleep! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小点声行吗？我要睡觉！</font><br><i>(usually used in negative sentences</i>通常用于否定句) to be able to eat food without bringing it back out of your mouth吃下…(不吐出来):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hasn’t been able to hold any food down since the operation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手术之后她一直是一吃东西就全吐掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>food</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep sth down</b><br>to not allow yourself to show or express a strong emotion克制，忍住(强烈感情):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to hold down the urge to hit him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得强忍住要揍他的慾望。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'forth (on/about sth) (<i>formal </i> or <i>humorous</i>)</b><br>to speak for a long time and often in a boring or annoying way喋喋不休；大发议论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was holding forth about how successful his business is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他滔滔不绝地谈他的公司如何红火。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'in </b><br>to keep sth inside a place so that it cannot fall out or escape把…固定在里面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The straps hold the baby in securely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 带子把婴儿安全地系在里面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to hold my stomach in }(=pull the muscles flat)&b{ to zip up my jeans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得收腹以便拉上牛仔裤的拉锁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your stomach,your tummy </b><br>to not show or express how you feel不显露(感觉):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t hold in my anger any longer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我再也忍不住怒火了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>let sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'off </b><br>if rain or a storm, etc. <b>holds off</b>, it does not start(雨或风暴)不来，延迟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope the rain holds off for the wedding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望等婚礼结束之后再下雨。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep off </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,hold 'off sth, ,hold 'off (from) doing sth</b>) to delay doing sth推迟(做某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to make a decision soon, but I’ll hold off until next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得很快作决定，但我会推迟到下个星期。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee will hold off their decision until they receive the report.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会要等收到报告后再作决定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m holding off buying a dress until the sales start.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要等开始降价时才买件连衣裙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb/sth 'off </b><br>to resist an attack by an enemy or an opponent抵抗；战胜；抗击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long do you think you can hold off the attack?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你认为你对这一攻击能抵抗多久？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He held off a late challenge from Davies to win the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他战胜了戴维斯后来居上的威胁，赢了赛跑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'on </b><br><i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>) used to ask sb to wait or stop for a short time等等；停住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold on a minute — I’m not quite ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 稍等一下─我还没准备好呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold on! That doesn’t sound right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等一下！这好像不对。</font><br>to survive in a difficult or dangerous situation; to continue doing sth although it is difficult(在困境或危险中)坚持住，挺住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They managed to hold on until help arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们勉强坚持到救援到来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'on; ,hold 'onto sth/sb; ,hold 'on to sth/sb </b><br>to hold sth/sb tightly; to not let go of sth/sb抓紧；不放开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Hold on tight</b>— I’m going to speed up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抓紧─我要加速了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold onto your hat or it’ll blow away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 捂住你的帽子，免得吹跑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to hold onto the chair for support.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只好抓着椅子支壠住。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang on,hang onto sth/sb,hang on to sth/sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'on</b><br>to keep sth in position so that it cannot fall off固定某物的位置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is these nuts and bolts that hold the wheels on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是这些螺母和螺栓把轮子固定住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'onto sb/sth; ,hold 'on to sb/sth </b><br>to keep sth/sb; to not lose sth/sb把人或物留下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold on to the magazines for as long as you like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽量把杂志保存长一点时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party will hold on to its majority at the next election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个党在下次选举中将保持其多数优势。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s a good worker.You should hold on to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很能干。你应该把她留住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must pass the ball else and not hold onto it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须把球传给别人，不要粘球。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang onto sb/sth,hang on to sb/sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'out </b><br>if money or supplies, etc. <b>hold out</b>,they last or remain(钱或其他东西)供应持续，未完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m staying here for as long as my money holds out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要在这里一直呆到我的钱花光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think the fine weather will hold out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认为好天气会持续下去吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>last out </b><br>(<b>against sb/sth</b> ) to resist an attack抵抗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The town continues to hold out against enemy bombing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座镇子继续抵御敌人的轰炸。</font><br>(<b>against sth</b>) to refuse to accept sth that you not agree with拒绝，拒不接受(不同意的事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can’t hold out against industrialization any longer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不能再拒绝工业化了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>give in (to sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'holdout <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>someone who resists an attack, an enemy or an opponent, or who refuses to accept sth抵抗者；抵御者；拒绝者<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'out sth </b><br>to offer a chance, hope or possibility of sth提供机会；给予希望；使有可能:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He may come, but I don’t <b>hold out much hope</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他可能来，可我不抱很大希望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This method seems to hold out the greatest promise of success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种方法似乎最有希望成功。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the promise/prospect/possibility of…,hope</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'out </b><br>to hold sth such as your hand or sth in your hand, in front of you towards sb else伸出手(或胳膊)；递出东西:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held her cup out for more coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她递过杯子来要再添点咖啡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘You must be Kate,’ he said, holding out his hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你一定是凯特。”他说着伸过手来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hand</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'out for sth </b><br>to deliberately delay reaching an agreement in the hope that you will gain sth;to refuse to accept anything less than what you are asking for(为得到利益)拖延达成协议；拒绝让步:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Union leaders are holding out for a better deal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会领导人拖延着，以期达成较优厚的协议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'out on sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to refuse to tell or give sb sth拒绝告诉(或给予)某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You promised to give me the money. Stop holding out on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你答应过给我钱的。不许赖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'over </b><br>to leave sth to be dealt with later搁置；推迟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We decided to hold the matter over until the next meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决定把这件事推迟到下次会议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>postpone sth </b><br><i>(AmE</i>)to show a film/movie or play for longer than planned because it is so successful延长(电影、戏剧等)的上演期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The show is being held over for another month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演出正在延续，为期一个月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'holdover <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>a person who keeps a position of power, for example sb who had a particular position in one government and who still has it in the next留任人员；(在下届政府中)留任的官员<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sth 'over sb </b><br>to use sth that you know about sb in order to threaten them and to make them do what you want抓住某人的把柄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to give him anything to hold over me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想给他留下任何把柄来要挟我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hold to sth </b><br>if you <b>hold to</b> an opinion, a belief,etc., you do not change it坚持(意见、信念等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always holds to her principles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她始终坚持自己的原则。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep to sth;stick to sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hold sb to sth </b><br>to make sb keep a promise要求某人遵守诺言:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘I promise I’ll take you out to dinner if we win.’ ‘I’ll hold you to that!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “如果我们赢了，我答应请你出去吃饭。”“你得说话算数啊！ ” </font><br><i>(sport</i>) to stop your opponent in a sports competition winning more points than you压住对手；不让对方得分超过自己:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spain held France to a 1-1 draw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 西班牙队把法国队迫成了1 :1的平局。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hold sth to sth </b><br>to place sth close to sth else把…靠近…放:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He held a knife to her throat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把刀搁在她的喉咙上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold to'gether; ,hold sth to'gether </b><br>to remain, or to keep sb/sth, united(使) 保持团结:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coalition has held together for longer than expected.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联盟坚持的时间超出预料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strong bonds of loyalty hold the family together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 绝对的忠诚把全家人连结在一起。</font><br>if ideas,arguments, etc. <b>hold together</b>, or sth <b>holds them together</b>, they are logical and the parts agree with each other(思想、论点等)合乎逻辑，连贯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ideas don’t really hold together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的思想有点松散。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Words like ‘however’, ‘therefore’, ‘although’, etc. can hold your text together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “然而”、“所以”、“尽管”等词能使你的文章连贯起来。</font><br>to remain in one piece; to stay in good condition未破碎；完好无损:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a miracle that his car is still holding together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的汽车依然完好真是个奇迹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His trousers were held together by safety pins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的裤子是用安全别针别在一块的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold 'up </b><br>to remain healthy, in good condition or working effectively, especially when there are difficulties支持住；承受住；支壠得住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sales have held up well, in spite of economic difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管遇到了经济困难，销售额还相当可观。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did your tent hold up in the storm? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的帐篷在风暴中是怎样支壠起来的？</font><br>if an idea, an argument, etc. <b>holds up</b>, it remains strong when you analyse it carefully(想法、论据等)经得起推敲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think his argument really holds up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他的论点实际上站不住脚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb/sth 'up </b><br>to raise sb/sth in the air举起；抬起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held up her hand to stop him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抬起手阻挡他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He held up his trophy as the crowd applauded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在众人的欢呼声中举起奖杯。</font><br>to support sb/sth and prevent it/them from falling搀扶；支壠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her trousers were held up with string.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的裤子是用绳子系着的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two pillars were holding the ceiling up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两根柱子承托着天花板。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep sth up </b><br>to block or delay the progress of sb/sth阻碍；延迟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Roadworks on the motorway are holding up traffic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高速公路检修造成了交通阻塞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She phoned to say she’d been held up at the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打电话来说她在办公室脱不开身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to hold you up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想耽误你的时间。</font><br>to rob a person, a bank, a shop/store, etc. using a gun持枪抢劫某人(或银行、商店等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have they caught the people who held up the bank? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们抓到持枪抢劫银行的人了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'hold-up <i>n </i></b><br>a delay or sth which causes a delay延误；阻滞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What’s the hold-up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遇到什么障碍了？ </font><br>an act of robbing a person, a bank, a shop/store, etc. using a gun持枪抢劫<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hold sb/sth 'up as sth </b><br>to present sb/sth as an example of sth将某人(或某事物)作为…的例子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother held up my cousin as an example of a good student.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我母亲把我表哥看作好学生的代表。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点，我们五分钟之后必须走！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish the bus would hurry up and come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望公共汽车能快点来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish the waiter would hurry up with our soup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望服务员能快些把我们的汤端来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,hurry sb/sth 'up </b><br>to encourage sb to move or work faster; to do sth to make sth happen faster催促(某人) ； 加速… 的发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hurry your brother up or we’ll be late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让你弟弟快点，不然我们要迟到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Hurry it up</b> — we haven’t got all day! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加紧点做─ 我们可没有一整天的时间！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is there a way of <b>hurrying things up</b> ?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有没有办法把事情往前赶？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n

indulge	<h3>indulge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>in'dulge in sth </b><br>to allow yourself to have or do sth that you like, often sth that is bad for you沉湎，沉溺，沉迷(于…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She indulged in the luxury of a long bath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在澡盆里泡了半天，尽情享受了一番。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He now has time to indulge in his favourite hobby:photography.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他现在有时间尽情投入他的爱好— 摄影。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to indulge in a chocolate cake! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要享用巧克力蛋糕了！</font><br>to take part in an activity, especially sth bad or illegal参加，参与(尤指坏事或违法活动) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shouldn’t indulge in speculation as to what really happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不应该对实际发生的事胡乱猜测。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a luxury that can only be indulged in from time to time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种奢侈只能偶尔享用一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不请我进里面喝杯咖啡吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ask sb in/up <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>in,vite sb 'out </b><br>to ask sb to go out with you, especially as a way of beginning a romantic relationship请某人外出约会(尤指为建立恋爱关系):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve been invited out for dinner this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚我们应邀出去吃饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He eventually found the courage to invite Julia out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他终于鼓起勇气约朱莉娅外出。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ask sb out <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>in,vite sb 'over/ 'round <i>(BrE</i>)(<i>AmE </i>,invite sb a'round) </b><br>to ask sb to come and visit you in your home邀请某人到家中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve invited a few friends round to watch the game with us on TV.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我请了几个朋友来家里一起看这场电视转播的比赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ought to invite the new neighbours over for coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该邀请新邻居来家里喝咖啡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ask sb over/round <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>in,vite sb 'up=INVITE SB IN/UP</b><br>\n

the office while I’m working.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我工作时请不要进办公室。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,keep 'out of sth; ,keep sb 'out of sth </b><br>to avoid sth; to prevent sb/yourself from being affected by sth避免某事；(使)免受…的影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor has advised me to keep out of the sth避免(让…)卷入/参与…；使置身于…之外:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep out of this! key	<h3>key<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,key sth 'in; ,key sth 'into sth </b><br>to put information into a computer, using a keyboard键入，输入(信息)；把信息输入(或键入)计算机:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Key in your personal number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 输入你的个人号码。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the information has been keyed into the computer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有信息均已输入电脑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>data,information</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>enter sth (into sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,key 'into sth</b><br>to use a computer or information stored on a computer调用计算机(或计算机内存信息):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A hacker keyed into a vital database at the newspaper’s office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名黑客窃入了这家报馆的重要数据库。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>access sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>if sth <b>keys into</b> sth else, it goes well with it and agrees with it, producing a good result适合于某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp remedies that key into the body’s basic metabolism </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 能配合身体基本新陈代谢的疗法</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'key sth to sth/sb </b><br>to make sth suitable for sth/sb; to make sth consistent with sth else or to link sth with sth else使某事物适合…；使某事物与…一致(或衔接):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farm was keyed to the needs of the local people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农场是根据当地人的需要而经营的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The timing of the concerts was keyed to the World Cup soccer games.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些音乐会是配合世界杯足球赛来安排时间的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
kick	<h3>kick<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick a'bout; ,kick a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=KICK AROUND,KICK AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick sb a'bout <i>(BrE</i>)=KICK SB AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick sth a'bout <i>(BrE</i>)=KICK STH AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick a'round; ,kick a'round sth <i>(BrE also</i> ,kick a'bout, ,kick a'bout sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) <br>to be present or lying somewhere not being used存在；被闲置；闲置不用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His letter is kicking about somewhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的信不知放到哪儿了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea has been kicking around for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个想法多年没提起过了。</font><br>(of a person人) to be somewhere, or to go from one place to another,with no particular purpose(无目的地)四处游荡，闲逛，到处走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I decided to kick around the States for a couple of months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决定在美国各地转悠几个月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock around,knock around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick sb a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,kick sb a'bout)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to treat sb in a harsh or unfair way苛刻(或不公正地)对待某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let the boss kick you around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让老板欺负你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick sth a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,kick sth a'bout) </b><br>to play with a ball by kicking it with your foot踢球:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were kicking a ball around in the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在街上踢球。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>ball </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to discuss plans, ideas, etc. in an informal way非正式谈论(或讨论)…；随便谈谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re kicking around the idea of a merger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在纵谈合併的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>discuss sth <i>(more formal</i>),knock sth around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'kick against sth </b><br>to protest about sth or resist sth反对，反抗，抵抗(某事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s no use kicking against the system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反对这个制度也没有用。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,kick 'back <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to relax放松:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent the evening kicking back in the hotel’s piano bar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp used(某人)在某处闲散；(某物)闲置在某个地方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These chocolates have been knocking around since New Year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ofdifferent situations)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰夫会有办法的─他见多识广。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>kick around,kick around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sth 'back (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to drink sth quickly很快喝掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked back ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sb 'down </b><br>if a car or another vehicle<b>knocks sb down</b>, it hits them, often killing or injuring them(汽车等)撞倒某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was knocked down by a bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一辆公共汽车把她撞倒在地。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run sb over</b><br>to hit or push sb so 他第一回合就将对手击倒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> KNOCK SB OVER<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp you could have knocked me down with a 'feather<br>used to express great surprise(表示惊讶)太离奇了，难以置信<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'knock-down <i>n </i></b><br>an occasion in boxing when one competitor hits the other so hard that they fall to the ground(拳击比赛)击倒<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> KNOCK-DOWN PRICE at KNOCK STH DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sb/sth 'down </b><br>to persuade sb to accept a lower price for sth; to make the price of sth lower说服…降价；使降价；杀价:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked Simon down to ￡5.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他让西蒙把价格降到了5英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We knocked the price down to ￡10.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把价格杀到了10 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you manage to knock them down from ￡5000 to ￡4 000? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是如何说服他们从5 000 英镑降到4000 英镑的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to knock the price down from ￡350 to ￡320.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他设法把价格从350 英镑杀到了320 英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>beat sb/sth down</b><br><b>Knock sb down sth </b>and <b>knock sth down sth</b> can also be used.也可以说<b>knock sb down sth</b> 或<b>knock sth down sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should be able to knock them down a few pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该能使他们降价几英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked the price down five dollars.</font></i><br><font fall down推倒(或拆掉、拆毁)某物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you don’t open up, I’m going to knock the door down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是不开门， 我就要踹门了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These old houses are going to be knocked down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些旧房子将要拆掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>house,door</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>demolish sth (<i>more formal</i>) </b><br>(<b>to sb</b>) to sell sth to the person who offers most money at a public sale (an<b>auction</b> )(拍卖会上)卖出；拍卖掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The painting was knocked down to me for ￡5 000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那幅画以5000 英镑成交拍卖给了我。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to take sth apart, especially furniture, so that it can be sent or carried somewhere more easily拆卸，拆开(尤指傢具)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'knock-down price <i>n </i></b><br>a much lower price than usual低价；特价:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got these books at a knockdown price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以低价买到这些书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> KNOCK-DOWN at KNOCK SB DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sth 'in; ,knock sth 'in/ 'into sth </b><br>to make sth enter sth by hitting it, for ,knock sb 'off sth </b><br>to make sb fall off sth by hitting them把某人(从…上)撞倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was knocked off my bike this morning }(=by a car)&b{.</font></i><br><font 'out</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to complete sth quickly and without much effort迅速而轻松地完成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They expect me to knock off }(= write)&b{ a thousand words a them(气愤时说)我要揍扁你<br>&nbsp&nbsp knock/blow sb’s 'socks off<br>to impress or surprise sb very much给某人留下深刻印象；使某人感到惊奇<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sb 'out </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,knock yourself 'out</b>) to make sb fall asleep or become unconscious使入睡；使昏睡；使不省人事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bump on the head knocked me <b>out cold</b> .</font></i><br><font boxing拳击) to hit an opponent so hard that they fall to the ground and cannot get up within a limited time, so losing the fight击败对手<br>(<i>also</i> <b>,knock yourself 'out</b>) to make sb very tired, It knocked me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这电影棒极了，着实令我赞叹不已。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'knockout (<i>also </i>'knock-out) <i>n </i></b><br>a person,a piece of clothing, a performance, etc. that is extremely attractive or impressive引人注目(或给人留下深刻印象)的人(或衣服、演出等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her daughter’s an absolute knockout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的女儿简直令人倾倒。</font><br>(in boxing拳击) a blow that is so hard that your opponent falls to the ground and cannot get up within a limited time,so losing the fight击倒对手的一击；击倒对手获胜<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> KNOCKOUT at KNOCK SB/STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'knockout drops <i>n </i></b><br>[pl.] (<i>humorous</i>) medicine in liquid form that makes you sleep or feel sleepy麻醉药水；蒙药<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sb/sth 'out; ,knock sb/sth 'out of sth <i>(sport</i>)</b><br>to defeat a person or a team so that they cannot continue in the competition把某人(或队伍)淘汰出(比赛):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp France knocked Belgium out of the European Cup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法国队把比利时队淘汰出欧洲杯赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'knockout (<i>also </i>'knock-out) <i>n</i> (<i>especially BrE</i>,<i>sport</i>)</b><br>a competition in which the winning player or team at each stage goes on to the next stage,but the losing one no longer takes part in the competition淘汰赛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the European cup knockout</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欧洲杯淘汰赛</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a knockout competition </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 淘汰赛</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> KNOCKOUT at KNOCK SB OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock sth 'out</b><br>1=KNOCK STH OFF 1 (<i>informal</i>)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you knock out a quick report for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能不能给我赶写一份报告？</font><br>to remove sth with a hard blow猛敲掉；打落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knocked out her front teeth in the fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她摔了一跤，把门牙碰掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>teeth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knock yourself 'out </b><br>=KNOCK SB OUT 1 <br>=KNOCK SB OUT 3 <br><i>(informal</i>, <i>humorous</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) used to encourage sb to do sth they have said they would like to do, even though you do not understand why they want to do it(用于鼓励)来试试吧，好吧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You want to help? know	<h3>know<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'know sb/sth as sth </b><br>to call sb/sth by a particular name; to think that sb/sth has a particular characteristic or is a particular type of person or thing把…称为；认为…具有某特质；把…看成某类人(或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is known to her friends as Beth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的朋友们叫她贝思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It became known as the worst local company to work for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 它成了雇员公认的最差的本地公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'known for sth </b><br>to be well known because of a particular characteristic, achievement or feature因…而闻名；因…而出名:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The town is best known for its ancient university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座镇子最出名的是一所古老大学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is not known for his tact! }(= he is often rude)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常常出言不逊！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'know A from B</b><br>to be able to recognize the difference between two things能区分，能辨别(两事物) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t know a Rolls Royce from a Renault.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她分辨不出劳斯莱斯车和雷诺车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp not know your ,arse from your 'elbow(<i>BrE</i>,!, <i>slang</i>) <br>used to say that you think sb is very stupid or completely lacking in skill笨蛋；白痴；屁都不懂<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'know of sb/sth </b><br>to have heard of sb/sth, but not have very much information about or experience of them/it听说过；略知一二:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Has he ever been in trouble with the police?’ ‘Not that I know of.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “他曾被警方抓获吗？”“据我所知没有。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know of one student who failed the exam twice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说过一个学生两次没通过这个考试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know of her, but we’ve never actually met.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对她有所耳闻，可我们实际上未曾谋面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
knuckle	<h3>knuckle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knuckle 'down (to sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to begin to work seriously at sth, usually after a period when you have not worked hard(闲散之后)开始努力(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to knuckle down (<i>to some hard work</i>).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得开始认真(刻苦工作)了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>buckle down (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,knuckle 'under (to sb/sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to accept or admit defeat and do what you are told or what you have to do(向…)屈服，低头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those who refused to knuckle under were imprisoned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不肯妥协的人被关押起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
kowtow	<h3>kowtow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>kow'tow to sb/sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to show sb/sth too much respect and be too willing to obey them(对…)卑躬屈膝，俯首帖耳:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I refuse to kowtow to anyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决不屈从任何人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
labour (<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i> labor)	<h3>labour (<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i> labor)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'labour under sth <i>(BrE</i>)(<i>formal</i>)</b><br>(<i>often used in the progressive tenses</i> 常用于进行时) to believe sth that is not true为…所蒙蔽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to be labouring under a delusion </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有错觉</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was labouring under the impression that he loved her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她以前一直有错觉，以为他爱她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>misapprehension,delusion </b><br>to find a situation very difficult because of sth因…而处境艰难；为…而苦恼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new government is labouring under a huge debt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新一届政府负债累累，举步维艰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
lace	<h3>lace<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lace 'up; ,lace sth 'up </b><br>to tie the strings that go through the holes on a shoe to fasten it (<b>shoelaces</b> or <b>laces</b> ) 把鞋带系牢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laced her shoes up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她系好了鞋带。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>shoes,boots</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>do up,do sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lace-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually pl.] (<i>BrE</i>) shoes fastened with strings系带鞋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As a child, she always wore lace-ups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她小时候总是穿系带鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp lace-up shoes </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 系带鞋</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lace sth with sth </b><br>to put a small amount of sth, such as alcohol, a drug, poison, etc. into a drink给(饮料)掺(少许酒、药、毒药等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone had laced the cat’s milk with alcohol.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人在猫的奶里加了点酒。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to put a lot of a particular quality into sth such as a speech, a piece of writing, etc.把(讲话、文章等)大加润色:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The show is laced with black humour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次演出富于黑色幽默。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laces her stories with irony.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的故事都运用大量讽刺。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
ladle	<h3>ladle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ladle sth 'out </b><br>to serve food with a large spoon or in large quantities(用大汤勺)舀出，盛出；盛出(很多食物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ladled out the soup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用大勺分汤。</font><br><i>(sometimes disapproving</i>) to give sb a lot of sth, especially money or advice大量给予，给以一大堆(尤指金钱或建议)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
lag	<h3>lag<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lag be'hind; ,lag be'hind sb/sth </b><br>to be behind sb/sth because you are walking more slowly落后；落在…后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone ran down to the beach, but Amy lagged behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家都向海滩跑去， 只有埃米落在后面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Susie lagged behind the other children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 苏西落在其他孩子后面。</font><br>(<b>in sth/in doing sth</b>) to progress or develop more slowly than others(…方面)进展比… 缓慢； 落后； 滞后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are lagging far behind our European competitors in using new technology.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在使用新技术方面远远落后于我们的欧洲对手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
land	<h3>land<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'land in sth;'land sb/yourself in sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to get sb/yourself into trouble or a difficult situation(使他人或自己)陷入…境地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She landed in court for stealing a car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因为偷车而要出庭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being too outspoken landed her in trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她太直率，惹了麻烦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did I land myself in such a mess? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我怎么陷入了这种困境？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He really <b>landed</b> us <b>in it</b> ! }(= got us into trouble)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他可把我们害惨了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,land 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to reach a final position or situation终于到达(某位置)；最终落到(某种处境):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She landed up in hospital with a broken leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 结果她断了一条腿住进了医院。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train was diverted and we landed up in York.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车改变路线，我们最后到了约克。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dish slipped out of my hands and landed up on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盘子从我手中滑落，掉到了地板上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I landed up with more work than I could manage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到头来我的活多得难以应付。</font><br><b>land up doing sth </b> to end by doing sth or having to do sth that you had not planned to do最终要做(意料之外的事)收场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They landed up paying for the damage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后他们只得赔偿损失。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We landed up spending the night at the airport.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最后只好在机场过夜了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>end up;finish up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'land sb/yourself with sb/sth;'land sb/yourself with doing sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to give sb/yourself an unpleasant or difficult task to deal with把重担(或苦差事等)给别人/自己:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve landed ourselves with the most boring job of the lot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们承担了其中最枯燥乏味的工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got landed with clearing up the mess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打扫这片狼藉的活落在了我的头上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They landed the organization with a huge bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们要这个机构支付巨额的账单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>saddle sb/yourself with sb/sth,saddle sb/yourself with doing sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Guess who got landed with washing the dishes? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猜猜洗碗的事落到谁头上了？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
lap	<h3>lap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lap sth 'up </b><br>to receive sth such as praise or a kind remark with pleasure without thinking about whether it is true or not不加考虑接受好话(等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby was lapping up the attention he was getting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小孩子发现有人看他就高兴起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lapped up his flattery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的恭维话她照单全收。</font><br>to drink all of sth with great enjoyment开怀畅饮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat lapped up the cream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫把奶油津津有味地舔光了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
lapse	<h3>lapse<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lapse into sth </b><br>to pass gradually into a worse or less active state or condition(逐渐)陷入，进入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lapsed into silence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们陷入了沉默。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country lapsed into chaos.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国家陷入混乱状态。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to lapse into unconsciousness/a coma</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 逐渐失去知觉/陷入昏迷状态</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>silence,unconsciousness </b><br>to start speaking or behaving in a different way, often one that is less acceptable说话或举止开始异常:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lapses into French when she can’t think of a word in English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她想不出英语词就用法语。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

lark	<h3>lark<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lark a'bout/a'round <i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to enjoy yourself by behaving in a silly way傻玩；胡闹；嬉戏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some kids were larking about in the shopping centre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些孩子在购物中心嬉戏。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>mess around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
lash	<h3>lash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lash 'down </b><br>if rain <b>lashes down</b>, it falls heavily(雨)下得很大，下得猛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain lashed down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大雨倾盆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lash 'out (at sb/sth) </b><br>to make a sudden violent attack on sb(突然)狠打，痛打:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lashed out at us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然对我们大打出手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim lashed out with both fists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆突然双手挥拳猛打起来。</font><br>to criticize sb/sth in an angry way怒斥；严厉斥责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lashed out at the company for treating her so badly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她猛烈抨击公司如此亏待她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit out (at sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
last	<h3>last<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,last 'out; ,last sth 'out </b><br>to survive for a period of time存活，活过(一段时间):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long can we last out without water? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不喝水能活多长时间？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctors thought he might not last out the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生们以为他可能活不过那晚。</font><br>to continue in the same situation or manage to do sth for a particular length of time坚持下去；坚持(在某段时间内)做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made it to the summit, but at one point I thought he wasn’t going to last out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他达到了颠峰，可我一度以为他坚持不下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lasted out for a week without smoking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坚持了一个星期不抽烟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you last out the day without using your phone?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能坚持一天不用电话吗？</font><br>to be enough for a particular length of time够用；够维持(某段时间) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our supplies should last out until the end of the month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的贮备品应足够维持到月底。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will the food last out the week? </font></i><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,last sb 'out </b><br><i>(often humorous</i>) to live or continue longer than sb else活过，寿命超过(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My grandmother is so fit and healthy she’ll probably last us all out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我祖母身体这么硬朗健康，她很可能比我们大家都长寿！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
latch	<h3>latch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,latch 'on; ,latch 'onto sb (<i>also</i> ,latch 'on to sb)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to follow sb around, often when they do not want you with them纠缠，缠住(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He latched onto us and we couldn’t get rid of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他缠着我们，甩也甩不掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,latch 'on; ,latch 'onto sth (<i>also</i> ,latch 'on to sth) </b><br>to become attached to sth附着(在某物上):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The virus latches onto the red blood cells.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种病毒附着在红细胞上。</font><br>to be interested in an idea, a fashion, etc. and use it for your own purposes对…产生兴趣(并加以利用):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government have latched onto environmental issues to win votes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已开始大谈环境问题以争取选票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have a reputation for latching onto all the latest crazes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家都知道他们对所有的最新时尚都有兴趣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Young children latch onto phrases and repeat them over and over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小孩子喜欢成语，一遍遍地重复。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)to understand an idea, what sb is saying, etc.理解，懂得，领会(想法或某人的话等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took him a while to latch onto their style of humour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他过了一会儿才明白他们的幽默方式。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She soon latched onto the idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快就理解了这个想法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a difficult concept to grasp, but Sam latched on very quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是个难掌握的概念，但萨姆很快就理解了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>\n
laugh	<h3>laugh<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'laugh at sb/yourself </b><br>to make sb/yourself seem stupid by making jokes about them/yourself; to not be too serious about sb/yourself嘲笑， 讥笑，取笑(某人或自己):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were laughing at him behind his back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在背后取笑他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all laughed at Jane when she said she believed in ghosts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简说她相信有鬼，我们都笑话她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I laughed at myself for believing such an unlikely story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我因为相信了这种不可信的事而自嘲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody likes to be laughed at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人喜欢被嘲笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'laugh at sth </b><br>to show that you find sth funny or amusing因(有趣的事物等)发笑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You never laugh at my jokes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讲笑话你从来不笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole class was laughing at him clowning around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全班同学都给他的滑稽相逗乐了。</font><br>to make sth seem stupid by making jokes about it嘲笑，讥笑(某事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was laughing at my accent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在取笑我的口音。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ridicule sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He doesn’t like his ideas being laughed at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不喜欢别人拿他的想法开玩笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,laugh sth 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to try to make people think that you do not care about sth, or that it is not serious or important, by making a joke about it一笑置之； 付之一笑； 用笑话摆脱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laughed off suggestions that he had been approached to be manager of the England team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 传说有人找他当英格兰队的经理，他一笑置之。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was an embarrassing situation, but she managed to laugh it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个场面很尴尬，可她一笑摆脱了窘境。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
launch	<h3>launch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'launch into sth;'launch yourself into sth </b><br>to start doing sth in a very enthusiastic way; to start to attack sb physically or with words(热情地)开始做，投入；开始攻击(或抨击)某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She launched into an explanation of how the machine worked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她开始大力讲解机器如何运转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We don’t want to launch ourselves into the wrong enterprise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不想投入一项我们不应投入的规划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band launched into one of their best known songs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队演奏起他们的一首最有名的歌曲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>speech,explanation,challenge</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,launch 'out (into sth) </b><br>to begin to do sth new or different in a confident way拓展，投身于(新的或不同事业):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s decided she has enough experience to launch out on her own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她认为她的经验足以自己创业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
lavish	<h3>lavish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lavish sth on sb/sth (<i>also</i> 'lavish sth upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to give a lot of sth, often too much, to sb/sth过分给予；漤施:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lavished such care on that house! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把那所房子保养得过于仔细了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was jealous of the attention lavished on his sister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他嫉妒妹妹得到了过多的关爱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Millions of pounds were lavished on restoring the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 修复这座建筑物耗费了几百万英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>attention,praise,care</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
lay	<h3>lay<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay a'bout sb (with sth) (<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to attack sb violently physically or sometimes with words袭击(或猛打)某人；猛烈抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He started to lay about me with his walking stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始用拐杖狠狠揍我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth a'side <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to put sth to one side and not use it or think about it把…放在一边(或搁置一旁):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I laid my book aside and picked up the letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把书放在一边，拿起那封信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) They laid aside their differences until the crisis was over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把分歧搁置起来，直到危机过去。</font><br>(<i>also</i> ,lay sth 'by <i>less frequent</i>)to keep sth to use in the future; to save sth留存备用； 保存:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you laid anything aside for your old age? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有为防老积攒些什么吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth aside;set sth aside</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth be'fore sb/sth </b><br>to present a proposal,some information, etc. to sb for them to think about and decide on呈交； 提交； 通报:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill was laid before Parliament.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议案提交给了国会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'by=LAY STH ASIDE</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'down </b><br>to put sth down or stop using it放下； 停止使用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stopped writing and laid down his pen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他停止写字，放下钢笔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They refused to <b>lay down their arms</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拒绝放下武器。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sb/sth down </b><br>if you <b>lay down</b> a rule, or a principle, you state officially that people must obey it or use it规定，制定(条例或原则等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has laid down procedures for negotiating teachers’ pay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已制定出协商解决桝师工资问题的程序。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Clear guidelines have been laid down for religious teaching in schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已明确制订出学校宗桝桝育大纲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>guidelines,rules,conditions </b><br>to establish sth that will develop or be useful in the future形成； 确立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Good eating habits can be laid down in childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 良好的饮食习惯可以在童年养成。</font><br>to produce sth that is stored and gradually increases积聚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you eat too much, the surplus is laid down as fat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是吃得太多，过剩的营养就会成为脂肪贮存起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fat</b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to store sth, especially wine, to use in the future贮备，贮存(尤指葡萄酒):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has laid down hundreds of bottles of port.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她贮存了几百瓶波尔图葡萄酒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bottles,wine</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp lay down the 'law <br>to tell sb firmly what they can or cannot do发号施令；严令<br>&nbsp&nbsp lay down your 'life (for sb/sth) <br>to die willingly in order to save sb or because of sth that you believe in(为救人或信仰)牺牲生命<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'in <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to get a supply of sth and store it to use in the future贮备；贮存:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve laid in enough logs for the winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我贮备了足够的木柴过冬。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get sth in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay 'into sb/sth (with sth) (&b{for sth/for doing sth</b> )(<i>informal</i>) }<br>to attack sb/sth violently, with words or blows(为某事物)(以… ) 痛击， 严厉抨击… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laid into him with her fists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她挥拳狠狠地揍他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid into the government for spending millions of pounds on buildings nobody wanted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他痛斥政府把几百万英镑耗费在兴建没人想要的建筑物上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rip into sb/sth (with sth) (&b{for sth/for doing sth</b> )}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay 'off; ,lay 'off sb/sth; ,lay 'off doing sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to stop doing sth that irritates or annoys you(让人停止做某事)停止，别再打扰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay off! You’re messing up my homework! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别闹了！你打扰我写作业了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay off him, he’s still learning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别烦他，他还在学习呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay off bullying your brother! </font></i><br><font
