sth harmful停止做，停止使用(有害的东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should lay off alcohol/ drinking for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该暂时别喝酒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sb 'off </b><br>to dismiss workers, usually for a short time, because there is not enough work(因工作不多而)暂时遣散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve had to lay off hundreds of workers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不得不遣散几百名工人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lay-off <i>n </i></b><br>[C] an act of dismissing workers because there is not enough work(因工作不多的)遣散，裁员:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crisis has caused thousands of lay-offs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场危机造成了几千人遭解职。</font><br>[usually sing.] a period of time when sb is not able to take part in an activity or a sport that they usually do(无法参加活动或运动的)歇工期，歇息期<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'on <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to provide or arrange sth for sb, for example food, transport or entertainment提供，安排(食物、运输或娱乐等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Extra buses were laid on during the train strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁路罢工期间增派了公共汽车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had laid on tea for the players.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她为运动员提供茶水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp lay it/sth on with a 'trowel;lay it on 'thick<br>(<i>informal</i>) to talk about sb/sth in a way that makes them seem much better or worse than they really are; to exaggerate sth大肆吹捧；过分贬低；夸张:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was laying on the flattery with a trowel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在一个劲儿地拍马屁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Calling him a genius is laying it on a bit thick! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叫他天才未免有些言过其实了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'on sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to force sb to deal with sth unpleasant or difficult要某人处理(讨厌或困难的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sorry to lay all this work on you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很抱歉把这活全给你干。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to break bad or surprising news to sb把(坏的或惊人的)消息透露给某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry to <b>lay this on you</b>, but he’s never coming back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抱歉告诉你， 他绝不会回来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sb 'out </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to knock sb unconscious把… 打昏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid his opponent out with a single blow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一拳就打昏了对手。</font><br>to prepare a dead body to be buried(给死者)作殡葬准备<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'out </b><br>to spread sth out ready to use or so that it can be seen easily铺开；摆开；展开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay out all the clothes you want to take.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把要带走的衣服全摆出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay all the cards out on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把纸牌全摆在桌子上。</font><br>to plan how sth should look and arrange it in this way布置；策划；安排；设计:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They laid the streets out on a grid pattern.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们按格子图案设计了街道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a well laid out CV/resumé </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 编排清晰的个人简历</font><br>to present or explain sth clearly and carefully清晰细緻地演示(或解释):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the meeting, he laid out his plans for the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在会议上清楚阐释了他对公司的规划。</font><br>(<b>on sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to spend money花钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid out thousands renovating the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他花了几千元钱翻新房子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'layout <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] the way in which sth is arranged安排；设计；规划:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He still recalled the layout of the house perfectly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他依然清晰地记得那所房子的布置。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The magazine has a very attractive layout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那本杂志的设计非常吸引人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outlay <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the money that you spend on sth, especially when you start a new project(尤指新项目的)开支，费用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an outlay of $400 000</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 40 万元的开支</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What was your initial outlay on equipment? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你购置设备的起始费用是多少？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay 'up </b><br>to hide somewhere or do nothing for a while躲藏；闲着；无所事事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lay up in a cave until it got dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在洞里一直躲到天黑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if sb is <b>laid up</b> they are unable to work or take part in an activity because they are ill/sick or injured(疾病或创伤)使某人暂停工作(或参与活动):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was laid up for a month with a broken leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我因腿部骨折…床休养一个月。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has been laid up with flu for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因患流感休息了一个星期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lay sth 'up </b><br>(<b>for yourself</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) if you <b>lay up</b> trouble or problems for yourself, you do sth that will result in difficulties later把困难(或问题等) 积存起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re laying up problems for yourself by not tackling this now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在不处理这事就是给自己积存困难。</font><br>to stop using a vehicle, ship, etc. because you do not need it, or it has to be repaired暂停使用(车、船等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our boat is laid up during the winter months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的船在冬季的几个月里闲着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
laze	<h3>laze<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,laze a'round;laze a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,laze a'bout, ,laze a'bout sth) </b><br>to spend your time relaxing and doing very little闲散地打发时间；消磨时光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lazed about all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他闲散地过了一整天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lazed around the pool in the afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们下午在游泳池里消磨。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lie around,lie around sth;lounge about/around,lounge about/around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,laze sth a'way </b><br>to spend a period of time relaxing and doing very little闲散地打发时间；消磨时光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We lazed away the summer on the beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在沙滩上打发了夏天的时光。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
lead	<h3>lead<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead 'into sth </b><br>if a subject or a discussion<b>leads into</b> sth, it moves naturally into a second subject or discussion自然进入，引出(下个课题等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This led into a discussion on gender differences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就引出了有关性别差异的讨论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pair and group work often leads into a whole class discussion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两人或以上一组活动之后常常是全班讨论。</font><br>if a room, a door, a street, etc.<b>leads into</b> a place, it opens into it or connects with it(房间、门、街道等)通往…，与…连接:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door led into a tiny kitchen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这道门通向一个小厨房。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>door,room,road</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lead-in (&b{to sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br>an introduction to a subject,a story, etc.(主题、故事等的)引子，介绍；开场白:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We want a striking lead-in to the new programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们这个新节目需要个精彩的引子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead 'off (with sth) (<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to start a discussion,meeting, etc.(为讨论、会议等)带头，领头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone will have a chance to speak. Would you like to lead off? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家都有机会发言。你愿意带个头吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead 'off sth; ,lead 'off from sth </b><br>if a street<b>leads off</b> (from) a place, it starts there and goes away from it(街道)起始于…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pointed to a street leading off (<i>from</i>) the corner of the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他指了指从广场一角延伸出去的街道。</font><br>if a room, a door, etc. <b>leads off</b> (from) a place, it connects directly with it(房间、门等) 紧接着…，直接连着…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the rooms lead off the main hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的房间都与大厅连接。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead sb 'on <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to deceive sb and make them believe sth that is not true, especially that you love them or find them attractive误导某人(使其以为受人喜爱等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn’t have led him on like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不应该让他产生那样的误解。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lead to sth;'lead sb to sth (<i>also</i> ,lead 'on to sth, ,lead sb 'on to sth) </b><br>to result in a particular action or event; to force or persuade sb to take a particular action导致；引发；迫使(或劝)某人采取某行动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Living in damp conditions can lead to serious health problems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活在潮湿环境中会引发严重的健康问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What led you to this conclusion? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如何得出这个结论的？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The increase in the number of motor vehicles has led to an increase in autocrimes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机动车辆数目增加， 结果汽车相关罪案亦增长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police have offered a reward for information leading to the conviction of the child’s killers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方已悬赏寻找有助于对杀害孩子的兇手定罪的线索。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She described how her early life had led her to her profession as an artist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她叙述了她的早年生活如何引导她从事艺术家职业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One thing <b>led to another</b> and before long Sue and I were engaged.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事情一件接着一件，不久之后我和休就订婚了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She described how her early life led her to become an artist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她描述了她的早年生活如何引导她成为艺术家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead 'up to sth </b><br>to be the introduction to or the cause of sth …之前(的时期)；导致…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book describes the period leading up to the start of the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书描述了战前时期。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police are investigating the chain of events that led up to her death.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方正在调查导致她死亡的一连串事情。</font><br>to prepare to talk about sth or ask a difficult question by gradually introducing the subject you want to talk about逐渐引出(话题或难题)；铺埝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What exactly are you leading up to? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到底想谈什么？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seemed to be leading up to asking a difficult question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他似乎正在为提出难题作铺埝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lead-'up (&b{to sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br>[sing.] (<i>BrE</i>) a period of time or an event or series of events before another event or activity前期；(…的)前奏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp in the lead-up to the election </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在选举前夕</font><br>\n

lean	<h3>lean<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lean against/on sth/sb; ,lean 'up against sth </b><br>to rest against or on sth/sb for support倚着人(或物)；靠在…上(或旁)；靠置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Laura leaned weakly against the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 劳拉虚弱地靠在门上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We left our bikes leaning up against the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把自行车靠墙放着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can lean on my arm.</font></i><br><font sth 'up against sth </b><br>to make sth rest against or on sth in a sloping position使…斜靠着…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He leaned his head on his hand and closed his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他手托着头闭上眼睛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maggie leant the broom up against the wall.</font></i><br><font threatening them对…施加压力；威胁；恐吓:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are leaning on him to make him withdraw his complaints.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在给他施加压力，让他撤回投诉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was being leaned on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我受到了威胁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lean on sb/sth (<i>also</i> 'lean upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to depend on sb/sth依靠…，依赖…(帮助和支持):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s good to have someone to lean on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人依赖真好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was unsure of herself and leaned heavily on her friends for support.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对自己没有信心，在很大程度上依靠朋友的支持。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LEAN AGAINST/ON SB/STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lean to'wards sth (<i>also</i> ,lean to'ward sth) </b><br>to support or tend to prefer a particular idea or political party倾向，偏向(某想法或政党):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not sure how I’m going to vote but I’m leaning towards the Democrats.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有确定投谁的票，可我倾向于民主党。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lean leap	<h3>leap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leap at sth </b><br>to accept sth eagerly, without hesitating急于接受(机会等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She leapt at the chance of working in Paris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她立刻抓住了去巴黎工作的机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>chance,opportunity</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>jump at sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leap on sth (<i>also</i> 'leap upon sth <i>more formal</i>)(<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to suddenly become very interested in an idea or a suggestion, especially because you think it will give you an advantage(尤指因有利可图，对某想法或建议)突然很感兴趣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The press leapt on the story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报界开始对这件事大为关注。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leap 'out at sb </b><br>if sth, especially sth written,<b>leaps out at</b> you, you see it immediately立刻进入(某人的)视线；引人注目:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His name leapt out at me from the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在那一页上一眼就看见了他的名字。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>jump out at sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leap 'up </b><br>to stand quickly and suddenly when you have been sitting迅速(或猛然)站起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He leapt up and ran to answer the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一下子站起来跑过去开门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>jump up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leap upon sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)=LEAP ON STH</b><br>\n
leave	<h3>leave<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sth a'side </b><br>to not discuss or consider a particular idea or issue把想法(或问题)搁置一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Leaving aside </b>car parking space, the housing development is well planned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撇开停车空间不谈，住房开发规划得很好。</font><br><i><font v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sb/sth be'hind </b><br>to make progress much faster than sb else把…抛在后面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new car is going to leave the competition far behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新型汽车将把对手远远地甩在后面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sb/sth be'hind; ,leave sb/sth be'hind sb </b><br>to go away from a place without taking sb/sth because you have forgotten them/it忘记带，丢下(人或物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somebody has left their umbrella behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人忘了取回雨伞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait — don’t leave me behind! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等等─别丢下我！</font><br>to go away from a place while the result of sth you have done stays there留下(某行为的结果):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wore gloves so as not to leave any fingerprints behind (them).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们戴着手套，以免留下指纹。</font><br>to leave a person or place permanently,especially in order to begin a new life(尤指为开始新生活)永久离开(某人或某地):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was anxious to leave the past behind (him).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他巴不得永远告别过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She disappeared a year ago leaving behind a boyfriend and a small baby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一年前抛弃了男友和在襁褓中的孩子消失了。</font><br>to have sb/sth remaining after your death死后留下(人或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He died at the age of 33, leaving behind a wife and three young children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他33岁时死去，留下妻子和三个年幼的孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wore gloves so as not to leave any fingerprints.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们戴着手套，以免留下指纹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sth 'in </b><br>to not remove sth for example from a book, a piece of writing, etc.保留(书或文章等内容):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Make sure you leave that paragraph in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要保留那个段落。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>leave sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave 'off; ,leave 'off sth; ,leave 'off doing sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to stop doing sth停止(做某事) ； 中断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lee shouted at him, but he wouldn’t leave off.</font></i><br><font 我们将设法从他们停下的地方接续下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Will you leave off nagging?’ he shouted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你能不能别唠叨了？”他大声说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+adv+-ing<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sb/sth 'off; ,leave sb/sth 'off sth </b><br>to not include or mention sb/sth, especially on a list不把…列入；不包括；不含:<br><i><font night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发现电视机开了一夜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep sth on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>leave sth off;switch sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave it 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to stop doing sth silly or annoying(制止某人做愚蠢或讨厌的事)停下，别干…了<br>used to tell sb that you think what they have said is stupid,or that you do not believe it瞎说； 胡说； 不可能:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two million dollars? Leave it out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两百万元？不会吧﹗</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sb 'out; ,leave sb 'out of sth </b><br>to not include sb deliberately不把某人列入(…)；不把某人包括在(…内):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It seemed unkind to leave Daisy out, so we invited her too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把戴西排除在外似乎不太好，所以我们也邀请了她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was an outcry when he was left out of the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被这个队剔除时引起了抗议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exclude sb <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'left 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>unhappy because you have not been included in sth感到被冷落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt a bit left out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到有点受到冷落。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,leave sb/sth 'out; ,leave sb/sth 'out of sth</b><br>to not involve sb/sth in sth不把…牵涉在(…)内:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave my brother out of this — he had nothing to do with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别把我弟弟牵扯进去─他与这事没关系。</font><br>to not include sb/sth either accidentally or on purpose(偶然或故意地)没有把…包括在(…)内，漏掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have I left anyone out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我漏掉了什么人吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can leave out the gory details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以删掉那些血腥的细节。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is spelt wrongly. You’ve left out the ‘e’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个词拼写错了。你漏掉了e。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve left the second ‘m’ out of ‘committee’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你漏掉committee中的第二个m字母。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve left out an ‘m’ in ‘committee’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在committee中漏掉了一个m字母。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>omit sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,left 'over (from sth) </b><br>(of food or money 食物或钱) if food, money, etc. is <b>left over</b>, it remains when the rest has been eaten or used up剩下；残留:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After I’ve paid my rent and bought food there isn’t much left over to spend on books.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我付掉房租和买完吃的之后，就没剩下多少钱买书了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was plenty of food left over after the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 聚会后剩了不少食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s some rice left over from lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午饭剩了些米饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leftover <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>[usually pl.] food that has not been eaten and remains after a meal吃剩的饭菜<br>a custom, tradition, etc. that belongs to an earlier time but still exists遗留下来的风俗习惯(或传统等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These narrow roads are a leftover from the days of horse-drawn carriages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些小道是从马车时代沿用下来的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leftover <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] remaining because it has not been eaten or used吃剩的；用剩的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp leftover vegetables/fabric </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剩菜；边角布料</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'leave sb to sth </b><br>to go away from sb so that they can continue what they were doing before you came, or do sth without your help离开某人让其继续(或独自) …:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>informal</i>) If you don’t need me any more, I’ll <b>leave you to it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是不再需要我， 我就走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll leave you to your lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我走了，你用午饭吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp leave sb to their own de'vices<br>to leave sb alone to do as they wish让某人自行其是:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once I’ve explained things to him I tend to leave him to his own devices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一对他说明了情况，就往往不去干涉他。</font><br>\n
lend	<h3>lend<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lend sth 'out (to sb) </b><br>to allow sb to borrow sth for a period of time借出；把…借给(某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The reference books cannot be lent out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参考书不得外借。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lend itself/themselves to sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to be suitable for sth适合于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Science in elementary schools lends itself well to learning through play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小学科学课很适于在游戏中学习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not all materials lend themselves to scientific dating.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 并非所有材料都能够进行科学鉴定年代。</font><br>\n
let	<h3>let<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb 'down</b><br>to fail to help or support sb in the way that they hoped or expected(因未如期望中提供协助或支持) 让某人失望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She said she would help, but let them down at the last minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说过要帮忙，可最后却让他们失望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s important our decision doesn’t let down our customers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 重要的是我们的决定不要辜负了我们的顾客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car has never let me down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这辆汽车从未出过毛病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt I’d been badly let down by the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感到公司令我非常失望。</font><br>to tell sb some bad news in a kind way so that they will not be too disappointed or upset婉转地告诉某人(坏消息):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids will be really upset the trip’s been cancelled — try to let them down gently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅行取消了会使孩子们十分失望的─尽量慢慢跟他们说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp let the 'side down (<i>BrE</i>) <br>to disappoint your family, friends, team, etc. by not being as successful as they expect, or not helping or supporting them使家人(或朋友、团队等)失望；未能帮助(或支持)自己的一方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John would never let the side down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰永远不会让人失望的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I knew I was letting the side down }(= disappointing my family, etc.)&b{ by not going to college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道我没上大学让大家失望了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'let-down <i>n </i></b><br>[C, usually sing.] [U] something that is not as good as you thought or hoped it would be令人失望的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie was great but the ending was a bit of a let-down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影很不错，可是结尾有些不尽人意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/sth 'down; ,let yourself 'down </b><br>to make sb/sth/yourself less successful or impressive than they/it/you should be(使) 略逊一筹， 美中不足:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her knowledge of Italian is excellent, but her pronunciation lets her down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她对意大利语的认识很充分，美中不足的是发音不大好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His clothes let him down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他穿着不够得体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you don’t work hard for these exams, you’ll only be letting yourself down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果不努力准备这些考试，成绩就会不理想。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sth 'down </b><br>to make sth go lower放下；降低；降下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We let the bucket down on a rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用绳子把吊桶放下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lower sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to make sth longer, especially an item of clothing such as a skirt or a dress(把裙子、连衣裙等)放长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to let the hem down a couple of centimetres.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要把褶边放出几公分。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>take sth up </b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to allow the air to come out of sth, such as a tyre(给轮胎等)放气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tyres on his car had been let down during the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚上有人把他的汽车轮胎放了气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>tyre</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>deflate sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp let your 'hair down (<i>informal</i>)<br>to relax and enjoy yourself, often in a wild or lively way(疯狂或快活地)放松，轻松一下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw my parents letting their hair down on the dance floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见父母在舞池上快活地跳着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/sth 'in; ,let yourself 'in; ,let sb/sth/yourself 'into sth </b><br>to allow sb/sth/yourself to enter a room or a building让…进入(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me in! It’s cold out here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我进去！外面很冷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guard refuses to let anyone in without a security pass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警宪不放任何没有安全通行证的人入内。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She let herself into the flat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她进了公寓单元。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sth 'in </b><br>to allow sth such as water or light to enter a place through a hole让水(或光)透过(或渗漏):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a hole in the roof that let the rain in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屋顶有个洞漏雨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I drew the curtains back to let in some light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拉开窗帘透透光。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>light,rain</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'inlet <i>n </i></b><br>a narrow strip of water which goes from the sea or a lake into the land(湖、海伸向陆地的)小湾，水湾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a narrow/sheltered inlet</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狭窄的/隐蔽的港湾</font><br>the part of a machine through which air, gas or fuel enters(气体、液体或燃料进入机器的)入口，进口:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a fuel/ power inlet </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燃料入口；充电阀</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/yourself 'in for sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to allow yourself to become involved in sth difficult or unpleasant让他人(或自己) 陷入… ， 卷入…，牵涉到…中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I’d known what I was letting myself in for, I’d never have agreed to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我知道要把自己卷进什么事，我决不会同意帮忙的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What have you let me in for? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给我招惹了什么麻烦？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb 'in on sth <i>(BrE also </i>,let sb 'into sth)(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to allow sb to share a secret向某人透露秘密；让某人知道秘密:<br><i><font wanted to let Chris in on the secret.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我原打算告诉克里斯这个秘密的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll let you into a little secret.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要告诉你个小秘密。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>secret</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,let 'into sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to be put into the surface of sth使置入(或嵌进)…里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A large window was let into the wall.</font></i><br><font through your bottom放屁<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb 'off (with sth) </b><br>to punish sb lightly for sth wrong they have done; to not punish sb at all(以轻罚)从宽处理某人，放过某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was let off with a fine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只交了罚款就完事。</font><br><i><font [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb 'off; ,let sb 'off sth</b><br>to allow sb not to do sth or not to go somewhere让某人免予做…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You really ought to help with the shopping, but I suppose I could let you off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你真应该帮着买东西，但我想我可以免你不干。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mum let me off the household chores during exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考试期间妈妈免了我的家务活儿。</font><br>to allow sb to get out of a vehicle, especially a bus让某人下车(尤指公共汽车):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you let me off here? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我在这儿下车好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp let sb off the 'hook <br>to free sb from a difficult or unpleasant task or situation让某人免予苦差(或摆脱窘境等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wasn’t going to let the senator off the hook easily; he kept asking difficult questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不轻易放过参议员；他不断地质疑问难。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sth 'off </b><br>to fire a gun; to make a bomb explode放(枪)；使炸弹爆炸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys were letting off fireworks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些男孩在放花炮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He let off a warning shot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开枪示警。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>firework,shot</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,let off 'steam <br>to get rid of your energy, emotions,etc. by shouting or doing sth active释放精力；宣泄感情:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He let off steam by hitting a pillow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他捶打枕头泄愤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let 'on (to sb) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to tell sb sth that is supposed to be a secret透露(给某人):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t know I’ve bought her a watch, so don’t let on, will you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她并不知道我给她买了块手表，所以请保密，行吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children knew he was coming, but they didn’t let on to anyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们知道他要来，但他们对谁都没有说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were holes in Jack’s shoes, but Kate didn’t let on (<i>that</i>) she’d noticed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克的鞋子破了几个洞，凯特看见了但没说出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>when schools, classes, offices, etc.<b>let out</b>, they come to an end and students, workers,etc. go home at the end of a day or a term放学；放假；下班:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Classes let out in June.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 六月份学校放假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More than 30 000 people are expected in the square after work lets out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预计有3万多人下班后来广场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb 'out; ,let sb 'out of sth </b><br>to allow sb not to do sth they have promised or are expected to do; to free sb from a difficult situation让某人免于做…(或摆脱窘境):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got school tomorrow, so that lets me out (of helping).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我明天上学，因此我不用帮忙了。</font><br>to allow sb to leave a hospital,prison, etc., especially early or for a short time让某人(尤指提前或暂时)出院(或出狱等) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctors might let me out tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生可能让我明天出院。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'let-out <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>especially BrE</i>) something that allows you to avoid an unpleasant or difficult situation让人摆脱窘境的事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a let-out clause }(= in a contract)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可钻空子的合同条款</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘I think it’s too hot to go jogging today,’ I said, looking for a let-out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我觉得今天慢跑太热。”我找藉口说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/sth 'out; ,let sb/sth 'out of sth; ,let yourself 'out; ,let yourself 'out of sth </b><br>to allow sb/sth/yourself to go out of a room or a building让…(从房间或建筑物)出去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you let yourself out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你自己可以出去吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was amazed they let her out of hospital so soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很惊讶他们这么早就让她出院了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp let the 'cat out of the bag <br>to tell a secret carelessly or by mistake(无意中)泄露秘密；说漏嘴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was trying to keep my promotion quiet, but Steve went and let the cat out of the bag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我尽量不说我升职的事，可史蒂夫过去说漏了嘴。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sth 'out </b><br>to give a cry; to make a sound发出(叫声等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She let out a scream of terror.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发出一声恐怖的尖叫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He let out a sigh of relief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他松了口气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cry,sigh</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>hold sth in </b><br>to allow secret information to become known透露， 泄露(信息) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s the only person who could have let the secret out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是唯一可能泄密的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company let out that they were putting in a bid for KFC.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司放出风声说他们要提出收购肯德基。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>secret</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reveal sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>(<b>to sb</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) to make a house, flat,apartment, etc. available for rent出租(给…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The apartment’s been let out to a German couple.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那套公寓房子租给了一对德国夫妇。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>flat/apartment,house</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hire sth out (to sb); rent sth out (to sb)</b><br>to make an item of clothing looser or larger(把衣服等)放宽，放松:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve eaten so much I’ll have to let my belt out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我吃得太多，只好松一松皮带了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>skirt,trousers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>take sth in </b><br>(<i>also</i> ,let sth 'out of sth) to allow air, liquid, etc. to escape or flow out of somewhere让空气(或液体等)(从…)透出(或渗漏):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to let the air out of the radiator.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得给散热器放放气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outlet <i>n </i></b><br>(<b>for sth</b>) a way of expressing or using energy, strong feelings, ideas, etc.(精力、感情、思想的)出路；表达(或宣泄等的)机会:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children need an outlet for all their energy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子需要有机会消耗全部精力。</font><br>a shop/store or an organization that sells goods made by a particular company or of a particular type专营店；经销店:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a retail/fast food outlet </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 零售/快餐店</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) a shop/store that sells goods of a particular make/makes at reduced prices廉价经销店:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp designer outlets </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 设计师品牌廉价经销店</font><br>a pipe or hole through which water,steam, etc. can flow out(水、蒸汽等的)排放管，出口<br><i>(AmE</i>) a device in a wall that you use to connect a piece of electrical equipment to a power supply(墙壁上的)电源插座:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an electrical outlet </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电源插座</font><br>the end of a river where it flows into a lake or the sea河口；湖口；海口<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/sth 'past </b><br>to allow sb/sth to go past you给…让路:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you let me past, please?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  请让我过去好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let sb/sth 'through</b><br>to allow sb/sth to pass or go through sth that is blocking the way给…让路；让… 通过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd moved aside to let the am bulance through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群退开让救护车通过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me through — I’m a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我过一下─我是医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These blinds don’t let much light through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些窗帘不怎么透光。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to say that sb/sth is good enough for sth or is correct通过；许可；批准:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were worried the council wouldn’t let the plans for the new building through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们担心议会不会通过兴建新楼房的计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,let 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become less strong减弱；减轻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain showed no sign of letting up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨没有减小的迹象。</font><br>to do sth with less effort or energy than before, or stop doing it放松(努力) ； 松劲； 停止… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We mustn’t let up, even though we’re winning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管我们现在领先，我们一定不能松劲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Doesn’t she ever let up? She’s been complaining all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她就不能停一下吗？她抱怨了一整天了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'let-up (in sth) <i>n </i></b><br>[U] [sing.] a reduction in the strength of something; a period of time when sth unpleasant stops减弱；减少；(不愉快的事的)停止期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There can be no let-up in the war against drugs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与毒品的斗争是不能松懈的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain continued all afternoon with no let-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨连续下了整整一下午，没有停止过。</font><br>\n
level	<h3>level<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'level sth at sb/sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,level sth a'gainst sb/sth</b>) to say publicly that sb is to blame for sth,especially a mistake or a crime针对…提出指责(或批评等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The charges levelled against him are unjust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对他的公开指责是不公平的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Environmental groups have levelled a number of criticisms at the proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 环保团体对建议提出了种种批评。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>criticism,accusation,charge</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Accusations of incompetence have been levelled at the principal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多项指责都针对校长，指其不称职。</font><br>to point sth, especially a gun, at sb(尤指用枪)瞄准，对准:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She levelled the pistol at his head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用手枪指着他的脑袋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,level sth 'down/ 'up </b><br>to make standards,amounts, etc. be the same low/high or lower/higher level使(标准、数量等)降低/提高到同等水平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government is accused of levelling down standards in schools rather than levelling them up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府受到了全面拉低，而非提高各学校标准的指责。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,level 'off/ 'out </b><br>to become level or steady after a period of sharp rises and falls(经过急剧的涨落后)平稳下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp House prices showed no sign of levelling off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 住房价格没有趋于稳定的迹象。</font><br>to become level or horizontal after rising or falling(停止升降而) 保持水平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road began to level off as we approached the coast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们接近海岸时，路开始变得平坦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane levelled off at 20 000 feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机在2万英尺的高空保持水平飞行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,level sth 'off/ 'out </b><br>to make something smooth or flat使平坦；使平整:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Level the ground out before sowing the seed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把地平整好再播种。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,level sth 'up=LEVEL STH DOWN/UP</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'level with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to speak or deal with sb in an honest and direct way对某人说实话；直言相告:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to level with you now — your work hasn’t been up to standard for some time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我跟你说实话吧─你的工作最近一段时间没有达到要求。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got the feeling that he’s not levelling with me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感觉他对我不够坦率。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
lick	<h3>lick<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lick sth 'off/ 'up; ,lick sth 'off sth </b><br>to eat or drink sth by moving your tongue over the surface of it舔食；舔着喝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She licked the jam off (the spoon).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她舔了(小勺上的)果酱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat licked up the milk from the dish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫舔了碟子里的牛奶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
lie	<h3>lie<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie a'bout; ,lie a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=LIE AROUND,LIE AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie a'head; ,lie a'head of sb</b><br>to be in the future;to be in front of you在将来；在某人面前；面对某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Great opportunities lie ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将来机会很多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who knows what problems might lie ahead of us? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁知道我们可能遇到什么问题呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie a'round; ,lie a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,lie a'bout, ,lie a'bout sth)</b><br>(of a person 人) to spend time being lazy and not doing anything in particular无所事事地混日子；懒散度日；游手好闲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been lying around the house all day doing nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在家里懒散了一整天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>laze around,laze around sth;lounge about/around,lounge about/around sth </b><br>(of a number of things 许多东西) to be left somewhere in a careless or untidy way乱放；乱搁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His clothes lay around all over the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一地都是他的衣服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Have you seen my purse?’ ‘It was lying about in the kitchen when I last saw it.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你看见我的皮夹了吗？”“我上次看见的时候是在厨房里的。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn’t <b>leave</b> valuables <b>lying around</b> the changing rooms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不应该把贵重物品随便放在更衣室。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'layabout <i>n </i>(<i>old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>a lazy person who does very little work游手好闲的人；懒汉；二流子<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie 'back (in/on sth) </b><br>to rest, relax and do very little悠闲；休息；放松:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just lie back and enjoy the peace and quiet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只管悠闲享受这种宁静好啦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lay back on the pillows and closed her eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她安闲地躺在枕头上合上了眼睛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie be'fore sb <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to be in front of sb在某人面前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A terrible sight lay before them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可怕的情景出现在他们面前。</font><br>to be in the future在将来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your whole life lies before you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你整个人生还长着呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie be'hind sth </b><br>to be the real explanation or reason for sth是…的真实原因(或理由):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She understood the feelings that lay behind his angry words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她明白他愤怒的话语之后的真实感受。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We will probably never know what lay behind his decision to resign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可能永远不会知道他辞职的真正原因。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie 'down</b><br>to be or move into a horizontal position on a bed, etc. in order to sleep or rest躺下；平…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Go and lie down for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去躺一会儿吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lay down on the sofa and went to sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在沙发上躺下睡着了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coughing is worse when he’s lying down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他躺着时咳嗽得越发厉害。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was lying down on the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她躺在床上。</font><br>Do not confuse this sense of <b>lie down</b> with <b>lay sth down</b>, which must always have an object.不要将<b>lie down</b> 的这个含义和<b>lay sth down</b> 混淆，后者必须带宾语:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack lay down on the sofa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克在沙发上躺下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack laid the pen down on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克把笔放在桌子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack was lying down on the sofa, (not而非Jack was laying down on the sofa).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克躺在沙发上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp take sth lying 'down <br>to accept an insult, a criticism, a violent attack, etc. without protesting or reacting to it默默承受(屈辱、批评、严厉抨击等)；逆来顺受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has been accused of bribery, but he won’t take this lying down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人指责他受贿，但他不肯忍气吞声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie-'down <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) a short rest,especially in bed(尤指在床上的)小睡，小憩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to have a lie-down </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 躺一会儿</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie 'in <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to stay in bed after the time you usually get up睡懒觉；起得晚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s Saturday tomorrow, so you can lie in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天是星期六，你可以睡懒觉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sleep in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie-'in <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) an act of staying in bed longer than usual in the morning睡懒觉；晚起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to have a lie-in </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 睡懒觉</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lie 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to hide somewhere躲藏；藏匿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fugitives lay up in the caves until it got dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 逃亡者在洞里一直躲到天黑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lie with sb/sth (to do sth) (<i>formal</i>) </b><br>to be the duty or responsibility of sb/sth是…的职责(或责任):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>It lies with you</b> to accept or reject the proposal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接受或拒绝这一建议由你决定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The decision on whether to proceed lies with the minister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 得由部长决定是否继续进行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rest with sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
lift	<h3>lift<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lift 'off </b><br>when a rocket, etc. <b>lifts off</b> it rises from the ground into the air(火箭等)发射，起飞，升空:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rocket lifts off next Monday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火箭将于下星期一发射。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lift-off <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the moment when a rocket or spacecraft leaves the ground and rises into the air(火箭或航天器的)发射，起飞，升空:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have lift-off! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们发射了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lift sb/sth 'up; ,lift yourself 'up </b><br>to raise sb/sth/yourself to a higher position or level举起； 提起； 抬高； 吊起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t lift you up — you’re too heavy! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我抱不动你─你太重了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lifted herself up on one elbow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用一只胳膊肘支壠起身体。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lifted up the box and put it on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把盒子搬起来放到桌子上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
light	<h3>light<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'light on/upon sb/sth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to suddenly see sb/sth视线突然落在…上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her gaze lighted on her daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一眼瞅见了她的女儿。</font><br>to suddenly find sb/sth or think of sb/sth突然发现；忽然想到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The research team has lit upon important new material.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 研究队伍突然找到了重要的新资料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit on sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Lighted </b>is also used for the past tense and past participle.过去时和过去分词也用<b>lighted</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>alight on/upon sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,light 'up; ,light sth 'up </b><br>to become or to make sth bright with light or colour(使)光亮，放光彩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She switched the monitor on and the screen lit up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打开显示屏，屏幕上出现了画面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Flashes of lightning lit up the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 闪电照亮了天空。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waterfall was lit up at night with pink and green floodlights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜间的粉红色和绿色泛光灯把瀑布映照得辉煌夺目。</font><br>if a person’s eyes or face <b>light up</b>, or sth <b>lights them up</b>,they become bright with excitement or happiness喜形于色；喜气洋洋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes lit up when she saw them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看见他们时两眼一亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A smile of delight lit up his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脸上露出了高兴的笑容。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His face <b>lit up with</b> pleasure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他脸上露出欣喜的神色。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to begin to smoke a cigarette, etc.开始吸一根烟(等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took out a cigarette and lit up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她掏出一支香烟点上吸起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lit up one cigarette after another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一根接一根地抽着烟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'light upon sb/sth=LIGHT ON/UPON SB/STH</b><br>\n
lighten	<h3>lighten<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lighten 'up <i>(spoken</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to be less serious or to complain or worry less about sth别那么严肃；别抱怨；别担忧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, lighten up! It was only a joke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喂，别紧张！这只不过是开玩笑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lighten sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make sth more cheerful and less serious or depressing使生动活泼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did his best to <b>lighten things up</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他尽力使局势生动起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to lighten up her speech with a few jokes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她讲了几个笑话以使讲话轻松愉快些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

line	<h3>line<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,line 'up </b><br>(<b>for sth/to do sth</b>) if people <b>line up</b>,they form a line, standing one behind the other or beside each other排成一行； 站队； 排队(等候… ) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A group of people were lining up for tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一群人正在排队买票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lined up to shake the President’s hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们站成一排逐一和总统握手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The runners lined up at the starting line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赛跑者在起跑线上站成一排。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> QUEUE UP (FOR STH/TO DO STH) <br>to join with sb in order to do sth与某人联合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Local groups are lining up against the new development.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当地团体正联合起来反对新的开发项目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several newspapers lined up to demand his resignation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几家报纸联手要求他辞职。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'line-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] a row of people that is formed so that sb who saw a crime can try to recognize the person who did it辨认行列，列队认人(把嫌疑犯同其他人排在一起，让目击罪案者辨认):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She picked him out of a line-up }(=she recognized him as the person who committed the crime)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从辨认行列中把他指认出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LINE-UP at LINE SB/STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,line 'up; ,line sth 'up </b><br>to be, or to put sth, in the correct position in relation to sth else(使与相关的其他东西)排齐；(使)对齐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The three holes should all line up (with each other).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这三个孔应该全对齐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,line sb/sth 'up </b><br>to arrange people or things in a line or a row使…排成一行(或一列):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lined the children up for the photograph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她让孩子们站成一排照相。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His CDs were lined up on the shelf.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的光盘排列在架子上。</font><br>(<b>for sb/sth</b>) to organize an event or an activity; to arrange for sb to do something at an event, a competition, etc.组织，安排(活动)；邀集…(做…或参与活动等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s lined up a band for the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为聚会安排了一个乐队。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve lined up a few things for the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们安排了这个周末有几件事要做。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They already had a buyer for their car lined up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已经为他们的汽车找到了个买主。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'line-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] <br>a group of people who have been chosen or invited to take part in an event人员力量的配备状态；阵容；阵式:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an impressive line-up of performers </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 强大的演员阵容</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The line-up for tonight’s game is still not known.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚的比赛阵容还不清楚。</font><br>a set of events, people or things一系列事件；一批人(或事物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several new dramas are included in the line-up of programmes for next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明年的一系列节目中包括几部新戏剧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LINE-UP at LINE UP<br>\n

listen	<h3>listen<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'listen for sb/sth; ,listen 'out for sb/sth </b><br>to listen carefully to see if you can hear sb/sth留心听…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lay awake, listening out for the sound of the key in the lock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她躺着没睡，一直留心听着是否有钥匙转动锁孔的声音。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you listen out for the phone while I’m in the bath? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我洗澡时你注意听电话好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were asked to listen out for a word beginning with ‘sh’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们被要求注意听以sh开头的词。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sound,door</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,listen 'in </b><br>(<b>on/to sth</b>) to listen to sth or sb secretly窃听；偷听；监听:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you been listening in on my phone calls? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是一直在偷听我的电话？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sure that the police were listening in to their conversations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们肯定警方在监听他们的谈话。</font><br>(<b>to sth</b>) to listen to a radio programme, etc.收听(无线电广播等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listen in on Friday for our interview with George Michael.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请于星期五收听我们对乔治·迈克尔的访谈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,listen 'out for sb/sth=LISTEN FOR SB/STH,LISTEN OUT FOR SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,listen 'up <i>(spoken</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to pay attention to what you are going to say(请对方注意听)听着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listen up, everyone — this is important! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家注意听─这很重要！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
live	<h3>live<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live by sth </b><br>to follow a particular belief or set of principles遵守某种信念(或原则等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some people live by the rule ‘anything for the sake of peace’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些人的信念是不惜任何代价寻求和平。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Women working in a man’s world have to live by men’s rules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在男性的圈子里工作的女性要遵守男性的规则。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>principles,standards</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp live by your 'wits <br>to earn money or survive by clever and sometimes dishonest means靠聪明赚钱(或维持生活)；靠玩花招捞钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had no money and was living by his wits and by selling a few paintings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时他没有钱， 靠小聪明和卖几幅画过活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live by sth;'live by doing sth </b><br>to earn the money that you need by using or doing a particular thing靠做某事赚钱为生(或获取所需):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp people who live by the land }(= for example, farmers)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 靠土地为生的人们(如农民) </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lived by giving private lessons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她靠做家庭桝师赚钱生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,live sth 'down </b><br>to make people forget sth very embarrassing or bad that you have done in the past让人忘记(自己做过的事):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t believe I fell in the river — I’ll never be able to <b>live it down</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我难以相信自己曾掉进河里─我永远无法让人忘记的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live for sb/sth </b><br>to consider sb/sth as the main purpose of or the most important person or thing in your life为… 而活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lives for her work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她活着是为了工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What have I got to live for now? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如今我活着是为了什么？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,live 'in </b><br>to live at the place where you work or study住在工作(或学习)的地方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have a nanny living in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们有个保姆住在家里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>BrE</i>) Most students live in during their first year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数学生第一学年住在学校。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>live out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live-in <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>(of an employee雇员) living in the house where they work住在工作场所的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a live-in housekeeper/ position </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 住在雇主家的管家/工作</font><br>(of a boyfriend,girlfriend, etc. 男朋友、女朋友等) living in the same house as their sexual partner同居的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a live-in lover/boyfriend </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 同居恋人/男朋友</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live off sb/sth <i>(often disapproving</i>)</b><br>to get the money or the things you need from sb/sth靠…过活；依赖…生活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t live off your parents forever! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能一辈子靠父母养！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had to live off his savings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他得靠积蓄过活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live off sth </b><br>to eat one type of food very frequently or all the time以食…为生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I was a student I lived off bread and cheese.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我当学生时主要吃麵包和黄油。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LIVE ON STH 2<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp live off the 'land <br>to eat food that you can grow, kill or find yourself依靠种地(或养殖、打猎等)为生；靠土地吃饭；自食其力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The army was forced to live off the land.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军队被迫自给自足。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a farming area and most of the people still live off the land.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是个农业地区，多数人依然靠土地吃饭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp live off the fat of the 'land(<i>disapproving</i>) <br>to have enough money to be able to buy expensive food, drink, clothes, etc.锦衣玉食；生活奢华:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a time when landlords and merchants lived off the fat of the land.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个时代地主和商人穿金戴银，生活阔绰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,live 'on </b><br>to continue to live or exist继续活着；继续存在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He may be dead but his music lives on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他或许不在人世了，但他的音乐经久不衰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'live on sth </b><br>to have a particular amount of money with which to buy everything you need靠(…钱)生活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you manage to live on a student grant? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如何靠奖学金应付生活的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They don’t earn enough to live on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们入不敷出。</font><br>to eat a particular type of food very frequently or all the time常吃…；以…为主食:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was living on fruit and raw vegetables.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她主要吃水果和生蔬菜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp birds that live on insects</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 靠食昆虫为生的鸟</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> LIVE OFF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,live 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to live away from the place where you work or study住在工作(或学习)以外的地方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I lived out during my final year at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我唸大学的最后一年住在校外。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>live in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,live 'out sth; ,live it/them 'out </b><br>to do in reality sth that you think about, believe in, dream of,etc.将(思想)付诸行动；实践(信念等)；实现(梦想等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>) an occasion when customers are locked into a bar or pub after it has closed so that they can continue drinking privately顾客留在关门后的酒吧里(继续喝酒)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'locked in sth </b><br>to be involved in a difficult or unpleasant situation, especially an argument or a legal dispute, that seems unlikely to end soon陷入，卷入(纷争或困境等中无法摆脱):<br><i><font locked into a policy of reducing taxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府的减税政策欲罢不能。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Older horses can get locked into bad target from a kilometre away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 导弹能锁定一公里之外的目标。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>target</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The missile was </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,lock sb/sth 'out of sth</b>) to prevent sb/sth from entering a place by locking a door把…锁在门外:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I arrived home to find the landlady had
