color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Huge sums of money are locked up in pension funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大量的钱都搁死在退休基金上了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>capital,money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tie sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
log	<h3>log<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,log 'in/ 'on; ,log 'into/ 'onto sth <i>(computing</i>)</b><br>to perform the actions that allow you to begin using a computer system登录，注册，进入，登入(计算机系统) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got an error message when I tried to log in/on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想登录时信息提示登录有误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The password allows the user to log into the system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用户用密码可进入系统。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>system,network,computer</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>log off/out;log off/out of sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was logged onto the Internet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我登录了互联网。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,log 'off/ 'out; ,log 'off/ 'out of sth <i>(computing</i>)</b><br>to perform the actions that allow you to finish using a computer system退出， 注销， 登出(计算机系统):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try logging off and logging on again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 试一试先退出再登录。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>system,computer</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>log in/on;log into/onto sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait until all the users are logged off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等所有的用户都退出为止。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
loll	<h3>loll<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,loll a'round; ,loll a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,loll a'bout, ,loll a'bout sth) </b><br>to sit, lie or stand in a relaxed way, doing very little懒洋洋地坐着(或躺着、站着)；无所事事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were several kids lolling around outside the club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几个小孩在俱乐部外面闲荡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim should get a job instead of lolling around the house all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆应该找份工作，不要成天闲在家里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
long	<h3>long<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'long for sb/sth;'long for sb to do sth </b><br>to want sb/sth very much渴望；渴求:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to long for a baby </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盼望要个孩子</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was longing for a chat and a good laugh.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很想聊聊天开心地笑一笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She found herself longing for her visitors to leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她发觉自己巴望着客人离开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+prep+n/pron+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'longed-for <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that sb has been wanting or hoping for very much渴望的；期待已久的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a longed-for child </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盼望已久的孩子</font><br>\n
look	<h3>look<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'bout; ,look a'bout sth; ,look a'bout you <i>(BrE</i>)=LOOK AROUND,LOOK AROUND STH,LOOK AROUND YOU</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'cross/ 'over (at/to sb/sth)</b><br>to look quickly across a room迅速朝(房间)对面看:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked across to where they were sitting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我朝他们坐的地方望过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knew I was there, but she didn’t look over at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她知道我在那里，可她没往我这边看。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'after sb/sth/yourself <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make sure that sb/sth is safe; take care of sb/sth照料；照顾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His parents are looking after the children for the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的父母这个周末照看孩子们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t look after her clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她穿得不整洁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sophie will look after the visitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 索菲会接待客人的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re old enough to look after themselves now }(= they don’t need any help)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们现在够大了，能够自理了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you mind looking after my bag for a minute? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你照看一下我的包好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp See you soon — look after yourself }(= when saying goodbye to sb)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再见吧─保重。</font><br><b>Take care of sb </b>is used in American and British English with the same meaning.美国英语和英国英语均可用<b>take</b> care of sb 表达此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mother is going to look after/take care of the kids while we’re away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们外出时我母亲将照看孩子们。</font><br>In more formal language you can also use <b>care for sb</b> .较正式用语也可以说<b>care for sb</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His job involves caring for the elderly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的工作是照看老年人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> BRING SB UP 1 <br>to make sure that things happen to sb’s advantage确保对自己有利:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s good at <b>looking after his own interests</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他善于保障自己的利益。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He needs to be properly looked after.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他需要得到妥善的照顾。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'after sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to deal with sth; to be responsible for sth处理； 对… 负责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their accountant looks after the financial side of things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的会计负责财务方面的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>attend to sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything’s being looked after.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的事情都有人负责。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Take care of sth</b> is used in American and British English with the same meaning.美国英语和英国英语均可用<b>take care of sth</b> 表达此义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'head (to sth) </b><br>to think about what is going to happen in the future展望未来；为将来设想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team is looking ahead to next season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这支队伍正为下个赛季作准备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Looking ahead to the weekend, the weather will stay fine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可以预见好天气将持续到周末。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,look 'round) </b><br>(<b>at sb/sth</b>) to turn your head in order to see sb/sth behind you转过头看，回头看(某人/某物):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people in front kept looking round at us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 前面的人不时地回过头看我们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked round to see if I was still there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他回头看看我是否还在。</font><br>(<b>for sb/sth</b>) to examine various choices or possibilities考虑各种可能性(以作出选择):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re looking around for a new car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在到处看看，准备买辆新汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'round; ,look a'round sth <i>(BrE also</i> ,look 'round, ,look 'round sth)</b><br>to visit a place or a building as a tourist游览，参观(某处):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take your time looking around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 慢慢游览吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve gone to look round the cathedral.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们去参观大桝堂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent the day looking around the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我白天游览了市区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'round; ,look a'round sth; ,look a'round you <i>(BrE also </i>,look a'bout/ 'round,,look a'bout/ 'round sth, ,look a'bout/ 'round you)</b><br>to turn your head in different directions so that you can see sth or see what is there环视；环顾；四下察看:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She came into the room, looked around, then went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她进房间里四下察看了一下就出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked round the classroom angrily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他生气地环顾桝室。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked about me at the other passengers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看了看我周围的乘客。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look at sb/sth </b><br>to turn your eyes towards sb/sth so that you can see them/it看着， 瞧着(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t look at me like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别那样看着我！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you looking at? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在看什么呢？</font><br>to examine sth/sb closely(仔细)察看，检查:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like the doctor to look at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想找医生给他检查一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you look at this watch for me? I think it might be broken.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我看看这块手表吗？我想可能是坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took the car to the garage to get it looked at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把汽车开到修理厂去检修。</font><br><i>(usually used in negative sentences or questions</i>通常用于否定句或疑问句)to consider or be prepared to accept sb/sth考虑； 准备接受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wouldn’t even look at someone wanting part-time work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对于想兼职的人他们完全不予考虑。</font><br>used to draw sb’s attention to sb/sth, often as an example that you want them to follow or not follow看看…吧(常作为正面或反面范例) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t take advice from her — just look at the mess she’s made of her own life! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会听她的建议的─就看看她把自己的生活搞得有多糟糕吧！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He left school without any qualifications, but look at him now! }(= he is very successful now)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有毕业就离开学校， 可看他现在多有出息！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Money doesn’t always bring happiness — just look at Ian }(= he is rich but not happy)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 金钱并非总能带来幸福─看看伊恩就知道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look at sth </b><br>to read sth, usually quickly, without reading all the details浏览；翻阅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sat in the waiting room, looking at a magazine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坐在等候室翻阅杂志。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t hand the form in until it’s been looked at by a teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等老师过目之后再交这份表。</font><br>to think about or study sth思考；考虑；研究:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you looked at the possibility of adopting a child? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想过可以收养个孩子吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film looks at the events leading up to the war.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影探讨了导致这场战争的诸多事件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Four possible routes were looked at for the new road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 修建新公路考虑了四条可能的路线。</font><br>to consider sth in a particular way(用某种方式)看待，考虑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you look at it like that, it’s a good thing we didn’t go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你那么看，我们没去是件好事。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) (<i>always used in the progressive tenses</i> 总是用于进行时) to have to consider or deal with sth; to be faced with sth不得不考虑(或处理) ； 面临:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re looking at ￡600 to get the car fixed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你若想修好这辆车就得考虑花600 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he’s found guilty he’s looking at a six-year prison sentence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他如果被判有罪，就面临六年监禁的判刑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look a'way (from sb/sth) </b><br>to look in the opposite direction; to turn your eyes away from sb/sth把视线(从…)移开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked at him then looked away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看了看他，然后移开了视线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He mumbled a reply and looked away from me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他支支吾吾回答了一下就不再看我了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'back (at/on/to sth) </b><br>to think about sth that has happened in your past回首(往事)；回忆； 回顾:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Looking back, I’m not surprised she left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回头想想，我对她的离开并不感到意外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked back on his time in England with a sense of nostalgia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他怀恋着自己在英国的时光。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp never/not look 'back (<i>informal</i>) <br>to become more and more successful一帆风顺；蒸蒸日上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He started work on a market stall in 1970 and he’s never looked back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他于1970年开了个集市货摊，从此生意日益兴旺。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'down </b><br>to turn your eyes downwards to the floor, especially because you are embarrassed,shy, etc.(尤指因尴尬、害羞等)垂下目光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little boy blushed and looked down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小男孩脸红了， 低头向下看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked down at her hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她低头看着自己的双手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'down on sb/sth </b><br>to consider sb/sth as less good or important than yourself蔑视，轻视，瞧不起(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tends to look down on people who haven’t been to college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她偏向瞧不起没上过大学的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They looked down on our little house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对我们的小屋不屑一顾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was looked down on at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在学校被人看扁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look for sb/sth </b><br>to search for sb/sth, either because you have lost them/it, or because you need them/it寻找；寻求:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sue’s been looking for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 休一直在找你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Can I help you?’ ‘Yes, I’m looking for this shirt in blue.’ }(= in a shop/store)&b{“我能帮你吗？”“是的，我要找这款蓝色衬衣。”</font></i><br>[NOTE]<b>Seek sb/sth</b> is only used with this meaning in very formal language or in newspapers.表达此义也用<b>seek sb/sth</b> ，但只作十分正式的用语或用于报章。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look for sth </b><br>to hope for sth or expect sth期望；期待；盼望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The examiners will be looking for good grammar and spelling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主考人希望语法和拼写正确无误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This could be just the opportunity he’s been looking for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这可能就是他一直期待的机会。</font><br>to search for sth; to try to find sth寻找；试图找到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were looking for an easy solution to the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在寻求解决这个问题的简捷途径。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Seek sth</b> is only used with this meaning in very formal language,or in newspapers.表达此义也用<b>seek sth</b> ，但只作十分正式的用语或用于报章。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp look for 'trouble <br>to behave in a way that is likely to cause an argument, a fight, etc.自找麻烦；自寻烦恼；自讨苦吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you looking for trouble? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要招惹麻烦吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>un'looked-for <i>adj </i>(<i>formal</i>)</b><br>not expected没想到的；出乎预料的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp unlooked-for success </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 意想不到的成功</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'forward to sth; ,look 'forward to doing sth </b><br>to feel excited about sth that is going to happen because you expect to enjoy it盼望，期待(…) :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you looking forward to your trip? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你期待着这次旅行吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not looking forward to going to the dentist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可不希望去看牙医。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re looking forward to the concert!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对音乐会翘首以待！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I look forward to hearing from you }(= at the end of a letter)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盼望着收到你的信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President’s visit is eagerly looked forward to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们热切地盼望总统来访。</font><br>[NOTE]Remember that<b>to</b> is a preposition in this phrasal verb and must be followed by a noun or the -ing form of a verb.记住<b>to</b> 在本短语动词中是介词，后面必须跟名词或动词的-ing 形式。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'in (on sb) </b><br>to make a short visit to a place(到某人处)短暂拜访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked Sarah to look in on her grandmother on her way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要萨拉回家时顺便去看看她的祖母。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor will look in again this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生今晚会再来探视的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'into sth</b><br>to examine sth or consider it carefully调查；研究；认真考虑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee is looking into the matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会正在调查这件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager is looking into your complaint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理正在处理你们的投诉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re looking into the possibility of moving to France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在考虑迁往法国的可能性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This situation should be looked into.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个情况应该进行调查。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'on </b><br>to watch an event or an incident without taking part in it yourself旁观:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People looked on in alarm as the car began to roll down the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们惊恐地看着那辆车开始磙下山坡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Passers-by just looked on as he was attacked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他遭人袭击，路人只在一边袖手旁观。</font><br>(<b>with sb</b>)(<i>AmE</i>) to share a book, etc. with another person in a group(和某人)合看，合读(书等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There aren’t enough books so you’ll have to look on with your neighbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 书不够，你们只能和邻近的人一起看了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'onlooker <i>n </i></b><br>a person who watches sth without becoming involved in it旁观者:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A crowd of onlookers formed around the fight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旁观者聚集起来围观斗殴。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look on sb/sth (<i>also</i> 'look upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to consider sb/sth in a particular way(以…)看待；把…视作(…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I look on you as my friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把你视为朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked upon the assignment as a challenge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把这项任务看成一种挑战。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked on life in a different way after that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自此以后，我的人生观改变了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was always looked on with distrust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以前她总被视为不可信任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job was looked upon as glamorous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份工作令人嚮往。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'out </b><br>used to tell sb to be careful, especially when there is some danger(表示警告，尤指有危险)小心，当心，留神:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look out! There’s a car coming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当心！有车来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re going to burn that food if you don’t look out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是不看着点就会把食物煮煳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>watch out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look sth 'out (for sb/sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to search for something from among your possessions把…找出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll look out that book for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会给你找出那本书的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'out for sb/yourself </b><br>to take care of sb/yourself and think about their/your own interests考虑他人(或自己)的利益；关照:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once he was in London he had to look out for himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一到伦敦就要自己照顾自己。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Emily’s brothers always looked out for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃米莉的哥哥们总是关照她。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'out for sb/sth </b><br>to try to find sb/sth or meet sb留心寻觅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was looking out for Pete but I didn’t see him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我当时一直找皮特，可没有看见他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look out for this film at your local cinema.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留意你当地的电影院有没有播放这部影片。</font><br>to try to avoid sth bad happening or doing sth bad当心；提防；留心防备:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look out for pickpockets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当心扒手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>watch out for sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lookout <i>n </i></b><br>a place where sb watches from to see if there is any danger监视处；观察所；了望台:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a lookout post/tower </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 了望哨/塔</font><br>a person who watches for danger监视员；观察员；了望员:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burglars posted a lookout outside the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盗贼在房子外面安排了一人望风。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'out on/over sth </b><br>(of a room, etc.房间等) to have a view of sth面向；朝向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our room looked out over the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从我们的房间朝外看可俯视广场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'over (at/to sb/sth)=LOOK ACROSS/OVER(AT/TO SB/STH)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'over sth</b><br>to make a tour of a place参观；游览:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were invited to look over the new classrooms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应邀参观了新桝室。</font><br>to read sth quickly浏览；快速阅读:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to look over my notes before the test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 测验前我得把笔记过一遍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your tutor will look over your work with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的导师会和你一道看一遍你的作业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look sb/sth 'over </b><br>to inspect or examine sb/sth to see how good, big, etc. it is查看；检查:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked the painting over carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他仔细查看了那幅画。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like the doctor to look him over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想医生给他检查一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll get a mechanic to look the car over before we buy it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要请个技工检验一下这辆车再买。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>check sb/sth over;examine sb/sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d like a mechanic to look over it for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们想请个技工帮我们把它检验一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=LOOK AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'round; ,look 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=LOOK AROUND,LOOK AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'round; ,look 'round sth; ,look 'round you <i>(BrE</i>)=LOOK AROUND,LOOK AROUND STH,LOOK AROUND YOU</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'through sb </b><br>to look at sb and not show that you have seen or recognized them对某人视而不见；佯装没有看见某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I smiled at him, but he just looked straight through me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我朝他笑了笑，可他假装没看见我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'through sth </b><br>to read sth quickly快速阅读:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked through her notes before the exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她考试前匆匆看了一下笔记。</font><br>to read sth quickly浏览； 翻阅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked through the paper while I was waiting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我边等边翻阅了一下报纸。</font><br>to examine a collection of things or what is inside sth查看，翻看(一批或某物内的东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you doing looking through my bag? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你干吗翻我的包？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look to sb/sth (for sth/to do sth) </b><br>to rely on sb/sth or expect sb to provide sth or do sth依赖…；期待，指望(某人…):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They looked to us for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们指望得到我们的帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must look to other means to generate the funds we need.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须通过别的方法筹集我们需要的资金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many students can’t look to their parents for financial support.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多学生不能指望父母在经济上支持。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn to sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look to sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to think about something that will happen in the future考虑(将来的事)；展望:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are looking to the future with confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们满怀信心地展望未来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the future </b><br><i>(formal</i>) to make sure that sth is safe or in good condition; to think about how to improve sth注意(确保安全、正常等)；考虑(改进):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should look to your own behaviour before criticizing others.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正人先要正己。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'up </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to raise your eyes抬头看:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She looked up from her book and smiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从书本里抬起头来笑了笑。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) (<i>usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时)(of a business, a situation etc. 生意、情况等) to become better; to improve好转；改善:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things started to look up for me after I got a job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我找到工作后情况开始好转了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Business is looking up at last.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生意终于有起色了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look sb 'up (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to visit or contact sb when you are in the place where they live, especially when you have not seen them for a long time(尤指久别之后在所处之地)拜访，看望，接触:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look me up next time you’re in London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你下次到伦敦，来看我吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp look sb ,up and 'down <br>to look at sb suspiciously or in a careful or critical way(因怀疑或审视等)上下仔细打量<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look sth 'up </b><br>to search for a word or some information in a dictionary or another book(在词典或其他书中)查阅，查检:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked the word up in the dictionary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在词典里查过这个词。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on, I’ll just look up her telephone number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 稍等一下，我马上查查她的电话号码。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,look 'up to sb </b><br>to admire or respect sb钦佩；仰慕；尊敬:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always looked up to her older sister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一向尊敬她的姐姐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was looked up to by the rest of her family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她受到家人的尊敬。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'look upon sb/sth=LOOK ON SB/STH</b><br>\n
loom	<h3>loom<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,loom a'head </b><br>if sth dangerous, difficult or unpleasant <b>looms ahead</b>, it is likely to happen soon(危险、困难或不愉快的事情)即将出现，逼近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Further problems are looming ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 更多的问题迫在眉睫。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,loom 'up </b><br>to appear as a large shape that is not clear, often in a way that seems frightening or threatening赫然耸现；令人惊恐地隐现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A dark shape loomed up out of the fog.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个黑煳煳的物体在雾霭中出现了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A man loomed up out of the darkness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个男人隐隐出现在黑暗中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
loosen	<h3>loosen<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,loosen 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become more relaxed and comfortable放松；舒散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He began to loosen up and enjoy the evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始轻松下来享受这个夜晚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,loosen 'up; ,loosen sb/sth 'up </b><br>to relax your muscles or parts of the body, or make them relax,before taking exercise, etc.(在运动或其他活动前)放松:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I swam a short distance to loosen up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我游了一小段距离放松放松。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A massage will help loosen you up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按摩一下会使你得到放松的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These exercises will loosen up your shoulders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些动作会使你的肩部松弛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
lop	<h3>lop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lop sth 'off; ,lop sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sth from sth, especially branches from a tree, by cutting it(从…)砍掉，剪去，削去(树枝等):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several branches had been lopped off (<i>the tree</i>).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (从树上)砍下了几条枝桠。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lopped 20p off the price of each unit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把单价削减了20 便士。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth off,chop sth off sth;cut sth off,cut sth off sth </b><br>to make sth smaller or less削减；缩小；减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new rail link has lopped an hour off the journey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新铁路连线把旅程缩短了一个小时。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sth off,knock sth off sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
lord	<h3>lord<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lord it over sb </b><br>to behave in a superior way to sb对某人摆架子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She likes to lord it over the junior staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢在初级职员面前摆架子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+prep<br>\n
lose	<h3>lose<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'lose yourself in sth </b><br>to become so interested in sth that you are not aware of anything else沉迷于；专心致志于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I soon lost myself in the excitement of the play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很快就沉浸在戏剧激动人心的情节中了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lose 'out (on sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to be unsuccessful in getting sth that you want or think you should have得不到(需要或觉得应有的东西):<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some youngsters are taking day jobs and losing out on schooling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些年轻人白天工作而荒废了学业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If things go wrong, I’m the one who’ll lose out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果有什么差错，受损失的将是我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp While the stores make big profits, it’s the customers who lose out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店赚大钱，而吃亏的是顾客。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,lose 'out to sb/sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to not get the business you expected or hoped to get, because sb else has got it(生意)落到…手里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Small stores are losing out to the big supermarkets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小商店的生意都转到了大型超市那里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n

这大字体便于阅读。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'make sb/sth into sth </b><br>to change sb/sth into sth把…变成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made the extra [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'off (with sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to hurry or rush away, especially when sb is trying to escape or has stolen sth匆忙离开；﹙尤指﹚仓惶逃跑，﹙带某物﹚熘走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The youths made off in a stolen car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个年轻人开着偷来的车熘了。</font><br><i><font [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>used to ask sb how they have managed or survived in a particular situation﹙询问是否处理得当﹚应付，过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>How are you making out</b> in your new home? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在新家生活得怎么样？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Did you make out all right in the interview?’ ‘Yes, fine.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “ 你面试顺利吗？ ”“是的，还好。”</font><br><b>(with sb)</b> (<i>AmE</i>) to kiss sb亲吻﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her making out with Billy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见她和比利接吻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'out (that …), ,make sb/sth/yourself 'out to be … </b><br>to claim that sth is true that may not be; to try to make people believe sth声称；把……说成；努力使人相信:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She made out (that) she was earning a fortune.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吹嘘说她赚大钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Things aren’t as bad as he makes out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 情况并非像他说的那样糟糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brochure made the place out to be a quiet resort.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小册子把这个地方描绘成清静的度假胜地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He makes himself out to be a big shot in the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自诩为城里的大人物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hotel wasn’t quite what it was made out to be (= }it was not as good as the brochure said it was&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅馆并没有介绍的那么好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make sb/sth 'out </b><br>to manage to see sb/sth or read sth看清； 分清； 辨认清楚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could just make out the shape of a house in the darkness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黑暗中我隐约看见房子的外形。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you make out his handwriting? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看得清他写的字吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could just make out the sound of distant voices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她模模煳煳地听到了远处的声音。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t make out what he was saying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听不清他当时在说什么。</font><br><i>(used in negative sentences and questions </i>用于否定句和疑问句) to understand sb/sth; to see the reasons why sth happens or why sb behaves in the way that they do理解；明白；弄懂:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She couldn’t make out the expression on his face as he spoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不明白他说话时为什么有这样的表情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t make her out at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根本摸不透她的性格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn’t make out what was going on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他搞不清这到底是怎么回事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to apply for a permit, <b>as far as I can make out</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据我了解，你需要申请许可证。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How do you make that out (= }how did you reach that conclusion&b{)? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你怎样得出那个结论？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make sth 'out </b><br>to write out or complete a form or document开具，填写﹙表格或文件﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made out a cheque for ￡100.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开了一张100 英镑的支票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who shall I make the cheque out to (=}whose name shall I write on it&b{)? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 支票抬头写什么？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I make the invoice out to the company?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发票抬头写公司的名称吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you make out a list for me of everyone who’s coming?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请给我写一张所有来宾的名单好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cheque,list</b><br>In informal spoken language <b>make sb out sth</b> can also be used.非正式口语也可以说<b>make sb out sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll make you out a list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来给你开张清单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make sb/sth 'over <i>(informal,especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to change sb/sth to give them/it a new appearance; to change sth to give it a new use改变形象；改造；修饰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to make over the whole house when they moved in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们搬家时决定把新居彻底整修一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b> 'makeover <i>n </i></b><br>the process of improving the appearance of a person or a place﹙外观的﹚改进，改善；修饰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won a complete makeover (=}new clothes, hairstyle, etc.&b{) in a competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在比赛中获得革新形象奖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make sth 'over to sb </b><br>to legally give sth you own to sb else﹙合法地﹚给予，转让，转送:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made his estate over to his eldest son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把财产传给了他的长子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has made a lot of its power over to the regions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府将很多权力下放给了各个行政区。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house was made over to the charity three years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这所房子三年前转赠给了慈善团体。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>estate,money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'make towards sb/sth </b><br>to go in the direction of sb/sth向……移动；朝……走去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw them making towards the exit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见他们向出口走去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'up; ,make sb/sth 'up; ,make yourself 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to put substances on your/sb’s eyes, lips and face to make them or yourself attractive or to prepare for an appearance in the theatre, on television, etc.化妆；上妆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It takes her an hour to make up before going on stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她上台演出前用了一个小时化妆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spends ages making herself up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没完没了地梳理打扮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children had been made up to look like clowns.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们的脸涂抹得像小丑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,made-'up <i>adj </i></b><br>wearing coloured substances on the face化妆的；上了妆的:<br><i><font substances that people put on their eyes, lips and face to make themselves more attractive, or that actors, etc. use化妆品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to put on your make-up </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 化妆</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a make-up bag</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 化妆包</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> MAKE-UP at MAKE STH UP <br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'up; ,make it 'up (with sb) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to end a quarrel or a dispute with sb和解；﹙同某人﹚言归于好:<br><i><font parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和父母和解了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make sth 'up </b><br>to invent sth, often in order to deceive sb杜撰；编造﹙谎言等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was making up stories for the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在给孩子们编故事。</font><br><i><font making it all up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是以为我纯粹是在瞎编？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>story,excuse</b><br>2<b>,make 'up sth </b>to form a particular part of sth形成……的一部份；构成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rice makes up a large part of their diet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大米是他们的主粮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Women make up 55% of the student population.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女生占学生人数的55%。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>account for sth;constitute sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>3<b>,make 'up sth, ,make it/them 'up </b>to put sth together from several different things拼装；组成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the cultures and races that make up the nation </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家包含的各种文化和种族</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The course <b>is made up of</b> five modules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课程由五个单元组成。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>constitute sth;be composed of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow<b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and<b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  CONSIST OF STH/SB,CONSIST OF DOING STH <br>to complete sth, especially a number or an amount凑数:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need one more player to make up a team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们还需要一个队员才能凑成一队。</font><br>to replace sth that has been lost补上﹙失去的东西﹚；补偿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to make up lost time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得补回失去的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was late for work but he made the time up the following day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他上班迟到了，可他第二天把时间补上了。</font><br>to prepare sth; to make sth ready to use准备；预备； 配备:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pharmacist made up the prescription(= }the medicine&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药剂师配好了药。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She made up a basket of food for the picnic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她为野餐弄好了一篮子食物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bed’s already made up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 床已经铺好了。</font><br>In informal spoken language <b>make sb up sth</b> is also used.非正式口语也说<b>make sb up sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you make us up a packed lunch? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请为我们准备一份盒饭好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp make up your 'mind <br>to decide sth作出决定；下定决心:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I like both dresses — I can’t make up my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两件连衣裙我都喜欢─我定不下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you made up your minds where to go for your honeymoon? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们想好了去哪儿度蜜月了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll never persuade him to stay — his mind’s made up (}= he has definitely decided to go&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你根本无法劝他留下来─他去意已决。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on — it’s make your mind up time! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别犹豫了─该下决心了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>made-'up <i>adj </i></b><br>invented; not true or real杜撰的； 编造的； 假的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a true story, not a made-up one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是件真实的事，并不是瞎编的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> MADE-UP at MAKE UP,MAKE SB/STH UP,MAKE YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'make-up <i>n </i></b><br>the different things, people,qualities, etc. that combine to form something组成成分；构成方式:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Aggression is part of our genetic make-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好斗是我们遗传个性的一部份。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country has a complicated ethnic makeup.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个国家的种族成分很复杂。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) a school test that you were not present for and that you take later补考:<br><i><font </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 补考</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  MAKE-UP at MAKE UP,MAKE SB/STH UP,MAKE YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'up for sth; ,make 'up for doing sth</b><br>to do or provide sth good to balance or reduce the effects of sth bad补救；弥补；补偿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I bought myself a new dress to make up for not getting the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没得到那份工作，于是买了件连衣裙聊以自慰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After two years in prison he’s now making up for lost time (= }doing the things he was not able to do while he was in prison&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在狱中关了两年之后，他正在弥补失去的时间。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>compensate (for sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,make 'up for sth; ,make it 'up to sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to do sth good for sb because you have treated them badly or because they have done sth good for you弥补﹙对某人的无礼等﹚；表示歉意；报答:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An apology won’t make up for the way you’ve behaved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 单纯道歉无法补救你所做过的事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he was sorry and promised to make it up to her.</font></i><br><font march	<h3>march<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,march 'on </b><br>to continue marching; to continue walking quickly继续行进；继续快速行走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to speak to her but she just marched on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想和她搭话，可她闷头一个劲儿地走。</font><br>to move on or pass quickly继续行进；快速经过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Time marched on and we still hadn’t finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间过得飞快，我们还没有完成任务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>time</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'march on sth </b><br>to march to a place in order to attack it or make a protest向……行进﹙以示抗议或进行攻击﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Demonstrators marched on the American embassy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 示威者向着美国大使馆行进。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,march 'past; ,march 'past sb/sth</b><br>(of soldiers士兵) to march past an important person or building在要员﹙或重要建筑﹚前列队经过；作分列式接受检阅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At 11 o’clock the army began to march past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 部队在11 点钟开始接受检阅。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b> 'march past <i>n </i></b><br>a ceremony in which soldiers formally march past an important person, etc.分列式﹙军人列队通过检阅台﹚<br>\n

marry	<h3>marry<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,marry be'neath you/yourself </b><br>to marry sb who belongs to a lower social class than your own和社会地位较低的人结婚； 下嫁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She thought her son was marrying beneath him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得她的儿子的婚姻门不当、户不对。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,marry 'into sth </b><br>to become a part of a family or a group because you have married sb who belongs to it因结婚而成为﹙家庭或团体的﹚成员:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She married into a wealthy family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她嫁到了富裕人家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>family,aristocracy</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,marry sb 'off (to sb) (<i>disapproving</i>) </b><br>to get rid of a daughter or a son by finding a husband or wife for them让﹙子女﹚结婚以将其摆脱；把……嫁出；让……娶亲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had married his daughter off to a man twice her age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把女儿嫁给了年纪比她大一倍的男人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,marry 'up; ,marry sth 'up (with sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to join up or connect successfully; to make two things or two parts do this﹙将两个事物或部份﹚接合；﹙使﹚连接上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two halves of the structure didn’t marry up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个结构的两半部份接合得不好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn’t marry up the two parts of the lock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他锁不上锁。</font><br>to match; mess	<h3>mess<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mess a'bout <i>(BrE</i>)=MESS AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mess a'bout with sb <i>(BrE</i>)=MESS AROUND WITH SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mess a'bout with sth <i>(BrE</i>)=MESS AROUND WITH STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mess sb a'bout/a'round <i>(BrE,informal</i>)</b><br>to treat sb badly, making them waste time, changing your mind a lot, etc.不公正地﹙或随便地﹚看待某人； 团弄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They messed us around so much, I wrote to complain.</font></i><br><font 我讨厌被人愚弄。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>muck sb about/around <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mess a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,mess a'bout) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>1(<b>with sb/sth</b>) to spend time and enjoy yourself doing sth with no particular purpose闲着；自娱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We just messed around at home all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一整天都在家里闲着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children love to mess about in water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童喜欢嬉水。</font><br>(<b>with sb/sth</b>) to behave in a silly way, especially when you should be working or doing sth else胡闹；瞎闹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got told off for messing around in class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为捣乱课堂而受到一通训斥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She messed about all year and failed her exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她混了整整一年，结果考砸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop messing around with Jo and get on with the work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别和乔瞎折腾了，快干活吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘They fixed that quickly!’ ‘Yeah, they don’t mess around.’ (= }they do things quickly&b{)</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “他们很快就修好了！”“是啊，他们做事效率高。”</font><br>to joke, to say silly things开玩笑；胡说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not a situation that is full of confusion混乱；杂乱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a mix-up over the tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些票弄混了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,mixed-'up <i>adj </i></b><br>untidy; in a state of confusion混乱的；混杂的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She presented me with a mixedup stack of files and asked me to put them in order.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把一堆杂乱的文件推给我让我整理好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My papers were all mixed-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的文件全乱了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> MIXED-UP at MIX SB UP,BE/GET MIXED UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,mixed 'up in sth </b><br>to be/become involved in sth dangerous or illegal卷入，牵涉进﹙危险或非法的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He would never have got mixed up in anything criminal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决不会参与任何犯罪的事的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did you get mixed up in all this?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是如何被牵连进这一切的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,mixed 'up with sb </b><br>to be/become friendly with or involved with sb dangerous or dishonest和﹙危险或不诚实的人﹚来往；与……厮混:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll never understand how she got mixed up with Phil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我永远也搞不明白她是如何跟菲尔鬼混上的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was mixed up with the wrong crowd for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和一些不三不四的人交往过一阵。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'mix it with sb <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to compete with sb; to argue or fight with sb和……较量；与某人吵架﹙ 或打架﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll be mixing it with the world’s best players.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将和世界级好手较量。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can mix it with the best of them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他能够和他们中最好的一比高低。</font><br>to meet and spend time with people in a friendly way和……交往；同……相处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She loves mixing it with the rich and famous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢结交上层人物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+prep<br>\n

[G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,move 'down</b><br>(of a level or an amount水平或数量) to decrease降低；减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,move 'down; ,move 'down sth</b><br>to movefrom a higher position to a lower one向下移动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I watched her move nervously down the slope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看着她战战兢兢地下坡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hill,ladder</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go up,go up sth </b><br>to move to a new position tomake more space for sb else移动﹙ 以腾出地方﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you move down (the bus) so more people can get on? </font></i><br><font to approach or movenearer to sth准备做﹙或取得﹚；接近；靠近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are moving towards a better understanding of the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正逐渐了解这一状况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the group moving towards finding a solution? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个团体有望找到解决方法吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>understanding,settlement</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,move 'up </b><br>(of a rate, a level or an amount 比率、水平或数量) to increase增长；上升:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What will we do if interest rates move up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果利率上调，我们该怎么办？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>go down</b><br>to change your position to make room for sb else让位；让开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, move up a bit and let your mother sit down! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快，挪开点让你妈坐下！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> MOVE DOWN,MOVE DOWN STH 2; ,move 'up sth; ,move sb/sth 'up;,move sb/sth 'up sth </b><br>to move from a lower to a higher position; to make sb/sth do this﹙使﹚向上移动， 升高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold the ladder tightly and move up a rung at a time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抓紧梯子一级一级地往上爬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We watched the group moving up the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看着这队人登上山冈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) This is your chance to move up the career ladder and get a better job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是你往事业阶梯上攀登并得到好工作的机会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Move your hand up and down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上下挥动你的手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to move the piano up three flights of stairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得把钢琴抬上三段楼梯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go up,go up sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>move down,move down sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

muck	<h3>muck<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,muck a'bout/a'round <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>(<b>with sb/sth</b>) to spend time and enjoy yourself doing sth with no particular purpose游手好闲；闲荡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were mucking about outside, kicking a ball around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在外面悠闲地踢着球。</font><br>(<b>with sb/sth</b>) to behave in a silly way, especially when you should be working or doing sth else游手好闲；游荡；胡混:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop mucking around and go to bed.</font></i><br><font nibble	<h3>nibble<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'nibble at sth </b><br>to eat sth by taking very small bites小口咬；一点点地咬:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mouse nibbled at the peanuts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老鼠一点一点地啃着花生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve only nibbled at your lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你午饭只吃了几口。</font><br>to show a slight interest in sth表示对……稍感兴趣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several companies have nibbled at our offer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 若干公司表示对我们的出价有兴趣。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,nibble a'way at sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to gradually reduce or use up the total amount of sth慢慢减少；蚕食:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Inflation began to nibble away at their savings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通货膨胀开始蚕食他们的存款。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n

nose	<h3>nose<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,nose a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,nose a'bout) (&b{for sth</b> )(<i>informal</i>)}<br>to go around trying to find out sth about sb/sth, particularly when you should not do this打探；探察；搜寻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m just nosing about for clues.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正在寻找线索。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,nose sb 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to defeat sb by a small amount, for example in a race or an election以微弱优势打败:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was nosed out of first place by her old rival.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被老对手以微弱优势击败丢掉了冠军。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,nose sth 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to discover some information by searching for it侦察到；打探到；查出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That man can nose a news story out anywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那人到任何地方都能挖出新闻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sniff sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
