open	<h3>open<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open 'into/ 'onto sth </b><br>if a door or a room <b>opens into/onto</b> sth, it leads directly to it﹙门或房间﹚直接通向，通往:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door opened onto a small yard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门外就是一个小院子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kitchen opens into a large sitting room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 厨房和一个大客厅相通。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open 'off sth </b><br>if a door or a room <b>opens off</b> sth, it connects directly with it﹙门或房间﹚与……相连:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several doors opened off the hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几道门通往大厅。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The offices opened off the reception area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些办公室和接待区相接。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open 'out </b><br>(into/onto sth) to become wider or bigger; to become more open and not enclosed by anything变宽； 变大； 变得开阔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley opened out in front of us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宽阔的山谷在我们面前展开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The narrow lane opened out into a field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狭窄的小路尽头是一大片地。</font><br>(<b>to sb</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) =OPEN UP 1<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He only opened out to her very slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他慢慢地才对她把话敞开来说。</font><br>to spread out;to become open and larger or flatter展开； 打开；变得更大更平展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The table opens out so that more people can sit at it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这桌子可以打开，让多些人坐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The buds on the trees have all opened out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树上的花蕾都绽放了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open sth 'out </b><br>to spread sth out; to make sth open and flat把……展开；把……打开铺平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He opened the map out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他铺开了地图。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open 'up </b><br><i>(BrE also </i>,<b>open 'out</b>) (<b>to sb</b> ) (<i>informal</i>) to talk freely and openly about what you feel or think直抒胸臆；畅所欲言:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you open up to me and tell me what’s worrying you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请放开谈谈你的烦恼好吗？</font><br>to start firing开火:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The antiaircraft guns opened up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高射炮开始射击。</font><br>(often used in orders, etc.常用于命令等) to open a door开门:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Open up or we’ll break the door down! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开门，不然就砸门了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open sb 'up </b><br>to cut sb open in order to do a medical operation开刀﹙做手术﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They opened her up but didn’t find anything wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们给她开刀，可没有发现毛病。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open 'up; ,open sth 'up</b><br>to become or to make sth possible, available or able to be reached﹙使某事物﹚ 成为可能， 可得到， 可达到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you have good qualifications, a whole range of possibilities open up for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果资历足够，发展的机会就会很多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole region has been opened up for trade by the new rail link.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新铁路线把整个地区的贸易搞活了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They opened up the sports hall to house the flood victims.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们开放体育馆安置水灾灾民。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Writing to penfriends can open up a whole new world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和笔友通信给你开闢一个新世界。</font><br>to start a new business开业；开张:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company are opening up a new factory in Wales.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司将在威尔士开一家新工厂。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>close down,close sth down</b><br>to begin business for the day﹙每天﹚开门营业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’re feeling tired this morning, I’ll open up (the store).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你今天早上要是觉得累，就由我来开店吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>close up,close sth up </b><br>(usually in sport通常用于体育运动) to develop or start to happen; to produce sth or make sth start to happen发展；﹙使﹚开始发生，出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An increasing gap is opening up between the achievements of girls and boys in exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女生和男生的考试成绩差距开始拉远。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp United have opened up a three-point lead after five games.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联队在五局比赛后以三分领先。</font><br>to become wider; to make sth wider, especially sth that has been closed﹙使﹚张开，裂开；拓展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Coughing might open up your wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咳嗽有可能震裂你的伤口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wished the floor would open up and swallow her (= }for example, because she felt very embarrassed about sth&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她恨不得地上开个口子把她吞下去﹙因受窘为难等﹚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cutting down the trees opened up the view from the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些树砍掉之后， 房子的视野开阔了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,open sth 'up</b><br>to make sth that is shut, locked, etc.open打开；开启:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you open up that box of books for me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请帮我打开那箱书好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
opt	<h3>opt<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'opt for sth </b><br>to choose sth; to make a decision about sth选择；做决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More students are now opting for computer science courses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在有较多的学生选修计算机科学课程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can stay in the main hotel or opt for one of the bungalows near the beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以住在旅馆主楼或海滩附近其中一座平房。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,opt 'in; ,opt 'into sth </b><br>to choose to take part in sth决定加入；选择参加:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We offer a pension plan, and all staff have the chance to opt in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们实行养老金计划，所有职员均可参加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government decided to opt into the new European treaty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府决定加入新的欧洲条约。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>opt out,opt out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,opt 'out; ,opt 'out of sth</b><br>to choose not to take part in sth决定退出；选择不参加:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can opt out of the company’s pension plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以选择不参加公司的养老金计划。</font><br>(of a school or a hospital in Britain英国学校或医院) to choose not to be under the control of the local authority选择不受地方当局管理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A majority of parents were in favour of opting out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数家长赞成脱离地方当局管理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>opt in,opt into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b> 'opt-out <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>often used as an adjective </i>常用作形容词﹚<br>the act of choosing not to take part in sth不参加的决定<br>(in Britain英国) the action of a school or a hospital that decides to manage its own money and is therefore no longer controlled by a local authority﹙学校或医院从地方当局管理的﹚退出，脱离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nurses and health workers voted against the opt-out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 护士和保健员表决反对脱离地方当局管理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,opted-'out <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] (in Britain英国) an <b>opted-out</b> school or hospital is one that has decided not to be under the control of the local authority﹙学校或医院﹚选择不受地方当局管理的<br>\n
order	<h3>order<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,order sb a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,order sb a'bout)</b><br>to keep on telling sb to do things in an unpleasant way﹙不断地﹚支使，命令，使唤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop ordering me around! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别再使唤我了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Even as a child he ordered his friends about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从小就爱支使朋友。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,order 'in; ,order 'in sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to telephone and buy a meal from a restaurant that cooks the food and brings it to your home打电话让餐馆等送外卖食物；电话订餐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m too tired to cook — let’s order in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我累得不想做饭了─我们叫外卖吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s order in Chinese tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们今晚打电话要中餐外卖吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,order sb 'off; ,order sb 'off sth </b><br>to tell sb to leave sth such as a bus, a train, etc.指示某人离开；叫…下车:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driver ordered the boys off for messing around on the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个男孩在公共汽车上捣乱被司机赶了下去。</font><br>(<b>for sth</b>) (<i>especially BrE</i>) (in a sports game体育比赛) to make sb leave the field because they have broken the rules of the game罚某人下场:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was ordered off for arguing with the referee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和裁判发生口角被罚下场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>player</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>send sb off (for sth)(<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,order 'out (for sth) (<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>to telephone and buy a meal from a restaurant that cooks the food and brings it to you打电话让餐馆等送外卖食物；电话订餐； 叫外卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We could order out for a Chinese.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以打电话要份外卖中餐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
own	<h3>own<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,own 'up(to sth/to doing sth)</b><br>to admit that you are the person responsible for sth that has happened承担﹙事故等的﹚责任；承认﹙错误﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nobody owned up to breaking the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人承认把窗户打破了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>confess (to sth/to doing sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
pace	<h3>pace<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pace 'out sth; ,pace it/them 'out <i>(also </i>,pace 'off sth, ,pace it/them 'off <i>less frequent</i>)</b><br>to measure sth by taking regular steps across it以步丈量；步测:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She paced out the length of the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她步测了屋子的长度。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>out</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>out</b> .名词必须放在<b>out</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>out</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>\n
pack	<h3>pack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack a'way </b><br>if sth <b>packs away</b>, it can be folded up small when you are no longer using it能摺叠﹙收拢﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jacket packs away neatly into its own pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件夹克可以摺好，收拢在本身的口袋里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack sth a'way </b><br>to put sth into a box,cupboard, etc. when you are no longer using it﹙用后﹚收拾好；把东西装进盒子里﹙或柜子里等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We packed away the picnic things and put them in the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把野餐用品装好放到车里。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to eat a lot of sth吃掉很多；胃口大:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She can certainly <b>pack it away</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她肯定能一扫而光！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack sb 'in </b><br>to attract large numbers of people to a show, a play, etc.吸引大批观众；使爆满:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film is still packing in the crowds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影依然吸引着大批观众。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the crowds</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack sb/sth 'in; ,pack sb/sth 'in/ 'into sth </b><br>to do a lot of things, see a lot of people, etc. in a limited period of time把要做的事情﹙或要见的人等﹚挤在﹙有限的时间里﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She managed to pack a lot of sightseeing into three days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她设法用三天时间游览了许多地方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We packed in a lot yesterday afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们昨天下午做了很多事情。</font><br>to put a lot of things or people into a limited space把大量的东西﹙或人﹚挤在﹙有限的空间里﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somehow we managed to pack everyone in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们设法让所有的人都挤了进去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cram sb/sth in,cram sb/sth in/into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack sth 'in <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to give sth up,especially a job放弃﹙尤指工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s packed in her job as a teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她辞去了桝师工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smoking’s bad for you. You ought to pack it in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吸烟有害健康。你应该戒掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was so depressed I felt like <b>packing it all in</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我心灰意懒，想彻底放弃。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>job</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chuck sth in/up <i>(BrE</i>),jack sth in <i>(BrE</i>),give sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PACK UP,PACK STH UP 2<br><b>,pack it 'in</b> used to tell sb to stop behaving badly or doing sth that is annoying you收敛点；别说了；别做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just pack it in, will you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能不能闭上嘴？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack 'into sth </b><br>if people <b>pack into</b> a place, they go there in large numbers and fill it completely﹙人﹚挤进……里；使爆满:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All six of us packed into the tiny car.</font></i><br><font IN,PACK SB/STH IN/INTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack sb 'off (to …) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to send sb away,especially because you do not want them with you把……打发走；把……赶﹙到﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was packed off to boarding school at the age of eight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她八岁时就被送到寄宿学校。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He packed the children off to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打发孩子们去睡觉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv etc. <b>packs up</b>, it stops working﹙机器、发动机等﹚出故障，坏了:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My car’s packed up again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的车又坏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break down;give out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pack 'up; ,pack sth 'up </b><br>to put your possessions,equipment, etc. into bags or boxes before you leave a place打行李；收拾行装:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to pack up and go home now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp but he packed up last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他抽过烟，但去年戒掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’d feel better if you packed up smoking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把烟戒掉你就会感觉好些的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When did you pack up your job at the bookshop? </font></i><br><font pair	<h3>pair<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pair 'off; ,pair sb 'off (with sb)</b><br>to form a pair or pairs, especially in order to have a romantic relationship; to bring two people together in this way﹙使﹚结对，配对，成为恋人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By the end of the course, everyone had paired off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 课程结束时大家都成双结对了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (especially BrE) They tried to pair their daughter off with the neighbour’s son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们尝试把女儿与邻居的儿子配成一对。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pair 'up; ,pair sb 'up (with sb/sth)</b><br>to form a pair or pairs (with sb/sth) in order to work, play a game, etc. together; to bring two people together for this purpose配对；使配成对儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job is a lot easier if you pair up with someone else.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果找人搭档，这活儿就轻松多了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Writers have been paired up with artists to write articles on paintings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作家和艺术家联手作画赋文。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

palm	<h3>palm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,palm sb 'off (with sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to persuade sb to believe an explanation for sth that is not true, in order to stop them asking questions or complaining﹙藉口某事﹚搪塞某人，骗过某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let him palm you off with an excuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别听他找藉口搪塞你。</font><br>to persuade sb to accept sth that has little value or is not what they really want以次充好；以假充真:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Make sure he doesn’t palm you off with faulty goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当心别让他以残次品假充正品卖给你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fob sb off (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,palm sth 'off as sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to persuade sb that sth is better than it really is, or is sth different,especially in order to sell it以﹙次品﹚假充﹙正品﹚；以假乱真:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was trying to palm copies off as original paintings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她企图以复制品假冒原画作出售。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,palm sb/sth 'off on/onto sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to get rid of sb/sth that you do not want by persuading sb else to accept them/it劝说……接受﹙自己不想要的人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to palm his uncle off on me for the whole afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他整整花了一下午时间把他叔叔推给我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think she palmed off the stolen necklace on some unsuspecting old lady.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想她已经把偷来的项链脱了手给一位没有防备的老妇人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep<br>\n

pass	<h3>pass<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth a'round; ,pass sth a'round sth (<i>BrE also </i>,pass sth 'round, ,pass sth 'round sth)</b><br>to offer sth to each person in a around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pass as sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PASS FOR/AS SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass a'way</b><br><i>(also </i><b>,pass 'on</b>) people say <b>pass away</b> to avoid saying ‘die’﹙婉辞，与die同义﹚亡故:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She passed away peacefully in her sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是在睡梦中安详地过世的。</font><br>to disappear消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many of these customs have passed away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些风俗有很多已失传了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass be'tween sb </b><br>if sth such as a look, a word,etc. <b>passes between</b> two people, they look quickly at each other, speak to each other, etc.在﹙ 两人的眉眼、言语等﹚ 之间:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A look of understanding passed between Ann and Carla.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安和卡拉心照不宣地交换了一下目光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never knew what passed between them (= }what they said to each by</b>, it goes past﹙时间﹚过去，逝去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weeks passed by and she didn’t call.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个星期过去了，她没有打电话来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go by</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weeks passed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个星期过去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'by; ,pass 'by sb/sth </b><br>to go past sb/sth without stopping通过；经过﹙……旁边等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He saw the procession pass by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看见队伍走过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat passed close by the island.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那艘船紧挨着岛驶过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go by,go by sb/sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We watched the procession pass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们看着队伍走过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bypass <i>n </i></b><br>a road that goes around a town, etc.and which is intended to keep traffic out of the town centre旁道，外环道﹙绕过市中心等﹚<br>a medical operation on the heart in which blood is directed along a different route so that it does not flow through a part that is damaged or blocked;the new route that the blood takes﹙给心脏接旁通管的﹚分流术，搭桥术；旁通管:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a bypass operation </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 分流手术</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,passer-'by <i>n </i></b><br>a person who is walking past sb/sth, especially when sth unexpected happens﹙ 尤指出现意外事情时的﹚ 过路人； 路人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several passers-by stopped to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几位过路人停下来帮忙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sb/sth 'by </b><br>to happen without affecting sb/sth未影响﹙某人/某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She feels that life is passing her by (}= that she is not enjoying the opportunities and pleasures of life&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得所有人生的机遇欢乐都与她无缘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole business passed him by (= }he was hardly aware that it was happening&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有察觉到发生了什么事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'down(to sb)</b><br>to give sth or teach sth to your children or people who are younger than you, who will then give or teach it to their children,etc.使世代相传；流传:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These stories were passed down from one generation to the next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些故事世代相传。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the furniture has been passed down through the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些傢具是一代代传下来的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth down (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pass for sth <i>(disapproving</i>)</b><br>used to say that although sth is said to be a particular thing, you do not think it is good enough to be called that名义上说是……的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got used to drinking what passes for tea in that part of the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我习惯了喝那个地方的所谓的茶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pass for/as sb </b><br>to be so much like another person,or another type of person, that people could easily think you were that person or type﹙因相似﹚被当作某人，被看成为某类人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He speaks French well enough to pass for a Frenchman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说法语很流利，很容易被当作法国人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s in her forties but she could pass for ten years younger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她四十多岁了，但看上去要年轻十岁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They could pass as twins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们长得像双胞胎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pass into sth </b><br>to become a part of sth成为其中一部份；溶入；纳入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many foreign words have passed into English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多外来词语已被英语吸收过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'off <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>1[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] if an event <b>passes off</b> in a particular way, it takes place and is finished in the way mentioned事情……地过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The election has passed off without incident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选举自始至终未发生意外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The celebrations passed off peacefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 庆祝活动和平地进行并结束了。</font><br>if pain, the effects of a drug, etc. <b>pass off</b>, they gradually disappear﹙疼痛、药效等﹚逐渐消失，消退:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The symptoms should pass off within 24 hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 症状应该在24小时内消失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'off </b><br>to act as if a difficult or awkward remark or situation is less important than you really think it is对﹙ 困难或尴尬的话语或状况﹚加以淡化，从容应付:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had really upset her, but she smiled and tried to pass it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他着实让她难过，但她笑了笑就算了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to pass the question off lightly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把那个问题轻轻带过就应付下去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sb/sth 'off as sb/sth; ,pass yourself 'off as sb/sth </b><br>to pretend that sb or sth is something that they are not装作；佯装；假装:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to pass the picture off as an original.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她企图把那张画冒充成原作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He succeeded in passing himself off as a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他成功地装扮成医生。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n+prep (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'on </b><br>(<b>to sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) to begin a new activity,discussion, etc.开始下一项﹙活动、讨论等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s pass on to the next item on the agenda.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们进入下一项议程吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you can’t answer one question, pass on to the next.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果某个问题回答不上来，就回答下一个。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>move on (to sth)</b><br>2=PASS AWAY 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'on (to sb) </b><br>to give sth to sb else, especially after receiving or using it yourself转交；﹙用后﹚递给，传给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pass this book on to you when I’ve finished with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看完这本书后就给你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pass on your news to the rest of the family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会把你的消息带给家里人的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sth on (to sb) </b><br>to give sth that you have, such as a disease, a quality, etc. to sb else把﹙疾病﹚传染给；将﹙品质等﹚传给:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp HIV can be passed on from parent to child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艾滋病病毒能传染后代。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parents pass these attitudes on to their children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母的这些态度传递给了孩子。</font><br>if a company,a shop/store, etc. <b>passes on</b> higher or lower costs to its customers, it makes them pay more or less for sth把﹙成本﹚转给﹙顾客﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The supermarket did not pass on its profit to customers by cutting prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 超市没有通过削价给顾客让利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sb 'on to sb </b><br>to arrange for sb else to help or deal with a particular person把某人交给他人；安排他人接手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m afraid I can’t answer your question, but I’ll pass you on to my colleague.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕我不能回答你的问题，不过我可以请我的同事回答你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'out </b><br>to lose consciousness昏迷；失去知觉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He almost passed out with the pain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他痛得快要昏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>black out;faint</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> COME ROUND/COME TO<br>(<i>also </i><b>,pass 'out of sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) to leave a military college after completing a course of training从军校毕业<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'out (to sb)</b><br>to give something to each person in a group分发；分配:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher asked me to pass the books out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师让我把书发给大家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth out;hand sth out (to sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'over sb (for sth), ,pass him,them,etc.'over (for sth)</b><br>to not consider sb for a better job,especially when they deserve it or think they deserve it﹙考虑提职等时﹚跳过某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was passed over for promotion again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晋升又没有考虑我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was passed over in favour of a younger man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他未被擢升，却提拔了一个比他年轻的人。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>over</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>over</b> .名词必须放在<b>over</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>over</b> 之间。<br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is often used in the passive.这个短语动词常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'over sb/sth </b><br>to move over the top of sb/sth在……上方经过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The planes pass directly over the hospital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机都从医院的正上方飞过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The eye of the storm was passing over us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时风暴眼正从我们上方通过。</font><br>to ignore or avoid sth避免提及﹙或考虑﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They chose to pass over her rude remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定不理会她的粗鲁言辞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For years this painting was passed over by experts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这幅画有很多年都被专家冷落在一边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ignore sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'overpass <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) a bridge that carries one road or railway above another; a bridge over a road for people who want to cross立交桥；天桥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t try to cross the highway — use the overpass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别横穿公路—从天桥上走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sb/sth 'over (to sb)</b><br>to give sth to sb, especially when they ask for it or you do not want it any more; to give sb, or the responsibility for sb,to sb else将……交给﹙某人﹚；让……照看:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jeff passed the phone over so that I could speak to Clare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰夫把电话递给我，让我和克莱尔讲话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor passed the baby over to the nurse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生把婴儿交给护士照料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Control of the budgets has been passed over to individual schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对预算的管理已交给了各个学校。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand sb/sth over (to sb) </b><br>to let sb listen or speak to sb else when you have finished talking﹙讲话之后﹚让……听﹙别人﹚讲话，让……找﹙ 别人﹚ 谈话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If there are no more questions, I’ll pass you over to Ted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果没有其他问题问我，现在请听特德讲话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hand over to sb,hand sb over to sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'round; ,pass sth 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=PASS STH AROUND,PASS STH AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'through; ,pass 'through sth </b><br>to go or travel through a place, only stopping for a short time经过；路过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re not staying here, we’re just passing through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只是路经此地，不会久留的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We passed through Pompeii on our way to Naples.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们去那不勒斯时途经庞贝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass 'through sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to experience a particular kind of situation or period of time, especially a difficult or unpleasant one,and develop during it经历；经受；遭受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She passed through a difficult period after her divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她离婚之后一度倍受煎熬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The industry is passing through a period of change.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该行业正经历着一场变革。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>period,stage</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go through sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pass to sb/sth </b><br>to begin to be owned by sb new易手；易主:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she died, the house passed to her niece.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她去世后，房子归她的姪女所有。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pass sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to decide not to take advantage of an opportunity, an offer, etc.放弃，不要﹙机会、帮助等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She passed up the chance of a trip to Rome.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她放弃了去罗马旅游的机会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Imagine passing up an offer like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 真想不到居然放弃人家提供的大好机会！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>opportunity,chance,offer</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
patch	<h3>patch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,patch sb/sth 'through </b><br>to connect telephone or electronic equipment temporarily﹙ 临时把电话、电子设备﹚接通，连通:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio was patched through to army headquarters </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 无线电和部队司令部接通了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,patch sth to'gether </b><br>to arrange sth quickly,especially by putting several different parts together, without taking any care over it拼凑；草草拼合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An interim government was quickly patched together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 匆匆组建了临时政府。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,patch sb/sth 'up </b><br>to give quick or temporary medical treatment to someone who is injured匆忙处理，临时包扎﹙伤员或伤口﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They patched him up and sent him back onto the field (=}for example in a game of football&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们给他上了点药就让他回到了赛场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor did the best he could to patch up their wounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生尽最大努力很快给他们包扎了伤口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,patch sth 'up </b><br>to repair sth, especially quickly or temporarily修理；﹙尤指﹚临时修补:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car was patched up and resold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车草草修理一下又卖掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We patched up the hole in the roof and got it repaired the next day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们堵了堵顶部的洞，第二天找人把它修好了。</font><br>to end a quarrel or dispute with sb and be friends again调停；讲和:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They patched up their differences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们弥合了分歧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can’t you two try to <b>patch things up</b>? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们俩就不能试试和好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>differences,quarrel,things</b><br>to agree on sth, especially after long discussions and even though the agreement is not completely satisfactory勉强同意；求同存异:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They managed to patch up a peace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们好歹达成了和约。</font><br>\n
paw	<h3>paw<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'paw at sb/sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if an animal <b>paws at</b> sb/sth, it touches sb/sth repeatedly with its foot﹙动物﹚用爪子抓，用蹄刨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a horse pawing at the ground </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不停地刨着地的马</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) One of the children was pawing at my sleeve.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有个孩子一个劲地拽我的袖子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
pay	<h3>pay<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pay sb 'back (for sth/for doing sth)</b><br>to punish sb because they have made you or sb else suffer报复；回击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pay him back for getting me into trouble! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我惹了麻烦，我非治治他不可！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get back at sb (for sth/for doing sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'payback <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] a reward or a punishment that sb receives for sth they have done回报；回击<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PAYBACK at PAY SB BACK,PAY STH BACK (TO SB)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pay sb 'back; ,pay sth 'back (to sb)</b><br>to return money that you have borrowed from sb还钱﹙给某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pay you back next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我下周把钱还给你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s trying to pay the loan back over 5 years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在争取5年内分期归还贷款。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll never be able to pay back the money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绝对没有能力还那笔钱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>repay sb (sth), repay sth (to sb) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>In informal language <b>pay sb back sth</b> and,less often, <b>pay sb sth back</b> are also used.非正式语言中也可以说<b>pay sb back sth</b> ，有时说<b>pay sb sth back</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When are you going to pay me back that $100 you owe me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你打算啥时候还欠我的100 元?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you pay me that money back soon? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你早点把钱还给我好吗?</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'payback <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the money that you receive back on money that you have invested; the time that it takes to get your money back本金返还；还本；投资回收期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m waiting to get the maximum payback on my investment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我等着得到我的投资的最大回报。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a ten-year payback </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十年的投资回收期</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PAYBACK at PAY SB BACK (FOR STH/FOR DOING STH)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pay for sth </b><br>to suffer or be punished for sth wrong that you have done or said, or for sth you believe为﹙做错的事或说错的话、相信的事﹚吃苦头；为……受惩罚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone’s going to pay for this! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定得有人为这事付出代价！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are <b>paying dearly for</b> their mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们因为自身的失误正大吃苦头呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>mistake,crime</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pay sth 'in; ,pay sth 'into sth </b><br>to put money into a bank account存钱；存入账户:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to go to the bank to pay a cheque in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得去银行存入一张支票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her wages are paid directly into her account.</font></i><br><font v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pay 'off </b><br>if sth that involves risk <b>pays off</b>, it is successful and brings the results that you want﹙冒险的事﹚成功，奏效，达到目的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gamble paid off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赌博赢了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their hard work is beginning to pay off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的辛勤劳动显出成果了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the training you’ve been doing seems to have <b>paid off handsomely</b> (= }has had very good results&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你接受的那些训练似乎效果很好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pay-off <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) a reward or a benefit that you receive as a result of sth you do报偿；赢利:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are the pay-offs of working at home? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在家工作有什么好处？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PAY-OFF at PAY SB OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pay sb 'off </b><br>to give sb money to persuade them not to do sth or not to tell sb about sth illegal or dishonest you have done用钱封某人的口；买通某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She refused to be paid off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拒绝被收买。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>buy sb off </b><br>to pay sb the money they have earned and dismiss them from their job付清工资后解雇；遣散:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The store has paid off many of the full-time staff and offered them part-time work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店付酬解雇了很多全职职员，而后让他们做半职工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pay-off <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>a payment you make to sb to persuade them not to do sth or not to tell sb about sth illegal or dishonest you have done﹙用以买通别人的﹚黑钱；行贿钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police have been accused of receiving pay-offs from local gangs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方被控接受当地匪徒的贿赂。</font><br>a payment made to sb to persuade them to leave their job辞退金； 遣散费:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has phase	<h3>phase<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phase sth 'in </b><br>to introduce sth gradually or in stages逐步引入；分阶段开始:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government will phase in the new tax.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府将逐步推出新税种。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>phase sth out</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scheme will be phased in over 15 years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一方案将用15年时间逐步推行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phase sth 'out </b><br>to stop using sth gradually or in stages逐步废除；分阶段废除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They agreed to phase out chemical weapons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们同意逐步废除化学武器。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>phase sth in</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old system is being phased out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旧体制正在一步步地废除。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
phone	<h3>phone<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]<b>To phone </b>is the most common way to say ‘to telephone’ in British English. <b>To ring</b> and <b>to call</b> are also used. The most common verb in American English for this is <b>to call</b> .英国英语最常用<b>to phone</b> 表示打电话，也用<b>to ring</b> 和<b>to call</b> 。美国英语表达此义的最常用动词是<b>to call</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone a'round/ 'round; ,phone a'round/'round sb/sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make phone calls to several different people or places, usually to try to find out some information给各人﹙或到处﹚打电话﹙询问等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent the morning phoning round hotels, trying to book a room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一上午都在给各家旅馆打电话想订个房间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He phoned around to tell everyone about the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打电话通知大家开会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone 'back; ,phone sb 'back <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to telephone sb again or to telephone sb who telephoned you earlier﹙ 给某人﹚ 再打电话， 回电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I left a message but they never phoned back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我留言了，可他们从没回过电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom called while you were out. He asked if you could phone him back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你外出时汤姆来电话了，他请你给他回电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The travel agent phoned back to confirm your booking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅行社来电话确认你预订的项目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s engaged — I’ll phone back later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电话占线—我过会儿再打。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone 'in <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to telephone your place of work往工作单位打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll phone in to say I won’t be in until lunchtime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会给单位打电话说我到午饭时才到。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>phoned in sick</b> (=}to say he was ill/sick and could not go to work&b{)this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他今天上午打电话来请病假。</font><br>to phone a television or radio programme给电视﹙或电台﹚节目打电话；打﹙观众或听众﹚热线电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hundreds of listeners phoned in to complain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几百名听众打热线电话表示不满。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'phone-in <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>especially BrE</i>) a radio or TV programme in which people can phone and ask questions, give their opinions, etc. as the programme is being broadcast﹙电台或电视台的﹚热线电话节目:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hosts a radio phone-in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在电台主持热线电话节目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a phone-in programme</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 热线电话节目</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone sth 'in <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make a telephone call to the place where you work in order to give sb some information往单位打电话报告:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our reporter phoned the story in this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的记者今天下午来电通告了这件事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>ring sth in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone 'round; ,phone 'round sb/sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)=PHONE AROUND/ROUND,PHONE AROUND/ROUND SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone sth 'through <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to phone sb with details of or information about sth打电话详细通告:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Phone your order through to the store.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给商店打电话详细说明你订购的货物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,phone 'up; ,phone sb/sth 'up <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make a telephone call to sb/sth﹙给…﹚打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll phone up and cancel my appointment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将打电话取消约会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Phone Mike up and ask him if he wants to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给迈克打电话，问问他想不想来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I phoned up the bank this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今天上午给银行打电话。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Phone </b>and <b>phone sb</b> are also frequently used with this meaning. <b>Phone up</b> and <b>phone sb up</b> are very common in spoken English.此义也常作<b>phone</b> 和<b>phone sb</b> 。英语口语经常说<b>phone up</b> 和<b>phone sb up</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
pick	<h3>pick<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pick at sth </b><br>to eat very small amounts of food because you are not hungry﹙因不饿而﹚小口地吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She picked at her food for a while, then left the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吃了几小口东西就离开了餐桌。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>food,meal</b><br>to pull sth with your fingers several times﹙用手指反复地﹚揪，扯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She picked nervously at her skirt until she made a hole.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不安地抓弄着裙子，结果撕了个洞。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sb/sth 'off</b><br>to shoot a person, an animal, a bird, an aircraft, etc. especially one of a group,after aiming carefully瞄准﹙目标﹚射击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of our men was picked off by a sniper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狙击手射中了我们的一个人。</font><br>to choose the best people or things for your own use挑选﹙ 优秀人才或事物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company continues to pick off the brightest young graduates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司继续物色最优秀的年轻大学毕业生。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sth 'off; ,pick sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sth from sth with your fingernails or a tool﹙用指甲或工具﹚去除，剪除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She watered the plants and picked off the dead leaves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她浇了花草并摘掉了枯叶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pick on sb </b><br>to treat sb badly or unfairly, especially repeatedly﹙一再对某人﹚刁难挑剔，找彆扭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re always picking on me! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你总是在跟我过不去！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager was accused of picking on a member of the department.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人指责经理总刁难这个部门中的一名职员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s difficult being the younger sister — you always get picked on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当妹妹真难—动不动就受欺负。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>)to choose sb for a task, especially an unpleasant one指定某人做﹙尤指苦差﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher always picked on Tom to answer the difficult questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师总是点汤姆回答难题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was picked on by the other children at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在学校被别的孩子欺负了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sb/sth 'out </b><br>to choose sb/sth from a number of people or things选择；挑选；选中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picks out people from the audience to come up on stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他叫一些听众到台上来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brightest students were picked out for special training.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最优秀的学生被选出来接受专门的培训。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked out the most expensive suit in the shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他选中了商店里最贵的一套西服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>select sb/sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to recognize sb/sth from among people or things认出；辨别出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you pick me out in this old school photo? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能在这张旧学校照片中认出我来吗﹖</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The suspect was picked out at an identity parade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 嫌疑犯在列队认人时被认出了。</font><br>to manage to see sb/sth看得见；能认出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We could just pick out a car in the distance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只能隐隐约约看见远处有一辆车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>make sb/sth out <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>if a light, etc. <b>picks sb/sth out</b> it shines on sb/sth so that they/it are easier to see﹙灯光等﹚照在，照见；使容易看见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car’s headlights picked out a road sign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车前灯照射在一块路标上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sth 'out </b><br>to discover or recognize sth after careful study﹙经仔细研究﹚找出，认识到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult to pick out the important points from the mass of facts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很难从这一大堆资料中理出要点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were asked to pick out exactly what it was that made his style so distinctive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们被问到到底是什么使他的风格如此鲜明。</font><br>if you <b>pick out</b> a tune on a musical instrument,you play a tune that you have heard or made up slowly, note by note, without using written music﹙不用乐谱﹚慢慢弹奏出﹙乐曲﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Buddie was picking out a simple tune on his guitar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巴迪在吉他上慢慢弹出了一支简单的曲子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>melody,tune </b><br>usually <b>be ,picked 'out</b> <i>(BrE</i>)to paint, draw or write sth in such a way that it is very easy to see, especially by using a colour that is different from the background﹙用对比色﹚醒目地画﹙或写﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The details of the flowers were picked out in blue and gold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 花的纹理用蓝色和金黄色勾画得很鲜艳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sth 'over </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,pick 'through sth </b><i>less frequent</i>)to look carefully at a group of things,choosing what you want and rejecting anything you do not want用心挑选；筛选:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked over the apples, checking for bad ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他仔细挑选苹果，把坏的捡出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bargain hunters picked over a pile of sale items.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 专捡便宜货的人在一堆廉价货中挑来捡去。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to examine or analyse sth carefully仔细审查；认真分析:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spent the meeting picking over last month’s results.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们开会详细研究了上个月的成绩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick 'up </b><br>to become better; to improve改善；好转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The market always picks up in the spring.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 市面总是在春季好转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game started very slowly but picked up in the second half.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛开始时进行缓慢，但在下半场越来越激烈。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re waiting until the weather picks up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们等天气有所好转再说。</font><br>if the wind <b>picks up</b>, it starts to blow more strongly﹙风﹚变大，增强:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind seems to be picking up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风似乎越颳越大。</font><br>to start again; to continue重新开始；继续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new series <b>picks up where</b> the old one <b>left off</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 播放的新系列节目接续上一系列。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK STH UP 10 <br>if your speed <b>picks up</b>, you start to go faster加速；提高﹙速度﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the first mile (= }in a race&b{) I started to feel stronger and my speed picked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跑了第一英里后我觉得有劲头了， 于是加快速度。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK UP SPEED/MOMENTUM at PICK STH UP<br>if a bus, etc.<b>picks up</b> somewhere, it stops there to allow passengers to get on﹙公共汽车等﹚让人乘车，搭载:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus picks up outside the Post Office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车在邮局外停下让乘客上车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK SB UP 3<br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)to collect things that have been dropped or left on the ground and put them away收拾； 整理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shouldn’t have to pick up after you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凭啥我要跟在你后面收拾东西！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK STH UP 12<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pickup <i>n </i></b><br>an improvement改进；好转；改善:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are no signs of a pickup in consumer spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有迹象显示消费开支会增长。</font><br>(<i>AmE</i>) the ability of a vehicle to increase its speed﹙车辆的﹚加速性能<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICKUP at PICK SB UP;PICKUP at PICK STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pick sb 'up </b><br>to take hold of and lift sb举起，抱起﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I always pick the baby up when she cries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子一哭我就把她抱起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK STH UP 1<br>to go to sb’s home or a place you have arranged and take them somewhere in your car开车接人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pick you up at seven o’clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我七点钟来接你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked up a hitch-hiker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带上了一名沿路搭车的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went to pick her up from the airport.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我开车去机场接她了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Pick sb up</b> is used much more often than <b>collect sb</b> in spoken English.在英语口语中，<b>pick sb up</b> 比<b>collect sb</b> 常用得多。<br><b>,pick 'up sb, ,pick him,her,them,etc. 'up </b>if a bus, etc. <b>picks up</b> sb,it stops and allows them to get on﹙公共汽车等﹚让人乘车，搭载:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus stopped to pick up some passengers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车停下让乘客上车。</font><br>[NOTE] A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK UP 5<br>to rescue sb, for example from the sea﹙ 从海里等﹚ 营救， 搭救:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lifeboats picked up all the survivors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 救生艇救起了所有的幸存者。</font><br>to arrest sb; to take sb somewhere in order to question them逮捕；拘押﹙问话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was picked up by the police as she was leaving her hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正要离开旅馆时被警察逮住了。</font><br><i>(informal</i>)to start talking to sb you do not know, because you want to have a sexual relationship with them﹙猥亵地与生人﹚搭讪，勾搭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked her up at a club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是在俱乐部勾搭上她的。</font><br>if sth <b>picks you up</b>, it makes you feel better使感觉舒服；提神:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cup of tea will soon pick you up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喝杯茶你就会清醒的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PICK YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pick-me-up <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) something that makes you feel better or happier, etc.提神之物；振奋精神的事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country air was the perfect pick-me-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乡下的空气让人神清气爽。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pickup <i>n </i></b><br>an occasion when sb gets in a car, on a bus, etc. to be taken to another place搭车；搭载:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coach driver made several pickups before heading for the airport.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 长途汽车开往飞机场之前，司机停了几次搭载乘客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a pickup point </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 搭车地点</font><br><i>(informal</i>) a situation in which sb is trying to start a sexual relationship with a person they do not know; the person they are trying to start a sexual relationship with﹙与陌生人的﹚调情；偶然结识的调情者:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing ever came of his 我错拿了你的包。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pick your coat up off the floor! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的外衣从地板上捡起来！</font><br><i><font 1<br>to obtain or collect sth拿到；取回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can pick up the tickets an hour before the show starts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以在演出开始前一小时取票。</font><br>to learn a language, a skill, etc., or to get information,without making an effort轻松学会﹙语言、技能等﹚；得到，弄到﹙消息﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She picks up languages really easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她学习语言确实很轻松。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I showed her how to use the software and she picked it up pin	<h3>pin<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pin sb 'down </b><br>to make sb unable to move, especially by holding them firmly﹙按住﹚使动弹不得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The }they could not move from their position&b{) just south of the border.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反叛者就钳制在边境以南。</font><br>(<b>to sth/to doing sth</b>) to make sb say clearly again继续比赛；恢复比赛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They claimed a penalty but the referee told them to play on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们要求判罚，但裁判却要他们继续比赛。</font><br>to continue to play music继续奏乐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Despite the uproar, the musicians played on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐师们不顾喧闹继续奏乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'play on sth <i>(also </i> &b{'play upon sth</b><i>more formal</i>)}<br>to deliberately use sb’s fears, etc. for your own advantage利用﹙别人的恐惧等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He played on my feelings of guilt to make me stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他利用我的内疚感让我留下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government played on people’s fears of rising crime to get support for their policies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府利用人们对犯罪增长的恐惧来获取他们对政策的支持。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fears</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exploit sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if a band, etc. <b>plays out</b>, it performs in front of an audience﹙乐队等﹚演出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Serious bands should be playing out regularly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 重要的乐队应该定期演出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Playing out is the best way for a DJ to build a following.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 举办演出是流行音乐节目主持人赢得拥戴者的最佳途径。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'out; ,play itself/themselves 'out ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to develop and come to an end or be no longer useful or important衰竭式微:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crisis has yet to play out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 危机尚待消除。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The revolution soon played itself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 革命很快便垮掉了。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is usually used in written English.这个短语动词通常用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,played 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>completely finished; too tired or weak to continue完结；筋疲力尽；衰竭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was played out — too exhausted even to cry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她疲惫不堪—累得连哭的力气也没有了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play sth 'out </b><br>when an event <b>is played out</b>, or sb <b>plays it out</b>, it happens﹙使﹚发生，出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The negotiations are being played out behind closed doors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谈判正在秘密进行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She continued to play out her role of dutiful daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她继续克尽她作为女儿的职责。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to continue to play sth until it finishes继续将﹙比赛等﹚完成:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll play out this game and then go to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们完成这一局就去睡觉。</font><br>to let a length of rope pass through your hands bit by bit﹙从手中﹚缓缓放出﹙绳索﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'up; ,play sb 'up <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if a part of your body, a machine, etc. <b>plays up</b> or <b>plays you up</b>, it causes you problem﹙身体部位、机器等﹚出毛病，出问题，给……添麻烦:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My leg’s playing up again (= }it is painful&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的腿又疼起来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My back plays me up from time to time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的嵴背不时酸疼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car started playing up (= }not working in a reliable way&b{) about six months ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆车大约六个月前开始不听使唤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The computer’s been playing me up recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的计算机最近出乱子了。</font><br>if children play up or play sb up, they behave very badly﹙孩子﹚惹麻烦，调皮捣蛋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids have been playing up all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们胡闹了一整天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All kids play new teachers up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有孩子都戏弄新老师的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'up sth; ,play it/them 'up </b><br>to try to make sth appear more important than it really is夸大……的重要性；渲染；吹嘘；炒热:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She played up her achievements in an attempt to impress us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吹嘘自己的成就，好让我们觉得她了不起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>play sth down</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'up to sb <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to behave towards sb in a way that you think they will like and will bring you an advantage讨好；谄媚；奉承:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always played up to her father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是讨好她的父亲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,play 'up to sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to behave in the way that people expect you to迎合，顺应﹙别人的期望﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She doesn’t look 12. People think she’s only 8 or 9, and she plays up to this all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她看上去不到十二岁。别人以为她只有八九岁，于是她乾脆以小卖小。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'play upon sth =PLAY ON STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'play with sb/sth <i>(disapproving</i>)</b><br>to behave towards sb in a way that is not serious, especially by pretending to feel sth you do not feel轻率对待；玩弄；对……虚情假意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was just playing with my emotions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只不过是在玩弄我的感情。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'play with sth </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) if you <b>play with</b> an idea,you think about it, but do not really intend to do anything about it随意想想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s playing with the idea of starting her own business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只是随意地想着开创自己的事业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>toy with sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'play with yourself <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to touch your sexual organs in order to give yourself pleasure手淫<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
plod	<h3>plod<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plod a'long/ 'on</b><br>to continue doing sth, especially difficult or boring work, at a very slow rate缓慢进行﹙尤指艰难枯燥的工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep plodding on — you’ll soon be finished! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坚持干吧—就快做完啦！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re still plodding along with their investigation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们仍然在不厌其烦地进行调查。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plod a'way (at sth)</b><br>to work steadily but slowly at a difficult or boring task坚持不懈地做﹙困难或枯燥的事﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plodded away all night at his project to get it finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他通宵埋头苦干以便做完专题研究。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
plonk (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually </i><b>plunk</b>)	<h3>plonk (<i>especially BrE</i>) (<i>AmE usually </i><b>plunk</b>)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plonk 'down; ,plonk yourself 'down <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to sit down heavily and quickly猛地坐下；重重地坐下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She plonked herself down in front of the telly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一屁股坐在了电视机前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>plump down,plump yourself down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plonk sb/sth 'down <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to drop sth or put sth down heavily without taking great care砰然扔下；重重地放下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She plonked the food down in front of them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把食物啪的一声扔在他们面前。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t just plonk the baby down on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别粗手粗脚地把孩子往地板上随便一扔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
plough(<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i>plow)	<h3>plough(<i>BrE</i>) (<i>AmE </i>plow)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough sth 'back (into sth), ,plough sth back 'in </b><br>to put profits back into the business that produced them把﹙利润﹚再投资:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the profits are ploughed back into the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的利润都再投资到了公司。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The director confirmed that every penny had been ploughed back in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 董事确认所有的钱都进行了再投资。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>profits,money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough 'into sb/sth</b><br>(of a vehicle or a driver车辆或司机) to crash violently into sb/sth猛撞；撞车:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car hit a lamp post before ploughing into a wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车碰了灯柱后就撞上一堵墙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough sth 'into sth; ,plough sth 'into doing sth </b><br>to invest a large amount of money on a project, a business etc.把﹙巨额资金﹚投入；大量投资于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp $50 million will be ploughed into the area over the next five years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在今后的五年中将有5千万元投放到这个地区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sink sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough 'on (with sth)</b><br>to continue to say or do sth even though it becomes difficult坚持说，继续做﹙困难的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one was listening to him but he <b>ploughed on regardless</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有人在听他讲话，但他坚持讲下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The path was steep, but we ploughed on until we got to the top.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小路很陡峭，然而我们坚持不懈地爬到了最高处。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough 'through sth; ,plough your way 'through sth </b><br>to force a way through sth费劲地穿越﹙ 或通过﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car ploughed its way through the snow and ice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车在冰雪中艰难地行驶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The journey involved ploughing through 50 miles of swamp land.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅途中需要穿行50 英里的沼泽地。</font><br>(of a vehicle or an aircraft车辆或飞机) to crash violently through sth猛冲过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car ploughed through the hedge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车猛地冲破了树篱。</font><br>to slowly do, read or eat all of sth even though it is difficult or boring缓慢地做完﹙或读完、吃完﹚；艰难地进行；埋头苦干:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me hours to plough through all the mail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我花了几小时埋头读完了所有信件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to plough my way through a mountain of pasta because I didn’t want to appear rude.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想让人觉得我不礼貌，于是硬着头皮吃下了一大盘意大利麵食。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plough sth 'up </b><br>to break the surface of an area of land that has not been used for growing crops before, and turn it over using a special piece of farming equipment (a <b>plough</b> )﹙用犁﹚开垦，开荒；犁地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ploughed up the field ready for sowing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开了那片地准备播种。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp action to prevent farmers ploughing up footpaths </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阻止农民把小路开垦为农田的行动</font><br>to break up the surface of the ground by walking or driving across it again and again轧翻，碾坏﹙地面﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got so angry he ploughed up his neighbour’s lawn with his motorbike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他火冒三丈，开着摩托车把邻居的草坪碾得稀巴烂。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
plow(<i>AmE</i>)	<h3>plow(<i>AmE</i>)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow sth 'back (into sth), ,plow sth back 'in(<i>AmE</i>) =PLOUGH STH BACK (INTO STH),PLOUGH STH BACK IN</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow 'into sb/sth <i>(AmE</i>)=PLOUGH INTO SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow sth 'into sth; ,plow sth 'into doing sth <i>(AmE</i>)=PLOUGH STH INTO STH,PLOUGH STH INTO DOING STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow 'on (with sth) (<i>AmE</i>) =PLOUGH ON (WITH STH)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow 'through sth; ,plow your way 'through sth <i>(AmE</i>)=PLOUGH THROUGH STH,PLOUGH YOUR WAY THROUGH STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plow sth 'up <i>(AmE</i>)=PLOUGH STH UP</b><br>\n

plug	<h3>plug<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plug a'way (at sth) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to work hard and steadily at sth for a long time, especially sth difficult or boring坚持不懈地做﹙尤指困难或乏味的工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Scientists have been plugging away at the problem for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guitar plugs into this amplifier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把吉他能接到这个扬声器上。</font><br>to become involved with a particular activity or group of people参与；加入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company hopes to plug into new markets in Asia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司希望打入亚洲新市场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp equipment接通﹙电源﹚；把插头插进﹙插座﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget to plug the printer in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 记住给打印机接上电源。</font><br><i><font plug (= }a small plastic object with two or three metal pins&b{)带﹙电源﹚插头的；插入式的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a plug-in kettle</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp
