give extra features软插件；插入程序:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp plug-ins for a palmtop computer </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 掌上电脑的软插件</font><br><i><font STH INTO STH<br>to connect a computer to a computer system把﹙电脑﹚联网<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PLUG-IN at PLUG STH IN,PLUG STH INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp window to stop the wind coming in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们堵上了窗隙挡风。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hole</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>block sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
plumb	<h3>plumb<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plumb sth'in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to connect a washingmachine,a bath, etc. to a water system把﹙洗衣机、浴缸等﹚与水管连接:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s plumbed in the new washing machine for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他帮我给新洗衣机接上了水管。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
plump	<h3>plump<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plump 'down; ,plump yourself 'down</b><br>(<i>informal</i>) to sit down quickly and heavily猛地坐下；重重地坐下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She plumped herself down in the armchair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一屁股坐到扶手椅上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>plonk down,plonk yourself down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plump sth 'down <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to put sth down suddenly and carelessly扔下；甩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plumped his books down on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的一声把书丢在桌子上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'plump for sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to choose or vote for sb/sth after thinking about it carefully慎重挑选﹙或投票﹚；筛选:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’ll plump for the steak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我要牛排。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plump 'up </b><br>to become rounder or fatter变圆；变胖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soak the raisins until they plump up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把葡萄乾泡在水里发好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plump sth 'up </b><br>to make sth such as a cushion rounder and softer by shaking it把﹙埝子等﹚拍得蓬松柔软:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me plump up your pillows for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来帮你把枕头拍松。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cushion,pillow</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
plunge	<h3>plunge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunge 'in; ,plunge 'into sth </b><br>to jump or fall in to sth, usually with some force﹙用力地﹚跳进，投入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plunged into the pool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他猛地跳进了游泳池。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car plunged into a gorge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车坠入了峡谷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ran down to the sea and plunged in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们跑到海边，纵身跳入海水中。</font><br>to begin doing sth or talking about sth without preparing for it or thinking carefully贸然行动；唐突讲话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He plunged into the task of clearing the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他二话没说就开始清理办公室。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I plunged in and started telling him all about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我冒冒失失地把这事给他和盘托出。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunge sth 'in; ,plunge sth 'in/ 'into sth </b><br>to put sth quickly and with force into sth else猛力插入；扎进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She plunged the knife into his leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把刀子刺进他的腿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He opened the sack and plunged his arm in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打开袋子将胳膊一下子插进去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>knife,hand</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunge 'into sth =PLUNGE IN,PLUNGE INTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunge 'into sth; ,plunge sb/sth 'into sth </b><br>to be or to make sb/sth suddenly be in a bad situation or state﹙使﹚突然陷入﹙糟糕的境地或状况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country plunged into recession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国家经济急剧衰退。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city was plunged into chaos as a result of the strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工使城市骤然陷入一片混乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room was suddenly plunged into darkness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间一下子变得漆黑一团。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>recession,despair</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunge sth 'into sth =PLUNGE STH IN,PLUNGE STH IN/INTO STH</b><br>\n
plunk	<h3>plunk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunk 'down; ,plunk yourself 'down<i>(AmE</i>,<i>informal</i>) =PLONK DOWN,PLONK YOURSELF DOWN</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,plunk sb/sth 'down <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)=PLONK SB/STH DOWN:</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Movie goers <b>plunked down $1.7 billion for tickets</b> (= }spent that amount on tickets&b{) this summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今夏电影观众的消费共17 亿元。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
ply	<h3>ply<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ply sb with sth </b><br>to keep giving sb large amounts of sth, especially food and drink持续大量提供﹙食物和饮料﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They plied us with tea and cakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一个劲儿地让我们喝茶、吃糕饼。</font><br>to keep asking sb question不停地提问:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They plied me with questions about my visit to England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不断地询问我的英国之行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
point	<h3>point<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,point sb/sth 'out (to sb)</b><br>to show sb which person or thing you are referring to, for example by moving your head, by describing them/it, etc.指﹙给某人﹚看；指点:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you point his wife out to me if you see her? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果看见他的妻子就指给我看好吗﹖ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drove them around Beverley Hills pointing out where the stars lived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开车带他们在贝弗利希尔斯各处转，把明星的住所指给他们看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The guide pointed out various historic monuments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 导游介绍了各处历史遗迹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,point sth 'out (to sb)</b><br>to mention sth in order to give sb information about it or make them notice it﹙向某人﹚指出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thanked me for pointing out the mistakes in his report.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他感谢我指出了他报告中的错误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must point out that my part in the rescue was very small.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须说明，我在这次营救行动中的作用非常小。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>It must be pointed out that</b> this new drug is not a miracle cure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必须指出的是，这种新药不是什么灵丹妙药。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He doesn’t like having his faults pointed out to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他听不进别人的指正。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘He’s not my father, he’s my stepfather,’ he pointed out angrily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “他不是我父亲，他是我继父。”他愤怒地说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'point to sth </b><br>to mention sth that you think is important and/or the reason why a particular situation exists提出， 指出﹙ 重要的事或理由﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pointed to unemployment as a reason for rising crime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她强调失业导致了犯罪率上升。</font><br>if a fact, event or situation <b>points to</b> sth, it suggests that this is true or likely to happen暗示；预示；显示:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the signs pointed to a successful year ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的迹象都预示着来年将一帆风顺。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The facts seem to point to him having been murdered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事实似乎表明他是被谋杀的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had symptoms which pointed to a diagnosis of kidney failure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从症状看来，她很可能患肾衰竭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,point 'up sth; ,point it/ 'them up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to give special emphasis to one particular aspect of a problem, fact or opinion; to show sth very clearly强调；明确显示:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This incident points up the hostility between the two sides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此次事件显明了双方的敌意。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> . 名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>\n
poke	<h3>poke<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke a'bout/a'round; ,poke a'bout/a'round sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br><i>(also </i><b>,poke 'through sth</b><i>especially AmE</i>) to look for sth, especially sth that is hidden among other things that you have to move﹙在……中﹚搜寻，翻找:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were poking around in the bushes, looking for their ball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在灌木丛中找他们的球。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What were you doing poking about in my room? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在我房间里四处找什么来着？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spent his weekends poking around dusty old bookshops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他周末都泡在布满尘埃的旧书店里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Customs officials poked through the containers looking for weapons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海关官员在货柜里查找武器。</font><br>to try to find out information, especially secret or hidden information; to get involved in sth that does not concern you探听；打听；干涉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A reporter had been poking around, trying to discover something in my past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有位记者一直试图探听我过去的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke a'round; ,poke a'round sth <i>(AmE</i>,<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to move or do things slowly, without hurrying闲逛；从容做事；闲散地移动﹙或做﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was just poking around in town all morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一个上午都在城里闲逛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'poke at sth </b><br>to push your finger, a stick, etc. into sth, often several times﹙用手指、棍子等反复地﹚捅，戳，扎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She poked at her salad with her fork.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用叉子拨弄着色拉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>prod at sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke 'out; ,poke 'out of sth <i>(also </i>&b{,poke 'through, ,poke 'through sth</b>)}<br>if sth <b>pokes out</b> or<b>pokes out of</b> sth, you can see it because a small part is coming through a hole or is no longer covered﹙从……中﹚露出，戳出，探出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His toes were poking through the holes in his socks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脚趾从袜子的破洞露出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two feet poked out from under the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 床底下伸出了两只脚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were flowers poking out of holes in the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 花儿从墙隙探出头来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick out,stick out of sth;stick through,stick through sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke sth 'out; ,poke sth 'out of sth </b><br>to move sth suddenly forwards or out of sth突然前移；突然从……出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door opened and Max poked his head out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门开了，马克斯猛地探出头来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pony poked its nose out of the door as I went past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我经过时，小马一下子把鼻子伸出门来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>head,tongue</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick sth out,stick sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke 'through; ,poke 'through sth =POKE OUT,POKE OUT OF STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke 'through sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)=POKE ABOUT/AROUND,POKE ABOUT/AROUND STH 1</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poke 'up </b><br>to become visible because a small part is coming through a hole, etc.露出；突出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grass had begun to poke up through the snow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 草开始破雪而出了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
polish	<h3>polish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,polish sb 'off <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to kill someone干掉；杀死:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hired an assassin to polish him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她雇了杀手除掉他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,polish sth 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to finish sth quickly,especially food or drink很快做完；迅速吃光﹙或喝完﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They polished off the pudding in no time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们眨眼工夫就把布丁吃完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ ll polish off this last bit of work, then we can go out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我加把劲把剩下这点活儿干完， 我们就可以出去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,polish sth 'up </b><br>to make changes to sth in order to improve it修改； 润色； 润饰:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The college needs to polish up its image.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这所学院得改变一下形象了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>act,image </b><br>to improve your skills in sth that you have learned but have not used for a long time捡起﹙生疏了的技能等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went on a course to polish up her German.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她学习一门课程，重温一下德语。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>French,Italian,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>brush sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
ponce	<h3>ponce<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ponce a'bout/a'round <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to do silly things in a way that looks ridiculous, especially to attract attention; to waste time﹙尤指为引人注意﹚ 无事忙， 做无聊的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ponces around on the show, interviewing members of the audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他装模作样地采访着观众。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could have finished that job while you’ve been poncing around! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你胡闹的时候我就可以把那活干完。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
poop	<h3>poop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poop 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>(on sth) (<i>also </i><b>,poop 'out of sth</b>) to fail to do something that you have arranged to do; to stop doing sth because you are very tired or afraid没做﹙打算的事﹚；﹙因劳累或害怕﹚停止做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was supposed to go out last night but I pooped out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨晚没有按原定计划出去。</font><br>if a machine <b>poops out</b>, it stops working﹙机器﹚抛锚，停止运转<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv 1 }also&b{ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,poop sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb very tired使筋疲力尽；累垮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A long day at the office poops me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在办公室忙了一整天把我累垮了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pooped 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>[not before noun] (<i>informal</i>,<i>especially AmE</i>) very tired筋疲力尽；疲惫不堪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was pooped out after a long day at the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 办公室的漫长一天让我疲乏极了。</font><br>\n
pop	<h3>pop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pop 'in <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to visit sb/sth for a short time﹙短暂﹚走访，逗留:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She often pops in for coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她常来小坐，喝杯咖啡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pop in to see you at the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 周末我要去看看你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop in (on sb/at …)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pop sth 'in/ 'round <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to deliver sth to sb on your way to another place顺道递送:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pop the library books in on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家时会捎带把图书馆的书还了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you pop those photos round later? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回头请顺便把那些照片带来好吗?</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop sth by;drop sth in (to sb/sth);drop sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pop 'off <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to go or leave somewhere, especially for a short time﹙尤指暂时﹚ 前往， 离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to pop off early tonight (= }leave work early&b{), if it’s all right with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不介意，我今晚要早点下班。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They just pop off to France whenever they feel like it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一高兴就去法国。</font><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>) to die死；一命呜呼；翘辫子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I pop off, all my money goes to you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我死后，我的钱全都归你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pop sth 'on <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to put on a piece of clothing quickly﹙迅速﹚穿﹙衣﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He popped on his jacket and went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他披上短上衣就出去了。</font><br>to turn on a piece of electrical equipment开启﹙电器﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pop the kettle on and we’ll have some tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来烧壶水，咱们泡茶喝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pop 'out </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,pop 'out of sth</b>) to come out from a place suddenly突然出现；﹙从…﹚窜出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just popped out from behind a tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他冷不丁从树后窜了出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) I didn’t mean to tell them — it just popped out (= }I spoke&b{) before I realized.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不是有意告诉他们的─我说漏嘴了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) His eyes nearly popped out of his head (= }he was very surprised&b{) when he saw what she was wearing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他见到她的穿着时，吓得眼睛都要突出来了。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to leave somewhere for a very short time暂时离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John’s just popped out to get a newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰刚刚出去取份报纸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv 1 }also&b{ lonely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是觉得寂寞就来家里坐坐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop by;drop over <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp places.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他好像神出鬼没。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you click with the mouse, a menu pops up.</font></i><br><font ,pour 'forth sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to appear or to produce sth from somewhere in large numbers or amounts涌现； 大量产生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doors opened and a crowd of people poured forth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门开了， 一群人蜂拥而进。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He poured forth a stream of bitter accusations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他连珠炮般地进行了严厉谴责。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pour 'in; ,pour 'into sth </b><br>to arrive somewhere in large numbers or amounts涌入； 涌向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Complaints poured in after last night’s programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚的节目播出之后，不满意见纷至沓来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sunlight poured in through the windows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光从窗户照射进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fans were still pouring into the stadium.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球迷继续涌入体育场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>flood in,flood into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>pour sth 'into sth </b><br>to provide a large amount of money for sth向……投入大量金钱；大量投资于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The council has been pouring money into the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 议会一直在向这个地区投入大量金钱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pour sth 'off </b><br>to remove some of the liquid from a container, cooking pot, etc. by pouring倒出﹙容器中的液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the fish is cooked, pour off the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鱼煮熟之后就把水滗出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pour 'out; ,pour sth 'out </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,pour 'out of sth, ,pour sth 'out of sth</b>) to come out or to produce sth from somewhere in large amounts or numbers涌出；大量产生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Black smoke poured out of the engine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发动机排放出磙磙黑烟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People poured out through the gates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们涌出大门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Factory chimneys poured out smoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工厂的烟囱喷出了浓烟。</font><br>when feelings or words<b>pour out</b>, or sb <b>pours them out</b>, they are expressed, usually after they have been kept hidden for some time﹙感情或话语﹚奔涌，迸发；畅所欲言:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All her feelings of resentment just came <b>pouring out</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一股脑儿倾吐出所有的怨恨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole story then poured out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接着，事情的来龙去脉被和盘托出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He poured out his troubles to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对我倾诉了他的烦恼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b> 'outpouring <i>n </i></b><br>[usually pl.] a strong and sudden expression of feeling﹙感情的﹚迸发:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hated having to listen to his passionate outpourings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她讨厌他那赤裸裸的表白。</font><br>a large amount of sth produced in a short time涌现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a remarkable outpouring of scholarship </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学术成就的涌现</font><br>\n

press	<h3>press<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,press a'head/ 'on <i>(also </i>&b{,press 'forward </b><i>less frequent</i>)(<b>with sth</b> )}<br>to continue moving forward quickly; to continue to do a task in a determined way匆忙前进；坚持不懈地做；加紧进行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pressed on, even though it was now dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不顾夜幕降临，继续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to press ahead with their plans.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定坚持推行他们的计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>forge ahead (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'press for sth;'press sb for sth </b><br>to make repeated and urgent requests for sth催逼；不断向……要求……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The unions are pressing for a pay rise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会正强烈要求增加工资。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must press you for a reply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得催你给一个答覆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>push for sth,push sb for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,press 'forward =PRESS AHEAD/ON</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,press 'in (on/upon sb)</b><br>to move nearer to sb in a way that seems likely to cause harm逼近；进逼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He felt as if the walls were pressing in on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他彷彿觉得四周的墙壁向他压过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>close in (on sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,press 'on =PRESS AHEAD/ON</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'press sth on sb </b><br>to try to make sb accept sth,even though they may not want it勉强﹙或要求﹚某人接受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pressed cake and tea on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她非要我们吃蛋糕、喝茶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pulled ahead of the other runners on the last straight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在直道冲刺时一下子超过了其他选手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ criticizesb/sth严厉批评； 斥责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pulled my work apart and made me do it again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把我的工作批得一无是处，并且令我返工。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pull sth a'part </b><br>to destroy sth or separate sthinto pieces by pulling parts of it in different directions毁坏；拆散；拆卸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pulled the machine apart, but couldn’t find what was wrong with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我卸开机器，但没找到毛病。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fox was pulled apart by the dogs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几条狗把狐狸撕成了碎片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pull sb a'side </b><br>to take sb to a quiet corner orplace to talk to them privately把某人拉到一旁﹙说话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pulled him aside to warn him not to say anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她掀开帘子，露出了一道小门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>curtain</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'pull at sth </b><br>to pull sth lightly several timesespecially to to</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pull to'gether </b><br>if a group of people <b>pull together</b>, they act or work together in order to achieve pulling him under.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他觉得波浪要把他吞没了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pull 'up</b><br>(of a vehicle, or its driver车辆或司机) to stop, especially for a short time﹙尤指临时﹚停车，停止:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pulled up alongside me at the traffic lights.</font></i><br><font 我因没有按照正确程序而受到责备。</font><br>to make sb stop doing or saying sth very suddenly使突然停住；使愣住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shock of his words <b>pulled me up short</b> .</font></i><br><font pull your 'socks up (<i>BrE </i>) <br>to try to develop a more serious, responsible attitude to your work;to improve your behaviour努力改善工作态度﹙或行为等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll have pump	<h3>pump<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pump sth 'in; ,pump sth 'into sth </b><br>to give large amounts of money or resources to sth把﹙资金或资源﹚大量投入；大量注入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Millions have been pumped into this industry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已经对这个产业投资几百万。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>inject sth (into sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pump 'out; ,pump 'out of sth; ,pump sth 'out; ,pump sth 'out of sth </b><br>(of a liquid液体) to come out of somewhere or to be produced from somewhere with force and in large amounts涌出；涌流；排放:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blood was pumping out of the wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲜血正从伤口中喷涌出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cars are pumping out tons of pollutants every year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车每年排放成吨的污染物。</font><br>if music,sound, etc. <b>pumps out</b> or sb <b>pumps it out</b>, it is produced from somewhere very loudly and for a long time﹙使音乐、声音等﹚连续高声播放:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Heavy metal was pumping out of huge speakers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巨大的扬声器不断播放着震耳欲聋的重金属摇磙乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pump sth 'out; ,pump sth 'out of sth </b><br>to remove a gas, liquid, etc. from inside sth with a pump用泵排出；用泵从……抽出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire brigade pumped out the basement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队把地下室的水抽出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire brigade pumped the water out of the basement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队把地下室的水抽出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pump sb 'up; ,pump yourself 'up<i>(informal</i>,<i>especially AmE </i>) </b><br>to make sb feel more excited or determined about sth给﹙某人﹚打气；振奋斗志:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was really pumped up for the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那次赛跑我真是鼓足了劲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,pump sth 'up </b><br>to fill a tyre, etc. with air using a pump为﹙轮胎等﹚充气；打气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pump your tyres up before you set off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出发前给你的轮胎打打气。</font><br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE </i>) to increase the amount, value or volume of sth增加数量﹙或价值、体积等﹚；提高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They always pump their prices up before Christmas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们总是在圣诞节之前提价。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
punch	<h3>punch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,punch 'in/ 'out; ,punch sb 'in/ 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to record the time that you arrive at or leave work,by putting a card into a machine; to do this for sb else﹙替某人﹚用计时卡登录﹙上、下班﹚时间；﹙替某人﹚刷计时卡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He punched in ten minutes late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他上班刷卡迟到了十分钟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was in such a hurry to leave that I forgot to punch out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我下班时过于匆忙，忘了刷卡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you punch me in? I’m going to be late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以帮我刷卡吗？我要迟到了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>clock in/on,clock sb in/on <i>(BrE</i>),clock off/out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,punch sth 'in; ,punch sth 'into sth </b><br>to put information into a computer, etc. by pressing keys将﹙信息﹚键入﹙计算机﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She punched in the security code and the door opened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她输入密码，门开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,punch 'out; ,punch sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>)=PUNCH IN/OUT,PUNCH SB IN/OUT</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,punch sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to hit sb repeatedly反复击打；连续揍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Touch my car and I’ll punch you out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你敢动一下我的车，我就让你嚐嚐我的拳头。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>beat sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> PUNCH IN/OUT,PUNCH SB IN/OUT <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,punch sth 'out </b><br>to press a combination of buttons or keys on a computer, telephone, etc.按键﹙ 输入号码等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked up the phone and punched out Donna’s number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拿起电话，拨打唐娜的号码。</font><br>to hit sth very hard and make a hole in it or make sth fall out在……上打孔；打破； 打掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burglar had punched out a pane of glass to open the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼打碎了一块玻璃弄开窗户。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
push	<h3>push<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>push sb a'bout <i>(especially BrE</i>)=PUSH SBAROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push a'head/ 'forward/ 'on (with sth)</b><br>to continue with a plan in a determined way毅然推行﹙计划﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pushed ahead with the modernization programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们坚定地推行现代化计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  PUSH ON<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb a'round <i>(also </i>&b{,push sb a'bout</b><i>especially BrE </i>) (<i>informal</i>)}<br>to order sb to do things ina threatening or unpleasant way发号施令；任意使唤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let him push you around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让他对你指手画脚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb/sth a'side </b><br>to move sb/sth to a positionwhere they do not prevent you from goingsomewhere or doing sth移开，推开﹙阻挡前进的人或物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pushed her aside and went into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他推开她，自己进了房间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I pushed the curtain aside to get a better view.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拉开窗帘开阔视野。</font><br>to treat sb/sth as if they/it are notimportant; to avoid thinking about sb/sth﹙将人或事物﹚置之不理，抛诸脑后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When his sister brought home a school friend, he felt pushed aside and abandoned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他妹妹带了一位同学回家，他觉得自己被扔在一边，无人理会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Emma immediately pushed the unpleasant thought aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃玛立刻把这不愉快的想法抛到脑后。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb/sth a'way </b><br>to remove sb/sth from infront of you with your hands or arms, to showthat you do not want them/it把﹙不需要的人或物﹚推开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He offered to help, but she pushed him away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他主动来帮忙，却被她推开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pushed her plate away. ‘I’m not hungry.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把盘子推到一边说：“我不饿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Had he lied to me? I <b>pushed the thought away</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对我说谎了吗？我要排除这种想法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb 'back </b><br>to use force to make sb movebackwards, especially by using your hands orarms把﹙人﹚向后推:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police pushed the protesters back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Magnus’s army was gradually pushed back into a defensive circle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马格努斯的军队被迫逐步撤回防守圈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sth 'back </b><br>to make sth move backwardsby using your hands, arms, legs, etc.把﹙物﹚向后推:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pushed his chair back and stood up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把椅子向后一推，站了起来。</font><br>to make thetime or date of a meeting, etc. later than originallyplanned推迟；延迟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The release of their new album has been pushed back until early next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp move to one side﹙推搡着﹚向前挤，挤过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She pushed by without saying a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一言不发地挤了过去。</font><br><i><font me for a decision on the matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在催促我就此事做出决定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>press for sth,press sb for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ the enemy, especially with some difficulty﹙部队﹚向敌方推进，艰难前进<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb/yourself 'forward </b><br>to try to make sb notice sb/yourself, especially in order to obtain sth such as a job or a move to a more important job﹙使﹚引人注目，出风头，突显:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s not the sort of person who pushes himself forward.</font></i><br><font who are waiting in a line加塞儿；插队:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They thought I was trying to push in at the head of the queue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们以为我想插到队列前面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cut in <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push 'off </b><br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE </i>) used to tell sb rudely to go away磙开；一边去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Push off and leave me in peace! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 磙开，让我安静点！</font><br>to leave sb/a place, especially in order to go home离开；动身回家:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time I pushed off and did some work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时候我该回家干活儿。</font><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to move away from the shore in a boat, or from the side of a swimming pool﹙乘船﹚离岸；离开﹙游泳池边﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pushed off from the bank and rowed downstream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他划船离开河岸顺流而下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push 'on </b><br>(<b>to…</b>) to continue travelling somewhere﹙向…﹚继续行进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We decided to push on to Kobe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决定继续前往神户。</font><br>=PUSH AHEAD/FORWARD/ON<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'push sth on/onto sb </b><br>to try to make sb accept or buy sth they do not really want强人所难；强买:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He keeps pushing his attentions on her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没完没了地向她献殷勤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb 'out; ,push sb 'out of sth </b><br>to make sb leave a place or an organization驱逐；开除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He refused to resign, so his colleagues pushed him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不肯辞职，于是他的同僚把他赶下了台。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Patients are being pushed out of hospital before they are really ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人们现在还没好利索就要被逐出医院。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb/sth 'out </b><br>to make sb/sth less important than before; to replace sb/sth with sb/sth else减少……的重要性； 使失势； 替换:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents didn’t want me to feel pushed out by my younger brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母不想让我因为我弟弟而觉得失宠。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Harry Potter’ is pushing out more traditional children’s stories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 《哈利波特》正取代更多的传统童话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sb/sth 'over </b><br>to make sb/sth fall to the ground; to make sth fall onto its side or turn over推倒；推翻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was pushed over in the playground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在运动场上被撞倒了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b> 'pushover <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>) </b><br>a task that is easy to do; a contest that you win easily简易的事；轻易取胜的比赛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game against Sheffield will be a pushover.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和谢菲尔德队的比赛将易如反掌。</font><br>a person who is easy to influence or persuade容易说服的人；好说话的人；耳软心活的人<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push 'past; ,push 'past sb =PUSH BY/PAST,PUSH BY/PAST SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push 'through; ,push 'through sth </b><br>to use force to cross a barrier, especially one formed by a crowd of people冲过﹙障碍物﹚；挤过﹙ 人群﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>pushed his way through</b> to the front of the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挤到了人群前面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sth 'through; ,push sth 'through sth</b><br>to get a new law, plan or proposal officially accepted使通过；使得到批准:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re trying to push through the reforms as v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,push sth 'to </b><br>if you <b>push</b> a door or a window <b>to</b>,you close it or almost close it by moving it away from you把﹙门窗﹚推合；关闭:<br><i><font put	<h3>put<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put a'bout </b><br><i>(technical</i>) if a ship <b>puts about</b>, it changes direction﹙船﹚改变航向，掉转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship put about and headed back to port.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船掉头驶回港口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put sth a'bout <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to spread information, stories, etc. among a group of people散布；传播:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone has been <b>putting it about that</b> you’re leaving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人传说你要走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This was an idea put about by the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一想法是从政府传出的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rumours were put about that the shop was closing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据说商店要关门了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>rumour,idea,it</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'put sb/sth above sb/sth =PUT SB/STH BEFORE SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put sth a'cross <i>(also </i>,put sth 'over) (&b{to sb</b> )}<br>to communicate your ideas, feelings, etc. to sb clearly and successfully交流，沟通﹙思想、感情等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The campaign failed to put the message across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次运动未能把信息传递开来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s very good at putting across her ideas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很善于表达思想。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>message,idea,point</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>get sth across</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp put one a'cross sb (<i>informal</i>) <br>to deceive or trick sb欺骗，蒙骗﹙某人﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put yourself a'cross <i>(also </i>&b{,put yourself 'over</b>)(<b>to sb</b> ) (<i>BrE </i>)}<br>to make sb understand your ideas,your personality, etc.表明自己的想法；使﹙别人﹚ 了解自己:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She puts herself across well at interviews.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她面试表达得很好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put sth a'side</b><br>to place sth to one side把……放在一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put the newspaper aside and stood up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把报纸放在旁边站了起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lay sth aside </b><br>to keep an item for a customer to collect later保留……﹙给顾客﹚:<br><i><font BrE</i>,<b>,put sth a'way</b>) to save some money to use later积蓄；攒﹙钱﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had been putting some money aside every month.</font></i><br><font to be a particular size, amount, etc.估计；计算:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d put his age at about sixty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我估计他大约六十岁。</font><br><i><font 他把盘子洗乾净放回碗柜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m just going to put the car away (= }in the garage&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正要把车开进车库。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kids — will you put away your toys now? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们─把玩具收起来好吗？</font><br>=PUT STH ASIDE 3<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s putting some money away for college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正在攒钱准备上大学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m <b>putting </b>something <b>away for a rainy day</b> (= }for difficult times&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在积榖防饥。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to eat or drink large quantities of sth猛吃；猛喝；胡吃海塞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They put away five bottles of wine between them! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他俩共喝了五瓶酒！ DOWN 4<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put sth 'back </b><br>to return sth to its usual place;to return sth to the place it was before把……放回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He uses my </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把书放回书架上好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She carefully put the letters back where she’d found them.</font></i><br><font month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工使我们的交货日期延误了一个多月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set sth back</b><br>to move the hands of a clock back to give the correct earlier time, especially at the end of summer﹙尤指夏时制结束时﹚向后拨，拨慢﹙钟表指针﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We forgot to put the clocks back last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I really want to put something back into it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校对我这么好，我真想报答它。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>something</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>give sth back </b><br>to spend more money on sth in order to make it better or more successful对……增加投资:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government isn’t putting enough money back into the past倒退；复旧；回到从前:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish I could put the clock back and give our marriage another chance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp else把……看得比……重要:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He puts his children before anyone else.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把子女看得比谁都重要。</font><br><i><font 她想忘掉过去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your/the past,your problems</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put sth 'by <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br><i><font <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,put 'out </b><br>(<b>to/from…</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) (of a boat or a crew船或船员) to move out to sea from a harbour,port, etc.起航；离港:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship put surprised that someone has done something wrong, illegal, etc.对某人﹙做错的、违法的事等﹚感到吃惊:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t put it past him to use force to get what he ,reach sth 'out </b><br>to stretch your arm or your hand in order to touch or get something伸出胳膊﹙或手﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He reached out to switch on the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他伸手开灯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>I reached out a hand</b> to touch her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我伸手摸她的脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child reached out for her hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子伸过手来抓她的手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,reach 'out to sb </b><br>to show sb that you are interested in them and/or want to help them; to try to get people’s interest or attention表示对某人感兴趣；伸出援助之手；试图吸引注意力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The organization is trying to reach out to people of all ages and from all levels of society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个组织正尝试惠及各个年龄段以及社会各阶层的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party has failed to reach out to young people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个政党未能成功接触年轻人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The makers of this movie have tried to reach out to an older audience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 影片的制作人试图迎合较年长观众。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outreach <i>n </i></b><br>[U] the activity of an organization that provides a service or advice to people in the community, especially those who cannot or are unlikely to come to an office, a hospital, etc. for help外展服务﹙在服务机构以外的场所提供的社区服务等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a rural outreach programme </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农村外展活动</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp outreach work </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外展工作</font><br>\n
read	<h3>read<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read sth 'back </b><br>to read a message, a letter etc.aloud in order to check that it is correct读出﹙以便核对﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got her to read the message back to me to make sure it was right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我让她把便条给我读了一遍，以确保没什么错。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read sth 'into sth </b><br>to think that something has a meaning or an importance that it probably does not have认为有更深层含义；作过多的理解:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a mistake to read too much into the results of one opinion poll.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凭一次民意调查结果作过多的推想是不对的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can read anything you want into horoscopes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 占星术算命任你诠释。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her voice was cold and I wasn’t sure what to read into it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的声音很冷淡，我弄不清该作何理解。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>too much,something,anything</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read sth 'off </b><br>to look at the measurement shown on a machine or other measuring device看读数:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speed can be calculated or read off from the graph.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可以计算速度， 或从图表读取。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked at the thermometer and read off the temperature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看了看温度计上的读数。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read 'on </b><br>to continue reading继续读；接着读:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was so exciting he read on until dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那本书太精彩了，他一口气读到天亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea is to make the reader want to read on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 目的是吸引读者继续读下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you want to find out more, read on! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要知道后事如何，就接着读吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read sth 'out (to sb) </b><br>to read sth aloud, especially to other people读﹙给某人听﹚；朗读:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She read out the names of the winners.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她宣读了获胜者的名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher read my poem out to the class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师在班上朗读了我的诗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s a letter from Tom. Shall I read it out to you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆来信了。要不要读给你听？</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>, <i>computing</i>) to get back information that is stored on a computer; to produce a display of the information on a screen读取，读出﹙数据﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'read-out <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>computing</i>) a record or display of information on a computer screen﹙数据的﹚读取，读出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The computer will work out the best route for you and give you a read-out on the screen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机会为你设计出最佳路线并显示在屏幕上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read sth 'through <i>(also </i>&b{,read sth 'over</b><i>less frequent</i>)}<br>to read something from the beginning to the end, usually in order to find any mistakes通读﹙以便核对或检查﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I read through my translation, checking for mistakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从头到尾核对我的译文。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she read her letter through the next day, she decided not to send it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第二天她把信通读之后便决定不发了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she’d finished, Emily read over what she’d written.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她写完以后，埃米莉细读了一遍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,read 'up on sb/sth; ,read sb/sth 'up(<i>also </i>&b{,read 'up about sb/sth </b><i>less frequent</i>)}<br>to read a lot about a particular subject in order to learn about it﹙就某课题﹚广泛阅读，博览群书:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you been reading up on the history of the island?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是一直在阅读有关这个岛的历史？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been reading this place up in the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直在图书馆查阅有关这个地方的资料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
rear	<h3>rear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rear sb/sth on sth </b><br>to give a person or an animal a particular type of food, entertainment, etc.when they are young﹙用…﹚餵养；﹙以…﹚娱乐，培养:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was reared on jazz, but later discovered rock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我小时候听的都是爵士乐，后来才发现了摇磙乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rear 'up</b><br>if a horse, etc. <b>rears up</b>, it stands on its back legs with its front legs in the air﹙马等﹚用后腿直立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse reared up and she fell off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马用后腿直立起来把她摔了下去。</font><br>if a building,cliff, etc. <b>rears up</b>, it seems to lean over you in a threatening way﹙楼房、峭壁等﹚危立，陡立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cliff reared up before them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的面前山崖壁立。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse reared and she fell off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马用后腿直立起来把她摔了下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
reason	<h3>reason<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,reason sth 'out </b><br>to think carefully about something in a logical way in order to understand it推测，琢磨﹙原因﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s try to reason out why he behaved as he did.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们来想一想，他为什么会有这种行为。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Reason it out for yourself — why do you think she didn’t say where she was going? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你自己想想─她为什么不说她上哪儿去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>figure sb/sth out;work sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'reason with sb </b><br>to talk to sb in order to persuade them to be more sensible和某人讲道理；规劝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s impossible to reason with her when she’s in this mood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她情绪不好，不可能听得进劝告。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can’t be reasoned with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他这人不可理喻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
rebound	<h3>rebound<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'bound on sb <i>(also </i>&b{re'bound upon sb</b><i>more formal</i>, <i>less frequent</i>)}<br>if sth that you do, especially sth that is intended to be unpleasant for sb else, <b>rebounds on/upon</b> you, it has a bad or unpleasant effect for you instead反作用于；使自作自受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His little trick seems to have rebounded on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的小伎俩似乎使他自食其果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These measures could rebound on the poorest families(= }affect them instead of the people they were intended to affect&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些措施反而会殃及那些最贫穷的家庭。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
reckon	<h3>reckon<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'reckon on sb/sth;'reckon on doing sth;'reckon on sb/sth doing sth </b><br>to rely on sb/sth or on sth happening; to expect sb to do sth or sth to happen指望；依赖；把希望寄託在……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were reckoning on a profit of about half a million.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们希望大约有五十万的赢利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can reckon on my support.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以指望我会支持你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hadn’t reckoned on them arriving so early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没想到他们来得这么早。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t always reckon on having good weather in June.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不能指望六月份常有好天气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company thought they would easily get permission to build a hotel, but they hadn’t reckoned on the local people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司认为要获得批准建造旅馆很容易，但没有对当地的人寄予希望。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on sb/sth,count on doing sth,count on sb/sth doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,reckon sth 'up <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to add figures or numbers together累加；统计；合计:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’ll be ￡20.50, if I’ve reckoned it up correctly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我没合计错的话，应该是20.50 英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>add sth up;calculate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'reckon with sb/sth </b><br><i>(usually used in negative sentences </i>通常用于否定句) to consider sb/sth as a possible problem that you should be prepared for考虑到﹙可能出现的问题﹚；顾及:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unfortunately, we hadn’t reckoned with Emily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可惜我们忘了考虑埃米莉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must reckon with the possibility of failure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须考虑到有可能失败。</font><br>to consider or deal with sb/sth as a serious opponent or problem处理，应付﹙威胁、问题等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had to reckon with a great deal of opposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不得不认真对待诸多的反对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team are still <b>a force to be reckoned with</b> (= }they will be difficult to defeat&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队依然威力强大。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'reckon without sb/sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to not consider sb/sth as a possible problem and therefore not be prepared for it没考虑到；没有顾及:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We allowed an hour to get there, but we’d reckoned without the traffic (= }it took us much longer&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp rein	<h3>rein<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rein 'in; ,rein sth 'in <i>(also </i>&b{,rein 'back, ,rein sth 'back</b><i>less frequent</i>)}<br>to pull on the reins of a horse (= the leather bands that go around its neck) to make it go more slowly or stop用繮绳勒马:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Felipe reined back and rode beside her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 费利普勒了勒马和她并驾齐驱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She reined in her horse and waited for John to catch up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她勒住马等着约翰赶上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rein sb/sth 'in <i>(also </i>&b{,rein sb/sth 'back</b><i>less frequent</i>)}<br>to control sb or sth more strictly严格控制；加强管理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to rein in public spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们需要严格控制公共开销。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new President is faced with the task of reining in the military.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新总统面临着在军事上保持克制的任务。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was unable to rein back his impatience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他按捺不住自己的急躁情绪。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
relate	<h3>relate<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'late to sb/sth </b><br>to feel that you can understand a person, a situation, sth that sb does or feels, etc. and have sympathy with them/it能够理解并同情；谅解；体恤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was unable to relate to her youngest child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她无法和她最小的孩子沟通。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I find him very difficult to relate to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发现他这人难以琢磨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just couldn’t relate to that movie at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根本无法理解那部电影。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could relate to his feelings of guilt about his children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她体谅他对自己孩子的愧疚感。</font><br>to be connected to sb/sth; to refer to sb/sth涉及；关系到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the documents relating to the matter were destroyed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有与这件事有关的文件都给销毁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new law relates only to children born after 1996.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新法规只涉及1996年之后出生的儿童。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
relieve	<h3>relieve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'lieve sb of sth </b><br>( <i>formal</i>) to carry out a difficult or unpleasant task for sb else, or instead of them替……做﹙艰难困苦的工作﹚；减轻……的负担:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Robots can relieve people of dull and repetitive work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 单调重复的工作，机器人可以代劳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I relieve you of some of your bags (= }carry them for you&b{)?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我帮你提其中几个包好吗？</font><br>( <i>formal</i>) to dismiss sb from a job or responsibility开除；解除……的职务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was relieved of his post as manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被解除了经理职务。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>, <i>ironic</i>) to rob sb of sth偷窃；窃取:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief relieved him of his wallet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小偷偷走了他的钱包。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
rely	<h3>rely<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'ly on sb/sth <i>(also </i>&b{re'ly upon sb/sth</b><i>more formal</i>)}<br>(for sth) to need or be dependent on sb/sth依赖；依靠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She still has to rely on her parents for money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她仍然得向父母要钱花。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hasn’t got a car, and relies on public transport to get around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没有汽车，出外都得靠公交。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We relied on Anna to translate for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们靠安娜给我们翻译。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Before they got a piped water supply, local people had to rely on getting their water from wells and tanks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在未有自来水的日子，当地人不得不依赖水井或储水箱取水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>depend on/upon sb/sth (for sth) </b><br>to trust or have confidence in sb/sth信任； 信赖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can safely rely on her judgement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以完全相信她的判断。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can rely on Jon to turn up late! (= }he always does&b{)</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔恩准保迟到！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For the first time in years she had someone she could rely on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多年来她这是第一次有可以信任的人了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We relied on the advice of our solicitor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们听从我们律师的建议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count on/upon sb/sth;depend on/upon sb/sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cannot be relied on to tell the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不能指望她说真话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

remind	<h3>remind<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'mind sb of sb/sth </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) if sb/sth <b>reminds you of</b> sb/sth, they make you think of sb/sth because they are similar使想起，使联想到﹙人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smell of bread baking reminds me of home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烤麵包的香味使我想家了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When Clare smiled, she reminded me of her mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 克莱尔的微笑让我想起她的母亲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watching his serious face, with its big round glasses, she was reminded of an owl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看着他那又大又圆的眼镜和严肃的面孔，她想到了猫头鹰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listening to her, he was reminded of Helen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听着她的声音，他想起了海伦。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

report	<h3>report<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'port 'back </b><br>(to sb) (<b>on sb/sth</b> ) to give a spoken or written account of some information that you were asked to find out about﹙向某人﹚汇报:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have to report back to the manager on our progress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得向经理汇报我们的进展。</font><br>(to…) to return to a place, especially in order to start work again返回﹙工作岗位等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When do you have to report back for duty? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你什么时候归队？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'port 'in (to sb/sth)</b><br>to contact sb to let them know where you are or what you are doing报告，汇报﹙方位或工作情况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The officer briefly reported in (to the police station).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位警察向警察局简单报告了情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'port to sb </b><br><i>(business</i>) (<i>not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) if you <b>report to</b> sb in a company or an organization, they are responsible for your work and tell you what to do隶属；从属；向……负责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She reports directly to the chief executive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她直接向总经理汇报工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A new team will be put together for the project, reporting to Julia Healey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个项目将组建一支新队伍，由朱莉娅·希利负责。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
reside	<h3>reside<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'side in sb/sth( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to be in sb/sth; to be caused by sth在于；由……引起﹙或造成﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The attraction of the book resides in its illustrations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书的魅力在于它的插图。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The interests of the child reside in getting the best possible education.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子的权益是得到尽可能好的桝育。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'side in/with sb/sth ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to be present in or belong to sb/sth存在于； 属于； 隶属于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Supreme authority resides with the President.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最高权力属于总统。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Political power seems to reside increasingly in the South of England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国南部的政治力量似乎与日俱增。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
