resolve	<h3>resolve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'solve into sth;re'solve sth into sth </b><br>to separate or to be separated into its parts分成﹙若干部份﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The design resolved into a number of different patterns.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 设计图分成若干不同的图案。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a lawyer’s ability to resolve facts into their legal categories </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 律师按照法律将事实分门别类的能力</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'solve into sth;re'solve itself/themselves into sth</b><br>if sth you see or hear at a distance<b>resolves into</b> sth or <b>resolves itself into</b> sth, you gradually see it or hear it clearly as a particular thing﹙远处景物、响声等﹚逐渐呈现为……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grey shape resolved into a group of walkers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灰色的影子慢慢呈现为一群走路的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The white light resolved itself into the headlights of a car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 白色灯光逐渐呈现为一辆汽车的前灯。</font><br>to gradually become or be understood as sth逐步变成；逐渐被理解为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The discussion eventually resolved itself into two main issues.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讨论后来集中在两大主要议题上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The question resolves itself into whether individuals should be allowed to choose such a course of action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问题逐步被解释为是否应该允许个人选择这种做法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+pron+prep<br>\n
resort	<h3>resort<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'sort to sth;re'sort to doing sth </b><br>to make use of something, especially something bad or unpleasant, as a way of achieving sth, often because no other course of action is possible不得已而诉之于﹙或采用某种方法﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They should be able to settle their differences without resorting to violence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们应该能够解决分歧，无须诉诸暴力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They resorted to bribery to get what they wanted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们最后靠贿赂达到目的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>violence,bribery</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Various measures were resorted to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已试行了各种措施。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
rest	<h3>rest<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rest on sb/sth <i>(also </i>&b{ 'rest upon sb/sth</b><i>more formal</i>)}<br>to depend on sb/sth寄託在某人身上﹙或某事物上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Britain’s hopes of a medal now rest on Henderson.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在英国把得奖的希望寄託在亨德森身上。</font><br>if your eyes <b>rest on</b> sb/sth, you look at them/it﹙视线﹚在……上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes rested on a photograph on the desk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的视线落在桌上的一张照片上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>eyes,gaze</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rest on sth <i>(also </i> &b{'rest upon sth</b><i>more formal</i>)}<br>to be based on sth基于；以……为基础:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole case rests on one man’s evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个论据都基于一名男子提供的证明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His argument seemed to rest on a false assumption.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的论点似乎基于错误的假设。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rest 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) to rest after an illness or injury﹙因病或受伤﹚休息；养病；养伤:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was advised to rest up for a week after his fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摔了一跤，要遵嘱休息一个星期。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) to rest in order to gain energy and strength, for example after an illness or before a sports competition﹙因病瘉或比赛前等﹚休养；养精蓄锐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should rest up if you’re going to be fit for the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果想以最佳状态参加比赛，就应该养养劲了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The climbers decided to rest up for a couple of days before continuing up to the summit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 登山队员决定休息几天再继续向顶峰进发。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Rest </b>can also be used with this meaning. <b>rest </b>也可作此义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rest with sb (to do sth) ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>(<i>not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to be sb’s responsibility﹙责任﹚落在……身上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The decision rests entirely with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个决定完全得由你来作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The responsibility for bringing up children rests with the parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 养育子女是父母的责任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>It rests with</b>the bus company <b>to</b> prove they were not responsible for the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车公司应当证明他们不用对这一事故负责。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lie with sb (to do sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
result	<h3>result<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'sult in sth </b><br>to have a particular effect; to make sth happen产生某效果；造成；导致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The accident resulted in 67 deaths.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场事故造成了67人死亡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The agreement will result in employers working more closely with students and teachers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 协议将促使雇主更紧密地和师生合作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>death,increase,loss</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
retail	<h3>retail<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'retail at/for sth </b><br><i>(business</i>) to be sold at a particular price以……价格销售:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The videos retail at ￡15 each.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 录像带每盘售价15英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
return	<h3>return<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'turn to sth </b><br>to go back to a previous state回复，恢复﹙先前的状态﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Train services have <b>returned to normal </b>after the strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工之后，铁路运营已恢复正常。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go back to sth </b><br>to start discussing a subject you were discussing earlier回到﹙先前的话题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He returns to this topic later in the report.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在报告中后来又提到了这个主题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come back to sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
rev	<h3>rev<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rev 'up; ,rev sth 'up </b><br>if the engine of a vehicle<b>revs up</b>, or sb <b>revs it up</b>, it runs quickly although the vehicle does not move﹙使发动机﹚快速旋转， 加快转速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car revved up and roared away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车发动起来，然后轰鸣着开走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rev 'up (for sth); ,rev sb/sth 'up (for sth) (<i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to become, or to make sb/sth, more active or excited﹙使﹚活跃起来，兴奋起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team are revving up for next week’s game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队伍对下周的比赛跃跃欲试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s his job to rev up the audience before the show starts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要负责在表演开始前鼓动观众的热情。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
revel	<h3>revel<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'revel in sth;'revel in doing sth </b><br>to enjoy a situation or an experience very much陶醉于；沉迷于；纵情于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think he’s secretly revelling in all the attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得他对于能够引起广泛的注意心里感到飘飘然。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seems to revel in annoying her parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她似乎以惹父母生气为乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
revert	<h3>revert<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'vert to sb <i>(law</i>)</b><br>(of property and land财产或土地) to return legally to the owner复归，归还﹙合法主人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After his death the house reverted to its original owner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他死后房子归还给了原先的主人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'vert to sth;re'vert to doing sth ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to go back to a previous condition or activity,especially a worse one回复，退回﹙尤指较差的状况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the pressure is on, players revert to bad habits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遇到压力，运动员就恢复坏习惯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a good year the team <b>reverted to type</b> in their last game (= }they played badly again&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队好了一年，上一场比赛中又故态复萌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After 80 years as a school, the building has reverted back to being a house again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座建筑用作校舍80 年之后又重新成为住房。</font><br>to start talking or thinking again about a subject you were considering earlier回到，恢复﹙先前的话题或思路﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To revert to your earlier question . . .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回到你前面提出的问题……</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
revolve	<h3>revolve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'volve around sb/sth;re'volve around doing sth <i>(also </i>&b{revolve round sb/sth,revolve round doing sth </b><i>especially BrE</i>)}<br>to have sb/sth as the main subject or interest围绕； 以……为中心；将……作为主要兴趣﹙或主题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His whole life revolved round cars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一生都在和汽车打交道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You think the whole world revolves around you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你以为整个世界都以你为中心呢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Much of a dolphin’s life revolves around finding and eating food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海豚生命的大部份时间用于觅食和进食。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>re'volve around sth <i>(also </i>&b{re'volve round sth</b> <i>especially BrE</i>)}<br>to move around sth in a circle绕……旋转﹙或做圆周运动﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The earth revolves around the sun.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地球绕太阳公转。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
rid	<h3>rid<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rid sb/sth/yourself of sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to remove sth/sb unpleasant from a person, a place or an organization去除；清除；﹙使﹚摆脱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government pledged to rid the country of nuclear weapons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府承诺清除这个国家的核武器。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How could she rid herself of Charles?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她如何能摆脱查尔斯？</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is used mainly in written English.这个短语动词主要用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
riddle	<h3>riddle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'riddle sb/sth with sth </b><br>to fill sb/sth with bullets or with holes使布满子弹﹙或窟窿﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His body was riddled with bullets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被子弹打得体无完肤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp wooden beams riddled with holes </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 千疮百孔的木梁</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a bullet-riddled car </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布满弹坑的汽车</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'riddled with sth </b><br>to be full of sth, especially sth unpleasant or bad充满…… ；……充斥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole organization is riddled with corruption.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个组织腐败透顶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n
ride	<h3>ride<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'ride on sth </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses</i>通常用于进行时) to depend on sth决定于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My whole future is riding on this interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的未来全押在这场面试上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s a lot of money riding on this deal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这宗交易关系到一大笔钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has <b>a lot riding on</b> this film after the failure of the last two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上两部电影失败之后，她对这一部寄予很大希望。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ride sth 'out </b><br>to manage to survive a difficult period or situation without suffering serious harm安然渡过﹙难关﹚；经受住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think the president will be able to ride out this latest crisis? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认为总统能挺过最近这次危机吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Of course your parents were angry, but you should have stayed to <b>ride out the storm</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的父母当然生气，但你应当留下来挨过那一刻的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>storm,recession</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ride 'up </b><br>if an item of clothing <b>rides up</b>, it gradually moves upwards, out of position﹙衣服﹚慢慢向上移动，渐渐缩上去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His waistcoat was riding up over his stomach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的马甲收到腹部以上了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
rifle	<h3>rifle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rifle 'through sth </b><br>to search quickly through sth such as drawers, cupboards or papers, in order to find or steal sth迅速搜寻；匆忙翻找:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sally rifled through her wardrobe looking for something to wear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨莉翻腾着衣柜找穿的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room looked as if a burglar had rifled through it (= }it was very untidy&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间看上去像是被劫掠过。</font><br><b>Rifle through sth </b>can be used in the passive.<b>rifle through sth </b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drawers had been rifled through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人翻检过抽屉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
rig	<h3>rig<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rig sb/sth 'out (in/with sth) (<i>old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to provide sb/sth with clothes or equipment给……提供﹙衣服或设备﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They took the kids to a big store and rigged them out from top to bottom (= }bought them a set of new clothes,shoes, etc.&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把孩子们带到一家大商店，给他们从头到脚穿戴一新。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship had been rigged out with state-of-the-art equipment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这艘轮船安装了最先进的设备。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>kit sb/sth out (in/with sth) (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rig sth 'up </b><br>to fix a piece of equipment into place安装；装置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve rigged up lights in the garden for the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在花园里安了开晚会的灯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was rigged up to a machine so that the nurses could check his heartbeat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他身上连接了机器让护士检查心跳。</font><br>to make or build sth quickly, using whatever materials are available﹙用现有材料﹚匆匆做成，草草搭建:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had rigged up a sort of tent, using his jacket and shirt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用外衣和衬衫匆忙搭了个类似帐篷的东西。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
ring	<h3>ring<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]<b>To ring</b> is not used in American English to mean ‘to telephone’. <b>To call</b> is the most common verb for this in American English. It is also used in British English, as well as <b>to phone</b> .美国英语不用<b>to ring</b> 表示打电话，表达此义的最常用动词是<b>to call</b> 。<b>to call</b> 和<b>to phone</b> 也用于英国英语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring a'round/ 'round; ,ring a'round/ 'round sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to phone several people or places to find out information or discuss sth到处打电话；打电话给各方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve spent the morning ringing round travel agents to find a flight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一上午都在打电话向各旅行社询问航班。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'back; ,ring sb 'back <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to telephone sb again or to telephone sb who telephoned you earlier﹙给某人﹚再打电话，回覆电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll ring you back later with more details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我过会儿再给你打电话细说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your mother called while you were out. She wants you to ring back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你外出时你母亲打来电话了。她让你回电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve only got a few coins for this call (= }from a public telephone&b{). Can you ring me back? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只有几枚硬币打电话。你给我打回来好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he phones while I’m out, tell him to ring back later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出去时他要是打来电话，就告诉他过会儿再打。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'in <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to telephone the place where you work给工作单位打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt so exhausted she rang in sick (= }to say she could not come to work&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感觉筋疲力尽，于是给单位打电话请病假。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boss rings in several times a day, even when he’s on holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板一天打来几次电话，即使他休假也不例外。</font><br>to telephone a radio,television programme, etc.给电台﹙或电视节目等﹚打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Listeners were asked to ring in with their opinions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欢迎听众打电话来提意见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'off <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to end a telephone conversation,and put the telephone down挂断电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rang off before I could explain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还没来得及解释他就把电话挂了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'out </b><br>to be heard loudly and clearly清晰可闻；发出响亮的声音:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His clear voice rang out across the hall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那清亮的嗓音在大厅中回响。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly shots rang out nearby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 附近突然响起一阵枪声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'round; ,ring 'round sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>)=RING AROUND/ROUND,RING AROUND/ROUND SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'through (to sb/sth) (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to make a telephone call to sb, especially within the same building打电话﹙给同一栋大楼内的人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Reception rang through to say my visitor had arrived.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 服务打电话来说我的客人到了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring 'up; ,ring sb/sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to telephone sb/sth给……打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rang up to apologize.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打电话来道歉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must ring Jenny up tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今天晚上一定得给珍妮打电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you ring up the station to check the train times? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给火车站打电话核实一下列车时刻好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dad was once rung up by someone claiming to be John Lennon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爸爸曾经接到一个自称是约翰·列农的人的电话。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Ring </b>and <b>ring sb</b> are also frequently used with this meaning. <b>Ring up</b> and <b>ring sb up</b> are very common in spoken English. <b>ring </b>和<b>ring sb</b> 也常作此义。<b>ring up</b> 和<b>ring sb up</b> 在英语口语中十分常见。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ring sth 'up </b><br>to record the cost of goods being bought in a shop/store on a machine (a <b>cash register</b> ); to make sales of the value mentioned将﹙款额﹚输入现金出纳机；达到……销售额:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rang up the drinks on the till.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她将所购饮料款额记入现金出纳机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company rang up profits of $160 million last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司去年的利润达到了1.6 亿元。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
rinse	<h3>rinse<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rinse sth 'out </b><br>to make sth clean by washing it in water冲洗；洗刷乾净:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ruth finished her coffee and rinsed out her cup under the tap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲁思喝完咖啡就到水龙头把杯子冲乾净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rinse your mouth out to get rid of the taste.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 漱漱口除掉嘴里的味道。</font><br><b>Rinse sth </b>is also used with the same meaning. <b>rinse sth </b>也作此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She quickly rinsed her cup and plate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快地清洗了杯子和盘子。</font><br><i>(also </i><b>,rinse sth 'out of sth</b>) to remove sth such as soap from sth else with water把﹙肥皂等﹚冲掉；漂洗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave the conditioner on your hair for three minutes and then rinse it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让护发剂在头发上保留三分钟，然后冲乾净。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wash sth out</b><br>\n
rip	<h3>rip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rip at sth </b><br>to attack sth violently and tear it or cut it猛烈撕扯； 用力割:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bird ripped at its rival’s throat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只鸟猛啄敌人的喉咙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)The hurricane tore at their skin and ripped at their clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飓风打在他们的皮肤上，撕扯着他们的衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip 'into sb/sth (with sth) (&b{for sth/for doing sth</b> )(<i>informal</i>)}<br>to criticize sb in an angry way for sth they have done or said﹙因…﹚责骂，斥责:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ripped into me for being late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我因为迟到而受到他训斥。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lay into sb/sth (with sth) (&b{for sth/for doing sth</b> )}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip 'into/ 'through sb/sth </b><br>to go very quickly or violently into or through sb/sth﹙猛地﹚钻入，穿透:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An explosion ripped through a four-storey apartment building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猛烈的爆炸穿过一座四层楼公寓。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip sb 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to cheat sb, for example by charging them too much for sth, selling them sth of poor quality, etc.﹙以次货等﹚欺诈某人；敲竹杠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bank was accused of ripping off its customers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 银行被指责欺诈顾客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tickets were very expensive, but the play was terrible.We felt we’d been ripped off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 票很贵，可演出糟糕透了。我们觉得上当受骗了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The law protects tenants from being ripped off by landlords.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法律保障租户免受业主敲诈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rip-off <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] (<i>informal</i>) a situation where you pay too much for sth; sth that is not worth what you pay for it敲竹杠﹙的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They charged you ￡25 for a T-shirt? What a ripoff! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一件T恤衫开价25英镑？真会敲竹杠！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meal was a total rip-off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那顿饭完全不合算。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp rip-off prices </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过高的价格</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RIP-OFF at RIP SB/STH OFF;RIP-OFF at RIP STH OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip sb/sth 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to copy sb/sth, by stealing ideas, designs, etc. especially in order to make money for yourself剽窃；抄袭；仿冒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Another band has ripped off our song.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 另一个乐队剽窃了我们的歌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was accused of ripping off other people’s ideas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被控抄袭他人的构想。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rip-off (&b{of sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br>(<i>informal</i>)a copy of sth, especially one that is not as good as the original冒牌货；仿制品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has a stall that sells designer ripoffs(= }clothes&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开了个铺子卖仿冒设计师品牌衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  RIP-OFF at RIP SB OFF;RIP-OFF at RIP STH OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rip sth 'off <i>(slang</i>)</b><br>to steal sth偷窃； 盗取:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thieves broke in and ripped off five computers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盗贼破门而入，偷走了五台计算机。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>nick sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rip-off <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) an act of stealing sth盗窃；偷盗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a scandalous rip-off of public funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那是一桩盗用公款的丑闻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RIP-OFF at RIP SB OFF;RIP-OFF at RIP SB/STH OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip sth 'off; ,rip sth 'off sb/sth </b><br>to remove sth,especially clothing, very quickly by pulling sharply猛地拉下﹙或拽下﹚；迅速脱下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fans were trying to rip his clothes off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 追随者试图拉掉他的衣服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ripped the poster off the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把海报从墙上一把撕下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tear sth off,tear sth off sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip 'through sth =RIP INTO/THROUGH STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rip sth 'up </b><br>to tear sth to pieces把某物撕碎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ripped the letter up without reading it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没看信就把它撕碎了。</font><br>to pull sth quickly or violently from the floor or ground﹙从地上﹚迅速拉起来，猛地拔起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A gang of teenagers ripped up fences and plants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一帮青少年拔掉围栏和花草。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve ripped up the old carpets and painted the walls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把旧地毯拽了起来，刷了墙壁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tear sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
rise	<h3>rise<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rise a'bove sth <i>(written</i>)</b><br>to not be affected or limited by problems, insults, etc.; to be able to deal with problems克服﹙障碍﹚；超越﹙界限﹚；战胜﹙困难﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was able to rise above her disability.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她能够战胜自身残疾。</font><br>to be too wise or good to do sth wrong or to think or behave in the way other people do不为……所动；超脱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had an unusual ability to rise above the prejudices of his generation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一种不寻常的能力，能够超脱同代人的偏见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There will always be gossip. You have to try and rise above it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 流言蜚语总是会有的。你必须尽量置之不理。</font><br>to be better than other similar things超群；出众；突出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her articles never rise above the level of a gossip column.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的文章从未超出过漫谈栏的水平。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rise to sth</b><br>to deal successfully with a situation or problem that you do not expect or do not usually have to face成功处理﹙突发情况、问题等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The job wasn’t easy but Sam was ready to <b>rise to the challenge</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那份工作并不轻松，可萨姆愿意面对挑战。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play was a challenge for the actors but they <b>rose to the occasion</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部戏剧对于演员们是个挑战，但他们应付裕如。</font><br>to react when sb is deliberately trying to make you angry or get you interested in sth上当；上漖； 进圈套:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I refuse to rise to that sort of comment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拒绝对那样的评论作出反应。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I decided to flatter him and he <b>rose to the bait</b> (=}he reacted in the way that I wanted&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决定奉承他，结果他上漖了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rise 'up </b><br>(<b>against sb/sth</b>) (<i>formal</i>) to start to fight against or refuse to obey people in authority, for example a government or king反抗；起义；反叛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The people rose up against the invaders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们起来抗击侵略者。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rebel (against sb/sth) </b><br><i>(literary</i>) to appear as a tall shape above the surroundings高耸；矗立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A magnificent palace rose up before her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一座富丽堂皇的宫殿矗立在她的面前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'uprising <i>n </i></b><br>a situation in which a group of people join together to fight against or to refuse to obey people in authority起义；暴动；造反:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 起义被残酷地镇压下去。</font><br>\n
roll	<h3>roll<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll a'round <i>(BrE also </i>&b{,roll 'round</b>) (<i>informal</i>) }<br>(<i>BrE also </i><b>,roll a'bout</b>) to be laughing so much that you can hardly control yourself大笑不止:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her speech had everyone rolling around with laughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的话令大家笑得前仰后合。</font><br>(of a regular event定期活动) to arrive; to happen at the usual time举行；进行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to be ready when election time rolls around again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须为下次选举作好准备。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come round,come around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll sth 'back </b><br>to reduce the amount of influence,power or importance that sth has; to change sth so that it is the opposite of what it was减少﹙影响、力量或重要性﹚；扭转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were determined to roll back union power.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决心削减工会的权力。</font><br>to reduce prices,wages, etc.降低，削减﹙价格、工资等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must roll back inflation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须减低通胀。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>prices </b><br>to make sth go back or further away使回复﹙原貌﹚；扩大领域:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to roll back the frontiers of space/science </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拓展太空/科学领域</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The former international football player <b>rolled back the years</b> with a brilliant performance last night (= }he played as he did when he was younger&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位前世界级足球员昨晚展现了年轻时的丰采。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>frontiers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rollback (&b{of sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br><i>(especially AmE</i>) a reduction or decrease in sth回降；削减:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a 2% rollback in taxes </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 减税2% </font><br><i>(computing</i>) a return to the condition that existed before there was an error in a computer system回退；重算；重新运行<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll sth 'down </b><br>to open out a piece of clothing, etc. that has been folded over and over展开，铺开，摊开﹙卷状物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rolled down her sleeves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她放下了衣袖。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sleeves</b><br>to lower sth; to open a window in a car, especially by turning a handle放低；摇开﹙车窗﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rolled down the car window and waved to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摇下车窗向我们招手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>car window</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>roll sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll 'in <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to arrive in great numbers or quantities大量涌入；磙磙而来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Offers of help continue to roll in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不断有人表示愿意提供援助。</font><br>to arrive somewhere, usually late and without being worried or sorry姗姗来迟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rob finally rolled in at lunch time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到午饭时分，罗布终于慢吞吞地来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll 'on </b><br>(of time时间) to pass steadily流逝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the years rolled on the painful memories began to fade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一年年过去了，痛苦的回忆开始淡忘。</font><br>to continue without changing very much继续进行；持续:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp For the next few weeks the debate rolled on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在随后的几周里，争论一如既往地进行着。</font><br><b>roll on ...</b> <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)used to say that you wish sth would come soon… 快来吧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Roll on summer! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夏天快点来到吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll sb/sth 'out <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to use sb/sth to help you achieve sth动员；动用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rolled out all his old friends to help him win the election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发动了所有的老朋友帮他赢得选举。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Moscow Circus rolled out dancing bears to announce its arrival in North America.</font></i><br><font pastry flat and thin by rolling sth over it将……轧平:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Roll out the pastry with a clean rolling pin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用乾净的麵杖把油酥麵糰平。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pastry,dough </b><br>to unfold sth that is in a roll and put it flat on the ground铺平， 展开﹙ 卷状物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I rolled out my sleeping bag and crawled in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放开睡袋爬了进去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>roll sth up </b><br>to officially make a new product available to the public正式推出﹙新产品﹚；将……公之于世:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Air Force will roll out its new planes in November.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 空军的新型飞机将于十一月面世。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>launch sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp roll out the red 'carpet (for sb) <br>to treat sb like a very important visitor以贵宾般的礼节接待；隆重欢迎<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'roll-out <i>n </i></b><br>an occasion when a company introduces a new product﹙新产品的﹚面世，问世:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a roll-out ceremony </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新产品上市仪式</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll 'over; ,roll sb/sth 'over </b><br>(of a person人)to turn from lying on one side of your body to the other side; to move sb in this way﹙使﹚躺着时转动身体:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rolled over onto her back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她翻了个身仰……着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I rolled the baby over and sat up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把婴儿翻过来， 自己坐直身子。</font><br>(of a vehicle, a boat, etc.车辆、船等) to turn onto its side or upside down; to move sth in this way﹙使﹚翻侧，翻转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car rolled over into a ditch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车翻进了沟里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn over,turn sb/sth over</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll sth 'over </b><br><i>(finance</i>) to allow money that sb owes to be paid at a later date准许﹙将欠款﹚延期偿还； ﹙ 将债项﹚ 转期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government agreed to roll over the debt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府批准延期还债。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>debt,loan </b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to add the prize money in a competition in a particular week to the prize money the next week, if no one has won it﹙将金额﹚累加到﹙下周奖金中﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This week’s lottery jackpot will be rolled over until next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个星期的彩金将加到下个星期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rollover <i>n </i></b><br>[C] (<i>BrE</i>) a prize of money in a competition that is formed by adding the prize from one week when no one has won it to the prize for the next week累积奖金:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This week there is a rollover of $14 million.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本周的累积奖金是1 400 万元。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a rollover jackpot/week </font></i><br><font 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=ROLL AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to arrive到达:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finally rolled up an hour late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最终迟到了一小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Roll up! Roll up for the greatest show on earth! (= }used to invite people who are passing to come and form an audience&b{)</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快来看哪！快来看世界上最精彩的表演吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,roll sth 'up </b><br>to turn the end of a piece of clothing over and over to make it shorter卷起，挽起﹙ 衣服﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rolled up his sleeves and started washing the dishes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挽起衣袖开始洗盘子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>sleeves,trousers</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>roll sth down </b><br>to fold sth to make the shape of a tube or a ball把……卷起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rolled up the sleeping bag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她卷起了睡袋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>roll sth out </b><br>to close the window in a car, especially by turning a handle;to raise sth摇上﹙车窗﹚；将……升高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She rolled up the window and drove off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她摇上车窗把车开走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>car window</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>roll sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'roll-up <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) a cigarette that you make yourself by rolling tobacco in special paper烟卷；卷烟:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Simon lit a roll-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 西蒙点了根烟卷。</font><br>\n
romp	<h3>romp<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,romp a'head/a'way <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to make progress,increase or win quickly and easily进步神速；快速增加；轻易取胜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The home team romped away to win by 3 goals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主队轻而易举地以3分取胜。</font><br>[NOTE]This verb is mostly used in newspapers.这个动词主要用于报章。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,romp 'through sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to do sth easily and quickly轻易而快速地做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She romped through the exam questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快就答完了考试题。</font><br>[NOTE]This verb is mostly used in newspapers.这个动词主要用于报章。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
root	<h3>root<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,root a'round; ,root a'round/ 'through sth (<i>BrE also </i>&b{,root a'bout, ,root a'bout sth) (for sth</b>)}<br>to move things around or v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rub 'up against sb/sth =RUB AGAINST SB/STH,RUB UP AGAINST SB/STH</b><br>\n
ruck	<h3>ruck<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ruck 'up; ,ruck sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to form untidy folds; to make sth do this﹙使﹚起皱褶:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your blouse has rucked up at the back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的衬衫后面起褶儿了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her skirt was rucked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的裙子皱了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
rule	<h3>rule<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rule sth 'in; ,rule sth 'into sth( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>if sb<b>rules sth in</b>, they decide that it is possible, or that it can or should happen认为某事有可能发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He asked for all possible results to be ruled in to the discussions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要求讨论时要考虑到所有可能出现的结果。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>rule sth out,rule sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rule sb 'out (as sth), ,rule sb 'out of sth </b><br>if somebody <b>rules</b> somebody else <b>out</b>, they decide that it is not possible for them to have done sth or to do sth, or that they are not suitable for sth把﹙某人﹚排除在外；认为某人不适合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police soon ruled out her husband as a suspect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方很快就排除了她丈夫的嫌疑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The producer ruled out an older actress for the role.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 制片人认为年龄较大的女演员不适合该角色。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ramsay has been ruled out as too old for the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拉姆齐被认为年纪太大不适合做那份工作。</font><br>if something<b>rules sb out</b>, it makes it impossible for sb to have done sth or to do sth, or makes them unsuitable for sth﹙某事﹚使某人被排除，使某人不适合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several people saw her at the restaurant at 9.00 p.m. so that seems to rule her out as the murderer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几个人晚上9点在饭店见过她，因此似乎排除了她是兇手的可能性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Beckham has been ruled out of tonight’s game with a knee injury.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贝克汉姆因膝部受伤不可能参加今晚的比赛了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RULE YOURSELF,ITSELF,ETC. OUT,RULE YOURSELF,ITSELF,ETC. OUT OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rule sth 'out (as sth), ,rule sth 'out of sth </b><br>if somebody <b>rules sth out</b>, they decide that it is not possible, or that it cannot or should not happen将某事物排除在外；认为某事不可能发生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police have ruled out suicide.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方排除了自杀的可能。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t rule anything out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会排除任何可能性的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Detectives have not <b>ruled out the possibility </b>that she was abducted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侦探尚未排除她被绑架的可能性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Manchester has been ruled out as the site for the next Olympics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 曼彻斯特已经没有可能成为下届奥运会的主办地了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sabotage was ruled out of the investigation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 调查排除了蓄意破坏的可能。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>rule sth in,rule sth into sth </b><br>if something<b>rules</b> sth <b>out</b>, it makes it impossible for sth to happen, or makes sth unsuitable for a particular purpose使……不可能发生；使某物不适合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The latest developments <b>rule out the possibility</b> of a lasting peace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最新的发展使和平不可能持久。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The change in the weather ruled out any climbing the next day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因天气变化第二天不能登山了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The size of the house ruled it out as a family home (= }it was too small&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子太小，住不下一家人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rule yourself, itself, etc. 'out; ,rule yourself, itself, etc. 'out of sth </b><br>to decide you do not want to or are not able to do sth; to decide that you are not suitable for sth认为自己不想做﹙或没有能力、不适合等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smith has not ruled himself out of Saturday’s game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯没排除自己参加星期六的比赛的可能。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv ◆ v+pron+adv+prep<br>\n
rumble	<h3>rumble<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rumble 'on </b><br><i>(written</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) if an argument,a dispute, etc. <b>rumbles on</b>, it continues slowly and steadily for much longer than it should﹙争吵、辩论等﹚拖得很长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dispute rumbled on through the summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争辩没完没了地进行了整个夏天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The row has been rumbling on for two years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争吵已经延续了两年了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
run	<h3>run<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'bout; ,run a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>)=RUN AROUND,RUN AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'runabout <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>a small car, boat or aircraft, used mainly for short journeys﹙短途﹚小汽车，小船，小飞机<br><i>(AmE</i>) a person who moves from place to place居无定所的人；流浪者<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'cross sb/sth </b><br>to meet sb or find sth by chance偶然遇见﹙或看到﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran across Mary in town yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨天在城里遇见玛丽了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come across sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'after sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to try to persuade sb to have a romantic or sexual relationship with you追求:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always running after younger women.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总在追求年轻女子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'after sb/sth </b><br>to run to try to catch sb/sth; to chase sb/sth追逐；追赶:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran after the thief but he got away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们追赶小偷，可他跑掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'long </b><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>informal</i>) used to tell sb, especially a child, to go away and not disturb you﹙尤用以命令儿童﹚走开，一边去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Run along now, children, I’m busy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们，都走开吧，我忙着呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'round; ,run a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>&b{,run a'bout/ 'round, ,run a'bout/ 'round sth</b>) }<br>to run in different directions, especially in an excited way﹙兴奋地﹚各处跑，东奔西跑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a lovely park to run around in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个公园不错，可以到处跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were running round the house with no clothes on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们光着身子在房子里各处跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stopped the car to let the dogs out to run about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们停车让狗只下去遛遛。</font><br>to move very quickly from place to place, being very busy奔走忙碌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran around like a mad thing all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一整天像疯了一样跑来跑去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s been running about the place organizing the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一直在这里四处奔走组织聚会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been running round everywhere looking for you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我跑遍了所有的地方寻找你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s had the police <b>running around in circles</b> (= }being very busy but not achieving anything&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他搞得警察四处扑空。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rush around,rush around sth;tear around, tear around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'runaround <i>n </i></b><br>if you give sb the <b>runaround</b>,you treat them badly by delaying them, giving them false information, not telling them the truth, etc.兜圈子；耍弄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You know where she is, don’t you, but you’re just <b>giving me the runaround</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道她在哪儿，对不对，可你却在和我兜圈子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'round after sb <i>(BrE also </i>&b{,run 'round after sb</b>)}<br>to be very busy doing a lot of things for sb,when they should be able to do them for themselves替﹙某人﹚做他力所能及的事；替……忙活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His mother shouldn’t have to run around after him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的母亲不该替他忙活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spends all her time running round after the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她所有的时间都无谓地花在照料孩子上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'round with sb <i>(disapproving</i>)</b><br>to spend a lot of time with sb与……厮混﹙或泡在一块儿﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their son is running around with a bad crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的儿子与一帮坏人混在一起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run at sb </b><br>to run towards sb to attack them or as if you were going to attack them向某人冲去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran at me with a knife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拿着刀朝我冲过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run at sth </b><br><i>(often used in the progressive tenses</i>常用于进行时) to be at or near a particular level or rate达到，接近﹙某水平或比率﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Inflation is running at 26%.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通货膨胀处于26%。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Interest rates were running at record levels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 利率接近历史最高水平。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>inflation,unemployment</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way </b><br>(from sb/sth) to move quickly away from sb/a place; to escape from sb/a place迅速离开；逃离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A man was seen running away from the shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人看见一名男子从商店里跑出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Bye then,’ she said, and ran away without looking back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “再见吧。”她说完头也不回拔腿就走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His first instinct was to run away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的本能反应就是逃跑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUN OFF 1<br>(from sth)to leave the place where you are living or staying suddenly and secretly because you are unhappy出走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran away from home on several occasions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她几次离家出走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran away and joined a circus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离家出走后进了马戏团。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUN OFF 2<br>to leave a person or a place to try to avoid doing sth﹙为免做某事而﹚离开某人，离开某地；避开；躲避:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t run away — I want your advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别跑开─你得帮我出主意。</font><br>used to tell a child to go away and not disturb you﹙对儿童说﹚走开，别捣乱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Run away and play.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一边玩儿去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'runaway <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>(of a situation or an event情况或事情) happening quickly and easily and not able to be controlled迅猛的；急骤的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie has been a runaway success.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部电影一炮打响。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game was a runaway victory for Liverpool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 利物浦队这场比赛赢得乾净利落。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp runaway inflation </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 急速的通胀</font><br>(of an animal or a vehicle动物或车辆) moving, but no longer under the control of the rider or driver失去控制的；失控的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a runaway horse </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 脱繮的马</font><br>(of a person人) having secretly left their home or the place where they are staying出走了的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp runaway children/teenagers </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离家出走的孩子/少年</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'runaway <i>n </i></b><br>a person who has left their home or the place where they are staying suddenly and secretly because they are unhappy there出走的人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a 16-year-old runaway </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离家出走的16 岁少年</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way/ 'off; ,run a'way/ 'off with sb; ,run a'way/ 'off together </b><br>to leave your home, husband,wife, etc. secretly with sb else in order to marry them or have a sexual relationship with them与某人私奔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran away to Scotland.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们私奔到了苏格兰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We think John and Susie have run off together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们认为约翰和苏西一起私奔了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way from sth </b><br>to try to avoid dealing with or thinking about sth because it is difficult or unpleasant逃避，迴避﹙困难等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is running away from his responsibilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在逃避责任。</font><br><i><font [OBJ]<b>responsibilities</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way with sb; ,run a'way together =RUN AWAY/OFF,RUN AWAY/OFF WITH SB,RUN AWAY/OFF TOGETHER</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way with you </b><br>if a feeling, an emotion,etc. <b>runs away with you</b>, you are not able to control it﹙感情、情绪等﹚无法抑制，失去控制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her imagination tends to run away with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她动辄想入非非。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My tongue ran away with me and I said things I regretted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没留神说出了令我后悔的话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>imagination,tongue</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run a'way with sth </b><br>to win sth clearly or easily轻而易举地赢得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their team are running away with the championship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们队即将轻松获得冠军。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran away with the show (= }she was easily the best performer&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她轻而易举地成为最佳演员。</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) (<i>also </i><b>,run 'off with sth</b>)to escape with sth that you have stolen or taken without asking偷走；未经允许拿走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The treasurer ran away with all the funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出纳偷走了所有的资金。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to believe sth that is not true误信；误认为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t <b>run away with the idea that</b> everything was perfect in our marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要以为我们的婚姻很完美。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea,impression</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sth 'by/ 'past sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to show sb sth or tell them about an idea, a proposal, etc. in order to get their reaction to it给某人看，说给某人听﹙以观察其反应﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got a few ideas I’d like to run by you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有几个主意想说给你听听。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Run that past me again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把它再给我看看。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'down; ,run sth 'down </b><br>to lose power or stop working; to make sth do this﹙使﹚耗尽能量，停止工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think the batteries are running down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想电池没电了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you leave your headlights on, you’ll run the battery down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让前灯亮着就会耗尽电池的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>battery </b><br>to stop functioning gradually or become smaller in size or number; to make sth do this﹙使﹚逐步失去作用，萎缩，衰减:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Oil supplies in the region will start to run down in the next decade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下一个年代这个地区的石油资源将开始萎缩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company are running down their operations in the UK.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司正逐步缩减在英国的业务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rundown (&b{in/of sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br>[usually sing.] (<i>BrE</i>) <br>a reduction in the size, number, amount or importance of sth削减； 紧缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The public are complaining about the rundown of health services.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公众抱怨医疗宪生服务紧缩。</font><br>a description or an explanation of sth, especially the main points解释； 要略； 综述:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a rundown of the history of each team </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 各队历史概略</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUNDOWN at RUN DOWN STH,RUN STH DOWN STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run-'down <i>adj </i></b><br>(of a building or an area建筑或地区) in poor condition; that has not been looked after破旧的； 疏于管理的； 失修的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a run-down area of East London </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伦敦东部破败的地区</font><br>(of a business, etc.商业机构等) not as busy or as active as it used to be衰微的；衰落的<br>[not before noun] (of a person人) tired, weak and not in good health after having worked too hard, etc.衰弱；虚弱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m feeling a bit run-down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得有点虚弱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUNDOWN at RUN DOWN STH,RUN STH DOWN STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'down sth </b><br>if a liquid <b>runs down</b> a surface,it flows downwards over it沿……流下；淌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tears were running down his cheeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他泪流满面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'down sth; ,run sth 'down sth </b><br>to look quickly at a list; to quickly read and mention the items on it快速浏览；迅速读到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her eyes ran down the figures on the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她浏览了一下这一页的数字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran her eyes down the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她迅速浏览了这一页。</font><br>to pass, or to make sth pass, downwards over a surface﹙使﹚沿……向下移动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran her finger down the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用手指往下抹了抹那一页。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'rundown (&b{on/of sth</b>) <i>n </i>}<br>[usually sing.] an explanation or a description of sth解释； 要略；综述:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can give you a brief rundown on each of the job applicants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以给你简单介绍一下每位求职者的情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We would like a full rundown on the progress of the project so far.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们想详细了解这个项目至今为止的进展情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUNDOWN at RUN DOWN,RUN STH DOWN<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb/sth 'down </b><br>(of a vehicle or its driver车辆或司机) to hit a person or an animal and knock them/it to the ground把……撞倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cyclist was run down by a lorry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骑自行车的人被一辆货车撞倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You nearly ran down that pedestrian.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你差点撞了那个行人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sb down;knock sb over</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The officer challenged the thief and tried to make the car stop, but the driver ran him down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察命令窃贼停下并试图拦住汽车，可司机开车撞了他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  RUN SB/STH OVER<br>to criticize sb/sth in an unkind way恶意批评；说……的坏话；贬低:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always running her husband down in front of their friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是当着朋友的面说丈夫不好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>disparage sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUN YOURSELF DOWN<br>to find sb/sth after looking for a long time﹙长时间搜寻后﹚找到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I finally ran the book down in the college library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我终于在大学图书馆找到了这本书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>track sb/sth down;trace sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run yourself 'down </b><br>to criticize yourself, often unfairly自责；自我贬低:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re always running yourself down! </font></i><br><font <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to visit sb for a short time in an informal way; to go somewhere quickly on your way to somewhere else顺便探望﹙某人﹚；串门子；顺路去﹙某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll run in on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家时顺便去看看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you run into the dry-cleaner’s on your way to work? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你上班时顺路到乾洗店去一下好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb 'in </b><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>informal</i>) to arrest sb and take them to a police station把某人扭送警察局:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was run in for shoplifting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因为到商店里偷东西被抓到局子里了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run-in <i>n </i></b><br>(<b>with sb</b>) (<i>informal</i>) an argument or a quarrel争吵；争论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had a run-in with my mum this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚和我妈妈吵了一架。</font><br>(<i>also </i><b>'run-up</b>) (<b>to sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) a period of preparation just before an event takes place﹙活动等的﹚准备阶段； 酿期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the final run-in to the World Cup </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 世界杯预赛</font><br>the action of approaching sth or the distance you cover靠拢； 接近；接近的距离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the final run-in to the target </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向目标的最后靠拢</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb 'in; ,run sb 'into sth/…</b><br>to take sb by car to the centre of town, <b>'run into sth </b><br>to meet or enter an area of bad weather while travelling途中遭遇﹙ 恶劣天气﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We ran into a patch of thick fog just outside the [OBJ]<b>trouble,difficulties,problems,opposition</b><br>to reach a particular level or amount达到﹙某水平或数量﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill will run into hundreds of pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 账单将高达几百英镑。</font><br>if things <b>run into</b> each other, or sth <b>runs into</b> sth else, they join so that they can only be separated with difficulty相互连接；纠缠不清:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to explain, but my words all ran into each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我试图解释，然而却越说越乱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb 'into sth=RUN SB IN,RUN SB INTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run sth into sb/sth =RUN INTO thief ran off down a side street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小偷从小巷逃跑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran off laughing.</font></i><br><font TOGETHER <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'off; ,run 'off sth </b><br>if a road, path, etc. <b>runs off</b> or <b>runs off</b> a place, it leads away from sb/sth从……流出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water runs off the fields into the valley.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水从地里流进了峡谷。</font><br><i><font  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run-off <i>n </i></b><br>[C] (<i>technical</i>) rain, water or other liquid that runs off land and into rivers, etc.﹙雨、水或其他液体的﹚径流，径流量<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'off sth; ,run sth 'off sth</b><br>(of a machine,etc.机器等) to use a particular type of power in order to operate a machine以……为动力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The outboard motor runs off an ordinary car battery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 舷外发动机以一个普通汽车蓄电池来推动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUN ON STH,RUN STH ON STH <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sth 'off </b><br>to produce copies of a piece of writing, etc. on a machine﹙用机器﹚复印，复制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran off hundreds of copies of the leaflet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们复印了几百张传单。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you run these letters off for me? 给我把这些信复印出来好吗？</font></i><br>In informal spoken language <b>run sb off sth</b> and <b>run sb sth off</b> are also used.非正式口语也说<b>run sb off sth</b> 和<b>run sb sth off</b> :<br><i><font now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在就给你复印一份。</font><br>to produce sth that is usually difficult to write,such as a poem, speech, etc. quickly and color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stop here, you run on ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在这儿打住了，你接着往前跑吧。</font><br>to continue longer than is necessary or expected拖延:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want the meeting to run on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想延长会议。</font><br>(<b>about sth</b>) (<i>especially AmE</i>) to continue talking for a long time about unimportant things没完没了地唠叨；不停地囉嗦:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She does tend to run on! </font></i><br><font The road runs on into the desert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条路一直通往沙漠。</font><br>(of a line of text文字的行) to continue into the next line延续到下一行:<br><i><font
