on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run on sth </b><br>if your thoughts etc. <b>run on</b> a particular subject, you think or talk about it a lot﹙思想等﹚以…为中心，围绕:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her thoughts kept running on their last meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不断地回味着他们上次的会面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run on sth;'run sth on sth </b><br>to use a particular type of power or fuel to make a machine or a vehicle work用﹙某种动力或燃料﹚使运转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can run the car on any type of unleaded petrol.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆汽车可使用任何类型的无铅汽油做燃料。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also </i>RUN OFF STH,RUN STH OFF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'out </b><br>if a supply of sth <b>runs out</b>, it is finished or used up用完；耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to keep travelling until my money runs out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要一直旅行到钱花光为止。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to eat quickly as time is running out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间不多了，我们必须快点吃。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One day his luck will run out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总有一天他会不再这么幸运的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My patience with her suddenly ran out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我突然对她失去了耐心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>money,petrol,time,luck,patience </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,run 'out of sth</b>) if a person or a machine <b>runs out</b> of a supply of sth, they finish it or use it all up﹙人或机器﹚用完……，耗尽……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re running out of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们快把钱花光了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you get some more milk? We’ve run out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再拿点奶来好吗？我们喝完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve run out of patience with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对她失去耐心了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve run out of space on the disk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的磁盘没有空间了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band seems to have run out of ideas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队似乎江郎才尽了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money,ideas,petrol,patience,time </b><br>if a contract or other legal document<b>runs out</b>, it is no longer valid﹙合同等法律文件﹚失效，过期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His contract with the club runs out at the end of the season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和俱乐部的合同这个季度末到期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>expire <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp ,run out of 'steam (<i>informal</i>)<br>to have less energy and enthusiasm and stop doing sth or do it less well泄气；热情冷却:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran out of steam halfway up the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爬到半山腰就累趴下了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The campaign seems to have run out of steam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场运动似乎大势已去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb 'out; ,run sb 'out of sth/…</b><br>(<i>especially AmE</i>) to force sb to leave a place使……离开；把……赶走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He vowed to run them out of town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发誓把他们赶出这座城。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb 'out; ,run yourself 'out</b><br>(in cricket, etc.板球等) to make a player end their turn at hitting the ball by throwing the ball so that it hits the set of upright sticks, (the <b>wicket</b> ), while they are still running将﹙正在跑的击球员﹚截杀出局:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was run out for 73.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以73分被截杀出局。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'out on sb </b><br>to leave sb that you live or work with, especially when they need your help弃某人而去；抛弃某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran out on him as soon as things got difficult.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 情况一变得艰难她就离他而去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'over </b><br>if a container or the liquid in it <b>runs over</b>, the liquid flows out of it over the edge溢出；潽出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let the bath run over! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让浴缸的水满出来！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tea ran over into the saucer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茶水溢到了茶碟上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>overflow </b><br>to continue longer than expected or planned拖延；超出时间:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve already run over so let’s try to end the meeting soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经超过时间了，抓紧点把会开完吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'over sb/sth; ,run sth 'over sb/sth </b><br>to move over a surface; to make sth do this﹙使﹚在表面经过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I let the cold water run over me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把凉水浇在身上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran her eye over the figures on the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她浏览了那一页上的数字。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'over sth </b><br>to read through or think about sth quickly; to practise sth快速阅读﹙ 或思索﹚；练习:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s run over the plans again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们再把计划很快地过一遍吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran over the possibilities in my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在脑子里合计了一下这些可能性。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go over sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sb/sth 'over</b><br>(of a vehicle or its driver车辆或司机) to knock a person or an animal down and often pass over their body or part of it撞倒并碾过﹙人或动物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two children were run over by a truck and killed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名儿童被一辆卡车轧死了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran over a cat last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨晚轧了一只猫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You nearly ran me over! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你差点轧了我！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sb over</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> RUN SB/STH DOWN 1 <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sth 'past sb <i>(informal</i>)=RUN STH BY/PAST SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'round; ,run 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=RUN AROUND,RUN AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'round after sb <i>(BrE</i>)=RUN AROUND AFTER SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'through sb/sth </b><br>if a feeling <b>runs through</b> sb/sth, it passes quickly through them/it﹙感觉﹚迅速传遍，快速穿过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A thrill of excitement ran through her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一阵兴奋传遍了她的全身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt a tremor run through his body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到他全身一阵颤抖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An angry murmur ran through the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愤怒的抱怨声在人群中迅速蔓延。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>tremor,shiver,shudder,fear,relief</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'through sth</b><br>to be present in every part of sth遍布:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a common theme running through all of her novels.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一个共同主题贯穿她所有的小说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The English title picks up a thread running through the film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英文标题和贯穿影片的线索相呼应。</font><br>to discuss, examine or read sth quickly匆匆讨论﹙或检查﹚；快速阅读:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran through his check list one more time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他再浏览了一下清单。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you run through some of these figures with me? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和我一起核对一下这里的一些数据好吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She mentally ran through the list of who to invite.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在脑子里匆匆过了一遍邀请来宾的名单。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s run through what I’m meant to do again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们再来简要讨论一下我要做的事好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go through sth </b><br>to perform, act or practise sth表演；扮演；排练:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could we run through Act 3 again, please? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请大家再来排练一下第3幕好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go through sth</b><br><i>(informal</i>)to use up or spend money carelessly挥霍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran through a lot of money in her first year at college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她上大学的第一年花了很多钱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go through sth</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That scene’s been run through plenty of times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那一幕排练了很多次。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run-through <i>n </i></b><br>a practice for an event or a performance连排； 试演:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re having the main technical run-through of the play tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今晚进行这部戏的主要技术连排。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run to sb </b><br>to go to sb for help, advice, protection,etc.向某人寻求帮助﹙或建议、保护等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you get hurt, don’t come running to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是伤害到自己，可别来找我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run to sth </b><br>to reach the amount, or size mentioned,especially a large one达到，有﹙某一数量或规模﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The total cost runs to hundreds of pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全部费用达到几百英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The report already runs to 800 pages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报告已经长达800 页。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) (<i>often used in negative sentences and with can </i>常与can一起用于否定句) if a person or their money can <b>run to sth</b>, they have enough money to pay for it有足够……的钱；足够……之用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We couldn’t quite run to private education for the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的钱不太够让孩子接受私立桝育。</font><br>if your taste or your mind, etc. <b>runs to</b> sth, you enjoy it or can do it喜好； 能做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His taste in music runs to pop and jazz, but that’s about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的音乐爱好仅限于流行音乐和爵士乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'up </b><br>to move quickly towards sb/sth快速朝……移动；跑向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran up to me, smiling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向我跑来，脸上带着微笑。</font><br>(in cricket and other sports板球和其他体育运动) to run in order to gain speed before you throw a ball, jump a long distance, etc.助跑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gough is now running up to bowl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高夫正在助跑投球。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'run-up <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>) </b><br><i>(sport</i>) the act of running or the distance you run in order to gain speed before you throw a ball, jump a long distance, etc.助跑；助跑距离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took a run-up and kicked the ball.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她通过助跑踢球。</font><br><i>(also </i><b> 'run-in</b> <i>less frequent</i>) (<b>to sth</b> ) the period of preparation before an important event﹙ 重大活动的﹚准备阶段； 酿期:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s been training hard in the run-up to the big competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在大赛前的这段时间里刻苦训练。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the run-up to the election </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 选举前夕</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run sth 'up </b><br>to allow a bill, debt, etc. to reach a large total积欠﹙账单、债务等﹚；累积:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I ran up a few debts while I was abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出国期间欠下了几笔债。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s run up a huge bill on his credit card.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在信用卡上积欠了一大笔账。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bill,debts,overdraft </b><br>(for sb) to make sth very quickly, especially an item of clothing赶制﹙尤指衣服﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll run up some new dresses for the girls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要给女孩们赶制一些新连衣裙。</font><br>In informal spoken language <b>run sb up sth</b> and,less often, <b>run sb sth up</b> can also be used.非正式口语也可以说<b>run sb up sth</b> ，有时说<b>run sb sth up</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you run me up some curtains/run me some curtains up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请帮我赶制几块窗帘好吗？</font><br>to raise sth, especially a flag竖起，升起﹙ 旗帜﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran up a white flag and surrendered.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们打出白旗投降。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>flag </b><br>to achieve sth取得；获得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team have run up their best victory yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队获得了到现时为止他们最大的胜利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>victory, results</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,run 'up against sb/sth </b><br>to experience a difficulty or a problem遭遇，经历﹙困难或问题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The project keeps running up against the problem of lack of funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个项目不断地遇到缺乏资金的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In this round, he will run up against the previous year’s champion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在这一轮将和去年的冠军交手。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problems</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come up against sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
rush	<h3>rush<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush a'round; ,rush a'round sth<i>(BrE also</i> ,rush a'bout/ 'round, ,rush a'bout/ 'round sth) </b><br>to move very quickly from place to place, being very busy忙个不停:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been rushing around all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我整整一天忙得团团转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He rushed about the room tidying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跑来跑去收拾着房间。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run around,run around sth;tear around, tear around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush 'in </b><br>to do or decide sth very quickly, often without thinking about it for long enough贸然行事；仓促决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s very wary of rushing in and making changes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他十分慎重， 不肯贸然改变。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp fools rush in (where angels fear to tread) <br>used to say that people with little experience will try to do the difficult or dangerous things that people with more experience would not do无知者无畏<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush 'into sth; ,rush 'into doing sth; ,rush sb 'into doing sth </b><br>to do or decide sth quickly without thinking about it carefully; to make sb do this﹙使﹚贸然行事，仓促决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t go rushing into anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要贸然采取任何行动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn’t rush into getting married.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不应该仓促结婚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won’t be rushed into a decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不会迫于仓卒作决定的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let anyone rush you into accepting the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要受任何人的影响以致匆匆接受那份工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush 'off </b><br>to leave quickly迅速离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t rush off, I haven’t finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别忙着走，我还没说完呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush sth 'out </b><br>to produce sth very quickly仓促生产；赶制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They rushed out the posters in time for the festival.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们及时为庆祝活动赶制出海报。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was rushed out by the publishers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出版商匆匆发行了这本书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush 'round; ,rush 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=RUSH AROUND,RUSH AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rush sth 'through; ,rush sth 'through sth</b><br>to make sth become official policy, etc. much quicker than normal赶快通过﹙ 使成为政策等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The legislation has been rushed through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条法规匆匆通过了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They rushed the bill through Parliament.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们使议案在议会仓促通过。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bill,legislation</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
rustle	<h3>rustle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,rustle sb/sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to prepare or provide sth for sb very quickly without planning; to find sb very quickly仓促准备﹙或提供﹚；迅速找到﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll rustle up some lunch up for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给你马上弄些午饭来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I rustled up a few helpers to hand out leaflets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我仓促拉了几个帮手来分发传单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

saddle	<h3>saddle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,saddle 'up; ,saddle sth 'up</b><br>to prepare to ride a horse by placing a leather seat (a <b>saddle</b> ) on it给﹙马﹚备鞍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you saddled up the horses yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给马套好鞍了吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Saddle up, we’re leaving right away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 备鞍，我们马上就走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>horse</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'saddle sb/yourself with sb/sth;'saddle sb/yourself with doing sth </b><br>to give sb/yourself a difficult or unpleasant task or responsibility to deal with使某人﹙或自己﹚担负重活儿﹙或讨厌的工作、责任﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been saddled with my brother’s kids for the weekend }(= I have to take care of them)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这个周末要照看我哥哥的孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had saddled himself with huge debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他背上了巨大的债务</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been saddled with organizing the conference.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我被指派担当组织会议的繁杂任务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>land sb/yourself with sb/sth,land sb/yourself with doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

,scare it, him, etc. 'up <i>(AmE</i>,<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to find sb/sth or to make sth by using whatever is available﹙就现有材料﹚勉强凑合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll see if I can scare up enough chairs for us all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来看看能不能给大家凑够椅子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll try to scare up some friends to come and help us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我尽量拉些朋友来帮帮忙。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

,scrape 'into sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to manage to get a job, a position, a place at college, etc., but with difficulty勉强获得﹙工作、职位、入学资格等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just managed to scrape into university.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我勉强升入了大学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scraped in with 180 votes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以180票勉强当选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our team just scraped into the semi-finals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的队勉强挤进半决赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,scrape sth 'off; ,scrape sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sth from a surface by moving sth sharp and hard like a knife across it﹙ 用刀子等﹚刮掉，削去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spent all day scraping paint off the walls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一整天都在刮墙壁上的漆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,scrape sth 'out </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,scrape sth 'out of sth</b>) to remove sth from the inside of sth else using sth sharp and hard like a knife﹙ 用刀子等从…﹚挖出，掘出…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I scraped all the seeds out of the melon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把瓜里的籽都挖了出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He scraped out the bowl }(= removed everything from it) &b{with a teaspoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用茶匙把碗刮乾净了。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to just manage to make enough money to live只挣得煳口的钱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>scraped out a living</b> by drawing cartoons for local newspapers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他靠给当地的报纸画漫画勉强度日。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>living,existence</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv1 }also&b{ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,scrape 'through; ,scrape 'through sth </b><br>to succeed with difficulty in doing sth, especially in passing an exam艰难完成；勉强通过﹙考试﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I might scrape through (<i>the exam</i>) if I’m lucky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是走运的话，我也许可以勉强及格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She just scraped through law school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她勉强从法学院毕业。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>exam</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,scrape sth to'gether (<i>also</i> ,scrape sth 'up <i>less frequent</i>) </b><br>to obtain or collect sth such as an amount of money with difficulty勉强凑集；费力聚拢； 艰难筹措:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They managed to scrape together $1 200 and printed 3 000 copies of the comic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们勉强凑了1 200 元印了3 000 份连环画册。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We <b>scraped up enough money</b> to buy a small car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们好不容易才凑够钱买辆小汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll go and see about lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去安排一下午餐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must see about getting without a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把她送到家之后，他一句话都没说就开车走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SEE SB/YOURSELF OUT,SEE SB/YOURSELF OUT OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp seize	<h3>seize<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'seize on sth (<i>also</i> 'seize upon sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to suddenly show a lot of interest in sth, especially because you can use it to your advantage突然大为关注，抓住﹙可利用的事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scandal was immediately seized upon by the press.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 报章立即对这件丑闻抓住不放。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peter seized eagerly on all opportunities for conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彼得逮谁跟谁聊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pounce on sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,seize 'up </b><br>if a machine or a part of a machine<b>seizes up</b>, it stops moving or working correctly﹙机器或部件﹚停止运转，发生故障:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine seized up after only three weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发动机只用了三个星期就坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) The whole city seized up (}= no traffic, etc. was able to move&b{) during the blizzard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雪期间全市陷于瘫痪。</font><br>if a part of your body <b>seizes up</b>, it becomes stiff and you are unable to move it easily﹙身体部位﹚发僵:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My legs were beginning to seize up and I needed a rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我腿麻了，需要休息一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
sell	<h3>sell<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sell sth 'off </b><br>to sell all or part of an industry, a company or a piece of land售出，卖掉﹙产业、公司或土地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unwanted land next to the farm was sold off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农场附近闲置的那片地给卖掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cheaply because you no longer want them or because you need the money甩卖；抛售；变卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The store is selling off the old stock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家商店正在折卖旧存货。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The family silver was sold off to pay the debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 家里的银器被变卖来还债。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sell-off <i>n</i> (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>the sale by the government of an industry or a service to individual people or private companies﹙国有企业的﹚出售；私有化:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the proposed sell-off of the rail company </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp of shares in a company, after which their value usually falls﹙公司证券的﹚抛售<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sell sth 'on (to sb)</b><br>to sell sth to sb else that you have bought not long before, usually in order to make a profit转卖；倒卖；倒手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She managed the business for a year and then sold it on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把公司经营了一年，然后转卖了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'sold on sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to be convinced that sth is very good相信…很好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I could see she was sold on the idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看得出她非常赞同这个主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not really sold on American music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并不怎么喜欢美国音乐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>idea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sell 'out;be ,sold 'out</b><br>if tickets for a concert,a game, etc. <b>sell out</b> or are <b>sold out</b>, they are all sold and there are none left﹙门票等﹚售光，卖完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tickets for the game will sell out quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场比赛的门票很快就会卖光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tonight’s performance is completely sold out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚演出的门票全部售完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first 5 000 copies of the book have sold out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书首次印刷的5 000 册已经卖完了。</font><br>(<i>also</i> ,sell 'out of sth,be ,sold 'out of sth) if sb <b>sells out</b> of sth or is <b>sold out</b> of sth,they have sold all of it and have nothing left售空；卖光；脱销:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sorry, we’ve sold out of milk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抱歉， 我们的牛奶卖完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are already sold out for tonight’s concert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经把今晚的音乐会门票卖光了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ be+v+adv2 }also&b{ v+adv+prep ◆ be+v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sell-out <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] a play, concert, etc.for which all the tickets have been sold满座的演出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gig is a sell-out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次演奏会座无虚席。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a sell-out tour/crowd </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 场场爆满的巡迴演出/观众</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SELL-OUT }at&b{ SELL OUT (TO SB/STH)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sell 'out (to sb/sth) (<i>disapproving</i>) </b><br>to ignore or change your principles or beliefs, especially to gain an advantage for yourself背弃﹙原则、信念等﹚；背叛… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rest of the gang accused him of selling out to the law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个团伙的其他人指责他告发了他们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a talented British movie director who’s sold out to Hollywood </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一位卖身到好莱坞的有才华的英国电影导演</font><br>to sell your business or a part of your business出售﹙ 财产、企业等﹚:<br><i><font <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] a situation in which sb betrays sb who trusted them, by not doing sth that they promised to do, or by doing sth that they promised not to do背叛；出卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a dreadful sell-out of their cause </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对他们事业的严重背叛</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The deal was seen as a work卖光﹙家当、企业等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sold up and moved to France.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把家卖了，移居到法国。</font><br><i><font send	<h3>send<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,send sb/sth a'head </b><br>to arrange for sb/sth to go or be taken to the place you are going to, before you arrive there提前运送某人﹙或物﹚；派某人打头阵:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rest of the equipment was sent ahead by air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 记者都被要求离开，空手而回。</font><br>(to…) to arrange for sb to go somewhere away from home安排某人离开家﹙去某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sent away to boarding school at the age of 那些人被派出去找水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n2 v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sending-'off <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>) (in a sports game 体育运动) a situation when a player separate	<h3>separate<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,separate sth 'off (from sth)</b><br>to remove sth from a larger thing or group; to keep sth apart使﹙从…﹚分出；使分离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The property agency has been separated off from the main business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房地产经销处从主公司分离出来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,separate 'out; ,separate sb/sth 'out (from sth)</b><br>to divide into different parts; to divide sb/sth into different parts or groups﹙使﹚分开；划分:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mixture separates out into layers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 混合物分出了层次。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Plastics must be separated out into different types for recycling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回收塑料必须先行分类。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to separate out fact from speculation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得把事实和猜测加以区分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The process separates out the different gases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个过程可将各种气体分离出来。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Separate</b> and <b>separate sb/sth</b> can also be used with this meaning. <b>separate</b>和<b>separate sb/sth</b> 也可作此义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
serve	<h3>serve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'serve as/for sth </b><br>to be used instead of sth else when there is nothing better available权且用作；凑合着当…用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An old box served as a table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时就用一个旧箱子凑合着充当桌子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Small temporary buildings had to serve for offices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狭小的临时建筑权且作办公室用。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>act as sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'serve sth on sb (<i>also</i> 'serve sth upon sb <i>more formal</i>); 'serve sb with sth <i>(law</i>)</b><br>to give or send sb an official document, especially one that orders them to appear in a court of law将传票﹙等﹚送达某人；给某人发出传票﹙等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police have served a summons on Mr Jackson.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方已向杰克逊先生发传票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police have served him with a summons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方已经把传票送交给他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>summons,notice,writ</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,serve sth 'out </b><br>to continue doing sth until the end of a fixed period of time直至期满:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She served out the rest of her sentence in an open prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在一座开放式监狱服满了刑期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>notice,sentence,term</b><br>[NOTE]In this meaning<b>serve sth out</b> cannot be used in the passive.<b>serve sth out</b>作此义时不用于被动语态。<br><i>(especially BrE</i>)=SERVE STH UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,serve sth 'up </b><br>(<i>also</i> ,serve sth 'out <i>especially BrE</i>)<br>to put food onto plates and give it to people端上﹙ 食物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He served up a delicious meal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他端上一顿可口的饭菜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dish sth out;dish up,dish sth up </b><br><i>(disapproving</i>) to give or offer sth给出；提供:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the TV channels served up the usual old movies during the holidays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假期时所有电视频道都播放老掉牙的影片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,serve sth u'pon sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'serve sb with sth</b><br>\n
set	<h3>set<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>set about sb (with sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>old-fashioned</i>) </b><br>to attack sb袭击；攻击；抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set about me with a stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用棍子打我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set about sth;'set about doing sth </b><br>tobegin a task or an activity, especially withenergy or enthusiasm开始进行；开展﹙活动等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We set about the task of cleaning the apartment. </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们动手打扫起公寓来。</font><br>to approach aproblem or task in a particular way着手处理﹙问题﹚；展开﹙工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve set about this problem the wrong way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你处理这个问题的方式错了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How should I set about finding a job? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我该怎样着手找工作呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go about sth,go about doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb a'gainst sb </b><br>to make sb oppose a friend,relative, etc.使某人反对﹙朋友、亲人等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The civil war set brother against brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 内战造成骨肉相残。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth a'gainst sth </b><br>to consider sth by comparing good points with bad ones权衡利弊﹙或优缺点﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Set against the benefits of the new technology is the possibility that jobs will be lost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 权衡利弊，新技术的确有种种好处，但亦可能使一些人失去工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>balance A against B</b><br>(<i>also</i> ,<b>set sth 'off against sth</b>) (<i>finance</i>) to record sth as a business cost as a way of reducing the amount of tax you must pay把… 按营业成本记账以降低﹙税额﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cost of looking for oil can be set against tax as business expenditure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 寻找石油的成本可按营业支出记账以减税。</font><br><b>be set against sth</b> if sth is <b>set against</b> sth else, it is placed near it or next to it so that the difference between the two is very noticeable与……形成对比；以…为衬托:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp views of rocky islands set against fiery sunsets </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 石矶岛和火红的落日交相辉映的景色</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Set against her white dress, her hair seemed even darker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 白色的连衣裙把她的头发衬得更黑了。</font><br><b>be set against sth</b> if a story, a film/movie, etc. is <b>set against</b> a particular time, event or place, the action happens at that time or place﹙故事、电影等﹚以…为背景，发生在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is a love story set against a backdrop of rural Irish life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个以爱尔兰乡村生活为背景的爱情故事。</font><br>[NOTE]In meanings 3 and 4 <b>set sth against sth</b> is only used in the passive . <b>set sth against sth</b>作第3及第4义时只用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 ,2 v+n/pron+prep3 ,4 be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth a'head (<i>AmE</i>) </b><br>to change a clock or watch to show the correct later time把﹙钟表﹚拨快:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget to set your clocks ahead tonight }(=because the time has officially changed)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚别忘了把时钟拨快。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>clock,watch</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth forward <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>set sth back <i>(AmE</i>), put sth back <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb/sth a'part (from sb/sth) </b><br>to make sb/sth different from or better than others使某人﹙或事物﹚与其他的不同；使突出；使优于﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His confidence sets him apart from his classmates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的自信心使他有别于同班同学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s the service at the restaurant that sets it apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家餐馆的服务独具特色。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth a'part <i>(BrE</i>) (<i>also </i>,set sth aside <i>AmE</i>,<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to keep sth such as money or time for a special use or purpose留出金钱﹙或时间等﹚；拨出﹙专用﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A room was set apart for quiet reading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留出了一个房间作为安静的读书室。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth a'side</b><br>to place sth to one side把…放到一旁﹙或搁到一边﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I set her letter aside, meaning to read it later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把她的信放在一边等以后读。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth aside</b><br>to save or keep sth for a particular purpose省出；留出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sets aside ￡50 every month for her daughter’s college fees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她每月省出50 英镑作为女儿上大学的学费。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to set aside some time to deal with this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得抽点时间处理这事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money,time</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth aside </b><br>to ignore sth such as your feelings or opinions, because other things are important暂时不考虑﹙或放一放﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We decided to set our differences aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决定把我们的分歧放到一边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s set aside my personal feelings for now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 目前咱们就不要顾及我的个人感情了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth aside </b><br>4=SET STH APART<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Restaurants must set aside an area for nonsmokers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 餐馆必须留出禁烟区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>area,room</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth aside </b><br><i>(law</i>) to reject a previous decision made by a court of law撤销，驳回﹙法庭判决﹚；宣布无效:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The verdict was set aside by the Appeal Court.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上诉法庭驳回了那个裁决。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>decision,conviction</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>overturn sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set-aside <i>n </i></b><br>[U] a system in which the government pays farmers not to use some of their land for growing crops; the land that the farmers are paid not to use退耕补贴制度，退耕地﹙由政府补贴，鼓励农民退耕部份耕地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 750 acres of setaside</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  750 英亩的退耕土地</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb 'back sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to cost sb a large amount of money使某人花费…；使破费:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That new car must have set her back a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新汽车一定让她破费了一笔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This watch set me back ￡200.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只表花了我200 英镑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>knock sb back sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb/sth 'back </b><br>to delay the progress of sb/sth耽搁某人﹙或事物﹚的进展；耽误；使延误:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain set the building programme back by several weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 建筑计划因雨延误了几周。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was starting to play very well, but his injury has really set him back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正开始表现非常好，但受伤着实把他耽误了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'setback <i>n </i></b><br>a problem or difficulty that delays the progress of sb/sth挫折； 障碍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parry’s broken ankle was a major setback for the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帕里脚腕受伤对于这个队是一大打击。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth 'back <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to change a clock or watch to show the correct earlier time把﹙钟表﹚拨慢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I forgot to set my watch back last night }(= when the time officially changed)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我昨晚忘记把手表拨慢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>clock,watch</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth back <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>put sth forward <i>(BrE</i>), set sth ahead <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,set 'back (from sth) </b><br>if a building is <b>set back</b>,it is a long way from sth, especially a road﹙建筑物﹚远离﹙公路等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their house is the only one that’s set back ( from the road) .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有他们的房子是远离公路的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'down; ,set sth 'down </b><br>(of a plane, a pilot,passengers, etc.飞机、飞行员、乘客等) to land着陆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We set down on the beach.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在沙滩上着陆了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot tried to set the plane down in a field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞行员试图把飞机降落在一块田里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put down <i>(especially BrE</i>) land,land sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb 'down <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>(of a vehicle or its driver车辆或驾驶员) to stop and allow sb to get off/out让人下车；停车谢客:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The taxi set me down at the end of the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出租车在路尽头让我下了车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop sb/sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>pick sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth 'down </b><br>(<b>on sth</b>) (<i>literary</i>) to place an object down on a surface放下；搁下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set his glass down before he spoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他放下玻璃杯开始说话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She made space so that I could set the tray down on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她腾出地方让我把托盘放在桌子上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth down</b><br>to write sth down on paper in order to record it写下；记下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wanted to set my thoughts down on paper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想把自己的想法写下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a good idea to set down your complaint in writing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以书面形式投诉是个好主意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth down </b><br>to give sth as a rule,etc.制定﹙规则、原则等﹚；规定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to set down guidelines/rules </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 制定指导方针/规则</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp qualifying standards set down by the Athletics Association</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由运动员协会制订的资格标准</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 ,2 v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n3 v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'forth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to start a journey出发；动身；启程:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They set forth for Crete.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们动身前往克里特岛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set out <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'forth sth; ,set it/them 'forth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to state sth clearly; to make sth known明确陈述；阐明:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President set forth his views in a long television broadcast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统在一次很长的电视讲话中阐述了自己的观点。</font><br>This phrasal verb can be used in the passive.这个短语动词可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her beliefs have been clearly set forth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已经表明自己的信念。</font><br>A noun must always follow <b>forth</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>forth</b> .名词必须放在<b>forth</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>forth</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'in </b><br>if bad weather, an unpleasant feeling, an illness, etc. <b>sets in</b>, it begins and seems likely to continue﹙恶劣天气、不快感觉、疾病等﹚到来，开始:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to mend the roof before winter sets in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冬天到来之前我得把屋顶修好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Panic set in when she realized how much work there was to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她意识到有那么多活儿要干就一下子慌了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He eventually agreed to stay in bed, but it was too late — pneumonia had set in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他终于同意卧床，可是太晚了──他患上了肺炎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>panic,winter</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp the 'rot set in <br>used to describe the fact that a situation has become very bad and will continue like that每况愈下；形势恶化:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had problems at her first school, but when she changed schools the rot really set in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在第一所学校学习就不好，然而转学后更每况愈下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth 'in/ 'into sth </b><br>to fix sth in a space so that it does not stick out beyond the surface把…装进﹙或镶入…中﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A small safe had been set into the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 墙壁里安装了个小保险箱。</font><br><b>Set sth in/into sth</b> is usually used in the passive.<b>set sth in/into sth</b>通常用于被动语态。<br>The verb <b>inset sth</b> has a similar meaning.动词<b>inset sth</b> 表达相近含义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'inset <i>n </i></b><br>a small picture, map, etc. inside a larger one﹙套印在大图片、地图等中的﹚小图，小地图:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Brad Pitt at the premiere, and his wife (inset) }(= about a photograph in a newspaper&b{) </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首次公演时的布雷德·皮特，以及他的妻子﹙插图﹚</font><br>a piece of material, a small stone,etc. that is added on to sth else or put inside sth else嵌入物；附加物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a silver brooch with ruby insets </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 镶嵌红宝石的银胸针</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'off </b><br>to begin a journey出发；动身；启程:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I set off for work at seven.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我七点钟动身上班。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check your oil before setting off on a long journey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 长途旅行出发前要检查一下燃油。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When are you planning to set off? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你准备何时出发？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb 'off; ,set sb 'off doing sth <i>(informal</i>,<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make sb start doing sth such as laughing, crying or talking使……笑起来﹙或哭起来、说起话来﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those photos always set her off (crying).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她每次看那些照片就哭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just seeing him laughing sets me off! }(= makes me start laughing&b{)</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看到他笑我忍不住也笑了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>start sb off,start sb off doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth 'off </b><br>to make a bomb, etc. explode使﹙ 炸弹等﹚ 爆炸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to set off fireworks </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放烟火</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They set the bomb off as soon as they were a safe distance away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一退到安全距离就引爆了炸弹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bomb,firework </b><br>to make an alarm (=a loud warning noise or signal) start使﹙警报﹚响起；拉响﹙警报﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burglars set the alarm off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼弄响了警报。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you burn the toast you’ll set the smoke alarm off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 麵包片如果烤焦，烟雾警报就会响起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>alarm </b><br>to start a process or series of events引发；激起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news set off a wave of panic on world markets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这则消息引发了全球市场的一阵恐慌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl’s death set off a terrible chain of events.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 女孩的死牵扯出一连串可怕的事件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>panic,chain/series of events</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SET STH UP 4 <br>to make sth appear more attractive by being placed near it衬托；使显得更突出﹙或更漂亮﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That scarf sets off the blue of her eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 围巾衬托出她的蓝眼睛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 ,2 v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n3 ,4 v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sth 'off against sth=SET STH AGAINST STH 2</b><br>The verb <b>offset sth</b> (<b>against sth</b> ) has a similar meaning.动词<b>offset sth</b> (<b>against sth</b> )表达相近含义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are certain expenses that you can offset against tax.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 某些支出可以获得税项减免。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set on/upon sb <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to attack sb攻击；袭击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was set upon by a gang of youths.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我遭到一伙青年袭击。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set sb/sth on sb </b><br>to make a person or an animal attack sb使…攻击﹙或袭击﹚某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmer threatened to set his dogs on us if we didn’t leave at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农夫威胁说，如果我们不马上离开，他就放狗咬我们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'out </b><br>to leave a place and begin a journey,especially a long journey出发，动身，启程﹙尤指长途旅行﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They set out on the last stage of their journey.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们踏上最后一段行程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We set out at dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们是拂晓时分出发的。</font><br><b>,set 'out to do sth</b> to begin to do sth with a particular aim or purpose﹙胸怀目标﹚开始工作，展开任务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She set out to break the world record.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她开始努力要打破世界纪录。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They succeeded in what they had set out to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们实现了既定的目标。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv2 }also&b{ v+adv+to inf<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'outset <i>n </i></b><br>the beginning of sth开端；开始；起点:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We knew the danger <b>at/from the answers neatly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把答案写得工整些。</font><br>to present ideas, facts, etc. in a clear, organized way,in speech or writing﹙有条理地﹚陈述，阐明:<br><i><font [OBJ]<b>terms,reasons,policies,conditions</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv2 v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'to <i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>formal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to begin doing sth in a busy or determined way起劲地干起来；毅然开始做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She set to with a scrubbing brush }(= she started cleaning)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拿起刷子起劲地擦洗。</font><br>to begin fighting开始打架:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They took off their jackets and set to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们脱掉外衣就打了起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set-'to <i>n </i>[sing.] (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>a fight or an argument打架；争吵:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a set-to with one of his workmates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和一位工友干了一架。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'up; ,set sth 'up </b><br>to make a machine, some equipment, etc. ready to use安装好，装配好，调试好﹙设备或机器﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He equipment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 花了很长时间才把所有的设备安装好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set 'up; ,set yourself 'up</b><br>to start running your own business立业；创业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He left the firm and set up in business on his own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离开了公司自己开业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She set herself up as a hairdresser.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她自己开了个理发店。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set sb 'up </b><br>to provide sb with the money they need, for example to start a business, buy a home, etc.资助，经济上扶植﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A bank loan helped to set her up in business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她靠一笔银行贷款做起了生意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set his daughter up in her own apartment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他资助女儿买了她自己的公寓。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you win tonight’s fight, you’ll <b>be set up for life</b> }(= have all the money you will ever need)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果赢了今晚的拳击比赛，这辈子就不愁没钱花了。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to trick sb, especially by making them appear to be guilty of sth that they have not done诬陷，冤枉﹙某人﹚；给某人栽﹙罪名﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He claimed he had been set up by the police.</font></i><br><font will set you up for the day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早餐吃好一天都精力充沛。</font><br>(with sb) (<i>informal</i>) to arrange for sb to meet sb so that they can have a romantic or sexual relationship介绍某人﹙ 和… ﹚ 约会；给…当红娘；为…搭桥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set me up with his sister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他介绍我和他妹妹约会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set-up <i>n </i>[usually sing.] (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>a situation in which sb tricks you or makes it seem as if you are guilty of sth that you have not done诬陷；冤枉；栽赃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t do it, this is a set-up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没干那事，这是诬陷！ </font><br>a situation when sb arranges for you to meet sb in order to begin a romantic or sexual relationship经人介绍约会:<br><i><font <b>,set sth 'up </b><br>to create sth or start a business, an organization, etc.创建；建立；开办:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She gave a talk on setting up a business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她就如何创业发表了演说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A committee was set up to investigate the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已成立委员会探讨这个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp young people <b>setting up home</b> for the first time </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 初次成家的年轻人</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,committee,system,company </b><br>to build sth or put sth somewhere架起； 设立； 设置:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police set up roadblocks on all main roads.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方在所有主要道路上设置了路障。</font><br>to organize or arrange sth;to make the arrangements for sth to happen组织；安排；策划:<br><i><font arrangements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们将安排运输。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>meeting</b><br>to start a process or a series of events引发；导致﹙一连串的事情﹚:<br><i><font reaction,chain of events</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SET STH OFF 3<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] (<i>informal</i>) the way sth is organized or arranged; a system组织；机构；建制；体制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve only been here a week so I don’t really know the set-up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来这里才一个星期，所以还不太清楚这里的组织情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SET-UP }at&b{ SET SB UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set yourself 'up=SET UP,SET YOURSELF UP</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,set yourself 'up as sth </b><br>to claim to be very important, know a lot about sth, etc.自诩为…；自夸为…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He set himself up as an authority on modern art.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自我标榜为现代艺术权威。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'set upon sb ( <i>formal</i>)=SET ON/UPON SB</b><br>\n
settle	<h3>settle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle 'down </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,settle yourself 'down</b>) to get yourself into a comfortable position when you are sitting or lying舒适地坐下﹙或躺下﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She settled down in an armchair to read.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她舒舒服服地坐在扶手椅上读书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom settled himself down at the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆舒适地坐在桌子旁边。</font><br>to start to have a calmer or quieter way of life,without many changes, especially living in one place﹙在某地﹚定居下来，过安定的生活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got married and settled down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他成了家并安定下来。</font><br>to become relaxed and confident in a new situation; to get used to a new way of life, job, etc.安顿下来；习惯于﹙新生活﹚；适应﹙新环境﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s settling down well at her new school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在新学校很习惯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just couldn’t settle down in the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就是不能适应城里的生活。</font><br>to become calmer and less active平静下来；安定下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been really busy at work, but things should settle down again soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我确实一直忙于工作，但情况很快就会再平静下来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their speed settled down to a steady fifty miles an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们减低车速，稳定在每小时五十英里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv1 }also&b{ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle 'down; ,settle sb 'down </b><br>to become or to make sb become calmer, less excited, etc.﹙使某人﹚ 安静下来， 平静下来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children finally settled down and started work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们终于安静下来开始干活了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher had trouble settling the class down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师没法让班上的同学安静下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle yourself 'down=SETTLE DOWN</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle 'down to sth (<i>also</i> 'settle to sth <i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to begin to think about sth or give your attention to doing sth开始认真对待；定下心来做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had just settled down to dinner when the phone rang.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们刚刚开始吃饭，电话铃就响了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m so worried that I can’t settle to anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忧心忡忡，做什么事都静不下心来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle for sth;'settle for doing sth </b><br>to accept sth that is not quite what you wanted but is the best that you can get将就，凑合着﹙做…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both teams were happy to settle for a draw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个队都愿意接受平局的结果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’d hoped to get ￡8 000 for the car but had to settle for a lot less.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他本想把车卖上8 000 英镑，可只得接受低得多的价格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I refuse to settle for (being) second best! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决不退而求其次！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>less</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle 'in; ,settle 'into sth </b><br>to become used to something new, such as a new home, school or job安顿下来；习惯于，适应﹙新事物或新环境﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She soon settled in at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在学校很快便习惯了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took her a while to settle into her new job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她过了一段时间才适应了新工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>routine,school,job</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle on sth (<i>also</i> 'settle upon sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to choose sth ; to make a decision about sth选定某事物；决定某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We couldn’t decide where to go but we eventually settled on Italy.我们定不下来去哪儿，可最终决定去意大利。</font></i><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>decide on/upon sth</b><br><b>Settle on/upon sth</b> can be used in the passive.<b>settle on/upon sth</b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A date was finally settled on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后敲定了日期。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle sth on/upon sb <i>(formal</i>, <i>law</i>)</b><br>to arrange to give property or money to sb, for example after your death指定把财产等授与﹙或分配给﹚某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He settled his entire estate on his son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把全部财产都传给了儿子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money,estate</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle to sth <i>(BrE</i>)=SETTLE DOWN TO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,settle 'up (with sb)</b><br>to pay sb the money you owe them﹙向某人﹚还钱；结算；结账:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to settle up with them for the hire of the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得跟他们结清房租。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll pay now — we can settle up later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来付钱吧—我们以后再算。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle upon sth=SETTLE ON STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'settle sth upon sb=SETTLE STH ON/UPON SB</b><br>\n

sb) </b><br>to try to make people pay attention to sb/sth because you are proud of them/it﹙向人﹚炫示，夸示﹙人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was showing his CD collection off to his friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在向朋友展示他所有的光盘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She brought her new boyfriend along to show him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把新男友带来炫耀一番。</font><br>to make sb/sth look attractive or seem interesting or exciting by showing their best features使﹙人或物﹚显得漂亮；使夺目；衬托:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The black sweater showed off her figure to full advantage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件黑毛衣完全衬托出她的身材。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The music shows the band off in their best light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这音乐展现了乐队最出色的一面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show sb 'out; ,show sb 'out of sth </b><br>to lead a visitor to the door out of a room, a building, etc.把﹙客人﹚送出门:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll show you out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来送送你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>show sb in,show sb into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show sb 'over sth <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to take sb around a place they are visiting and show them what is interesting带某人查看； 带某人参观:<br><i><font STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show sb 'round; ,show sb 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)= SHOW SB AROUND,SHOW SB AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show 'through; ,show 'through sth </b><br>to be visible through something or behind sth﹙从某事物中﹚ 透出， 显出， 透视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This paper is so thin the ink shows through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这纸薄得能透过墨迹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His skull showed through his thin hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的脑壳在稀疏的头发下清晰可见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he spoke, his bitterness showed through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说话时流露出内心的辛酸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to arrive or appear at the place you have arranged如约赶到；出现；露面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She finally showed up at lunchtime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午饭时分她终于赶到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I arranged to meet him but he didn’t show up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我约了和他见面，可他没来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show 'up; ,show sth 'up </b><br>to become or to make sth easy to see﹙使﹚容易看见，变得明显，显现出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His striped tie showed up well against his dark red shirt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那条纹领带在深红色的衬衫下十分醒目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Something odd has shown up on the X-ray.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp X光照片显示有些不寻常。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her lack of experience was shown up by the test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她缺乏经验，在测验中可以看出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,show sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb else feel embarrassed by behaving badly or by doing sth better than them使人难堪﹙ 或尴尬、丢脸等﹚；让人脸上下不来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said I’d shown him up in front of his friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说我弄得他在朋友面前下不了台。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You really showed me up by snoring during the concert! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在音乐会上大声打鼾， 真给我丢面子！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t worry about being shown up by the kids — they’ve always used computers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们暴露了二流球队的水平。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
shower	<h3>shower<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,shower 'down; ,shower 'down on sb/sth;'shower on sb/sth; ,shower sth 'down on sb/sth;'shower sth on sb/sth </b><br>to fall onto sb/sth, especially in a lot of small pieces﹙雨点般﹚ 落在… 上； 洒落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Volcanic ash showered down on the town after the eruption.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火山喷发之后，小城落了一层火山灰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bottle broke and showered glass fragments on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 瓶子炸了，玻璃碎片溅到我们身上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'shower sb with sth </b><br>to drop a lot of small things onto sb将… 洒向某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bride and groom were showered with rice as they left the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新娘新郎离开教堂时大家向他们身上撒大米。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The roof collapsed, showering us with dust and debris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房顶塌了，灰尘和瓦砾洒落在我们身上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He showered her with gifts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他送给她大量礼物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
shrink	<h3>shrink<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,shrink a'way/ 'back (from sb/sth) </b><br>to move backwards or away from sb/sth, especially because you are frightened or disgusted躲避﹙人或事物﹚；退避；畏缩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She shrank away from him in horror.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因恐惧而躲避他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'shrink from sth;'shrink from doing sth</b><br>(<i>often used in negative sentences </i>常用于否定句) to be unwilling to do or accept sth that you find frightening, unpleasant or immoral畏避，迴避﹙可怕、讨厌或邪恶的事情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She recognized her responsibility and did not shrink from it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她意识到自己的责任，没有退缩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He shrank from confronting his son face to face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迴避和儿子正面交锋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She never shrank from difficult tasks.她从不迴避困难的任务。</font></i><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>task,duty </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>back away from sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Shrink from sth/from doing sth</b> are usually used in written English. <b>shrink from sth/from doing sth</b>通常用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

shrug	<h3>shrug<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,shrug sth 'off </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,shrug sth a'way</b> <i>less frequent</i>) to push sth back or away with your shoulders﹙用肩﹚顶回，推走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She shrugged off her jacket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抖抖肩甩掉外衣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put her hand on his shoulder but he shrugged it away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把手搭在他的肩上，可他一甩膀子推开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>jacket,hand</b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,shrug sth a'side</b> <i>less frequent</i>)to treat sth as if it is not important不把…当回事；对…满不在乎﹙或不予理睬﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He shrugged off all the objections I raised.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把我所有的反对意见都置之不理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Barnes is trying to shrug off an ankle injury.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巴恩斯试图不去理会脚腕的伤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>injury,criticism</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
shut	<h3>shut<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,shut sb/sth a'way </b><br>to put sb/sth in a place where other people cannot see or find them/it把…藏起来；隔离；禁闭:<br><i><font in jail for a long time </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 长期监禁的犯人</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lock sb up/away;lock sth up/away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ </b><br>to deliberately separate yourself physically or socially from other people躲避﹙ 人或事物﹚ ； 离群独处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After her son died, she just wanted to shut herself off from the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿子死后，她只想遁世离群。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cut yourself off (from sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>informal</i>) to stop an opponent from scoring in a game or contest﹙比赛中﹚不让对方得分:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They shut out the Mets in their last game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在最后一局比赛中没让大都会队得分。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n1 }also&b{ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'shut-out <i>n </i>(<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>a game in which one team does not score输方得分为零的比赛<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,shut sb/sth 'out; ,shut sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>to stop sb/sth from entering a place使…不能进入﹙某处﹚；挡住；遮住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He closed the door firmly, shutting us out of the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp
