sink	<h3>sink<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sink 'back (into sth)</b><br>to move or fall backwards,or lie down, especially when you are feeling tired向后靠﹙或倒﹚﹙在…上﹚；躺下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sank back into her chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向后一仰靠在椅子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sank back against the pillows, exhausted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他筋疲力尽地靠到枕头上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sink 'in; ,sink 'into sth </b><br>(of liquids 液体) to go down into another substance渗透；渗入…中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Apply the moisturiser and let it sink in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 擦上润肤霜，让它渗进皮肤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain sank into the dry ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨水渗进了乾地里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>be absorbed (&b{into sth</b> ) }<br>(of words, etc.话语等) to be fully understood or realized被完全理解；消化；被吸收:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took a while for the news to sink in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们过了一段时间才完全明白这则消息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He paused to let his words sink into her brain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他停了一下，好让她充分领会他的意思。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>words,news,meaning</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp be 'sunk in sth <br>to be in a state of unhappiness or deep thought闷闷不乐；陷于不快﹙或沉思﹚ 中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She just sat there, sunk in thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只是坐在那儿沉思。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sink into sth </b><br>to go gradually into a less active,happy or pleasant state渐渐进入﹙消极、不快等的﹚状态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sank into a deep sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她沉沉地睡去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sank deeper into depression.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他越来越消沉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>depression</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>descend into sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sink 'into sth; ,sink sth 'into sth </b><br>to go deep into sth solid; to make sth sharp do this﹙把某物﹚插入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sharp teeth sank into his arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 锋利的牙齿刺入了他的胳膊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog sank its teeth into my leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗猛咬我的腿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sink sth 'into sth </b><br>to spend a lot of money on a business or an activity, for example in order to make money from it in the future把﹙资金﹚投入﹙企业或活动﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sank all our savings into the new company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把所有的积蓄都投进了新公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>a fortune</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>plough sth into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

sit	<h3>sit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sit a'round; ,sit a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,sit a'bout/ 'round, ,sit a'bout/ 'round sth) </b><br>to spend time sitting down doing very little无所事事地坐着；闲坐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m far too busy to sit around here all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忙得很，没空在这儿成天闲坐着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sat about talking for most of the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天我们大半上午都坐着闲聊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All we could do was sit around and wait.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们所能做的就是无聊地坐着等待。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sitting around the house chatting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们闲散地坐在屋子里聊天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sit 'back </b><br>to sit or lean comfortably in a chair舒服地坐﹙或靠在椅子上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sat back in his chair and closed his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他安稳地坐在椅子上闭上眼睛。</font><br>(and do sth) to relax, especially by not getting too involved in or anxious about sth放松精神﹙做…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now all the work’s done we can <b>sit back and</b> enjoy things! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 活儿全干完了，我们可以放松地玩了！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you going to sit back and let me do everything? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是要在一旁歇着，让我包揽所有的活儿？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sit 'by </b><br>to do nothing to stop sth bad or unpleasant happening坐视不管；无动于衷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m not going to sit by and let an innocent man go to jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会坐视一个无辜的人去坐牢的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sit 'down </b><br>to lower your body until you are sitting on a chair, sofa.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在沙发上坐下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When everyone was sitting down, he began.</font></i><br><font sth坐下来认真做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve never actually <b>sat down and</b> talked the problem through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们从来没有坐下来认真讨论过这个问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sit-down <i>n </i></b><br>[C] a strike, demonstration, protest,etc. involving people sitting down and refusing to leave a place静坐罢工﹙或示威、抗议等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to stage a sit-down</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发起静坐请愿</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a you拖延处理；积压，搁置﹙信函、报告等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve been sitting on my application for a month now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp mine(<i>informal</i>) <br>to own sth very valuable,often when you do not realize it﹙无意识地﹚坐拥财富﹙或金矿﹚，拥有珍品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His paintings are in great demand. </b>不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sit over sth </b><br>to have a meal or a drink in a slow relaxed way悠闲地吃﹙ 或喝﹚ :<br><i><font up</b><br>(and do sth) to suddenly give your attention to sth关注起来；警觉起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need an advert that will make people <b>sit up and take notice</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得打出广告吸引人们注意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This will make them sit up and listen.</font></i><br><font position仰卧起坐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I do about sixty sit-ups a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每天做大约六十个仰卧起坐。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sit sb 'up </b><br>to move sb from lying to a sitting position让…坐起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sat the baby up in the pram.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把孩子放在婴儿车里坐着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

skirt	<h3>skirt<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,skirt a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i> ,skirt 'round sth) </b><br>to be or move around the edge环绕…的边缘；位于…的四周:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We skirted around the pond and crossed the bridge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们绕着池塘边走， 然后过桥。</font><br>to avoid discussing or dealing with a difficult or embarrassing subject迴避， 绕开﹙话题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tactfully skirted around the subject of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她巧妙地避而不谈钱的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>subject,question</b><br><b>Skirt around/round sth</b>can be used in the passive in this meaning.<b>skirt around/round sth</b>作此义时可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The issue was skirted around for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题被迴避了很多年了。</font><br><b>Skirt sth</b> is also used with both these meanings.表达这两种含义也可用<b>skirt sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the road that skirted the lake </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 环绕湖边的路</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to skirt laws/duties </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 逃避法律/职责</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

[G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sleep 'in </b><br>to remain in bed longer than usual in the morning﹙比平常﹚迟起；睡懒觉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She usually sleeps in on alcohol, by sleeping靠睡觉来消除；睡一觉熬过﹙酒劲﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s still sleeping off yesterday’s hangover.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在希腊时大部份时间露宿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sleep 'over </b><br>to stay the night at sb else’s home在别人家里过夜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids are sleeping over with friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在朋友家过夜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s very late now — why don’t you sleep over? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在已经很晚了——为什么不就睡这儿呢？</font><br>[NOTE]Compare <b>oversleep</b>, which means to sleep longer than you intended.比较<b>oversleep</b> ，这个动词表示睡过头。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sleepover <i>n </i></b><br>a party for children or young people when a group of them spend the night at one house﹙儿童或年轻人在某人家里的﹚过夜聚会<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sleep 'through sth </b><br>to not be woken up by sth such as a loud noise or a lot of activity不被﹙吵闹声或混乱﹚吵醒；睡觉不受…影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She slept right through the thunderstorm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她完全没被暴风雨吵醒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m afraid I slept through the alarm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 或许闹钟没把我叫醒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did he sleep through the whole incident? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这事自始至终他都在睡觉吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sleep together;'sleep with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to have sex with sb, especially sb you are not married to和某人﹙尤指非配偶﹚发生性关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have been sleeping together for months now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一块儿睡觉已经有几个月了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
slice	<h3>slice<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slice sth 'off; ,slice sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove a thin piece of sth from sth larger by cutting﹙从…﹚切下，割下﹙薄块﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The top of his finger was sliced off in an accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的指尖在一次事故中被切掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sliced a piece of meat off the joint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从大块烤肉上切下一片。</font><br>to reduce sth by a particular amount将…减少某数量；使缩减:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sliced two seconds off the world record.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把世界纪录缩短了两秒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slice 'through sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to pass through sth very easily轻易地通过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The axe sliced through the wood like butter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把斧子噼木柴如同切黄油一样轻松。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He sliced through all my objections.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他轻而易举地避开了我的一切反对。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slice sth 'up </b><br>to cut sth into flat thin pieces把…切成薄片:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you slice the cucumber up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把黄瓜切成片好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

slim	<h3>slim<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slim 'down </b><br>to become thinner, for example as a result of eating less﹙靠节食等﹚变苗条，减肥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She slimmed down to 60 kilos before her wedding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在婚礼前把体重减到了60 公斤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>trim down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slim 'down; ,slim sth 'down</b><br>to make sth, such as an organization or a company, smaller by employing fewer people, reducing the amount of work done, etc.精简﹙机构﹚；裁减﹙人员﹚；减少﹙岗位等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coal industry has had to slim down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 煤炭工业还得压缩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firm had to slim down its workforce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司不得不裁减职工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a slimmed down curriculum </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 压缩了的课程</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>trim down,trim sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
slip	<h3>slip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip a'way </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,slip 'off</b>) to leave quietly without attracting attention熘走； 悄悄离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I slipped away to my room to write some letters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我悄悄躲进房间去写信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to slip off alone for an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他设法独自熘掉了一个小时。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,slip 'by</b>) if a period of time <b>slips away</b>, it passes more quickly than you realize﹙ 时间﹚ 不知不觉地流逝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She could see her childhood slipping away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她可以看到自己的童年不知不觉地过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The afternoon slipped away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下午很快就过去了。</font><br>(from sb) to disappear; to die or to stop existing消失； 消亡； 死去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He slipped away }(= died) &b{peacefully during the night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他夜间安详地去世了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I felt the game was slipping away from me }(= I was losing&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我感觉我要输掉比赛了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip 'by</b><br>1=SLIP AWAY 2<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Time just seemed to slip by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间好像悄悄地就过去了。</font><br>if an opportunity,etc. <b>slips by</b>, it passes and you do not use it﹙机会等﹚熘走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I try never to let a chance to travel slip by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我争取不错过任何旅行的机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip sth 'in; ,slip sth 'into sth </b><br>to add sth to a speech, conversation or written text quickly or secretly﹙在说话或文字中﹚插入﹙几句话等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He usually slips a couple of jokes into his lectures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲课时常捎带插进几个笑话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She slipped in a few comments about her boyfriend.</font></i><br><font easily迅速轻易地穿上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll just slip into something more comfortable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我套件舒服点的衣服就行了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>dress,shoes,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>slip out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SLIP STH OFF;SLIP STH ON<br>to pass into a particular state or situation, especially a difficult or unpleasant one进入，陷入﹙尤指困难或不快的状况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient slipped into a coma.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>coma,sleep,recession,debt</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip 'off=SLIP AWAY 1</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip sth 'off </b><br>to take clothes or 她在门旁一下子踢掉了鞋子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Slip off your coat and I’ll make some tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快把外衣脱了，我去沏茶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp out</b>, you say it when you do not intend to无意中说出﹙或泄露﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t mean to tell him — it just slipped out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp deal with it/them﹙被﹚疏漏，忽视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mistakes occasionally slip through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 错误偶尔被忽略。</font><br><i><font had slipped through their fingers yet again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼又一次从他们的眼皮底下熘掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve wasted your time at college and let your chances slip through your fingers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在大学里浪费了时间，一次次地错过机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp slip through the 'net<br>when sb/sth slips through the net, an organization or a system fails to find them and deal with them被漏掉；得不到处理；漏网:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We tried to contact all the former students, but some slipped through the net.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们尝试和所有校友取得联系，可有一些找不到。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slip 'up (over sth) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to make a careless mistake疏忽；不小心出差错:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I slipped up over the date of the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不小心把开会日期搞错了。</font><br><i><font slop	<h3>slop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slop a'bout/a'round</b><br>(in sth) (of a liquid 液体)to move around in a container, often so that some liquid comes over the edge晃盪；﹙常指﹚溢出，溅出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water was slopping about in the bottom of the boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水在船底晃来晃去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slosh around/about</b><br>(in sth) to move around in water,mud, etc.﹙在水、泥等里﹚趟来趟去，走动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She slopped around in the cooling water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在凉爽的水里走来走去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slosh around/about </b><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>) to spend time relaxing or being lazy休息；放松；偷懒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She used to slop around all day in old jeans and sweatshirts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以前，她时常整天穿着旧牛仔裤和运动衫闲逛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slouch about/around <i>(BrE</i>),hang around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slop 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>when prisoners <b>slop out</b>, they empty the containers that they use as toilets﹙囚犯﹚倒便桶<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slop 'over; ,slop 'over sth</b><br>(of a liquid 液体) to move around in a container so much that some liquid comes out over the edge晃出； 溅出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some tea had slopped over into the saucer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一些茶水晃到了茶托上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water slopped over the edge of the bath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水从浴缸边上溅出了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n

slosh	<h3>slosh<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slosh a'round (<i>also</i> ,slosh a'bout <i>especially BrE</i>) (&b{in sth</b> ) (<i>informal</i>)}<br>(of a liquid 液体) to move around noisily in a container﹙在容器里﹚晃盪作响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water was sloshing about in the bucket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水在桶里哗啦哗啦地晃着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slop about/around</b><br>to move around noisily in sth liquid﹙在液体里﹚出声地四处移动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were sloshing around in the puddles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在啪嗒啪嗒地踩水坑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slop about/around</b><br><i>(BrE</i>) (especially of money 尤指钱) to be present in large quantities大量存在:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There seems to be lots of money sloshing around in professional tennis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 职业网球比赛可谓金钱磙磙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
slot	<h3>slot<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slot 'in; ,slot 'into sth </b><br>if sth <b>slots in</b> or <b>slots into sth</b>, it fits easily and exactly into a space,especially the space made or designed for it正好插入，轻易地嵌入﹙设计好的空间﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This bit slots in neatly just here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一块正好插在这儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This piece is meant to slot into this groove.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一块是要插在这个槽里的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) I didn’t understand everything at the time, but later it all slotted into place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我当时并不明白所有的事情，可后来我把一切都理清了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SLOT STH IN,SLOT STH INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slot sb/sth 'in </b><br>to manage to find a time to see sb or to do sth为…安排时间；抽时间﹙见某人、做某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can slot you in tomorrow at four.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以把你安排在明天四点钟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fit sb/sth in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slot sth 'in; ,slot sth 'into sth </b><br>to put something into a space that is available or designed for it把…投入﹙已有的或设计好的空隙﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He slotted a coin into the machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他往机器里投了一枚硬币。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The final pieces of the puzzle had been <b>slotted into place</b> and I understand what was happening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把这个谜的最后几部份联系起来，于是明白了整件事情。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SLOT IN,SLOT INTO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,slot to'gether; ,slot A and B to'gether </b><br>if two things <b>slot together</b>, or sb <b>slots them together</b>, they fit together easily and exactly﹙使﹚吻合，简易准确地接合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The base comes in two sections that simply slot together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 底座是可以插接起来的两部份。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The parts are precut, ready to be slotted together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 组件是预先切割好的，可随时安装。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
snack	<h3>snack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'snack on sth </b><br>to eat small amounts of food between or instead of meals吃小吃﹙或零食﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s healthier to snack on fruit rather than chocolate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以水果当零食比吃巧克力更有益于健康。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
snap	<h3>snap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snap 'back(into sth) (<i>AmE</i>) (<i>informal</i>)=BOUNCE BACK (FROM STH) </b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the initial shock, he soon snapped back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最初的震惊过后，他很快就恢复了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She snapped back into her daily routine soon after the operation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手术之后不久她就恢复了日常生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>recover (from sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snap sth 'out </b><br>to say sth in a sharp or unpleasant way厉声说出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sergeant snapped out an order.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中士厉声下达命令。</font><br><b>Snap sth </b>can be used with this meaning.<b>snap sth</b> 可作此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She snapped instructions to the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她厉声向队伍下达命令。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snap 'out of sth; ,snap sb 'out of sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make yourself, or help sb else, stop feeling upset, in a bad mood, etc.; to wake up from a day dream﹙ 帮某人﹚ 消除烦恼﹙或坏心情等﹚；从白日梦中醒来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, Joe. <b>Snap out of it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 振作些，乔。别难过了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was snapped out of her reverie by the sound of the door opening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开门声把她从幻想中惊醒了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snap 'to it <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to start working harder or more quickly快点干； 加把劲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This place has to be clean by this evening so snap to it! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地方到晚上必须乾乾净净，加紧干吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+it<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snap sb/sth 'up </b><br>to buy or seize sth quickly and eagerly抢购；抢先抓住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fans quickly snapped up the tickets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球迷很快就把门票抢购一空。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) He was snapped up by United.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被联队抢去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
snarl	<h3>snarl<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snarl 'up; ,snarl sth 'up</b><br>if sth <b>snarls up</b>, or sth<b>snarls it up</b>, it becomes so confused, twisted,etc. that no part of it can move﹙使﹚缠结，混乱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog’s lead got snarled up in a bush.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗的皮带缠绕在一株灌木上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The traffic snarls up at that junction every evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个交叉路口的交通每晚都堵塞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The accident snarled up the traffic for the whole day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次事故使交通堵塞了整整一天。</font><br><b>Snarl sth up</b> is often used in the passive with <i>get</i>. <b>snarl sth up</b>常与get连接，用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city centre gets snarled up with tourists in the summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到了夏天，市中心游人如织。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'snarl-up <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) a situation in which traffic is unable to move交通阻塞<br>\n
snatch	<h3>snatch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'snatch at sth </b><br>to try to take hold of sth伸手抓，试图夺﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She snatched at the letter in his hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她伸手去抓他手里的信。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) to take an opportunity to do sth eagerly and quickly抓紧﹙ 机会﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They snatched at the chance to be happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们抓住机会开心一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
sneak	<h3>sneak<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]The usual past form is <b>sneaked</b>, but <b>snuck</b> is now very common in informal speech in American English and some people use it in British English too. However, many people consider it incorrect and it should not be used in formal writing.过去式一般用<b>sneaked</b> ，但在非正式美国口语中<b>snuck</b> 已很常见，有人也把它用于英国英语。不过，很多人认为<b>snuck</b> 不正确，不应用于正式书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sneak 'up (on sb) </b><br>to approach sb very quietly, so that they do not see or hear you until you reach them悄悄走近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He loves sneaking up on me to scare me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就爱偷偷熘到我身边吓唬我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She snuck up behind them and suddenly shouted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她蹑手蹑脚地走到他们身后，然后突然大喊一声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
sniff	<h3>sniff<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sniff a'round; ,sniff a'round sth/sb <i>(BrE also </i>,sniff 'round, ,sniff 'round sth/sb) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to go somewhere to try to find secret information about sth/sb or to look for a particular person or thing探查， 打探， 访查﹙ 秘密信息﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Representatives from the studio were sniffing around for new talent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影公司的代表在四处物色新秀。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It won’t be long before the press come sniffing around the club.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 记者们很快就会来这个俱乐部访查的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sniff at sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to show a lack of interest in or respect for sth对…嗤之以鼻﹙或不屑一顾﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At first he sniffed at her foreign ways.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 起初他对她的外国作风嗤之以鼻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp not to be 'sniffed at (<i>informal</i>)<br>good enough to be accepted or considered seriously值得认真对待； 不容轻视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her achievement is not to be sniffed at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不可小看她的成绩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sniff sb/sth 'out</b><br>(especially of dogs 尤指狗) to find sb/sth by smelling嗅出；闻出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These dogs can sniff out explosives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些狗能闻出炸药。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>smell sb/sth out</b><br><i>(informal</i>) to find information about sb/sth觉察，找到，发现﹙人或信息等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp journalists trained to sniff out a sensation or a scandal </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在发掘轰动事件或丑闻方面受过训练的记者</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re quick to sniff out a deception.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们迅速察觉到有骗局。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>nose sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sniff 'round; ,sniff 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=SNIFF AROUND,SNIFF AROUND STH/SB</b><br>\n
snow	<h3>snow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,snowed 'in/ 'up </b><br>to be unable to go anywhere or leave a place because of heavy snow被大雪困住；因雪滞留:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got snowed in for three days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们被大雪困了三天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,snowed 'under (with sth) </b><br>to have so much work that you have problems dealing with it﹙工作多﹚不胜负荷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re snowed under with work at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们现在让工作压得直不起腰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be/get ,snowed 'up <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>1=BE/GET SNOWED IN/UP<br>2(of a road, etc. 道路等) to be/become blocked with snow被雪封住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The driveway was still snowed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车行道依然被雪封着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be/get+v+adv<br>\n
snuff	<h3>snuff<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snuff sb 'out <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to kill sb杀，消灭﹙ 某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was snuffed out by the Mafia.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被黑手党杀了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,snuff sth 'out </b><br>to stop a flame from burning熄灭﹙火焰﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She snuffed out the candles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她吹灭了蜡烛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>candle,flame</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Snuff sth</b> can also be used with this meaning. <b>snuff sth</b>也可作此义。<br><i>(written</i>) to suddenly end or destroy sth突然结束，扼杀，消灭﹙某事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A moment of mindless violence snuffed out his life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一时无谓的暴力结束了他的生命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The revolution was quickly snuffed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那场革命被迅速镇压了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>life,hope</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

soak	<h3>soak<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,soak 'in; ,soak 'into sth</b><br>(of a liquid 液体) to pass into sth渗入； 渗进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Apply the oil to the wood and leave it to soak in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把油涂在木头上让它渗进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wine had soaked into the carpet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 葡萄酒渗进了地毯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,soak 'through; ,soak 'through sth</b><br>(of a liquid 液体) to pass into or through sth渗入；渗透:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Blood had soaked through the bandage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 血透过绷带渗了出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,soak sth 'up </b><br>to take in or absorb sth, especially a liquid吸收，吸掉﹙尤指液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use a paper towel to soak up the excess oil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用厚纸巾把多余的油吸去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) <b>The farmers soak up</b> }(= use up) &b{￡1 billion of government aid a year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民每年用十亿英镑的政府资助。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>water,debts </b><br>to absorb sth into your senses, your body or your mind﹙通过感官、身心﹚吸取，摄取:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We walked around the town, soaking up the atmosphere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在城里边散步边感受着那里的气氛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the sun,the atmosphere</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>absorb sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

sock	<h3>sock<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sock sth a'way <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to save money by putting it in a bank or by buying shares in a company, etc.﹙通过存银行或买股票﹚存，积攒﹙钱﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She already has $500 socked away for college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她已经存了500 元用于上大学。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He socks away half his salary every month for the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每个月将工资的一半攒起来用于买房子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sock it to sb </b><br><i>(informal </i> or <i>humorous</i>) used to encourage sb to do or say sth that will have a strong effect, for example before an interview, a sports game, etc.尽最大努力做某事；有力地对某人说…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll be fine. Just get in there and sock it to them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没事的。只要进去好好发挥就行了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Sock it to sb </b>is not used in the passive.<b>sock it to sb </b>不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+prep<br>\n

sort	<h3>sort<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort sb 'out <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to deal with sb who has been causing trouble整治，对付，收拾﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent the lads round to sort him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们派小伙子们去收拾他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>deal with sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort sb/yourself 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to find a solution to sb’s/your own problems, etc.解决某人﹙或自己﹚的问题:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took her months to sort herself out after the divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离婚后，她过了好几个月才恢复正常生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was so upset it took us an hour to calm him down and sort him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他十分难过，我们用了一个小时才让他平静下来并帮他解决问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>straighten sb/yourself out </b><br>to organize sb or yourself组织某人，安顿某人﹙或自己﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You load the car and I’ll sort the kids out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你装车，我把孩子们安顿好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s in her room sorting herself out for the trip }(=packing clothes, etc.&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在房间里打点行装。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort sb 'out with sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE </i>)</b><br>to provide sb with something they need给某人提供﹙ 所需物品﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sure we can sort you out with some dry clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我们一定能给你找几件乾衣服的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort sth 'out </b><br>to put sth in order; to tidy and organize sth把…安排好；理顺；整理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I spent the afternoon sorting out my study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下午的时间我用来整理我的书房了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>room,stuff </b><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to organize or arrange sth组织；安排:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp First you have to sort out a work permit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 首先，你必须办理工作许可证。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>)to decide on sth作出决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to sort out what clothes to take with me on the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得想好旅行带什么衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>details,priorities</b><br>[NOTE]In this meaning <b>sort sth out</b> is usually used with question words such as <i>what</i>, <i>where</i>, etc. <b>sort sth out</b> 作此义时通常与<i>what、where</i>等疑问词连用。<br>to solve a problem解决﹙问题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve sorted the problem out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把问题解决了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problem,mess </b><br>(from sth) to separate sth from a larger group﹙从…中﹚区分出来，辨别出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sort out the ripe pears from the rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把成熟的梨子和其他的分开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sorted out the clothes that she didn’t wear any more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把不再穿的衣服挑了出来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sort-out <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) an act of arranging or organizing things in a neat and tidy way and getting rid of things you don’t want收拾；清理<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort itself 'out <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if a problem<b>sorts itself out</b>, it stops being a problem without anyone having to do anything﹙问题﹚自行化解:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He woke up feeling ill, but thought the problem would soon sort itself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他醒来时感觉不舒服，可他以为一会儿就会自动好起来的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>work itself out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sort 'through sth </b><br>to look through a number of things either in order to find a particular thing or to put them in groups翻查；归整:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sorted through her wardrobe for something to wear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她翻遍衣柜找件穿的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sorted through thousands of old photos.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们归整了几千张旧照片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
sound	<h3>sound<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sound 'off (about sth) (<i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to express your opinions loudly or in an aggressive way高谈阔论；夸夸其谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He should check his facts before sounding off like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他应该先核实一下实情再那样高谈阔论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sound sb/sth 'out (about/on sth)</b><br>to try to discover sb’s views, opinions, etc. on sth, especially in an indirect way试探某人﹙对某事﹚的看法；探口风:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to sound him out about a possible job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想探探他的口风看看能不能得到那份工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should sound out opinions on these changes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该试探一下人们对这些变革的看法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
soup	<h3>soup<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,soup sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>soup up</b> a car, a computer, etc., you make changes to it so that it is more powerful or exciting通过改装﹙汽车、计算机等﹚增强功能:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He makes a living buying old cars and souping them up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把买来的旧车进行加大马力改装，以此为生。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'souped-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] (<i>informal</i>) a<b>souped-up</b> car, computer, etc. has been changed to make it more powerful or exciting﹙汽车、计算机等，通过改装﹚功能增强的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a souped-up Mini </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加大马力的迷你牌汽车</font><br>\n
space	<h3>space<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,space 'out; ,space sb 'out <i>(slang</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to be confused, unable to think clearly, or not aware of what is happening around you, for example as a result of taking drugs; to put sb in a state like this﹙药物等导致﹚精神恍惚，神志迷蒙:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was supposed to meet her for lunch but I spaced out and forgot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我本应该和她共进午餐，可我昏昏沉沉地忘记了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drugs I was taking for my illness spaced me out so I couldn’t think clearly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我为治病吃的药把我弄得头晕脑胀，神志不清。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spaced 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>(<i>slang</i>) confused, unable to think clearly and not completely conscious of what is happening around you, for example because of taking drugs﹙药物等导致﹚精神恍惚的，神志迷蒙的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sat in the corner looking completely spaced out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坐在角落里，显得完全神色迷离。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,space sth 'out </b><br>to arrange things with a regular distance or time between them, especially a fairly large amount使拉开﹙空间或时间上的﹚间距；使隔开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try spacing the words out more on the page.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把页面上的字间距再拉大些。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Should I space out the baby’s feeds over 24 hours?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要不要把餵宝宝的时间按24小时平均分开？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
spark	<h3>spark<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spark sth 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to cause something to suddenly happen or develop使突然发生﹙或发展﹚；引发；导致:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The incident sparked off riots across the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事引起了全国各地的骚乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His resignation sparked off a political crisis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他辞职触发了一场政治危机。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>riots,debate,incident,protest,crisis</b><br><b>Spark sth</b> is also used with this meaning.<b>spark sth</b>也作此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The TV programme sparked a storm of protest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个电视节目引发了一阵抗议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spark 'up </b><br>if a fire <b>sparks up</b>, it starts to burn brightly again after a period when it was almost out死灰复燃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire is still smoking and could spark up at any moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那火堆还在冒烟，随时会再燃烧起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)They sparked up }(=became more lively and interested&b{) when they heard the music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一听到音乐就来了精神。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spark sth 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>if you <b>spark up</b> a conversation, a debate, a friendship, etc., you start one, often suddenly﹙突然﹚开始谈话﹙或争论、交友等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sat down beside Helen and tried to spark up a conversation with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在海伦旁边坐下，想和她讲话。</font><br>to add interest or excitement to sth给…增添趣味﹙ 或兴味﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spark up pasta dishes with fresh herbs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用新鲜香草给麵食调味。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Send a card and spark up someone’s day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 寄张贺卡，为人打打气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>spice sth up</b><br><b>spark up sth,spark it/them up</b> to light a fire, etc.点燃；引燃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>slang</i>) Time to spark up a cigarette.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到吸烟时间了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)There is nothing in the book to spark up the reader’s interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 书里没有什么能激起读者兴趣的东西。</font><br>[NOTE]A noun must come after <b>up</b>,but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
speak	<h3>speak<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'speak for sb</b><br>to state the wishes or views of sb;to act as a representative for sb代﹙或代表﹚某人讲话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t speak for the others, but I’d love to come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能代表其他人讲话，但我很想来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She speaks for a whole generation of disillusioned youngsters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她代表着整整一代幻想破灭的青年。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>answer for sb </b><br>to give evidence to support sb in a court of law﹙在法庭上﹚提供有利于某人的证词:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many people spoke for her at the trial.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 审判时有很多人提供了支持她的证词。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp speak for it'self/them'selves <br>if something<b>speaks for itself</b> it is so clear and easy to understand that it does not need to be explained一目了然；不言而喻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The facts speak for themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事实是明摆着的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,speak for your'self </b><br>to express your own opinion,although you know that others might not agree with you表达自己的观点；按照个人的意见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Speaking for myself</b>, I’d prefer to go by train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 依我看，我宁愿坐火车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He speaks for himself when he says we need a smoking area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说我们需要一个吸烟区，这是他个人的意见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp speak for my'self/her'self/him'self/them'selves<br>to express your opinion yourself, rather than sb else doing it for you表达自己的意思:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can speak for myself, thank you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我自己能说清楚的，谢谢你！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp speak for your'self (<i>spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)<br>used to tell sb that sth they have said is not true of you﹙表示对方说的话只能代表他自己﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘We’re all tired.’ ‘Speak for yourself — I’m fine!’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我们都累了。”“你说的是你自己吧─我可不累！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'spoken for </b><br>to be married or to have a partner already结了婚的；有伴侣的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can forget about him, he’s spoken for! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你别去想他了，他是有妇之夫！ </font><br>to be set aside for a particular purpose预留的；留作他用的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Half the money is already spoken for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 半数的钱已经留出来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'speak of sth <i>(formal </i>or <i>literary</i>)</b><br>to be evidence of sth; to suggest sth表明；说明；意味着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pictures and ornaments in the room spoke of dreams of faraway places.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里的图画和摆设表明了对遥远地方的嚮往。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,speak 'out (against/in favour of/on sth) </b><br>to say what you think clearly and publicly, often criticizing or opposing sb/sth, in a way that needs courage挺身而出，站出来﹙表示反对、支持等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are no longer afraid to speak out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们再也不惧怕站出来说话了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spoke out against the regime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她公开表示反对这一政权。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>out'spoken <i>adj </i></b><br>saying openly exactly what you think, even if you know other people will disagree or be offended直言不讳的；直率的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her outspoken views often get her into trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她坦率的观点常常给她惹麻烦。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,speak 'up </b><br>used to ask sb to speak louder大声点说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please speak up — we can’t hear you at the back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请大点声讲——我们在后面听不见。</font><br>(for sb/sth/yourself) to say what you think clearly and freely, especially to support or defend sb/sth明确表态；﹙尤指为…﹚说好话，辩护:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several players spoke up for their manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几个运动员为他们的经理辩护。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s learned to speak up for herself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她学会了据理力争。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time to speak up about what is happening in our schools (}= to say we do not like it&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在该把对学校的不满说一说了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
speed	<h3>speed<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,speed a'way/ 'off </b><br>to leave very quickly, usually in a vehicle of some kind﹙驾车﹚迅速离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car sped away from the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那辆车嗖地一声离开了那所房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sped off on her bike to get help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她飞快地骑着自行车去找人帮忙。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Sped</b> is usually used as the past tense and past participle of this verb.过去时和过去分词通常用<b>sped</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,speed 'up; ,speed sth 'up </b><br>to start to move or happen faster; to make sth do this﹙使﹚加速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train started to speed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车开始加速了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parking restrictions were introduced to try to speed up the traffic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 推行限制停车的规定以使交通提速。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They worked slowly at first, speeding up as they got used to it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们开始时工作缓慢，等熟悉之后便加快进度了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new tool bar on the screen definitely <b>speeds things up</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 屏幕上的新工具栏确实提升了处理速度。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Speeded</b> is used as the past tense and past participle of this verb.过去时和过去分词通常用<b>speeded</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
spell	<h3>spell<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spell sth 'out </b><br>to make sth clear and easy to understand; to explain sth in detail解释明白；讲清楚；详细解释:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His reasons for leaving are spelt out in detail in his letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在信中详细解释了他离开的原因。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Surely I don’t have to spell it out? }(= it should be obvious)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我肯定不需要作进一步解释吧？ </font><br>to say or write the letters of a word in the correct order用字母拼；拼写:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you spell that word out for me again? 你能不能把那个字再给我拼一次？</font></i><br>[NOTE]<b>Spell sth</b> is usually used with this meaning. <b>spell sth</b> 通常作此义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)2 v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+speech<br>\n
spew	<h3>spew<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spew 'out; ,spew sth 'out </b><br>to flow out quickly in large amounts; to make sth do this﹙使﹚喷涌出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp lava spewing out from a volcano </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从火山中喷出的熔岩</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp fumes spewed out by cars and trucks </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽车和货车排放的废气</font><br><b>Spew</b> and <b>spew sth</b> are also used with this meaning.<b>spew</b> 和<b>spew sth</b>也作此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a volcano spewing clouds of ash </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喷吐着团团火山灰的火山</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spew 'up; ,spew sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to bring food from the stomach back out through the mouth呕吐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spewed up all over my jacket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把我的上衣吐得到处都是。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>throw up,throw sth up;vomit,vomit sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

spill	<h3>spill<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spill 'out; ,spill 'out of sth </b><br>to accidentally flow out of a container﹙从容器中意外地﹚流出，洒出，溢出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The contents of her bag spilled out everywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她袋子里的东西洒得到处都是。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water had spilled out onto the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水流到了地板上。</font><br>to come out in large numbers or amounts大量出现；涌出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The theatre crowds spilled out onto the pavement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧院的观众纷纷涌上人行道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children spilled out into the yard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们蜂拥到院子里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pour out,pour out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spill 'out; ,spill sth 'out </b><br>to tell sb a secret, your fears, worries, etc. in a hurried and unplanned way倾诉；倾吐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she started to speak, the words just <b>came spilling out</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一开腔就滔滔不绝。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spilled out her troubles to her parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向父母诉苦。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spill 'over (into/to sth)</b><br>to start in one situation or area and then have an effect on another situation or in another area波及，影响到﹙另一范围﹚；蜕变﹙成另一局面﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Unrest has spilt over into areas outside the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 骚乱已经波及城市的周边地区。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anger spilled over into violence at yesterday’s demonstration.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在昨天的示威游行中，愤怒的人群后来采取了暴力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her excitement spilled over to the rest of the group.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的兴奋情绪感染了这个组的其他人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'overspill <i>n </i></b><br>[U] [sing.] (<i>BrE</i>) people who move from a town or city because it is too crowded and go and live somewhere else迁出城市的过剩人口:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These towns were built to house overspill populations from the big cities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 兴建这些小镇是为了容纳从大城市迁出的过剩人口。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spillover [C] [U] </b><br>something that is too large or too much for the place where it starts and spreads to other places容纳不下的部份；溢出部份:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a spillover of riots </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 其他地区引致的骚乱</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a spillover room for guests and friends }(= a room where extra guests and friends can go)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给客人和朋友使用的空闲房间</font><br>the results and effects of sth that have spread to other situations or areas﹙波及其他情况或地区的﹚伴随结果，影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Other resorts could benefit from the spillover (of tourists).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 其他度假胜地可以从游客带来的影响中间接受益。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp spillover effects/benefits </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 间接影响/利益</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spill 'over; ,spill 'over sth </b><br>to flow over the edge of a container that is too full溢出；漫出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water spilled over the rim of the glass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水从玻璃杯口溢出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her tears suddenly spilled over }(=she started to cry&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她突然哭了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The goods were spilling over from the shops onto the pavements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 货物从店铺里摆到了人行道上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) His emotions suddenly spilled over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然控制不住自己的情绪了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
spin	<h3>spin<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spin a'round; ,spin sb/sth a'round <i>(BrE also</i> ,spin 'round, ,spin sb/sth 'round) </b><br>to turn very quickly to face in the opposite direction; to turn sb/sth in this way﹙使﹚迅速转身，猛然回首:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She jumped when she heard her name and spun around to see the speaker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她听到自己的名字时吓了一跳，猛地回过身去看说话的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spun her round to face him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拉她转过身面对着自己。</font><br>to turn round and round quickly; to make sth do this﹙使某物﹚快速旋转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The propeller started to spin around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 螺旋桨开始飞快地旋转起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room seemed to be spinning round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间彷彿在不停地旋转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to spin a ball/coin</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 转动球/硬币</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spin 'off (from sth), ,spin sth 'off (from sth)(<i>especially BrE</i>, <i>business</i>) </b><br>to produce a new product,material, service, etc. that is connected with sth successful that already exists; to be produced in this way﹙从成功的产品、服务等﹚派生，衍生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Calendars and diaries spinning off from familiar books and TV shows are always popular.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 根据喜闻乐见的书和电视节目生产的日历和日记本始终受欢迎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘A Different World’ was spun off from ‘The Cosby Show’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 《与众不同的世界》是《科斯比节目》成功后的派生作品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their research has spun off many useful applications.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的研究已经开发了很多实际应用的产品。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spin-off <i>n </i></b><br>an unexpected but useful result of an activity that is designed to produce sth else﹙意外但有用的﹚副产品，派生物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp commercial spin-offs from medical research </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医学研究的商业副产品</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp spin-off effects </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 副作用</font><br>a product or a book, film/movie, etc. that is based on a very successful book, film/movie or television series﹙根据成功的书、电影或电视系列剧制作的﹚派生作品，搭车产品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘The Cosby Show’ and its spinoff ‘A Different World’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 《科斯比节目》及其派生作品《与众不同的世界》</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a spin-off movie </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一部派生电影</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spin sth 'off </b><br><i>(especially AmE</i>, <i>business</i>) to separate part of a company or an organization from the main part in order to form a new one﹙从公司或机构中﹚分拆出…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fast food chain could be spun off as a separate company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个快餐连锁店可以分拆出来作为独立公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spin sth 'out </b><br>to make sth last as long as possible拉长；拖长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I managed to spin my talk out to an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我设法把讲话拖长到一个小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had to spin out her money until pay day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她得一分钱掰作两半花，坚持到发工资日。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spin 'round; ,spin sb/sth 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=SPIN AROUND,SPIN SB/STH AROUND</b><br>\n

spit	<h3>spit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spit it 'out <i>(spoken</i>)</b><br>used to tell sb to reveal a piece of information or to say sth when they are feeling nervous or unwilling to speak说出来吧； 有什么尽管说出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come on, spit it out! Who did it? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点说出来吧！是谁干的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spit sth 'out </b><br>to force sth out of your mouth吐出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It tasted so horrible he had to spit it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那东西味道差极了，他只好吐了出来。</font><br>to say sth very angrily愤怒地说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Men!’ She spat the word out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “老兄们！”她愤怒地说。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>word</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n2 }also&b{ v+adv+speech<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spit 'up; ,spit sth 'up <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>if a baby <b>spits up</b> or <b>spits sth up</b>, it brings milk back from its stomach out through its mouth﹙婴儿﹚漾奶，吐奶:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put this cloth on your shoulder in case she spits up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这块布埝在肩上， 她可能吐奶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lots of babies spit up a bit of milk after feeding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多婴儿餵过之后都漾点奶。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>vomit,vomit sth;be sick <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spit-up <i>n </i></b><br>[U] the milk that a baby brings back out of its mouth婴儿漾的奶<br>\n
splash	<h3>splash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash a'bout <i>(BrE</i>)=SPLASH AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash sth a'bout/a'round <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to spend money freely or carelessly无节制地花钱； 挥霍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He splashes his wages about just to impress her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大手大脚地花工资只是为了引起她注意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash sth a'cross/ 'over sth </b><br>to publish a photograph, a news story, etc. in a place where a lot of people will see it, especially in a newspaper把﹙照片、新闻报道等﹚安排在﹙报纸等的﹚显着位置；在突出位置刊载:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The next day her name was splashed across all the front pages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第二天，她的名字出现在所有报纸的头版。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want my private life splashed all over the tabloids.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想让我的私生活刊载在所有小报的显着位置。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Splash sth across/over sth </b>is often used in the passive.  <b>splash sth across/over sth</b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,splash a'bout) (&b{in sth</b> ) }<br>to move about in water making it fly everywhere﹙ 在水里﹚四处溅泼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children splashed about in the river all afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们整个下午都在河里嬉水。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash sth a'round=SPLASH STH ABOUT/AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash 'down</b><br>when a spacecraft <b>splashes down</b>, it returns to earth and lands in the sea/ocean﹙航天器﹚坠落﹙在海洋﹚；溅落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The capsule splashed down in the Pacific.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 航天舱溅落在太平洋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'splashdown <i>n </i></b><br>[C] [U] the return of a spacecraft to earth when it lands in the sea/ocean溅落﹙指航天器坠入海洋﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Splashdown is expected 300 kilometres west of Valparai so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 溅落位置预定在瓦尔帕来索以西300 公里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash 'out (on sth), ,splash sth 'out (on/for sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to spend a lot of money on sth花大笔的钱﹙买某物等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She splashed out on a new pair of shoes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她花很多钱买了双新鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t we splash out and go out for a meal?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们为什么不潇洒一把出去吃顿饭呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band splashed out thousands of pounds on new equipment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队花了几千英镑购置新设备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t splash it all out at once! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别把钱一下子挥霍光！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,splash sth 'over sth=SPLASH STH ACROSS/OVER STH</b><br>\n
split	<h3>split<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,split a'way/ 'off (from sth), ,split sth a'way/'off (from sth)</b><br>to separate from, or be separated from, a large object or a group﹙从……中﹚脱离，分裂出去， 分离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The branch had split away from the main trunk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那根树枝是从树干上折下的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind split the door away from its frame.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 强风把门从门框上颳了下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the members split away to form a new party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些党员分裂出去成立新党。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Should the ownership of the rail track be split off from the running of the train services? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 铁路的所有权是否应该从火车服务营运中分离出来？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'split on sb (to sb) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to tell sb in authority about sth bad or wrong that sb has done﹙向…﹚告发某人，揭发某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Promise you won’t split on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要答应不出卖我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tell on sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,split 'up (with/from sb), ,split sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to end a relationship or a marriage; to make two people stop having a relationship with each other﹙使和某人﹚断绝关系，分手:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He told me he had split up with his girlfriend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他告诉我他和女友分手了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band split up at the height of their fame.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队在最红的时候散伙了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My friend is doing her best to split Maria and me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的朋友竭力想拆散我和玛丽亚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break up (with sb), break sb up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,split 'up (into sth), ,split sb/sth 'up (into sth)</b><br>if a group of people or a family <b>splits up</b>, or sb<b>splits it up</b>, the members separate and do not stay together﹙把集体或家庭﹚分散，化整为零；分成﹙小组﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We split up into groups to discuss the question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们分组讨论那个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The class was split up into groups.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已在班上进行分组。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got split up in the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在人群中走散了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>break up,break sb/sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,split sth 'up (into sth)</b><br>to divide sth into smaller parts划分，分解﹙成…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The day was split up into 6 one-hour classes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一天分作6节课，每节课一小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We split the profits up between us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把利润分了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

sponge	<h3>sponge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sponge sb/sth 'down</b><br>to wash sb/sth with a wet cloth or a soft material用湿布﹙或软材料﹚清洗人﹙或物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sponged the coat down to remove the mud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用湿布擦洗掉外套上的泥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried sponging the baby down to lower his temperature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试着用湿毛巾给孩子降体温。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sponge off sb (<i>also </i>'sponge on sb <i>less frequent</i>) (<i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>) </b><br>to get money, food, etc.from other people, without doing anything for them or offering to pay从某人处白拿钱﹙或食物等﹚ ； 揩油； 蹭﹙ 饭等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s constantly sponging off his friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他时常揩朋友的油。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sponge sth 'off; ,sponge sth 'off sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to remove a mark, some dirt, etc. with a wet cloth or a piece of a soft material用湿布﹙或软材料﹚除掉污迹﹙或尘土等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was impossible to sponge the mark off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这块污斑擦不掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t sponge the stain off my dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我擦不掉我连衣裙上的污迹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sponge on sb=SPONGE OFF SB</b><br>\n

spread	<h3>spread<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spread 'out </b><br>to gradually cover a wider area逐渐扩展﹙或散开﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city has spread out into what used to be countryside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 城市渐渐延伸到了从前的乡村。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ripples spread out across the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 波纹在水面上扩散开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) A bright future spread out before him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 光明的前景展现在他面前。</font><br><b>Spread</b> is also frequently used with this meaning.此义也常作<b>spread</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fields spread for miles along the river.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 田地沿河延伸几英里。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,spread yourselves 'out</b>) to move away from others in a group so as to cover a wider area﹙ 集体﹚ 散开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The search party spread out over the moor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 搜索队在旷野分散开来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t all sit together. Spread yourselves out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别都挨在一块儿坐。分开坐吧。</font><br>[NOTE]When this phrasal verb is used with a reflexive pronoun, the pronoun is always plural: ourselves,yourselves or themselves.这个短语动词和反身代词连用时，这个代词用复数形式：ourselves、yourselves或themselves。<br>(<i>also </i><b>,spread yourself 'out</b>) to stretch your body or arrange your things over a large area伸展身体；摊开…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s more room to spread out in business class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商务舱宽敞些，伸得开腿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you have to spread yourself out all over the sofa?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你就非得躺下，把整个大沙发全占了才行吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 v+adv2,3 }also&b{ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spread 'out;be ,spread 'out </b><br>to cover a wide area开阔:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley spread out beneath us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开阔的山谷出现在我们脚下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We looked down at the city spread out below us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们鸟瞰着下面宽广的城市。</font><br>This verb is often used in descriptions of cities, views, etc.这个动词常用于形容城市、景色等。<br><b>Spread</b> and <b>be spread</b> are also frequently used with this meaning.此义也常作<b>spread</b> 和<b>be spread</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley lay spread before us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开阔的山谷展现在我们面前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ be+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spread sth 'out </b><br>to arrange a group of objects on a surface so that you can see them all clearly摆开，摊开﹙一组物品﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spread out all the pieces before you begin the jigsaw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拼图之前先把所有的小片摊开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the brochures were spread out on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小册子全都摆放在地板上。</font><br>to unfold sth and put it down on a flat surface打开，铺开﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They spread the blanket out on the grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把毯子铺在草地上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The map had been spread out on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地图铺在了桌子上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>map,newspaper,blanket</b><br>to stretch your fingers, arms, etc. so that they are apart伸开﹙手指﹚；摊开﹙四肢等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy spread out his arms, pretending to be an aeroplane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个男孩张开双臂，装成一架飞机。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>arms,hands</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Spread sth</b> is also frequently used with this meaning.此义也常作<b>spread sth</b> 。<br>(over sth) to separate sth into parts and arrange them over a period of time or divide them between different people把…﹙按时间﹚分开处理:<br><i><font
