spring	<h3>spring<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spring for sth <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to pay for sth for other people替他人付账；包揽费用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll spring for lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午饭我来买单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spring from sth</b><br><i>(written</i>) to be caused by sth;to start from sth由某事物造成；起源于﹙或来自﹚某事物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea for the novel sprang from a trip to India.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部小说的灵感来自一次印度旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Aggression often springs from fear.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侵略行为常常是由恐惧引起的。</font><br><i>(informal</i>)(<i>usually used in questions </i>通常用于疑问句) to appear suddenly or unexpectedly from somewhere突如其来地从﹙某处﹚出现:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where on earth did you spring from? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你究竟是从哪儿冒出来的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spring sth on sb </b><br>to suddenly do, say or suggest sth that people do not expect突如其来地做﹙或说、提起﹚某人意想不到的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hate to spring this on you at such short notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想如此突然地让你知道这件事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were planning to spring a surprise on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们计划着给我们来个惊喜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t know a thing about Rob’s new job until he sprang it on me this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天上午罗布突然告诉我关于他的新工作，在这之前，我毫无所知。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spring 'up </b><br>to appear, develop, grow, etc. quickly or suddenly迅速出现﹙或发展、生长等﹚；突然兴起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Weeds were springing up everywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到处杂草丛生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several new cafés sprang up in the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区突然冒出了几家新的小餐馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cool breeze had sprung up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突然吹来一阵凉风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New industries were springing up all over the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新工业如雨后春笋在全国各地兴起。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
spruce	<h3>spruce<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spruce sb/sth 'up; ,spruce yourself 'up </b><br>to make sb/sth/yourself tidy and clean打扮；把…收拾整洁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spruced up the room with a coat of paint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把房间刷了一层涂料，令其整洁一新。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spruced himself up for the interview.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为参加面试打扮了一番。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>smarten up,smarten yourself up;smarten sb/sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
spur	<h3>spur<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spur sb 'on (to sth/to do sth)</b><br>to encourage sb to act in a particular way, especially to work harder or to try to achieve sth鼓励；激励；鞭策:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her difficult childhood spurred her on to succeed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她艰难的童年激励着她去争取成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His parents’ encouragement spurred him on to greater efforts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母的鼓励促使他更加努力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spurred on by this victory, we went on to win the championship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这次胜利的鼓舞下，我们接着赢得了冠军。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their shouts of encouragement spurred us on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们助威的吶喊声激励着我们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>encourage sb</b><br><b>Spur sb on </b>is often used in the passive.<b>spur sb on</b>常用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was spurred on by new hope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新的希望鼓舞了他。</font><br><b>Spur sb</b> followed by an infinitive or a phrase beginning with a preposition is also used with this meaning.表达此义也可用<b>spur sb</b> 后接不定式或介词短语:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His criticism spurred me to try harder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的批评鞭策我更加努力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
spurt	<h3>spurt<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spurt 'out; ,spurt 'out of sth; ,spurt sth 'out; ,spurt sth 'out of sth </b><br>to come out of sth in a sudden or fast stream; to pour out a sudden fast stream of liquid or flames﹙ 从…中﹚ 喷出，冒出，涌出﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Water spurted out of the hole.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水从小孔中喷出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The volcano was spurting out rivers of molten lava.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火山喷涌着熔岩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
spy	<h3>spy<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'spy on sb/sth (<i>also</i> 'spy upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to watch sb/sth secretly暗中监视，窥探﹙某人或事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hired a detective to spy on his wife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他雇了侦探暗中监视他的妻子。</font><br><b>Spy on sb/sth </b>can be used in the passive.<b>spy on sb/sth </b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knew he was being spied on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他知道当时有人监视着他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,spy sth 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>to go somewhere secretly to try to find out information﹙去某处﹚暗中查明，秘密了解清楚﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I arrived early to spy out the land }(= collect information before deciding what to do&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很早便到了，以便摸清情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He studied the map and spied out the quickest route.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他研究了一下地图，发现了一条最快捷的路径。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
square	<h3>square<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,square sth a'way <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to finish dealing with sth; to put sth in order办妥；了结；归整:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to get everything squared away before you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在你走之前得把一切整理好。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Square sth away </b>is often used in the passive. <b>square sth away </b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,square 'off (against sb) (<i>AmE</i>)</b><br>to fight or to prepare to fight sb﹙和某人﹚打斗；摆好架势﹙和某人﹚打斗:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two candidates will square off in a TV debate tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名候选人将在明天的电视辩论中交锋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Protesting students squared off against police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抗议的学生和警察发生了冲突。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,square 'up </b><br>(<b>to sb</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) to stand facing sb as if you are prepared to fight or argue with them气势汹汹地面对﹙某人﹚；摆好﹙与某人﹚打斗﹙或吵架﹚的架势:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kath put her hands on her hips and squared up to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯瑟双手叉腰凛然面对着他。</font><br>(to sb/sth) to face a difficult situation and deal with it in a determined way勇敢地面对，毅然面对﹙某人或事情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must square up to the reality of being out of work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他必须直面失业的现实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>face up to sth</b><br>(with sb) to pay sb the money you owe them﹙向某人﹚付清欠款；﹙与某人﹚结清账:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I leave you to square up with the waiter? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我先走，你来和服务员结账好不好？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>settle up (with sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'square with sth;'square sth with sth </b><br>to agree with another fact, idea or situation; to make two facts, ideas or situations agree with each other﹙使﹚与…一致，与…相符:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This doesn’t square with what you told us earlier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这与你先前告诉我们的有出入。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How do you square your profession with your religious beliefs?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  你怎样使你从事的职业和你的宗教信仰协调一致呢？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must remember that the interests of the farmers need to be squared with those of consumers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须记住农场主的利益要和消费者的利益相一致。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'square sth with sb </b><br>to get sb’s approval before you do sth就……徵得某人同意﹙或认可﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’d better square it with the boss if you want to leave early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是想提前下班， 最好徵得老板的同意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
squash	<h3>squash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squash 'in; ,squash 'into sth=SQUEEZE IN,SQUEEZE INTO STH</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I squash in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我能挤进来吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all squashed into the back of the van.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都挤进了客货车的后座。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squash sb/sth 'in; ,squash sb/sth 'into sth=SQUEEZE SB/STH IN,SQUEEZE SB/STH INTO STH</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can squash you in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们能让你挤进来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squash sb/sth to'gether </b><br>to press people or things tightly together in a small space把人﹙或物﹚挤在一起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp people living squashed together in terrible conditions </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拥挤地生活在恶劣环境中的人</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Squash sb/sth together </b>is usually used in the passive.<b>squash sb/sth together </b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squash 'up (against sb/sth), ,squash sb/sth 'up (against sb/sth) (<i>BrE</i>)=SQUEEZE UP,SQUEEZE SB/STH UP</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we squash up there’ll be room for one more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们挤一挤就会再腾出个位子来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was squashed up against Jo in the back of the van.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在客货车的后座上和乔挤在一起。</font><br>\n
squeak	<h3>squeak<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeak 'by <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to achieve a successful result with great difficulty费力﹙ 或勉强﹚ 取得成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We just squeaked by in the semi-final.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们好不容易在半决赛中取胜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeak 'through; ,squeak 'through sth (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to manage to achieve sth or get a successful result with great difficulty﹙在…中﹚勉力取得成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Andrew squeaked through the qualifying rounds of the championship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 安德鲁勉强通过了锦标赛的资格赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
squeeze	<h3>squeeze<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeeze 'in; ,squeeze 'into sth (<i>also</i> ,squash 'in, ,squash 'into sth)</b><br>to just manage to fit into a small space挤进；挤入…里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus was so full not one more passenger could have squeezed in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车上拥挤得连一个乘客也再塞不下了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeeze sb/sth 'in; ,squeeze sb/sth 'into sth </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,squash sb/sth 'in, ,squash sb/sth 'into sth</b>) to just manage to put sb/sth into a small space勉强把某人﹙或某物﹚挤进；塞进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you squeeze anything else into that case? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能再往那个箱子里塞点东西吗？ </font><br>to just manage to fit sb/sth into a short period of time挤出时间见某人﹙或做某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor can squeeze you in on Tuesday morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大夫星期二上午可以挤出时间看你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All my classes are squeezed into four days a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每周上四天课，挤得满满的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeeze sb/sth 'out; ,squeeze sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>to prevent sb/sth from doing sth or from doing business挤垮；把…挤出﹙某行业等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Small firms are being squeezed out by larger companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小公司逐渐被较大的公司挤垮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One candidate has already been squeezed out of the leadership race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名候选人已从领导人竞选中被淘汰。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>crowd sb/sth out,crowd sb/sth out of sth;exclude sb/sth (from sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeeze sth 'out </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,squeeze sth 'out of sth</b>) to remove liquid from sth by pressing it hard﹙从…中﹚挤出，榨出﹙液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She squeezed the cloth out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把那块布拧乾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll need to squeeze the juice out of four oranges.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要榨出四个橙子的汁。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,squeeze sth 'out of sb/sth</b>) to get sth such as information or money from sb by putting pressure on them, threatening them, etc.勒索；敲诈；逼供:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government will always try to squeeze more money out of the taxpayer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府总是想方设法向纳税人榨取更多的钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police squeezed the truth out of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方迫他讲出了真相。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They finally squeezed some concessions out of the employers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们终于迫使雇主作出了一些让步。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squeeze 'up (against sth), ,squeeze sb/sth'up (against sth) (<i>also </i>,squash 'up, ,squash sb/sth 'up) </b><br>to move closer towards sb so that you are pressed tightly together﹙使﹚挤紧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’ll be enough room if we all squeeze up a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家稍稍挤一挤，地方就够了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll walk — it’s better than being squeezed up in the back of the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要步行——这总比挤在车的后座上要好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
squirrel	<h3>squirrel<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,squirrel sth a'way </b><br>to put sth, especially money,in a safe place so that you can use it later储藏；贮存:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had money squirrelled away in various bank accounts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把钱存在几个不同的银行账户上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
stack	<h3>stack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stack 'up </b><br>to increase gradually until there is a large pile, a long line, etc.积聚成一大堆﹙或一长排等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Over the months he just let the paperwork stack up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个月过去了，他就那么让文案工作积压成堆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The traffic quickly stacked up behind the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车后面的车辆很快排成了长龙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pile up</b><br>(<b>against sb/sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to compare with sb/sth﹙和某人或某物﹚相比:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How does this washing powder stack up against your usual brand?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种洗衣粉和你平常用的那种比怎么样？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s try him in the team and see how he stacks up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把他安排到队里试试，看和其他人比怎么样。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>compare (with sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stack 'up; ,stack sth 'up </b><br>if planes <b>stack up</b> or are <b>stacked up</b> over an airport, there are a lot of them flying around waiting to land﹙飞机﹚作分层盘旋﹙等待降落﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Planes stacked up at Heathrow after an accident on the runway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 跑道上出事之后，飞机在希思罗机场上空作分层盘旋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a queue of planes stacked in the air over the closed airport</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在关闭的机场上空作分层盘旋的一长列飞机</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stack sth 'up </b><br>to arrange things in a tall pile将某物堆起；摞起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stacked up the dishes on the draining board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把碟子摞在滴水板上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pile sth up</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Stack sth</b> is often used with this meaning. <b>stack sth</b>常作此义。<br>2(<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to gradually get more of sth逐渐得到更多；累积:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s stacking up the college credits with all of her night classes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她通过多个晚上的课程积累大学学分。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
stake	<h3>stake<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stake sth on sth;'stake sth on doing sth </b><br>to risk money or sth very important on the result of sth or on sth happening﹙就某事﹚拿钱﹙或十分重要的东西﹚ 冒险； 以…打赌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He staked twenty pounds on the favourite }(= in horse racing,for example)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在那匹众人看好的马上押了二十英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several journalists staked their reputation on Bush winning the election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几个记者拿名誉担保布什能赢得选举。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll never let you down — I’d <b>stake my life on it</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绝对不会令你失望的——我拿性命担保。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stake sth 'out </b><br>to mark the position and the limits of a piece of land or an area to show that you own it界定属于自己的地区；划出自己的势力范围；圈地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The male stakes out his territory and defends it from other birds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雄鸟清楚标出自己的地盘，保护它不受别的鸟侵犯。</font><br>to state your position or opinion on sth clearly表明立场﹙ 或看法﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President staked out his position on the issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统明确阐述了他在这个问题上的立场。</font><br>if police <b>stake out</b> a building, they watch it secretly and continuously because they think sth illegal is happening there﹙警方﹚监视某处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Armed police have been staking out the house for two weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 武警已监视这所房子两个星期了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cops had the building staked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察把这座建筑监视起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stake-out <i>n </i></b><br>a situation when police watch a building continuously and secretly because they think sth illegal is happening there警方监视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stake-out at the house produced nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 监视这所房子没有什么收获。</font><br>\n
stamp	<h3>stamp<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stamp on sth </b><br>to bring your foot down on sth with force用力踩:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child stamped on the spider.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小孩使劲踩那只蜘蛛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stamped on his foot as hard as she could.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她使出全身力气踩他的脚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The victim had been kicked and stamped on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 受害者遭人用脚又踢又踩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A child ran out into the road and I had to stamp on the brakes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有个小孩跑到马路上，我只好用力踩剎车。</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) to control sth or stop sth from happening by force压制；镇压:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This kind of disobedience must be stamped on at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 必须立刻镇压此类违抗行为。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Stamp on sb/sth </b>can be used in the passive. <b>stamp on sb/sth</b> 可用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stamp sth on sth </b><br>to make sth have an important effect or influence on sth在…上打上…印记；把…铭刻在…中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stamped her own interpretation on the role.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给角色注入自己的诠释。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new director has worked hard to stamp his authority on the board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位新董事力求在董事会树立权威。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The date is forever stamped on her memory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个日子永远铭刻在她的记忆中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your authority,your mark</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stamp sth 'out </b><br>to destroy or get rid of sth bad or unpleasant by force or with a lot of effort﹙通过武力或不懈努力﹚消除，消灭，镇压:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They aim to stamp out drug dealing in schools.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们旨在消灭校园里的毒品交易。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party chairman is determined to stamp out corruption.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 党主席决心杜绝腐败现象。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>a problem,drug abuse </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>eradicate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to put out a fire by pressing down on it hard with your foot踩灭﹙ 火﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stamped out the flames before they spread any further.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他踩灭火焰，以免蔓延。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]1 v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n2 v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
stand	<h3>stand<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand a'round; ,stand a'round sb/sth <i>(BrE also </i>,stand a'bout/ 'round, ,stand 'round sb/sth)</b><br>to stand in a place doing nothing, either waiting for sb/sth or with no particular purpose﹙在某人旁或在某处﹚ 闲站着， 站着等:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t just stand around watching me, give me a hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别光站着看，帮帮我嘛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were a few people standing around the square.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 广场四周站了几个人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A group of people stood around watching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一群人站着观看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Young men stood about in groups, chatting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小伙子三五成群地站着闲聊。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand a'side </b><br>to move to one side to let sb/sth pass站到一边；让开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stand aside please and let her through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请站到一边让她过去。</font><br>to take no part in events; to do nothing不参与；不介入:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t stand aside and let you waste an opportunity like that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能不管不问，让你把机会那样浪费掉。</font><br>to stop doing a job so that sb else can do it退居一旁；让位于他人；靠边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time he stood aside and let somebody younger take his place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在他该退出职位，让给较年轻的人了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'back (from sth) </b><br>to move a short distance away from sb/sth离开点； 退后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp <b>Stand well back</b> from the flames.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离那堆火远点。</font><br>to be situated at a distance from sth位于远离一些的地方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house stands back from the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子离公路有一段距离。</font><br>to think about a situation as if you are not involved in it置身局外﹙来考虑﹚；旁观:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She found it hard to stand back from the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得很难把自己当成局外人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is an opportunity to stand back and think about what you have achieved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是一个客观思考自己成绩的机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>step back (&b{from sth</b> )}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand be'tween A and B </b><br>to prevent sb from doing or having sth, or being in a particular situation在…和…之间隔着:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only three people stood between him and the crown }(= becoming king)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在他与王位之间只有三个人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your lack of confidence is all that stands between you and a much better job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 缺乏自信是你得到更好工作的唯一阻碍。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'by </b><br>to be present when sth bad or unpleasant is happening, but not become involved袖手旁观；无动于衷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t <b>stand idly by</b> and let him take the blame for what happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能袖手旁观，让他对所发生的事承担责任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t stand by and see you ruin your life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能眼睁睁看着你摧毁你的一生。</font><br>(for sth) to be ready to take appropriate action做好随时行动的准备； 候命:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot was instructed to stand by for take-off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞行员接到指示，做好随时起飞的准备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fire crews are standing by in case of an explosion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队严阵以待，若有爆炸立刻出动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'bystander <i>n </i></b><br>a person who is present but is not involved in sth旁观者:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two innocent bystanders were hit by stray bullets.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名无辜的旁观者被流弹击中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'standby <i>n </i></b><br>[C] a person or a thing that can be used if sb/sth else is not available后备﹙或候补﹚人员；备用品:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep some candles as a standby in case the power fails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预备一些蜡烛以防断电。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mia made a delicious meal from standbys in the store cupboard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 米娅用储藏柜里的备用食物做了一顿可口的饭。</font><br>[U] a state of being ready to act if necessary待命状态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All local hospitals have been put <b>on standby</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有当地的医院都进入了待命状态。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'standby <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>that can be used if other things are not available备用的；候补的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp standby supplies </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 备用物资</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two divers work together while a standby diver remains on the surface.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名潜水员协同工作，同时有一名候补潜水员留在水面上。</font><br>a <b>standby</b> ticket for a flight, a theatre, etc. is one that cannot be bought in advance and is only available a very short time before the plane leaves or the performance starts最后时刻出售的﹙ 机票、戏票等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp standby passengers </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 临时买机票的旅客</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to fly standby }(= with a standby ticket)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用临时买的票乘飞机</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'by sb </b><br>to support or help sb in a difficult situation支持，帮助，忠于﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stand by you whatever happens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不管发生什么事，我都支持你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick by sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stand by sth </b><br>to continue to believe sth you said earlier even though the situation may now be different遵守诺言﹙或协议等﹚；不改初衷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stand by what I said earlier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会恪守我说过的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He appealed against his suspension, but the committee stood by their decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对被停职一事提出上诉，可委员会维持他们的决定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'down </b><br>(<b>as/from sth</b>) to leave a job or position; to stop taking part in a race or a competition,etc.离职；下台；退出﹙比赛等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stood down after only three months as chairman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她只当了三个月主席就下台了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stood down from the committee for personal reasons.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为了个人原因离开了委员会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>step down (&b{as/from sth</b> ) }<br>(in a court of law 法庭) to leave the place where you stand to give evidence离开证人席:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The witness was allowed to stand down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 证人获准离开证人席。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stand for sth </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to be an abbreviation of sth﹙指缩写﹚是…意思，代表:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What does DVD stand for? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp DVD代表什么？ </font><br>to support sth; to be in favour of sth支持某事物；主张:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our party stands for racial harmony.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的党主张种族和谐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hated him and all he stood for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讨厌他，也讨厌他的一切主张。</font><br><i>(used in negative sentences and questions </i>用于否定句和疑问句) to allow sth to happen or sb to do sth容忍；忍受:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won’t stand for this behaviour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无法容忍这种行为。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put up with sth;tolerate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'in (for sb) </b><br>to take sb’s place代替，顶替﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll need someone to stand in for you while you’re away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不在期间，我们需要有个人代替你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>deputize (for sb) (<i>formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stand-in <i>n </i></b><br>a person who does sb’s job for a short time while they are away or not available﹙暂时担任某种职务的﹚代理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom acted as my stand-in while I was abroad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出国期间由汤姆代职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a stand-in captain/goalkeeper }(= for example, in a football game&b{)</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 代理船长；临时守门员</font><br>a person who replaces an actor in some scenes in a film/movie, especially dangerous ones﹙ 尤指影视中危险动作的﹚ 替身演员:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp rehearsing with stand-ins </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和替身一起排练</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'out </b><br>(against/from sth) to be clearly visible显眼； 突出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His yellow jacket stood out clearly against the grey hillside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 灰色的山坡把他黄色的上衣衬托得十分鲜明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The church tower stands out against the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教堂的尖塔在天空映衬下格外突出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A small figure in red stood out from the rest of the group.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个穿着红衣服的小个头在人群中特别显眼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick out </b><br>(as/from sb/sth) to be much better or more important than other people or things出色；杰出；更为重要:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This building stands out from the rest because of its superior design.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座建筑物由于设计优良而鹤立鸡群。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s the sort of person who always <b>stands out in a crowd</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是那种在哪儿都出众的人。</font><br>(<b>against/for sb/sth</b>) to oppose or refuse to accept sth that you believe is wrong反对，拒绝接受﹙认为错误的事情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parents often stand out against troublesome behaviour for some time, then give in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母常常对令人讨厌的行为反对一段时间，而后就听之任之了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stick out for sth;hold out against/for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp stand out like a sore thumb <br>to be very noticeable in an unpleasant way扎眼； 刺眼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dressed like that, you’ll stand out like a sore thumb.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你穿戴成那样会很扎眼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>out'standing <i>adj </i></b><br>excellent优秀的；杰出的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an outstanding young actress </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰出的年轻女演员</font><br>[usually before noun] very obvious or important突出的；明显的；重要的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lake Baykal is one of earth’s outstanding features.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贝加尔湖是世界上最引人注目的景色之一。</font><br>(of payment,work, problems, etc.款项、工作、困难等) not yet paid, done, solved, etc.未支付的；未完成的；未解决的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to repay outstanding debts </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 清偿欠债</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t have any urgent work outstanding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有什么未做完的紧要工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>out'standingly <i>adv </i></b><br>used to emphasize the good quality of sth特别；异常:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp outstandingly beautiful/successful </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 特别美丽/成功</font><br>extremely well优异；极好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Owen has played outstandingly this season.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 欧文在这个赛季表现极佳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'over sb </b><br>to remain close to sb and watch them, usually to make sure that they behave or do sth correctly监督，监视﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She won’t do her homework unless I stand over her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除非我看着她，否则她不肯做作业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t concentrate with you standing over me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你盯着我，我无法集中精神。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'round; ,stand 'round sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>)=STAND AROUND,STAND AROUND SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'up </b><br>to rise to your feet from a sitting or lying position; to be on your feet站起；站立；起立:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Darcy stood up when Emma came into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃玛一进房间，达西就站起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was silence when the President stood up to speak.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统起身讲话，会场就寂静下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stand up 〗straight instead of slouching.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 挺直身子，别歪歪斜斜的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Horses can sleep standing up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马能站着睡觉。</font><br>(to sth) to remain true or correct even when tested, examined closely, etc.经得起﹙检验、审查等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your theory doesn’t stand up to close examination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的理论经不起仔细推敲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story won’t stand up under crossexamination.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的陈述经不起严密诘问。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold up </b><br>(to sth) to be strong enough not to be harmed by sth经受得住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children <b>stood up well</b> under questioning from the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们顶住了警察的盘问。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The players are standing up to the tour well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演员们在巡迴演出中丝毫未显疲态。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stand-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>a <b>stand-up</b> comedian (= an entertainer who makes people laugh by telling jokes) is sb who stands in front of an audience and tells jokes or funny stories﹙喜剧节目﹚单人表演的；说单口相声的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp stand-up comedy </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 单口相声</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a stand-up act </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 单口相声表演</font><br><i>(especially BrE</i>) a <b>stand-up</b> argument, fight,etc. is one in which people shout loudly at each other or are violent towards each other激烈的﹙争论、打斗等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a stand-up row with the team captain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和队长大吵了一番。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to deliberately fail to meet sb you have arranged to meet, especially sb you are having a romantic relationship with﹙尤指恋人﹚故意失约使某人空等:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We agreed to meet at the cinema but she stood me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们约好在电影院见面，可她让我空等一场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been stood up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人家让我空等一场！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'up for sb/sth/yourself </b><br>to support or defend sb/sth/yourself, especially when sb is criticizing them/it/you支持，维护﹙某人、某事、自己﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s always stood up for her friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她常常为朋友辩解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should stand up for what you believe in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该维护自己的信念。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always telling her what to do. It’s time she stood up for herself!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是对她指手画脚。现在她该挺身自我保护了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp James doesn’t need you to stand up for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 詹姆斯不需要你为他辩护。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>your rights,your interests</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'up to sb/sth </b><br>to resist sb/sth; to defend your position against a more powerful person or organization that is treating you badly or unfairly抵抗；勇敢维护；反抗某人的欺负﹙或不公平对待﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you don’t stand up to him he’ll treat you like dirt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果俯首帖耳，他就根本不会尊重你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult for Paul to stand up to his father’s rage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 保罗很难不屈服于他父亲的暴怒。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stand 'up to sth</b><br>(of a product, material, etc. 产品、材料等) to be able to stay in good condition even though it is treated roughly能承受；经受得住；耐用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will your china and glass stand up to family wear and tear? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的瓷器和玻璃器皿在家里耐用吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>withstand sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
stare	<h3>stare<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stare sb 'out <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,stare sb 'down</b><i>AmE</i>,<i>BrE</i>) to look sb directly in the eyes for a long time until they feel forced to lower their eyes or look away盯得某人转移目光﹙或慌了神﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was looking at her intently but she stared him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他专注地看着她，可她盯得他移开了目光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The two nations are trying to stare each other down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两个国家正试图把对方镇住。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
start	<h3>start<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'back </b><br>to begin to return somewhere动身﹙或启程﹚返回:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time we started back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们该回去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'start for …</b><br>to leave one place to go to another动身去；启程前往:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started for home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们动身回家去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>head for …</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'in (on sth) (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to begin to do sth开始做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s start in now and get the job done quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们现在就动手快点把活干完吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time you started in on your homework.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你该做家庭作业了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'in on sb/sth <i>(especially AmE</i>) 1=START ON SB/STH 2=START ON AT SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'off </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,start 'off doing sth, ,start sth 'off</b>) [<b>+adv/prep/adj</b> ] to begin happening in a particular way; to begin doing sth in a particular way﹙…地﹚进行﹙或开展﹚起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game started off well, but gradually got worse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛开始很顺利，但逐渐变得艰难起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started off with some gentle exercises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们先是做了点强度小的练习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She <b>started off by</b> welcoming everyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她首先向大家表示欢迎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He started off as a plumber.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的第一份工作是水暖工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I started off working quite hard, but it didn’t last.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一开始非常勤奋，但没有坚持下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The discussion started off calmly enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讨论开始时颇为平静。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leaves start off green but turn red later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树叶起先是绿色，到后来就变红。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We always started off the lessons with a quiz.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们上课开始时总是先做一份小测验。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher <b>started things off</b> by asking us what we had done at the weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师上课时首先问我们周末做过什么。</font><br>[NOTE]In this meaning, <b>start off</b> and<b>start off sth</b> are always followed by an adverb,an adjective, a phrase beginning with a preposition,or the <i>-ing </i> form of a verb. <b>start off</b>和<b>start off sth</b> 作此义时总是后接副词、形容词、介词短语或动词的-ing形式。<br>[<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to begin to move or travel开始活动﹙或旅行﹚；开动；启程:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus started off with a jolt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公共汽车开动时颠了一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started off for home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们启程回家了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start sb 'off </b><br><b>(on sth)</b> (<i>also </i><b>,start sb 'off doing sth</b>) to help sb begin an activity, an exercise, a job, etc.帮助某人开始﹙活动、练习或工作等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll start you off on the first exercise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来带你们做第一个练习。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father started him off farming.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲指点他做农活儿。</font><br><i>(also</i> <b>,start sb 'off doing sth</b>) to make sb react in a particular way or begin doing sth使人作出某种反应；使开始﹙做某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just mentioning ‘The Simpsons’ started her off again }(= made her start laughing)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要提起《辛普森一家》就又把她逗笑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t shout — you’ll start the baby off (<i>crying</i>) again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别喊了——不然又要把婴儿吓哭了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set sb off,set sb off doing sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Start sb off </b>cannot be used in the passive in this meaning. <b>start sb off </b>作此义时不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start sth 'off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> START OFF 1<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'start on sb/sth (<i>also</i> ,start 'in on sb/sth <i>especially AmE</i>) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to attack sb physically or with words﹙使用暴力或言语﹚对……进行攻击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hit me first and then he started (<i>in</i>) on my friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他先打了我，然后就打我的朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t start on me, I’m tired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别跟我找茬了，我累了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My mum started on me about doing my homework as soon as I got home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一回到家妈妈就数落我做作业的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'start on sth </b><br>to begin to deal with sth; to begin to do sth开始处理﹙或做﹚某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she’d finished cleaning the kitchen, she started on the bathroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把厨房打扫完就动手清洁浴室。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Start sth</b> has a similar meaning. <b>start sth</b>表达相近含义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'on at sb <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,start 'on about sth,start 'in on sb/sth</b> <i>AmE</i>, <i>BrE</i>) (<i>informal</i>) to begin to criticize sb/sth or complain to sb about sth开始责备某人；开始向某人抱怨﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He started on at me again about my hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他又为我的头发数落起我来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t start on about that dog barking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要为那条狗吠叫的事发牢骚了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'out</b><br>to begin a journey启程；上路:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Check the engine before you start out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出发之前检查一下发动机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time did they start out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们什么时间动身的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set off </b><br>(as sth) to begin in a particular way, especially in business or work…地开始；﹙以…﹚创业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We started out originally as a taxi firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们起初开业时是一家出租车公司。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the band started out, they had hardly any equipment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队刚成立时几乎没有什么设备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you know the tower started out leaning the other way? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知不知道那座塔开始时是向另一边倾斜的？ </font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,start 'out to do sth, ,start 'out doing sth</b>) to have a particular idea or intention when you begin to do sth最初想要；起先打算:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had no idea what I was going to write about when I started out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我当初根本不知道想写些什么东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had started out to write a short story but it ended up as a novel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她起先打算写短篇小说，但最后成了长篇小说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He started out with no political opinions, but soon got involved in student politics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始时不抱有任何政见，可是很快就参与了学生的政治活动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’d started out meaning to apologize but couldn’t.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她原本打算道歉，可就是做不成。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set out to do sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv3 }also&b{ v+adv+to inf ◆ v+adv+-ing<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'over; ,start sth 'over <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to begin doing sth again, especially because you were not successful the first time重新开始；从头开始再做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I messed up and had to start over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我弄得一团糟，不得不返工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spelled my name wrong and had to start over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把我的名字拼错了， 只好再来一次。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His wife has walked out on him and he must start life over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妻子抛弃了他，他必须开始新的生活。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'up </b><br>to begin happening开始:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a moment’s silence, the music started up again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 片刻沉寂过后，又扬起了音乐声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,start 'up; ,start sth 'up </b><br>to start operating; to make sth start operating﹙使﹚发动，启动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine started up with a roar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引擎轰隆隆地发动起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a while to start up the generator.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我费了点时间启动发电机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard the car starting up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听见汽车发动了。</font><br>(in sth) to start operating or trading; to establish a business开始营运﹙或营业﹚；创业:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I started up in business, I needed a lot of help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我创业时需要很多帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a lot of small businesses starting up in the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 区内小企业涌现。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My father helped me start up my own company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父亲帮助我创办了自己的公司。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,company</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'start-up <i>adj </i></b><br>connected with beginning a new business创业有关的； 创办阶段的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the new company’s start-up costs </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司的开业成本</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'start-up <i>n </i></b><br>a company that is just beginning to operate, especially an Internet company新成立的公司；新网络商:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is just one of the problems facing start-ups in this highly competitive area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只是新互联网公司在这个竞争激烈的领域中所面临的问题之一。</font><br>\n
starve	<h3>starve<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'starve for sth;'starve sb/sth for sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to feel you do not have something that you really need; to prevent sb/sth from having sth necessary or very important渴求；迫切需要；使…缺乏…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam was starving for a kind word from Clare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆渴望听到克莱尔的一句好话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were starved for affection.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些孩子严重缺乏爱。</font><br><b>Starve for sth </b>is usually used in the progressive tenses.<b>starve for sth </b>通常用于进行时。<br><b>Starve sb/sth for sth</b> is usually used in the passive. <b>starve sb/sth for sth </b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> STARVE SB/STH OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'starve sb into sth;'starve sb into doing sth </b><br>to force sb to do sth or accept sth by preventing them from getting food or money断绝食物﹙或资金﹚来源以迫使某人做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aim was to <b>starve</b> the enemy <b>into submission</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 目的是断绝敌人的粮食，迫使他们屈服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'starve sb/sth of sth </b><br>to prevent sb/sth from having sth that they want or need使…得不到…；使缺乏所需:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The project is being starved of funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个项目正苦于缺少资金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby had been starved of oxygen at birth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个婴儿出生时缺氧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Teachers described the students as starved of attention and affection.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教师们说这些学生缺乏关爱。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>deprive sb/sth/yourself of sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Starve sb/sth of sth </b>is usually used in the passive. <b>starve sb/sth of sth </b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> STARVE FOR STH,STARVE SB/STH FOR STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,starve sb 'out </b><br>to force sb to leave a place by not allowing them to get food以断绝食物来源迫使某人出来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took a month to starve them out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给他们断绝食物一个月才把他们迫了出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A few rebels remain in the area. The rest have been starved out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 少数反叛者还留在那个地区，其余的都饿得跑出来了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

stave	<h3>stave<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stave sth 'in </b><br>to break sth by hitting it with force and making part of it fall inwards使向内塌陷；压凹；撞扁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The side of the boat was staved in when it hit the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船触礁把船舷撞扁了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stave sth 'off </b><br>to prevent sth unpleasant from happening for a period of time; to delay sth unpleasant暂时挡住，避开﹙某事﹚；延缓，推迟﹙令人不快的事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to stave off hunger/illness</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暂时解飢/缓解病情</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp desperate attempts to stave off civil war </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孤注一掷地避免内战的努力</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I staved off jet lag with a bath and an early night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我洗了个澡又提前睡下，免除飞行时差的反应。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>avert sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
stay	<h3>stay<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stay a'head; ,stay a'head of sb/sth </b><br>to succeedin remaining further forward in space,time, development, success, etc.保持领先地位；占上风:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to keep an eye on our competitors if we want to stay ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要保持领先地位，就得对竞争对手时刻留神。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stayed ahead of me throughout the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个赛跑中他一直冲在我前面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp More investment is needed if we are to <b>stay ahead of the game</b> }(= be more successfulthan our competitors&b{).</font></i><br><font </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道他会不会生我们的气，不过我不会傻等着弄清楚的！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stay a'way (from sb/sth)</b><br>to not go near sb/sthdangerous or unpleasant; to have nothing to dowith sb/sth离开，不接近﹙危险或讨厌的人或事物﹚；不去﹙某处﹚；不沾染﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stay away from the edge!</font></i><br><font steep	<h3>steep<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'steep sth in sth </b><br>to put food in a liquid and leave it for some time so that it becomes soft and flavoured by the liquid将﹙食物﹚浸泡在﹙液体﹚中:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Raspberries are delicious steeped in brandy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 悬鈎子用白兰地浸泡味道很好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'steep yourself in sth;be 'steeped in sth (<i>formal</i>)</b><br>to spend a lot of time doing sth or thinking about sth and learn a lot about it沉浸于；潜心于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp teenagers steeping themselves in pop culture </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 沉迷于通俗文化的青少年</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was steeped in the family business from an early age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从早年起就潜心经营家族企业。</font><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is mainly used in written English.这个短语动词主要用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep ◆ be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'steeped in sth <i>(written</i>)</b><br>to have a lot of a particular quality深深浸淫；饱含﹙某品质﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a city steeped in history and tradition </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有着悠久历史和丰富传统的一个城市</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>history,tradition</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n
steer	<h3>steer<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,steer a'way from sth </b><br>to avoid discussing sth or becoming involved with sb/sth, because it may cause problems避免谈论某事；把话题引开；避开某人﹙或某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to steer away from the subject of divorce.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我设法避开离婚这个话题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane tends to steer away from sugary foods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简一般不吃甜食。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
stem	<h3>stem<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stem from sth </b><br>(<i>not used in the progressive tenses</i>不用于进行时) to be caused by sth; to be the result of sth起源于；根源是；是……的结果:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many of her problems stem from the fact that her parents are famous.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的很多问题根源于她的父母是名人这一现实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their opposition stems from fear and ignorance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们反对是出于惧怕和无知。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>problem,difficulty </b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the fact that…</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
step	<h3>step<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step a'side/ 'down (as/from sth) </b><br>to leave an important job or position in order to let sb else take your place让位；退位；让出…职位:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After 10 years as party leader, it’s time for him to step aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他当了10 年的党领导，现在该让贤了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He decided to step aside as company director to make way for his son.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他决定把公司董事的位置让给儿子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I intended to step down as Chairman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想辞去主席职务。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s stepping down from her post next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她明年就要退职了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'back </b><br>(from sth) to try to think calmly about a situation in which you have been closely involved, as if you are not involved in it跳出﹙某事物的﹚圈子看问题；旁观:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should try to step back from the problem and look for a new way to deal with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该试着从旁观者的角度看待这个问题，寻找新的处理方法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand back (&b{from sth</b> )}<br>to feel as if you have moved backwards to an earlier period of history彷彿回到﹙某历史时期﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you enter the cathedral you <b>step back in time</b> to the 15th Century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一进大教堂，你就有一种回到了15世纪的感觉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'down(as/from sth)=STEP ASIDE/DOWN</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand down (as/from sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'forward </b><br>to offer to help sb, give information,money, etc.主动站出来﹙帮忙、提供信息、出钱等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A soft drinks company has stepped forward to sponsor the team.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一家软饮料公司提出赞助这个队。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'in </b><br>to help in an argument or a difficult situation援之以手；居间调停；居中斡旋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When my mum was ill, my aunt stepped in to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我妈妈生病时，姨妈前来帮忙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Youth Club was going to close, but a local bank stepped in with a generous donation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 青年俱乐部即将关闭时，当地一家银行出来捐了一大笔款。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'step on it <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>used especially to tell sb to drive faster﹙尤用以要求加速驾驶﹚开快些，赶快:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Step on it! We’re late already! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开快点！我们都迟到了！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll have to really step on it to be there by noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要想中午赶到那里，就真的得加速了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Step on it! I need those figures by lunchtime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 麻利点！午饭之前我需要那些数据。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+it<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'out <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to leave a place for a short period离开一小会儿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s just stepped out for ten minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就出去了十分钟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step 'up(to sb/sth) </b><br>to come forward走上前去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stepped up to receive his award.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他走上前去领奖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The runners stepped up to the line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赛跑运动员走向起跑线。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,step sth 'up </b><br>to increase the rate, level, amount,etc. of sth增加，提高﹙速度、水平、数量等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Security has been stepped up at the airport since the bomb scare.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自炸弹恐慌以来，机场已加强了安全措施。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Police have stepped up their search for the missing schoolgirl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方加紧了对失捬女学生的搜寻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>campaign,pressure,security,production,efforts</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
stick	<h3>stick<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]<b>Stick</b> is often used as an informal way of saying <b>put</b> . <b>stick</b> 常作<b>put</b> 的非正式说法。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick a'round <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to stay in or near a place, waiting for sth to happen, sb to arrive, etc.不走开；呆在原地﹙附近﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick around, we need all the help we can get.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别走开，我们需要任何可能得到的帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stick around here in case Maya arrives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我就待在这儿，说不定马娅会来呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stick at sth </b><br>to work continuously at sth in a determined way坚持不懈地做﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we stick at it, we should finish the job today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只要不停地干，今天应该能把活干完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She never sticks at anything for very long.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她做任何事都缺乏恒心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>keep at sth;persevere with sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>stick sth 'back <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to return sth to its usual place; to return sth to the place it was before把…放回﹙原位﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick the cake back in the oven for ten minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把蛋糕放回烤箱里烤十分钟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you’ve finished with the dictionary, just stick it back on the shelf.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你用完词典就把它放回书架上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth back</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stick by sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to be loyal to sb and continue to support them in difficult times坚持忠于，不离弃﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stuck by him through thick and thin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在任何情况下她都对他忠贞不渝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand by sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stick by sth </b><br>to do what you said, planned or promised you would do, even though the situation might have changed信守， 遵守， 贯彻﹙计划、承诺等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spite of what’s happened, we must stick by our decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管出现了这种事，我们必须坚持执行我们的决定。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The developer wants to stick by his original plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开发商想坚持执行原来的计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand by sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stick sth 'down </b><br>to fix a piece of paper, etc. to sth else using glue﹙用胶水﹚把…粘住，把…贴好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t stick the corners of this wallpaper down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没法粘住墙纸的角。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The envelope hadn’t been stuck down properly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 信封没粘好。</font><br>(<i>informal</i>) to place sth that you are holding onto the floor or another surface把…放下﹙ 或放好﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick your coat on the chair and come and sit down here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的外套放在椅子上，过来坐这儿吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth down</b><br>(in/on sth) (<i>informal</i>)to write or note sth down quickly﹙迅速﹚写下，记下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick it all down on paper before you forget.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这个全写下来，以免忘了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth down;jot sth down;note sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stick in sth </b><br>if something sharp <b>sticks in</b> sth,it goes into sth, making a small hole, and stays there插入，刺进﹙…里﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The arrow whizzed past and stuck in the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 箭嗖的一声飞过去插在那棵树上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These poles stick in the ground easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些杆子很容易插进地面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Something was sticking in my back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有什么东西戳着我的背。</font><br>if something <b>sticks in</b> a place, it stays there and does not move卡在﹙某处﹚；﹙在某物中﹚卡住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A crumb stuck in my throat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有个食物屑卡在我的嗓子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve <b>got</b> my finger <b>stuck</b> in the bottle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的手指卡在瓶子里拔不出来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) The words stuck in my throat }(= I couldn’t say them)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有口难言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) Her words stuck in my mind/memory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的话铭刻在我的脑海/记忆中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick sth 'in/ 'into sth; ,stick sth 'in </b><br><i>(informal</i>)to put sth into sth把…放入﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stuck the letter in my pocket to read later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把信塞进衣兜，等以后再看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He saw the hole and stuck his finger in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看见那个小孔就把手指伸了进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stuck my feet into my slippers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把脚伸进拖鞋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Timmy stuck his thumb in his mouth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 蒂米把拇指咬在嘴里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth in,put sth in/into sth</b><br>to put sth sharp into sth, making a small hole把﹙尖利物﹚刺入，穿入﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ouch! I’ve stuck the needle in my finger! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哎哟！我的手指被针扎了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>knife,needle </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to include sth in a story, a letter, etc.将…写进小说﹙或信等﹚；把…加进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Should I stick this paragraph in or leave it out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我是否该把这个段落加进去呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stick in something about football to make the article more interesting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来加点关于足球的内容，这样就能给文章增添趣味。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth in,put sth in/into sth </b><br>to attach sth firmly to sth, using tape or glue把…粘贴﹙在…上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to stick the new photos in my album.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要把新照片贴在我的相册里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp stick/poke your 'oar/ 'nose into sth (<i>informal</i>)<br>to try to become involved in sth that does not concern you多管闲事；干预，插手﹙别人的事﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,get stuck 'in; ,get stuck 'into sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to start doing sth in an enthusiastic way; to become very interested and involved in sth热情地开始﹙做某事﹚；热切地参与﹙某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must be hungry. Get stuck in! }(= start eating)&b{</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一定饿了。快吃吧！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was too tired to get really stuck into the debate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我疲乏得没法真正投入这场争辩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]get+v+adv ◆ get+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick sth 'on <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to switch on a piece of electrical equipment打开﹙ 电器﹚ 开关:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stick the kettle on for a cup of tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来烧壶水，沏杯茶。</font><br>to put on clothes穿上﹙衣服﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll just stick a jacket on, and I’m ready.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我套件上衣就行了。</font><br>to begin to cook food开始烹制食物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stick the potatoes on and then I’ll make us a coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我来把土豆做上，然后给咱们弄杯咖啡。</font><br>to make a tape, a CD, etc. begin to play播放﹙磁带、激光唱片等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick on some music, if you like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喜欢的话就放点音乐吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n <br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick sth 'on; ,stick sth 'on/'onto sth </b><br>to attach sth firmly to a surface, using glue, tape,etc.把…粘贴﹙到…上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stuck the label on with adhesive tape.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用黏胶带贴上标籤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sealed the envelope, and stuck a stamp on it.</font></i><br><font stick-on object has glue on one side so that it can be attached to sth可粘贴的；一面带黏胶的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp stickon badges/labels </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 带黏胶的标记/标籤</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick sth 'on sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to put sth somewhere in a casual way把…随便放在﹙某处﹚；扔；丢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stick your report on my desk when you’ve finished it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把报告写完就放在我的写字枱上吧。</font><br>to add an amount of money to the price or cost of sth把﹙某数额﹚加在﹙价格或成本﹚上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They can’t just stick an extra 20p on the price of cigarettes! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不能就这么把香烟价格提高20便士！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth on sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick 'out </b><br>to be very noticeable or easy to see醒目；显眼；引人注目:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wrote the notice in red so that it would stick out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用红字写出通知，这样会显眼一些。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) One of the boys in the class sticks out in my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 班里有个男孩给我的印象特别深刻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stand out <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp stick out a 'mile <br>to be very noticeable or easy to see十分显眼；显而易见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dressed like that, you stick out a mile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你打扮成那样，可真够出风头的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It stuck out a mile that she was lying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她显然是在说谎。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>stick out like a sore 'thumb</b><br>to be very different from others, especially in an unpleasant way扎眼；招眼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The red house stuck out like a sore thumb among the old stone cottages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那所红房子在陈旧的小石屋中间很扎眼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick 'out; ,stick 'out of sth </b><br>to be further out than sth else; to be partly outside sth such as a container突出；﹙从容器等中﹚伸出，探出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ears stick out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他长着一对招风耳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a newspaper sticking out of her coat pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她外衣兜里露出了一截报纸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick sth 'out; ,stick sth 'out of sth </b><br>to make sth, especially part of your body, come through a hole使﹙尤指身体部位﹚伸出；使探出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you want to turn right, stick out your hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是想向右转就伸出手。</font><br><i><font
