[OBJ]<b>head,tongue</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>poke sth out,poke sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp stick your 'neck out (<i>informal</i>)<br>to do or say sth when there is a risk you may be wrong做有风险的事；冒险说没有把握的话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to stick my neck out and say that we’ll have a dry summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不一定对，但我还是要说这个夏天会乾旱的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick it/sth 'out </b><br>to continue doing sth difficult or boring until it is finished坚持到底；忍受下去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t like being on my own, but I’ll stick it out until my parents come back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢独自在家，但我会坚持等到父母回来的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m amazed that she’s stuck the course out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得很意外，她居然耐着性子把课学完了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick 'out for sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to refuse to give up until you get what you want坚持要求；得不到……不罢休:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re sticking out for a higher pay rise.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们坚持要求更大幅度地提高工资。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hold out for sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick 'through; ,stick 'through sth </b><br>if sth<b>sticks through</b> or <b>sticks through sth</b>, it goes from one side of sth to the other and it is partly outside从…的一边伸到另一边；穿过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His head was sticking through the railings.</font></i><br><font problems坚持﹙做某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He found it difficult to stick to a diet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要经常按规定饮食，他觉得很困难。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> STICK WITH STH 1; STAY WITH STH<br>to continue doing or using sth and not want to change it坚持； 维持；固守；坚持保留:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m sticking to my previous [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp stick to your 'guns <br>to refuse to change your mind about sth even when other people are trying to persuade you that you are wrong坚持己见；一意孤行<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stick to'gether <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to remain friendly and loyal to one another; to support each other彼此友好忠诚；团结在一起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The family should stick together at a time like this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这样的时期，全家人应该团结一致。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children from the village tended to stick 'up </b><br>to attach sth to a wall, a noticeboard,a window, etc. so that people can see it张贴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had stuck up posters everywhere advertising the I’ve been stitched up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没干那事！有人诬陷我！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>frame sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stitch sth 'up </b><br>to join things together using a needle and thread缝合:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This wound has to be stitched up urgently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个伤口必须立刻缝合。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>wound</b><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to arrange sth; to complete a business deal安排；做成﹙买卖﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has managed to stitch up major deals all over the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在世界各地做成了几笔大买卖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company has the US market stitched up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司在美国市场已是万无一失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>deal</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sew sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
stock	<h3>stock<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stock 'up(on/with sth) </b><br>to buy or get a lot of sth so that you can use it later贮备，备足﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shops are very busy with people stocking up for the holidays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店里到处是忙于为节日大采购的人们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to stock up on food before all the family arrive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得赶在全家人到来之前备足食物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stock sth 'up (on/with sth) </b><br>to fill sth with goods,food, etc.在…中备足货品﹙或食物等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mum stocked up the freezer for us before she went to the conference.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妈妈去开会之前为我们在冰柜里存满了食物。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
stoke	<h3>stoke<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stoke 'up (on/with sth) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to eat a lot of sth so that you will not feel hungry later预先吃饱；预先吃好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d better stoke up now — we’ve got a long journey in front of us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们现在最好吃得饱饱的——前面的路还很长呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stoke sth 'up </b><br>to keep a fire, etc. burning by adding more fuel往﹙火里等﹚加燃料:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stoked up the fire before going to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他睡前往炉子里加了煤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>fire </b><br>to make people feel sth more strongly使﹙感觉﹚更加强烈；火上加油:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He continued to stoke up hatred in his speeches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在讲话中不断加深人们的仇恨。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Stoke sth</b> can also be used with the same meanings. <b>stoke sth</b>也可作这些含义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

stop	<h3>stop<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop a'round; ,stop a'round sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to make a short visit to sb, usually at their home去看看﹙某人﹚；去﹙某人家﹚坐坐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stop around this evening when I finish work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚下班后要去拜访一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s stop around the Smiths’ house for a quick drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们去史密斯家坐坐喝点东西吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop round;pop over/round <i>(both away</b> is used much more frequently than <b>stop away</b> . <b>stay away</b>比<b>stop away</b>常用得多。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop 'back <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to return to somewhere that you have visited earlier返回，回到﹙先前去过的地方﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll stop back on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回家时会再来一下的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop be'hind (after sth) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to remain somewhere at the end of an event after other people have left﹙ 在他人走后﹚ 留下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stopped behind after the meeting to talk to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会后她留下来和他谈话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stay behind (after sth)</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Stay behind</b> is used more frequently than<b>stop behind</b> . <b>stay behind</b>比<b>stop behind</b> 常用。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop 'by; ,stop 'by sth </b><br>to make a short visit to sb/somewhere, especially when you are on the way to somewhere else过去坐坐；顺路造访:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop by for a chat on your way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你回家时顺路过来聊聊吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you stop by the store for some milk? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能不能顺路进那家店里买点牛奶？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>come by,come by sth;drop by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>stop 'in <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to stay at home rather than go out呆在家里﹙不外出﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve decided to stop in tonight because it’s raining.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下雨了，我们打算今晚留在家里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stay in</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Stay in</b> is used much more frequently than <b>stop in</b> . <b>stay in</b>比<b>stop in</b> 常用得多。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop 'off (at/in…) </b><br>to stop somewhere for a short time when you are on the way to somewhere else中途停留﹙在某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We stopped off for lunch just north of Paris.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就在巴黎的北面中途停下来吃了午饭。</font><br><i><font <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stop-off <i>n </i></b><br>a short stay somewhere during a trip﹙旅程中的﹚中途停留:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a stop-off in Sydney</font></i><br><font stop on an hour after work and help tidy up after the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今晚要晚回家——老板要我加班一小时，会后帮忙收拾一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stay on</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Stay on</b> is used more frequently than <b>stop on</b> . <b>stay on</b>比<b>stop on</b> 常用。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to stay out late at night or all night instead of going home夜里很晚不回家；夜不归宿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He often stops out till three in the 我去哈瓦那途中在梅里达停留了一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'stopover <i>n </i></b><br>a short stay somewhere during a long journey﹙长途旅行的﹚中途停留:<br><i><font journey﹙长途旅行的﹚中途停留地<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stop 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to not go to bed until later than usual熬夜；迟睡:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stopped up to see the football match.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她熬夜看足球赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stay up</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Stay up</b> is used much more frequently than store	<h3>store<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,store sth a'way </b><br>to put sth in a safe place and keep it there so that you can use it later贮存，贮备，贮藏﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We stored away the baby clothes until we had another child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把婴儿服装全都收好了，等再生孩子时又用上了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s amazing how much knowledge he’s got stored away in his memory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他记忆里贮存的知识多得令人吃惊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stored away the information for future use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我存了这条信息等以后用。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,store 'up sth; ,store it 'up </b><br>to not express strong feelings or deal with problems when you have them, often making trouble for yourself in future﹙把强烈的感情或问题﹚郁积，憋在心里；当断不断:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smokers may be storing up health problems for their unborn children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吸烟的人可能给他们的胎儿留下健康隐患。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children who store up their bad feelings often develop headaches or stomach pains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子郁积坏心情常常造成头痛或腹痛现象。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problems,trouble</b><br>[NOTE]A noun must always follow <b>up</b>, but a pronoun comes between the verb and <b>up</b> .名词必须放在<b>up</b> 之后，但代词放在动词和<b>up</b> 之间。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,store sth 'up </b><br>to keep sth so that it can be used later贮存，贮藏﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp animals storing up food for the winter</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贮藏食物准备过冬的动物</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The batteries store up enough energy for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电池可存储足够一周用的能量。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Store sth</b> is also used with this meaning. <b>store sth</b>也作此义。<br>to keep information or facts in your memory to use later﹙在脑中﹚记下，记住﹙信息或事实﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stored up all the amusing and interesting things that happened during the day to tell his family in the evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把白天发生的好笑和有趣的事都记住，等到晚上讲给家人听。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
storm	<h3>storm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,storm 'off </b><br>to leave a place or a person suddenly because you are very angry怒气冲冲地突然离开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had a big argument and he stormed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们大吵一架，然后他愤怒地冲了出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n

to organize things that are confused解决问题﹙或困难﹚；清理；整顿:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was left to straighten out the mess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只留下我来收拾这个烂摊子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s trying to straighten out his finances.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正试图理清他的财务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sort sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,straighten 'up </b><br>to stand up straight from a bent position挺直身子； 站立起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She slowly straightened up and rubbed her back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她慢慢站起来揉了揉背。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,straighten sth 'up </b><br>to make a room, etc. neat and tidy整理；收拾整齐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d better straighten up the house before they get back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最好在他们回来之前把房子收拾好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tidy sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
strain	<h3>strain<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'strain at sth </b><br>to pull very hard on sth用力拉，拽﹙某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog was straining at its lead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那狗用力拖拽着牵狗绳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp strain at the 'leash <br>(<i>informal</i>) to want to do sth very much, especially when sb/sth is trying to stop you迫不及待，急于摆脱束缚﹙做某事﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s straining at the leash to get on with his research.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他急于摆脱束缚继续搞研究。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strain sth 'off </b><br>to separate a liquid from sth solid by pouring it through sth that has very small holes in it滤掉，滤去﹙液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strain off any excess liquid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把多余的液体都滤掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
strap	<h3>strap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strap sb 'in; ,strap yourself 'in; ,strap sb/yourself 'into sth </b><br>to fasten sb/yourself in a seat, etc. using straps给某人﹙或自己﹚系上安全带:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All passengers in the plane must be securely strapped in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机上的所有乘客必须把安全带系牢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Make sure you strap the baby firmly into the high chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子坐高脚椅一定要系牢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you strapped yourselves in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你系好安全带了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strap sth 'on; ,strap sth 'onto sth </b><br>to attach sth to sth else with straps用带子把…捆﹙或系、绑﹚﹙在…上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He strapped on his helmet and rode away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他系好头盔就开车走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She strapped the suitcases onto the roof of the car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把手提箱绑在车顶上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strap sth 'up </b><br>to tie strips of cloth (a <b>bandage</b> )around sth, especially an injured part of the body, to support it or prevent it from moving用绷带包扎﹙ 受伤部位﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your wrist needs to be strapped up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的手腕需要包扎一下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
stress	<h3>stress<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stress sb 'out <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to make sb very anxious and tired so that they are unable to relax使某人过度焦虑﹙或劳累﹚；使心力交瘁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My job really stresses me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的工作实在使我心力交瘁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My Dad stressed me out by criticizing me all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爸爸没完没了地数落我，都快把我逼疯了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stressed 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>too anxious and tired to be able to relax焦虑不安；心力交瘁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I’m stressed out, I try to go for a long walk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我压力过大时，就抽出时间往远处散步。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp stressed-out executives </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 心力交瘁的行政人员</font><br>\n
stretch	<h3>stretch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stretch a'way/ 'out [&b{+adv/prep</b> ] }<br>to spread over a large area of land, especially away from where you are﹙往远处﹚绵延，延伸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mountains stretched away into the distance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 山脉延伸向远方。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Banana plantations stretched away as far as the eye could see.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 极目远望，只见一片香蕉种植园。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>extend</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stretch 'out; ,stretch yourself 'out </b><br>to lie down, with your arms or legs out straight, especially in order to relax or sleep舒展四肢躺下﹙尤指为休息或睡觉﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stretched out on the floor and fell asleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摊开四肢躺在地板上睡了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,stretch sth 'out </b><br>to put your arm or leg out straight, especially in order to reach sth伸手﹙ 或脚﹚﹙够… ﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stretched out a hand to touch his face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她伸手去摸他的脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He leant back and stretched his legs out in front of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他靠后仰，把腿伸向前面。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>arm,hand,leg</b><br>to make sth last as long as possible by not using very much at a time把…﹙按时间﹚摊开来用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s hard to stretch my money out to the end of the month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的钱很难坚持用到月底。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>spin sth out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

strike	<h3>strike<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'strike at sb/sth </b><br>to try to hit sb/sth, especially with a weapon﹙ 用武器﹚ 朝…打去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She screamed and struck at the wolf with a stick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尖叫着用棍子朝那只狼打去。</font><br>to cause damage or have a serious effect on sb/sth损害；有损于；严重影响到:<br><i><font [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike 'back (at/against sb/sth) </b><br>to criticize or attack sb who has criticized or attacked you反击； 回击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sarah used the article to strike back at her critics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨拉借这篇文章反击批评她的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit back (at sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike sb 'down <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>if a disease <b>strikes sb down</b>, it kills them or makes them seriously ill﹙疾病﹚使丧命，使病倒，摧垮:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was struck down by polio at the age of four.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她四岁那年因小儿麻痺症死去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was struck down by flu and had to cancel the trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得了流感，不得不取消旅行。</font><br>to hit sb very hard so that they fall to the ground; to kill sb击倒，撞倒﹙某人﹚；使丧命:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fights broke out near the shop and one girl was struck down by a handbag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 商店附近发生了打斗，一名女孩被一只手提包击倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the spot where Kennedy was struck down </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 肯尼迪遇刺的地点</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Strike sb down </b>is often used in the passive.<b>strike sb down </b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike sth 'down <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to reject sth;to make sth no longer valid取消；废止；废除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only the Supreme Court has the power to strike down this legislation.</font></i><br><font 父母们试图使跳舞禁令得以取消。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike 'off=STRIKE OUT 3</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike sb/sth 'off; ,strike sb/sth 'off sth (<i>BrE</i>)</b><br>to remove sb’s name from the list of members of a profession so that they can no longer work in that profession把某人﹙从某专业中﹚除名；取消…资格:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was struck off for professional misconduct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因为渎职被除名了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These doctors should be struck off the medical register.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些医生应该被取消行医资格。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to strike Ashok off my guest list for the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要把阿肖克从宴请名单上画掉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike sth 'off <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to remove sth with a sharp blow; to cut sth off打掉；砍掉；砍下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They struck off his head with a sword.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用剑削掉了他的脑袋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chop sth off <i>(less formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike 'out </b><br>(at sb/sth) to aim a violent blow at sb猛打:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck out at me with his fist.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了我一记重拳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit out (at sb/sth) </b><br>to start being independent and do sth new独立出去；自立谋生:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sanjay left the firm and struck out on his own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桑杰离开了公司自己开业。</font><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,strike 'off</b> <i>less frequent</i>) [<b>+adv/prep</b> ] to start to go somewhere in a determined way毅然走向﹙某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck out across the fields towards the farmhouse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大步流星地穿过田地朝农舍走去。</font><br>(with sb) (<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to fail; to be unsuccessful失败；砸锅:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to get a job but struck out completely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我努力想找份工作，可是彻底失败了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must have struck out with her because he came home early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他肯定和她没戏了，因为他很早就回家了。</font><br>(at sb/sth) to criticize sb/sth, especially publicly﹙尤指公开﹚抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp striking out at your critics </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 驳斥别人对你的批评</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hit out (at sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike 'out; ,strike sb 'out <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>(in baseball棒球) to fail to hit the ball successfully three times and so finish your turn; to make sb do this﹙使﹚三击不中出局:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He struck out in the third inning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在第三局三击不中出局了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pitcher struck out three batters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 投手使三名击球员三击未中出局。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strike sth 'out/ 'through <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to remove sth from a text or a list by drawing a line through it画掉；删去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I struck out some words to make the telegram shorter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我删掉一些字，把电报压缩了一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He insisted that I strike out all references to his family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坚持要我删掉所有提及他的家庭的内容。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cross sth out/through</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp string	<h3>string<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string a'long (with sb) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to go somewhere or do sth with sb else, especially because you have nothing else to do﹙闲时﹚伴随﹙某人﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m free this morning. Can I string along with you when you go to the shops? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我今天上午有空。能跟你去商店吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>tag along (behind/with sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string sb a'long <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to allow sb to believe sth that is not true for a long period of time,especially when you encourage them to have false hopes一直让某人相信﹙不真实的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They never really intended to give her a job. They were just stringing her along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们从未真正想过要给她一份工作。他们只不过是吊吊她的胃口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He strung her along for years and then married somebody else.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他耍弄了她好几年，后来却娶了别人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string 'out (across/along sth) </b><br>to spread out in a line分开成一列:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As we climbed, we tended to string out, with the fittest people taking the lead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们爬山时一般会拉长阵线，由最强壮的人领头。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string sth 'out </b><br>to make sth last longer than expected or necessary延长；把…的时间拖长:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t want to string out the argument.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无意把这场辩论拖延下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string sth to'gether </b><br>to combine words,phrases, sentences, etc. to form sth that has some meaning把﹙单词、短语、句子等﹚联成有意义的单位:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can barely string together two words of German.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我勉强懂得说一两句德语。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The report should be written by somebody who can string two sentences together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份报告应该让会摆弄文笔的人来写。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>words,a sentence</b><br>to join a series of things together把﹙一系列事物﹚连接起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp pearls strung together on a necklace</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 穿在项链上的珍珠</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The student of kung fu learns various movements that are then strung together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学功夫的人先学会各种基本动作，然后组合成一套一套的动作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to kill sb by hanging them, especially illegally﹙尤指非法地﹚吊死某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ll string him up if they catch him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一抓住他，就会把他吊死。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,string sth 'up </b><br>to hang or tie sth in place悬挂；系起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She strung up a banner saying ‘Happy 40th Birthday’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她挂起一条横幅， 上面写着“ 祝贺40 大寿”。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
strip	<h3>strip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strip sth a'way </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) to completely remove a layer of sth that is covering sth else剥去；剥下；揭去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strip away the paint to reveal the wood underneath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把油漆刮掉，露出下面的木头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bark has been stripped away from the tree.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树皮已经剥光了。</font><br>to remove anything that is not true and necessary to reveal what sb/sth is really like揭去，揭穿，清除﹙虚假或不必要的东西﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you strip away the jargon, he really has nothing sensible to say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去掉术语之后，他实际上没有说任何有道理的东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The programme stripped away the mystery surrounding the royal family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个节目揭开了王室的神秘面纱。</font><br>to remove or get rid of sth that has existed for a long time剥夺，去除﹙存在已久的事物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our basic rights are being stripped away by these laws.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些法规正在剥夺我们的基本权利。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strip sth 'down </b><br>to separate a machine or an engine into parts, especially in order to clean or repair it拆开，拆卸﹙机器或引擎﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to strip down the engine and replace the worn parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得拆开引擎更换磨损了的部件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car was stripped down and sold for parts.</font></i><br><font 'down to sth </b><br>to take off your clothes until you are only wearing the items mentioned脱得只剩下…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stripped down to my underwear for the massage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我脱得只剩下内衣，等着按摩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep+noun<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strip sth 'from sth=STRIP STH OFF,STRIP STH OFF/FROM STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'strip sb/sth of sth </b><br>to take away a right, a privilege,property, etc. that sb has, as a punishment取消…的权利﹙或特权、财产等﹚；使…丧失权利等﹙作为惩罚﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was stripped of his title for refusing to fight in Britain }(= for example, in boxing&b{).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为拒绝在英国比赛而被取消了头衔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stripped me of my citizenship and deported me.他们剥夺我的公民资格，将我驱逐出境。</font></i><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>divest sb/sth of sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Strip sb of sth </b>is often used in the passive. <b>strip sb of sth </b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,strip 'off; ,strip sth 'off <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>if you<b>strip off</b>, or <b>strip sth off</b>, you take off all or nearly all your clothes﹙几乎﹚脱光衣服:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stripped off and dived into the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她脱了衣服就跳入水中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Strip off your wet clothes and put on these dry sum	<h3>sum<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sum 'up; ,sum sth 'up </b><br>to give the main points of sth in a few words总结；概括:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Before we conclude the meeting, let me sum up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议结束之前，我来总结一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To sum up, there are three main ways of tackling the problem…</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 概括起来说，这一问题主要有三种处理办法…</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In her conclusion, she summed up what had been agreed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在总结中概括了已达成的共识。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>summarize,summarize sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>(of a judge 法官) to give the main points of the evidence or arguments in a legal case, near the end of the trial﹙ 根据证据﹚ 做概述:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he summed up, the judge reminded the jury of the seriousness of the case.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官在概述证据时提醒陪审团注意案件的严重性。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,summing-'up <i>n </i></b><br>a speech made by the judge to the jury near the end of the trial, giving the main points of the evidence and the arguments in the case证据概述﹙法官综述证据，提请陪审员注意﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge will begin her summing-up on Monday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官将于周一开始进行概述。</font><br>an occasion when sb states the main points of an argument, etc.总结； 概括:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a final summing-up by each of the speakers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每位演讲者都作了最后总结。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speakers gave brief summings-up of their talks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲者对他们的讲话进行了简要总结。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>sum sb/sth 'up </b><br>to describe or show the most typical characteristics of sb/sth, especially in a few words扼要描述人﹙或事物﹚；简而言之:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His speech summed up the mood of the whole country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的讲话简要描述了整个国家的气氛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Totally lazy — that just about sums him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 懒到家了——这大体上就是他的真实写照。</font><br>(as sb/sth) to decide or express what you think about sb/sth估量，判断﹙人或事物﹚；视某人﹙或事物﹚为……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two of them stood there, summing each other up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们俩站在那儿，相互打量着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had already summed her up as someone who hated to admit defeat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已经把她归为那种不愿认输的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I summed up the situation immediately }(= realized what was happening and what needed to be done)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我立刻看出是怎么回事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>size sb/sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
summon	<h3>summon<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,summon sth 'up </b><br>to manage to produce a particular feeling in yourself, although this is difficult设法激起﹙感情﹚；鼓起﹙勇气﹚；振作﹙ 精神﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She eventually summoned up the courage to knock at the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她最终鼓起勇气敲了门。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He managed to summon up a smile.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他挤出了一个笑容。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t summon up much enthusiasm for grammar! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无法对语法产生多大热情！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t think I can summon up the energy to go for a run.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我拿不出劲头去跑步了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>courage,smile,energy,strength</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>muster sth up</b><br>In this meaning <b>summon sth up</b> is not used in the passive.<b>summon sth up </b>作此义时不用于被动语态。<br><b>Summon sth</b> is sometimes used with this meaning. <b>summon sth</b>有时作此义。<br>to make an idea, a feeling, a memory, etc. come into your mind唤起；使想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a smell that summons up memories of my childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那种气味会唤起我童年的记忆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>memories,vision,image</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>evoke sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
surge	<h3>surge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,surge 'through sb </b><br>if a feeling <b>surges through</b> you, you suddenly feel it very strongly﹙某种感觉﹚ 传遍全身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A thrill of excitement surged through Isobel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伊泽贝尔突然感到一阵激动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>relief,excitement,anger</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SURGE UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,surge 'up <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>if an emotion <b>surges up</b> in you, you suddenly feel it very strongly﹙情绪﹚高涨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Panic surged up inside her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她突然感到十分恐慌。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Surge up</b> is usually used with another adverb or a phrase beginning with a preposition.<b>surge up</b>通常与其他副词或介词短语连用。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> SURGE THROUGH SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'upsurge (in/of sth) <i>n </i></b><br>[<i>usually </i>sing.] a sudden great increase in sth激增；急剧上升；飚升:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There has been a recent upsurge of violence in the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 近日区内暴力事件急增。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an upsurge of interest in science and technology </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对科学技术的兴趣倍增</font><br>\n
surrender	<h3>surrender<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>sur'render to sb/sth;sur'render yourself to sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to stop trying to resist a feeling,a particular person, etc. and let them control what you do任随别人﹙或感觉等﹚控制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He surrendered to his natural instinct to run away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他克制不住，本能地逃跑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She surrendered to Leo’s charm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抵挡不住利奥的魅力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He surrendered himself to sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不知不觉睡着了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+pron+prep<br>\n
suss	<h3>suss<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,suss sb/sth 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to find out what sb/sth is really like; to understand the important things about sb/sth发现…的真相；了解…的本质:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My classmates were sussing me out, seeing how tough I was.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的同学开始了解我，看出我有多坚强。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ll need to suss out our opponents before the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在比赛前要摸清对手的底细。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got him sussed out now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在看清他的真面目了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jen had sussed out right away that there was something strange going on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 詹一眼就看出情况有些不对头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Simon always did what his family wanted. I soon sussed that out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 西蒙总是顺着家人的意思去做。我很快就了解到这一点。</font><br><b>Suss sb/sth</b> can be used with a similar meaning.表达相近含义可用<b>suss sb/sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got him sussed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看清他的真面目了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
swallow	<h3>swallow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swallow sb/sth 'up </b><br>to completely cover sb/sth or absorb them/it, so that they can no longer be seen or do not exist separately吞没，淹没﹙某人或物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He watched them walk away until the darkness swallowed them up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他目送他们走远，直到消失在黑夜里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was so embarrassed she wished that the ground would open and swallow her up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她尴尬极了，简直希望地面裂开把她吞没。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The countryside is rapidly being swallowed up by building developments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乡村地区正被建筑开发迅速侵吞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many small businesses have been swallowed up by larger companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很多小公司被较大的公司兼併了。</font><br><b>Swallow sb/sth</b> is sometimes used with this meaning. <b>swallow sb/sth</b>有时作此义:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wished that the ground would open up and swallow her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她希望地面裂开把她吞没。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swallow sth 'up </b><br>to use sth such as money or resources completely﹙把钱或资源等﹚用光，用尽，耗尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Practising the piano swallows up all her free time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 练钢琴占用了她的所有闲暇时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pay rises were quickly swallowed up by price increases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工资的增长很快就被物价的提高抵消了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nuclear weapons swallowed up a third of the country’s defence spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 核武器用掉了国防开支的三分之一。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The extra money was swallowed up by debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剩余的钱都用来还债了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>time,money</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>use sth up</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Swallow sth up </b>is often used in the passive.<b>swallow sth up </b>常用于被动语态。 <br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
swan	<h3>swan<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swan a'bout/a'round; ,swan a'bout/a'round sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to move around or go from one place to another enjoying yourself, but with no real purpose﹙悠闲自得地﹚晃荡；闲逛:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop swanning about pretending to be clever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别自以为是地晃荡了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s swanning around Europe for the summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她夏天要在欧洲转悠。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swan 'off (to…) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>) </b><br>to go off to enjoy yourself with no real purpose外出闲荡找乐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always swanning off to Spain on holiday! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一有假期就去西班牙悠闲作乐！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
swap (<i>also </i> swop)	<h3>swap (<i>also </i> swop)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swap a'round/ 'over/ 'round <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>if two people <b>swap around/over/round</b>, they move to where the other person was before or start doing each other’s jobs﹙俩人﹚对调位置，交换工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll drive there and you can read the map. We’ll swap over on the way back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去时我开车，你看地图。回来时我们交换位置。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>change over/round <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swap sb/sth a'round/ 'over/ 'round <i>(informal</i>,<i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to replace sb/sth with sb/sth else用…替换﹙某人或物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At half-time the manager swapped some of the players around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理在半场时把几名队员换下了场。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>change sb/sth round/around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swap 'over (to sth), ,swap sb/sth 'over (to sth)</b><br>to change from one situation, position, etc. to another; to make sb do this﹙使…﹚从一种情况﹙或位置等﹚转换到另一种:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We swapped over from an electric cooker to a gas cooker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们从电炉灶具换到了煤气炉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you been swapped over to the new computer system yet? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人给你换上新计算机系统了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>switch over,switch sth over,switch sb over</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
swarm	<h3>swarm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swarm with sb/sth </b><br><i>(usually used in the progressive tenses </i>通常用于进行时) if a place is <b>swarming with</b> sb/sth, it is very full of people or things moving around到处是人﹙或物﹚在移动；挤满活动着的…… :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The museum was swarming with tourists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 博物馆里挤满了游客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room was hot and swarming with flies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里很热，到处是苍蝇。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
swear	<h3>swear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swear by sb </b><br>(not used in the progressive tenses不用于进行时) to name sb in order to show that you are making a serious promise以… 名义发誓；起誓；立誓:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I swear by Almighty God that I will tell the truth }(= for example, said in a British court of law)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我向全能的上帝起誓，我以下所说句句属实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swear by sth/sb </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to believe strongly that sth/sb is very useful and helpful极信赖；对…推崇备至:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My brother swears by lemon and honey drinks as a cold remedy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我哥哥深信柠檬加蜂蜜饮料能治疗感冒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t you go and see Dr. Nash? My mother swears by him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你干吗不去看纳什医生呢？我母亲对他十分推崇。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swear sb 'in; ,swear sb 'into sth </b><br>to introduce sb publicly to a new position, responsibility, etc.by getting them to promise that they will do the job correctly, be loyal to the organization, their country, etc.使某人宣誓就职；使某人宣誓忠于某组织﹙ 或国家等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sworn in as President in January.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他于一月份宣誓就任总统。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new President was hurriedly sworn into office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新总统急急忙忙宣誓就职。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Swear sb in</b> and <b>swear sb into sth</b> are often used in the passive. <b>swear sb in </b>和<b>swear sb into sth</b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swearing-'in <i>n </i></b><br>[U] [sing.] the act of getting sb to promise publicly to do their job correctly, be loyal to their organization or country, etc. before they begin a new job or responsibility宣誓就职:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The swearing-in of the new president will take place tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新总统将于明天宣誓就职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a swearing-in ceremony </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宣誓就职典礼</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swear 'off sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to make a serious promise that you will give sth up,especially sth that is bad or harmful发誓放弃﹙ 尤指坏的或有害事物﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s intending to swear off alcohol.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有意发誓戒酒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ever since her boyfriend left she has sworn off men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自从她的男友离开之后，她发誓不再和男性来往。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swear to sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to say that sth is definitely true断言；肯定；保证:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’ve met him somewhere before, but I <b>couldn’t swear to it</b> }(=I’m not completely certain)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得我在什么地方见过他，不过我不敢肯定。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swear sb to sth </b><br>to make sb promise sth, especially that they will not tell other people sth使某人发誓﹙要保守秘密等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The actors know how the series will end but they are <b>sworn to secrecy</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演员们知道连续剧的结局，但他们按要求发誓保密。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jeff told me about his promotion and swore me <b>to silence</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰夫告诉我他要升职，要我别吭声。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
sweat	<h3>sweat<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweat sth 'off </b><br>to lose weight by doing a lot of hard exercise to make yourself hot and produce sweat通过排汗减轻体重:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I sweated off the extra weight by playing squash every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我每天靠打壁球出一身汗减掉多余的体重。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweat sth 'out</b><br>to get rid of a cold, fever, etc. by staying warm so that you produce sweat通过发汗治好感冒﹙或发烧等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Whenever I get a bad fever I go to bed and sweat it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一发高烧就卧床发发汗把它治好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cold,fever </b><br><b>,sweat it 'out</b> to wait for sth that you feel nervous or anxious about to happen or to end熬过；焦急地等待到最后:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They made us sweat it out for two hours until the result was announced.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们让我们苦等了两个钟头才宣布结果。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Sweat sth out </b>is not used in the passive.<b>sweat sth out </b>不用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'sweat over sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to work very hard on sth; to spend a lot of time doing sth or worrying about sth努力做某事；耗费时间做﹙或操心﹚某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been sweating over my letter of resignation for several days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经花了几天时间写辞职信了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
sweep	<h3>sweep<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sb a'long/a'way </b><br>to make sb feel very enthusiastic about sth or involved in sth; to affect sb so much they forget everything else使某人醉心﹙或专注于…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Anna was swept along by her father’s enthusiasm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲的热情使安娜也激动起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry sb along;be/get carried away</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Sweep sb along/away </b>is usually used in the passive. <b>sweep sb along/away</b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sb a'side </b><br>to defeat sb easily轻易战胜某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp United swept Liverpool aside with ease.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联队轻而易举地把利物浦队打败。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth a'side </b><br>to ignore sth; to treat sth as though it is not important对…置之不理；不理会；无视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All their objections were swept aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没人理会他们的所有反对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sweeps aside every suggestion I make.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把我的所有建议都当成了耳边风。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>objections,protests,restrictions,opposition,criticism</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Sweep sth aside </b>is often used in the passive. <b>sweep sth aside </b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sb a'way=SWEEP SB ALONG/AWAY</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth a'way </b><br>to destroy or get rid of sth completely消灭；彻底消除；完全打消:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The President’s speech swept away all our doubts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 总统的讲话消除了我们的一切疑虑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Poverty will be swept away! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贫穷将被消灭！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old way of life has been swept away by the electronic revolution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电子革命使旧的生活方式不复存在。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth 'back/ 'up </b><br>if you <b>sweep</b> your hair<b>back</b> or <b>up</b>, you brush or push it away from your face﹙把头发﹚往后梳理，梳到头上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She swept her hair back from her face with both hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用双手把头发从面颊抹到后面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Long hair can be swept up on top of your head.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 长头发可以盘在头上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hair</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth 'off; ,sweep sth 'off sth </b><br>to remove sth from somewhere, especially by brushing with your hands, a brush, etc.﹙从…﹚扫走…，擦掉…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swept the crumbs off the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把桌上的麵包屑扫掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) The wind swept her hat off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风把她的帽子吹走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp ,sweep sb off their 'feet <br>to make sb fall suddenly and deeply in love with you使某人一见倾心；使某人立刻迷上自己:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Maria was swept off her feet by Mark’s charm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马克的魅力使玛丽亚一见倾心。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth 'out </b><br>to clean a room, a cupboard, etc.with a large brush with a long handle (a <b>broom</b> )打扫，清扫乾净﹙房间、橱柜等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Brad was busy sweeping out the yard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布拉德忙着扫院子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sb 'up </b><br>to lift sb with a sudden smooth movement一把抱起某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran forward and swept her up in his arms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跑上前去一把将她抱在怀里。</font><br>to make sb become very involved in sth so that they are unable to think clearly使沉醉于…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole country was swept up in the excitement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全国上下都沉浸在兴奋的气氛中。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>be/get caught up (in sth)</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Sweep sb up</b> is often used in the passive in this meaning.<b>sweep sb up</b>作此义时常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep 'up; ,sweep sth 'up </b><br>to remove dust,dirt, etc. from a floor with a brush扫地；清扫﹙灰尘等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to sweep up before we left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们临走之前得清扫地板。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d better sweep up all the bits of broken glass quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最好快点把玻璃碴子扫乾净。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweep sth 'up=SWEEP STH BACK/UP</b><br>\n
sweeten	<h3>sweeten<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,sweeten sb 'up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to try to persuade sb to help you, agree to sth, etc. by giving them gifts,being very nice to them, etc.哄某人﹙帮忙、同意等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you sweeten him up he’ll do the work for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是哄哄他，他就会帮你干活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sweeten up customers with special offers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用特别优惠吸引顾客。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

swing	<h3>swing<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swing a'round; ,swing sb/sth a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,swing 'round, ,swing sb/sth 'round) </b><br>to turn around fast to face the other way; to make sb/sth do this﹙使某人﹚猛地转身；猛地掉转﹙ 某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Luke suddenly swung round and glared at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卢克突然转过身来瞪着我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I swung the car round and drove back down the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我猛地掉转车头沿路开车返回。</font><br>to change from one idea, opinion, etc. to another,especially the opposite one﹙使﹚改变主意﹙或想法等﹚；﹙使﹚改弦易辙:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Labour Party has now swung round to supporting Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工党现在已经改弦更张，转而支持欧洲了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should be able to swing people round to your point of view.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该有能力扭转人们的想法，接受你的观点。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'swing at sb;'swing sth at sb </b><br>to try to hit sb﹙用…﹚朝某人打去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She swung at me with the iron bar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抡着根铁棍向我打过来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swing 'by; ,swing 'by sth <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to visit a person or place for a short time, especially when you are going somewhere else进某处一会儿；短暂拜访；看望一下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She swung by }(=came here&b{) on her way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她回家路过时进来了一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s swing by Dave’s house after the movie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们看完电影后顺便到戴夫家去坐坐吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drop by</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swing 'round; ,swing sb/sth 'round <i>(BrE</i>)=SWING AROUND,SWING SB/STH AROUND</b><br>\n
switch	<h3>switch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,switch 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to stop giving your attention to sb or sth不再想着；不考虑；失去兴趣；觉得乏味:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just switch off when Jo starts talking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一听见乔讲话就腻味。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you find it hard to switch off }(= stop thinking about work)&b{ when you get home? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你回到家后是不是觉得很难不想工作？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,switch 'off; ,switch sth 'off; ,switch itself 'off </b><br>to stop an electrical device, a machine or an engine working by pressing a switch, a button,etc.关﹙ 电器、机器或引擎﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The heating switches off at 10.00 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚上10 点停止供暖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I switch the lights off? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要不要关了灯？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The electricity has been switched off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电源被切断了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Her smile switched off suddenly when she saw him come in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一看见他进来，她的笑容马上消失了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn off,turn itself off,turn sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>switch on,switch sth on,switch itself on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,switch 'on; ,switch sth 'on; ,switch itself 'on </b><br>to start an electrical device, a machine or an engine by pressing a switch, a button, etc.开﹙电器、机器或引擎﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked in and switched on the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她走进来打开了灯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine switches (<i>itself</i>) on automatically.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台机器能自动开启。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How do you switch this thing on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 怎么把这个打开？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He can switch on the charm whenever he likes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他随时就能发出魅力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>turn on,turn itself on;turn sth on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>switch off,switch sth off,switch itself off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,switch 'over (to sth), ,switch sth 'over (to sth)</b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to change from one television station to another换台；换频道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I switched over to watch the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我换了个频道看看新闻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>change over (to sth); turn over (to sth), turn sth over (to sth) </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,switch sb 'over</b>) to change from one position, situation, job, etc. to another﹙把某人﹚转到另一位置﹙或情况、岗位等上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve finally switched over to a computerized system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最终换上了计算机化系统。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The country gradually switched over from imperial to metric.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国家逐渐从英制转用公制。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 35 000 customers have been switched over to the new system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已经让35 000 个客户转用新系统。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>change over (&b{from sth</b> ) (<b>to sth</b> )}<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
swivel	<h3>swivel<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,swivel a'round; ,swivel sb/sth a'round (<i>also</i> ,swivel 'round, ,swivel sb/sth 'round <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to turn or move your body, eyes or head around quickly to face another direction﹙把身子或脸等﹚转向另一方:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swivelled around to look at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他猛地转过头去看她。</font><br>to turn or make sth turn around a fixed central point﹙使﹚转动，旋转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She swivelled the chair around to face them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把椅子转过来面向他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

tack	<h3>tack<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tack sth 'on; ,tack sth 'on to sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to add sth as an extra item, especially in a careless way﹙ 不经意地﹚ 附加， 增补， 添加:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The last paragraph seems to have been tacked on at the last minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后一段像是在最后一分钟加上的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An extra day has been tacked onto the New Year holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新年休假额外增加了一天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a porch tacked on to the front of the house </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接在房子前面的门廊</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>add sth on,add sth on to sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Tack sth on</b> and <b>tack sth on to sth</b> are often used in the passive. <b>tack sth on</b>和<b>tack sth on to sth</b>常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TAG STH ON,TAG STH ON TO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
tag	<h3>tag<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tag a'long (behind/with sb) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to go somewhere with sb, especially when you have not been invited﹙尤指未经邀请﹚跟随，尾随:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children tagged along behind their mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们跟在妈妈后面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I tag along (<i>with you</i>) when you go to the shops? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我跟着你去商店好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>string along (with sb)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TAG ON,TAG ON TO SB<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tag 'on; ,tag 'on to sb/sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to follow sb closely and go somewhere with them,although you have not been invited﹙未经邀请﹚紧跟，紧随:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kate’s friend tagged on and spoiled the day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯特的朋友黏着她，弄得大家一天都扫兴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We tagged on to the end of the procession.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们紧紧地跟在游行队伍的末尾。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TAG ALONG (BEHIND/WITH SB)<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tag sth 'on; ,tag sth 'on to sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to add sth as an extra item to the end of sth, especially in a careless way﹙不经意地﹚给…加上，附加:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An apology was tagged on to the end of the letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 信的结尾顺便附了一句抱歉的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Online security is being built in to the system, not tagged on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联机安全措施正被内置在系统中，不是外加的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>add sth on,add sth on to sth</b><br>[NOTE]<b>Tag sth on</b> and <b>tag sth on to sth</b> are often used in the passive. <b>tag sth on</b> 和<b>tag sth on to sth</b> 常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TACK STH ON,TACK STH ON TO STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>\n
tail	<h3>tail<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tail a'way =TAIL OFF</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tail 'back <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>if traffic <b>tails back</b>, it forms a long line that moves very slowly or does not move at all﹙车辆受阻﹚排成长队:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the accident, traffic tailed back eight miles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事故发生后，受阻车辆排了八英里长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tailback <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>) a long line of traffic that moves very slowly or does not move at all﹙车辆受阻排成的﹚长队:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crash caused a six-mile tailback.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撞车事故使受阻车辆排了六英里长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tail 'off (<i>also</i> ,tail a'way <i>less frequent</i>) </b><br>to become smaller, fewer, weaker, etc.变得越来越小﹙或少、弱等﹚；逐渐消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sales tailed off in the autumn/fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进入秋季，销售开始下滑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The number of tourists starts to tail off in September.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从九月份起，游客人数开始逐步减少。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her voice tailed away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的声音越来越小。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Did you want to see . . .’ she tailed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你是不是想看……”她的声音细了下去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
tailor	<h3>tailor<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tailor sth to/for sb/sth </b><br>to make or adapt sth for a particular purpose, a particular person, etc.为…专门做﹙或订制﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Special programmes of study are tailored to the needs of specific students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 针对具体学生的需要安排了特别的课程。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
take	<h3>take<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb a'back </b><br>to shock or surprise sb使…震惊；使…吃惊:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was taken aback by his rudeness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对他的粗鲁无礼感到吃惊。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Take sb aback </b>is usually used in the passive.<b>take sb aback </b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take 'after sb </b><br><i>(not used in the progressive tenses </i>不用于进行时) to look like or behave likean older member of your family﹙外貌或举止﹚像﹙长辈﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m told I take after my grandmother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人说我长得像外婆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your daughter doesn’t ake after you at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你女儿一点儿都不像你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s always been shy — he takes after his father.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一贯羞答答的——像他的父亲。</font><br><i>(oldfashioned，AmE</i>) to begin to follow sb quickly inorder to catch them开始追赶； 跟踪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A man rushed out of the bank and two men took after him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一名男子冲出银行，另两名男子追了出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran out into the night and he took after her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她冲入了夜幕，他紧随其后赶了出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep,take a'gainst sb/sth <br><i>(old-fashioned</i>, <i>BrE</i>) tobegin to dislike sb/sth开始不喜欢:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why have you suddenly taken against Laura? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么突然讨厌劳拉了？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>take to sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb/sth a'long (to sth) </b><br>to take sb or sth withyou when you go somewhere随身带着﹙或携带﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom took his sister along to the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆带着妹妹去参加晚会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When you travel with young children, take along some favourite toys or a book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和孩子们旅行要带些他们喜欢的玩具或一本书。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb/sth a'part <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>(in sport 体育运动) to defeat sb easily轻易打败；把…打得一败涂地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took the American apart in the third set }(= in a game of tennis)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在第三盘轻松地打败了美国选手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We took the other team apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把另一个队打得一败涂地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Touch her again and I’ll take you apart! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再动她一下我就把你撕个粉碎！</font><br>to attack or criticize sb/sthseverely严厉抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her second novel was taken apart by the critics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的第二部小说被评论家批得体无完肤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth a'part </b><br>to separate a machine, a piece ofequipment, etc. into its parts拆卸，拆散，拆开﹙机器等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took the clock apart and couldn’t put it back together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把钟拆了却装不到一块儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can take the mixer apart to clean it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以把搅拌器拆开来清洁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police took the room apart }(= examined everything verycarefully)&b{, looking for evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察仔细检查了房间里的所有物品，寻找证据。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dismantle sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>put sth together</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb a'round; ,take sb a'round sth <i>(BrE</i><i>also </i>,take sb 'round, ,take sb 'round sth) </b><br>to visita place with sb; to show sb the interesting orimportant parts of a place带﹙某人﹚游览；领﹙ 某人﹚ 参观:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’d like to see the town, I could take you around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是想看看城里，我可以带你转转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got a guide to take us round the temples.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一位导游带我们参观了那些寺庙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>show sb around,show sb around sth;take sb over sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb/sth a'round <i>(especially AmE</i>)=TAKESB/STH ROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb a'side </b><br>to separate sb from the rest of agroup in order to talk to them privately把……带到一边﹙ 私下谈话﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took me aside and explained the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把我拉到旁边解释情况。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb a'way (from sb/sth) </b><br>to remove sb fromsomewhere; to lead or move sb to another place把…送走；带…去别处；将…转到别处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The injured were taken away by ambulance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伤员被救护车送走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can take you away from all this }(= all this trouble)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以带你离开这一切烦扰。</font><br>to remove sb, especially a child, from sb’scare使…离开﹙某人的监护等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were taken away from them and put into a children’s home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们从他们身边被带走，送到了儿童之家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My father took me away from school and taught me himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父亲给我退了学亲自教我。</font><br>to take sb with you on a trip or holiday/vacation带…旅行﹙或度假﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He takes the whole family away for two weeks in the summer. </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他夏天带全家旅游两个星期。</font><br>to make it necessaryfor sb to leave a place, especially temporarily使﹙暂时﹚离开某处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam’s work takes him away from his family for months at a time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆因工作所需每次要离家好几个月。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth a'way </b><br>to remove sth and place itsomewhere else把某物移到别处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to take the computer away to fix it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们得把计算机拿去修理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can take the book away with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以把书带走。</font><br>(from sb/sth) to removesomething from a person, a place or an organizationso that they no longer have it把…﹙从某人、某处﹚带走；取去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These books must not be taken away from the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书不得带出图书馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They can’t take our rights away from us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们不能剥夺我们的权利。</font><br>to make a feeling,pain, etc. disappear解除，消除﹙感觉、痛苦等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These tablets should help take the pain away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些药片能止痛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That was disgusting! I need a drink of water to take the taste away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这东西真恶心！我得喝杯水除掉这味道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pain,taste,appetite </b><br>(from sth) (<i>mathematics</i>)to take one number from another减去；减掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you take four away from ten, that leaves six.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十减去四剩下六。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ten take away four leaves six (10 – 4=6).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 十减去四等于六。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) (<i>AmE</i> ,take sth 'out) (<i>usually used in the infinitive with</i><i>‘to’ </i>通常与to一起用于不定式) to buy a cookeddish at a restaurant and carry it away to eat at home, in the street, etc.﹙从餐馆等买东西﹚带回食用；买外卖食物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A cheeseburger and a coffee to take away, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请来一份外卖乾酪汉堡包和一杯咖啡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is that to eat here or take away?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是在这里吃还是带走？</font><br>(from sth) to form an opinion or impression of sb/sth that is still there when you go away带着某观点﹙或印象﹚离开；对…留下某观点﹙或印象﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We didn’t take away a very favourable impression of the hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对这家旅馆没留下什么好印象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do we want students to take away }(= to learn)&b{ from this course? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们想让学生从这个课程中学到什么呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp take sb’s 'breath away <br>to surprise or please somebody very much使惊讶﹙或惊叹﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The first sight of the waterfall takes your breath away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第一次看到那瀑布，你会感到震撼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'takeaway (<i>BrE</i>) <i>n </i></b><br>a restaurant that cooks and sells food that you eat somewhere else外卖餐馆:<br><i><font
