</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外卖餐馆</font><br><i>(AmE </i>'takeout, 'carry-out) a meal that you buy from this type of restaurant外卖的饭菜；外卖食物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We could get a takeaway tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今天可以吃外卖晚餐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a takeaway pizza </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 外卖的比萨饼</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take a'way from sth</b><br>to make the effect or value of sth seem less﹙使效果、价值等﹚减少，减弱；贬低﹙意义等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t wish to take away from his achievements, but he couldn’t have done it without our help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想贬低他的成绩，但是如果没有我们的帮助，他是做不成的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>detract from sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb a'way from sth </b><br>to take sb’s attention away from what they are trying to do使某人从…… 上分散﹙ 或转移﹚ 注意力:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These minor problems are taking us away from the real issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些次要问题分散了我们对根本问题的注意力。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>distract sb (from sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb 'back </b><br>(to sth) to go with someone to the place where they were or to your/their home把…送回原处；把…送回家:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you take me back to the hotel? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能把我送回旅馆吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll take the kids back now — they’re getting tired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在要把孩子们送回家了——他们有些疲倦。</font><br>to allow sb such as your husband, wife or partner to come home after they have left because of a problem; to allow sb to return to their job允许﹙因不合而离去的配偶等﹚回家；与…重归于好；允许…复职:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I agreed to take her back if she promised to be faithful in future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我同意让她回家，但她要保证以后对我忠诚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An employer cannot be forced to take you back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没有什么可以逼使雇主让雇员复职。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>have sb back</b><br>(to sth) to make sb’s thoughts return to a past time使回想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The smell of the sea took him back to his childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大海的气味使他回想起孩提时代。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That song takes me back a bit! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那首歌勾起了我无限的回忆！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>carry sb back (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth 'back </b><br>(<b>to sb/sth</b>) if you <b>take sth back</b> to a shop/store, or a shop/store <b>takes sth back</b>, you return sth that you have bought because it is the wrong size or does not work, for example退回﹙商品﹚；收回﹙退货﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sweater had a hole in it so I took it back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 毛衫上有个洞， 于是我把它退了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return sth (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to return sth you have borrowed,hired, etc.归还；交还:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I forgot to take my books back to the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忘记把书还给图书馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s your turn to take the videos back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮到你还录像带了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>return sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>In informal spoken language <b>take sb back sth</b>,or, less often, <b>take sb sth back</b> can also be used.非正式口语也可以说<b>take sb back sth</b> ，有时说<b>take sb sth back</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took him back his CD.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把光盘还给他了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I took him his CD back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把光盘还给他了。</font><br>to take something you have bought, etc. home with you after you have been away﹙外出后﹚带回﹙所买的东西等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spent a lot of the holiday looking for presents to take back for the kids.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们假期花了很多时间选购礼物给孩子们。</font><br>In informal spoken language<b>take sb back sth</b> is also used.非正式口语也说<b>take sb back sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We took the kids back some presents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们给孩子们带回了一些礼物。</font><br>to receive or take sth that you own from sb who has borrowed it收回，拿到﹙借出的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I’d read the letter he took it back and put it in his pocket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看完信后，他就拿回去塞进衣兜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No attempt was ever made to take back the land }(= to take control of it again)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从未有人试图收回这块土地。</font><br>to admit that sth you said was wrong or that you should not have said it收回，撤回﹙说过的话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I take back what I said about you being lazy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把说你懒惰的话收回。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>retract sth;withdraw sth <i>(both more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n5 v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb/sth 'down; ,take sb/sth 'down sth</b><br>to go with sb/sth to a lower level, to a more southern part of a country, etc., or to a different part of a building, town, country, etc.带…去﹙下一层、南方或别处﹚:<br><i><font used in the passive in this meaning. <b>take sth out </b>作此义时不用于被动语态。<br>to make sth disappear from somewhere使消失；消除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Soaking should help to take the stain out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 浸泡应有助于除掉污迹。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>stain</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>v+n+adv ◆ v+n+adv+prep ◆ v+adv+n(<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp take a leaf out of sb’s 'book<br>to follow sb’s example效法某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m going to take a leaf out of your book and get to work early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算向你学习，早点上班工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp take sth out of sb’s 'hands<br>to remove sth from sb’s control and deal with it yourself从…手中取得…权﹙亲自掌握﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The decision has been taken out of my hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经无权作决定了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp take the 'mickey out of sb/sth (<i>also </i>take the 'piss out of sb !, <i>slang</i>) both (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) <br>to make sb look or feel silly by copying sth that they do, or making them believe sth that is not true﹙通过模仿某人或使其信以为真﹚取笑，愚弄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They used to take the mickey out of Ade because of the way he spoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们过去常取笑埃德说话的样子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'takeout (<i>AmE</i>)=TAKEAWAY at TAKE STH AWAY</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'take it/sth 'out of sb </b><br>to make sb feel very tired使筋疲力尽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That flu really took it out of me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那次流感使我病得一塌煳涂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Looking after three young children really takes a lot out of you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 照看三个小孩子能把你累死。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>a lot,so much</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>wear sb out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv+prep ◆ v+pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb 'out of themselves <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make sb forget their worries, thoughts, concerns,etc.使摆脱苦恼；为…消愁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seeing his old friends again took him out of himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再次见到老朋友使他忘掉了很多烦恼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth 'out on sb/sth </b><br>to behave in an unpleasant way towards sb/sth because you feel angry, disappointed, etc.向…发泄；拿……撒气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he’s had a bad day, he always takes it out on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他哪天不顺心就拿我当出气筒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn’t take your frustrations out on the kids.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你别拿孩子们出气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take 'over </b><br>(<b>from sth</b>) (<b>as sth</b> ) to become more important than sth else and replace it取而代之:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Computers are rapidly taking over from books as children’s learning resources.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计算机正迅速取代书本成为儿童的学习资源。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Glasgow took over from Lisbon as cultural capital of Europe.</font></i><br><font feelings take over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很难克服消极的想法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she saw the accident, her training as a doctor immediately took over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看到这场事故时，她接受的医生培训立刻让她跃跃欲试。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take 'over; ,take sth 'over </b><br>(<b>from as manager when he retires? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比尔退休，谁来接替他的经理职务？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’re tired of driving, I’ll take over for a Socialist Party takes over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 社会党接管之后情况就会不同了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the film, aliens take over the sb 'over sth</b><br>to go with sb around a building and show them what is interesting or important带…参观:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A guide took us over the house.</font></i><br><font THROUGH STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb/sth 'over </b><br>to affect sb so strongly that they are unable to think of anything else or do anything v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n2 v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth 'over </b><br>to gain control of a business, a company, etc. by buying it or by buying the most of its earlier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想继续谈一谈你早些时候提出的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Paula took up the story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 葆拉接着讲这个故事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>story</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pick sth up </b><br>to accept a suggestion, a policy, an invitation, etc.接受﹙建议、政策、邀请等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The union have taken up her case.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工会已经同意在这件事上帮她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea was never taken up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个主意从未受到重视。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to take up their invitation to visit them in Rio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想接受他们的邀请，去里约拜访他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>case,idea,challenge,offer </b><br>to join in saying or singing sth一起说；一齐唱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cry was taken up by the rest of the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群中的其他人也跟着吶喊起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>the cry,the refrain</b><br>to move into a particular position进入，占据﹙位置﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We took up our positions by the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把住了门口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>formal</i>) She has <b>taken up residence</b> }(= begun to live) &b{in London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她到伦敦居住了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>position </b><br><i>(old-fashioned</i>,<i>formal</i>) to take sth in your hand拿起； 抓起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took up a book and began to read.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她拿起一本书读了起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pick sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)1 v+n+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'uptake <i>n </i>[U] [sing.] </b><br>the process by which sth is taken into a body or system; the rate at which this happens摄取，吸收﹙速度﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The experiment measured the uptake of oxygen by the muscles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个实验测量了肌肉对氧气的吸收速度。</font><br>an act of making or starting sth; the number of people who do this制作某物﹙的人数﹚；开始某事﹙的人数﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There has been an increase in the uptake of these courses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听这些课的人数有所增长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sb 'up on sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to question sb or argue with sb about sth because you do not agree质问；查问:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought he was wrong but I didn’t take him up on it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他错了，但我没有和他澄清。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to take you up on what you said about unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想就你对失业问题发表的谈话提几个问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pick sb up on sth</b><br>to accept an offer, an invitation that sb has made接受﹙提议、邀请﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I’ll take you up on your offer to help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我可以接受你的帮忙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘You can borrow the car if you like.’ ‘I might take you up on that.’ </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “这辆车你可以随意借用。”“我也许会的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take 'up with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become friendly with sb; to start a relationship with sb, especially sb who might have a bad influence on you开始结交﹙尤指会产生坏影响的人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard Tom has taken up with a supermodel! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说汤姆傍上了个超级模特儿！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s taken up with a bunch of losers }(= people who will never be successful)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她结交了一帮碌碌无为的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth 'up with sb </b><br>to speak or write to sb about sth they may be able to help you with向…提出；与…交涉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll have to take your complaint up with the manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得向经理表示你的不满。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,taken 'up with sb/sth;be ,taken 'up with doing sth </b><br>to be very busy with sb or with doing sth致力于；专心于；对…一心一意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is very taken up with the children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她整天忙着照料孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been completely taken up with preparing for exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直在全力以赴准备考试。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,take sth u'pon yourself=TAKE STH ON/UPON YOURSELF</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'taken with sb/sth </b><br>to find sb/sth attractive or interesting被…吸引；迷上；对…感兴趣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were all very taken with Zoe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都觉得佐伊非常讨人喜欢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n
talk	<h3>talk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,talk 'round sth) </b><br>to talk in a general way about a subject or a problem without discussing the difficult or important parts of it拐弯抹角地谈；不着边际地谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We talked around the subject for some time before coming to the real issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们围绕这个主题闲扯了一会之后才进入正题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>subject</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'talk at sb </b><br>to speak to sb without listening to what they say in reply对…大发议论；滔滔不绝地对…说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My father always listened to our point of view — he never just talked at us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父亲总是听取我们的观点——他从不搞一言堂。</font><br><b>Talk at sb </b>can be used in the passive.<b>talk at sb</b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was being talked at rather than talked to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有交谈，而是被动地听冲着我的话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk a'way (to sb) </b><br>to talk without stopping for a period of time喋喋不休；说个不停:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were soon talking away to each other as if they’d known each other for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们很快就像老相识一般聊个没完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Marie was <b>talking away nineteen to the dozen</b> }(= talking a lot without stopping)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽不住嘴地唠叨着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk 'back (to sb) </b><br>to reply rudely to sb in authority﹙对上司﹚回嘴，顶嘴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was sent out for talking back to the teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因为顶撞老师而被赶了出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>answer back,answer sb back <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'back talk <i>n </i></b><br>[U] (<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) a rude reply or comment回嘴；顶嘴:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I said no, and don’t give me any more back talk.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我说过不行， 不要再顶嘴了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb 'down </b><br>to talk to sb who is threatening to kill themselves and persuade them not to jump from a tall building, a bridge, etc.劝阻﹙表示要自杀的人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police were trying to talk down a youth threatening to jump from the roof of the car park.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察正通过谈话制止一名要从停车场顶跳下的青年。</font><br>to prevent sb from speaking by talking loudly or without stopping以高声﹙或连续﹚讲话盖过﹙某人的话﹚；不让…插话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried to argue but they talked me down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想争辩，可他们不给我说话的机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb/sth 'down</b><br>to help a pilot bring a plane to the ground by giving detailed instructions from the ground引导﹙飞行员﹚着陆；引降:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilots were talked down through the fog by the Ground Controllers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 地面导航人员引导飞行员穿过雾霭降落。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to talk a plane down </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引导飞机降落</font><br>to persuade sb to lower their prices和…讲价；压价:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s asked for $1 000. Can we talk him down any further? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要1 000 元。咱们能不能和他再压压价？</font><br>to talk about sth in a way that makes it seem less important or successful than it really is贬低；贬抑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The opposition was attacked for talking the country down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 反对派因贬损国家而遭到抨击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tends to talk his achievements down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常常贬低自己的成绩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>talk sb/sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk 'down to sb </b><br>to speak to sb as if they are younger or less intelligent than you or than they really are以高人一等﹙或不尊重﹚的口气说话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He makes the mistake of talking down to his students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不该以高高在上的态度跟学生说话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>patronize sb</b><br><b>Talk down to sb </b>can be used in the passive.<b>talk down to sb</b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hate being talked down to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讨厌别人自命不凡地对我说话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb/yourself 'into/ 'out of sth; ,talk sb/yourself 'into/ 'out of doing sth </b><br>to persuade sb/yourself to do/not to do sth说服别人﹙或自己﹚做/不做某事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why did you let James talk you into this crazy scheme? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么听信了詹姆斯作出此等荒唐的计划？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I talked myself into believing I was happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我让自己相信自己身在福中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m leaving now and don’t try to talk me out of it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这就要走了，别想说服我留下。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp talk your way out of sth/of doing sth <br>to make excuses and give reasons for not doing sth;to manage to get yourself out of a difficult situation找藉口﹙或理由﹚不做某事；以话解围:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I managed to talk my way out of having to give a speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我设法逃避了讲话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His wife’s found out about everything! I’d like to see him talk his way out of this one! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的妻子什么都知道了！我倒想看看他怎么逃过这次！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sth 'out </b><br>to discuss sth thoroughly until you find a solution, an agreement, etc. or make a decision把…谈透；协商做出决定﹙或解决问题、达成协议等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to talk out your thoughts/ feelings/problems with sb </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对某人说出想法/倾吐感情；与某人协商解决问题</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It might help to talk things out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把事情好好谈谈也许有助益。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>things,problem</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk yourself 'out </b><br>to talk until you have nothing left to say把事情全说出来；倾谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They spent all the evening discussing the problem until they talked themselves out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用了一晚上尽情讨论这个问题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb/yourself 'out of sth; ,talk sb/yourself 'out of doing sth=TALK SB/YOURSELF INTO/OUT OF STH,TALK SB/YOURSELF INTO/OUT OF DOING STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sth 'over (with sb) </b><br>to discuss sth thoroughly with sb in order to find a solution, make a decision,etc.详细讨论，详谈﹙以解决问题或做出决定等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to talk it over with my parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得和父母好好商量。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll find it helpful to talk things over with a friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把情况和朋友畅谈，你会觉得大有帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You and Len both need to talk over what happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你和莱恩需要把发生的事好好谈谈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>things,feelings,problems</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=TALK AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb 'round (to sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to persuade sb to accept sth or to agree to sth说服；劝说某人同意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents didn’t want me to go to study in Britain, but I managed to talk them round (<i>to the idea</i>).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我父母不想让我去英国学习，但我总算说服了他们。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb 'through sth </b><br>to explain sth to sb in detail so that they understand it给某人详细解释:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The technical support staff will talk you through any difficulties you have with the software.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 技术支持人员将给你详细讲解使用软件时遇到的困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can talk you through the application form.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我可以详细告诉你如何填写申请表。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>walk sb through sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sth 'through </b><br>to discuss sth thoroughly so that you can understand it, come to an agreement,or make a decision about it把某事谈透﹙以达成协议、作出决定等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Throughout their marriage they have always talked things through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们结婚后一直是商量着解决问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s helpful to talk the problem through with a counsellor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 找个顾问把问题谈透会有帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We talked through what had happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们就所发生的事彻底交换了意见。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>things,problems</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'talk to sb </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>'talk with sb</b> <i>especially AmE</i>) to have a conversation with sb和…谈话<br>to speak to sb seriously, especially about sth wrong that they have done, or sth that they have not done找…认真谈谈；责骂；训斥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like to talk to you in my office now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想现在请你来我的办公室好好谈谈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'talking-to <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>informal</i>) a serious talk with sb who has done sth wrong责骂；训斥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to give sb a good talking-to</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狠狠责骂某人一通</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,talk sb/sth 'up </b><br>to praise sb/sth in order to make other people interested in them/it; to describe sb/sth in a way that makes them sound better or more successful than they really are过分夸奖；吹捧； 炒作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They talked up the tourist attractions to encourage more visitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对这些旅游胜地大肆炒作以吸引更多游客。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was being talked up as a future presidential candidate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被吹捧成未来的总统候选人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s too early to tell if the new President will talk the dollar up or down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在断言新总统是否会炒高或炒低美元还为时过早。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>talk sb/sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'talk with sb <i>(especially AmE</i>)=TALK TO SB 1</b><br>\n
tamper	<h3>tamper<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tamper with sth </b><br>to do something to sth to change it without permission篡改；擅自改动；胡乱摆弄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two policemen were accused of tampering with the evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有两名警察被控篡改证据。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>evidence,controls,brakes</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>interfere with sth</b><br><b>Tamper with sth </b>can be used in the passive.<b>tamper with sth </b>可用于被动语态:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lock has been tampered with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人捣鼓这把锁了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
tangle	<h3>tangle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tangle sth 'up;be/get ,tangled 'up (in/with sth)</b><br>to twist sth into an untidy mass; to become twisted in this way使缠结；纠结；乱作一团:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My long skirt got tangled up in the wheel of my bike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的长裙缠进了自行车轮子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Kurt didn’t want to get tangled up with a girl while he was trying to study.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 库尔特不想在求学期间和女孩子谈恋爱。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Tangle sth up </b>is usually used in the passive.<b>tangle sth up</b>通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ be/get+v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tangle with sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become involved in an argument or a fight with sb争论； 争吵；打架:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve chosen the wrong man to tangle with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你吵架找错人了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
tank	<h3>tank<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tank 'up; ,tank sth 'up <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to fill a vehicle with fuel给﹙车辆﹚加满油:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’d better tank up before we get on the thruway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上直达高速公路前我们最好加满油。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tank 'up (on sth) (<i>slang</i>) </b><br>to drink a lot of alcohol大量饮酒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lads had spent all evening tanking up on scotch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小伙子们整晚都在狂饮苏格兰威士忌。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tanked 'up <i>adj </i></b><br>very drunk喝得烂醉的；烂醉如泥的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got totally tanked up and couldn’t drive home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喝得酩酊大醉，没法开车回家。</font><br>\n
tap	<h3>tap<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tap sb for sth </b><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to persuade sb to give you sth, especially money向…索要，向…乞讨﹙尤指钱﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can’t you tap your father for a loan? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能找你父亲借钱吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tap sb for information </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 向某人索取资料</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to choose sb for a particular role or job挑选﹙或指定﹚…做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A British actress has been tapped for a part in the movie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 已挑选一名英国女演员参与这部电影的演出。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Tap sb for sth</b> is usually used in the passive in this meaning.<b>tap sb for sth</b>作此义时通常用于被动语态。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tap sth 'in/ 'out </b><br>to put information, numbers,letters, etc. into a machine by pressing buttons输入，输出﹙信息、数字、字母等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tap in your password.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请输入密码。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I picked up the phone and tapped out Joe’s number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我抓起电话拨了乔的号码。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tap 'into sth </b><br>to use a computer to obtain information from another computer﹙用计算机﹚获取…的信息:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had managed to tap into the company’s database.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他设法进入了公司的数据库。</font><br>to use sth from a supply of energy, knowledge,etc. for your own advantage利用，开发﹙资源、知识等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Schools should tap into the knowledge and experience of people in the local community.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校应该利用当地社区的人们的知识和经验。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His talk about bullying tapped into parents’ anxieties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的关于霸道行为的讲话是利用了父母的担忧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tap sth 'out </b><br>to hit a surface lightly, making a rhythm轻轻打拍子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tapped out the rhythm with his foot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用脚轻轻打着节拍。</font><br>2=TAP STH IN/OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
tape	<h3>tape<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tape sth 'up </b><br>to fasten tape around sth firmly用带子捆紧﹙或系紧﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put it in a box and tape it up securely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把它装进盒子捆扎牢固。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to tie a long strip of fabric (a <b>bandage</b> ) firmly around an injury or a wound用绷带包扎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s a nasty cut — come on, we’ll get it all taped up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这伤口很深——快，我们用绷带把它包扎好。</font><br><b>Tape</b> sth can also be used.也可用<b>tape sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put it in a box and tape it securely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把它装进盒子捆扎牢固。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
taper	<h3>taper<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,taper 'off </b><br>to gradually become smaller in size,volume, amount, etc.﹙规模、体积、数量等﹚逐渐减少:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our profits have begun to taper off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的利润开始逐步减少了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
tart	<h3>tart<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tart sth 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to decorate or improve the appearance of sth, often in a way that other people do not think is attractive把…装饰得俗气；把…弄得花里胡哨:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve tarted up the restaurant but the food hasn’t improved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把餐馆整得花里胡哨，然而食物却没有改进。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tart yourself 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>(especially of a woman 尤指女子) to try and make yourself more attractive by putting on special clothes and jewellery, and putting substances on your face (<b>make-up</b> )打扮得花枝招展；浓妆艳抹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spends ages tarting herself up for a night out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她为了外出玩一晚上花了大量时间梳妆打扮。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>doll yourself up (in sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>\n
task	<h3>task<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'task sb with sth </b><br>to give sb a task to do把任务交给某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp forces tasked with keeping the peace</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 执行维和任务的部队</font><br><b>Task sb with sth </b>is usually used in the passive.<b>task sb with sth</b>通常用于被动语态。<br>You can also use the pattern <b>task sb to do sth</b> .也可使用句型<b>task sb to do sth</b> :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp soldiers tasked to provide medical support </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 派去提供医疗援助的士兵</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

team	<h3>team<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,team 'up (with sb) </b><br>to work together with another person or group in order to do sth﹙与…﹚合作，搭档:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two companies have teamed up to produce new software.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两家公司联手生产新软件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve teamed up with XL Records to give away 25 pairs of tickets for the live concert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们和唱片合作，送出25套现场音乐会双人门票。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How did the two of you come to team up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们俩是怎么开始合伙的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
tear	<h3>tear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear a'bout; ,tear a'bout sth <i>(BrE</i>) =TEAR AROUND,TEAR AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sb/yourself a'part </b><br>to make sb/yourself suffer very much or feel very unhappy使别人﹙或自己﹚痛苦，使难过:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being separated from the children was tearing her apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与子女分离令她痛不欲生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t tear yourself apart thinking about the past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别想过去的事了，那只会使自己难受。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sb/sth a'part </b><br>(<i>also</i> ,tear itself, themselves, etc. a'part) to separate people in a family,an organization, a country, etc. and make them argue with or fight against each other使四分五裂；使分崩离析:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The civil war is tearing the country apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 内战把这个国家搞得四分五裂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The family was torn apart by conflicting loyalties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个家庭因家人政见不和而破裂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The region was tearing itself apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区正在瓦解。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jealousy tore them apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 嫉妒令他们互相排斥。</font><br>to destroy or defeat sb/sth; to criticize sb/sth severely摧毁； 打败； 严厉抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We tore the other team apart in the second half.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在下半场把对方打得片甲不留。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t write that — you’ll be torn apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能写那个─他们会毁了你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sth a'part </b><br>to destroy sth by pulling it violently so that it breaks into pieces撕毁；撕碎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dogs tore the fox apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几条狗把那只狐狸撕成了碎片。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>prey</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>rip sth apart</b><br>to destroy a building, etc.摧毁﹙建筑物等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hundreds of homes were torn apart by the hurricane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飓风毁掉了几百所住房。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police tore the room apart looking for drugs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察为了寻找毒品把房间翻了个底朝天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear itself, themselves, etc. a'part=TEAR SB/STH APART 1</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear a'round; ,tear a'round sth </b><br><i>(BrE also</i> <b>,tear a'bout/ 'round, ,tear a'bout/ 'round sth</b>) to move very quickly from place to place, being very busy﹙忙碌地﹚四处跑动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were tearing around shouting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们吵吵嚷嚷地跑来跑去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No wonder you’re tired, tearing about like that all the time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你那么不停地忙忙碌碌，难怪要累呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>run around,run around sth;rush around,rush around sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tear at sth (with sth) </b><br>to attack sth violently, especially by pulling pieces off it﹙用…﹚撕扯，撕裂，扯开，撕破:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The brambles tore at her legs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 荆棘挂破了她的腿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tore at the meat with his bare hands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他乾脆用手把肉撕开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sb/yourself/sth a'way (from sb/sth) </b><br>to make sb/yourself stop doing sth they/you enjoy in order to do sth else﹙使﹚依依不捨地停止；﹙使﹚忍痛离去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t tear myself away from this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对这本书简直爱不释手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come and visit us, if you can tear Bill away from his computer! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是能说服比尔离开电脑，就来看看我们吧！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn’t <b>tear his eyes away</b> from }(= stop looking at)&b{ Mina.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他恋恋不捨地望着米娜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>drag sb/sth/yourself away (from sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tearaway <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) a young person who behaves in a wild way or who is not responsible or reliable放荡不羁的年轻人；无责任心﹙或不可靠﹚的年轻人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her son’s a bit of a tearaway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她儿子有点鲁莽。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The 11-year-old tearaway had burgled several houses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个11 岁的小阿飞已经盗窃了几家了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sth a'way </b><br>to pull sth violently from the thing it is attached to用力撕下；猛地拉掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The floods had torn away the base of the bridge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 洪水把桥墩冲走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'torn between A and B </b><br>to have to make a very difficult choice between two things, people,etc.﹙在两者间﹚难以选择，左右为难:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was torn between my parents and my friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在父母和朋友之间左右为难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jenni was torn between staying at school or going to music college.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 珍妮在继续留在学校和去音乐学院之间难以取捨。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sth 'down</b><br>to pull or knock down a building,a wall, etc.拆毁， 拆除﹙ 建筑物、墙等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re tearing down some old houses to build a new office block.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在拆除旧房，以建造新的办公楼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>building,house,trees</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>pull sth down;demolish sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear 'into sb/sth </b><br>to attack sb/sth physically or with words攻击；袭击；痛斥；抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tore into Jed with his fists.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给了杰德几拳。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tore into the students if they were late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学生要是迟到，她就训斥他们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) They tore into their food }(= started eating)&b{ as if they were starving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们狼吞虎咽地吃，好像饿坏了似的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sth 'off; ,tear sth 'off sb/sth </b><br>to remove sth quickly by pulling violently﹙猛地﹚撕下，拽掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Alice tore off her ring and threw it on the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 爱丽丝一把摘下戒指摔到了地上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The door was nearly torn off its hinges.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门几乎要从铰链上被拽掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you need a piece of paper I’ll tear some off my pad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是需要纸，我就从我的拍纸簿上撕下一些。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp tear sb 'off a strip;tear a 'strip off sb (<i>BrE</i>,<i>informal</i>)<br>to speak angrily to sb you think has done sth wrong责骂；训斥:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boss tore him off a strip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板把他痛骂了一通。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tear sth 'out; ,tear sth 'out of sth </b><br>to separate sth from sth it is attached to, especially with your hands﹙从…﹚撕下，拽掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several pages had been torn out of the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书有几页给撕掉了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp thaw	<h3>thaw<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thaw 'out </b><br>if ice or snow <b>thaws out</b>, it becomes water again﹙ 冰或雪﹚ 销融， 融化， 解冻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Britain is thawing out after the big freeze }(= there has been a lot of snow and ice)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 严寒过后，英国开始冰销雪融了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thaw 'out; ,thaw sth 'out </b><br>to become, or to let frozen food become, soft and ready to cook﹙让食物﹚解冻，化冻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took the meat out of the freezer and left it to thaw out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把肉从冰箱里拿出来解冻。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to thaw out meat/fish </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把肉/鱼解冻</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>defrost,defrost sth</b><br><i>(informal</i>)to become, or to let sth become, warmer after being very cold ﹙ 使﹚ 暖和:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come in and thaw out by the fire! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进来靠着火炉暖和暖和吧！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My feet are frozen! I need to thaw them out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的脚冻僵了！我得把它们暖和过来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>)She was very shy at first, but she soon thawed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她起初羞答答的，可是很快就活跃起来了。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Thaw</b> and <b>thaw sth</b> can also be used with these meanings. <b>thaw</b>和<b>thaw sth</b>也可作这些含义。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
thin	<h3>thin<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thin sth 'down (with sth) </b><br>to make a liquid less thick or strong, for example by adding water to it﹙掺水等﹚稀释:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The paint needs to be thinned down with water before you use it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 颜料使用之前需要用水调稀。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Thin sth</b> is used more frequently. <b>thin sth</b>较常用。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thin 'out </b><br>to become fewer in number, or less thick减少；变稀薄:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd had thinned out and only a few people were left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群渐渐散去，只剩下几个人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once they were clear of the city, the traffic started to thin out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一出城， 来往车辆就开始减少。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trees began to thin out as we climbed higher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们再往上爬，树木就变得稀少。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>crowd,trees,traffic</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thin sth 'out </b><br>to reduce the number of sth so that there is more space between them把东西分散﹙ 以免聚在一起﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thin out the seedlings to about 10 cm apart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按10 公分等距间苗。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>plants</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
think	<h3>think<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'think about sb/sth </b><br>to have ideas or images in your mind; to remember sb/sth想；思考；回想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t stop thinking about her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没法不想她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All he ever thinks about is money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他满脑子都是钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It doesn’t bear thinking about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这事不堪回首。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I was alone, I just sat and thought about things.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一个人呆着时， 就只是坐着遐想。</font><br>(<i>also</i> 'think of sb/sth) to consider sb/sth考虑； 顾及； 替…着想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s time you stopped being so selfish and started thinking about other people!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在该别这么自私了，为别人想想吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sb/sth into account</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp if/when you 'think about it <br>used to draw attention to a fact that is not obvious or has not been mentioned before如果仔细想想； 如果三思:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It must have been terrible when you think about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想想看，这事一定很可怕。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'think about sth;'think about doing sth </b><br>to use your mind to consider sth, such as your future plans, to try to solve problems, etc.考虑；打算； 动脑筋:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ll think about it and let you know tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我先考虑一下， 明天再告诉你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s thinking about changing her job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在考虑换工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you thought about what you’ll do if you don’t get a place at college? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你考虑过如果上不了大学要干什么吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘What did I do wrong?’ ‘Just think about it!’</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “ 我做错了什么？”“ 你自己想想吧！”</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp think 'twice about sth/about doing sth<br>to think carefully before you decide to do sth认真考虑后再决定； 三思而后行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d think twice about calling him if I were you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要是你，给他打电话之前会先考虑考虑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think a'head (to sth)</b><br>to think carefully about what might happen in the future; to plan for the future预先考虑﹙或计划﹚；预想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Even whe their children are very young, parents are thinking ahead to exams and jobs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子年纪还很小，父母就在想什么考试呀、工作呀，实在太早了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pilots are trained to think ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞行员接受预见情况的训练。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think 'back (to sth) </b><br>to remember or think about sth that happened in the past回想；追忆:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She thought back to the day they first met.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她回想起他们第一次见面的那一天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Thinking back, I’m sure I noticed there was something strange.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 回想起来，我敢说我注意到有些不寻常。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think for your'self </b><br>to make your own decisions,form your own opinions, etc. without depending on other people独立思考；自行决定:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to learn to think for yourself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你需要学会独立思考。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our parents always encouraged us to think for ourselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母总是鼓励我们自己拿主意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep+pron<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'think of sb/sth </b><br>to have an image or idea of a particular person or thing in your mind想到某人﹙或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I said that, I wasn’t thinking of anyone in particular.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我说那话时，并没有想到任何具体的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thought of how happy his parents would be to see him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想着父母见到他会有多高兴。</font><br>2=THINK ABOUT SB/STH 2<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  Just think of the consequences if you give up your job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 想一想你放弃工作的后果吧。</font><br>to create an idea in your imagination想出； 构思出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who first thought of the idea? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是谁想出来的主意？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you think of anyone who could help? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能想到有谁可以帮忙吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hasn’t this idea ever been thought of before? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以前就没有人想到过这个主意吗？</font><br><i>(used especially with <b>can</i> </b>尤与<b>can</b> 连用) to remember sb/sth记得；想起:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t think of his name at the moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一时想不起他的名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was just thinking of the wonderful trip we had.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时我正在回味我们的旅行。</font><br>(as sb/sth) to consider sb/sth from a particular point of view把…看作； 把… 视为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I still think of Oxford as my home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我依然把牛津当成我的家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Franco thought of his landlady as his ‘English mother’.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 佛朗哥把房东看成自己的“英国母亲”。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t really think of myself as a businesswoman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我并没有真的认为自己是商界女性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jenni hates being thought of as a little girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 珍妮不喜欢别人把她当成小女孩。</font><br>[NOTE]<b>Think of sb/sth</b> can be used in the passive,especially in meanings 3 and 5. <b>think of sb/sth</b>可用于被动语态，尤其作第3及第5义时。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp come to 'think of it <br>used when you suddenly remember sth or realize that it might be important﹙突然想起某事或意识到此事可能很重要时说﹚想起来了，对了:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come to think of it, he did mention seeing you yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对了，他的确提起昨天见过你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp not think much of sb/sth<br>to not have a very high opinion of sb/sth对…评价不高:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn’t think much of her new boyfriend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我觉得她的新男友不怎么样。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp think 'better of it/of doing sth <br>to decide not to do sth you had planned to do after you have thought about it经考虑后决定不做﹙计划的事﹚；一想又改变主意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was about to tell him the truth, but I thought better of it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我本来要告诉他实情，可是考虑了一下觉得还是不说好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp think the 'world of sb<br>to have a very high opinion of sb; to love sb very much对某人评价很高；十分爱某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thinks the world of his daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他非常宠爱女儿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'think of doing sth</b><br>to consider that you might do sth考虑要做某事；掂量:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re thinking of moving to America.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在考虑移居美国。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did think of resigning, but I decided against it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我确实考虑过辞职，可后来决定放弃这个念头。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>contemplate sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to imagine an actual or a possible situation想像；想一想:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d never have thought of doing that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我绝对不会想到干那事！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t think of letting you take the blame }(= I wouldn’t allow you to do this)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没想到过让你承受指责。</font><br>[NOTE]In this meaning <b>think of doing sth</b> is often used in negative sentences. <b>think of doing sth</b>作此义时常用于否定句。<br>&nbsp&nbsp think 'nothing of doing sth <br>to consider that doing sth is normal and not very difficult认为做某事很正常﹙或不难﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She thinks nothing of walking all the way home in the rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得冒雨一直步行回家算不了什么。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think sth 'out </b><br>to consider all the details of sth carefully, especially in order to find an answer or a solution to a problem认真考虑；仔细盘算:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She needed to be alone to <b>think things out</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她需要单独呆着把事情仔细想想。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought out what I was going to say before I phoned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打电话前先斟酌了一下要说的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a well-thought-out training programme </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考虑周密的培训计划</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think sth 'over </b><br>to consider sth carefully especially before making a decision﹙在做出决定前﹚仔细考虑，慎重思考:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please think over what I’ve said.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把我的话仔细思考一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d like more time to <b>think things over</b>.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望有更多的时间把情况考虑周详。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>mull sth over</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think sth 'through </b><br>to consider a problem fully充分考虑；全盘考虑；想透:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Careers advisers can help you think through your choices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 职业顾问能帮你把各种选择考虑清楚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take my advice and <b>think things through</b> before you do anything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听我的，要三思而后行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,think sth 'up (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>to create an idea, a plan,a story, etc. in your mind想出；构思出；发明:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to think up a new name for the group.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得给这个团体想出个新名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can’t you think up a better excuse than that? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 难道你就想不出一个更好的藉口﹖</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>devise sth (<i> more formal</i>), invent sth (<i> more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
thirst	<h3>thirst<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'thirst for sth <i>(literary</i>)</b><br>to be eager for sth; to want sth very much渴望；渴求:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our opponents were thirsting for revenge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的对手迫不及待地想还击。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
thrash	<h3>thrash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thrash a'round (<i>also</i> ,thrash a'bout <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to move about in a violent, uncontrolled way剧烈扭动；翻来覆去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thrashed around in the water, gasping for breath.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在水里挣扎，急促地喘着气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thrash sth 'out </b><br>to discuss sth thoroughly and in an open and honest way to try to find a solution彻底讨论，反复讨论﹙寻求解决方法﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He called a meeting to thrash out the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他召开了会议研究这个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Eventually they thrashed out an agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们通过讨论最终达成了协议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>problem,details,agreement,deal</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hash sth out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n
thrill	<h3>thrill<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'thrill to sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to feel very excited at sth对… 感到非常兴奋﹙ 或激动﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Audiences thrilled to his performance in Macbeth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 观众看到他在《麦克佩斯》中的演出感到十分兴奋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
thrive	<h3>thrive<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'thrive on sth </b><br>to enjoy or be successful in a situation or condition that other people would not like在﹙某种环境等﹚中自得其乐；以﹙令人不快的事﹚ 取乐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He thrives on hard work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他以苦干为乐事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sue and Jack seem to thrive on arguments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 休和杰克似乎专爱吵架。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
throttle	<h3>throttle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throttle 'back (<i>also</i> ,throttle 'down <i>less frequent</i>)</b><br>to control the supply of fuel or power to an engine in order to reduce the speed of a vehicle调节油门减速:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pilot got very low before he throttled back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞行员减速之前下降得很低。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throttle 'up(<i>rare</i>) </b><br>to control the supply of fuel or power to an engine in order to increase the speed of a vehicle调节油门加速<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
throw	<h3>throw<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sb/yourself a'bout; ,throw sb/yourself a'bout sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)=THROW SB/YOURSELF AROUND,THROW SB/YOURSELF AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'bout <i>(especially BrE</i>)=THROW STH AROUND</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'bout; ,throw sth a'bout sth <i>especially BrE</i>)=THROW STH AROUND,THROW STH AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'bout sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>)=THROW STH AROUND SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sb/yourself a'round; ,throw sb/yourself a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,throw sb/yourself a'bout, ,throw sb/yourself a'bout sth<i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to make sb/yourself move about suddenly and violently, often causing injury﹙使人﹚大力摇晃；﹙指人﹚横冲直撞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The passengers were thrown around in the crash.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撞车时乘客给抛到不同的位置。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child was screaming and throwing himself around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子尖叫着跑来跑去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band threw themselves around the stage like madmen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队在舞台上狂舞。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,throw sth a'bout)</b><br>to say sth, discuss sth, etc. in a general way泛泛而谈；笼统地讨论:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t just throw accusations around like that! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能只是那样不着边际地指责！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let’s have an initial meeting to throw some ideas about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们先开个会简单讨论一下某些想法吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>accusations,ideas</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>toss sth around </b><br>to spend time throwing sth such as a ball from one person to another, in a not very serious way随便地相互抛﹙或传球等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were in the yard throwing a ball around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在院子里抛球玩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>ball </b><br>to move part of your body around violently用劲地挥动， 甩动﹙ 身体部位﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was speaking excitedly, throwing her arms around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一边挥舞着胳膊一边兴奋地讲话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>arms,head</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp throw your 'money around<br>to spend a lot of money in a very careless way, often in order to impress people大手大脚；肆意挥霍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John hates people being well off and throwing their money about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰讨厌那些大肆挥霍的有钱人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp throw your 'weight around (<i>informal</i>) <br>to use your authority too aggressively to achieve what you want以权谋私；仗势欺人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She enjoys throwing her weight about and making people do what she wants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喜欢依权势，支使他人为她做事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'round; ,throw sth a'round sth (<i>also </i>,throw sth a'bout/ 'round, ,throw sth a'bout/ 'round sth <i>especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to send sth from your hand in different directions, often because you are angry﹙常因生气﹚四处扔，到处撒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How do you stop babies throwing their food around? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 怎样才能制止小孩子把食物撒得到处都是呢？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jeff got so angry that he started throwing furniture about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰夫气愤得动手乱摔傢具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People were throwing glasses round the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间里的人到处扔玻璃杯。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'round sb/sth <i>(BrE also </i>,throw sth a'bout/ 'round sb/sth) </b><br>if you <b>throw</b> your arms<b>around</b> sb, you hold them tightly to show that you love them or wish to thank them for sth紧紧拥抱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Diana rushed up to her father, threw her arms around him/his neck and kissed him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黛安娜冲向父亲，紧紧搂住他/他的脖子并吻了他。</font><br>to put sth quickly around sb/sth很快地用…围住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We threw blankets around ourselves to keep warm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们马上用毯子把自己裹住取暖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a silk scarf thrown casually around the shoulders</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 随意地围在肩上的丝巾</font><br>to put a barrier around a place so that people cannot enter or leave用﹙障碍物﹚围起，隔离:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A security cordon had been thrown around the area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地方被治安防衞圈包围了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'side </b><br>to put sth quickly to one side, often because you are angry or in a hurry﹙常因生气或匆忙﹚把……搁在一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She read the letter and immediately threw it aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她读完信便立刻把它扔到一边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>cast sth aside (<i>formal</i>), toss sth aside <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to reject sth such as an attitude, an idea, a way of life, etc.拒绝接受﹙某种看法、想法、生活方式等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All loyalties were thrown aside once the competition started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 竞争一开始，所有的效忠义务都抛弃了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to throw aside sentimentality/nervousness</font></i><br><font [synonym]<b>cast sth aside ( <i>formal </i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throw sth at sb</b><br>to direct sth such as a remark,a question, etc. at sb, often in an aggressive way针对某人说话﹙或提问等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She threw a look of contempt at me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她鄙视地看了我一眼。</font><br><i><font for any question you can throw at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你给他提出任何问题他都能解答。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>question,look,accusation</b><br>You can also say也可以说:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She threw me a look of contempt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她鄙视地看了我一眼。</font><br>to do sth or give sb sth that tests their abilities and skills给…难题； 考验:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You never know what life’s going to throw at you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人生的考验从来都是不可预见的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can cope with anything our opponents throw at us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们能应付对手的任何挑战。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>everything,anything,whatever</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throw sth at sb/sth </b><br>to throw an object in the direction of sb/sth, trying to make it hit them向人或物掷﹙或扔﹚；以…砸向人或物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw stones at the window to try to catch their attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝窗户扔石头， 想吸引他们的注意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp throw the 'book at sb (<i>informal</i>) <br>to punish sb who has committed an offence very severely严惩；严办<br>&nbsp&nbsp throw 'money at sth <br>(<i>disapproving</i>)to try to solve a difficult situation or problem by spending lots of money on it rather than considering other ways of dealing with it企图靠花大钱解决问题:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t solve the problem by throwing money at it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题不是靠花大钱可以解决的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throw yourself at sb <i>(informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>(usually of a woman通常指女性) to be too eager to try to attract sb, because you want to have a romantic relationship with them撒娇；献媚；勾引:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was flattered that such an attractive woman as Nell was throwing herself at him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有内尔这样漂亮的女子向他献媚，他心里飘飘然起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>fling yourself at sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throw yourself at sb/sth </b><br>to rush or jump violently towards or onto sb/sth冲向﹙ 人或物﹚；向……猛扑过去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dogs threw themselves at the gate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几条狗扑向大门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sth a'way </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,throw sth 'out</b>) to get rid of sth that has no use or that you no longer need扔掉； 丢弃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She never throws anything away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从来不丢掉任何东西。</font><br><i><font [synonym]<b>discard sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to fail to make good use of sth; to waste sth错过；浪费；白费:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s throwing away a great opportunity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她这样就要错过一个大好机会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team threw away a 2-0 lead }(= they were winning, but then lost the game)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队失去了2 :0 的领先优势。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>chance,lead,money,opportunity</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throwaway <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] <br>a <b>throwaway</b> product is intended to be used only once,or for a short time and then to be got rid of﹙产品﹚ 一次性的， 用后丢弃的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a throwaway lighter/razor </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一次性打火机/剃刀</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp line or comment is sth you say casually, without careful thought, often in order to be funny随口的话﹙尤指俏皮话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some people overreacted to what was only a throwaway remark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些人对随便说出的一句话反应过敏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw yourself a'way (on sb)</b><br>to have a relationship with sb, or work for sb, who is not good enough for you or does not deserve you﹙和不相配的人﹚ 交往； 屈就:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t throw yourself away on somebody like him.</font></i><br><font carelessly in the place where it was before﹙匆匆﹚把……放回原处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just throw those papers back in the drawer when you’ve finished with them.</font></i><br><font [OBJ]<b>covers,bedclothes</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'throwback (&b{to sth</b> ) <i>n </i>}<br>[C, usually sing.] sb/sth that is very similar to ,throw sb/sth 'off sth </b><br>to get rid of sb/sth that is making you suffer, annoying you, following you, etc.; to free yourself from sb/sth摆脱；甩掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to throw </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消除愤怒/家务烦恼/烦心事</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They waded through a stream to throw the dogs off }(= so that they could not follow them)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们涉水穿过小溪，摆脱狗只的追缠。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I tried every way I could think of to throw him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用尽一切办法甩开他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wants to throw off her old image and start again.</font></i><br><font 我好像不能摆脱这伤风。</font><br>to disturb sb/sth who is trying to do sth, making them fail or not behave as usual打扰；扰乱；使慌乱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The director came in while I was speaking and that threw me off a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我讲话时主任走了进来，让我有点着慌。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sb off,put sb off sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp throw sb off 'balance <br>to make sb unsteady and likely to fall使失去平衡；使摇摇欲坠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was thrown off balance by the sudden gust of wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的一阵风差点把我吹倒。</font><br>to make sb surprised and no longer calm使慌张；使张惶失措:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The senator was course</b>, they are forced away from the direction they should be travelling in使偏离行进﹙或行驶﹚方向:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane was thrown off course in dense fog.</font></i><br><font government was thrown off course by labour and economic problems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 劳工和经济问题迫使政府改变了方针政策。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp throw sb off the 'scent<br>to do sth to 他吃了饭，但马上全吐了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bring sth up;vomit,vomit sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,throw sb/sth 'up </b><br>to lift sb/sth and make them move upwards into the air by moving your hand quickly猛地举起﹙或举高﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby loved being <b>thrown up into the air</b> .</font></i><br><font [OBJ]<b>problems,questions,ideas,facts </b><br><i>(BrE</i>,<i>informal</i>) to leave your job suddenly and often unexpectedly﹙ 出人意料地﹚突然放弃﹙ 工作﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw up a highly paid job to travel round the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他辞去高薪工作，周游世界。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>job</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chuck sth in/up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>),give sth up <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to build sth suddenly or quickly, and often carelessly﹙草草地﹚急促建造，匆忙建造:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These buildings were 他摔倒时连忙举起双手护着脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She threw her arms up in horror.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她惊恐地举起了双臂。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hand,arm </b><br>to make sth such as dust or water rise up into the air扬起﹙灰尘、水等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wheels threw up a shower of mud and water.</font></i><br><font thrust	<h3>thrust<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,thrust sth a'side </b><br>to refuse to listen to sb’s complaints,comments, etc.置若罔闻:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All our objections were thrust aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们所有的异议都被置之不理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'thrust sb/sth on sb (<i>also</i> 'thrust sb/sth upon sb <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to force sb to accept sb/sth or do sth that they do not want to把……强加于某人；强迫某人接受……；强人所难:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Responsibility for the family was thrust upon him at an early age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他年龄不大的时候就担负起家庭的责任。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was annoyed at having three extra guests suddenly thrust upon her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突然又来了三位不速之客要她接待，她感到很恼火。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>role,responsibility,change</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n

tick	<h3>tick<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tick a'way; ,tick sth a'way </b><br>if a clock <b>ticks away</b> or <b>ticks</b> the minutes or seconds <b>away</b>, it makes continuous short light regular sounds to mark time passing﹙钟表﹚发出滴答声，滴答地走时:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clock ticked away in the silence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只钟在寂静中滴答作响。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We waited as the clock ticked away the last few seconds of the old millennium.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们静候着时钟滴答走过千年的最后几秒钟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tick a'way/ 'by/ 'past</b><br>(of time时间) to pass, especially when you feel it is passing too quickly or too slowly过去，流逝﹙尤其使人感觉太快或太慢﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The seconds ticked by as I tried to think of something to say.</font></i><br><font 漫长的两分钟过去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>minutes,seconds,time</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tick sb 'off </b><br>(for sth/for doing sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)to
