tie	<h3>tie<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie sb 'down </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,tie yourself 'down</b>) (<b>to sth/to doing sth</b> ) to restrict sb’s activities or freedom, for example by making them accept particular conditions or by keeping them busy限制；束缚；牵制:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We managed to tie him down to a date for the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们终于让他敲定了开会的日期。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She didn’t want to be tied down by a full-time job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不想被全职工作拴住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t want to be tied down to coming back at a particular time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想限定自己回来的时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you really want to tie yourself down at 18 with a husband, a home and a baby? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你真的想在18 岁就被丈夫、家庭和孩子捆绑住吗？</font><br>to do sth so that an enemy force is kept busy and has to stay in a particular area牵制﹙ 敌人﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Guerrilla activity kept the army tied down in the mountains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游击队的活动把军队牵制在了山区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>troops,police</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie 'in (with sth)</b><br>to fit or be in agreement with sth﹙与…﹚相配，相符:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This new evidence ties in with the witness’s statement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一新证据和目击者的证词相符。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That doesn’t tie in with what you said yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个跟你昨天说的有出入。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie 'in (with sth), ,tie sth 'in (with sth)</b><br>to link sth or be linked to sth; to happen or to arrange for sth to happen at the same time as sth else﹙使﹚ ……﹙与…﹚连接在一起；﹙使﹚同时进行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book was intended to tie in with the TV series.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书旨在配合这部电视系列剧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack couldn’t be tied in with the murder.</font></i><br><font book or a toy that is sold in close connection with a film/movie, television programme, etc.﹙与上映的电影或电视节目等﹚相关的产品，有关的书籍，有联系的玩具:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp television/film tie-ins </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与电视/电影紧密联系的产品</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp tie-in books/toys/ sales </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与电影相关的书/玩具/销售</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>) a link or a relationship with sth关联；关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a tie-in to the main subject </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与主题的关系</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie sth 'off </b><br>to put a knot in the end of sth; to close sth with string, thread, etc.结扎；﹙用绳子、线等﹚封口:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tie off a rope/an artery </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在绳子头上打结；结扎动脉</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie 'up; ,tie sth 'up </b><br>to attach a boat to a fixed point with a rope﹙使船只﹚系泊，停靠:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The barge tied up at the quay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 驳船停靠在码头边上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ben tied the boat up and jumped ashore.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 本把船停泊妥当，然后跳到岸上。</font><br>to close or fasten sth with a knot; to be closed or fastened in this way﹙把某物﹚系紧，捆牢，拴住，扎紧:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m so fat my bathrobe won’t tie up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我胖得连浴衣都系不上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tie up a garbage bag </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 扎紧垃圾袋</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie sb 'up </b><br>to tie sb’s arms and legs tightly so that they cannot move or escape把某人捆绑起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gang tied up the security guard and put a gag in his mouth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那帮歹徒把保安人员捆绑起来，然后把他的嘴堵住。</font><br>to keep sb so busy that they have no time for other things把某人缠住；使不能分身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m tied up in a meeting until three.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我开会直到三点钟才能脱身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry I’m late — I was tied up at the office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 抱歉， 我来晚了—我在办公室忙得走不开。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tie sth 'up </b><br>to make sth secure by putting string, rope, etc. around it, or attaching it to sth else﹙用绳索等把某物﹚系好，拴住，拴到……上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tied the parcel up with a ribbon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用丝带把包裹扎好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tied the dog up outside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把狗拴在外面。</font><br>(with sth) to connect or link sth to sth else把……联系起来； 使与……有关系:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her behaviour is tied up with her feelings of guilt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的行为出于内疚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think these two incidents are tied up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认为这两件事有联系吗？</font><br>(in sth) to invest money so that it is not easily available for use搁死﹙资金﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of our capital is tied up in property.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们大部份资金都搁死在房地产上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>money,capital,resources,assets</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>lock sth up</b><br>to deal with all the remaining details of sth完成；处理完:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tie up a deal </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 达成交易</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re hoping to <b>tie up all the loose ends</b> as quickly as possible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们希望尽快把未了结的事全部处理完。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>deal,loose ends </b><br>to bring sth to a stop; to prevent sb from doing sth or using sth使停止；阻止……做某事﹙或使用某物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strike tied up production for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工使生产停顿了一周。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Haven’t you finished yet? You’ve been tying up the phone for hours! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你还没打完吗？你把电话占用了几个小时了！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tie-up <i>n </i></b><br>(<b>with sb/sth</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) an agreement between two companies to join together﹙公司之间的﹚联合，合作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re negotiating a tieup with Ford.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在和福特公司商定协作事宜。</font><br>(<b>between A and B</b>) (<i>BrE</i>) a connection between two or more things﹙事物之间的﹚联系，关系，关联:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a tie-up between politics and economics </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政治和经济的关系</font><br><i>(especially AmE</i>)a situation in which sth, especially traffic, stops moving停滞不前；停顿；﹙尤指﹚交通阻塞:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A tie-up on the highway caused major delays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公路上的交通阻塞引起了重大的延误。</font><br>\n
tighten	<h3>tighten<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tighten 'up; ,tighten sth 'up </b><br>to become or to make sth tight or tighter﹙使﹚绷紧，更加牢固:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His face muscles tightened up in anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他生气地紧绷着脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tighten up a screw/ wheel/muscle </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拧紧螺丝；上紧轮子；绷紧肌肉</font><br>to become more careful or strict about sth; to make sth more strict变得更加小心﹙或严格﹚；使更加严格:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Laws on gambling have tightened up recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有关赌博的法律最近变得更加严厉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are <b>tightening up on</b> drinkdriving.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方正在采取更加严厉的措施对付酒后开车的问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to tighten up laws/rules/legislation/ security </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加强法律/规定/法规/安全措施</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv(<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

,tip sth 'over </b><br>to become unstable and fall over; to make sth do this﹙使﹚跌倒，翻倒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bottle tipped over and all the water spilled out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 瓶子倒了，水全洒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch you don’t tip the jug over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小心点，别把罐子打翻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>overturn,overturn sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tip 'up; way漫不经心地讨论；泛泛而谈:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sat and tossed around a few suggestions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们坐着纵谈了几个意见。</font><br><i><font 态度、想法、生活方式等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The idea of buying a new car was quickly tossed aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 买新车的想法很快就被抛到一边。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp carelessly随意扔掉﹙或丢掉﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She finished her drink and tossed the can away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她喝完饮料就随手把罐子扔了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) He’s tossed away so many opportunities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他丢失了这么多机会。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,toss sth 'back </b><br>(<i>also</i> <b>,toss sth 'down </b><i>less frequent</i>)to drink sth very quickly, especially alcohol很快地喝下﹙尤指酒﹚；灌下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tossed back glass after glass of champagne.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一杯接一杯地灌香槟酒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tossed back the rest of his drink and walked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把剩下的酒一饮而尽，然后走了出去。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>drink,whisky,wine,etc. </b><br>to move sth, especially your head, quickly backwards,especially when you are angry or impatient甩﹙头，表示不高兴﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sam tossed back his head in defiance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 萨姆蔑视地扬起头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tossed back her hair and smiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她向后甩了甩头发，笑了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>hair,head</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'toss for sth;'toss sb for sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)(<i>BrE also </i>&b{,toss 'up (for sth))</b> (<i>AmE also </i><b>'flip for sth,'flip sb for sth</b>)}<br>to make a decision about sth by spinning a coin in the air and seeing which side is on top when it lands﹙给某人﹚掷硬币决定……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can’t both go, so why don’t we toss for it? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 既然咱俩不能都去，为什么不掷硬币决定谁去呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’s only one ticket left — I’ll toss you for it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只剩一张票—我要和你掷硬币决定给谁。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> FLIP FOR STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,toss 'off; ,toss sb 'off; ,toss yourself 'off</b><br>(<i>BrE</i>, !, <i>slang</i>) to give yourself sexual pleasure by rubbing your sex organs; to give sb else sexual pleasure in this way手淫；对某人行手淫<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,toss sth 'off <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to do sth quickly,easily and often with little care or effort﹙不加审慎或不费力﹚很快做好:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tossed this novel off in two months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用了两个月就把小说匆匆写完了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp to decide between two things, or where there are two possible results两难的局面；难以取捨的事；机会均等的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a tossup between spending the night in the van and walking ten miles for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在客货车里睡一晚还是走上十英里求援，当时实在是进退两难。</font><br>\n

touch	<h3>touch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,touch 'down </b><br>(of a plane, a spacecraft, etc.飞机、航天器等) to land着陆；降落:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane touched down safely at Kennedy Airport at about midday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机中午时分安全降落在肯尼迪机场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) A tornado touched down in Colorado, injuring five people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 龙卷风在科罗拉多登陆，导致五人受伤。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>plane,aircraft,helicopter</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>land</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>take off </b><br>(in rugby橄榄球) to score points (a <b>try</b> ) by putting the ball on the ground behind the other team’s goal line﹙在对方球门线后﹚持球触地得分，底线得分:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Williams touched down in the first few minutes of the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp act of scoring points by putting the ball down on the area of ground behind the other team’s goal line﹙在对方球门线后的﹚持球触地<br>(in American football美式足球) an act of scoring points by crossing the other team’s goal line while carrying the ball, or receiving the ball when you are over the other team’s goal line持球越过对方球门线；在对方球门线上接球<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'touch sb for sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to persuade sb to give or lend you money向……要，劝说……借给﹙钱﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to touch me for twenty pounds.</font></i><br><font v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'touch on/upon sth </b><br>to mention or deal briefly with a topic, a problem, etc.谈及； 提及:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp trade	<h3>trade<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trade 'down (to sth) </b><br>to spend less money on things than you used to降低消费:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are trading down and buying cheaper food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们都降低消费，购买廉价食物。</font><br>to sell sth large or expensive and buy sth smaller or less expensive卖好买次；卖大的买小的，卖高价的买低价的﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They traded down to a house with fewer bedrooms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们卖掉房子，买了座少几间卧室的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>trade up (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trade sth 'in (for sth)</b><br>to give sth that you have used to sb you are buying sth new from as part of your payment以旧物折价﹙换新物﹚；折价贴换﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He traded his motorbike in for a new van.</font></i><br><font used item as part of the payment for a new one; the used item that you give折价贴换；以旧折价换新；折价旧物:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp the trade-in value of a car </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一辆汽车的折价价值</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you have a tradein?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有折价的旧东西吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trade sth 'off (against sth)</b><br>to balance two things or situations that are opposed to each other权衡； 平衡； 使协调:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government were attempting to trade off inflation against unemployment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府正力求在通货膨胀和失业之间取得平衡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were willing to trade off information to keep the hostages alive }(= to give information in exchange for their lives)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们愿意交出信息以换取人质的性命。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trade-off (&b{between sth and sth</b>) <i>n </i>}<br>the act of balancing two things that you need or want but which are opposed to each other﹙在需要而又相互对立的两者间的﹚权衡，协调:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a trade-off between inflation and unemployment </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通货膨胀和失业之间的平衡</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a trade-off between the benefits of the drug and the risk of side effects.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药既有好处又有产生副作用的危险。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trade on sth (<i>also</i> &b{'trade upon sth</b><i>more formal</i>,<i>less frequent</i>) (<i>disapproving</i>)}<br>to unfairly make use of sth for your own advantage用……﹙谋私利﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He traded on his father’s name to get himself a job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他利用他父亲的名义为自己弄到了份工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exploit sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trade 'up (to sth) </b><br>to sell sth small or not expensive in order to buy sth larger or more expensive卖次买好；卖小的买大的，卖低价的买高价的﹙……﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He traded up to a larger car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他卖掉汽车，买了辆较大的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>trade down (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trade upon sth =TRADE ON STH</b><br>\n
traffic	<h3>traffic<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'traffic in sth </b><br>to buy and sell sth, especially drugs or weapons, illegally﹙非法﹚进行……交易，做……买卖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was accused of trafficking in stolen works of art.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被控买卖盗窃艺术品。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>drugs,weapons</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

train	<h3>train<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'train sth on/upon sb/sth( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to point sth such as a gun, a camera, a light, etc. at sb/sth把﹙枪口、照相机、灯光等﹚瞄准，对准:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police marksmen trained their weapons on the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方的射手用武器瞄准那座楼房。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She trained the camera on the bride and groom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把照相机对准了新娘和新郎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He kept his eyes trained on the road ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的眼睛一直盯着前方的路。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>gun,camera,eyes</b><br>[NOTE]This phrasal verb is used mainly in written English.这个短语动词主要用于书面语。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,train sb 'up </b><br>to make sb ready to do a job or an activity by teaching them the skills they need把……培训好；充分培养:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to train up extra staff for the Christmas period.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得培训额外的职员，以应付圣诞节期间的需要。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
traipse	<h3>traipse<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,traipse a'round; ,traipse a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,traipse 'round, ,traipse 'round sth) (<i>informal</i>)</b><br>to walk from place to place slowly because you are tired and unwilling疲惫地走；拖沓地行走；磨蹭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been traipsing around all day with Jenny trying to buy a coat for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一整天都疲乏地陪着珍妮四处转悠，想给她买件大衣。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We spent the afternoon traipsing around the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们拖着疲惫的身子在城里转了一下午。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>\n
trample	<h3>trample<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trample on/over sb/sth </b><br>to ignore sb’s feelings or rights and treat them as if they are not important践踏，摧残﹙人权、心灵等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government is trampling on the views of ordinary people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府在践踏民意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let Jack <b>trample all over</b> you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要让杰克任意糟蹋你！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

Can you trim off about two centimetres? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的头发太长了。你给我剪掉大约两公分好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trim 'down; ,trim sth 'down </b><br>to become, or to make sth, smaller in size减少； 缩减:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s trimmed down from 90 kilos to 70.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的体重从90千克减到了70 千克。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie was trimmed down to 21/2 hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影被剪辑成了两个半小时。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>slim down;slim down,slim sth down</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n

trot	<h3>trot<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trot 'off </b><br>to go somewhere, walking quite quickly快步走， 小跑﹙ 去某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She trotted off to school happily with her new lunch box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她带着新午饭盒高高兴兴地跑去学校了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,trot sth 'out <i>(informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to say or repeat sth such as an excuse, an explanation, etc.without thinking about it or being sincere about it随口说出﹙常用的託词、解释等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The airline trotted out the same old excuses to explain the delays.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 航空公司又用那老一套的藉口来解释延误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s just trotting out the party line again}(= in politics)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他又搬出了党的路线。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

trust	<h3>trust<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trust in sb/sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to have confidence in sb/sth; to rely on sb completely相信，信任，信赖﹙人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was scared before the operation, but I trusted in the skill of the doctors and nurses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手术之前我很害怕，但我相信医生和护士的技术。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He urged them to trust in God.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他鼓励他们相信上帝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>God</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trust to sb/sth </b><br>to leave the result or progress of events to be decided by luck, chance, etc.,because there is nothing or no one else to help you依靠，依赖﹙运气、机会等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I stumbled along in the dark, <b>trusting to luck</b> to find the right door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我摸黑跌跌撞撞地往前走，全凭运气去找对门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>luck</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'trust sb with sb/sth </b><br>to give sb/sth to a person to take care of because you believe they will be careful with them/it託付；託交；把……委託给某人照管:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you trust her with the children?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把孩子们交给她照看好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d trust him with my life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是我可以託付终身的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
try	<h3>try<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,try 'back; ,try sb 'back <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to telephone sb again when you have already telephoned them but have not managed to speak to them﹙给某人﹚再打电话:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you try back later? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你过会儿再打过来好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s not there. I’ll have to try her back after lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不在。我只好等午饭之后再给她打电话。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>phone back,phone sb back <i>(especially BrE</i>), call back,call sb back</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'try for sth <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to make an attempt to get or win sth试图获得； 力争赢得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you going to try for that job? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你打算争取那份工作吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve been trying for a baby for several years now }(= the woman has been trying to become pregnant)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们试了几年时间想怀上孩子。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>a baby</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,try it 'on (with sb)</b><br>(<i>informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>) to behave badly towards sb or try to get sth from them just to see what you can do before they become angry or stop you摸﹙别人的﹚脾气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The kids sometimes try it on with a new babysitter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小孩子有时会摸摸新保姆的脾气。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+it+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'try-on <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>BrE</i>) an act of trying to behave badly and hoping that no one will stop you﹙对别人脾气的﹚摸底，探索<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,try sth 'on</b><br>to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits and how it looks试穿﹙衣物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can I try on the blue one? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我能试试那件蓝色的吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you like it, why don’t you try it on? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你如果喜欢，为什么不试穿一下呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,try 'out (for sth) (<i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to compete for a place in a sports team, a part in a play, etc.参加﹙……的﹚选拔；参加﹙……的﹚试演:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried out for the school band.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他参加了学校乐队的甄选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s a pretty good team. I think I’ll try out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个队很不错。我想我要去参加选拔。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'try-out <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>AmE</i>) a test, etc. to choose players for a team, actors for a play, etc.选拔；试演:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team is holding try-outs this Thursday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队将于本周四进行选拔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you have a try-out for the school play? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你参加学校戏剧演员甄选了吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TRY-OUT at TRY SB/STH OUT (ON SB)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,try sb/sth 'out (on sb) </b><br>to test sb/sth to see how good and useful they are or how suitable for a particular task or purpose before you decide to use them/it试用﹙某人﹚；测试；试验:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve been trying out some new musicians for our band.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一直在为我们的乐队试用一些新乐手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn’t wait to try out his new invention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他迫不及待地想试验一下他的新发明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got an idea I’d like to try out on you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有个想法，想在你身上试试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drug has not been tried out on humans yet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药尚未进行人体试验。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>test sth out (on sb/sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'try-out <i>n </i></b><br>an act of testing how good or suitable sb/sth is before you decide to use them/it试用；试验；测试:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play had an out-of-town try-out in Oxford.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个剧在牛津进行了跨区试演。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TRY-OUT at TRY OUT (FOR STH)<br>\n
tuck	<h3>tuck<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck sth a'way </b><br><b>be ,tucked a'way</b> to be in a quiet or hidden place where not many people go坐落在， 位于﹙ 僻静的地方﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house is tucked away right at the end of a rough track.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那房子就在一条崎岖小路的尽头。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hide sth away</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The café was tucked away in the basement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小餐馆设在地下室。</font><br>(<b>in sth</b>) to put sth in a safe place, especially sth valuable把﹙ 珍贵的东西等﹚ 藏起来； 收存﹙ 在……﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tucked the photos away in her wallet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把那些相片收藏在皮夹子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’ve got some money tucked away for emergencies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们存了些钱以备急用。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stash sth away </b><br>(<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) to eat a lot of food大吃；拚命吃；暴食:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can certainly <b>tuck it away</b> ! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他真能吃！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>put sth away</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck 'in; ,tuck 'into sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to eat food, especially quickly or with enthusiasm痛快地吃；狼吞虎咽地吃:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We tucked in hungrily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们狼吞虎咽地大吃一通。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was tucking into a huge plateful of pasta.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在狼吞虎咽地吃一大盘通心粉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tuck in, everybody! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家痛痛快快地吃吧！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>dig in;dig into sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck sb 'in/ 'up </b><br>to cover sb, especially a child,comfortably in bed by pulling the covers around them把﹙孩子等﹚的被子掖好；给……盖好被子:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you come and tuck me in, Mummy? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妈妈，来给我掖掖被子好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were all tucked up in bed by 8 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们到晚上8点钟就全给掖进被窝了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck sth 'in; ,tuck sth 'into sth </b><br>to push or fold the loose end of a piece of clothing, a sheet,rope, hair, etc., in sth, to make it tidy or hold it in position把衣服﹙或床单、绳索、头发等﹚的松散末端收拢；把……掖在……里:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom, tuck your shirt in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆，掖好你的衬衣！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don’t you tuck your trousers into your socks? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么不把裤脚塞到袜子里？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tuck the flap of the envelope in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把信封的封盖摺好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>shirt </b><br>to pull a part of your body inwards, especially by making your muscles tight向内收，收缩﹙身体部位﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stand up straight and tuck your bottoms in! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 站直，臀部收拢！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep your chin tucked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收拢你的下巴。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck sb 'up=TUCK SB IN/UP</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tuck sth 'up </b><br>to move or put sth in a small space, especially to hide it or keep it safe or comfortable将……收起；将……放在﹙狭小而安全或舒适的位置﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She kicked off her shoes and tucked her feet up under her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她踢掉鞋子，盘起腿。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>legs,feet</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She sat with her legs tucked up under her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她盘腿坐着。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

tumble	<h3>tumble<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tumble 'down</b><br>to fall suddenly to the ground in a dramatic way突然倒塌；坍塌:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One push and the wall came tumbling down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那堵墙一推就倒塌了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her long dark hair tumbled down around her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她那黑油油的长发垂在她的脸庞周围。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ( <i>figurative</i>) She felt herself tumbling down into the hole.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感觉自己掉进洞里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tumbledown <i>adj </i></b><br>[usually before noun] a<b>tumbledown</b> building is old and in a very bad condition, with parts falling down﹙建筑物﹚摇摇欲坠的，破烂不堪的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lived in a small, tumbledown hut.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他住在一个狭小破败的棚屋里。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tumble 'over </b><br>to fall to the ground倒下；落下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knocked the statue and it tumbled over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她碰到塑像上，塑像就翻倒了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'tumble to sb/sth <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to suddenly realize, understand, or become aware of what sb/sth is really like一下子了解某人﹙或事情等﹚；顿悟；突然意识到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve tumbled to Isabel now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在突然明白了伊莎贝儿的为人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve tumbled to what he is trying to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我赫然意识到他的意图。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
tune	<h3>tune<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tune 'in (to sth), ,tune 'into sth </b><br>to turn on the radio or television in order to listen or watch a particular programme or channel收听﹙收音机广播节目﹚；收看﹙电视节目﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We tuned in to watch the football.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们收看了足球节目。</font><br><i><font people’s thoughts, feelings or needs理解，体谅﹙他人的思想、感情或需要﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must tune into the needs of the people you love.</font></i><br><font you can hear or see a particular programme or channel clearly﹙给收音机、电视﹚调谐，调频道:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio isn’t properly tuned in.</font></i><br><font 我把收音机调定在英国广播公司国际广播电台的频道。</font><br>(<i>AmE</i>) to turn on the radio or television in order to listen to or watch a particular programme收听﹙收音机广播节目﹚；收看﹙电视节目﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tune in our TV special tonight at nine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚九点请收看我们的特别节目。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be ,tuned 'in (to sth);be ,tuned 'into sth </b><br>to be aware of or understand sth, especially other people’s feelings明白，理解，体谅﹙尤指他人的感情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parents should be tuned in to the needs of their child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母应该理解孩子的需要。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m tuned in to what I have to do.</font></i><br><font television so that you can listen to or watch a particular programme把收音机﹙或电视机﹚调到﹙某频道﹚上:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the TVs in the store were tuned to the same channel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这店里所有的电视机都调在同一频道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,tune 'up </b><br>when an orchestra <b>tunes turf	<h3>turf<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turf sb/sth 'out; ,turf sb/sth 'out of sth <i>(also</i> ,turf sb 'off, ,turf sb 'off sth) (<i>BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to force sb/sth to leave a particular place or an organization把……赶出，驱逐出﹙地方、组织等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We need to turf the Democratic party out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该把民主党赶走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several families have been turfed out of their homes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几家人被逐出了家园。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys should have been turfed off the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些男孩原本应该被赶下公共汽车的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>kick sb out,kick sb out of sth;throw sb/sth out,throw sb/sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turf sth 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>to get rid of sth you do not want丢弃，扔掉﹙不需要的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shop is full of beautiful clothes that people have turfed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家商店里面全是人们处理掉的漂亮衣服。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
turn	<h3>turn<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn a'bout <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to turn around quickly so as to face in the opposite direction急向后转；突然转身；回头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She turned about and went into the kitchen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一转身进了厨房。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TURN AROUND,TURN SB/STH AROUND;TURN AROUND,TURN STH AROUND<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>a,bout-'turn <i>n </i>(<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>an act of turning around quickly so as to face in the opposite direction向后转； 急转身； 回头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He did a rapid about-turn when he saw me and went back inside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一见到我就连忙转过身回到里面。</font><br>a complete change of opinion, plan or behaviour﹙看法、计划、态度的﹚彻底转变；改弦易辙:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hours later the management did an about-turn and agreed to our demands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个小时之后，资方彻底转变了态度，同意了我们的要求。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a dramatic about-turn in government policy </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府政策的突然重大改变</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turnabout <i>n </i>[sing.] </b><br>an act of turning around quickly so as to face in the opposite direction向后转； 急转身； 回头<br>a sudden and complete change in attitude or opinion﹙态度或看法的﹚彻底转变；突变；变卦<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn a'gainst sb/sth; ,turn sb a'gainst sb/sth </b><br>to stop, or to make sb stop, being friendly towards sb; to stop, or to make sb stop,supporting sb/sth﹙使﹚与……反目成仇，变得敌对，不再支持:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her old friends were turning against her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的老朋友都跟她翻脸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s trying to turn his family against me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图令他的家人反对我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What has made them turn against the government? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是什么使他们不再支持政府了？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,turn round)</b><br>if sb <b>turns around</b> and does sth, they do sth unexpectedly and often unfairly﹙不公平地﹚做出人意料的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What will we do if he <b>turns around and</b> says it was all our fault? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他突然倒打一耙说全是我们的错，我们该怎么办呢？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn a'round; ,turn sb/sth a'round <i>(BrE also</i> ,turn 'round, ,turn sb/sth 'round) </b><br>to move your head and shoulders or your whole body so that you face in the opposite direction; to make sb/sth change position in this way﹙使﹚翻身，转身， 翻转:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She turned around to stare at the man behind her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她转身盯着后面的男子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked away without turning round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他头也不回地走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I turned the bottle round to look at the label.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把瓶子转过来看看标籤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nurse turned him around to face the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 护士帮他转过身去面对窗户。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  TURN ABOUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turnaround (<i>BrE also </i>'turnround) <i>n </i> [usually sing.] </b><br>the amount of time it takes to unload a plane or ship at the end of a journey and load it ready for the next one﹙飞机或船的﹚终点装卸时间<br>the amount of time that it takes to do a piece of work that you have been given and return it﹙接活到交活之间的﹚周转期，时限<br>a complete change in sb’s opinion, plans,behaviour, etc.﹙看法、计划、态度等的﹚彻底转变；改弦易辙<br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TURNAROUND at TURN AROUND,TURN STH AROUND<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn a'round; ,turn sth a'round <i>(BrE also</i> ,turn 'round, ,turn sth 'round) </b><br>if a business or an economy <b>turns around</b>, or sb <b>turns it around</b>,it becomes successful after it has been unsuccessful for a time﹙ 使企业或经济﹚ 好转，扭转， 有起色:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The economy is slowly turning around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经济正慢慢复苏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His job is to try to turn the company around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的工作是努力使公司扭亏为盈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turnaround (<i>BrE also </i>'turnround) <i>n </i>[C,usually sing.] </b><br>a sudden improvement in a business, an economy, etc.﹙企业、经济等的﹚好转，复苏，转机:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The predicted economic turnaround failed to happen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预期的经济复苏没有出现。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TURNAROUND at TURN AROUND,TURN SB/STH AROUND<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn sth a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,turn sth 'round) </b><br>to deliberately understand sth that sb says in the wrong way, especially for your own advantage故意错误理解，曲解﹙某人的话﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You turn everything I say around to make me look stupid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你成心曲解我的话，让我看上去像个傻瓜。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ to one side, especially in order to avoid sth difficult or dangerous使闪开；使避开；使转向一边:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As he bent to kiss her, she turned her head aside.</font></i><br><font 电流、煤气、水等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to turn the radio/television off </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关掉收音机/电视</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I forgot to turn the tap off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忘了关上水龙头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn all the lights off when you leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离开时把所有的灯都关掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll need to turn off the water to mend the pipe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你修理水管时得关上水阀。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>light,television,tap,water,gas,etc.</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>switch sth off</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>turn sth on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> period of time营业额为……；做金额为……的生意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company turned over a million pounds in its first year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司第一年的营业额为一百万英镑。</font><br>to think about sth carefully认真思考；深思熟虑:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Diana turned over what James had said in her mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黛安娜的脑子里不断琢磨詹姆斯的话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lay in the dark, turning over the day’s extraordinary events.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他躺在黑暗中，反复思考着那天里不寻常的事。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>chew sth over;mull sth over </b><br><i>(BrE</i>, <i>slang</i>) to enter a place illegally and steal valuable things from it抢劫﹙ 某处﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burglars had turned the house over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 盗贼把房子洗劫一空。</font><br>(<i>BrE</i>) to search a place very thoroughly, making it very untidy彻底搜查；把某处翻得凌乱不堪:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His room had been turned over by the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的房间被警察翻了个底朝天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turnover <i>n </i></b><br>[C, usually sing.] [U] the total amount of goods and services sold by a company during a particular period of time营业额；成交量:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp an annual turnover of twenty million </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两千万的年营业额</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i> TURNOVER at TURN OVER,TURN SB/STH OVER;TURNOVER at TURN OVER,TURN STH OVER<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn 'over to sth; ,turn sth 'over to sth </b><br>if an area, a factory, etc. <b>turns over</b> or sb <b>turns it over</b> to sth, it starts to be used for sth different﹙把…﹚改用作……:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole area has turned over to rice production.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个地区已改为生产大米。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The factory was turned over to the production of aircraft parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家工厂转产飞机部件。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn 'round <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn sth 'round <i>(BrE</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turn to sb </b><br>to move your head or body so as to face sb把脸转向，转身朝向﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned to me and smiled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他转过身对我笑了。</font><br>(<b>for sth</b>) to approach sb for help, sympathy or advice向某人﹙寻求帮助或意见等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sue turns to her friends for support rather than her family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 休求朋友支持，而不找家里人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’re the only person I can turn to for advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是我唯一能求教的人。</font><br><i><font </b><br>to start to become involved in sth or start to do sth, especially sth illegal or harmful,often because you are in a difficult situation诉诸……；落到做……的田地:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was forced to turn to crime to pay off his debts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为了还债被迫犯法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People often cope with stress by 他终于在三点钟到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The taxi didn’t turn up so we walked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 出租车没有来，于是我们就步行。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp </i>)=TURN ON STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'turn sth upon sb/sth=TURN STH ON SB/STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,turn upside 'down; ,turn sth upside 'down</b><br>to move sth so veg	<h3>veg<sup>1</sup></h3>[NOTE]Although these forms are spelt with <i>-gg-</i>,they are all pronounced /ved?- || v?d?-/.即使拼写用-gg-，读音仍为/ved?- || v?d?-/不变。<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,veg 'out <i>(spoken</i>, <i>informal </i>)</b><br>to relax and do very little消闲；休闲:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All she does is veg out in front of the telly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她成天清闲地泡在电视前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>laze about/around;lounge about/around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
venture	<h3>venture<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'venture into/on sth <i>(also </i> 'venture upon sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to dare to do sth that could be dangerous or involve risk敢于做；冒险做:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as he arrived in the country, he ventured on a trip up the Amazon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一到这个国家就沿亚马孙河溯流而上冒险旅行去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is the first time the company has ventured into movie production.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是本公司首次涉足电影制作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
verge	<h3>verge<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'verge on sth <i>(also </i> 'verge upon sth <i>more formal</i>)</b><br>to be very close or similar to an extreme state or condition极接近；濒于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was treated with suspicion that verged on hostility.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我受到了几近敌意的猜疑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her hair was dark brown, verging on black.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的头发深棕色，近乎黑色。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>border on sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
vest	<h3>vest<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'vest sth in sb/sth;'vest sb with sth ( <i>formal</i>)</b><br>to officially or legally give sb the power or authority to do sth授予，赋予，给予﹙正式或合法权力﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is unwise to vest absolute power in a single institution.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将绝对权力赋予单一机构是不明智的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The court is vested with certain rights.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法庭拥有某些权力。</font><br>to make sb the legal owner of land or property使合法拥有﹙土地或财产﹚<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
vie	<h3>vie<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'vie with sb/sth (for sth/to do sth), 'vie for sth</b><br>( <i>formal</i>) (<i>often used in the progressive tenses </i>常用于进行时) to compete strongly with sb/sth﹙为某事物﹚与…激烈竞争:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There’ll be a lot of people vying for those posts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会有很多人争夺这些职位的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were vying for the teacher’s attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们都较着劲想得到老师的注意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys were vying with each other to impress her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小伙子们争着给她留下好印象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were several restaurants vying with each other for customers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几家餐馆在相互竞争以招揽顾客。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>compete (with sb/sth) (for sth)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys were vying to impress her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小伙子们争着给她留下好印象。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
visit	<h3>visit<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'visit with sb </b><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>informal </i>) to spend time with sb talking in an informal and casual way与…聊天﹙或闲谈﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I visited with my neighbour while the kids were playing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们玩的时候我和邻居聊天。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>be 'visited on sb/sth <i>(also </i> be 'visited upon sb/sth) (<i>old-fashioned</i>, <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to be punished with sth遭到… 的惩罚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He listed the horrors visited upon the region during the conflict.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他列举了冲突期间这个地区的悲惨状况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Each new indignity visited on her was worse than the previous one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她受到的侮辱一次比一次严重。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]be+v+prep<br>\n
vote	<h3>vote<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sb/sth 'down </b><br>to reject or defeat a candidate or a proposal by voting投票否决；投票击败:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Senate has voted down efforts to raise taxes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参议院投票否决了增加税收的努力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If Mr Smith demands too much, the unions will vote him down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果史密斯先生提出过高的要求，工会将不投他的票。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sb 'in; ,vote sb 'into/ 'onto sth </b><br>to choose sb for a particular position by voting投票选出…任职:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was voted in as treasurer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我当选为司库。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When was this government voted into office?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个政府是何时获选当政的？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who voted her onto the Board of Governors? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁投票把她选进董事会的？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>elect sb (to sth) (<i>more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>) ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sb 'off sth=VOTE SB OUT,VOTE SB OUT OF/OFF STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'vote on sth </b><br>to make a decision about sth by voting就…投票表决:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee is voting on the proposal tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会将于今晚对该提议进行投票表决。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Workers have begun voting on whether to hold a series of one-day strikes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们已经开始进行投票，决定是否举行一连串的逐日罢工。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>proposal,resolution,issue</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The proposal was voted on and agreed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个提议经投票通过了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sb 'onto sth=VOTE SB IN,VOTE SB INTO/ONTO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sb 'out; ,vote sb 'out of/ 'off sth </b><br>to decide as a group to remove sb from a particular position by voting投票免去某人的职务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government may be voted out of office at the next election.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个政府在下次大选时可能落选。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What will he do if he gets voted out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他如果落选会做什么呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parsons was voted off the Board.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经投票帕森斯被免去了董事会的职务。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>government,party</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,vote sth 'through </b><br>to approve sth or bring a proposal,etc. into force by voting for it投票通过﹙ 建议等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Congress voted the bill through without a debate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国会未经辩论就投票通过了法案。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>bill,proposal</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
vouch	<h3>vouch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'vouch for sb/sth </b><br>to say that you know sb, that you believe they have a good character and that you are prepared to be responsible for their actions替… 担保﹙ 或保证﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They asked whether I was prepared to vouch for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们问我是否愿意为他作担保。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should give the names of two people who can vouch for your honesty and reliability.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应该提供两个能担保你诚实可信的人的名字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can vouch for the fact that he is a good worker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我保证他是好员工。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>answer for sth</b><br>to say that you know sth is true because you have seen it yourself﹙因亲眼看见而﹚为…作证；见证…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was in bed with flu. My wife can vouch for that/me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时我患流感卧床休息。我妻子可为此/为我作证。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t vouch for this hotel }(= I have no personal experience of it)&b{ but it looked wonderful from the brochure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没住过这家旅馆，可从指南上看它很棒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to be vouched for by a responsible person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得找个可靠的人来为我作证。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
wade	<h3>wade<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wade 'in; ,wade 'into sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to get involved in a discussion, an argument, a difficult situation, etc. in a forceful and not very sensitive way强行加入，介入，插手﹙讨论、争论、困局等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She waded in with an attack on company policy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她插了一杠子，对公司的政策进行了抨击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Senator waded into a new argument over defence spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参议员强行加入了关于国防开支的新一轮争论。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wade 'into sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to attack sb physically or with words猛烈攻击；抨击:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Marty was terrific — he just waded into the skinheads without a thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马蒂太棒了─他毫不含煳地揍了那些光头仔。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She waded straight into her critics with her opening remarks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在开场白里直截了当地反驳了批评她的人。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>launch into sb;attack sb <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wade 'through sth </b><br>to spend a lot of time and effort reading sth or dealing with sth费时费力地阅读； 艰难地处理:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had to wade through pages and pages of statistics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不得不硬着头皮研读一页页的统计数字。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>pages</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>plough through sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
waffle	<h3>waffle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,waffle 'on (about sth) (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to talk or write a lot about sth without giving any useful information囉囉嗦嗦地说；赘述:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He waffled on for ages about his garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他没完没了地瞎扯他的花园。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>go on (about sth); rattle on (about sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
wait	<h3>wait<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wait a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,wait a'bout) (for sb/sth )</b><br>to stay in a place without doing anything, waiting for sth to happen or for sb to arrive在某处等待﹙或等候﹚ ﹙某人或事情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t bother waiting around for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不介意留下来等他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She didn’t wait about to hear his reply.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有留下来等他回答。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wait be'hind <i>(especially BrE</i>)</b><br>to stay after other people have gone, especially in order to speak to sb privately等到他人走后留下来﹙尤指为私下谈话﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He asked her to wait behind after the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要她会议结束后留下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wait 'in (for sb/sth) (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>to stay at home because you are expecting sb to arrive or telephone在家等候﹙人、电话等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got to wait in for the TV repair man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我必须在家等维修电视的人来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She waited in all day in case he called.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一整天都守在家里，因为他可能打电话来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wait on sb</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>'wait on sth</b> <i>especially AmE</i>) to bring food and drink to people at a table, usually in a restaurant﹙通常指在餐馆里﹚服务，招待进餐:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My daughter will wait on us this evening! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚我女儿照料我们吃饭！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I started, I didn’t know anything about <b>waiting on tables</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刚开始工作时，我根本不知道如何招待客人进餐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were waited on by a very polite young man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们是由一位彬彬有礼的小伙子接待的。</font><br><i>(also </i> <b>'wait upon sb</b> <i>more formal</i>) to bring sb everything they want or need伺候；服侍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She spoiled the children, always <b>waiting on them hand and foot</b> }(= doing everything for them,like a servant)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她太娇惯孩子，总是像佣人一样替他们做一切事情。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>) to serve customers in a shop/store接待﹙商店里的顾客﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is anybody waiting on you? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人招呼你吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no one in the furniture department to wait on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 傢具部没人接待我。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wait on sb/sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to wait until sb arrives or until sth is available等待；等到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Judd was late and she was sick of waiting on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贾德迟到了，她讨厌一直等着他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m still waiting on the result of the blood test.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我还在等验血结果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was waiting on my decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她等着我拿主意。</font><br>[NOTE]In British English,<b>wait</b> (<b>for sb/sth</b> ) is usually used.英国英语通常用<b>wait</b> (<b>for sb/sth)</b> 。<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wait on sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)=WAIT ON SB 1</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wait sth 'out </b><br>to stay in a place until sth difficult or unpleasant has passed or finished等待﹙困难或令人不快的事情﹚结束:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We sheltered in a doorway to wait out the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们躲在一个门口等候暴风雨过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult to wait out the hours until I could phone her to hear the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很难熬上几个小时一直等到能给她打电话听取消息。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their strategy has been to wait the recession out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的策略是等着经济衰退结束。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wait 'up </b><br>(<b>for sb</b>) to not go to bed until sb comes home or arrives熬夜，不睡觉﹙等人回家﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t wait up (for me), I may be late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要熬夜等我，我可能要晚回来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>stay up </b><br><i>(informal</i>,<i>especially AmE</i>) used to tell sb to stop so that you can reach them and talk to them or go with them等一下，等等﹙以便某人赶上﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait up! I’ll be right there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等一等！我马上就过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hey guys, wait up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 喂，伙计们，先别走。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>hang on</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wait upon sb=WAIT ON SB 2</b><br>\n
wake	<h3>wake<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wake 'up; ,wake sb 'up; ,wake yourself 'up</b><br>to stop sleeping; to make sb stop sleeping醒来；唤醒；弄醒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How many times does the baby wake up in the night? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿夜里醒几次？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I usually wake up early in the summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我夏天通常醒得早。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look as if you’ve only just woken up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看上去睡眼惺忪！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you wake me up at 8?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能在8点钟叫醒我吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was woken up by the sound of breaking glass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被砸碎玻璃的声音吵醒了。</font><br>to become, or to make sb, more lively and interested﹙使﹚活跃，清醒，提起兴趣:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to wake up and start paying attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得清醒点并集中注意力了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wake up! I don’t want to have to repeat all this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打起精神！我不想再得重复这一切了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The class needs waking up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 应该让这个班活跃起来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wake-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] that is intended to wake you up催醒的；唤醒的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time would you like your wake-up call }(= for example, in a hotel)&b{? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想什么时间给你打催醒电话？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wake 'up to sth </b><br>to become aware of sth; to realize sth意识到；认识到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are finally <b>waking up to the fact that</b> the natural world must be conserved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们终于意识到自然界必须受到保护。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hospitals have woken up to the value of experienced nurses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医院已经意识到资深护士的价值。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hasn’t yet woken up to the seriousness of the situation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还没有认识到形势有多严峻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
walk	<h3>walk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk a'way (from sb/sth) </b><br>to leave a difficult or unpleasant situation in order to avoid it, instead of staying to deal with it丢下﹙某人﹚；﹙从困难或不愉快的处境中﹚脱身，一走了之:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to walk away from a situation/deal </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 脱离某情形；放弃一项协议</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can’t just walk away from the problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能就这么甩手不管这个问题了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just walked away from everything — his job, his home and his family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他就那么一走了之丢弃了一切─他的工作、他的家以及他的家人。</font><br>if you <b>walk away</b> from an accident, etc. you are not seriously injured﹙在事故等中﹚免受重伤，平安脱险:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both drivers walked away with minor cuts and bruises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两名司机都伤势不重，只有轻微的划伤和瘀伤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>walked away unhurt</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他毫发未损地平安脱险了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk a'way/ 'off with sth </b><br>to win sth very easily轻易取胜；轻易获得:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team walked away with the championship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个队轻松地获得了冠军。</font><br>to steal sth; to take sth without the owner’s permission顺手牵羊；顺便偷走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thief walked away with jewellery worth ￡24 000.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窃贼偷走了价值24 000 英镑的珠宝。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'in on sb/sth </b><br>to go into a room and see what sb is doing when they did not expect you and did not want anyone to see them冷不丁进屋撞见:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry, I didn’t mean to walk in on you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起，我没想到你在这儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’d obviously walked in on a very serious conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我显然是猝不及防地进去撞见了十分严肃的交谈。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'into sb/sth </b><br>to crash into sb/sth while you are walking走路时撞到﹙ 人或东西﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look where you’re going! You walked straight into me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看着点路！ 你把我撞了个正着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He keeps bumping into things and walking into walls.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不断地碰着东西撞着墙。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'into sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to become caught in sth that you are not expecting, especially because you are not careful不意落入，不小心陷入﹙不愉快的境地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He realized he’d walked into a trap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他意识到自己稀里煳涂落入了陷阱。</font><br>to succeed in getting a job without having to make an effort轻易获得﹙工作﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked straight into a job in publishing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她轻易获得了一份出版行业的工作。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'off; ,walk 'off sth </b><br>to leave a place or a person suddenly because you are angry or upset愤然离去；拂袖而去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She turned and walked off without a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她二话没说，转身离去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rest of the team walked off the field in protest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 其他队员气愤地离开了场地以示抗议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk sth 'off </b><br>to go for a walk in order to get rid of the feeling that you have eaten too much or an emotion such as anger散步消食﹙或消气等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I need to walk off that lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要散散步把午饭消化一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’ll do her good to walk some of her temper off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 散散步消消气会对她有好处。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'off with sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>1=WALK AWAY/OFF WITH STH 1 <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ve walked off with most of the film awards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们轻易获得了大部份电影奖项。</font><br><i>(humorous</i>)=WALK AWAY/OFF WITH STH 2<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who’s walked off with my pen? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁顺手牵羊拿走了我的笔？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That dog’s just walked off with our ball! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那狗刚刚叨走了我们的球！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'out </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,walk 'out of sth</b>) to leave a meeting, a performance, etc. suddenly before the end, because you do not like it or are angry﹙因不喜欢或生气﹚突然离去，退场，退席:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several students walked out of the debate before the vote.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个学生在投票前退出了辩论会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the audience walked out in disgust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一些观众因反感而退场了。</font><br>(of workers 工人) to stop working and go on strike罢工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cameramen have walked out over working conditions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 摄影师们因不满意工作条件而罢工。</font><br>(<b>on sb/sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to leave sb you have a close relationship with and a responsibility for遗弃，抛弃，捨弃，离开﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked out on his wife/ marriage after 35 years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活了35年之后，他抛弃了妻子/放弃了婚姻。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'walkout <i>n </i></b><br>a sudden strike by workers﹙突然的﹚罢工:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The staff <b>staged a one-day</b> <b>walkout</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 职员突然罢工一天。</font><br>a protest in which you leave a meeting, a performance, etc. to show your anger or disapproval﹙表示气愤或异议的﹚退席，退场，离开<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'over sb <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to treat sb badly and not consider their wishes or feelings苛刻对待:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We’re not prepared to let the management <b>walk all over</b> us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可不愿意让资方任意践踏。</font><br>to defeat sb easily in a competition轻而易举地打败:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’ll <b>walk all over</b> you on Saturday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们星期六将把你们一举打败。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let yourselves be walked over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要轻易被击败。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'walkover <i>n </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>) an easy victory in a game or competition; a situation in which you are considered to have won a game although you did not in fact play轻易获得的胜利；不战而胜:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The race was no walkover }(= it was not easy to win)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那场比赛的胜利得来不易。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The other team didn’t turn up so we had a walkover into the final.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对手没有出场，因此我队不战而胜，进入了决赛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'through sth <i>(especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to practise or perform a play in a simple way, just using basic moves and positions简单地排练，初排﹙ 戏剧﹚ ； 走过场<br>to practise a television programme without the cameras排练﹙电视节目﹚；拍摄前排练<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'walk-through <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] <br>a practice of a play without costumes or the objects you need,to practise basic moves and positions﹙戏剧的﹚初排，排练走台<br>a practice of a television programme without the cameras﹙电视节目的﹚开拍前排练，初拍<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk sb 'through sth <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to show or tell sb how to do sth by carefully explaining or showing each part separately给…详细解释，给…分步展示﹙操作方法等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked me through the complicated document.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她给我详细讲解了那份复杂的文件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll walk you through the procedure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他将给你分步演示整个程序。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>talk sb through sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,walk 'up (to sb/sth) </b><br>to approach sb/sth in a confident way﹙ 自信地﹚ 向… 走去， 走近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked straight up to the desk and asked to see the manager.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她直接走到服务台前要求见经理。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
wall	<h3>wall<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wall sth 'in </b><br>to put a wall or a barrier around sth把﹙某物﹚围到屏障等里面:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Apartment blocks walled in the playground completely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公寓大楼把操场围得严严实实。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wall sth 'off </b><br>to build a wall or a barrier around an area to separate it from another area用墙﹙或屏障﹚把…隔开:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Part of the yard had been walled off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 院子的一部份已经隔开了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wall sb 'up</b><br>to keep sb as a prisoner in a place surrounded by walls把…关在大墙后；监禁:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a story of a woman who was walled up in a small room and left to die </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个被关在小屋子里等死的女子的故事</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wall sth 'up</b><br>to block a space with bricks or a wall so that it can no longer be used﹙用砖或墙把通路﹚堵住，封死:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The entrance had been walled up in the 17th century.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 入口在17 世纪时封上了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
wallow	<h3>wallow<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wallow in sth <i>(often disapproving</i>)</b><br>to enjoy sth that gives you pleasure, especially when it is sth unpleasant and you do it in a way that makes other people think you enjoy being unhappy or want sympathy from them热中于，沉湎于﹙尤指不愉快或惹人同情的事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop wallowing in self-pity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要一味地自怜了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wallows in nostalgia for the past.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她沉湎于对过去的怀恋。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>self-pity,nostalgia</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
