want	<h3>want<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'want for sth <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>(<i>usually used with a negative word </i> 通常与否定词连用) to suffer because you do not have sth因缺少某物而受苦:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I work hard so that my children want for nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我努力工作为的是让我的孩子什么也不缺少。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>little,nothing</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,want 'in (on sth) </b><br><i>(also </i><b>,want 'into sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>,<i>especially AmE</i>) to want to be involved in sth, especially a business deal想要参与，希望涉足﹙尤指商业交易﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you want in (on this project)? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你想参与﹙这个项目﹚吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does Jack want into the club? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克想加入俱乐部吗？</font><br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) to want to come inside a place想进来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cat wants in. Can you open the door? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猫要进来。你开一下门好吗？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>want out,want out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,want 'out; ,want 'out of sth </b><br><i>(informal</i>) to no longer want to be involved in sth, especially a business deal想要退出﹙ 尤指商业交易﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want out before we get into difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想在我们遇到麻烦之前退出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want out of this mess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想再理这个烂摊子了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>want in (on sth),want into sth </b><br><i>(informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)to want to go out of a place想出去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want out of here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想出去了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>want in</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+prep<br>\n
ward	<h3>ward<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,ward sb/sth 'off </b><br>to prevent sb/sth dangerous or unpleasant from affecting or harming you抵御﹙人或事物带来的﹚不良影响；避开…人﹙或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put up a hand to ward off the blows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抬起一只手阻挡击打。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m taking vitamin C to ward off a cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在服用维生素C抗感冒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He keeps dogs to ward off unwanted visitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他养了狗以防不速之客。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>evil,blows,criticism,danger</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
warm	<h3>warm<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'warm to sb </b><br>to start to like a person喜欢上某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I warmed to the teacher immediately.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我立即喜欢上了那位老师。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'warm to sth </b><br>to become more interested in or enthusiastic about sth对…更加感兴趣﹙或热中﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The speaker was warming to his theme now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲者就他的主题越讲越起劲。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>theme,task,idea</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,warm 'up </b><br>(of the weather, the earth, etc. 天气、地球等) to become warmer变暖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Research shows that the sea is warming up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 研究显示海洋在变暖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When spring comes the earth begins to warm up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春天到来时大地开始回暖。</font><br>to do gentle exercise or practice to prepare for an athletic activity or a performance﹙为体育活动或表演﹚做适应性练习，做准备活动；热身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m always careful to warm up before I go jogging.</font></i><br><font 彼得在稍微做做准备活动。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>limber up (for sth) </b><br>(of a machine, an engine, etc. 机器、发动机等) to run for a short time in order to reach the temperature at which it will operate well暖机；预热:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This computer takes a long time to warm up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台计算机预热时间很长。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'warm-up <i>n </i></b><br>[usually sing.] a series of gentle exercises or a short practice to prepare for an athletic activity or a performance﹙体育运动或表演前的﹚准备活动，适应性练习；热身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What do you do as a warm-up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你准备活动做什么？</font><br><i><font make sb or a part of sb’s body, feel warmer﹙使某人或身体部位﹚暖和，变暖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come and warm up by the fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 来炉子旁暖和一下吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They stamped their feet to warm them up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们跺着脚取暖。</font><br>to become, or to make sb/sth, more lively or enthusiastic﹙使﹚活跃起来，热情起来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By midnight the party was only just warming up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到半夜时聚会才刚开始活跃起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His role is to warm up the audience before the main event.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的任务是在正式演出之前活跃观众的气氛。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,warm sth 'up </b><br>to make sth become warmer使﹙某物﹚暖和；使变暖:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire had begun to warm the room up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炉火开始让屋子暖和起来了。</font><br>to heat cooked food again before you eat it把﹙ 冷饭菜﹚ 热一热:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soup just needs warming up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤只需要热一热就行了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>heat sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n
warn	<h3>warn<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,warn sb/sth a'way </b><br>to tell a person, a ship, an aircraft, etc. not to come near a place because it is dangerous警告﹙人、船、飞机等﹚不要靠近:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The male birds sing to warn other males away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雄鸟鸣叫着警告其他雄鸟走开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An electric fence warned away anyone who came too close.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电篱笆使过于接近的人不敢再靠前。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,warn sb 'off; ,warn sb 'off sb/sth; ,warn sb 'off doing sth </b><br>to tell sb to leave or not to come near a place, often in a threatening way﹙常指以威胁的方式﹚叫某人离开，叫某人不要靠近，告诫某人不要…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmer warned us off his land when we tried to camp there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们想在那里露营时，农场主警告我们不得靠近他的土地。</font><br>to advise sb not to do sth or to stop doing sth劝某人不要…；建议某人停止…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was warned off smoking after his first heart attack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他心脏病初次发作之后，别人就劝他戒烟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She warned him off a career in acting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她建议他放弃演艺生涯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were warned off renting the apartment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人劝我们不要租这套公寓。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
wash	<h3>wash<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sb/sth a'way </b><br>if water, a wave, etc.<b>washes sb/sth away</b>, it removes or carries them/it away to another place﹙水、浪头等﹚把人或物冲掉，冲走…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A freak wave washed the two children away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的浪头把两个孩子卷走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bridge was washed away by the floods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桥被洪水冲垮了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sth a'way </b><br>to use water to remove a mark,dirt, etc. from sth洗掉，洗去﹙痕迹、灰尘等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to wash away some of the dirt and blood from the boy’s face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试着洗掉男孩脸上的一些尘土和血迹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) A hot bath soon washed my tiredness away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我洗了个热水澡，很快就解乏了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sth 'down </b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to clean sth by using a large quantity of water﹙用水﹚冲洗，洗刷:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I washed the car down with a hose.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我用水龙冲洗汽车。</font><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to drink sth after, or at the same time as, eating food配着食物喝﹙饮料﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We washed our lunch down with iced tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们喝着冰茶吃下了午饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a huge plate of pasta washed down with several bottles of beer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他吃了一大盘通心粉，喝了几瓶啤酒。</font><br>(of a river, a flood, etc. 河、洪水等) to carry sth downwards away from its original position将…冲到下方；冲走；冲积:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tons of earth had been washed down by the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨冲走了几吨土。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash 'off; ,wash sth 'off; ,wash sth 'off sth</b><br>to be removed from the surface of sth or from a fabric by washing; to remove sth in this way﹙被﹚刷洗掉，洗掉；﹙从…﹚洗掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp However hard you rub, an ink stain won’t wash off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 无论怎样用劲揉搓，墨水渍是洗不掉的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wash off the dirt with soap and water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用肥皂和水把污垢洗刷掉。</font><br><i><font v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash 'out; ,wash sth 'out; ,wash sth 'out of sth </b><br>to be removed from a fabric, hair, etc. by washing; to remove sth in this way﹙被﹚洗掉；﹙从…﹚洗掉:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hair colour isn’t permanent. It will wash out in a few weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种染发剂不会持久。过几个星期就会洗掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take care to wash all the shampoo out of your hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意把头发上的洗发水都冲乾净。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,washed 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>(of fabric, clothes or colours 织物、衣服或颜色) no longer brightly coloured,often as a result of frequent washing﹙洗后﹚退色的，不再鲜艳的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Washed-out jeans were very fashionable at that time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时退色牛仔裤很时髦。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  WASHED OUT at WASH SB OUT;WASHED OUT at WASH STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sb 'out </b><br>to make sb very tired使十分疲乏:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That long walk has washed me out.</font></i><br><font pale疲乏苍白的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You look washed out — go and rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你看上去苍白无力的─去休息吧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  WASHED OUT at WASH OUT,WASH STH OUT,WASH STH OUT OF STH;WASHED OUT at WASH STH OUT<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sb/sth 'out (to …), ,wash sb/sth 'out of sth </b><br>(of water, a wave, etc. 水、浪头等) to carry sb/sth away from their/its original position将人或物﹙从…﹚冲走﹙到…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you’d fallen in you would have been <b>washed out to sea</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你那时如果落水，就被冲到海里了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash sth 'out</b><br>(<b>with sth</b>) to wash the inside of a container in order to remove dirt, etc.洗净，清洗﹙容器内部﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carefully washed the bottles out with disinfectant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用消毒剂把瓶子里面清洗乾净。</font><br>if rain <b>washes out</b> a sports game,an event, etc. it makes it end early or prevents it from starting﹙雨﹚使﹙比赛等﹚提前结束，阻止…的举行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game was washed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场比赛因下雨无法进行了。</font><br><i>(AmE</i>, <i>formal</i>) to end sth结束； 终止:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Baltimore washed out the Indians’ six-game win streak with an 8-3 win.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 巴尔的摩队以8 :3结束了印地安队连赢六场的好运。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,washed 'out <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] flooded;damaged by floods发洪水的；遭洪水破坏的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Washed-out towns are appealing for help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 遭受洪灾的城镇正在呼吁救援。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  WASHED OUT at WASH SB OUT;WASHED OUT at WASH OUT,WASH STH OUT,WASH STH OUT OF STH<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'washout <i>n </i>(<i>informal</i>)</b><br>an event that stops early or does not happen, because of rain因雨中止﹙或取消﹚的赛事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game was a washout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这场比赛因雨提前结束。</font><br>an event that is a complete failure彻底失败的事:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party was a total washout.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 聚会完全是个失败。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash 'over sb</b><br>(<i>also </i><b>,wash 'through sb</b>) to suddenly affect sb very strongly突然强烈影响，震动﹙某人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A wave of guilt washed over her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她突然感到一阵强烈的内疚。</font><br><i>(informal</i>) to happen all around sb without affecting them﹙周围发生的事情﹚对…无多大影响:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All their criticism seems to wash over him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们所有的批评似乎都对他没有丝毫影响。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash 'up <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to wash your hands and face洗手洗脸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went to the men’s room to wash up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我到男洗手间去洗了洗手和脸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wash 'up; ,wash sth 'up </b><br><i>(BrE</i>) to wash dirty plates, glasses, etc. after a meal﹙餐后﹚洗刷餐具:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s your turn to wash up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 轮到你洗碗了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget to wash up the glasses as well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别忘了捎带洗洗玻璃杯。</font><br>to be carried along in the water and then left on land; to carry sth along and leave it in this way﹙ 被水﹚ 冲 上岸:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A number of dead dolphins have washed up on the shore.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一些死海豚被冲到了岸上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His body was washed up on the beach two days later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两天后，他的尸体被冲上海滩。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,washed 'up <i>adj </i></b><br>(<i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) to be no longer successful and unlikely to succeed again in the future﹙很可能﹚不再成功的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a washed-up cabaret singer </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不再走红的卡巴莱歌手</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,washing-'up <i>n </i> [U] (<i>BrE</i>) </b><br>the act of washing dirty dishes, glasses, etc. after a meal﹙餐后的﹚洗刷餐具:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t forget to do the washing-up before you go out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你出去之前别忘了洗碗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp washingup liquid </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 餐具洗涤液</font><br>the dirty dishes, glasses,etc. that have to be washed after a meal﹙餐后的﹚待洗餐具:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a sink full of washing-up </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 堆满脏碗碟的洗涤槽</font><br>\n
waste	<h3>waste<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,waste a'way </b><br>(of a person, part of the body, etc. 人、身体部位等) to grow thin or weak in an unhealthy way﹙不健康地﹚变得瘦弱:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was clearly wasting away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他明显消瘦了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The muscles in her arm had wasted away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她手臂上的肌肉退化了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
watch	<h3>watch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'watch for sb/sth </b><br>to look and wait for sth to happen or for sb to come观察等待﹙发生某事或某人出现﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My parents were watching for me coming off the plane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父母翘首等待着我下飞机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch for the sign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意观察信号。</font><br>2=WATCH OUT FOR SB/STH 1 <br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are several points to watch for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几点需要注意。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,watch 'out <i>(spoken</i>)</b><br>used to warn sb about sth dangerous小心；留神；注意:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch out, there’s a car coming! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小心，有车！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’ll get in a terrible mess if he doesn’t watch out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他如果不小心点儿就会搞得一团糟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>look out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,watch 'out for sb/sth </b><br><i>(also </i> <b>'watch for sb/sth</b>) to be quick to notice or be aware of sb/sth, especially sb/sth that might cause you trouble留心观察，密切注意﹙尤指可能带来麻烦的人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The staff were asked to watch out for forged banknotes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 职员们得知要注意伪钞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch out for their striker; he could cause us all sorts of problems.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看住他们的前锋；他会给我们带来种种麻烦的。</font><br>to be ready to see sb/sth new or interesting留意，等着看﹙新的或有趣的人或事物﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch out for a new feature in next month’s magazine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留意下月杂志中的新特写。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>look out for sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,watch 'over sb/sth ( <i>formal </i>) </b><br>to take care of sb/sth, by being near them; to protect or guard sb/sth照管； 保护:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child needed to be watched over 24 hours a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那孩子需要每天24小时看护。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He believed his mother was still watching over him, even though she had died when he was very young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管母亲在他很小的时候就去世了，他相信她依然在保护着他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>protect sb/sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>to watch sb/sth carefully to make sure that everything is done or happens correctly监督；监视:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a committee to watch over each different area of government policy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府政策的每一个范畴都有委员会监督。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>supervise sb/sth <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don’t like being watched over like a child.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢别人把我当作小孩子看管。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

wear	<h3>wear<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wear a'way <i>(written</i>)</b><br>if time <b>wears away</b>, it passes very slowly﹙时间﹚慢慢流逝:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weigh	<h3>weigh<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh a'gainst sb/sth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to make sb less likely to achieve sth or to be successful妨碍，阻碍某人﹙做成某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fact that he’s had five jobs in two years will weigh against his application.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他两年之内做过五份工作，这将妨碍他的申请。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>count against sb</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sth a'gainst sth </b><br>to consider the importance or the advantages of sth compared to sth else权衡；将…和…进行对比:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Potential benefits need to be weighed against the obvious risks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 需要对潜在的利益和明显的风险进行权衡。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>set sth against sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sb 'down (with sth) </b><br>to make sb feel anxious or depressed﹙某事物﹚使人烦恼﹙或焦虑、忧心、沮丧等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The responsibilities of the job are weighing her down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作上的责任压得她喘不过气来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was weighed down with grief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他悲伤过度。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sb/sth 'down (with sth) </b><br>to put a heavy weight on sb/sth so that it is difficult for them to move easily﹙某物﹚把…压得难以移动，把…压弯:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were weighed down with bags of shopping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一袋袋买来的东西把我们压得走不动路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snow was weighing down the branches of the fir trees.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雪把杉树枝压弯了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>burden sb (with sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh 'in </b><br>(<b>at sth</b>) to have your weight measured,especially before a race, a competition, etc.﹙尤指赛前﹚测体重:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Both boxers weighed in at several pounds below their limit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个拳击手赛前量的体重都比规定限度少几磅。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Baby Sam weighed in at 4 kilos.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿萨姆体重4公斤。</font><br>(<b>with sth</b>) (<i>informal</i>) to join in a discussion, an argument, etc. by saying sth important or doing sth to help﹙在讨论、辩论等中﹚发表有分量的意见，发挥作用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We all weighed in with helpful suggestions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都提出了有助益的建议。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh-in <i>n </i></b><br>the occasion when the weight of a sports person such as a boxer is measured just before a fight, a race, etc.﹙赛前对拳击手等的﹚量体重:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The champion arrived five minutes late for the weigh-in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冠军在赛前量体重时迟到了五分钟。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'weigh on sb/sth <i>(also </i> 'weigh upon sb/sth <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>to make sb feel worried or depressed; to be a difficult duty or task for sb/sth加重…的思想负担；使担忧；使沮丧；对…是艰难的任务:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The responsibilities are clearly <b>weighing heavily on</b> his <b>shoulders</b> .</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他显然肩负重任，忧心忡忡。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The debt burden weighs heavily on the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府的债务负担很沉重。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>burden sb/sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sth 'out </b><br>to measure a quantity of sth by weight称出﹙一定重量的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Weigh out all the ingredients before you start making the cake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 做蛋糕之前要先把配料都量好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sb 'up </b><br>to form an opinion of sb by watching them or talking to them﹙通过观察或谈话﹚形成对…的看法，品评:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She stared at him, weighing him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一边注视一边掂量着他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two women weighed each other up for a few moments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个女人相互揣摩了一会儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He’s certainly got Jeff weighed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他确实对杰夫形成了看法。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weigh sth 'up (against sth) </b><br>to think carefully about a situation before you decide what to do仔细考虑，斟酌，掂量﹙情况﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I weighed up the pros and cons }(= the advantages and disadvantages)&b{ of giving up my job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我仔细琢磨了辞去工作的利弊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to weigh up whether we can afford a trip to Italy this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得认真考虑一下我们今年能否负担得起去意大利旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s important to weigh up all possible courses of action.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对所有可能的行动进行斟酌是很重要的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'weigh upon sb/sth=WEIGH ON SB/STH</b><br>\n
weight	<h3>weight<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,weight sth 'down (with sth) </b><br>to add a weight to sth so that it feels very heavy, bends down, sinks,etc.﹙某物﹚加重…的负荷﹙以致其向下弯曲、下沉等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The canvas sheet was weighted down to stop it blowing away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帆布用东西压住了，以免被风颳走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My pockets were weighted down with lots of small coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的衣袋里装了很多小硬币，沉甸甸的。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>rare</i>)<br>\n
welch	<h3>welch<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'welch on sb/sth=WELSH ON SB/STH</b><br>\n

well	<h3>well<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,well 'up </b><br>if a liquid <b>wells up</b>, it rises to the surface and starts to flow﹙液体﹚溢出，冒出，涌出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tears welled up in his eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他热泪盈眶。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Spots of blood began to well up on her skin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的皮肤上开始渗出血滴。</font><br>(<b>in/inside sb</b>) if an emotion<b>wells up</b>, you start to feel it very strongly﹙情感﹚迸发，涌上心头:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt anger welling up inside her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到怒火中烧。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
welsh (<i>also</i>welch)	<h3>welsh (<i>also</i>welch)<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'welsh on sb/sth <i>(informal</i>, <i>disapproving</i>)</b><br>to not do sth that you have promised to do, for example to not pay money that you owe a person对…食言﹙或失信﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘I’m not in the habit of welshing on deals,’ said Don.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “我不习惯违背协议。”唐说道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n

wheel	<h3>wheel<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wheel a'round; ,wheel sb/sth a'round <i>(BrE also </i>,wheel 'round, ,wheel sb/sth 'round) (<i>literary</i>)</b><br>to turn around very quickly to face the opposite direction; to make sb/sth do this﹙使﹚迅速转身:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wheeled around to scream at Miles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我猛地转过去对着迈尔斯尖叫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He <b>wheeled</b> his <b>horse around</b> and started for home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他掉转马头策马回家。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>spin around,spin sb/sth around</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wheel sb/sth 'out <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to produce sb/sth and use them to help you do sth, even though they have often been used before故伎重演:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wheels out the same old arguments every time he makes a speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他又弹起了他每次讲话都弹的老调。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company wheeled out some big guns <b>(= very important people)</b> to launch the new car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司故伎重演，又请来了一些大人物推出这款新汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>\n

about or interested in sth鼓动﹙某人、情绪等﹚；激发﹙热情等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The studio audience was whipped up into a frenzy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 录制现场的观众被鼓动得十分痴狂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They’re trying to whip up support for their candidate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp dust, waves,etc. it makes it/them rise quickly﹙风﹚迅速掀起，卷起﹙灰尘、浪等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind whipped up the sand in gusts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大风卷起了沙尘。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [SUBJ]<b>wind</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+pron+adv ◆ v+n+adv (<i>less frequent</i>)<br>\n

win	<h3>win<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,win sb/sth 'back </b><br>to get again by your own efforts sb/sth that you had before重新获得；把…争取回来:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m hoping to win back my place in the team soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望很快恢复我在队里的位置。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack had tried everything to win Martha back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克尽一切努力要夺回马莎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You do have a chance to win your money back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你确实有机会把你的钱赢回来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,win 'out (over sb/sth) (<i>informal</i>) </b><br>if sth <b>wins out</b>,it is stronger or more successful than other things﹙比…﹚更强，更成功；胜出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not clear if the archaeologists will win out over the builders and save the temple.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考古学家能否斗过建筑商以挽救庙宇，还需拭目以待。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>prevail <i>(more formal</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,win sb 'over <i>(BrE also </i>,win sb 'round) (&b{to sth</b> ) }<br>to gain sb’s support or approval, especially by persuading them that you are right﹙尤指通过劝说﹚获得某人的支持﹙或赞成﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My dad’s against the idea, but I’m sure I can win him over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我爸爸反对这个想法，但我相信我能说服他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jenny’s parents were soon won over by Anthony’s easy charm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 珍妮的父母很快就被安东尼潇洒自如的风度征服了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>bring sb round/around (to sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,win 'through </b><br>to finally succeed after trying very hard摆脱困境；终获成功:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are faced with a lot of problems but we’ll win through in the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们面临很多问题，但我们终将成功。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp United won through to the final in an exciting game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 联队在一场激动人心的比赛中赢得了决赛权。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
wind	<h3>wind<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wind 'down</b><br>to relax, after a period of stress or excitement喘口气；喘息一下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It takes a while for me to wind down after work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我下班之后要过一会儿才能松下心来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>unwind </b><br>if a machine <b>winds down</b>, it goes slowly and then stops﹙机器﹚慢下来后停住:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old clock had wound right down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旧钟最后完全停了。</font><br>if a business <b>winds down</b>, it gradually reduces the amount of work it does until it closes completely﹙企业﹚逐渐减少业务直到关闭:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Next week the mill winds down for a summer break.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下个星期工厂将慢慢减产，然后休暑期短假。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wind sth 'down </b><br>to bring a business or an activity gradually to an end over a period of time使﹙业务、活动等﹚逐步结束:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government is winding down its nuclear programme.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府在逐步取消核计划。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>business,programme</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>reduce sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>expand sth </b><br>to make the window of car open and go downwards by moving a handle, pushing a button, etc.把﹙汽车窗玻璃﹚摇下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wound down the driver’s window and called to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她摇下驾驶座的窗玻璃和他打招呼。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>car window</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>open sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>wind sth up</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wind 'up; ,wind 'up doing sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to find yourself after a long time in a particular place or situation以…告终﹙或终结﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I always said she would wind up in jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以前一直说她终归要入狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bill wound up marrying the girl next door! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比尔最后娶了隔壁的女孩！</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he isn’t more careful, he’ll wind up dead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要是不加倍小心就会把命搭上。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>end up,end up doing sth;finish up,finish up doing sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wind 'up; ,wind sth 'up </b><br>to bring sth such as a speech, a meeting or a discussion to an end结束﹙讲话、会议或讨论﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Before I wind up, I’d like to make one final point.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讲话结束之前， 我想说明最后一点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we all agree, let’s wind up the discussion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果大家都同意，咱们就结束讨论吧。</font><br>to make sth mechanical work by turning a handle several times﹙ 给机械物品﹚上弦，上发条；﹙通过转动把手﹚操作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does this clock have a battery or does it wind up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个钟使用电池还是靠上弦？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a great little toy.You just wind it up and off it goes! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个小玩具很棒。只要上一下发条它就动起来！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wind-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] a <b>wind-up</b> mechanism is one that you operate by turning a handle several times﹙ 机械装置﹚ 装有发条的，用手柄操作的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a wind-up clock/toy </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上发条的钟/玩具</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wind sb 'up <i>(BrE</i>, <i>informal</i>) </b><br>to deliberately make sb very angry or annoyed﹙故意﹚惹…生气:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you deliberately winding me up? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是在故意气我？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ignore them. wire	<h3>wire<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wire sb/sth 'up (to sth) </b><br>to connect sb/sth to a piece of electrical equipment by using electrical wires用导线将某人﹙或某物﹚连接到﹙电气设备﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will be wired up to a machine which will record your heartbeat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你会被连接到记录心搏的仪器上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police suggested I should be wired up }(= to record the conversation)&b{ before I met the dealer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察建议我应该在见到毒品贩子之前接好录音设备。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band’s instruments were all wired up for sound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队的乐器都接通了电源以增加音响效果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The microphone hadn’t been wired up properly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 话筒没接好。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
wise	<h3>wise<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wise 'up (to sth) (<i>informal</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>) </b><br>to understand sth better; to become aware of the unpleasant truth about a situation加深﹙对情况的﹚理解；意识到，觉察﹙令人不愉快的实情﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Employees should wise up about how the industry works.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雇工应该进一步理解这个行业的运作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to wise up to the fact that he’s never coming back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得明白他永远不会回来这一事实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wise up! Try and see her for what she really is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 聪明点！看清她到底是个什么人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to wise up to how serious this situation is.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须意识到这一局势的严重性。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
wish	<h3>wish<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wish sb/sth a'way </b><br>to try to get rid of sth by wishing it did not exist; to wish that sb was somewhere else从心里竭力摆脱；希望﹙某事物﹚不存在；希望﹙某人﹚在别处:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These complications can’t just be wished away, you know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些麻烦事并不是想让它们消失就能消失的，你知道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t wish your life away }(= said to sb who spends a lot of time looking forward to sth that is going to happen in the future)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要成天空等着将来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wish sb/sth on sb <i>(also </i> 'wish sb/sth upon sb <i>more formal</i>) </b><br>(<i>used in negative sentences, especially with <b>wouldn’t</i> </b>用于否定句， 尤与wouldn’t 连用) to hope very much that sth unpleasant will happen to sb or that they will have to deal with sb unpleasant十分希望…遭遇﹙不愉快的事﹚；非常想让…应付﹙讨厌的人﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t wish this pain on my worst enemy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即使我的死对头，我也不想他承受这种痛苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn’t wish my daughter on anyone at the moment — she’s very difficult! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在不希望任何人受我女儿的气─她很难侍候！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
wither	<h3>wither<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wither a'way </b><br>to become less or weaker, especially before disappearing completely萎缩；﹙尤指渐渐﹚破灭，消失:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All our hopes just withered away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的一切希望就这样渐渐破灭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They predicted that the bad schools would wither away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们预言劣等学校将逐步消失。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
wolf	<h3>wolf<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wolf sth 'down <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to eat sth very quickly, especially in large quantities﹙尤指大量地﹚快速吃；狼吞虎咽:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wolfed down his breakfast and rushed out of the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他狼吞虎咽地吃了早餐就冲出房门。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>gobble sth down/up</b><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp wolfing tea and cakes </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狼吞虎咽地喝茶吃糕饼</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
wonder	<h3>wonder<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wonder at sth </b><br>to be very surprised by sth感到诧异； 非常惊奇； 惊叹:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wondered at her beauty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对她的美貌赞叹不已。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wondered at her own stupidity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没想到自己会这么笨。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’s hardly to be wondered at that he behaves as he does, considering his family background.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 考虑一下他的出身背景，他这种态度就不足为怪了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>marvel at sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>\n
work	<h3>work<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work a'gainst sb/sth </b><br>if sth <b>works against</b> sb/sth, it has the effect of making it harder for sb to do or achieve sth对…造成不便；阻碍:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engineering career structure works against women.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工程界的职业结构不利于女性。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government’s new policy has worked against the interests of small farmers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府的新政策不利于小农场主的权益。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work a'round sth <i>(BrE also </i>,work 'round sth)</b><br>to find a way of doing what you want to in spite of situations, rules, etc. that could prevent you doing it绕过﹙有妨碍的状况、规则等﹚；绕道走:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we can’t get rid of the problem, we’ll just have to work round it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我们不能解决这个问题， 就只好绕过它了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He urged the two sides to work around their disputes and reach an agreement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他敦促双方避开他们的纠纷达成协议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My uncle couldn’t read, but he’d found ways to work around it because he was too embarrassed to tell anyone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我叔叔不认字，但他设法迴避这一点，因为他羞于让别人知道。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work a'round to sth <i>(BrE also </i>,work 'round to sth) </b><br>to gradually turn a conversation towards a particular topic渐渐转移﹙话题﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wondered when he would work around to the subject of money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道他何时会绕到钱的主题上来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'work at sth;'work at doing sth </b><br>to make great efforts to achieve sth or do sth well努力…；致力于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She worked hard at her French and passed the exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她刻苦学习法语，通过了考试。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve got to work at losing weight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须下工夫减肥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ve got to work at it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须下工夫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Marriage has to be worked at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婚姻须要悉心维系。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work a'way (at sth)</b><br>(<i>often used in the progressive tenses </i>常用于进行时) to continue to work hard for a period of time继续努力﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve been working away in the gym, trying to get fit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直在健身房锻炼以保持健康。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ruth spends hours in the library, working away at Japanese.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鲁思在图书馆一待就是好几个小时，刻苦温习日语。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work sth 'in; ,work sth 'into sth </b><br>to add one substance to another and mix them together掺入；将…搅拌进:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Work the butter in with your fingers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用手指掺进黄油。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Use plenty of polish and work it well into the wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 涂上足够的光蜡并使它充分渗入木料。</font><br>to try to include sth in a piece of writing, a speech, etc.设法把…加进﹙文章、讲话等中﹚；尽量包括:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Try and work in something about your own experience.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽量穿插讲点你本人的经验。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He usually manages to work something topical into his act.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他通常设法在他的节目中加插些热门话题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work yourself 'into sth </b><br>to become very angry,excited, etc.变得十分气愤﹙或非常激动等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She’s <b>working</b> herself <b>into a state</b> about the exams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因为考试而精神紧张起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was working himself into a rage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始暴跳如雷。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  WORK SB UP,WORK YOURSELF UP<br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'work off sth </b><br>(of a machine, a piece of electrical equipment, etc. 机器、电气设备等) to use a supply of power or another machine in order to operate靠电源﹙或其他机器﹚运行:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lighter works off the car battery.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 引燃器利用汽车蓄电池打火。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work sth 'off</b><br>to get rid of sth by physical effort﹙通过消耗体力﹚宣泄，消除:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He went for a run to work off some calories }(= the food that he had eaten)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他去跑步以消耗部份热量。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By the time she had finished cleaning, she had worked off her anger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打扫完宪生之后气就消了。</font><br>to earn money in order to pay off a debt; to work for the person you owe money to工作以偿债；为债主工作:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They worked off their huge bank loan over five years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们工作了五年多才偿还了一大笔银行贷款。</font><br>if you <b>work off</b> a punishment,etc., you do what you have been told to do because you have done sth wrong or committed a crime听从，经受﹙处罚等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Grima has started to work off his eight-match suspension.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 格里马开始经受被停赛八场的处罚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'work on sb </b><br>to try to persuade sb to agree to sth or to do sth努力劝说…同意﹙或做某事﹚；尽力说服:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My father hasn’t said he will lend me the car yet, but I’m working on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲还没说他会把汽车借给我，但我正在竭力说服他呢。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'work on sth</b><br>to be busy with a particular activity,project, piece of research, etc.忙于，致力于﹙某活动、项目、研究等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What are you working on at the moment? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在忙什么呢？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee worked on ways to raise money for the project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会忙于为那个项目找路子筹措资金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tara is currently working on a solo album.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 塔拉眼下正忙着制作个人专辑。</font><br>to practise or work hard in order to improve sth刻苦练习，努力工作﹙以改进某事﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your designs are great, but you need to work on them a bit more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的设计图很不错，但你还需要下点工夫加工一下。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You need to work on your technique }(= for example, in a sport)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得努力提高技术。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jack’s been working on building up his confidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 杰克一直在努力增强自信。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ‘Have you sorted things out with your parents yet?’ ‘No, but I’m working on it }(= I’m trying hard to do this)&b{.’</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你和父母之间的事解决了吗？”“没有，但我在继续努力。”</font><br>to consider that sth is true when you are saying or doing sth, planning sth,etc.以…为前提﹙或出发点﹚；基于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are working on the assumption that everyone invited will come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的前提是，假设被邀的人都会到场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are working on the theory that she was attacked by somebody she knew.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方假定了她被认识的人袭击而进行追查。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'out </b><br>to happen or develop in a particular way, especially a successful way进展；﹙尤指﹚成功地发展:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’m glad my plan worked out }(= was successful)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很高兴我的计划成功了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their marriage didn’t work out }(= was not successful)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的婚姻不美满。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is all working out very well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切都进展得很顺利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t worry now, everything will work out all right in the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别担心了，一切事情最终都会有好结果的。</font><br>(<b>at sth</b>) if sth <b>works out</b> at sth, you calculate that it will be a particular amount计算；计算出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rent works out at ￡50 a week each.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 租金算下来是每人每周50 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It’ll <b>work out cheaper</b> to go by bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 算来还是乘公共汽车便宜些。</font><br>to train the body by physical exercise锻炼身体；做运动:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I try and work out two or three times a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我争取每周锻炼两三次。</font><br>if a sum, a mathematical problem, etc.<b>works out</b>, it gives a result﹙总数、数学题等﹚等于，算出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The equation won’t work out if x is negative.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果x为负数，这个等式就不成立。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'workout <i>n </i></b><br>a period of physical exercise锻炼:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did a two-hour workout in the gym.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在健身房锻炼了两个小时。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work sb 'out <i>(especially BrE</i>) </b><br>to understand sb’s character了解，理解﹙某人的性格﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve never been able to work my mother out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从未能摸准我母亲的秉性。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>figure sb out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n (<i>rare</i>)<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work sth 'out </b><br>to calculate sth计算；算出:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You’ll have to work out the costs involved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一定得计算出所需费用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you work out the answer to number 2? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能算出第2题的答案吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I worked out that we owe him ￡30.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我合计了一下，我们欠他30 英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me pay for now and we’ll work it out later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由我先付钱吧，我们以后再算清楚。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>cost,answer</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>figure sth out </b><br>to find the answer to a question or sth that is difficult to understand or explain找到…的答案；处理；解决:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I couldn’t <b>work out how</b> Jack had got there so quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我弄不清杰克怎么这么快就到了那儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We worked out that we were second cousins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们弄清楚了我们是远亲表兄弟姐妹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you work out what’s going on?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能弄明白目前的情况吗？ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The game was fairly simple once we’d worked out the rules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们搞清楚规则，这个游戏就很简单了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>figure sth out</b><br>to plan sth; to think of sth计划；思考:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve worked out a better way of doing it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想出了做这事的一个更好的方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The details still have to be worked out. </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 细节还需要进一步考虑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [OBJ]<b>details,plan,way </b><br>to organize sth or deal with problems in a satisfactory way妥善安排﹙ 或处理等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ed and Jane seem to have worked things out between them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 埃德和简似乎和解了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sort sth out </b><br>to continue to work at your job until the end of the period of time mentioned持续工作到﹙某期限﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They didn’t make me work out my notice }(= the period of time that is officially fixed before you can leave your job)&b{.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有让我工作到期满。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He didn’t want to work out the rest of his years in an office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不想把余生消耗在办公室里。</font><br>to remove all the coal or metal from a mine把﹙煤、金属等﹚挖尽； 开采光:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the mines had been worked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数矿井都已经开采光了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>exhaust sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work itself 'out </b><br>if a problem <b>works itself out</b>,it gradually stops being a problem without anyone having to do anything﹙问题﹚逐步自行解决，自行化解:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Did you think everything would just work itself out? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是不是以为所有的事情都会自动了结？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>sort itself out</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work sb 'over </b><br>to attack sb physically and injure them, either as a punishment or to get information from them拷打；逼供:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent the boys round to work him over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们派出了几个兄弟去拷问他。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'round sth <i>(BrE</i>)=WORK AROUND STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'round to sth <i>(BrE</i>)=WORK AROUND TO STH</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'through </b><br>to work without stopping for a particular period of time﹙一段时间内﹚连续工作， 不停地干活:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At harvest time we work through until it gets dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收穫季节里，我们一直干到天黑。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'through; ,work 'through sth </b><br>to start to have an effect somewhere开始影响； 对…发挥作用:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These pressures have worked through to the staff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些压力影响到了员工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The full effects of the change will take time to work through the system.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项改革对整个体系全面发挥效用是指日可待的事。</font><br>to move or pass through sth gradually until you reach a particular point逐渐移动到；慢慢过渡到:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I started at page one and slowly <b>worked my way through</b> to the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从第一页起慢慢读到末尾。</font><br><i><font Allow time for the drug to work through your body.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药效要过一段时间才会扩展到你的全身。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,work 'through sth </b><br>to experience a problem,a difficult situation, etc., and deal with it until you eventually find a solution处理好﹙问题﹚；挺过，挨过﹙困难状况等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to work through grief/emotions </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消除悲伤/情绪</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Counselling is helping him work through this through it and come out the other side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个家庭的状况很艰难，但他们能够挺过去并熬出了盼头。</font><br><i>(also </i><b>work sth 'through</b> <i>less frequent</i>) to think or talk about sth carefully until you can find a solution仔细想出﹙解决办法﹚；谈妥；交流清楚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you are having problems in your relationship, take time to work through it with to a very tight schedule.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的日程安排很满。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have to work to a budget.</font></i><br><font <i>adj </i>}<br>[not before noun](<i>informal</i>) very excited, upset or angry about sth﹙对某事﹚非常兴奋，惴惴不安，大怒:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What was Ben so worked up about? words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那么长的话语之中包含的是一句简单的解释。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>do sth up (in sth)</b><br>to complete sth in a satisfactory way圆满完成； wrestle	<h3>wrestle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wrestle with sth </b><br>to struggle to deal with sth difficult抵抗…；与…斗争；挣扎:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Farmers are wrestling with the problem of the wet weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民正努力抵御多雨的天气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spent several more weeks wrestling with his conscience and then finally decided to resign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和自己的良心又搏斗了几个星期，最终决定辞职。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wrestled with the reins as the horse galloped towards the cliff edge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马向悬崖边飞奔时，他奋力勒紧绳。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>grapple with sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
wriggle	<h3>wriggle<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wriggle 'out of sth; ,wriggle 'out of doing sth <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to avoid doing sth unpleasant or sth that you do not want to do by making clever excuses耍滑不做，逃避﹙应做的事等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp to wriggle out of your responsibilities </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 找藉口逃避责任</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I’ve got an appointment I can’t wriggle out of.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我有个推脱不掉的约会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t let Tom wriggle out of helping you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要让汤姆藉故不帮你。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
wring	<h3>wring<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wring sth from sb=WRING STH OUT OF/FROM SB</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,wring sth 'out </b><br>to remove water or other liquid from a cloth, etc. by twisting it tightly and squeezing it拧，绞﹙某物﹚；拧出，绞出﹙水或其他液体﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Rinse the cloth and wring it out well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把布冲洗净并拧乾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My clothes got so wet I could wring the water out! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的衣服湿得能拧出水来！</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'wring sth out of/from sb </b><br>to obtain sth from sb with difficulty, especially by putting pressure on them从…费力弄到﹙或逼出﹚…:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She eventually wrung an apology out of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她最终逼他道歉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A few concessions were wrung from the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府逼于压力作出了一些让步。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+prep<br>\n
write	<h3>write<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write a'way (to sb) (&b{for sth</b> )=WRITE OFF/AWAY}<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wrote away to the company for a free 覆信:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wrote and apologized, but he never wrote back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我写了信道歉，可他从未回覆。</font><br><i><font [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sth 'down (in/on sth) </b><br>to write sth on paper so that you do not forget it写下；记录下:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wrote her address down in my notebook.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把她的住址记在我的笔记本上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a handout so you needn’t write all this down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一份讲义发给你们，不必把这些全记下来。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>take sth down </b><br><i>(business </i>商业) to reduce the value of what a company owns when stating it in the company’s accounts减记，划减﹙资产账面值﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All stock over six months old was written down to 50%.</font></i><br><font value of what a company owns, etc.﹙资产账面值的﹚减记，划减<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write 'in (to sb/sth) </b><br>to write a letter to an organization to state an opinion or to ask a question致函﹙某机构﹚ ﹙表达意见或咨询﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Write in to the programme and tell us your own opinion on this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 名电视观众写信来投诉这个广告。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sb/sth 'in <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to add an extra name to a list of candidates in an election so that you can vote for them﹙在选票上﹚写上非原定候选人姓名:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wrote Carrasco in on the ballot paper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在选票上加上卡拉斯科的名字。</font><br><i><font 非原定候选人；非原定候选人选票</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sb/sth 'in; ,write sb/sth 'into sth </b><br>to add a character or a scene to a play, a film/movie,a regular series, etc.把某角色﹙或情节﹚加进戏剧﹙ 或电影、系列电视剧等﹚ :<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why did you write the plane crash in? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么要把飞机坠毁的一幕加进去？</font><br><i><font 他因创五度夺冠的纪录而名垂青史。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [opposite]<b>write sb/sth out,write sb/sth out of sth</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sth 'in; ﹙索取资料等﹚；函索﹙…﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wrote off to an agency for advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她去信代理行查询。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>send off (for sth),send away (for sth)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sb/sth 'off (as sth) </b><br>to consider that sb/sth is a failure or not important认定…失败﹙或不重要﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don’t write John off too soon — he may surprise you! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要过早认为约翰完蛋─他会出乎你意料的！ </font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wrote off my symptoms as tiredness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我以为我的症状是疲劳所致。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'write-off <i>n </i></b><br>[sing.] (<i>informal</i>) a failure; a time when you do not achieve anything失败；无所作为:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Today has been a write-off as far as work is concerned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天的工作毫无进展。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp <i>see also</i>  WRITE-OFF at WRITE STH OFF<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sth 'off</b><br>(<i>business</i>) to cancel a debt; to recognize that sth is a failure, has no value, etc.注销，销记﹙账项、资产等﹚；认定…失败﹙或无价值等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All outstanding Third World debts should now be written off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有未偿清的第三世界债务现在都应该注销了。</font><br><i>(BrE</i>) to damage a vehicle so badly that it is not worth spending money to repair it把﹙车辆等﹚毁坏；报废:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That’s the third car he’s written off this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是他今年报废的第三辆汽车。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'write-off <i>n </i></b><br><i>(business </i>) an act of cancelling a debt and accepting that it will never be paid﹙债项的﹚注销，销记:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a ￡4.9 billion debt write-off</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp  49亿英镑负债的注销</font><br><i>(BrE</i>, <b>,write sb/sth 'out; ,write sb/sth 'out of sth</b><br>to remove a character, a scene, etc. from a play, a film/movie, a regular series, etc.去掉﹙戏剧、电影、系列电视剧等中的﹚角色﹙或情节等﹚:<br><i><font 他给她开了一张支票。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sb 'up <i>(AmE</i>)</b><br>to report sb in writing because they have done sth illegal写传票传唤某人:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wrote me up for illegal parking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因为我违章停车给我开了罚单。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,write sth 'up </b><br>to write sth in a complete and final form, especially from notes that you have made﹙尤指利用笔记﹚详细写出:<br><i><font yield	<h3>yield<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'yield to sth ( <i>formal</i>) </b><br>to be replaced by sth被…替代； 为… 所取代:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Barges yielded to road vehicles for transporting goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在货物运输方面，驳船让位给了公路车辆。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'yield sth 'up <i>(formal</i>)</b><br>to allow sb else to take sth that you own and feel is very important for you交出，让出﹙自己看重的东西﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He swore he would never yield up the castle to the English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他发誓永远不会把城堡交给英国人。</font><br>to reveal sth that has been hidden暴露；露出；透露:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A thorough search of the site yielded up only a few ancient coins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彻底搜查了这个地方之后只发现了几枚古代的硬币。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>\n
zero	<h3>zero<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zero 'in on sb/sth </b><br>to aim weapons at sb/sth﹙用武器﹚瞄准:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They zeroed in on the target.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们瞄准了目标。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (<i>figurative</i>) Clare zeroed in on Craig }(= went to talk to him)&b{ as soon as he entered the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 克雷格一进房间，克莱尔就迳直去和他说话。</font><br>to fix all your attention on sb/sth集中注意力于:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wasting no time she zeroed in on the main topic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一开始就直截了当地切入主题。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+prep<br>\n
zip	<h3>zip<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zip 'through sth </b><br>to do, read, etc. sth very quickly很快地做﹙或阅读等﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you zip through my report and check it’s OK? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能不能快速检查一下我的报告是否可以？</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+prep<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zip 'up; ,zip sb/sth 'up </b><br>to be fastened with a zip/zipper (= a device consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth that you can pull together or pull apart); to fasten sth with a zip/zipper拉上拉链；拉上…的拉链:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The skirt zips up at the side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条裙子的拉链在侧面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you zip me up }(= my dress)&b{, please ? </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请帮我拉上拉链好吗？</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can’t zip my jacket up! </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拉不上夹克衫的拉链。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv ◆ v+adv+n<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'zip-up <i>adj </i></b><br>[only before noun] fastened with a zip/zipper用拉链的:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp a zip-up jacket </font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拉链夹克服</font><br>\n
zone	<h3>zone<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zone sth 'off (for sth) </b><br>to keep an area of land to be used for a particular purpose﹙为某目的﹚留出，划出﹙一片地﹚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city centre has been zoned off for pedestrians.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 市中心已划为行人区。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv+n ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zone 'out <i>(AmE</i>, <i>slang</i>)</b><br>to stop thinking or noticing what is going on around you不再想，不再注意﹙ 周围的事﹚ ； 入静:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Relax your muscles, take a deep breath, and zone out for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放松肌肉，深吸一口气，然后入静。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [synonym]<b>space out,space sb out <i>(slang</i>)</b><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>'zone-out <i>n </i></b><br>a time when you stop thinking or noticing what is going on around you入静<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zoned 'out <i>adj </i>(<i>AmE</i>, <i>informal</i>)</b><br>unable to think or to notice what is going on around you because of the effects of drugs or alcohol﹙由于药物或酒精作用﹚精神恍惚的，神志不清的<br>\n
zonk	<h3>zonk<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zonk 'out; ,zonk sb 'out <i>(slang</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>to fall asleep, become unconscious or unable to think, either because you are very tired or because of the effects of drugs or alcohol; to make sb do this﹙劳累或药物、酒精作用使﹚睡着，失去知觉，精神恍惚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He zonked out after the big exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他大考结束之后就倒头睡了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I usually zonk out about 11 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我通常在晚上11点左右睡觉。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv ◆ v+n/pron+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zonked 'out <i>adj </i>(<i>slang</i>, <i>especially AmE</i>)</b><br>sleeping,unconscious, or unable to think, especially from the effects of drugs or alcohol﹙尤指因药物或酒精作用﹚睡着，失去知觉，精神恍惚:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I feel totally zonked out after the day’s work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作了一天之后我觉得头昏脑胀。</font><br>\n
zoom	<h3>zoom<sup>1</sup></h3>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zoom 'in/ 'out (on sb/sth) </b><br>if a camera <b>zooms in/out</b>, it shows the object that is being photographed from closer/further away, by using a special lens (a <b>zoom lens</b> )推摄，拉摄﹙人或物﹚；将变焦距镜头推向﹙或移离﹚被摄体:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The camera zoomed in on her beautiful eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 摄影机镜头移向她那美丽的双眸。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>&nbsp&nbsp  <br>&nbsp&nbsp <b>,zoom 'off <i>(informal</i>)</b><br>to hurry away匆忙离去:<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He jumped into his car and zoomed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他跳进他的车里急匆匆地开走了。</font><br>&nbsp&nbsp [G]v+adv<br>\n
